comm: Chris Morris to Axar, 1 run, widish yorker outside off stump, Axar digs it out towards mid-off
Chris Morris to Bhuvneshwar, 3 runs, full toss, flicked to square leg, oh Dala fumbles and gifts a couple of extra runs

Chris Morris to Karthik, out Lbw!! Karthik walks across and misses this inswinging yorker, wanted to flick, but got hit on the back leg, hit the boot in line with off stump. Karthik decided to review, but he knew he was gone, so marched off and waited near the boundary. HawkEye shows that the ball would have crashed into off stump. Karthik lbw b Chris Morris 13(6) [4s-3]
Chris Morris to Karthik, wide, another one down the leg-side
Chris Morris to Karthik, FOUR, low full toss and Karthik gets a fine little tickle on it to beat the keeper. Morris missed the inswinging yorker there

Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Klaasen!! Now then, how did that ball take the leading edge? Pandya was making room, Morris followed him with a full ball, Pandya flicked awkwardly on one leg, the ball took the leading edge and went towards point, the keeper called for it. Hardik Pandya c Klaasen b Chris Morris 21(17) [6s-1]
Chris Morris to Karthik, leg byes, 1 run, oh dear! He's tried to reverse sweep this past point, but missed and got hit on the boot. Clever from Morris to follow Karthik as the batsman backed away
Junior Dala to Karthik, 1 run, pulled away nicely, but there's protection in the deep, Karthik wanted two, but Hardik Pandya spots him
Junior Dala to Karthik, FOUR, this is excellent batting. Long-off was called inside, Karthik spotted that, expected Dala to bowl full and wide, lofts the drive over mid-off and it's another boundary

Junior Dala to Karthik, FOUR, oh my word! What a shot first up! That gets the dug out going. Karthik walks across the stumps, Junior Dala tries to cramp him for room with a short of length delivery, but Karthik manages to open the bat face at the last moment and guide it past backward point, there is no one at third man
Junior Dala to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, full and outside off stump, Pandya reaches out and drives it to deep extra-cover
Junior Dala to Hardik Pandya, wide, that's way outside off stump, left alone

Junior Dala to Dhoni, out Caught by Miller!! There's more height on this than distance and Miller has another one on the rope. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Dhoni stayed leg-side of the ball and tried to muscle it over long-off, but looks like it flew off the bottom of the bat. Easy chance by Miller's standards. Dala has three. In fact, the replay suggests that Dhoni's bat turned in his hands on making contact with the ball. Dhoni c Miller b Junior Dala 12(11) [4s-1]

Junior Dala to Dhoni, FOUR, low full toss, inside edge and that's so cruel for the bowler, fine leg is inside the ring and he concedes a boundary despite outsmarting the batsman. Dhoni wanted to hit that over cover
Chris Morris to Dhoni, 1 run, Morris cramps the advancing Dhoni with a short of length delivery, wristed to backward square leg
Chris Morris to Dhoni, no run, short ball and Dhoni was beaten for pace, nowhere close to playing the pull, Dhoni reckons it was above his head and asks the umpire if it was a wide for height
Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, Pandya swings hard again, mistimed slog goes into the on-side

Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, SIX, he's hit this alright. Missed out on a full toss previous over, now he goes hard at it and hits it over long-on. Much needed maximum for India. Morris missed the yorker and bowled an easy ball for Pandya to free his arms
Chris Morris to Dhoni, 1 run, now he steps out and slogs, hit along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Chris Morris to Dhoni, 2 runs, "two, two, two," shouts Dhoni and look at him hare across the pitch. Slower ball, Dhoni gently works it towards mid-on, takes the fielder on and completes the second
Phehlukwayo to Dhoni, 1 run, short of length delivery on the stumps, Dhoni flicks it to mid-wicket and keeps strike
Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, low full toss and Pandya hits it to long-on, why didn't he bludgeon that?
Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, no run, change of pace and Pandya mistimes the attempted slap back to the bowler, was the back-of-the-hand slower ball from Phehlukwayo
Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, 105kph slower ball on the off stump, Pandya knocks it to mid-wicket and rushes back for the second
Phehlukwayo to Dhoni, 1 run, full delivery on the off stump, Dhoni drives it to long-on
Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, good length delivery outside off stump, Pandya pushes it to long-off
Shamsi to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, last ball of Shamsi's stint, so Pandya just leans forward and defends the ball towards to cover to see him off. 4-0-31-1 it is from Shamsi
Shamsi to Dhoni, 1 run, another gentle nudge to backward square leg
Shamsi to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, shortish and outside off stump, Pandya pushes it to mid-off
Shamsi to Dhoni, 1 run, allows the ball to come and nudges to backward square leg
Shamsi to Dhoni, no run, pushed into the off-side

Shamsi to Dhawan, out Dhawan Run Out!! 1 run completed. Races down the pitch and slogs despite not getting to the pitch of the ball, oh wait, it's a direct-hit from deep mid-wicket and Dhawan is walking off without waiting for the confirmation. Oh yes, brilliant work from Dala and Dhawan is well short. This was another mistimed hit that rolled towards the deep, Dhawan tried to steal the second, but Dala had a very good arm and the accuracy was top class because he had only one stump to aim at from the side. End of Dhawan's mistimed innings. Dhawan run out (Junior Dala) 47(40) [4s-3]
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, 1 run, he's missed out on a full toss and the ill-timed flick rolls wide of mid-on
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, wide, that's a wayward down the leg-side slower ball
Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, oh he pulled that ball without watching, the head was down as it came towards his helmet, managed to get bat on ball and it rolls towards square leg
Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, no run, short of length delivery on the off stump, Pandya walks across and defends to the right of Phehlukwayo, who stops it with his boot
Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, no run, another slower ball and Pandya had to check his push-drive after walking forward, the ball goes uppishly to the right of the bowler
Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, change of pace, Pandya adjusts and knocks it into the vacant backward square leg region, well placed and they rocket back for two
Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, on the rise and driven wide of mid-off, didn't go hard at it, in fact, hit him a touch high on the bat
Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, wide, now then, that's gone down the leg-side alright, but Pandya walked right across and exposed the sticks, this slower ball almost shaved the leg pole
Junior Dala to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, full and outside off stump, Pandya calmly taps to cover and takes off
Junior Dala to Dhawan, 1 run, oh that was a mighty swing for a pull shot, but the ball didn't find the middle of the bat, Dhawan wanted to smash this short ball over the fence
Junior Dala to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, Pandya gets an inside edge onto pad as he tries to defend this length ball, rolls to cover-point and they take a quick single
Junior Dala to Dhawan, 1 run, pushed away through mid-off
Junior Dala to Dhawan, 2 runs, fullish and outside off stump, Dhawan drives to deep backward point, a fumble by the bowler while collecting the throw and they get an extra run

Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Miller!! Mistimed and Miller won't drop those. Pandey was always looking to go bang, bang from the start. The runs were flowing, maybe could have chosen a better ball to hit. On seeing the batsman advance, Junior Dala dropped this short and cramped Pandey for room, it was a big swing of the bat in an attempt to go big, but the timing was awful as he tried to go towards mid-wicket, Miller ran forward and completed the catch. Maybe the pressure of Dhawan not freely scoring got to him, but Dhawan too has found his timing recently. Manish Pandey c Miller b Junior Dala 13(10) [6s-1]
Phangiso to Manish Pandey, 1 run, calm, showing out the full bat face in smearing it to long-off
Phangiso to Dhawan, 1 run, gets his sweeping timing right. Mid-wicket
Phangiso to Dhawan, FOUR, rubs it in, but down the ground. Oh Shamsi. Gets down, all bottom-handed and hammers it straight back

Phangiso to Dhawan, 2 runs, it's that man Shamsi again. And it's a drop again. Synonyms. A top-edge on the sweep, and Shamsi at 45 behind square runs all around swirling under. Was never going to be caught
Phangiso to Dhawan, no run, loopily enough to fox around with Dhawan's mind. Way too early into his carve
Phangiso to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slows it up. Pandey waits for the dip to come down and slices it to long-off
Shamsi to Dhawan, FOUR, one brings him another. Another filthy drag down, and inevitably gets pulled into square leg. Angry flat-bats these
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, 1 run, yorks with his jumps down the pitch, toe-ing it to mid-wicket
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, drills it past an outstretched right palm of the bowler

Shamsi to Dhawan, FOUR, finally. Gets what he's been looking for, desperately - his first boundary and it's taken him 29 balls. Off a half tracker, swatted and mowed away to bisect the two men in the deep square leg region
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, 1 run, dug out, whippily rather to leg
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, SIX, and just over. Miller, strangely placed a cool ten yards inside the ropes and Pandey takes on just that gap. Hoicked up and there's nothing that dive can do
Phangiso to Manish Pandey, 1 run, straight on with the arm. Off the hips. Or perhaps not..there's a tickle
Phangiso to Manish Pandey, no run, stays behind the line, respect dished out. In plenty
Phangiso to Dhawan, 1 run, gets away, on his move of course and stretches in a version of the drive to long-off
Phangiso to Dhawan, no run, on the dance, jamming it into the ground and popping back. Crowd catch
Phangiso to Manish Pandey, 1 run, low, opening up the bat face as he creams it through sweeper
Phangiso to Dhawan, 1 run, a hint of drift coming in on the pads. Whipped out to long-on
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, skids along off the turf, punched down the ground
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tucked away off the hips, round the corner

Shamsi to Raina, out Caught by Behardien !! Oh Behardien. The lofted drive had everything, grace, elevation, power and everything that would have brought a six at Pretoria. Just that this is the coast. Gravity is a lot more heartless. And a party-pooper. And the parabola has died just inside the straight boundary. But it's been typically Raina. Raina c Behardien b Shamsi 43(27) [4s-5 6s-1]
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, no wait. A correction. He's slogged, off the inside half. Oh dear. How the lack of timing haunts people
Shamsi to Dhawan, 2 runs, goes reverse. Oh the desperation. Never thought he'd be this ugly. Behind point
Shamsi to Raina, 1 run, knocks it to leg. And realizes it is Shamsi who'll have to run and clean up. And obviously takes him on. And rightly so. He's fluffed up the chance
Duminy to Raina, 1 run, moves away again, opening up his punch. Long-off this time
Duminy to Raina, 2 runs, slides backwards, sticking out the full straight bat in a punch down the ground
Duminy to Raina, FOUR, now Behardien gets some bad bounce. A formality of a stop at sweeper, and he ruins the pressure that was built up
Duminy to Dhawan, 1 run, pre-meditates the hack. Ungainly in the process. Once again, single, mid-wicket
Duminy to Raina, 1 run, a slingy dart. 92kph. Can't capitalize. Singles is all India are getting .. cover on this occasion
Duminy to Dhawan, 1 run, slowing it up with his loop. Dhawan sits, pulls into square leg
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, lines himself up, getting close to the line to tap it through the covers
Shamsi to Dhawan, no run, dance, can't get close and the elegance in the drive isn't good worthy enough of a gap
Shamsi to Raina, 1 run, lean, drive, long-on. Join the dots
Shamsi to Raina, no run, fuller. Waited, read and blocked
Shamsi to Raina, no run, squares him up. Raina tries going against the turn, on the back foot. And an obvious appeal, try keeping Shamsi away from that. An Inside-edge is there
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, a pad-line to start. Quite full too to not discourage Dhawan in taking matters against the turn. Bottom-handed flick
Duminy to Dhawan, 1 run, slower, turned away, wristily through square leg

Duminy to Dhawan, 2 runs, and Dhawan runs down. Aimlessly. The length's not there, it's flat too and almost sneaks under everything. Saved by a whisker. Literally. And that whisker is on the inside edge
Duminy to Dhawan, no run, spots Dhawan's moves around, pulls the length back. Another settled defence .. something's giving way, quickly
Duminy to Raina, 1 run, high on the bat as he checks the poke. Not bad enough again to avoid the gap
Duminy to Dhawan, 1 run, on the sweep. Nails it behind square
Duminy to Dhawan, no run, tries covering the line as he stretched out to defend. Quite a Test-like pop up off the glove
Chris Morris to Dhawan, 1 run, a polite carve out behind point
Chris Morris to Raina, 1 run, low full toss. Dropped in front of mid-on. Quick legs follow

Chris Morris to Dhawan, 1 run, right into Shamsi. He couldn't have been picked out better. But no. It can still be dropped. Dhawan goes on the high-elbowed drive. Manages the outside chunk, and short third is confused whether to go conventional or reverse-cupped. And before he makes up his mind the ball has already bumped into his chest. And down
Chris Morris to Raina, 1 run, goes shorter, looking to tuck him up. And Raina tucks too
Chris Morris to Raina, FOUR, he's toying with his mind now. Starts moving away, Morris tries going wide. But Raina was always going to stretch..and he does. And slaps it square
Chris Morris to Raina, 2 runs, drags it from outside off, feet off the earth as he shuffles and finds the fine leg gap. Pulled just in
Phehlukwayo to Raina, 1 run, sways away, letting the ball get close as he stabs it behind point
Phehlukwayo to Raina, no run, tightens up on the hips. A quick hopping bunt to leg
Phehlukwayo to Raina, wide, throws it wide, hoping for the sucker drive. Nah
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, 1 run, enticed into a pull. But it just skids off the length, under the meat, for a meek nudge in front of square
Phehlukwayo to Raina, 1 run, too full, too straight, whipped out to deep mid-wicket
Phehlukwayo to Raina, FOUR, this is falling apart, rather quickly. Overdoes his compensation with the width outside off. the length is fuller too. Raina doesn't take time to unleash the drive. Wow
Phehlukwayo to Raina, FOUR, on the dance. Uses the pace, uses the ball in the slot, under it and smokes through the line. Doesn't even bother keeping it down. Long-off, one-bounced
Junior Dala to Dhawan, no run, back to his drives. Crunchy. But extra cover couldn't have been found better
Junior Dala to Dhawan, 2 runs, agricultural. Against the line, freaky swing that, doesn't even get the timing, but once again .. powerplay saves the day. Vacant cow corner
Junior Dala to Dhawan, 2 runs, 137kph, pulls the length back a touch. Dhawan's balance goes backwards, angle-batted to crack it through sweeper
Junior Dala to Dhawan, no run, flirts. The bat can't resist the width, sadly the feet do. Fizzing past
Junior Dala to Raina, 1 run, a one-legged pull, crouching as he does so. Fine leg
Junior Dala to Raina, no run, lines himself up, beside the line in a pat to cover
Duminy to Raina, leg byes, 1 run, with the arm as Raina looks to search for the spin. There's none. So the runs go to the pad as it rolls out to point
Duminy to Dhawan, 1 run, on the drive again, nothing the dive from Duminy can do about it. Long-off
Duminy to Dhawan, no run, fully forward, too close for comfort in the process as he squeezes the yorker on the drive to a diving Duminy
Duminy to Raina, 1 run, a soft nudge, round the corner. Sensible
Duminy to Raina, FOUR, filthy short. Hop back, make it look worse and free the arms to punch it away through extra cover. Oh the timing, that sound
Duminy to Dhawan, 1 run, doesn't bother giving out flight. Flat, angling in and is nurdled away in front of square
Junior Dala to Raina, no run, length, fifth-stumpish. Raina shuffles, stands in front of his stumps, straight batted
Junior Dala to Raina, 2 runs, leans out, opening up the bat face as he checks his drive through the covers. The powerplay has enough gaps to pinch the second
Junior Dala to Raina, SIX, woah. How's that for a start. Yea, it's on the pads but Raina's bat swat is violent. Across the line, airy and into the stands behind square

Junior Dala to Rohit, out Lbw!! He's turned up in a complete twist. Pace, angle and Rohit's lack of feet gang up to have him back. Well he ponders the review, goes against it, and then Shikhar calls him back to think some more. And all the thinking has taken up the fifteen seconds. The foot is fine as well. Now then, Dala started right next to the stumps, nips it back in off a good length and Rohit, late to react is pinned. In front of middle. Rohit lbw b Junior Dala 11(8) [4s-2]
Junior Dala to Rohit, no run, 134kph, wobbly seam on off. Rohit gets forced into a defence
Junior Dala to Dhawan, 1 run, a typical bat swing, inside-halving his on-drive to mid-on
Chris Morris to Rohit, FOUR, back to slanting down leg. Swipe, frantically and fine leg's nowhere in the picture. Just the start the Proteas would've discussed to not have

Chris Morris to Rohit, FOUR, juicy overcook. And is drilled straight down. No, it's more of a smear. He hardly moves, doesn't even get it off the middle, but there's always enough when the length is such
Chris Morris to Rohit, no run, hits the 140 mark again. Hitting the pitch hard to get it to spit up a touch, Rohit's bat sponsor is found
Chris Morris to Rohit, no run, that's the line. 140kph. Right on the money, the good length, top-of-off. A quick press forward to defend
Chris Morris to Dhawan, 1 run, 136kph, finds some swing, back in on off. Squeezed, circumspect in front of a deepish mid-off
Chris Morris to Rohit, 1 run, oh dear. A wide full toss. A surprised Rohit can only throw his bat, late and toe-end it out through the covers

Chris Morris to Rohit, no ball, 2 runs, nice gentle feeder on the legs. Rohit has had tougher starts. Surely. The overstepping doesn't help either. So some inauspicious-ities to start off. Flicked with ease, round the corner

Bhuvneshwar to Jonker, out Caught by Rohit!! Okay, that was a full toss just below the waist. And Jonker finds extra cover with that. All over (but imagine the fun if this was no-balled for height). India win by 7 runs and take the series 2-1. Jonker c Rohit b Bhuvneshwar 49(24) [4s-5 6s-2]
Bhuvneshwar to Jonker, 2 runs, the India faction of the crowd knows it. This had to be a six. Isn't. Another yorker - perhaps an inch or two short - and Jonker jams out a couple round the corner
Bhuvneshwar to Jonker, 2 runs, can't do much about it. Inswinging yorker that's squeezed out to long-on. A slightly unsure second run but they complete it without much hassle in the end. 10 from 2
Bhuvneshwar to Jonker, wide, that's flirting with the inside of the tramline, I think, but the umpire thinks otherwise. Back of a length, decking away and making it worse for Bhuvneshwar
Bhuvneshwar to Behardien, 1 run, full tosses have a place in T20s now. Another one, punched to long-off. 13 off 3
Bhuvneshwar to Behardien, FOUR, great, he's cleared short third man with that uppish forced edge. Had to reach out because the ball was delivered quite wide
Bhuvneshwar to Jonker, 1 run, starts with a slowish length ball outside off, cut away through cover-point. 18 needed off 5
Bumrah to Jonker, 1 run, 145ks full toss, swatted to long-on. 16 runs off Bumrah's over!
Bumrah to Jonker, 2 runs, low full toss, and with Bumrah's angle coming into the batsmen, it's difficult to get under it. Cape Town is awake, again. 20 runs needed
Bumrah to Jonker, 2 runs, back to pace. Quicker back of a length delivery flat-batted off the splice to long-on. Quick throw, leading to a stuttered hurried second run. But all safe
Bumrah to Jonker, SIX, boom! 122ks ball, and the debutant has marauded that over long-on. What have we got?
Bumrah to Behardien, 1 run, fails to reads the slower ball and makes a fool of himself. Was shaping for the big hit, the ball never arrives and spoons that to shortish mid-on
Bumrah to Behardien, FOUR, incoming leg-stump full toss, clipped round the corner. Easy. 31 off 11 needed

SN Thakur to Jonker, FOUR, that might have hit the ropes on the full. Nah, just drops inside. Disparaging pull shot, picking the slower delivery and smacking the daylight out of this delivery. 18 runs off the over
SN Thakur to Jonker, no run, drops the ball short and Jonker looked late the backfooted slap shot. No timing whatsoever to buy a run
SN Thakur to Jonker, FOUR, gets back to pace, gets the yorker pitching inches short and is drilled down the ground for a much-needed boundary
SN Thakur to Jonker, no run, beaten by the 118ks slower delivery. Jonker goes for a similar hit over cow corner, and misses
SN Thakur to Jonker, FOUR, slower delivery, he wanted to go over covers but adjusts nicely to the lack of pace, opening the bat face and slicing the ball over backward point
SN Thakur to Jonker, SIX, 123kph ball right into Jonker's arc. Swings his bat across and sends it flying over cow corner
Bumrah to Behardien, FOUR, brilliant. Makes room, waits for it and pumps it over wide mid-off, picking the ball from right in front of the stumps and lifting that inside-out
Bumrah to Jonker, 1 run, there's long-off in place to intercept this slap-drive
Bumrah to Behardien, 1 run, late on this 142ks full ball. Wanted a single worked to long-on but all he gets is an inside edge scooting to fine leg

Bumrah to Chris Morris, out Bowled!! Bumrah is such a skiddy operator. Slides the ball in from wide of the crease, tempts Chris Morris into mowing that with the incoming angle and sneaks the ball through. Gone. Red. Chris Morris b Bumrah 4(3) [4s-1]
Bumrah to Chris Morris, no run, indipper, Chris Morris swings across and misses
Bumrah to Chris Morris, FOUR, now an outside edge through third man. Plays back to a fuller delivery and is not quite able to get behind. More off the cue end of the bat that
Bumrah to Chris Morris, wide, that's well inside the guideline outside off but it's been wided. Parallax error..

SN Thakur to Duminy, out Caught by Rohit!! That shot is pressure and might well be India's surge towards a convincing win (if it wasn't until now). With 64 needed off 25, Duminy had to go for it. Tries to clout a boundary over mid-wicket but all he does is pop a simple miscue to Rohit Sharma at mid-off. Duminy c Rohit b SN Thakur 55(41) [4s-2 6s-3]
SN Thakur to Duminy, 2 runs, fuller ball and he's played this a little late through mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Duminy, no run, now he goes overambitious and tries to swing this over mid-wicket. Doesn't get hold of it. Difficult doing that against SN Thakur's angle across him
SN Thakur to Duminy, FOUR, 11th T20I fifty for Duminy! And brings up the milestone with some nice timing through covers. Makes some room and finds the gap wide of covers with this punch
SN Thakur to Jonker, 1 run, staying low, Jonker punches it back-footed to long-on
SN Thakur to Duminy, 1 run, from over the wicket, Duminy drills the wide full ball to long-off
Bumrah to Duminy, 1 run, makes early room and slaps that to point
Bumrah to Jonker, 1 run, now the dipping 143ks full toss that's robbed away all the timing off Jonker's intended hit through wide long-on. Just a single
Bumrah to Duminy, 1 run, back of a length 140ks ball whacked away through mid-wicket
Bumrah to Duminy, SIX, he's read the bejeezus out of this slow ball. Stays put and mauls it over long-on. Wow, clean
Bumrah to Duminy, no run, yorker going across Duminy, who's tried to heave it away. More beaten by the pace, or the lack of it here. Bumrah bowled the slower yorker here

Bumrah to Jonker, 1 run, how good is Raina. Comes back rushing from mid-wicket and under-arms the ball onto the stumps with a head-first dive. Misses the stumps, Jonker was in after wristing the ball away but that was a good effort
Raina to Jonker, 1 run, stays in the crease and works that cross-batted through deep mid-wicket

Raina to Jonker, FOUR, Raina has turned a deaf ear to Dhoni. He was advised not to bowl quick on the stumps and look what Raina has done: bowled a darter on leg-stump that Jonker glances through fine leg
Raina to Jonker, FOUR, gets lower and sweeps that down to the fine leg fence. Spinners undoing it for India here..
Raina to Jonker, 2 runs, Raina has bowled short today. Another one swiveled to fine leg
Raina to Jonker, no run, plonked straight down the pitch
Raina to Duminy, 1 run, is standing middle and leg, and drives this one to long-off
Hardik Pandya to Jonker, no run, opens the bat face towards point but no single available

Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Pandya rags Klaasen with his smile. Flat hit straight to Bhuvneshwar, who's hurt himself a little in trying to reverse-cup that. Doesn't get the elevation, does Klaasen. Was under some pressure against India's top-notch bowling and finally goes for the hit, only to.. Klaasen c Bhuvneshwar b Hardik Pandya 7(10)
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, 137ks ball just down leg, Duminy opens his stance front-on and clips that through backward square leg
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, 1 run, sees Klaasen make early room and bowls for the wide yorker length delivery, that's been reached out and sliced through backward point by the batsman
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, slower delivery at 120ks, chopped to backward point
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 2 runs, stays leg-side of the ball and hooks it away, wide of the fielder at long leg
Axar to Klaasen, no run, quick and straight outside off, Klaasen looks to reverse sweep but can't connect his shot. Expensive over by the left-arm spinner. 16 runs off that!

Axar to Klaasen, 2 runs, sliding into the batsman, Klaasen looks to go inside-out but miscues it to wide long-on and calls for two. The throw at the batsman's end is flat but Klaasen is quick to get back in
Axar to Duminy, 1 run, plants his knee outside off and slogs it towards deep mid-wicket. That was hit hard but straight to the fielder there

Axar to Duminy, SIX, skipper has come to the party once again. Darted on middle, bowled at 101 kph, Duminy doesn't miss out and sends it sailing over the mid-wicket fence. Two in two. This is exciting, crowd has come alive
Axar to Duminy, SIX, insult to injury. Flighted delivery around off, Duminy moves inside, grounds his knee and slog sweeps it over mid-wicket for half a dozen
Axar to Klaasen, 1 run, chance.... put down! Axar not pleased with Thakur's effort. He can hurt you, this guy. Pulls the short delivery to long-on where Shardul spills it out. In and out!!
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, 1 run, a low full around off that has been whipped down to long-on by Klaasen
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, a low full toss, almost a yorker but on the pads, Duminy tickles it down to fine leg
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 2 runs, dances down the wicket and converts the full length into a full toss. Creams his drive to the left of sweeper and manages to get two more
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, 1 run, bangs it short again with not much pace in that, Klaasen pulls it over short mid-wicket, gets only one
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, no run, short and wide outside off, Klaasen goes for a pull, gets beaten though. Had it connected this, it would have gone into the orbit

Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, shortish delivery around off, Duminy tucks it to the left of the bowler and calls for a run. Pandya moves to his left, gathers the ball and goes for a shy at the bowler's end, but can't hit
Raina to Klaasen, no run, fired around off and that's driven back to Raina by Klaasen
Raina to Duminy, 1 run, flighted outside off, Duminy punches it away to sweeper cover for a run
Raina to Klaasen, 1 run, short in length around off, Klaasen pulls it away to deep mid-wicket for a run
Raina to Duminy, 1 run, knocks the floater down to long-off, does Duminy
Raina to Duminy, FOUR, pulled away! Short delivery on leg, Duminy swivels and pulls it over square leg. A much needed boundary for the Proteas

Raina to Miller, out Caught by Axar!! This was bound to happen. With the required run rate inching close to 12 the batsmen had to go for it. Short delivery around off, Miller goes for the pull in order to clear the mid-wicket fence but doesn't middle it. It's a skier and Axar is the man who takes it. Miller c Axar b Raina 24(23) [4s-2 6s-1]
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, no run, walks down the wicket and drives the low full toss back to the bowler
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, no run, back of a length outside off, slapped to wide mid-off
Hardik Pandya to Miller, byes, 1 run, and again. Bowls a slowish delivery that beats Miller's cut once again. In fact it beats MS Dhoni too, who fails to gather it cleanly
Hardik Pandya to Miller, no run, an off-cutter outside off, keeps low and beats Miller's cut shot. Similar delivery and a similar type of shot for the nth number of time in this innings
Hardik Pandya to Miller, SIX, in the arc out of the park. Short in length but on that leg stump line, Miller picks the length early and picks it up. Times it over square leg for half a dozen.
Hardik Pandya to Miller, no run, full in length and knuckle ball around off, Miller pushes the back to the bowler
Raina to Miller, 1 run, knocks the floater down to long-off and gets a single to retain strike in the next over
Raina to Miller, no run, short and quick on leg, Miller goes for a pull but the ball skids on and strikes him on the pad. The impact was outside leg, hence no chance of giving that out
Raina to Duminy, 1 run, fired outside off, eases it down to long-off for an easy run
Raina to Miller, 1 run, pushes the loopy delivery down to long-off

Raina to Miller, FOUR, nahi nahi chota nahi [no, no, not a short ball], says MS as Raina bowls the short one. Short in length around off, asking to be hit and Miller slams it aerially over cover to find the fence
Raina to Duminy, 1 run, darted well outside off, Duminy drives it away to sweeper cover and manages to get a single
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, fullish in length around off, Duminy flicks it towards short mid-wicket where Rohit stops it with a one-hand dive before he parries it to the keeper
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, no run, back of a length outside off, cut to the man at point by Duminy

Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 2 runs, slowish short of a length delivery around off, Duminy plays it with soft hands and turns it to deep square leg. Calls for two and manages to get it. A flat throw by the fielder in the deep might have been close
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, no run, change of pace on that, off-cutter going across the left hander, Duminy fails to connect as he attempts another cut shot

Hardik Pandya to Miller, 1 run, fails to put away that full toss. Tad high around off, Miller drives it away to sweeper cover, only for a single. Should have played it more aggressively, might have fetched him a boundary
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, starts off with a slowish delivery on middle and leg, Duminy nudges it to the on-side and rotates strike
SN Thakur to Miller, no run, another fine delivery. On a length around middle and off, not much pace on that. Miller turns it with the inside half off his bat to the left of the bowler
SN Thakur to Miller, no run, slowish delivery around off, Miller goes for an uppish drive but gets beaten due to the lack of pace. That beats his inside edge before it goes to the keeper
SN Thakur to Duminy, 1 run, short one that hurried onto the batsman. Duminy went ahead with a pull shot but got it off the splice of his bat. Towards the fielder at short mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Duminy, 2 runs, misfield by Bhuvi at third man allowed the batsman to come back for the second. Short of a length outside off, Duminy cuts it past backward point and gets two
SN Thakur to Duminy, no run, length ball that kept a tad low. Was outside off and as Duminy attempted a cut, it went underneath the blade
SN Thakur to Duminy, no run, bangs it short and aims at Duminy's ribs who ducks and evades the bouncer
Bhuvneshwar to Duminy, 1 run, chops his cut to a length delivery and gets a single at point, does Duminy. Partial stop by the fielder there, not enough to save the single
Bhuvneshwar to Miller, 1 run, fine stop by Dhawan at wide mid-off. Moved swiftly to his right and put in a dive to stop this off-drive by Miler. Was full in length and well outside off
Bhuvneshwar to Miller, no run, length delivery around middle and off, Miller blocks it from within the crease
Bhuvneshwar to Duminy, 1 run, slices the length delivery down to third man. Was in the air for a while but in a safe region at the same time
Bhuvneshwar to Duminy, no run, full length delivery outside off, Duminy goes for an uppish drive and almost chips it to the diving fieler at extra-cover
Bhuvneshwar to Miller, 1 run, short in length around off, Miller nurdles it towards short mid-wicket and calls for a quick run

SN Thakur to Duminy, no run, tad full in length around off, Duminy goes for a cut and connects it well. Manish, the man guarding point dives to his left and stops the ball. Saves a certain boundary with his valiant effort
SN Thakur to Duminy, no run, yorker just around the off-stump channel, nicely squeezed to the man at point. 'Wait wait' is the call by the South African skipper immediately
SN Thakur to Miller, 1 run, drags the length back and Miller has no problem to steer it down to third man
SN Thakur to Miller, no run, short of a length around off, Miller plays it into the off side

SN Thakur to Miller, FOUR, first one of this innings for Miller. Comes down the wicket and converts the length delivery into a fullish one. Connects his slap and gets it over cover. On a bounce and into the fence
SN Thakur to Duminy, 1 run, JP is off the mark with a tuck off his hips
Bhuvneshwar to Miller, 2 runs, walks inside the line and works the shortish delivery to long leg for a couple of runs. Successful over for Kumar there

Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, out Caught by Dhawan!! Bhuvi draws first blood, gets Hendricks. Bowls a length delivery around middle and leg, Hendricks stays put and goes for it. Gets the elevation but not the distance against the knuckle ball. As the ball skies up towards wide mid-on, Dhawan calls for it and takes it. Hasn't been an impressive series for the opener. Hendricks c Dhawan b Bhuvneshwar 7(13) [4s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, no run, shortish delivery around off, Hendricks attempts a hook but the bouncer beats him

Bhuvneshwar to Miller, 1 run, short of a length delivery around off, Miller looks to punch that off his back foot and ends up getting an inside edge to short third man. Calls for a single and his partner obliges. Shardul Thakur who went for a direct-hit at the striker's end couldn't hit
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, 1 run, shaped away from the batsman, on a length outside off, Hendricks steers it down to backward point and moves over to the other end
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, no run, nudges the length delivery to the man at short mid-wicket from within the crease

Bumrah to Hendricks, leg byes, 1 run, fast delivery on middle and leg, hits the deck hard and seams in to strike the batsman on his thigh pad. As the ball rolls in front of point, the batsmen change ends in a jiffy
Bumrah to Hendricks, no run, pulls the length back in the channel outside off, Hendricks taps it in front of point
Bumrah to Miller, 1 run, shufles in the crease, moves to his right and tucks the short of a length delivery to deep square leg. Dhawan is the man who tidies it up by converging from fine leg
Bumrah to Miller, no run, short of a length delivery shaping into the batsman from over the wicket, Miller walks across and looks to work that away, ends up getting hit high on the thigh pad
Bumrah to Miller, no run, on a length around off, Miller pushes the first ball he faces solidly to cover
Bumrah to Hendricks, 1 run, starts with a length delivery on middle and leg, Hendricks flicks it away to fine-leg and gets off the mark
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, 1 run, pitched up outside off, Hendricks plays it towards mid-off and takes a quick run. Slight fumble there
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, no run, back of a length around off, Hendricks plays that back to the bowler

Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, FOUR, another good delivery but equally well played. On a length around off, Hendricks plays it late and cuts it towards point. The fielder there leaps in order to stop that but can't stop it completely and parries it away. The fielder chasing at deep point can't stop it either
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, no run, fires in a full length delivery around off, Hendricks stays put and knocks it back to the bowler. Tidy start by Bhuvi, like always
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, no run, that swung away a tad. Pitches outside off, swings away and beats Hendricks' cover-drive. Inches away from kissing the blade
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, no run, starts off with a full length delivery outside off, Hendricks punches it to the off-side
Bhuvneshwar to Willey, 2 runs, full ball outside off, sliced away towards sweeper cover. They hustle back for two to complete the innings
Bhuvneshwar to Plunkett, 1 run, full ball angled in at the stumps, Plunkett hoicks but gets a thick inside edge onto pad
Bhuvneshwar to Willey, 1 run, full and wide outside off, crashed to sweeper cover

Bhuvneshwar to Willey, wide, another one fired in wide of the marker, right in the blockhole. Although Willey came across slightly, the umpire deemed it a wide which didn't go down well with the Indians
Bhuvneshwar to Willey, wide, Willey swings off his feet as he tries chasing a very wide one. Luckily for him, he missed it. Wide, it will be
Bhuvneshwar to Plunkett, 1 run, full ball on leg-stump, Plunkett stays leg-side of it and drives to long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Plunkett, no run, full ball at the stumps, Plunkett fails to get under it and hits it straight back to Bhuvi

Bhuvneshwar to Willey, 1 run, very wide outside off, might have been a wide had Willey left it. But he steps out to swipe it through midwicket and gets a thick inside edge towards Dhoni who - despite being wrongfooted - dives to his right and stops
U Yadav to Willey, 1 run, full toss at the stumps, limply driven down to long-on
U Yadav to Willey, no run, full and wide outside off, swing and a miss from Willey
U Yadav to Plunkett, 1 run, back of a length delivery at the stumps, skids onto Plunkett who chops it through point

U Yadav to Jordan, out Caught&Bowled!! Low full toss tailing in at pace, takes an inside edge onto pad and pops back to Yadav who accepts it gleefully. Jordan was beaten for pace and the late movement as he tried to whip it through the on-side. Jordan c and b U Yadav 0(1)
U Yadav to Willey, 1 run, squeezed out into the off-side
U Yadav to Willey, no run, quick and wide yorker outside off, it's past Willey before he gets his bat across
Kuldeep Yadav to Willey, 1 run, fired in full at the stumps, knocked down to long-on. Kuldeep's sensational spell comes to an end. First left-arm chinaman to take five in T20Is
Kuldeep Yadav to Willey, SIX, Willey playing a blinder for England here. Flighted ball drifting into the pads, he gets down low and shovels the sweep over square leg

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, out Caught by Kohli!! Another miscue, this time it's Kohli under it who makes no mistake. The Indian captain is pumped. Kuldeep has a five-for. Probably not the smartest thing from Buttler here, trying to take on India's most successful bowler. Another googly doing the damage, Buttler backs his strengths as he goes down the ground but he didn't pick the wrong 'un. It comes off the outside half and is taken 15-20 yards inside the boundary. Buttler c Kohli b Kuldeep Yadav 69(46) [4s-8 6s-2]
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, length ball on middle, defended back

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 2 runs, that's an inexplicable miss from India. It was long-off's catch - no question - but as it happens, KL Rahul is going for it running back from extra cover. Eventually, he has to dive back and doesn't even get a finger. Full and fast outside off, miscued loft from Buttler straight off the outside half, big reprieve
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 2 runs, flat googly on leg, clipped through square leg. The fielder in the deep is slightly finer than square, Buttler comes back
Bhuvneshwar to Willey, leg byes, 2 runs, full ball angled in sharply, Willey misses his swipe and it deflects off his pad through midwicket. They rush back for two. 20 off the over
Bhuvneshwar to Willey, wide, and another wild delivery down leg. This has been a very ordinary over from Bhuvneshwar, not what you expect from him at the death
Bhuvneshwar to Willey, wide, well down the leg-side, lost the angle there
Bhuvneshwar to Willey, FOUR, sloppy from Chahal. That shouldn't have escaped him. Not great bowling from Bhuvneshwar though. Full ball at the pads, clipped away by Willey past short fine leg
Bhuvneshwar to Willey, FOUR, some impetus from Willey here. He's 12 off 4. Steps out to a back of a length delivery, the length doesn't deter him and he proceeds to carve it through extra cover
Bhuvneshwar to Willey, no run, the off-cutter straightens on middle, Willey knocks it back down the pitch
Bhuvneshwar to Willey, 2 runs, back of a length delivery angled in on middle (round the wicket now), tucked away through midwicket

Bhuvneshwar to Willey, SIX, that's the worst ball Bhuvneshwar will probably bowl in England. Short of length delivery down leg, Willey simply helps the pull away over the fine leg boundary. Stunningly bad delivery to start the spell
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, no run, back of a length delivery on middle, played back to Hardik
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, no run, length ball on the pads, clipped to square leg

Hardik Pandya to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Raina!! Sliced up in the air, it's a dolly for Raina at extra cover. England crumbling. Back of a length delivery outside off, Ali is working against the angle as he looks to heave it away and he pays for it. The bat twists and it pops up right off the outside half. Moeen Ali c Raina b Hardik Pandya 6(8) [4s-1]
Hardik Pandya to Moeen Ali, no run, full ball pushed across off, punched fiercely but straight to short cover
Hardik Pandya to Moeen Ali, FOUR, lovely timing from Ali - he needed it too as this was an off-pace delivery from Pandya. Clips it off the pads backward of square to beat deep midwicket
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, back of a length delivery at the stumps, clipped down to long-on
U Yadav to Moeen Ali, no run, full ball on off, hurriedly gets his bat down and bunts it to mid-off
U Yadav to Moeen Ali, no run, bends his back with this short of length delivery, it leaps up on Ali and smashes into the splice as he fends it off
U Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, fuller than a good length outside off, driven to the sweeper
U Yadav to Moeen Ali, 1 run, skiddy short of length delivery at the body, Ali helps the pull down to fine leg
U Yadav to Moeen Ali, no run, back of a length delivery on middle and leg, blocked from the crease
U Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, good length ball outside off, driven on the up through cover-point
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, on the pads, clipped behind square
Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, 1 run, thick inside edge from Moeen Ali as he presses forward to defend the hat-trick ball. Even he has no idea about the googly. Wow what a spell

Kuldeep Yadav to Root, out Stumped!! Look at Kuldeep go. He's on fire at Old Trafford. Another googly and another stumping. The ball popped out of Dhoni's gloves initially, but Root was so far out of the crease that Dhoni could collect the rebound and flick over the bails and he still didn't have a chance of making it back. He was floored by this googly. Kuldeep has turned this on its head. Root st Dhoni b Kuldeep Yadav 0(1)

Kuldeep Yadav to Bairstow, out Stumped!! This is electric wrist spin from Kuldeep Yadav. Lovely flight, makes Bairstow stretch forward in defence and then turns it away from his outside edge. Bairstow was clueless about the googly. He was reaching out, he was unbalanced, he was drawn out of the crease, and he was stumped. Brilliant. Bairstow st Dhoni b Kuldeep Yadav 0(1)
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, darted in on a back of a length on middle and leg, clipped through midwicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Eoin Morgan, out Caught by Kohli!! Kuldeep strikes again. Sends the England skipper back this time. The flight on the delivery was too much of a tempter for Morgan to ignore. He immediately bends low eyeing a massive slog-sweep, but the ball turns away from him and takes a thick top-edge near the toe-end. Simple outfield catch for Kohli at deep midwicket. England pegged back in their stride. Eoin Morgan c Kohli b Kuldeep Yadav 7(6)
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, quicker through the air outside off, much fuller too. Driven to long-off
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, no run, tossed up on a length on off, the leg-break turns back into Morgan who defends forward
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, 2 runs, now down the leg-side, swept to the right of short fine leg where Kuldeep does well to take the pace off it. Saves a couple of runs
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, wide, persists with the wide line, Morgan throws his hands at it but fails to connect
Chahal to Buttler, 1 run, short and wide, cut away through the covers
Chahal to Buttler, no run, Chahal gets away with this. It was definitely wide of the marker, and it wasn't as if Buttler had moved across to justify the decision
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, fired in very wide outside off, Morgan chases it and slaps it through to sweeper cover

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 2 runs, back of a length, googly on middle and leg, Buttler tucks it away through square leg. It was played softly enough for them to come back for two. Morgan races back to beat the throw
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, darted in real quick outside off, Buttler steers to cover

Kuldeep Yadav to Eoin Morgan, 3 runs, premeditated paddle-sweep from Morgan to get off the mark. Gets into position quickly by bending across, the leg-break was drifting into him nicely and he just helps it on its way. Lots of ground for long leg to cover

Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, out Bowled!! Hales is put out of his misery. Walks well across against this googly, exposes middle and leg stumps and is bowled behind the legs. He was looking to sweep this hard behind square, but couldn't connect. Smacks his bat onto the turf in disappointment. This may not be the worst thing for England actually, he was really getting stuck. Hales b Kuldeep Yadav 8(18)
Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, no run, uses his feet this time but Kuldeep cleverly pulls the googly back in flight. Hales can only tap it to cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, no run, Hales is struggling badly. Tries nudging this googly through mid-wicket, but hits it so softly that Dhoni is able to get to it in a flash
Hardik Pandya to Hales, 1 run, full toss around off, flicked to deep mid-wicket. 18 off the Pandya over
Hardik Pandya to Hales, 2 runs, full ball spraying on the pads, clipped away wide of fine leg
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, no great timing this time as Buttler swats this back of a length delivery through mid-wicket

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, now slaps this through extra cover. Massive pressure on Pandya. After getting swiped through the on-side with the previous two deliveries, he tries going wider of off. But Buttler has an answer for this too. And what a ruthless answer at that

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, SIX, oh shot. What a way to get to fifty. Back of length delivery, so the length isn't all that short. But again, Buttler has used the depth of the crease well. He goes back and whacks it over the square leg boundary

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, back of a length delivery outside off, it was an off-cutter. Buttler waits on it as he goes deep in the crease before mowing it wide of long-on. All muscle there. Beats Rohit's dive at long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, fired in full outside off, drives it to long-off and retains the strike with it
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, googly outside off, goes on the back foot and pushes it to the off-side
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, yorker outside off, Buttler was caught napping on it. He gets his bat down just on time to dig it out
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, wrong 'un outside off, Buttler pushes it to the off-side
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, goes on the back foot and punches it to cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, fuller length delivery at the stumps, reaches the pitch of the ball, and flicks it beautifully using wrists through mid-wicket for a four
Chahal to Buttler, 1 run, brings out the reverse sweep again and plays it to point for a single
Chahal to Buttler, no run, flighted delivery outside off, Buttler moves to the leg-side a touch and ends up inside edging it to the off-side
Chahal to Buttler, FOUR, reverse sweep comes out. Smart batting. He plays it with the turn and connects it decently well. Manages to get over the short third man and you don't need to run for that
Chahal to Hales, 1 run, fuller length delivery at the stumps, pushes it to long-on
Chahal to Hales, no run, Hales isn't connecting today. Beautiful delivery, directs this one outside off and gives this one lot of air. Hales went for a slog and ends up missing it
Chahal to Hales, no run, slightly dropped down length outside off and has been chopped away into the off-side off the inner half of the blade
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, poor delivery. Bowls a full toss and Buttler comes inside the line of the ball to smash it to square leg for a four
Hardik Pandya to Hales, 1 run, back of a length delivery at the pads, tucks it to the leg-side
Hardik Pandya to Hales, no run, back of a length delivery outside off, misses the cut shot over the off-side
Hardik Pandya to Hales, no run, brilliant change in pace. He bowls it fuller and at the stumps, Hales picks up the slower one late and somehow manages to put bat to it
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, wanted to ramp it over short fine leg but ends up hitting it to the right of Dhoni. Third man comes across and they just take a single
Hardik Pandya to Hales, 1 run, good length delivery outside off, steers it to the third man

Chahal to Buttler, 2 runs, cuts it square of the wicket, and comes back for a risky double. Throw was awful from Mr. Yadav and that allowes Buttler to make it. Umpire went upstairs but he was safely in

Chahal to Buttler, no run, Chahal bringing his IPL experience to the fore. Buttler was shaping to hit through mid-wicket, Chahal watches this and tosses it up well outside off. He manages to only drag it to cover
Chahal to Hales, 1 run, marginally short, Hales stays in the crease and pulls it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Chahal to Buttler, 1 run, fuller length at the stumps, makes room and nudges it to the off-side for another single
Chahal to Hales, 1 run, well tossed up and bowls it much fuller outside off, pushes it to long-off
Chahal to Buttler, 1 run, goes on the back foot and cuts it to deep point
Hardik Pandya to Hales, no run, back of a length delivery at the stumps, stays in the crease and defends to mid-wicket. Excellent over from Hardik Pandya. That completes the powerplay

Hardik Pandya to Hales, no run, backs away to make room for himself, Hardik Pandya follows him and directs it at the stumps. Doesn't time it as well as he would have liked and ends up pushing it to cover
Hardik Pandya to Hales, no run, short of length delivery, Hales tries to pull but ends up missing it
Hardik Pandya to Hales, no run, oh nasty! It hits him where it really hurts. He was hurried by the pace on that back of a length ball and ends up missing the tuck
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, clips it to fine leg and takes a single
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, 2 runs, back of a length delivery at the pads, Buttler tucks it to square leg and takes a quick double. Good running

U Yadav to Roy, out Bowled!! Yadav draws first blood for India. The extra pace of his does the trick. It was on a back of a length and Roy again went for a heave across the line. Yadav was too fast for him and his bat came down a touch late. Ball arrives and takes the stumps with it. He tried this heave for the fifth time, missed first four times and his stumps were shattered on the fifth occassion. Roy b U Yadav 30(20) [4s-5]

U Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, in the air and falls in the no man's land. It was touch short, Buttler went for a pull, he got a top edge and Chahal at fine leg doesn't pick it up at all. He was late to reach and bails out at the last moment. Kohli isn't amused with this
U Yadav to Buttler, no run, on a good length and at the pads, Buttler punches it off the back foot to the off-side
U Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, picks this slower delivery off the hands, gets his hands and head in a great position and strikes it cleanly over mid-on
U Yadav to Roy, 1 run, yorker outside off, Roy was hurried by the pace a touch and inside half of the bat takes it to square leg for a single
U Yadav to Roy, no run, on a good length and just outside off, blocked to the off-side

Chahal to Buttler, FOUR, expected response from Chahal. After being hit down the ground, he bowls this one a touch short. Buttler rocks back in the crease and cuts it sumptuously through cover for another four
Chahal to Buttler, SIX, puts on his dancing shoes to reach the pitch of the ball and tonks it over the mid-on's head for another boundary. Great connection.
Chahal to Roy, 1 run, comes down the track, Chahal slows it down, gives it lot of air. Roy waits for the ball to arrive and turns it to the leg-side
Chahal to Roy, FOUR, pre-meditated reverse sweep from Roy and it comes off. Roy is playing high risk cricket. He played it with the turn and manages to get it over the head of short third man
Chahal to Buttler, 1 run, aiming at the pads and Buttler clips it to deep square leg for a single
Chahal to Buttler, no run, on a good length and it held its line, blocked back to Chahal
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, no run, good length delivery just over the stumps and Roy misses this across the line slog for the fouth time. Look to time the ball, Roy
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, 2 runs, gets inside the line of the ball and clips it to the leg-side for a double

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, slower delivery outside off, Roy was deceived by it. He went for an across the line slog, it went off the outside edge and over the head of third man. Once it hits the outfield it just races along.....
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, 2 runs, tries to only time this one and connects this much better. Shuffles across to the off-side and lofts it to the leg-side for a brace

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, no run, tantalizingly close to the off-stump. He has attempted that heave for the third and he has missed that on all the occasions. It was on a good length and juts outside off, Roy misses across the line slog
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, no run, on a good length and a hint of away movement, played inside the line of the ball and it went past the outside edge

U Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, audacity at its best from Buttler! Gee! Whatta shot. It was a fuller length ball and aimed at the stumps, Yadav isn't medium pace by any means. Buttler moves across and ramps it off the stumps over Dhoni's head for a four
U Yadav to Buttler, no run, on that good length and aiming at the stumps, Buttler stays in the crease and punches it to mid-off
U Yadav to Buttler, no run, looks to clip the ball away and misses. Gets hit on the pad but that was going down
U Yadav to Roy, 1 run, on the pads and clipped away to deep square leg as the ball was too full
U Yadav to Roy, FOUR, forget the format! Top-class hit. A back foot punch screams through the off-side for a four
U Yadav to Roy, no run, too quick for the batsman was he was trying to take on the bowler but misses thanks to the extra yard pace from Yadav. The batsman was cramped for room
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, 1 run, on that good length and just outside off, opens the face of the bat and guides it to point where Pandya fumbles a bit and that allowes Roy to take a run
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, at the stumps and Roy goes air-borne. That is typical Roy. He gets inside the line of the ball and lofts it over square leg. Back to back fours for Roy and England

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, FOUR, first boundary of the day. It was on a good length and moved away a touch, Roy waited for it and times it magnificently well, past the diving cover fielder and goes for a four
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, no run, walks into the shot, it was just outside off and he uses his wrists to defend it to the leg-side
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, 2 runs, this one jagged back in sharply, Roy was almost cramped for room but manages to steer it wide of the third man. There is a long boundary there and batsmen take a brace
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, no run, on that back of a length and moved away marginally after pitching, Roy goes on the back foot and defends it back
Moeen Ali to Kohli, SIX, seals in style. Thumppp. Moeen's been carted around enough, and Kohli joins in with a bottom-handed whip as he runs down the pitch. And lofts it over long-on. Well over
Moeen Ali to Rahul, 1 run, eased down the ground. Generous enough chap, he'll let Kohli finish

Willey to Rahul, 1 run, oh yes. And KL will do a dab to the dressing room. He joins Rohit Sharma on that elusive list - becoming the only two Indians with two T20I centuries. And unless there's an apocalypse, this should end up in a win for him. Does it with a flat-batted heave into deep square leg, and he doesn't even bother with the second. He'd rather celebrate
Willey to Kohli, 1 run, full, wide, angling further. Dug out, under a diving point. Doesn't matter - it's Rahul with his strike back - to become the second Indian with two T20I centuries
Willey to Kohli, 2 runs, rubbery-wrist-whip into the widely vacant cow corner. And he'll make KL wait longer
Willey to Rahul, 1 run, tickled away off the hips. 99
Willey to Rahul, FOUR, airy flick. And India have their first boundary in six overs. An absolute filthy float up down leg, Rahul swipes, almost sweeps .. and there's nothing Moeen can do out there
Willey to Kohli, 1 run, very tennis-like forehand. Down to long-on
Plunkett to Kohli, 1 run, 133kph, rides the bounce to dab it down to third man
Plunkett to Kohli, no run, angry charge down. An angry slap too. And cover couldn't be found better
Plunkett to Kohli, wide, 116kph, tries the slower sucker, but with Kohli walking across his stumps, it meekly trickles down leg
Plunkett to Kohli, no run, 130kph, hard back of a length outside off. Kohli loses timing in his stretched drive
Plunkett to Rahul, 1 run, gets his bottom-hand off in reaching away from his body to squeeze it in front of mid-off, who's way too deep for the situation's liking
Plunkett to Kohli, 1 run, jagging back in on the thighs. Nurdled, behind square
Plunkett to Kohli, no run, mistimed drive, toe-ending it to mid-off
Willey to Kohli, 1 run, stabs now. Just wide of point. 5.3.3.3.5 -- the story of the last few overs, just when we'd become used to seeing these many in a single over itself
Willey to Rahul, 1 run, sweepy-scoop. Helps the already leg-line to a tumbling long leg
Willey to Rahul, no run, on the move down, and then a hook. But then Willey's got it higher
Willey to Kohli, 1 run, bumps it in, angling across as Kohli uses all of it in dabbing it further. Third man again
Willey to Rahul, 1 run, calm punch into the covers. 92
Willey to Kohli, 1 run, backs away. Willey follows his legs. Both adjust with a flick to fine leg
Adil Rashid to Kohli, 1 run, 82kph, some air. A very Kohli-like off-drive, sinking on a knee. And those wrists
Adil Rashid to Kohli, no run, flat, wide, and Kohli leaves
Adil Rashid to Kohli, no run, stays back in his crease, blocking some. Net practice you see
Adil Rashid to Rahul, 1 run, walking drive. Long-off .. bloody confidence
Adil Rashid to Kohli, 1 run, 87kph, short. Kohli goes deep, tucking it to deep square leg
Adil Rashid to Kohli, no run, googly. Kohli covers it with his stride, turning it to short mid-wicket
Jordan to Kohli, 1 run, head-lined. A full-blooded swivel, but decently done to keep the pull down with fine leg waiting just for that
Jordan to Kohli, no run, body-lined. He's happy to buy time, buy defences
Jordan to Rahul, 1 run, punched away, angle-batted through the covers

Jordan to Rahul, no run, England review. In a ground as noisy as this, you'd require snickos in your ears to hear nicks. Well and umpire Michael Gough has them installed. So here it goes - Rahul chases a loopy bouncer going down leg with a pull, misses obviously, and Buttler has heard something. It's off his forearm, a slight flicker
Jordan to Kohli, 1 run, opens up his steer, reaching away from his body to get it behind point
Jordan to Kohli, no run, nipping in on middle off a length. A typical Kohli shuffle, with a typical Kohli-wrist knock. There's short mid-wicket
Adil Rashid to Rahul, no run, straighter one. Tapped away to extra cover
Adil Rashid to Kohli, 1 run, big stride out to the pitch of it, easing it down to long-off

Adil Rashid to Rohit, out Caught by Eoin Morgan!! He's bored watching Rahul -- tries to emulate an inside-out cover drive. This flight makes him wait longer, but Rohit's early, hence not the elevation, and hence the distance equalling it between the pitch at Morgan at short cover. And his love affair with leg-spinners continues to England. Rohit c Eoin Morgan b Adil Rashid 32(30) [4s-3 6s-1]
Adil Rashid to Rahul, 1 run, 89kph, in the crease, knocked away to leg
Adil Rashid to Rohit, 1 run, steps out, realizes the length is a meant-to-be drag down. And adjusts with a square punch
Adil Rashid to Rohit, no run, tossed into middle. Sharma presses out, defending a drive back down the wicket
Jordan to Rohit, 1 run, another full toss. Rohit takes it through the covers, sweeper to be precise
Jordan to Rahul, 1 run, quick bumper. 133kph. Rahul sways, ramps .. having to settle for an inside-half upper cut down to third man
Jordan to Rahul, 2 runs, drifting down. Neatly wristed to tease fine leg in, almost. Makes Willey dive
Jordan to Rahul, no run, 133kph, fuller, Rahul's early now, waiting to chip the drive eventually off the inside half
Jordan to Rahul, no run, on the ribs. Skidding in length, hurrying past Rahul's flat-bat. No, he's fine, he wants a century
Jordan to Rohit, 1 run, nice high full toss. Rohit will watch the show, clipping it round the corner
Plunkett to Rahul, SIX, yup normalcy. Plunkett tries going short. Oh poor Plunkett. Pulled, powered, swinging with his walk inside the line to make it all the more brutal. 20 off the over
Plunkett to Rahul, no run, just outside off, flat-footed in trying a run down to third man. Nope, it can only be this right, he'll have to deal with an inside-edge just past his stumps
Plunkett to Rahul, FOUR, leg. Off. And yes, leg. Hips, now Rahul shows us he can swivel too to whip it away .. behind square
Plunkett to Rahul, FOUR, and inside-out. It's a beauty show, and KL is the queen. Plunkett responds with a pitch up outside off, Rahul lines, stays under and lofts an extra cover class
Plunkett to Rahul, SIX, picks. Dispatches. Floated up on the legs, oh my Rahul doesn't need this. Surely not when he's riding this form. Swipes, flicking it uppishly and flying over fine leg
Plunkett to Rahul, no run, hard good length. Rahul gets across, straight batting .. a rare defence
Moeen Ali to Rahul, 1 run, eases the floated delivery down to long-on and retains strike

Moeen Ali to Rahul, SIX, tremendous hit! This is amazing hitting by Rahul. Takes on Moeen and clears long-on with an effortless lofted shot. India has crossed the 100-run mark too. They are hunting this down well before time

Moeen Ali to Rahul, FOUR, quite a risky shot! This could have easily been an lbw. Flatter one around middle, Rahul gets down on his knee and reverse-slaps right into the gap between backward point and short third man
Moeen Ali to Rohit, 1 run, a bit of air on that as Rohit drags it down to long-on
Moeen Ali to Rahul, 1 run, nudges it through mid-wicket for a single
Moeen Ali to Rohit, 1 run, punches the floated one through the gap at cover

Adil Rashid to Rahul, FOUR, 5th T20I fifty for Rahul! Gets there in style too. This was headed towards the glove of the keeper as Rahul is late to play his shot. Guides it past the diving fielder at short third man and gets to the milestone
Adil Rashid to Rohit, 1 run, drags the flighted delivery towards the fielder at mid-wicket
Adil Rashid to Rahul, 1 run, short in length outside off, well outside off as Rahul eases it into the off side
Adil Rashid to Rohit, 1 run, rotates the strike with an easy knock down to long-on
Adil Rashid to Rohit, no run, floated around off, Rohit stays in his crease and plays it down

Adil Rashid to Rohit, SIX, the crowd is loving this. When Rohit is in form, everyone does. Short in length on middle and leg, Rohit picks it nicely and goes back in his crease to club it way into the stands over mid-wicket. Sublime timing and connection on that blow
Moeen Ali to Rahul, 2 runs, short and flat on middle and leg, Rahul is quick to camp back and pull it in the gap at mid-wicket. Long-on sprints to his right and saves two
Moeen Ali to Rohit, 1 run, nudges this to deep square leg for a single
Moeen Ali to Rahul, 1 run, works that short one towards mid-wicket and takes a single
Moeen Ali to Rahul, 2 runs, floater on middle and leg, Rahul tucks it away to the man at deep mid-wicket and comes back for two

Moeen Ali to Rahul, SIX, that's a towering shot! The fielder at long-on was interested, but he came in as the ball was hit towards him. Rahul came down the track and tonked it towards long-on where Jordon misjudged it and spilt it over the boundary
Moeen Ali to Rahul, FOUR, premeditates and does it well. Goes on his knee and reverse sweeps the floater past short third man. The pace was enough and all Rahul had to do is get it past the fielder
Adil Rashid to Rohit, FOUR, here comes the fifty-run stand. Short and fraction wide. Rohit quickly camps back and cuts it. Past the fielder stationed at point and away to the fence in no time.
Adil Rashid to Rohit, no run, eases the tossed up delivery back to Rashid. He's picking him but a touch late
Adil Rashid to Rohit, no run, the straighter delivery, right in the slot on middle, Rohit attempts a sweep and gets an inside edge. Past the leg-stump and towards short fine leg
Adil Rashid to Rohit, no run, another wrong 'un. Around off and Rohit goes back to late-cut it to short third man
Adil Rashid to Rahul, 1 run, the leg-break, short and well outside off, Rahul rocks back and punches it through cover
Adil Rashid to Rohit, 1 run, starts off with a googly, Rohit is quick to camp back and whip it down to long-on
Plunkett to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length around middle and leg, Rohit stays in his crease and nurdles this around the corner to get a single
Plunkett to Rahul, 1 run, drills the full toss down to long-on to hand over the strike to Rohit

Plunkett to Rahul, FOUR, fifty up for India with a boundary. Short delivery aimed at the helmet, Rahul is quick to swivel and help it on its away over short fine leg. Boundaries have started to flow from the blade of both batsmen
Plunkett to Rahul, no run, short and slow around middle and leg, Rahul goes for a hack, but doesn't connect it
Plunkett to Rahul, no run, full toss around off, Rahul fails to get proper connection and mistimes his push to cover
Plunkett to Rahul, no run, pitched up, the line is middle and leg, Rahul plays the on-drive. Somewhat similar to a helicopter, but keeps it on the ground. Straight to the fielder at mid-on though
Jordan to Rohit, FOUR, picks the slower one this time around. Full in length around off, Rohit shimmies down the track and clobbers this past the fielder at mid-off. Another impressive shot by Sharma

Jordan to Rohit, no run, how close, how close to that leg-stump! Was the slower delivery and Rohit had no clue about it. Comes down the wicket way early and goes ahead with a hack. End result - a bottom edge that goes past the leg-stump! Jordan had his hands on his head!
Jordan to Rahul, 1 run, shuffles a bit, counters the line with a wristy flick. Was a length delivery on middle and leg,
Jordan to Rohit, 1 run, short again, Rohit goes for a pull and mistimes his pull to deep mid-wicket

Jordan to Rohit, FOUR, Rohit finally gets one shot right. Was looking to play that release shot since quite a while. Stays back in his crease and squeezes the fullish delivery through point. No fielder to stop this as Rohit gets his first one of the match
Jordan to Rohit, no run, back of a length around off, Rohit bunts it back to the bowler

Plunkett to Rahul, FOUR, boundary to end the over! Beautiful shot, exclaims Deep Dasgupta on air as Rahul crashes one into the fence. Srhot of a length around off, Rahul takes a step ahead and plays the square cut. Right past the fielder at backward point as this races away

Plunkett to Rahul, FOUR, nicely done! Full again but on the pads, Rahul moves towards the off-stump and glances it down to fine leg. The fielder was inside the circle and Rahul knew it. Gets it away to the fence eventually
Plunkett to Rahul, wide, short and wide outside off, Rahul flashes at it but it's well outside the guideline
Plunkett to Rohit, 1 run, was way early into his pull on that occasion. Short of a length bowled with rolled fingers. Rohit was on his front foot as he dragged it with his cue-end to deep mid-wicket
Plunkett to Rahul, 1 run, flicks this full one towards deep mid-wicket and takes a single again
Plunkett to Rohit, 1 run, drags his length back after bowling a full one previously. Rohit camps back and plays a late cut to find the fielder at third man
Plunkett to Rohit, no run, pitched on a full length again, around off as Rohit drills it towards the fielder at mid-off

Willey to Rahul, no run, dropped! Rahul gets away with it as Roy puts one down at backward point. He was probably too close, should have been back. Fullish delivery outside off, Rahul sqeezes it nicely but fails to keep it on the ground. Roy ain't pleased with that effort

Willey to Rahul, FOUR, class written all over that shot. Slightly full and outside off, Rahul gets down on his knee and creams his drive through the gap at cover. Even the diving fielder had no answers to this classic drive
Willey to Rahul, no run, full toss around off, Rahul times his drive but goes straight to mid-off
Willey to Rahul, 2 runs, on the pads again, on a length and Rahul flicks this through the gap at mid-wicket. Fielder was quite square to stop them from taking the second

Willey to Rohit, leg byes, 1 run, a mild appeal for an lbw by Willey. But the impact was a bit high, and was probably missing leg too. Short of a length delivery on middle and leg, raps Rohit's pads as he fails to connect his on side tuck
Willey to Rohit, wide, shaping away from the batsman, down the leg side as Rohit fails to counter the swing. Tried to glance it away, couldn't connect though
Willey to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Rahul punches it in the gap at cover-point for a single
Jordan to Rohit, no run, extra carry on that! Was short and wide outside off, Rohit tries to play the upper cut but gets done by the extra bounce. Could have easily top-edged that to the keeper
Jordan to Rohit, no run, good length delivery in the channel outside off, too close to the batsman as Rohit tamely chops it in front of point

Jordan to Rahul, 3 runs, excellent stop by Willey near the fence. Was a beautiful flick by Rahul but Willey was equally good with his chase, sliding near the fence and flicking it back into play. Can't stop the batsmen from taking three though
Jordan to Rahul, no run, pitched up, just outside off, Rahul gets forward in a stylish drive again. Cover-point in action as the ball comes at him

Jordan to Rahul, SIX, he's in the form of his life. Had a fantastic IPL earlier this year. His innings against Ireland wasn't bad either. Reaches for the full length ball and lofts it with nonchalance over the cover fence. The Indian fans in the crowd are up and roaring. They loved it!
Jordan to Rahul, no run, starts off with an away swinging delivery, wide enough to be left by the batsman. Was a stylish leave by Rahul that
Willey to Rahul, 1 run, ends the over with a full length ball, on the pads though as Rahul flicks it away to deep square leg

Willey to Dhawan, out Bowled!! First blow to India as Willey gets his man. Corrects his line and length. Was a full length delivery outside off, swinging away too. Dhawan was lured into a drive but ends up getting an inside edge. Ricochets on to the stumps and he makes his walk back to the hut, early in the innings. That'll unsettle some nerves back in the dressing room. Dhawan b Willey 4(4) [4s-1]
Willey to Rohit, 1 run, in the channel outside off, on a good length as Rohit steers it past backward point
Willey to Rohit, wide, got to see quite a few of these in the first innings. Bhuvi bowled quite a few wides too. Swinging on a full length but down the leg side as Rohit lets it go
Willey to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, short of a length on middle and leg, Dhawan fails to connect his tuck as the ball flicks his pads and rolls over to square leg
Willey to Dhawan, no run, swinging away, full and outside off, Dhawan shoulders arms

Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, the chase it on it's way. Couldn't be a better start. Not a convincing shot though! Was a length delivery and well outside off, Dhawan throws his bat at it and gets an edge. It's off the toe-end and well past the fielder at slip

Cottrell to Kohli, SIX, Kohli finishes off in style. It was a fine over up until the last delivery. Cottrell loses his length and the margin of error on this ground is very minimal, Kohli is down on his haunches as he smokes it straight back over the sightscreen. Picked the slower ball and absolutely smashed it
Cottrell to Kohli, wide, tries to keep it out of Kohli's hitting range and ends up spraying it outside off, Kohli does not go chasing after it and it is an easy call for umpire Nitin Menon
Cottrell to Kohli, no run, nails it in the blockhole and Kohli can only jam it back down the wicket. It has been a top over from Cottrell so far

Cottrell to Rahul, out Caught by Pooran!! Rahul asks umpire Nitin Menon if it was the second short ball of the over. The two umpires converge and send it upstairs. It is clearly below the shoulder and Rahul has been given the marching orders. The short slower delivery around chest height, Rahul goes for the pull and gets a fat top-edge, the ball goes into the skies and Pooran to take a simple catch. So, no hundred for Rahul as he walks off to a standing ovation. Rahul c Pooran b Cottrell 91(56) [4s-9 6s-4]

Cottrell to Kohli, 1 run, slanted across the right hander and Kohli loses his shape as he tries an ugly hoick to the on-side, nowhere close to the middle and he will have to settle with a single to deep mid-wicket

Cottrell to Kohli, no run, a surprise short ball and it was well-directed by Cottrell, Kohli was not expecting that and he was clearly late on the pull/hook, the ball flies over his top-edge and brushes the helmet on the way to Pooran. Kohli knew it and he straightaway send the decision upstairs. Clear gap between the glove and the ball on the replay

Cottrell to Rahul, leg byes, 1 run, needless from Rahul. He goes for the cheeky reverse paddle, misses and is struck on the pad, the ball rolls into the off-side and Kohli calls him through for the single

Pollard to Kohli, SIX, massive over for India, 27 runs off it. West Indies and Pollard were always gambling and today it didn't pay off. Once more Kohli peppers the area near deep mid-wicket. Good length ball on off and middle, Kohli flicks it with those supple wrists of his for his sixth maximum. Kohli asks someone to stay silent with his gloves
Pollard to Rahul, 1 run, now bangs the cutter into the surface and Rahul was almost through the shot, ends toe-ending it to long-on
Pollard to Kohli, 1 run, slower ball outside off, Kohli fetches the heave and mistimes it towards long-on

Pollard to Kohli, FOUR, Hetmyer misfields now to hand Kohli a boundary. It was a powerful shot but you expect it to be stopped at this level. On a length and outside off, Kohli thumps it on the rise to deep extra cover, the ball was traveling at the rate of knots and Hetmyer could not clasp his hands quick enough to make the stop

Pollard to Kohli, no ball, 2 runs, oh no! The third umpire has spotted the no-ball and called for it. Kohli mistimes the heave towards long-on and Holder fumbles, enough time for Rahul to race back for the second

Pollard to Kohli, SIX, fifty for Kohli. This is the Kohli of old who is in the face of the opposition all the time. Think he was searching for Williams and found him at short fine, points his bat towards him as he celebrates the landmark. Another slower ball angled in, Kohli does not get hold of the whip this time but has enough to clear the short Wankhede boundaries. He is pumped. He is on fire. And he is putting on a show
Pollard to Kohli, SIX, towers the first ball into the stands. Gentle good length delivery and Kohli does not even look where the ball landed, he maintains a good base and launches it over long-on

Kesrick Williams to Rahul, 2 runs, the fielder is not Pollard and Kohli is off in a flash for the second. Rahul pushes this full delivery in front of long-off and it was the skipper who called for the two immediately, nothing much Holder could do once Kohli had made up his mind

Kesrick Williams to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length around off, Kohli steers it to short third man and settles with a single. He called Rahul immediately after making contact despite the ball going straight to the fielder, completed the run and stares at Williams

Kesrick Williams to Kohli, SIX, Williams errs in length and Kohli has a few words for him after he sends the ball into the crowd. It was the slower back of a length deliveries that was difficult to score in the previous couple of overs, but this was on a length and allowed Kohli to get underneath it, he brings his bottom hand into play to whip it over cow corner. Gee he enjoyed watching that ball sail all the way after making contact

Kesrick Williams to Rahul, 1 run, shortens the length and Rahul is cramped for room, mistimes the pull to wide long-on and sprints for the first run. But since Pollard was the fielder, Kohli was not taking him on

Kesrick Williams to Rahul, SIX, it is time for Rahul to step on the gas and take India to a competitive total. The slower balls is fed on a fullish length, Rahul sets himself by staying deep in the crease and lofts through the line, plenty of air time and it clears long-off easily in the end. Look at Kohli. He's charged up. He's making his presence felt to the bowler at the non-striker's end
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, angled in from wide of the crease and Kohli has missed the flick, the ball brushes the pad on the way to Pooran who dives across to parry it to short fine
