Cottrell to Rahul, FOUR, that is one way to deal with the slower short of length deliveries. Rahul backs away a bit and gives himself the space to free his arms, flat-bats it straight past Cottrell and the fielder at long-on has no chance to stop that
Cottrell to Kohli, 1 run, good length ball and Kohli whips it sans timing to deep mid-wicket. He went too hard and lost his timing

Cottrell to Kohli, FOUR, edged and over Pooran. The cutter at 119kph and it had spongy-like bounce, Kohli looks to heave it across the line and the top-edge flies over to the right of Pooran. Cottrell leaps up expecting it would carry to the keeper
Cottrell to Rahul, 1 run, 124.6kph back of a length delivery, Rahul walks into the punch and sends it to long-off

Cottrell to Rahul, no run, and Cottrell has also resorted to slower balls. 114.7kph short of length delivery and Rahul cuts it straight to cover-point. He is not able to generate the power when the pace is taken off
Cottrell to Kohli, 1 run, 117.9kph length delivery on the pads, Kohli flicks it past Williams at short fine but Walsh does brilliantly to get cut the angle and keep it down to a single

Kesrick Williams to Kohli, 1 run, superb over from Williams, just 3 runs off it. In fact, he has gone for only 7 runs after conceding 14 in his first over. The slower short of length delivery and would have been wide had Kohli let go, but he chases and chops it towards extra cover
Kesrick Williams to Rahul, 1 run, low full toss on leg-stump, fliced close to short fine where Cottrell dives to make the stop
Kesrick Williams to Rahul, no run, 116.4kph short ball outside off, Rahul is livid as he under-edges the cut to Pooran. He reckons he has missed out there as it was short and wide
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, 1 run, once more no pace on offer as Williams slips in the leg-cutter, Kohli mistimes the punch to the right of cover-point and has to settle with a single
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, no run, back of a length around off, Kohli defends it back to Williams. He acknowledges the good ball by nodding his head
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, no run, 119.5kph short of length delivery and Kohli chops the cut to cover-point

Holder to Kohli, 1 run, banged into the surface and Kohli is smart enough, he rolls his wrists over the pull and sends it along the ground to deep mid-wicket. He knew the runs had come and there was no point going for another big shot

Holder to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli has come out firing. Another length delivery and he targets his favorite area in the field - mid-wicket. The bottom hand comes into play as he flicks it uppishly over the infield and the ball bounces a couple of times before reaching the fence

Holder to Kohli, SIX, this is horrible bowling from Holder. Might have slipped out of his hand. A high full toss just below the waist and Kohli feeds on it, uses his power to send it roaring over the backward square fence

Holder to Kohli, FOUR, ufff! Those wrists of Kohli have come to the Wankhede as well. He struck a couple like this in the first game but this is squarer, full delivery angled in and Kohli whips it with a lot of bottom hand to the right of mid-wicket, King had no chance of getting across to stop it

Holder to Rahul, 1 run, run-out missed. Rahul had given up. Holder could have taken his time. He once again watches Rahul's feet and keeps it close to yorker length, the flick is missed and the ball deflects off the pad in front of Holder, Kohli calls for the single and is almost next to Rahul when the latter decides to go, Holder gathers the ball and misses the target at the bowler's end

Holder to Rahul, SIX, woah! That is just indescribable. Rahul moved away to leg to make room and Holder follows him with a full delivery, there was just a wee bit of space and Rahul capitalizes, holds his shape and lofts it inside out over extra cover. The timing was such that it clears the rope quite comfortably

Hayden Walsh to Kohli, SIX, Kohli is already pumped. He is nodding his head and saying something to someone on the field. Walsh gives it a bit of air and that is enough for Kohli to get underneath, he kneels down and slog sweeps it straight over long-on
Hayden Walsh to Kohli, no run, flighted around off, Kohli drags the sweep straight to mid-wicket
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, 1 run, fraction short at 100.9kph, Rahul pulls it on the bounce to long-on
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, no run, slower and it grips on the surface, Rahul chops the cut to backward point

Hayden Walsh to Kohli, byes, 1 run, fired in the blockhole and Kohli cannot squeeze it out, tough take for Pooran and the ball deflects off his pad towards short fine, Rahul calls through for a quick run
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, 1 run, full toss and Rahul is disappointed that he didn't put that away, whips it along the ground to long-on

Pollard to Rahul, 1 run, two good overs on the trot for West Indies. India have scored 10 and lost two wickets in those. Back of a length delivery and Rahul knocks it in front of square on the off-side
Pollard to Kohli, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Kohli crunches it sweetly but close to sweeper cover, just a single
Pollard to Rahul, 1 run, angled in from wide of the crease and Rahul nudges it to the vacant mid-wicket region
Pollard to Kohli, 1 run, short of length around off, Kohli rides the bounce and steers it to third man

Pollard to Pant, out Caught by Holder!! He has a smile as Holder pouches it near the boundary. The license was there but Pant might have taken a couple of balls to get himself in. But no, he decides to get going from the start and perishes in the process. The off-cutter that lands full and outside off, Pant smacks it flat and to the right of long-off, Holder runs around the circumference and takes a good catch. Pollard is delighted with the wicket and he pumps his fist. Pant c Holder b Pollard 0(2)
Pollard to Rahul, 1 run, walks down the wicket and knocks it with soft hands in front of long-on, the idea was to steal a couple but Pant puts his hand and gestures to Rahul that a single is enough
Pollard to Rahul, wide, starts with a wayward delivery down leg, Rahul shuffles inside the line and cannot make any connection

Kesrick Williams to Pant, no run, a fine over from Williams, just the 4 runs and the wicket of Rohit. He ends it with a full toss outside off, Pant is down on his knee and goes hard on the drive, no contact made
Kesrick Williams to Rahul, 1 run, fuller and outside off, Rahul drives it to deep extra cover

Kesrick Williams to Rohit, out Caught by Hayden Walsh!! Williams has his finger on his lips and tells his mates to calm down. The break in play might have had a role to play in Rohit losing his concentration. He went for an ugly heave across the line and got it high on the bat, the ball stayed up for a long time and when it came down, Walsh was under it waiting. Terrific catch from the youngster as he had to run in from the deep mid-wicket fence and keep his cool under such a pressure situation. Nonetheless, the Wankhede stand up to applaud a fine innings from Rohit. Rohit c Hayden Walsh b Kesrick Williams 71(34) [4s-6 6s-5]
Kesrick Williams to Rahul, 1 run, 117.3kph back of a length delivery and Rahul is not able to time the ball, tries to force it through the off-side but mistimes it through the extra cover region
Kesrick Williams to Rohit, 1 run, off-pace delivery outside off, Rohit reaches out and mistimes the drive to long-off

Kesrick Williams to Rahul, 1 run, slower short of length delivery, Rahul delays his cut and sends it behind square, he wanted a second but Rohit is not interested. Lewis tidies up in the deep and seems to have done something to his knee
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, 1 run, tossed up on off, Rahul rolls his wrists and works it to long-on

Hayden Walsh to Rahul, FOUR, another freebie from Walsh. He has been poor this over. A nice juicy full toss and Rahul is happy with the second best result. He uses his wrists and whip-swipes it along the ground to cow corner - right between deep mid-wicket and long-on

Hayden Walsh to Rahul, FOUR, much needed boundary for Rahul. He has not had the strike much and not scored a boundary for a while. Flighted delivery outside off, Rahul drives it inside out but such is the elegance that he plays that all along the ground to deep extra cover

Hayden Walsh to Rohit, 1 run, shimmies down the wicket and absolutely drills it to extra cover, such was the power that Simmons could only deflect it away towards long-off, Rahul is content with the single
Hayden Walsh to Rohit, no run, quicker and no space to work with, Rohit knocks it down the wicket

Hayden Walsh to Rohit, SIX, the biggies continue to flow.. Rohit was helped here by Walsh. Half tracker on leg-stump and Rohit just had to pick his spot, swivels and pulls it into the crowd near long leg
Holder to Rohit, 1 run, full toss and strangely Rohit was kind to flick that along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Holder to Rohit, wide, slower delivery down leg, has to rebowl that

Holder to Rohit, FOUR, there's the luck that comes your way when you get going bravely. Full delivery and in the slot, Rohit tried to launch over long-on, thick edge flies fine of the keeper and into the third man fence
Holder to Rahul, 1 run, low full toss, dug out to long-on
Holder to Rahul, no run, Rahul livid with himself for placing this leg-side guide straight to short fine leg. A couple of yards either side would have been four
Holder to Rohit, 1 run, brilliant yorker following Rohit as he backed away. The batsman had to take his leg out of the way to dig this out through square leg
Holder to Rahul, 1 run, nudged to mid-wicket and that's a fifty for KL Rahul. Gets a good round of applause from his team-mates and the crowd
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, 1 run, brilliant back foot cut to this quicker delivery, but great work at deep point too. Just a run
Hayden Walsh to Rohit, 1 run, a proper slog sweep but he's hit it straight to deep mid-wicket
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, 1 run, flatter delivery on the off stump, Rahul taps it to cover
Hayden Walsh to Rohit, 1 run, overpitched delivery, Rohit mistimes the drive as the bowler rushed him, rolls to long-off
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, 1 run, short and wide, Rahul guides it square of the wicket on the off-side
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, no run, nice quicker delivery just inside the wide line, Rahul let it go. Cleverly bowled

K Pierre to Rohit, FOUR, full toss now, Pierre has lost it. Rohit reaches out and sensibly guides the ball wide of point, knowing there's no sweeper on the off-side. 21 runs off it, the best over the innings. 100 up in just 8 overs

K Pierre to Rohit, SIX, you just cannot bowl full as a bowler here! Pierre's got to learn. This is a monstrous lofted hit straight down the ground and that's probably gone into the top tier. Nothing full delivery, Rohit has a clean swing of the bat and it's a 23-ball fifty for Ro
K Pierre to Rohit, SIX, yikes! He's been waiting for a ball in his zone and as soon as Pierre overpitched one, he was down on one knee and out came a powerful slog sweep over mid-wicket
K Pierre to Rahul, 1 run, mistimed paddle goes to short fine leg as Pierre bowls a leg-side line
K Pierre to Rahul, 2 runs, cut late and past backward point, another couple of runs
K Pierre to Rahul, wide, fired down leg, keeper doesn't collect cleanly, but short fine leg had it covered
K Pierre to Rohit, 1 run, flatter delivery down the leg-side, worked away behind square
Hayden Walsh to Rohit, 1 run, punched square of the wicket on the off-side for a run
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, 1 run, knocked to long-on, they think about two, but Pollard attacked the ball quickly to prevent the second

Hayden Walsh to Rahul, FOUR, Hayden Walsh will argue he's not bowled a bad ball! This is a flatter delivery, that's the latest of late cuts you will in recent times. Almost played it just in front of the keeper's gloves and the connection very fine too. Into the third man fence
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, no run, loud "noooo," from Rohit as Rahul dangerously takes off for a run pushing this flighted delivery to the left of the bowler
Hayden Walsh to Rohit, 1 run, square-driven to deep point as Hayden Walsh fires full and outside off stump
Hayden Walsh to Rohit, 2 runs, full toss on the stumps, Rohit paddles it to fine leg. Could have fancied slogging that over mid-wicket for a maximum than being gentle on that full toss
Kesrick Williams to Rahul, no run, that would have been a wide had he let go, tried to reach out to this short delivery and under edged it to the keeper
Kesrick Williams to Rahul, no run, change of pace, Rahul pushes towards the off-side, gets an inside edge that rolls into the on-side
Kesrick Williams to Rahul, no run, slower delivery outside off stump, Rahul guides to cover-point

Kesrick Williams to Rahul, FOUR, you got to wonder how such a classy player is so inconsistent. He's right up there with the best with his strokeplay when he gets going. Full delivery, Rahul leans forward and powers the cover drive, the fielder got a hand on it, yet the timing was good enough

Kesrick Williams to Rahul, SIX, gee, what a shot! Viru Sehwag will be proud of that hit. Shortish from Kesrick Williams, Rahul plays the upper cut over third man. The highlight of this shot was how well Rahul bent his knees to get under the ball

Kesrick Williams to Rahul, FOUR, what a shot! West Indies are all about brute power in this format. But here are Rohit and Rahul making jaws drop with proper cricketing shots. Fullish delivery just outside off stump, Rahul leans forward and plays the drive, just middled that than hitting hard, big open space at deep cover and he hit that
K Pierre to Rohit, no run, shortish delivery outside off stump, Rohit cuts to backward point
K Pierre to Rahul, 1 run, Rahul hints at jumping down the ground and Pierre shortens his length to concede just a run to long-off through a punch
K Pierre to Rohit, 1 run, very full delivery outside off stump, Rohit drives it to long-off
K Pierre to Rohit, FOUR, this is short and width on offer outside off stump, Rohit cuts late and wide of backward point. Turning out to be another great over for India

K Pierre to Rohit, 2 runs, oh stunning effort from Evin Lewis. He caught the ball, but released as he was about to cross the boundary. Rohit escapes. And it was poor from Rohit that he had to put in the dive to avoid the run-out scare on the second attempt despite having so much time. Lewis had to jump over the ad boards to avoid damage to himself, Rohit was just ball-watching. Rahul pushed him for the second run. But full credit for the shot though. Short delivery, pulled flat, looked six for most bits, but Lewis's piece of fielding scripted all the drama

K Pierre to Rohit, SIX, no, no no, no no no! Do not bowl full freebie deliveries to quality batsmen at this venue please. Rohit waits as he spots the length early and almost slog-sweeps the loft over long-on

Holder to Rahul, SIX, upper cut and it's cleared third man. May be he should have attempted this shot for the fourth ball too. He may say this bounced a tad more. Anyway, short and wide, Rahul cuts hard and late, great timing to send it over the rope
Holder to Rahul, FOUR, there's that swipe across the line with his wrists despite the front foot pointing towards wide mid-off. Overpitched delivery from Holder, Rahul whips it away over mid-wicket
Holder to Rahul, no run, good length and outside off stump, strange leave from Rahul
Holder to Rahul, 2 runs, tucks it to deep mid-wicket and calls for an easy two
Holder to Rahul, no run, defended straight back to the bowler

Holder to Rahul, 2 runs, sloppy from West Indies, Williams fumbles while backing up the throw from Lewis. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Rahul taps it to cover and sets off, a direct-hit would have been interesting but they got an extra run

Cottrell to Rohit, FOUR, that's pure class from Ro! Third man in, so any width outside off stump he tries to use the pace and he guides this precisely in the gap between short third man and the keeper. 16 off the over

Cottrell to Rohit, no run, nice stop. That cover-drive was racing across for four. Cottrell got away with this full ball, thanks to his captain stretching full length to his right to stop that with bucket hands
Cottrell to Rahul, 1 run, fullish delivery, Rahul works it through square leg
Cottrell to Rohit, 1 run, short of length delivery on the leg stump, Rohit hops and glances it to fine leg
Cottrell to Rohit, FOUR, overcorrection from the bowler. Really full, right in the slot, Rohit calmly off-drives, mid-off was not in business and the outfield is fast here at the Wankhede

Cottrell to Rohit, SIX, lofted and it lands on the rope. 400th international six for Ro! Cottrell got the length wrong by bowling slightly short, Rohit swung across the line and sent it all the way over mid-wicket despite not getting the middle of the bat

Holder to Rahul, no run, beaten! Fine finish to the over, which was all about two edges to the boundary. Short of a length delivery swinging away outside off stump, Rahul plays inside the line and misses the ball

Holder to Rahul, no run, lovely delivery! The surprise short delivery. Rahul was expecting a swinging delivery but Holder banged the ball short and got it to rise, Rahul on his toes tried to poke, escaped the edge. Umpire Nitin Menon turned down the appeal for caught behind

Holder to Rahul, FOUR, and another edge past slip and into the third man fence. This is a conventional outside edge as Rahul looks to defend this outswinger with a straight bat, Simmons had no chance at third man again

Holder to Rahul, FOUR, edged and it goes very fine to take third man out of the equation. Good length delivery outside off stump, Rahul drives and gets a thick edge, looked like it came off the bottom of the bat, streaky way to open the account
Holder to Rohit, 1 run, Rohit moves away to unsettle the bowler, Holder follows and cramps him with a short of length delivery, pulled away to long leg, protection in the deep
Holder to Rohit, no run, full and just swinging away outside off stump, Rohit softly pushes it towards cover
Cottrell to Rahul, no run, Rahul wanted to guide that past short third man and get a boundary, but he sends this length delivery straight to the fielder
Cottrell to Rohit, 1 run, yorker down leg, Rohit adjusts and tucks it through square leg
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, this one doesn't move much, Rohit defends
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, inswinging length delivery, Rohit turns it to backward square leg

Cottrell to Rohit, FOUR, in the air but big gap wide of mid-off. Ovepitched delivery, Rohit never bothered to keep that down the ground, lofted so easily and the timing was pretty decent to take the ball to the boundary. India and the crowd are away
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, oh lovely inswinger and it was almost a yorker, Rohit manages to get his bat down in time to defend. Very interesting to see Rohit have a really open stance

Chahar to Cottrell, no run, that's the end of the game. Knuckle ball to finish things off. Cottrell has no clue as he slightly bends looking to heave it and makes no connection whatsoever. The series in the bag for India as they wrap it up 2-1
Chahar to Cottrell, no run, back of a length and rushing across the right-hander just outside off, Cottrell swings and misses
Chahar to Cottrell, FOUR, low full toss and Cottrell tonks it over mid-off. Backed away to the leg-side, gets some bat on it and lifts it over the in-field

Chahar to Cottrell, no run, Pant and Chahar appeal for a caught-behind but umpire Nitin Menon rejects it. The former looks up at Rohit and wants a review but India don't have one. Shorter and gathering height outside off, Cottrell chases with his horizontal bat and can't quite connect. There was some deviation, there could've been a faint edge there. Anyway, it hardly matters now

Chahar to K Pierre, out Caught by (sub)Jadeja!! Soft dismissal this. Virat claps in the dressing room. The knuckle ball from Chahar, dupes Pierre completely as he pokes it without any intent. Chips a sitter to Jadeja at point, who accepts it gleefully. K Pierre c (sub)Jadeja b Chahar 6(12)
Chahar to K Pierre, no run, very full and wide of off, Pierre reaches out and pushes it half-heartedly back to the bowler

Bhuvneshwar to Kesrick Williams, FOUR, oh, nice. Williams wants to prove a point with the bat. Spots a shortish delivery, backs away and uses the pace on offer. Opens his bat face as well and ramps it over Pant

Bhuvneshwar to Kesrick Williams, SIX, will Williams tick this six in his notebook? This comes out of nowhere. Pitched up just outside off, Williams steps out and makes enough room to free his arms. Blasts it straight down the ground and there's a catch that's been taken by a gentleman beyong the boundary ropes
Bhuvneshwar to K Pierre, 1 run, leg-cutter on a fuller length just outside off, Pierre drags it along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to K Pierre, no run, brisk bouncer, taking flight and Pierre half-ducks as he tries to pull
Bhuvneshwar to K Pierre, no run, takes the pace off this length delivery just outside off, Pierre goes too hard at it and chops it off the inside edge

Bhuvneshwar to Kesrick Williams, 1 run, dropped. A sharp catch for Kumar and he can only get a hand on it. These catches have to stick, as simple as that. Full and angled in, Williams bashes it uppishly back at the bowler. Bhuvneshwar sticks his left hand but can't hold onto it
Washington Sundar to Kesrick Williams, 1 run, 98.3kph. Darted just outside off, Williams with a forward press and pushes it to cover
Washington Sundar to Kesrick Williams, wide, oh, terrible delivery from Sundar. Faster and miles down leg, Pant does really well to get a hand on this
Washington Sundar to Kesrick Williams, no run, fired on leg, Williams misses the flick and it comes off the pads. Dribbles to short fine leg
Washington Sundar to K Pierre, 1 run, flighted outside off, Pierre fetches the sweep from there and brooms it to deep square leg
Washington Sundar to Kesrick Williams, 1 run, picked away to deep mid-wicket

Washington Sundar to K Pierre, 1 run, "Ahhh" appeals Pant but Sundar is not interested. Looped up on middle, Pierre sinks low to sweep and gets an underedge which bobbles to square leg. It's not even hit his pads I guess
Washington Sundar to K Pierre, no run, quicker and skidding on just outside off, Pierre with a lazy waft and inside-edges it onto his pads

Shami to Kesrick Williams, no run, Shami can't believe how Williams has managed to keep this out. This was on target. A razor-sharp yorker at the base of middle, Williams nullifies the threat by getting his bat down in time

Shami to Hayden Walsh, out Bowled!! Tries to be too cheeky does Walsh and pays the price. No real celebration from Shami, just turns and gets back to his run-up. Full and nipping back in, Walsh goes low and across looking to scoop. Misses the line altogether and hears the death rattle. Hayden Walsh b Shami 11(13) [4s-1]
Shami to K Pierre, 1 run, yorker from Shami, following Pierre's pads, who clears his front leg and digs it out to mid-wicket

Shami to K Pierre, 2 runs, sloppy stuff from India. Glided behind point and the throw from the fielder was so wayward that Pant had no chance of collecting as it was near the middle of the pitch. No backing up meant that they will steal one more
Shami to K Pierre, no run, sizzling bouncer from Shami. Kicking up outside off and Pierre decides to leave. Umpire Nandan calls first-bouncer for the over
Shami to Hayden Walsh, 1 run, slower delivery outside off stump, Walsh drives uppishly to mid-off, just short of KL Rahul
Chahar to K Pierre, no run, 126.3kph. Chahar goes for the bumper and Pierre is happy to duck under it
Chahar to Hayden Walsh, 1 run, pushes it towards point
Chahar to Hayden Walsh, no run, another short ball, gets big on Walsh and thuds Walsh behind the shoulder. Flies past Pant towards third man
Chahar to Hayden Walsh, FOUR, smashed in the gap and Walsh will collect a boundary. Ushered short and it sits up well for Walsh, who rocks back and nails it in the gap
Chahar to Hayden Walsh, no run, full and zips through quicker than Walsh expected. He's beaten on the flick and it rolls to the off-side after hitting him on the pad
Chahar to Hayden Walsh, 2 runs, smashed wide of long-on and Walsh picks up a brace

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, out Caught by (sub)Jadeja!! This should be the match for India. The whole of Wankhede will breathe a sigh of relief. So, will Kohli and the Indian fans all over the world. But hats off to Pollard for the effort. It's been a superb innings from him. Kumar backed his strengths and pitched it on a short of a length. Gets it to climb onto the batsman and Pollard muscled it albeit any power or timing. Jadeja circles around near the fence wide of long-on and grabs it calmly. Pollard c (sub)Jadeja b Bhuvneshwar 68(39) [4s-5 6s-6]
Bhuvneshwar to Hayden Walsh, 1 run, tailing onto the pads, flicked away to deep mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, 1 run, banged in short as Kumar corrects his length. Pulled away to deep mid-wicket

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, FOUR, back-to-back fours for Pollard. He's still keeping West Indies alive in this game. A fuller length delivery just outside off, Pollard sits deep and hammers it very hard past long-off, who stood no chance. It was hit extremely hard

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, FOUR, unbelievable! Looked like he was caught in a tangle here against this short ball. Lost his shape as the ball rose at him sharply, but Pollard adjusts accordingly and pulls it straight down the ground. Safest place in the ground!

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, SIX, low full toss and Pollard says thank you. Was waiting deep in his crease, Kumar serves him a freebie and he makes merry. Pastes it into the long-on stands. Pressure on Kumar now
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, wide, starts off with a wide. Bowls it very full and too wide of off, Pollard leaves and it's been given a wide
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, 1 run, whipped away through mid-wicket and Pollard will retain the strike

Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, FOUR, fifty for Pollard. His first half-century in T20Is as West Indies' captain. This is like his second home and there comes the raise of the bat. A round of applause from the crowd as well. This spun back at him, Pollard shifted his balance back and nonchalantly hoicked it over mid-wicket. Just short of the ropes and it's a four
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, quicker and too full, thrashed down to long-on. Pollard won't take the single

Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, SIX, the sound of thunder. Gee! One of the flattest hits you'll ever see. Floated up just outside off, Pollard backed away and made enough room to execute the inside-out loft. Kuldeep is stunned..
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, wow! The seam-up delivery from Kuldeep. Clocked at around 109kph, fires it on leg and it brushes Pollard's pad on the way through to Pant. Hence not given a wide

Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, SIX, goes down like a sack of potatoes and for a second, I thought he had mistimed it. So did Kuldeep, but such is his power that it's still gone into the stands behind long-on. Tossed up generously, Pollard stepped away and earns a maximum
Shivam Dube to Hayden Walsh, no run, 122.9kph. Goes full just outside off, Walsh wanted to drive and squirts it off the outer half to extra cover. They won't take the single
Shivam Dube to Hayden Walsh, no run, good length just outside off, punched to extra cover
Shivam Dube to Pollard, 1 run, fullish just outside off, Pollard dumps it straight down the ground. Has to be content with a single as Pandey is very fine

Shivam Dube to Pollard, no run, very full and just outside off, Pollard's feet is nowhere. Just hands reaching for it and he ends up jamming it off the inner half towards the bowler. There was a deflection off the pads as well there
Shivam Dube to Hayden Walsh, 1 run, rides the bounce on this delivery and guides it to third man
Shivam Dube to Hayden Walsh, no run, extra lift for Dube from a length, Walsh wanted to force it through cover and gets beaten
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, turning away just outside off, Pollard reads it off the pitch and pokes it to short third man

Kuldeep Yadav to Hayden Walsh, 1 run, quicker and just outside off, Walsh uppishly drills it over the bowler's head. "Catch it" was the shout but no way Kuldeep could've taken that or for that matter, even get anywhere close to it
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, 1 run, crashes this flatter delivery through point

Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, oh boy! Manish Pandey has saved a boundary here. He's one of the best fielders in this team and shows you why. This was clobbered with ferocity down the ground, Pandey from long-on flies across to his left and makes a stunning save. Pollard thought it was a four and didn't bother to run
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, googly from Kuldeep again, Pollard watchfully plays it out to cover

Kuldeep Yadav to Holder, out Caught by (sub)Manish Pandey!! Another one bites the dust and Kuldeep picks up his second wicket. Holder understandbly went in search of a biggie, doesn't get enough elevation and holes out at long-on. This was flighted just outside off, seemed like the one going away from the batsman. Holder opened his stance and messed up with his timing. Skies it up in the air, it went a long way into the night sky and Pandey, who's come on as a sub ain't dropping it. He's safe as houses and West Indies lose half their side now. Holder c (sub)Manish Pandey b Kuldeep Yadav 8(5) [4s-1]
Shami to Holder, 1 run, 137.5kph, swinging in, a low full toss within the stumps. Worked away to deep mid-wicket. They'll settle for a single
Shami to Holder, 2 runs, lovely straight drive from Holder, shows that there's good value for shots in this pitch. This doesn't quite reach the fence as long-on cuts it off
Shami to Pollard, 1 run, slanting in, closed bat-face clip to deep mid-wicket

Shami to Pollard, no run, the crowd gets excited for a moment and reckon Rohit at extra cover has dropped it. But what they aren't aware is that it was a bump ball, so it's not a chance. Very full just outside off, Pollard squeezes the drive straight to Rohit, who fumbles a bit
Shami to Holder, 1 run, length from Shami, Holder rolls his wrists and nudges it through mid-wicket
Shami to Pollard, 1 run, speared into the pads, Pollard takes his front leg out of the way and flicks it to deep square leg

Kuldeep Yadav to Holder, FOUR, that's a quality drive from Holder to start his innings. Leans forward to this flighted delivery and pings the drive with great timing. To the right of extra cover and long-off had no chance
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, 1 run, fired on the pads, whipped away to deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, wide, more turn on the googly but this is much wider and turns further away
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, he's lost his bat! Whoa! Loopy googly, Pollard looks to slog against the turn and the bat goes away flying. Quick work from Pant but Pollard's foot had gone nowhere

Kuldeep Yadav to Hetmyer, out Caught by Rahul!! Change of angle works. But Kuldeep is lucky here, a juicy full toss and that was the last delivery he would have wanted to bowl. Hetmyer gets too eager on the slog and ends up mistiming it towards wide long-on. Rahul, gets across to his left to take a jogging catch and starts celebrating with a fist pump. Good blitz from Hetmyer but unfortunately, the target WI need demanded a much bigger score. Hetmyer c Rahul b Kuldeep Yadav 41(24) [4s-1 6s-5]

Kuldeep Yadav to Hetmyer, SIX, consecutive sixes! Hetmyer shows that he can hit to any part of the ground. Waits in the crease for the fuller one, this is spinning away and he goes with the turn over wide long-off. A flat six

Kuldeep Yadav to Hetmyer, SIX, Kuldeep blasts himself as soon as he bowled this one. Fed this on leg stump, right in Hetmyer's arc and he slog swept it merrily over deep mid-wicket and it's into the second tier!

Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, 1 run, miscue lands safe! Two men were converging on this, one trekking back and long-off charging forward. The latter was a better bet to take this probably but he backs out. Eventually, it lands between them. A low full toss, Hetmyer sliced it uppishly over extra cover and for a moment, would have had his heart in his mouth
Shivam Dube to Pollard, 1 run, quite full and wide outside off, blasted down the ground and it rockets to long-off. Mistimed it

Shivam Dube to Pollard, SIX, bam! Pollard doesn't need to middle it to hit sixes here at the Wankhede. This is a slot ball from Dube but the WI skipper didn't seem to connect that well. Still ends up dragging it over wide long-on
Shivam Dube to Pollard, wide, dug in short, too high and it's left alone by Pollard
Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, 1 run, fuller and straighter, drilled off the inside half down to long-on

Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, no run, dropped! Relatively straightforward chance but Shami at mid-off puts it down. This was short and wide, flat-batted by Hetmyer who couldn't quite get the placement right. Shami jumped a bit to his right to pouch it, in and out! After some good catches, this is a bump for India's catching. Kohli won't mind this though, purely due to the total that his team have on the board
Shivam Dube to Pollard, 1 run, fuller and outside off, jammed out towards mid-off for a tight single. Pollard had to hurry, even as the shy at the bowler's end misses
Kuldeep Yadav to Hetmyer, no run, slightly short, Hetmyer sits back and cuts but cannot beat point
Kuldeep Yadav to Hetmyer, no run, the leg break, turns away with bounce and Hetmyer is beaten on the cut
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, 1 run, another dart, leg-stumpish and Pollard tucks it away to deep square leg

Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, SIX, mowed into the crowd! Fired fuller but it's in the slot for Pollard who just uses his power. Blasts it over long-on and it's a towering blow. 50-run stand comes up! Much-needed for the Windies after those early wickets
Kuldeep Yadav to Hetmyer, 1 run, follows Hetmyer once again and he mistimes the pull down to long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Hetmyer, no run, some turn straightaway, spins in a bit and cramps Hetmyer who was backing away for the cut. Gets an inside edge onto the pitch

Shivam Dube to Pollard, FOUR, disastrous start for Dube! A full toss and Pollard hacks it away to the deep mid-wicket fence. Didn't middle it as well as he would have liked but definitely got it in the gap. 19 off the over!
Shivam Dube to Pollard, no run, shortish and wider outside off, bottom-edge towards point
Shivam Dube to Pollard, FOUR, another harmless short ball, Pollard is on the back foot and he controls this pull nicely. Gets it away very fine. 1000 T20I runs for Pollard!
Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, 1 run, tries the yorker, gets it right almost, jammed out towards wide mid-on

Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, FOUR, Hetmyer is gathering some momentum for himself. Stays deep in the crease, expecting the fuller ball and there is width on offer as well. Drilled between cover and mid-off, rockets away

Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, SIX, that's a cold-shouldered welcome for Dube! Digs it short at his leisurely pace and Hetmyer picks the bones out of it with a muscular pull over deep mid-wicket. Easy peasy!

Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, leg byes, 1 run, this was always about where the ball pitched because the height wasn't a problem and might well have hit leg stump. Hetmyer got foxed by the knuckle ball and fell across on the flick, getting rapped on the front pad in the process. Bhuvneshwar was very confident but then withdrew the appeal quickly, as he probably knew it himself. Or wasn't confident enough to say no to Kohli who looked very interested in the review. In the end, it's pitching outside leg and Hetmyer survives
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, 1 run, shortish and outside off, bunts this towards mid-off and an easy single taken

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, SIX, how easily has he hit this! Absolute nonchalance from Pollard as he shuffles across a bit and whips this away over mid-wicket. Hardly any effort on this shot but it's cleared the ropes. Wow!
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, full and straight this time, patted back towards Bhuvneshwar who makes a good stop with his right hand
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, play and a miss! Shortish but not quite short enough for the cut shot that Pollard tries. Doesn't connect
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, shortish and outside off, played with an open bat face towards backward point
Shami to Hetmyer, no run, slower ball, Hetmyer was backing away a bit but didn't account for the change of pace. Ends up getting a thin inside edge that goes through his legs towards short fine leg

Shami to Hetmyer, SIX, that's on the second tier! Short of a length this time from Shami who reacts to the previous delivery but Hetmyer is ready for this. Stands tall and bashes it over mid-wicket with a meaty pull
Shami to Hetmyer, SIX, first six of the WI innings and it's taken a while! Slot ball from Shami, Hetmyer just clears his front leg and slams this straight down the ground. Hit it clean as a whistle
Shami to Hetmyer, no run, shortish and closer to off stump, dabbed with soft hands towards the gully region
Shami to Pollard, 1 run, very full and curving into Pollard who clears his front leg to dig this towards mid-on
Shami to Hetmyer, 1 run, almost a perfect wide yorker, Hetmyer stabs it towards the point region
Chahar to Pollard, no run, widish low full toss, Pollard leans forward and eases this towards cover
Chahar to Pollard, no run, short of a good length outside off, seams away a bit, Pollard shoulders arms
Chahar to Pollard, wide, another pacy bouncer, Pollard sways away from the line in time. Too high this time
Chahar to Pollard, no run, a sharp bumper at 133kph, saw Pollard walking down and dug it really short. No shot offered
Chahar to Hetmyer, 1 run, fuller and straighter on leg stump, whipped away to deep square leg
Chahar to Hetmyer, no run, fourth stump line, a bit fuller and Hetmyer lets it pass

Chahar to Pooran, out Caught by Shivam Dube!! Sensational catch! Dube is the man at third man and he's pulled off a stunning catch, covering good ground forward and tumbles forward at the right time. Golden duck for Pooran and West Indies are coming apart here at the Wankhede. Pooran made room for the cut but was probably hustled by the extra pace on this one, ended up getting a thickish edge that seemed to be dying on Dube initially. However, the all-rounder had judged it well and pouched a beauty. Already, a significant difference in India's catching and it's showing. Pooran c Shivam Dube b Chahar 0(1)

Shami to Simmons, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Gone this time! Simmons was never looking comfortable and falls in the bid to up the rate. Makes room for the slog and only gets a thick slice over backward point. Plenty of height on this one and Iyer treks back, with his back to the ball and takes it over his shoulder comfortably. A sharp running catch. WI have lost both their openers early and it's only going to get tougher from here on. Simmons c Shreyas Iyer b Shami 7(11) [4s-1]
Shami to Simmons, no run, wild swing and a miss! This is the pressure of a tall chase telling on Simmons! He backs away to the shorter length and tries to just slog on the leg-side. Doesn't connect
Shami to Simmons, no run, follows Simmons who is backing away for the pull. Hits him near the box. Ouch!
Shami to Hetmyer, 1 run, a bit too straight in line, worked away on the leg-side

Shami to Hetmyer, no run, run out missed! Almost a replica of what happened when Rahul and Kohli were batting. Holder was the culprit then, it's Shami here. This was deflected off the pads towards cover and Simmons kept charging for the single despite no real intent from Hetmyer. Shami attacked the ball, had enough time to fire the direct hit, but like Holder, missed the sticks. Simmons had given up
Shami to Hetmyer, no run, shortish and squares up Hetmyer a bit as he tries to defend. Off the outside half to point
Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, leg byes, FOUR, an early shuffle from Simmons and although he misses the flick, it deflects off the pads and goes very fine, beating Pant to his left

Bhuvneshwar to Brandon King, out Caught by Rahul!! He's skied this and finds sweeper cover to perfection. Master stroke from Kohli as he had just shifted third man to sweeper cover, and blimey! A wicket! Seems like the Indian captain do no wrong on his wedding anniversery. Was probably a change-up from Bhuvneshwar and King clearly didn't pick it as he went for the loft over cover. Ended up slicing it high to the deep and KLR ain't missing those. Brandon King c Rahul b Bhuvneshwar 5(4) [4s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Brandon King, no run, fuller and outside off, King toe-ends the drive towards mid-off
Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, 1 run, angling in on middle and leg, worked with soft hands towards short fine leg
Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, FOUR, hammered away! Simmons has had enough of sighters and comes charging down to flay this over the infield at cover

Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, no run, just short of mid-on! Dube the man there and he was on the edge of the ring, and so, this lands short of him. Was a mistimed whip stroke from Simmons and he didn't quite time it well enough

Chahar to Brandon King, FOUR, good effort by Dube at short fine leg but he can't make a clean stop and trickles away to the fence. A bit too straight is Chahar again in terms of the line and King gets inside the line to glance it away
Chahar to Simmons, 1 run, fuller and straighter this time, Simmons shuffles across a touch and whips it away to deep mid-wicket
Chahar to Brandon King, 1 run, short of a good length outside off, seams away a bit, King guides it with soft hands down to third man
Chahar to Simmons, 1 run, a bit too straight in line this time, Simmons clips it away behind square leg. There's protection in the deep there as Kuldeep tidies up
Chahar to Simmons, no run, more away movement, on a good length, Simmons stands tall and punches it to mid-off. Didn't time it that well
Chahar to Simmons, no run, lovely shape on this one for Chahar, gets it to move away from a good length, left alone by Simmons

Chameera to Pant, out Caught by Pradeep!! And a wicket off the final ball of the innings. Chameera gets his revenge but the damage has been done. Pant's charmed life is over. Banged in short - the slower ball perhaps - Pant went back and pulled. Forgets there is a fielder at fine leg, hits it straight to him and Pradeep grabs it with ease. Pant c Pradeep b Chameera 23(23) [4s-1 6s-1]

Chameera to Pant, FOUR, finally, Pant makes some connection and earns himself a boundary. Third boundary of the over. Very full outside off, Pant plants his front foot across and thrashes it through extra cover. Bulleted away to the fence
Chameera to Karthik, 1 run, swung hard, clearing his front leg to deep mid-wicket

Chameera to Karthik, FOUR, expertly done by Karthik. Wow! How did he manage to place it in the gap? Amazing. Chameera missed his yorker by an inch or so, Karthik gets his bat low and his rubber wrists meant that he walloped it into the gap at mid-wicket

Chameera to Karthik, FOUR, handy runs these. Karthik won't mind at all. The leg-cutter from Chameera, tries to hokey-pokey Karthik. But Karthik manages to feather an edge as he went hard at that. Third man was squarer and it runs away to the fence in a jiffy
Chameera to Pant, 1 run, Pant is just not able to hit his straps. Really struggled today and more evidence here. Blasts a fuller length delivery straight to long-off
Perera to Pant, 1 run, brilliant end to the over. Caps off with a wide yorker outside off, Pant keeps it out to extra cover. Just 7 off it
Perera to Karthik, 1 run, Karthik sits on one knee and treats Karthik like a spinner. Slog-sweeping him to deep mid-wicket

Perera to Karthik, 2 runs, three balls, all three on cue from Perera. This was around off, Karthik drives it crisply through extra cover. The sweeper cover fielder runs across and keeps them down to a couple
Perera to Pant, 1 run, very full outside off, nothing much can Pant do about it. Jammed towards long-off
Perera to Karthik, 1 run, hustles Karthik with a short delivery on the body, DK was late on the shot but manages to pull it away to deep mid-wicket
Perera to Pant, 1 run, Perera goes full outside off, Pant drills it away to long-off

Gunathilaka to Dhawan, out Caught by Perera!! The golden arm of Gunathilaka strikes. Dhawan misses out on a well-deserved ton by 10 runs. He is also the first Indian batsman to be dismissed in the 90s in T20Is. Looked like a tired shot but he had to go for it. Tossed wide of off, Dhawan lowers his stance and flat-bats - albeit lack of power meant that it went straight to long-off. Perera pouches it reverse-cupped. This has been a superb spell by Gunathilaka. Chandimal gives him a bear hug and the crowd find their voices back. Dhawan c Perera b Gunathilaka 90(49) [4s-6 6s-6]
Gunathilaka to Pant, 1 run, another mistimed heave from Pant, gets it off the inner half through square leg. But Dhawan is back on strike
Gunathilaka to Pant, no run, nice. Flatter delivery outside off, Pant swings a tad too early and comes up with zilch
Gunathilaka to Dhawan, 1 run, wicket-to-wicket line, flogged down to long-on
Gunathilaka to Pant, 1 run, hurled very full outside off, driven hard to long-off
Gunathilaka to Pant, no run, lasered full on the stumps, Pant goes for the reverse sweep, gets an under-edge onot his boot and it lobs away teasingly into the off-side
Chameera to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan carries on. Toying the bowlers to all parts. Charges out of his crease, extends his arms and bludgeons this low full toss straight over the bowler's head for a maximum
Chameera to Pant, 1 run, swinging down leg, a low full toss. Pant fails to connect cleanly. Manages some wood on it and Chandimal makes a half stop, they will sneak in a single

Chameera to Dhawan, 1 run, did that carry? Was that a chance? Very hard for Chandimal as it was dying. Chameera has his hands on his head. Very full outside off, Dhawan protracts his hands and the outside edge is found. Dipping to the left of Chandimal, who stretches his left glove but can't hold on
Chameera to Pant, 1 run, Pant throws his bat, gets a thickish outside edge that wanders away to third man
Chameera to Dhawan, 1 run, fullish outside off, slapped to mid-off

Chameera to Dhawan, SIX, top-edges are flying for sixes. Are Dhawan's edges made of wood or something else? Chameera spears in and offers a length ball on leg. Dhawan camps back, swivels across and pulls. Off the top-edge and it soars over short fine leg. All the way!
Gunathilaka to Dhawan, 1 run, lands this one well outside off, Dhawan flails his hands at that and spanks it through cover
Gunathilaka to Dhawan, no run, shortens his length, zips through the deck and Dhawan is stranded in his crease. Is hit on the thigh pad

Gunathilaka to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan targets his favorite zone and gets the desired result. Gunathilaka is too predictable with his quicker balls. This was full and in the slot for Dhawan, who gets under it and clubs it over cow corner
Gunathilaka to Pant, 1 run, dabbed with an open bat face to cover and hands the strike to the set batsman
Gunathilaka to Dhawan, 1 run, straighter lines from Gunathilaka, Dhawan changes his stance and reverse-hits it to cover. All soft hands

Gunathilaka to Pant, byes, 1 run, Gunathilaka rifling it quicker and Pant isn't able to read him. Another one fired full and quick outside off, Pant sinks low and attempts a mow across the line. Misses and Chandimal lets it through as well
Dananjaya to Pant, 1 run, shimmies out this time, fails to reach the pitch but still goes for the swipe across the line. Squirts it off the inner half through mid-wicket

Dananjaya to Pant, SIX, first six for Pant. He has seen it enough. Decides to engineer some room, picks this tossed up delivery and beautifully lifts it over wide long-off for a maximum. Lovely swing of the bat!
Dananjaya to Pant, no run, serves it wide outside off, Pant reaches out and picks extra cover
Dananjaya to Dhawan, 1 run, flighted outside off, Dhawan forces it towards cover

Dananjaya to Dhawan, SIX, rubbish. That's how a friendly dad will bowl to his five-year old son, who is holding a bat for the first time. Rank long hop, Dhawan had ample time to choose his spot. Rocks back and smokes it into the deep mid-wicket stands

Dananjaya to Pant, 1 run, Pant is looking a bit fidgety here. Uses his feet, Dananjaya slows it up and Pant hoicks across the line. Gets an inside edge onto his pad and it drops to the right of the bowler. They scamper through for a quick single, Chandimal rushed forward and failed to pick up the ball. Pant was struggling there..
Gunathilaka to Pant, 1 run, Gunathilaka keeps it short, Pant rolls his wrists and nudges it away to deep mid-wicket
Gunathilaka to Pant, no run, scooted through the deck, too quick. Pant misjudged the length and went for the cut. Beaten by the skiddiness of this surface
Gunathilaka to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan ventures out and drives it away to long-off
Gunathilaka to Pant, 1 run, pushed through quicker outside off, Pant opens the bat face and steers it to point. Gets off the mark and that should ease his nerves
Gunathilaka to Pant, no run, round-armish darter outside off, Pant with no feet feels for the ball and elicits an inside edge onto his boot
Gunathilaka to Dhawan, 1 run, armer on off, Dhawan stays back and taps it from the crease to point
J Mendis to Pant, no run, productive over for Sri Lanka. Tossed up on middle, Pant props forward and defends it calmly down the pitch
J Mendis to Dhawan, 1 run, dragged short, a helmetless Dhawan hangs back and biffs it away to deep mid-wicket. All along the ground

J Mendis to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Gunathilaka!! There you go. Mendis picks up his first wicket and has broken the 94-run stand. Pandey had ridden his luck throughout the innings, very queer innings. Flighted on the stumps, Pandey in search of a biggie stepped out and was hoodwinked by the drift. Ended up skewing off the bottom and skies it straight to deep mid-wicket. Gunathilaka safely settles under it and the Sri Lankans are over the moon. Big wicket in context of the game. Manish Pandey c Gunathilaka b J Mendis 37(35) [4s-3 6s-1]

J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, nervy. Pandey almost gifted his wicket there. Skipped out and Mendis foxed him by dishing it out much wider of off, Pandey wasn't to the pitch and had to reach out in the end. Chalks an under-edge that nutmegs Chandimal. Rolls away and they add two to the tally
J Mendis to Dhawan, 1 run, wrong 'un from Mendis, with a slingy and under-arm action much like Kedar Jadhav's. Dhawan sits low and muscles it to deep square leg
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 1 run, darted very full outside off, Pandey squeezes it to extra cover, they nab a quick single
Perera to Manish Pandey, 1 run, off-pace delivery from Perera, right at the stumps. Bunted away to long-on

Perera to Manish Pandey, no run, whangs it short outside off, Pandey backs away and looks it slash it over point. Again, some vicious bounce for Perera and Pandey can't connect. Pandey thought it would be called a wide, but the umpire thinks otherwise. Certainly wasn't too high IMO
Perera to Manish Pandey, no run, Pandey walks across his sticks aiming to pull it over fine leg. Is defeated by extra bounce

Perera to Manish Pandey, FOUR, "No respite for Thisara Perera," says Murali Karthik on air. Hurls in a low full toss on the stumps, misses his yorker and gets punished. Pandey hacks it powerfully behind square on the leg-side
Perera to Dhawan, 1 run, jettison's violence now. Waits patiently for this back of a length delivery to arrive, opens the bat face and guides it to third man

Perera to Dhawan, FOUR, woah. Sledge-hammered, absolutely belted this one. Perera's special slower delivery, goes wrong. Overpitches outside off and Dhawan deals it nonchalantly, smashing it through extra cover
Dananjaya to Dhawan, 1 run, on the stumps, Dhawan sinks low and sweeps it along the carpet through square leg

Dananjaya to Dhawan, FOUR, fifty for Dhawan, his 5th T20I half-century. Subtle celebration from the opener. Knows his job is only half done. Continues with his purple patch, he's been in some form. Thrown wide of off, Dhawan with his long levers reaches out and slaps it firmly through extra cover and reaches the milestone in style, raise of the bat and Pandey walks up to him to congratulate
Dananjaya to Manish Pandey, 1 run, 89kph, googly that stays low and messes up Pandey's timing. He went for the pull but doesn't rise as much as he expected. Drags it away to deep square leg
Dananjaya to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan backs away to leg and makes some room to punch this offie from Dananjaya towards cover
Dananjaya to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Pandey scoots down the track and drills it down to long-off
Dananjaya to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, floated outside off, stroked through extra cover for a couple of runs
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 1 run, once again Pandey makes room and loses shape while trying to slog, the ball rolls towards mid-wicket
J Mendis to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, this time Dhawan fails to flick this flatter delivery, rolls into the on-side
J Mendis to Dhawan, 2 runs, the reverse sweep to deep backward point as Mendis continues to bowl with a lower-arm trajectory
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 1 run, very full and on the stumps, Pandey slogs and edges along the ground to short fine leg

J Mendis to Dhawan, 2 wides, oh comical! Mendis fired this down the leg-side on seeing Dhawan advance, the keeper had to move to his right to collect, fired a throw towards the stumps and they concede an extra run
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 1 run, almost a yorker on the stumps, Pandey drills it to mid-on
J Mendis to Dhawan, 1 run, steps out and works the flighted delivery to mid-on
Pradeep to Manish Pandey, no run, a good slower ball bumper, Pandey lost shape as he had to reach out to meet this ball, backed away too much and made no contact, lack of pace foxed him as well
Pradeep to Manish Pandey, no run, flat-batted really hard but the ball smashes straight into the sticks at the bowler's end, few runs saved for Sri Lanka
Pradeep to Dhawan, 1 run, short of length delivery on the stumps, Dhawan stands tall and flicks it to fine leg

Pradeep to Dhawan, SIX, another top edge and another six. Hands on head for Pradeep. Oh these bats, so cruel for a bowler. Twice he's beaten the batsman for pace and bounce, yet 12 runs go against his name. Dhawan got inside the line and once again went for the pull, this time the ball flew squarer towards fine leg
Pradeep to Dhawan, SIX, lucky runs for Dhawan. Top edge flies all the way and that will frustrate the bowler. Short delivery on the off stump, Dhawan looks to pull and gets away with the edge
Pradeep to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Pandey punches it to deep extra-cover
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 1 run, a round-armish flatter delivery, Pandey punches it to long-on
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, no run, very full and on the off stump, Pandey digs it out back to the bowler
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, no run, driven towards cover

J Mendis to Manish Pandey, SIX, great connection. Full and in the slot, looked like the googly again, Pandey slogged really hard and timed it very well to send it way back over the deep mid-wicket boundary

J Mendis to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, googly from Mendis, Dhawan misses the sweep and gets hit in line with middle stump, but Mendis is bowling from over the wicket so the ball pitched just outside leg stump. Chandimal was once again squatting in his appeal and they decided to waste their review
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 1 run, flatter delivery just outside off stump, Pandey backs away and slices this through point

Perera to Manish Pandey, 1 run, hit hard as Perera bowls a juicy full ball, but Pandey found the man at short mid-wicket, tough to stop those, the ball ricochets away from the hands and they get a run
Perera to Dhawan, 1 run, advances and punches this short of length delivery square of the wicket on the off-side

Perera to Manish Pandey, 1 run, what was that? Pandey moves off-side again to play towards long leg, Perera bangs it short, Pandey ends up playing early, the ball hits the glove and rolls towards third man
Perera to Manish Pandey, no run, length ball and Pandey's ill-timed slog rolls to short mid-wicket

Perera to Manish Pandey, FOUR, that's excellent placement from Pandey. Spotted the gap at deep backward square leg, so he quickly jumped across to get the shot right, the length was short from Perera and Pandey just helped it on its way. Fine leg and deep mid-wicket couldn't cut that off
Perera to Dhawan, 1 run, good length delivery on the off stump, Dhawan punches it to long-on
Dananjaya to Dhawan, 1 run, leg stumpish and Dhawan wrists it to deep mid-wicket

Dananjaya to Manish Pandey, 1 run, a wild swing again from Manish Pandey because he doesn't know which way the ball is going to turn, a proper slog and he hits it to deep mid-wicket, wants two but Dhawan wasn't keen, the fielder in the deep quickly attacked the ball
Dananjaya to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, flatter and down the leg-side, Dhawan misses the flick, hit on the pad and they sneak a leg bye
Dananjaya to Manish Pandey, 1 run, the use of the feet to kill spin, goes for a big drive along the ground to long-on
Dananjaya to Manish Pandey, no run, Pandey didn't read that from the hand, allowed the ball to come and worked it into the on-side with the spin
Dananjaya to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan wants to play the sweep against Dananjaya, gets across and places it wide of short fine leg

Pradeep to Manish Pandey, FOUR, finally a big hit! Pradeep was targetting the sticks with this full ball, Pandey freed his arms and went for a big golf swing over mid-on, connected well and it almost went all the way
Pradeep to Dhawan, 1 run, slower delivery just outside off stump, Dhawan taps it to backward point
Pradeep to Dhawan, wide, would have been a decent nut to Pradeep, but Dhawan is a left-hander, so that it well down the leg-side
Pradeep to Manish Pandey, 1 run, another risky run, the runs aren't coming, so Pandey sets off as soon as he pushes this to mid-off, gets home in the end

Pradeep to Manish Pandey, wide, just missing the leg stump, Pradeep bowls short of length, Pandey missed the tickle, appeal for catch, there was a sound but the umpire calls wide, may have just brushed the pad
Pradeep to Dhawan, 1 run, worked away to short fine leg

Pradeep to Dhawan, FOUR, snorter of a delivery! Had Dhawan jumping and fending, got a top edge that flew high up in the air, unfortunately for the bowler fine leg was inside the ring, otherwise would have been a dolly. The key about that ball was the extra bounce and pace that troubled Dhawan

Pradeep to Dhawan, FOUR, good stop ruined in the end. Dhawan cleverly opens the bat face last and uses the bowler's pace as he spots third man standing very wide, Dananjaya does very well to slide to his right and stop the ball, but the momentum of the run meant he couldn't control the ball and it rolled further to touch the rope
Dananjaya to Dhawan, 1 run, short enough for Dhawan to go back and pull to deep mid-wicket
Dananjaya to Dhawan, 2 runs, on the leg stump, Dhawan flicks towards deep mid-wicket, quickly returns for the second as well
Dananjaya to Dhawan, wide, Dananjaya probably expected the batsman to jump down the pitch again and fired this way outside off stump, Dhawan stayed put though
Dananjaya to Dhawan, no run, steps down the pitch and drives towards cover
Dananjaya to Dhawan, FOUR, this time he connects with the sweep shot, timing very good and there's no protection in the deep. Got into position quickly and nailed that
Dananjaya to Dhawan, no run, oh almost bowled. Big open space behind square on the on-side and Dhawan wants to sweep, misses and the ball almost shaved the off stump

Dananjaya to Dhawan, no run, what a start from Akila Dananjaya. Huuuugee appeal for LBW, not given. Looked very close. The arm-ball, hurries Dhawan on the flick, hit in line with leg stump, but probably that was just snaking past the leg stump. Chandimal was doing a full squat in his appeal, they ponder about the review and decide against it
Chameera to Manish Pandey, no run, short again, this time it's a proper leave, end of another fine over from Chameera
Chameera to Manish Pandey, no run, gets behind the line and defends

Chameera to Manish Pandey, no run, that's a shot of a batsman playing at club level. Maybe he saw that late, whatever it was, looked ugly. Bumper on the stumps, Pandey was very late to react, ended up playing a half-hearted hook, lucky that he didn't hit that to the keeper
Chameera to Manish Pandey, no run, sneaks past the inside edge, Pandey was jumping at the crease and reaching out to meet this short of length delivery outside off stump
Chameera to Manish Pandey, no run, fullish and outside off stump, Pandey defends into the off-side
Chameera to Dhawan, 1 run, thickish outside edge found as Dhawan tries to drive through the off-side, the ball rolls to third man

Pradeep to Raina, out Bowled!! Kids, look away. Please do not look at this dismissal. This was nothing but a full toss and Raina, ever since his comeback to the Indian team, has always been shuffling around in the crease look to play shots every single ball. He backed away this time, made way too much room and missed a straight full toss headed towards middle and leg stumps. The captain and the coach will not be happy. This is as embarrassing as Glenn Maxwell's leave to the sticks in one of the BBL games. Raina b Pradeep 1(3)
Pradeep to Dhawan, 1 run, slower ball sits up nicely on the surface, Dhawan pulls in the air, but does on the bounce to deep backward square leg
Pradeep to Dhawan, no run, looked like the cutter, Dhawan defends into the off-side

Pradeep to Dhawan, FOUR, mistimed chip but it clears the in-field. Dhawan jumps out of the crease to unsettle Pradeep, was the cross-seamer from the seamer, Dhawan managed to hit it between mid-off and extra cover, first boundary of the game

Pradeep to Raina, 1 run, off the inside half of the bat, risky single, but Raina is home. A direct-hit would have been close. It was a fullish ball just outside off stump, Raina wanted to play through the off-side, but got away with the edge
Pradeep to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan yet again manages to get off strike with a nudge to mid-on
Chameera to Raina, no run, short of length delivery just outside off stump, Raina waits in his crease and dabs to backward point
Chameera to Dhawan, 1 run, short of length delivery on the leg stump, Dhawan knocks it to mid-on and opens the account

Chameera to Rohit, out Caught by J Mendis!! In the airrrrr and that's a blinder of a catch from Jeevan Mendis. This is exactly why that try for a slower ball was absolutely not needed. Chameera goes back to bowling normal pace, lands it on a good length and gets it to jump just a touch extra, Rohit was looking for a lofted-drive on the rise, tried to adjust for the bounce and ended up standing really tall, didn't get the timing right as the ball hit the bottom of the bat. Jeevan Mendis ran back from mid-off, never easy looking up while running back, stretches full length forward and dives to hold on. Gets the Sri Lankans going and look at that huddle. They are charged up. Great start for the hosts. Rohit c J Mendis b Chameera 0(4)

Chameera to Rohit, wide, there you go, this is what T20s do to a fast bowler. Three good balls, three dots and Chameera wants to bowl the slower ball for some reason, ends up firing it down the leg-side, India are off the mark
Chameera to Rohit, no run, this is very good bowling, right on the off stump from a good length, Rohit handles this from the crease, no freebies thus far

Chameera to Rohit, no run, hits the bat a little harder this time, the line is very tight, just outside off stump, mostly on off in fact, keeps Rohit calm on the defence and the full ball rolls to mid-off off the outer half of the bat

Chameera to Rohit, no run, right then, sweet timing from Rohit straightaway. Good to see Chameera bowl full to see if there is some swing, there wasn't much for this ball, Rohit was able to play the ball along the ground to cover

SN Thakur to Perera, FOUR, pulled away to the fine leg fence and that's it. Sri Lanka start their campaign with a confidence-boosting win against India. They win by 5 wickets. Thakur missed his mark, but Perera didn't, spots the slower short ball and posts it in the gap to mark the Sri Lanka's truimph
SN Thakur to Perera, 2 runs, slower short ball, Perera hammers the pull to deep mid-wicket and calls for two. A better throw at the striker's end would have had Perera in trouble
SN Thakur to Shanaka, 1 run, cue-ends the drive to extra cover and hustles for a quick single. Rohit aims and misses at the non-striker's end
SN Thakur to Shanaka, wide, ups his pace - 144ks - but loses radar, slips it down leg, wided
Unadkat to Perera, FOUR, sheer muscle power. Hasn't timed it that well, but he picked the safest spot to play the slog, nails this full toss (missed a attempted yorker of course) over his partner

Unadkat to Perera, SIX, he is a real bludgeoner of the cricket ball. Straight out of Justin Kemp's book. Clears his front leg, stays ready for a full ball and thrashes it straight back over the bowler's head
Unadkat to Perera, wide, fires a yorker, but dished it a little too far outside off, just past the tramline for the umpire to exercise his arms
Unadkat to Shanaka, leg byes, 1 run, angles this slower delivery into the body from round the wicket, smacks Shanaka on the hip and rolls into the off-side after he missed the hack
Unadkat to Shanaka, no run, offcutter closer to the stumps, Shanaka gave himself a bit of room and swung way too early. No dice
Unadkat to Shanaka, FOUR, width on offer and that's slapped over extra cover, Shanaka clears his front leg and picks his spot before laying into the stroke
Unadkat to Shanaka, no run, Unadkat seems to have exhumed some clay while into his delivery stride, dupes Shanaka with a slower delivery. A swing and a miss
Vijay Shankar to Shanaka, 1 run, 134ks, Shanaka drills it straight of long-off
Vijay Shankar to Shanaka, 2 runs, crouches and slices the square drive behind point
Vijay Shankar to Shanaka, 2 runs, cross-seam full delivery outside off, Shanaka chips the loft off the cue end over cover

Vijay Shankar to Shanaka, 2 runs, high full toss, over waist high is it? No, the umpire thinks otherwise. Shanaka is shattered. Gives a puzzling expression to umpire Ranmore Martinesz. It indeed was over waist high. Shanaka hacked this over backward square
Vijay Shankar to Shanaka, wide, gets carried away with the slower stuff and sprays it wide of tramline, needs to reload that
Vijay Shankar to Perera, 1 run, keeps bowling his variations, offering no pace whatsoever, Perera clears his front leg and powers it straight down the ground, long-off tidies up

Vijay Shankar to Perera, 2 runs, in the air and falls in no-man's land. Slower, fuller and wider from Vijay Shankar, Perera slices the lofted drive over extra cover, it drops in between three converging fielders from the deep
SN Thakur to Shanaka, no run, 136ks, short and wide, Shanaka has a big swish at it and misses. 8 runs off Thakur's last 2 overs after conceding 27 in his first. Brilliant!
SN Thakur to Perera, 1 run, slower ball outside off, Perera miscues the pull to mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Shanaka, 1 run, short ball outside off, Shanaka forehands the pull to long-on. The sort of stroke you'd generally witness in Tennis
SN Thakur to Shanaka, no run, 142ks once more, upright seam from Thakur, gets the ball to grip and nail Shanaka on the thigh pad after he missed the pull
SN Thakur to Shanaka, no run, 142ks, full around off, Shanaka pushes firmly to cover, was surprised by the pace on that I guess
SN Thakur to Perera, 1 run, sits on the back foot and pulls the knuckle ball through mid-wicket
Chahal to Perera, 1 run, dropped? Chahal's reaction suggests so. Short ball, smashed straight back at Chahal who stretched his right hand and only succeeded in parrying the ball to mid-off
Chahal to Perera, no run, floated full on middle and leg, flicked to mid-wicket

Chahal to Tharanga, out Bowled!! Off stump shattered. Very poor from Sri Lanka's most experienced player. Tharanga sets himself for a biggie and stoops to one knee to launch Chahal over mid-wicket, gets defeated by the drift and lack of pace, off pole takes the beating. Tharanga b Chahal 17(18) [6s-1]
Chahal to Shanaka, 1 run, pitches outside leg and spins in towards middle, Shanaka uses his wrists to nudge a single round the corner
Chahal to Tharanga, 1 run, stays low and muscles this legbreak over mid-wicket, fielder in the deep and he'll only manage a single
Chahal to Tharanga, 2 runs, googly dished wide of off-stump, Tharanga makes use of the width to steer that behind point for a couple of runs
SN Thakur to Tharanga, leg byes, 1 run, befuddles Tharanga with a slower delivery, Tharanga was early into his pull, misses and gets knocked on the thigh pad. They sneak a legbye though

SN Thakur to Tharanga, 2 runs, dropped! A real tough one that, but goes down as a chance. Short ball, got big on Tharanga who spliced the pull towards short mid-wicket where Pant dives and only manages a fingertip
SN Thakur to Shanaka, 1 run, full and straight, Shanaka forces the drive off the toe-end down to long-on
SN Thakur to Tharanga, 1 run, fetches the short ball from outside off and drags the pull to deep square
SN Thakur to Tharanga, no run, 140ks, Tharanga swipes and misses. Was looking to go over square leg/mid-wicket but was a touch late on the shot
SN Thakur to Tharanga, no run, slants it in from short of length, Tharanga hops and drops it at his feet
Washington Sundar to Shanaka, no run, goes on the back foot and forces the punch into the off-side
Washington Sundar to Shanaka, no run, nudges the delivery into the leg-side
Washington Sundar to Shanaka, no run, forward and defended to cover

Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, out Stumped!! Much needed wicket for India, but the damage has already been done you'd think. Perera gets restless after missing the first deliveries and looks to carve Washington Sundar straight down the ground, loses his footing for a fleeting moment while doing so and off go the bails. Quick glovework behind the stumps from DK. Also, credit to Washington Sundar who fired it slow and far of off-stump, deceived him in the flight. Kusal Perera st Karthik b Washington Sundar 66(37) [4s-6 6s-4]
Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, wide, overcorrects and spills it down leg, Perera misses the sweep
Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, no run, a repeat of the previous delivery, Perera moved too far down leg and gets hit on the pad
Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, no run, angles it in with the arm, Perera stays legside of the delivery and drives it back to the bowler
Raina to Tharanga, 2 runs, shuffles to leg at the last second and opens up the off-side with a lofted drive over extra cover
Raina to Kusal Perera, 1 run, this is below par bowling from India, just darting it in, Perera eases into the drive to long-off
Raina to Tharanga, 1 run, loopy outside off, forward and driven to long-off
Raina to Kusal Perera, 1 run, faster and flatter outside off, Perera cuts to deep point
Raina to Kusal Perera, SIX, that's one of the best switch hits you will ever see. KP would be proud of that. Premeditates, reverses his stance and packs Raina for a maximum over third man
Raina to Tharanga, 1 run, driven to long-off
Chahal to Tharanga, 1 run, punches this quicker delivery and Washington Sundar misfields at extra cover to concede a single

Chahal to Tharanga, SIX, down on one knee, gets a pie from Chahal and the next thing he sees is the ball sailing over the cow corner fence. That was ruthlessly hammered by Tharanga, a swivel and bam he goes...
Chahal to Kusal Perera, 1 run, shuffles out of his crease and milks a single to long-on. Sensible batting this from Kusal Perera
Chahal to Kusal Perera, FOUR, slips it down leg, Perera plays it with the spin and gets a top-edge on the sweep, rolls away to the fine leg fence
Chahal to Kusal Perera, no run, no room, Perera forces the punch to the left of Chahal who dives to tie the batsmen at their respective ends
Chahal to Kusal Perera, wide, throws the slider wide of off-stump, perhaps trying to second guess the batsman there. Epic fail. Perera lets it go
Chahal to Kusal Perera, no run, dances down and gets too close to the pitch of the delivery, drills the drive back to the bowler
Raina to Tharanga, no run, oh look at him loop it. Dipping on middle, Tharanga works it straight to mid-wicket
Raina to Kusal Perera, 1 run, makes room and pinches a single wide of mid-off
Raina to Tharanga, leg byes, 1 run, doesn't get the sweep right. Plays early. Deflected off the pad into the off-side
Raina to Tharanga, no run, again. Similar line and length
Raina to Tharanga, no run, he's looping them well. Tharanga blocks to cover front-footed
Raina to Kusal Perera, 1 run, Raina's been cut away first ball through cover-point
Chahal to Tharanga, no run, gets the googly going and beats Tharanga's outside edge from over the wicket

Chahal to Chandimal, out Bowled!! He's undone him. Gets the full ball drifting in and then skids it through. Chandimal completely misses it, hoodwinked by his lack of judgement of the length and then the pace. That's not a ball to give your wicket to, perhaps; you flick those for boundaries. Chandimal b Chahal 14(11) [4s-1]
Chahal to Chandimal, 2 runs, good work by Dhawan at deep mid-wicket. Sharp throw. Chandimal uses his feet for a couple through mid-wicket here

Chahal to Chandimal, FOUR, nowhere near the pitch of the ball there but he's gotten an all-hands boundary. Well sort of. Chahal drags the length back and drifts it wider on seeing the batsman advance, but Chandimal's upto the task. Uses his hands and flat-bats it wide of the bowler
Chahal to Chandimal, no run, fired flat, Chandimal elicits an inside edge on his pad, as he tries to work that through mid-wicket
Chahal to Chandimal, no run, top-edge on the cut flying wide of the keeper. Doesn't travel much far, so no run
Vijay Shankar to Kusal Perera, no run, wraps his maiden over in T20Is with a loopy bouncer outside off. Kusal Perera doesn't bother much; he's still recovering from his mindblowing fifty
Vijay Shankar to Chandimal, 1 run, waits and punches this length ball delivered from over the wicket. Single through cover
Vijay Shankar to Kusal Perera, 1 run, such quick hands. They move before the feet do actually. Swats the pull through backward square leg
Vijay Shankar to Kusal Perera, no run, from round the wicket, Kusal Perera doesn't have much room to work at
Vijay Shankar to Chandimal, 1 run, tapped to cover for a single

Vijay Shankar to Kusal Perera, 1 run, 8th T20I fifty for Kusal Perera! Second fastest fifty by Sri Lanka batsman versus India. Slaps at the bit of width, the ball's stopped at cover with a flying dive by Rohit but nothing's stopping that run. Kusal Perera charges through
Chahal to Chandimal, 2 runs, flatter ball outside off and it's been nicely late-cut behind point. Just the two; there's protection in the deep
Chahal to Kusal Perera, 1 run, holding on leg-stump, Kusal Perera waits and punches it through mid-wicket
Chahal to Kusal Perera, 2 runs, misfield by Shankar running in from deep mid-wicket and he's allowed Kusal Perera to get back onto the strike
Chahal to Kusal Perera, SIX, he's a sight for the sore eyes. No helmet against the spinner, and now he telegenically runs at India's marquee bowler of the night and lofts him over his head
Chahal to Chandimal, 1 run, uses his feet and drives this bottom-handed past mid-off
Chahal to Kusal Perera, 1 run, from over the wicket, gets it to straighten on off and middle. Kusal Perera works it through to deep mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Chandimal, no run, quicker delivery, spinning in to take Chandimal's thick inside edge to short fine leg
Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, 1 run, Washington Sundar drags the length back, allowing Kusal Perera a single to mid-on this time
Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, no run, gets forward and then rocks back, playing to mid-on
Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, no run, blocks it

Washington Sundar to Chandimal, 3 runs, he's played just a little late, opening the bat face and forcing the push in front of a diving point fielder. Raina there actually, who had covered some ground to put that dive
Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, 1 run, darted on the stumps, worked throgh mid-wicket

Unadkat to Gunathilaka, out Caught by Pant!! He's gone now. Tries to make room and loft down the ground this time but plays at it a little too early, offering a straight catch to Pant at mid-off. Popped off the splice. Gunathilaka c Pant b Unadkat 19(12) [4s-1 6s-2]
Unadkat to Gunathilaka, FOUR, that's latex wrists. Shuffles across his stumps and flicks this uppishly over backward square leg. What do you say..
Unadkat to Gunathilaka, wide, slow and short, bowled to Gunathilaka shuffling across, but the ball does a bit. Decks down leg and is given a wide
Unadkat to Gunathilaka, no run, nicely bowled. Sees Gunathilaka making room and slants the ball into the batsman, cramping him for room. Through Gunathilaka there
Unadkat to Gunathilaka, SIX, 50-run stand already. Slower back of a length ball sitting up, Gunathilaka waits and flat-bats it over long-on with utter sheer disdain
Unadkat to Gunathilaka, 2 runs, straight on the pads, Gunathilaka picks this with a chip over mid-wicket

Unadkat to Kusal Perera, 1 run, that's a very sharp run. Inside-edged Unadkat's slower delivery onto his boot, still went for the run. Unadkat ran across and hit the stumps but Gunathilaka was off the blocks very early from the non-striker's end. Hurried but safe

Washington Sundar to Gunathilaka, SIX, now it's Gunathilaka's turn. Fetches this from just outside off and slog-sweeps it over square leg. All the way. Oh they're laying into India at Colombo tonight ..
Washington Sundar to Gunathilaka, no run, bowled very slow, blocked to point
Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, 1 run, surprised by the ball holding in the pitch there. Inadvertently chipped towards mid-on. Safe

Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, 2 runs, uses his feet but gets too close to the ball. Bunted through mid-wicket and yeah, they's have come back for the second. Gunathilaka had to dive at the bowler's end but he's fine
Washington Sundar to Gunathilaka, leg byes, 1 run, sliding into the pad, Gunathilaka gets no bat on this glance but pinches a quick extra to short fine leg
Washington Sundar to Gunathilaka, no run, dipping and skidding on, Gunathilaka gets low and blocks to cover
SN Thakur to Kusal Perera, no run, short, swivelled to square leg

SN Thakur to Kusal Perera, FOUR, Thakur is against a Kusal Perera sandstorm here. Goes full on off-stump from round the wicket, Kusal Perera stays leg-side of the ball and flat-bats the drive through the other side of the stumps. That's how you treat a free-hit delivery
SN Thakur to Kusal Perera, no ball, FOUR, it's going from bad to worse for Thakur. Goes for the slower delivery but dishes out a high, high full toss that Kusal Perera smacks through sweeper cover
SN Thakur to Kusal Perera, SIX, still nothing from Thakur who's leaking runs here. Goes wide from round the wicket and bowls the slower one. Kusal Perera picks it and pumps it over wide long-off
