SN Thakur to Kusal Perera, FOUR, hat-trick of fours. Thakur doesn't know what length to bowl. Perfect seam for the inswinger from over the wicket, but nothing in the air. Still wide, going across Kusal Perera who drills it through long-off
SN Thakur to Kusal Perera, FOUR, back of a length outside off and Kusal Perera's just manoeuvred it with an open bat face. Back to back fours, this one through deep backward point
SN Thakur to Kusal Perera, FOUR, woah, first ball from SN Thakur and he's hit it over mid-wicket. Is already leg-side of the ball and swats it without much room to play with. As good as authoritative
Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, 1 run, turns a quick single to short mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, SIX, how nonchalantly has he slog-swept that over deep backward square. Sits low and plays with Washington Sundar's delivery coming into him. No spin, yet
Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, no run, blocks this back, with Washington Sundar from round the wicket to the left-hander

Washington Sundar to Kusal Mendis, out Caught by Dhawan!! It's been Dhawan's day all along. After one flew over his head at mid-off earlier in the over, he gets one falling behind him. Backtracks and takes it overhead with utmost ease. Kusal Mendis's hand came off the handle here, looking for the biggie, and hence no power, timing and direction in his intended big shot. Kusal Mendis c Dhawan b Washington Sundar 11(6) [4s-2]

Washington Sundar to Kusal Mendis, 2 runs, wide of Pandey at deep square leg. Kusal Mendis fetches this from outside off with a slog-sweep, Pandey dives and flicks the ball in, and tag-team work keeps the runs to just two
Washington Sundar to Kusal Mendis, FOUR, hit over mid-off. Darted full from over the wicket, Kusal Mendis gives it a real tonk and clears Dhawan, as intended
Unadkat to Gunathilaka, no run, nice tight line on off-stump, Gunathilaka blocks
Unadkat to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, throws his arms at the width and carts it uppishly behind the backward point fielder

Unadkat to Kusal Mendis, FOUR, almost steered it to first slip. Just wide. Wanted to play cheeky but extra bounce meant that he wasn't entirely in control and ended up playing too close to the lone slipper. Will get a boundary though
Unadkat to Kusal Mendis, no run, angling across the batsman, who's not quite behind his punch-slap
Unadkat to Gunathilaka, 1 run, too straight, worked to fine leg now. Off the mark
Unadkat to Gunathilaka, no run, some movement into the pad, blocked into the leg-side

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, 1 run, slower delivery to end the innings, Pooran is waiting to play the reverse paddle and has to delay it to get it past the man at point. Expensive last over from Khaleel, 23 runs off it

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, FOUR, fifty for Pooran. Maiden T20I fifty for him. He's come to the party. Waves his bat around and acknowledges the applause from the Chennai crowd. He gets there with a cheeky shot. Waits for Khaleel to bowl the yorker and reverse paddles it over short third man. Not off the middle but has enough legs to reach the rope

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, SIX, even miscues are clearing the rope. Hurried by the short delivery and he still goes through with the pull shot, the top-edge keeps sailing over Washington at deep square leg

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, FOUR, the slower delivery is dragged back and gives ample time for Pooran to pick his spot, he waits back in the crease and slaps it over extra cover. Pant has no chance from long-off
Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, no run, change of pace as Khaleel rolls his fingers across the ball, Pooran wanted to send this out of Chennai and was through the shot a day early, nowhere close to the ball
Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, 2 wides, spears the full delivery down leg and Bravo has no chance of making contact. DK can't prevent the batsmen from stealing the bye

Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, SIX, misses his radar and Bravo dispatches it. Full toss above the knee and Bravo flicks it over deep square leg. He looks at the square leg umpire for a no-ball but gets nothing. It was well below the waist
Bhuvneshwar to Darren Bravo, 1 run, low full toss on leg-stump, Bravo chips it on the bounce to long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, 1 run, another yorker outside leg, would have been a wide had Pooran not whipped it to fine leg
Bhuvneshwar to Darren Bravo, 1 run, low full toss on the pads, Bravo glances it down to fine leg

Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, 1 run, Bhuvi saw what Pooran was doing and robbed the pace off the ball, the reverse scoop does not have the pace to go over short third or backward point, rolls to the left of point

Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, FOUR, dropped! Chahal the culprit. Pooran with all his innovations almost found the backward point fielder. Low full toss and Pooran crouches low to play the reverse paddle, gets it to Chahal and he does not time his jump well, the ball burst through his hands and reaches the fence. Rohit not happy
Bhuvneshwar to Darren Bravo, 1 run, starts the over with a yorker, Bravo can only squeeze it out to long-on
Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, 1 run, low full toss at the stumps, Bravo cue-ends the flick to deep mid-wicket. Brilliant over from Khaleel. Got the yorkers spot on and conceded only 4 runs

Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, no run, this is mighty fine bowling by the young man. He's not perturbed by what the batsman is doing and sticking to his plan. Spears in the yorker and Bravo, who is backing away, can't squeeze it out

Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, 2 runs, good piece of fielding by KL. Slower back of a length delivery and Bravo pulls it with one hand - the bottom hand comes off the bat handle, Rahul moves to his left from deep mid-wicket and slides to flick the ball in play, saves two

Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, no run, good bowling. Mixing 'em up nicely. Follows the batsman with a yorker and Bravo can't put bat on ball, struck on the boot and the ball rolls back down the wicket
Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, no run, that was in the slot but Bravo was through his shot early, fraction short and outside off, Bravo swings across the line and connects with thin air
Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, 1 run, back of a length angled into the left-hander, Pooran heaves it along the ground to deep mid-wicket. He called for two but settles with a single

Chahal to Pooran, 1 run, floated up outside off, Pooran is drawn into the expansive drive and is deceived by the turn. The inside edge rolls to short fine leg and Pooran will only get a single. Chahal ends his spell. Been the pick of the Indian bowlers, 4-0-28-2
Chahal to Darren Bravo, 1 run, fired outside off and Bravo slaps it to deep extra cover, for a single
Chahal to Darren Bravo, no run, spins sharply and Bravo is all cramped up, under edges the cut shot near his boot and DK collects it on the bounce
Chahal to Pooran, 1 run, quicker and outside off, Pooran chops it to short third man and Bravo calls him through
Chahal to Pooran, 2 runs, drops it short and outside off, Pooran slaps it past a diving Pandya at cover-point. Rohit runs around to his right from deep extra cover and keeps it down to a brace
Chahal to Pooran, wide, another one.. DK does well to glove that. Spins well down leg and Pooran has no chance of connecting the with his pull shot. DK dives full length to his right to collect that
Chahal to Pooran, wide, turning down leg and Pooran can't meet with the pull shot. India giving way too many extras

Chahal to Pooran, SIX, wow! That is a switch hit for six. Pooran made his intentions clear even before Chahal was in his delivery stride, the dragged back length does not deter him as he pulls it into the stands over deep extra cover
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, 1 run, very full and close to yorker range, Pooran squeezes the drive to long-off
Bhuvneshwar to Darren Bravo, 1 run, off-cutter on middle, Bravo turns it into the leg-side and scampers through
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, 1 run, yorker length around off, Pooran jams it into the off-side and is happy to rotate strike

Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, SIX, consecutive sixes for Pooran. Windies getting back the momentum that they had lost. Fuller length this time and it doesn't matter for Pooran, who goes through the line and just about manages to clear long-off

Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, SIX, these Windies batsmen can all strike them big. Bhuvi errs by dragging the length back on the off-cutter and allows Pooran to take his time and smash the pull straight over long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, no run, continues with his cutters.. Pooran is early into his steer to third man and is beaten on the outside edge

Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, no run, Pandya might have got away with one. This was short and outside off, Bravo is beaten on the cut shot and he looks at the umpire for a wide. This was outside the guideline and should have been called. So it even things out. Expensive day for Pandya, 4-0-40-0

Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, SIX, this time a meatier connection and Bravo clears the fielder. Darted in outside off, Bravo goes through with the loft with a free flowing willow and sends it sailing over long-off
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, 2 runs, keeps firing 'em in outside off, Bravo slices the loft and luckily for him it lands wide of long-off, two added

Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, FOUR, thumped! Pandya overcorrects his length and offers a half volley, Bravo with a cleared front leg hammers it straight past Pandya, who tries to stop it with his boot but is well late
Krunal Pandya to Pooran, 1 run, fired across the left-hander and Pooran slaps it to sweeper cover
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, 1 run, slower and bit of turn in, Bravo taps it into the off-side and crosses over
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, wide, this was outside the tramline and a fair call. 12th wide by India
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, wide, that's a harsh call. Seemed like it was inside the tramline. Pandya darts it outside off and Bravo lets it pass. DK not happy with umpire Anil Chaudhary's call

Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, FOUR, ends the over with a boundary and ruins it. 100 up for the Windies. Offers width on the off-cutter and Pooran slices the drive square on the off-side. Dhawan gives a valiant chase
Bhuvneshwar to Darren Bravo, 1 run, waits for the slower delivery and taps it towards square leg

Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, 1 run, this time the contact is made but not as Pooran wanted. The off-cutter breaks away and the outside edge rolls to short third man, Khaleel has a go at the striker's end but Bravo was well in

Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, no run, another one.. Same result. Bhuvi is getting his off-cutters to turn away, Pooran is opened up this time as the ball beats the outside edge. Almost shaved the off-pole on the way to DK

Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, no run, change of pace - off-cutter that grips the surface and deviates away, Pooran is beaten on the steer to third man. Bounces in front of DK who does well to get his body behind
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, no run, back of a length around off, Pooran drops it with soft hands in front of backward point
Washington Sundar to Pooran, 1 run, touch short and outside off, Pooran punches it to sweeper cover to retian the strike

Washington Sundar to Ramdin, out Bowled!! Washington Sundar has the last laugh. He gets his first wicket of the night in his final over. It was a flatter delivery at the stumps. Ramdin rocks back and went for a cut shot. He was late on the shot. It clips his inside edge and comes back to hit the stumps. Ramdin b Washington Sundar 15(15) [6s-1]
Washington Sundar to Ramdin, no run, it turns in to Ramdin who goes on the back foot and could only push it to cover
Washington Sundar to Ramdin, wide, too wide of off, wide called
Washington Sundar to Ramdin, SIX, comes down the track to come close to the ball and powers it over deep mid-wicket. The connection was terrific and it clears the ropes with ease
Washington Sundar to Ramdin, no run, yorker length delivery down the leg-side, Ramdin misses it. It deflects to short fine off the pads
Washington Sundar to Darren Bravo, 1 run, steers it to short third for a single
Washington Sundar to Ramdin, 2 wides, massive turn on this delivery too. It started around middle and ends up down the leg-side
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, 1 run, in the air again, out of the reach of short mid-wicket. It eventually ends up at long-on

Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, no run, Krunal Pandya drops a dolly. This is a rarity as he is an exceptional fielder. This one came slowly off the pitch and Ramdin chips it back to Krunal Pandya who anticipated it to come a little faster. He mistimes the jump, it clips his hand and pops out. It deflects to the off-side in the end
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, 1 run, 90kmph delivery full toss outside off, Darren Bravo powers it to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, wide, too wide of off, Darren Bravo leaves smartly, wide called
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, 1 run, goes on the back foot and pushes it to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, 1 run, outside off, Darren Bravo cuts, point fielder dives but fails to reach it. It deflects off his hand to sweeper cover
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, 1 run, works it to deep square leg

Chahal to Darren Bravo, leg byes, FOUR, gee! From where this one came. Lot of air from Chahal and it spins in massively after pitching outside off. It cuts Darren Bravo into half, clips his pads according to the umpire and beats Karthik too. It ends up at fine leg fence
Chahal to Ramdin, 1 run, a gentle nudge to the on-side and they take a single
Chahal to Darren Bravo, 1 run, on the pads and Darren Bravo works it to backward square leg

Chahal to Darren Bravo, FOUR, Chahal was guilty of providing too much width. Darren Bravo reaches for it and absolutely smashes it down the ground. No chance for the straight fielders as it rockets to the fence
Chahal to Darren Bravo, no run, googly at the stumps, Darren Bravo picks it up off the pitch and defends it to the leg-side
Chahal to Ramdin, 1 run, on the pads and Ramdin clips it to deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, 1 run, this one was outside off, Ramdin goes back and uses bottom hand to work it to the leg-side
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, 2 runs, flatter and at the stumps, Ramdin works it to the on-side with soft hands and that allows him to come back for a brace
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, no run, closes the face of the bat early and leading edge takes it in the air, just short of cover
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, 1 run, this one spins back in to Darren Bravo who was cramp for room. He adjusts the shot and pushes it wide of cover
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, 1 run, on a fuller length and outside off, Ramdin paddles it to short fine
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, no run, quicker delivery at the stumps, Ramdin defends it to short cover

Chahal to Hetmyer, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! A short delivery gets the wicket for Chahal. How often you have seen this is T20! It was a flatter delivery outside off, Hetmyer wanted to power it through point. It bounces a touch extra and hits him high on the bat. Pops up in the air and Krunal takes an easy catch in front of deep point. Hetmyer c Krunal Pandya b Chahal 26(21) [4s-4 6s-1]
Chahal to Darren Bravo, 1 run, uses soft hands to push it to point for a single
Chahal to Hetmyer, 1 run, touch short and well wide of off, Hetmyer rocks back and cuts it to sweeper cover
Chahal to Darren Bravo, 1 run, googly around off, a delicate push to point for a single
Chahal to Darren Bravo, no run, this one spins in sharply, Darren Bravo was slightly foxed by the late turn. Half-push-half-punch to cover
Chahal to Darren Bravo, no run, flatter and outside off, Darren Bravo cuts it straight to cover

Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, no run, in the air, Washington Sundar dives forward but it is just out of his reach. Hetmyer wanted to work it to the leg-side, closes the face of the early and leading edge takes it in the air. It falls just short of him
Washington Sundar to Darren Bravo, 1 run, much slower, Darren Bravo nudges it to the on-side and completes an easy single
Washington Sundar to Darren Bravo, no run, quicker and outside off, Darren Bravo smashes it straight to cover
Washington Sundar to Darren Bravo, no run, slower and it spins away from Darren Bravo who finds the fielder on the cut
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, 1 run, flatter and targeting the stumps, Hetmyer knocks it to long-on
Washington Sundar to Darren Bravo, 1 run, 85kmph delivery at the stumps, Darren Bravo uses soft hands to push it to cover and charges for a quick single
Chahal to Darren Bravo, 1 run, quicker and well outside off, Darren Bravo goes back and cuts it to sweeper cover to retain strike
Chahal to Darren Bravo, no run, flighted, it was around off, Darren Bravo gets behind it and defends it to cover
Chahal to Hetmyer, 1 run, touch short and outside off, Hetmyer cuts it straight to sweeper cover
Chahal to Darren Bravo, 1 run, googly, Darren Bravo pushes it to cover and takes a quick single
Chahal to Hetmyer, 1 run, goes back and pulls it to long-on
Chahal to Hetmyer, wide, too wide of off, wide called

Chahal to Shai Hope, out Caught by Washington Sundar!! Chahal gets the breakthrough for India on his very first ball. India needed it badly. It was a flighted nut at the stumps. Shai Hope went for a mighty slog sweep. He top edges and it went a long way up in the air. Washington at deep mid-wicket comes under it and takes a good high catch. The force of the ball takes him down as he takes it. Shai Hope c Washington Sundar b Chahal 24(22) [4s-3 6s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Hetmyer, SIX, Hetmyer ends the powerplay in style. Windies are off to a flyer. It was a quicker delivery outside off, the length was too full. Hetmyer gets under it and larrups it straight down the ground. Over the fence!
Krunal Pandya to Hetmyer, no run, slows down the pace considerably, it was outside off and Hetmyer pushes it to cover
Krunal Pandya to Hetmyer, no run, 109 kmph delivery outside off, Hetmyer attempts a cut, ends up missing it

Krunal Pandya to Shai Hope, 1 run, in the air, Dhawan at deep mid-wicket has a chance. He leaps in the air and flicks the ball back in after taking the catch. His feet were very close to the cushions so he had no chance of completing the catch. He ends up saving 5 for his team. It was a flatter delivery down the leg-side and Shai Hope tonks with more elevation than distance
Krunal Pandya to Shai Hope, SIX, drags this delivery down. It was a poor one. Too short, Shai Hope rocks back and powers it over long-on for a maximum
Krunal Pandya to Shai Hope, no run, on a good length and outside off, not much turn on this delivery. Shai Hope pushes it to point

Bhuvneshwar to Shai Hope, 1 run, another fuller length delivery, it was aiming at the stumps again. Shai Hope tucks it wide of mid-wicket for a single. Bhuvi has been straight after being hit for a four
Bhuvneshwar to Shai Hope, no run, much fuller and targeting the stumps, Shai Hope was hurried by this delivery a touch. He could only dab it to point
Bhuvneshwar to Shai Hope, FOUR, charges down the ground, manufactures room by backing away a touch and lofts it over the in-field for a boundary. Lovely timing!
Bhuvneshwar to Shai Hope, no run, wanted to run it down the ground but finds point
Bhuvneshwar to Shai Hope, no run, slower delivery at the pads. Shai Hope was too early on the shot, he misses and it raps him on the pads
Bhuvneshwar to Shai Hope, FOUR, touch short and Shai Hope pounces on it. He gets in a fabulous position and pulls it through fine leg for a boundary
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, no run, this one comes back in to Hetmyer, it clips his pads and deflects to the off-side
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, 5 wides, darted it down the leg-side, Hetmyer misses and so does Karthik behind the stumps. Five wides!
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, FOUR, smashed! Hetmyer looks in his elements today. He clears his front leg and powers it wide of cover, no chance for any fielder. It reaches the fence in a canter
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, no run, slower and outside off, Hetmyer defends it to the off-side
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, FOUR, flatter and around off, Hetmyer rocks back and slaps it straight down the ground with disdain power. It rockets to the fence

Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, no run, Shai Hope dives in desperation at the non striker's end, he is safely home. He would have been OUT had there been a direct hit. It was far from being a direct hit though. Hetmyer dabs it wide of short third, Shai Hope was keen for a single and he charges. Hetmyer sends him back at the right time
Washington Sundar to Shai Hope, 1 run, on the pads, Shai Hope tucks it wide of short fine for a single
Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, no run, straight bat defensive shot back to the bowler

Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, FOUR, that's what happens with right and left combination. Khaleel Ahmed misses his radar, it was down the leg-side. Hetmyer gets in a good position and lofts it over short fine for another boundary. This is proving to be a costly over for India
Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, 1 run, down the leg-side, Shai Hope tucks it wide of square leg for a single

Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, FOUR, first boundary for Shai Hope. He gets the desired room on this delivery. Went for that lofted shot over point, times it well enough to clear point. It races off the turf for a boundary

Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, no run, misses the outside edge by a whisker! It was on a fuller length and moves away off the deck, Shai Hope wanted to run it down to third man. Due to that late movement he plays it inside the line of the ball and it misses his outside edge
Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, no run, on a back of a length and around off, Shai Hope gets behind the line of the ball and pushes it to cover

Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, no run, now a slider. Washington Sundar is mixing it up really well. It skids off the deck and Hetmyer was defeated by the pace. It raps him on the pads, was going above the stumps for sure
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, no run, this was much fuller and trajectory was outside off. Hetmyer had to wait for it to arrive, he delays his bat swing and defends it to the off-side
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, no run, on a good length and at the stumps, Hetmyer works it to the leg-side
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, FOUR, misses his radar on this delivery. It was down the leg-side, Hetmyer rocks back and tucks it wide of deep square leg for a boundary
Washington Sundar to Shai Hope, 1 run, this was much fuller, it was at the stumps too. Shai Hope pushes it with a straight bat to long-on
Washington Sundar to Shai Hope, no run, on a good length and at the stumps, Shai Hope goes on the back foot and defends it to the on-side
Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, no run, on a fuller length and outside off, Hetmyer could only push it straight to point
Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, 1 run, this time erring in line just a touch, it was on the pads. Shai Hope hops in the crease and tucks it wide of square leg for a single
Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, no run, on a good length and a hint of movement back in to Shai Hope, there was no room for Hope to free his arms. He flicks it straight to mid-wicket
Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, no run, on a fuller length again, the line was just outside off. Shai Hope plunges forward and pushes it straight to mid-off
Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, no run, lovely shape back in to Shai Hope who waits for the ball to move, adjusts his shot and blocks it back to the bowler
Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, no run, on a fuller length and a hint of inward movement off the deck, Shai Hope covers the line of the ball and defends it back

Fabian Allen to Manish Pandey, 1 run, India manage to win! What a final over by Fabian Allen. One has to feel for him! A fired-in flat ball on leg-stump, Manish Pandey just pushes it back to the bowler's right and takes off for a single. He doesn't collect cleanly and deflects it towards midwicket - and by the time they collect it, it's too late. India win by 6 wickets but it was closer than it sounds!

Fabian Allen to Dhawan, out Caught by Pollard! Are you kidding me? What have you done SD? Wide-ish outside off, Dhawan gets low and clubs it straight down the throat of long-on for a catch. A crucial time for him to depart and India now need one off one. Dhawan c Pollard b Fabian Allen 92(62) [4s-10 6s-2]
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, no run, fired in flat on the stumps, Dhawan comes down the track and whips it away towards square leg

Fabian Allen to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tossed up from round the wicket and angling in, Manish Pandey goes leg-side of the ball and slices it away inside out towards deep backward point for a single. Scores level...
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 1 run, short one served up on the body, Dhawan opens up his stance and pulls it away straight to deep mid-wicket for a single

Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 2 runs, short and angling away outside off, Dhawan carves it away from the crease towards the deep backward point fence for a brace. Hetmyer makes a good save at the boundary. This is Dhawan's highest score in T20Is
K Paul to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, fantastic bowling! Yet another yorker at the base of the stumps, and its finally dug out to long-off for a brace.
K Paul to Manish Pandey, no run, another inch-perfect yorker on middle, Manish Pandey once again fails to get under it and toe-ends it towards short midwicket
K Paul to Manish Pandey, no run, another perfect yorker, Manish Pandey tries to swat it away, too close to the fulcrum, and jhe can't get under it. Doesn't even get it off the pitch
K Paul to Manish Pandey, no run, yorker length delivery on the stump, dug out into the on-side

K Paul to Pant, out Bowled! Audacity/headlessness of youth. A full, nearly yorker length delivery on middle, Pant, with 7 needed off 11, tries an uber-cute reverse-scoop intended for some area behind the wicket, ends up losing his middle-stump. Looks rather disappointed as he should be. The most polite cliche I can use is lived by the sword, died by the sword. Pant b K Paul 58(38) [4s-5 6s-3]

K Paul to Dhawan, 1 run, full and wide outside off, Dhawan shimmies down the track, gets on his knee and caresses a crisp drive through towards the deep extra cover fence for - a single. There's protection in the deep
Brathwaite to Dhawan, 1 run, another very full delivery on leg-stump, clipped away off the pads to backward square leg for a single
Brathwaite to Pant, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the leg-stump, Pant swats it away towards fine leg for a single
Brathwaite to Dhawan, 1 run, pitching outside leg, Dhawan comes down the track and steers it to short third man for a single
Brathwaite to Pant, 1 run, very full, Pant backs away into the on-side again, Brathwaite follows and Pant single-handedly whips it away towards deep square leg for a single
Brathwaite to Pant, wide, leg-side yorker length delivery, Pant was trying to back away into the on-side, sees the line and gets out of the way - wide called. Harsh
Brathwaite to Pant, 2 runs, almost another no-ball for height - a thigh-high full-toss, pulled away towards backward square leg for a couple of runs
Brathwaite to Dhawan, 1 run, free-hit, fuller length delivery, Dhawan scoops it away all along the ground towards long-off for a single
Brathwaite to Dhawan, wide, fired in down leg-side, Dhawan tries an odd fine-sweep, and misses. The next ball will be a free-hit too...
Brathwaite to Pant, no ball, 1 run, beamer! On the body, Pant swivels on his heel to pull that away to fine leg for a single. Slipped out of Brathwaite's hand. Dhawan to face the free-hit...
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, fuller length delivery thrown in wide outside off, Dhawan gets on his knee and doesn't keep the cover drive down, reaches the man inside the circle on the bounce
Thomas to Dhawan, FOUR, feeds him a slow half-volley on off, Dhawan just checks the lofted drive over the circle towards long-off for a one-bounce four
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, low full-toss on middle and off, Dhawan opens the face and guides it towards point with an angled vertical bat
Thomas to Dhawan, FOUR, short and angling in towards off, Dhawan comes down the track and gets his bottom-hand off the bat to slice it away over the in-field to deep backward point for four
Thomas to Pant, 1 run, length delivery rather wide outside off, Pant, standing outside leg, throws his hands at it and toe-ends a cross-batted club towards extra cover for a single
Thomas to Dhawan, 1 run, length delivery angled in towards leg-stump, Dhawan taps it with an angled bat in front of point and scampers across for a quick single
K Paul to Dhawan, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the leg-stump, Dhawan clips it away towards backward square leg for a quick single
K Paul to Pant, 1 run, good length delivery skidding away with the angle, slugged away off a thick inside edge towards long-on for a single
K Paul to Dhawan, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the pads, clipped away to backward square leg for a single
K Paul to Dhawan, SIX, slower one pitched up wide outside off, back-of-the-hand slower one, Dhawan comes down the track and reaches out to loft that over the long-off boundary for six
K Paul to Pant, leg byes, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the pads, Pant misses the glance, into the on-side off the pads for a single

K Paul to Pant, FOUR, maiden fifty in T20Is for Pant! And what a memorable - if potentially reckless - way to bring it up. A full one on leg and middle, Pant gets his head out of the line and scoops that away high towards long stop for four - falls just short of the fielder running in from fine leg and nearly pulls off a catch
Brathwaite to Dhawan, 2 runs, knee-high full-toss on the pad-line to Dhawan, Dhawan twists his body into a swat towards deep square leg for a couple of runs
Brathwaite to Dhawan, no run, fuller and closer to the stumps, Dhawan comes down the track and drives towards extra cover, finds the same fielder
Brathwaite to Dhawan, no run, fuller length delivery angling way wide outside off, Dhawan gets on his knee and drives it away towards extra cover
Brathwaite to Dhawan, 2 runs, good length delivery on middle, Dhawan runs down the wicket, whips it away towards wide long-on for a brace - made possible by the poor timing on that
Brathwaite to Dhawan, FOUR, a quick one, very full, but down the wrong line - straying on the pads and that's whipped away for four in front of deep square leg
Brathwaite to Pant, 1 run, very full on middle, Pant bottomhand-swats that down to long-on for a single
Fabian Allen to Pant, 1 run, full and flat outside off again, Pant gets on his knee and flat-bats that hard and off the meat to long-off for a quick single
Fabian Allen to Pant, no run, fired in flat towards the off-stump, Pant misses the reverse-sweep
Fabian Allen to Pant, SIX, tossed up a little more on the stumps, Pant steps down and launches that in front of deep square leg for six!
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 1 run, another shorter one, stays low, Dhawan pulls it away off a low stance to backward square leg for a single
Fabian Allen to Pant, 1 run, fired in flat, skiddy and angling towards off, Pant gets on his knee, mistimes the slog-sweep to cow corner for a single
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 1 run, tossed up slow on the pads, turned away off the frontfoot towards short fine leg for a single

Pollard to Pant, SIX, for a left-hander, this is daayein haath ka khel! (Right hand's work) A slower full delivery on off-stump, Pant gets his bat down and lets go of his bottom-hand to loft that over wide long-on for six! Single-handed stuff by Pant. Smoked!
Pollard to Dhawan, 1 run, another slower back of a length delivery on off-stump, Dhawan waits for it and taps it on the head towards extra cover for a quick single

Pollard to Dhawan, 2 runs, another loopy slower delivery served up outside off, Dhawan gets forward, delays the tap towards cover and calls for two! They're really quick, and there's no one backing up the throw at the non-striker's end. No overthrows, either way
Pollard to Dhawan, FOUR, short of length delivery slanting across and eventually creating width - Dhawan clubs horizontal-batted towards the deep extra cover fence for four

Pollard to Pant, 1 run, a slower one on a short of length, angling away from off, Pant slugs it across the line towards deep mid-wicket for a single and doesn't quite carry to the man at cow corner for a catch
Pollard to Pant, FOUR, length delivery served up outside off, Pant with his high backlift cross-bats that straight down the ground for a one-bounce four into the sightscreen

Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 2 runs, a tad shorter than he'd like, Dhawan hangs back and tucks it to deep mid-wicket for a brace - that's a 50 for Shikhar Dhawan. A rather important innings in context. This is his first fifty of this series - across formats. And his first 50 in six T20I against WI
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 2 runs, fired in wide outside off, Dhawan comes down the track and reaches out to the pitch of it, caresses the drive towards deep extra cover for a brace
Fabian Allen to Pant, 1 run, flat and quick on a length angling towards off, Pant slogs with the turn and slugs it away off the thick inside edge to deep mid-wicket for a single
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 1 run, fired in on the pads again, clipped away to deep mid-wicket for a single
Fabian Allen to Pant, 1 run, fired in on a length and angled in towards leg-stump, Pant stays low and gets some top-spin on that pull to backward square leg for a single
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 1 run, flat and slow on middle, Dhawan hangs back and nudges it towards midwicket for a scampered single

Thomas to Dhawan, 1 run, very full and outside off, Dhawan makes room outside off and pushes it to cover to take off for a quick single. Taking on the strong arm of Pollard, but he's quick enough to make it...
Thomas to Dhawan, SIX, free-hit, juicy half-volley on the stumps, Dhawan opens up his stance and swat-flicks that aerially over deep mid-wicket for a massive six
Thomas to Dhawan, no ball, very full, Thomas oversteps, Dhawan drills it down wristily and hits the stumps at the other end
Thomas to Pant, 1 run, half-volley on middle and off, the open stance allows him to swing straight through the line, flat and aerial towards long-on for a single
Thomas to Pant, SIX, on a short of length and rising, Pant shuffles across to fall over and gets under it to swivel into a pseudo-hook over deep backward square leg for a pressure-releasing six
Thomas to Dhawan, 1 run, back of a length delivery just on, Dhawan drops it off the backfoot towards cover for a single

Thomas to Dhawan, 2 runs, a tad short on the stumps, Dhawan backs away and carves it away towards deep backward point for a couple. An appalling throw and it goes to deep square leg, but no overthrows...

Pollard to Pant, no run, off-cutter angling towards off-stump, just whizzes past the stump in fact as Pant misses the might heave through the line. That was going to land in the Arabian sea if he'd made contact...
Pollard to Dhawan, 1 run, yorker length delivery on middle, drive down to long-off off the toe-end for a single
Pollard to Pant, 1 run, very full delivery just outside off, dug out towards long-off for a quick single
Pollard to Pant, FOUR, length delivery angling away outside off, Pant reverse-laps that fine of the short third man fielder for four

Pollard to Pant, no run, shortish and angling away outside off, Pant keeps his distance for the leverage, throws his weight behind a drive through cover, gets a thick top-edge but it falls short of the keeper
Pollard to Dhawan, 1 run, fuller length and wide outside off, Dhawan reaches out and drives this square of the wicket to the deep for a single
Brathwaite to Pant, FOUR, a surprise bouncer to follow up two yorkers, quite the converse of the usual set-up, Pant swivels on his heel and guides the lofted pull towards fine leg for four
Brathwaite to Pant, no run, another excellent yorker length delivery on middle, Pant drags his feet out of the way to jab his bat down into the ground to keep it out
Brathwaite to Pant, no run, slow loopy yorker length delivery @110km/h, dug back out off the toe-end towards the bowler
Brathwaite to Pant, wide, fuller length delivery but down the wrong line - sprays it down leg-side as Pant misses the glance. Wide called
Brathwaite to Pant, no run, full-toss angling away outside off, Pant premeditates the reverse-laps but is somehow still late on it - misses
Brathwaite to Pant, FOUR, short of length delivery angling away just outside off, Pant waits for it and swats it away cross-batted over the bowler's head for four
Brathwaite to Pant, no run, low full-toss on off, Pant tries to bottom-hand the drive through the off-side, mistimes it towards cover

K Paul to Dhawan, 2 runs, back of a length delivery on the stumps, Dhawan charges down the wicket and tries to have a waft away from the body, gets a thick inside edge to mid-wicket and manages to scurry across for a couple
K Paul to Pant, 1 run, very full and slanting away from the line of off, Pant bottom-hands it down to long-off for a single
K Paul to Dhawan, 1 run, slower one on a back of a length angling away from off-stump, Dhawan clubs it down to long-off for a single
K Paul to Dhawan, no run, on a fuller length and outside off, Dhawan steps forward and slices it away towards point with a vertical bat
K Paul to Pant, 1 run, shortish and angling away, Pant stays back and carves it away towards sweeper cover for another single
K Paul to Dhawan, 1 run, pitching on a back of a length on middle and heading for the top of off, Dhawan stays in the crease and angles the bat to steer it towards point for a scampered single
Pollard to Pant, no run, no pace at all and Pant is through the shot early, the ball gently beats the bat and goes on the bounce to Ramdin
Pollard to Dhawan, 1 run, goes wide of the crease and slants it outside off, Dhawan slaps it towards extra cover and the fielder gets a hand to it, takes the pace off and allows Pierre to get across
Pollard to Pant, 1 run, back of a length on off, Pant flicks it with a lot of bottom hand to deep mid-wicket
Pollard to Dhawan, 1 run, he's bowling slower than Krunal - off-cutter at 101ks and Dhawan helps it along the way to deep backward square
Pollard to Pant, 1 run, shortens the length on the slower delivery and Pant pulls along the ground to deep square leg
Pollard to Pant, no run, starts with a typical off-cutter on a length, Pant defends it back to Pollard
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, short and outside off, Dhawan slashes without footwork and is beaten on the outside edge

Thomas to Dhawan, FOUR, this time he puts the full toss away. What did he do right? He relied on placement, waited for the ball and clipped it wide of mid-wicket, the fast outfield takes care of the rest
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, missed out. Dhawan has missed a couple of full tosses now. It was on the pads and Dhawan flicks it straight to mid-wicket. Went for power rather than placing the ball
Thomas to Pant, 1 run, Pant is off and running. He waits for the length ball and drops it with soft hands into the off-side, one look at Dhawan and off go the duo for the quick single

Thomas to Rahul, out Caught by Ramdin!! Edged and gone. Rahul misses out again. Thomas breaks the dangerous looking stand. Nothing but a length delivery that goes gun-barrel straight, Rahul with laden feet wanted to drive on the up and all he can manage is a healthy outside edge to Ramdin. This game was a perfect opportunity for Rahul to grab his chance. Rahul c Ramdin b Thomas 17(10) [4s-4]
Thomas to Rahul, wide, off-radar and called for it. Sprays it down leg and Rahul has nothing to do with it
Thomas to Dhawan, 1 run, shuffles early and gets a full delivery on off-stump, flicked to deep square leg

K Pierre to Rahul, no run, oh! Rahul has a smile on his face. He then has a look at the surface. That's unplayable. Flattish delivery angled in from round the wicket, landed on middle and spun past the prodding blade of Rahul. Beaten neck and crop. The bounce took it over off-stump
K Pierre to Rahul, no run, driven hard and straight back to Pierre

K Pierre to Rahul, FOUR, wow! This is an excellent hit. Pierre dragged the length and got it to turn away, Rahul was making room and he had to reach out to smash it over extra cover, gets there and though it is not middled the ball trickles into the rope
K Pierre to Rahul, no run, comes down the track and drills the drive straight to mid-on. He's disappointed with himself

K Pierre to Rahul, FOUR, lovely shot! Pierre slowed it up and Rahul backed away to open up the off-side field, went with the spin and lofted it over the infield. Once it clears the 30-yard ring there's no point chasing it
K Pierre to Rahul, no run, flighted on middle and leg, Rahul pushes it to the right of Pierre, who ensures the single is not taken

Brathwaite to Dhawan, FOUR, third boundary of the over and it is an expensive start for the Windies skipper. Dhawan runs down the wicket and gets a full delivery on the pads, whips it with a lot of bottom hand over the leaping mid-wicket fielder. Just about manages to clear him

Brathwaite to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan has decided that the best way to manufacture pace is by dancing down the wicket, the off-cutter is short and outside off, Dhawan slaps it hard and over mid-off. Just bounces inside the rope

Brathwaite to Dhawan, no run, low full toss on middle, Dhawan toe-ends the drive to extra cover and is sent back on the single. Good call from Rahul as there was no chance of either making their ground
Brathwaite to Dhawan, no run, once more jumps out of the crease and this time Brathwaite cramps him for room, knocked to mid-on

Brathwaite to Dhawan, FOUR, charges down and though the length is dragged back, Dhawan had made room to free his arms, punches it neatly past the diving cover-point fielder and collects another boundary
Brathwaite to Dhawan, no run, starts from round the wicket and Dhawan's push is firmer than he would have liked. Shouts a loud "no" to send back Rahul

K Paul to Rahul, FOUR, cracking shot! That should give him confidence. On a length and outside off, Rahul stands tall and drives on the rise through the crowded off-side field - placed it between cover-point and cover

K Paul to Rahul, FOUR, streaky! But Rahul won't mind. He needs a bit of it as he's not been in great nick. Short and angled down leg, Rahul is through the pull shot and the bottom hand also comes off, the ball hits the maker's area and lobs past Ramdin

K Paul to Dhawan, 1 run, missed out there. Paul overcooks the off-cutter and gives a juicy full toss, which Dhawan swipes straight to deep square leg. He could have placed it better and got more out of it
K Paul to Rahul, 1 run, walks down and towards the bowler, mistimes the on-drive to mid-on and that allows him to scamper across

K Paul to Rohit, out Caught by Brathwaite!! Stunned silence at the Chepauk. Windies have got the big wicket of Rohit. He can't believe it. Stands there hanging his head down. Paul cleverly rolls his fingers over the ball and lands it full, Rohit with premeditated room drills the off-drive straight into the bucket hands of Brathwaite. Looks at the bottom of his bat as he walks back to the dugout. The perfect start for Windies. Rohit c Brathwaite b K Paul 4(6) [4s-1]
K Paul to Rohit, no run, angled into the legs and Rohit tucks it to backward square, where a fielder is placed specifically

Thomas to Dhawan, FOUR, 146ks short delivery and the surface does not help Thomas there, Dhawan is quickly into position as he nails the pull well in front of square. There was a man in the deep but Dhawan beat him comfortably
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, offers no space for Dhawan to free his arms, tucked gently in front of mid-wicket

Thomas to Dhawan, no run, oh! That is the line and length Dhawan has found troublesome. Back of a length close to off, Dhawan looks to punch and the inside edge rolls into the off-side. Lucky that it didn't go back on
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, again on the shorter side is Thomas and Dhawan's cut is straight to backward point. Either side and that would have been four more

Thomas to Dhawan, FOUR, short and wide deliveries on this surface will do you no good, sat up nicely for Dhawan and he slaps it over the infield on the off-side. Bounces well in front of the ropes and trickles over it

Thomas to Dhawan, no run, back of a length around off, Dhawan is off the ground as he executes the back foot punch. He middled it alright but can't pierce the packed off-side field - finds cover-point
K Pierre to Rohit, no run, tossed up on off, Rohit pushes it inside out and picks the fielder at cover
K Pierre to Rohit, no run, drifts in with the arm and Rohit stands back to defend it into the off-side
K Pierre to Rohit, no run, even a 90ks ball is turning, Rohit plays a controlled cut shot to cover-point

K Pierre to Rohit, FOUR, Rohit is off and running. Pierre gives it a bit of air, but the line is outside leg, Rohit bends down and sweeps it over backward square. No one patroling the fence in the deep there
K Pierre to Dhawan, 1 run, fraction short and Dhawan is quick to rock back, pulled along the ground to deep square leg
K Pierre to Dhawan, no run, starts with a 90ks dart on leg-stump, Dhawan flicks and finds the fielder at backward square

SN Thakur to Lakmal, 1 run, missed out on the hat-trick. Thakur has his hands on his head. For a change he goes for the other slower delivery - off-cutter instead of the knuckle ball, Lakmal heaves and squirts an inside edge to short fine leg. He was gone had he missed that

SN Thakur to Chameera, out Caught by Unadkat!! Thakur on a hat-trick now. Chameera had to go for it and unfortunately for him he was up against the knuckle ball, swung as hard as he possibly could and skied it off the cue-end towards short third man, Unadkat runs back and takes it calmly. Made the catch look easy. Chameera c Unadkat b SN Thakur 0(1)

SN Thakur to Shanaka, out Caught by Karthik!! Third for Thakur. Those knuckle balls are really working for him tonight. Another one which is slightly closer to Shanaka, who lines up for the big loft down the ground, the ball arrives late and catches the outside edge. Carries easily to Karthik. Shanaka c Karthik b SN Thakur 19(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

SN Thakur to Lakmal, byes, 1 run, Thakur makes sure to keep it away from the bat, the slower delivery is outside off and Lakmal swings and misses, Shanaka calls for the run and Karthik has a shy at the striker's end, misses and the ball strikes Lakmal, who was running to the other end. Thakur thought he changed his path and went up, but Lakmal ran in a straight line
SN Thakur to Lakmal, no run, slower delivery outside off, Lakmal can't reach out and it is a dot

SN Thakur to Lakmal, FOUR, good start to the final over. And the Sri Lankan batsmen are making it a habit to get off the mark with a four or a six. Back of a length, Lakmal stays leg-side and goes through the line, lofts it straight back and splits long-on and long-off

Unadkat to Dananjaya, out Caught by Rahul!! That's how Unadkat generally picks his wicket - batsman trying to hit him out of the park and finding the fielder. Back of a length and Dananjaya had made room to free his arms, he also had to generate his own pace and that is where he faltered, didn't get the elevation and found Rahul at long-on, who takes the catch and has a few words with the fans behind him. Dananjaya c Rahul b Unadkat 5(11)
Unadkat to Dananjaya, no run, bouncer at a sharp pace, Dananjaya backs away and is way too late on the hook/pull. One for the over signals umpire Martinesz
Unadkat to Shanaka, 1 run, short of length and Shanaka pulls it along the ground to deep square leg

Unadkat to Shanaka, SIX, oh geez! He's struck that cleanly. The slower delivery on a fuller length, Shanaka goes hard on the loft and was looking to go more long-off, but the slice took it over deep extra cover
Unadkat to Shanaka, wide, pitches it right on the tramline and umpire Ranmore Martinesz stretches his arms
Unadkat to Dananjaya, 1 run, short of length on the stumps, Dananjaya makes room and ramps it on the bounce to third man
Unadkat to Shanaka, 1 run, round the wicket and off-pace which seems to be the mantra on this surface, Shanaka heaves and drags it off the inner half of the willow to deep mid-wicket, just a single
SN Thakur to Shanaka, 1 run, no pace from Thakur and Shanaka manages just a nudge to long-on
SN Thakur to Shanaka, no run, knuckle ball and Shanaka is deceived for pace, he prods forward to have a feel for the ball and it takes the outside edge, lands well in front of Karthik
SN Thakur to Shanaka, no run, the wide yorker outside off, Shanaka can't squeeze it out. Dot

SN Thakur to Dananjaya, 1 run, dropped! Took a blinder early on and now spills one - Raina. The knuckle ball on a fullish length, Dananjaya mistimes the lofted off-drive, Raina was slightly in at mid-off and had to track back, put in the leap and went with one hand, the ball did not stick. He might have gone with two hands there as the ball was not traveling at pace
SN Thakur to Shanaka, 1 run, short and at the body, Shanaka plays a controlled pull/tuck to fine leg

SN Thakur to Shanaka, FOUR, cheeky! Shanaka knew what he was doing there. He allowed the short of length delivery to arrive and opened the bat face at the last instance, steered it fine and beat third man comfortably
Raina to Shanaka, 1 run, once more slower through the air and Shanaka nurdles it round the corner - to backward square leg
Raina to Dananjaya, 1 run, flighted on the stumps, Dananjaya eases a single to long-on
Raina to Dananjaya, no run, slows it up and Dananjaya pushes it meekly to Rohit at cover
Raina to Shanaka, 1 run, too straight and Raina is picked away backward of square leg
Raina to Dananjaya, 1 run, quicker and fuller, Dananjaya drives it to long-off
Raina to Shanaka, 1 run, flatter and on the stumps, nudged through mid-wicket, for a single
Raina to Shanaka, wide, starts with one down leg, Shanaka can't meet with the glance, wide given
Chahal to Dananjaya, no run, round the wicket and spinning in, Dananjaya carefully works it to mid-wicket. Good recovery from Chahal after conceding 27 off his first two overs, ends with 4-0-34-1
Chahal to Dananjaya, no run, turning in from a shortish length, Dananjaya knocks it towards point
Chahal to Shanaka, 1 run, skips down and takes it on the full, eased down to long-off

Chahal to Shanaka, wide, floated up outside off, Shanaka attempts an audacious slog sweep and misses it by a long way. The ball keeps spinning away from the flashing blade. The ball spun so much that is deemed as a wide
Chahal to Dananjaya, 1 run, the googly is very full in length, Dananjaya eases the drive to long-off
Chahal to Dananjaya, no run, tossed up on off, Dananjaya works it with the spin to mid-wicket, straight to the fielder

Chahal to Kusal Mendis, out Caught by Rohit!! Soft soft dismissal. The set batsman has been sent back. Rohit's trust in Chahal pays off. He could have easily bowled only three of his overs and allowed the other four to bowl their quota, but instead goes for the leg-spinner. Looped on a shortish length and turning away, Mendis for some reason is half hearted in playing the cut shot, chips it tamely off the cue-end to Rohit at cover. Sri Lanka have lost their way in the last few overs. Kusal Mendis c Rohit b Chahal 55(38) [4s-3 6s-3]

Washington Sundar to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, round the wicket and darts in a low full toss, Mendis wrists it to long-on and retains strike. Sundar is done for the day, ends with impressive figures of 4-0-21-2
Washington Sundar to Shanaka, 1 run, flatter and just outside off, punched square on the off-side, for a single
Washington Sundar to Shanaka, no run, straight roller and Shanaka has no clue about that, he prods half forward in a hope that is an off-break but the ball goes straight on and beats the outside edge
Washington Sundar to Shanaka, no run, slower and around off, blocked

Washington Sundar to J Mendis, out Bowled!! Beaut! This had shades of Ashwin in it. His state mate would have been proud of that delivery. Tossed it up and gave the left-hander the false impression that it would turn away, it kept coming in with the arm and beat the inside edge as Mendis attempted the drive. The middle and leg stump takes a beating once again. India doing well here by chipping away at one end. J Mendis b Washington Sundar 1(3)
Washington Sundar to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, low dipping full toss and Mendis moves across to ease it to long-on
Chahal to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, fired in on the pads, flicked away to deep mid-wicket

Chahal to Kusal Mendis, no run, very very slow and outside off, Mendis bails out of the cut shot at the last instant, but the ball still hits the cue-end and lobs it into the off-side, fortunately for him it drops safely

Chahal to Kusal Mendis, 2 runs, sloppy. Mendis fetched the sweep from outside off and hits it in front of square, Sundar at deep mid-wicket makes a slight fumble and Mendis is quick to make him pay - sprints back for the second and makes it in with a dive. Chahal not happy
Chahal to Kusal Mendis, no run, slower and turning away outside off, Mendis thought it is a wide and let it pass, the umpire stays put. Marginal call that went in favour of the bowler
Chahal to J Mendis, 1 run, fraction short and Mendis drags the pull to long-on
Chahal to J Mendis, no run, tossed up around off, Mendis defends off the front foot

SN Thakur to Perera, out Caught by Chahal!! One shot too many. Thisara pays the price as he so often does. Just gets a bit carried away. Once again it is the knuckle ball from Thakur, the length is fuller and Thisara is sucked into the lofted shot, deceived by pace he only manages to toe-end it towards extra cover. Chahal runs back and reverse cups it over his head. Falls over on his back but manages to cling on. Perera c Chahal b SN Thakur 15(6) [6s-2]

SN Thakur to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, fifty for Mendis. Two in two for him. "Three in his last five T20Is," informs Roshan Abeysinghe on air. The back of a length knuckle ball and Mendis miscues the pull towards deep square leg, landed well in front of the fielder

SN Thakur to Perera, 1 run, not where he intended, but he's off strike. Can take a breather at the non-striker's end. The knuckle ball and Thisara wanted to nudge it into the on-side, the inside edge runs down to short fine leg

SN Thakur to Perera, no run, bit wider from Thakur and Thisara went for it, he does not believe in singles or twos by the look of it, threw the kitchen sink at the full delivery outside off and almost dragged it back on, the inside edge hit him on the pad

SN Thakur to Perera, 2 runs, good length ball on off and middle, Thisara goes through the line and lofts it straight back past the umpire, Raina from long-on runs across and slides to keep it to a brace
SN Thakur to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, fuller and on off, Mendis with a walk across glances it to fine leg

Vijay Shankar to Perera, SIX, back to back sixes. He's flying here, the stand-in Sri Lankan skipper. Shankar overcompensates by pitching it up and Thisara was ready for it, thumps it flat and over long-off. Authoratative start from Thisara!

Vijay Shankar to Perera, SIX, wow! That is some way to start your innings. Thisara is not going to hang about. He must have seen what Shankar is doing and sit himself up for the short of length delivery, got into position quickly and nailed the pull over backward square leg

Vijay Shankar to Tharanga, out Bowled!! Shankar puts him out of his misery. Tharanga never looked settled and trying to hit his way out, but when it ain't working, it just ain't working. Nothing but a cross-seamer delivered from round the wicket, the angle took it into the left-hander, Tharanga heaved with purpose and connected with nothing. The ball sneaks through bat and pad to hit the top of middle stump. Tharanga b Vijay Shankar 22(24) [4s-1 6s-1]

Vijay Shankar to Tharanga, no run, back of a length slanted in, Tharanga tries an ugly hack to the on-side and the ball snuck underneath the bat. Flew on top of the stumps. Tharanga is struggling here

Vijay Shankar to Tharanga, no run, good call? Tharanga had moved across his stumps to play the scoop, Shankar smartly keeps it away from the bat and sprays it outside leg, Tharanga missed and the umpire didn't stretch his arms for a wide

Vijay Shankar to Tharanga, 2 runs, round the wicket and angles the cross-seamer into the southpaw, Tharanga went through with the loft and chipped it over Shankar, Unadkat does not collect the ball cleanly in his first attempt and the second is stolen

Unadkat to Kusal Mendis, SIX, ruins the over. Why change what's working? Unadkat went round the wicket and dug it in short, at his pace the ball sat up nicely for a shuffling Mendis, who muscled the pull over deep square leg
Unadkat to Tharanga, 1 run, rolled his fingers across and is picked away over square leg, just a single
Unadkat to Tharanga, no run, now at the body, Tharanga is early into the pull shot even though the speedgun shows 134kph, doesn't connect and is struck on the tummy, the ball rolls down the wicket
Unadkat to Tharanga, no run, shortens the length and gets it to zip off the surface, Tharanga was looking to run a single down to third man, misses and is lucky not to have edged it behind
Unadkat to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, uses the angle Unadkat is generating and runs it down to third man
Unadkat to Kusal Mendis, no run, starts with a slower back of a length delivery, Mendis shuffled across and blocked it back
Vijay Shankar to Tharanga, 2 runs, nurdled into the gap at mid-wicket and they come back for the second
Vijay Shankar to Tharanga, FOUR, low full toss outside off and put away with ease. Shankar went wide of off, Tharanga threw his bat and gets it over extra cover. 50-stand comes up between the duo

Vijay Shankar to Tharanga, no run, nicely done. Follows Tharanga with a cross-seam slower delivery and dupes Tharanga. He took a stride down the pitch and played inside the line of the delivery. Beaten all ends up

Vijay Shankar to Kusal Mendis, 2 wides, "That was a tennis ball bounce," quips Roshan Abeysinghe on air. Shankar ushered it short on seeing Mendis trigger, but the ball gains so much of bounce that it beats a leaping DK. Manages to get some glove on it
Vijay Shankar to Kusal Mendis, no run, phew. The slower bumper from Shankar, Mendis didn't pick it as he went for the pull. Swivels too early and is hit on the back of the helmet
Vijay Shankar to Kusal Mendis, 2 runs, superb from Mendis. No fuss this time around. Walks across, sits low and scoops it very fine. Thakur does well, runs across and hauls the ball back in play
Vijay Shankar to Tharanga, 1 run
Chahal to Kusal Mendis, no run, drifting in, Mendis looks it push it down to long-off, ends up skewing it off the inner half to Chahal
Chahal to Kusal Mendis, SIX, rank long hop and Mendis takes toll. Rocks back, waits for the ball to come and clobbers it into the deep mid-wicket stands. Sails a long way!
Chahal to Tharanga, 2 wides, sliding down leg, slams DK's pad and rolls away
Chahal to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, slips in a googly, Mendis stays back and knocks it away through mid-wicket
Chahal to Tharanga, 1 run, flighted full at the stumps, drilled away to long-on
Chahal to Tharanga, SIX, finally, Tharanga finds the sweet spot and dismisses it from his sight. Chahal pitched it right in the slog and boom! Tharanga picked it early and clubbed it over cow corner
Chahal to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, looped full on off, Mendis gets low and sweeps it through square leg

Vijay Shankar to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, Shankar outfoxes Mendis. Walked across outside off, Shankar followed him and didn't give any space for him to play the scoop. In the end, Mendis could only place it towards fine leg
Vijay Shankar to Tharanga, 1 run, 130kph, full just outside off. Tharanga picks it from there and flogs it down to long-on. On the bounce to Manish Pandey
Vijay Shankar to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, persists with short of length, outside off. Mendis allows for the ball to arrive, opens the bat face and guides it to third man
Vijay Shankar to Tharanga, 1 run, short outside off, Tharanga waits and glides it to third man
Vijay Shankar to Tharanga, no run, beaten soundly. Length delivery that jags back in, Tharanga with no feet flirts and is beaten on the outside edge
Vijay Shankar to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, short outside off, Mendis controls the pull along the ground to mid-wicket. Chahal fails to intercept it and lets it through

Washington Sundar to Tharanga, no run, now the yorker at the base of off, squeezed to extra cover. Rohit swiftly collects and releases the throw to the keeper, who took the bails off. But Tharanga turned and dragged his bat in at the nick of time
Washington Sundar to Tharanga, no run, 102kph, cramps Tharanga for room. Punched straight to cover-point
Washington Sundar to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, 83kph, slow and turning down leg. Mendis wrists it with a half-a-stride forward to mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Tharanga, 1 run, flat and sticks to off, poked softly towards point
Washington Sundar to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, too full on leg, bunted down to long-on
Washington Sundar to Kusal Mendis, FOUR, wonderfully picked. Tossed up on the stumps, Mendis gets low and twirls his wrists to hack it over square leg
Chahal to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, leggie on off, Mendis sinks low and drags the slog-sweep into the leg-side
Chahal to Kusal Mendis, no run, quicker on off, defended with a crouch to extra cover

Chahal to Tharanga, 1 run, taken at deep mid-wicket, but it's a free hit. Saw the batsman advance and kept it short, Tharanga heaved it in the air, no real timing and hits it straight to Vijay Shankar at deep mid-wicket, who takes the catch
Chahal to Kusal Mendis, no ball, 1 run, more error from Chahal. Over-steps by an inch and the umpire is quick to spot that. Spinning on leg, turned to square leg
Chahal to Kusal Mendis, FOUR, similar ball, similar shot but Mendis threaded the gap on this occasion. Picked the length early and pulled it wide of mid-on
Chahal to Kusal Mendis, 2 runs, dropped short, Mendis pulls it wide of mid-on. Unadkat makes a fumble, dives over the ball and gifts an extra run to the Sri Lankans
Chahal to Kusal Mendis, no run, spinning away on off, Mendis backs away and punches it to cover
Washington Sundar to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, overpitches outside off, driven sweetly to long-on
Washington Sundar to Tharanga, 1 run, serves it quick and full outside off, Tharanga leans into a drive to extra cover and gets the scorecard ticking
Washington Sundar to Tharanga, no run, flatter outside off, Tharanga laces the cut to point, fine stop by the fielder

Washington Sundar to Tharanga, no run, turn for Sundar. "Nalla iruku, podum" chirps DK in Tamil (which roughly translates: enough, keep it there) from behind. Floated up just outside off, breaks away sharply and Tharanga does well not to fiddle at that
Washington Sundar to Tharanga, no run, darted full outside off, sliced to point

Washington Sundar to Kusal Perera, out Bowled!! Oh, what happened there? Perera is puzzled. He has been dismissed cheaply today. Sundar gets his first wicket and nets the big fish. KP went for an adventurous reverse sweep, the ball was rifled quick at the stumps. He was late into the shot, ends up dragging it off the pad, then glove and unfortunately onto the stumps. Sundar and India are cock-a-hoop. Kusal Perera b Washington Sundar 3(4)

SN Thakur to Kusal Mendis, 2 runs, goes short on middle and leg, with fine leg inside the circle. Mendis shuffles across and lifts it over the fielder at 45. Not enough legs to the reach the fence, Shikhar Dhawan sprints across from deep square leg and keeps the pair down to two runs

SN Thakur to Kusal Mendis, FOUR, one bounce and four. The third man was deliberately placed squarer but Mendis still manages to find the gap. Short and asking for trouble, Mendis went deep in his crease and slashed it over point. Eludes Chahal at third man and runs away to the fence
SN Thakur to Kusal Perera, 1 run, rising from a length, Perera rolls his wrists and tucks it to square leg
SN Thakur to Kusal Perera, 2 runs, lasered wide of off, Perera throws his bat. Chirps it off the toe-end over the in-field on the off-side. Two taken and he gets off the mark
SN Thakur to Kusal Perera, no run, angling on leg, Perera waits in his crease and blocks

SN Thakur to Gunathilaka, out Caught by Raina!! Wow. Wow. What a stunner from Raina. He dropped a straightforward catch in the last game and look at him here. Just flew across like a bird and grabs it. Sri Lanka have lost their first wicket, sheer courtesy of Raina's blinder. Short at the stumps, Gunathilaka pulled it hard and flat, didn't bother to keep it down and hits it to mid-wicket. Raina flew to his left, went with both hands and held onto it. Raina has taken many such catches in his career. Thakur just couldn't believe it. Gunathilaka c Raina b SN Thakur 17(8) [6s-1]
SN Thakur to Gunathilaka, wide, wayward start for Thakur, veering down leg-side. Called a wide

Washington Sundar to Kusal Mendis, no run, Mendis walks across his sticks, looking it turn it to the leg-side. But this low full toss dips and he ends up squirting it off the cue-end to the right of the bowler. Sundar has come back well after that first ball
Washington Sundar to Kusal Mendis, no run, slow and turns it in around off, defended manfully
Washington Sundar to Gunathilaka, 1 run, drifting on leg, quietly worked to mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Gunathilaka, 2 runs, keeps it short again, on leg. Turned through mid-wicket, they put on the jetpack and race back for the second
Washington Sundar to Gunathilaka, no run, pushed through quicker and gains some extra bounce. Gunathilaka's defence is met high on the bat
Washington Sundar to Gunathilaka, SIX, no respect whatsoever. Gunathilaka greets the youngster with a six to the crease. Makes room, flexes his arms and thumps it with a straight bat down the ground
Unadkat to Gunathilaka, 1 run, nudged wide of mid-on and that caps off an eventful first over for Sri Lanka

Unadkat to Gunathilaka, 2 runs, he's made it in. Look at that stretch from Gunathilaka, jeez! Swimming pool-esque dive. NOT OUT. Excellent running from the duo. Gunathilaka tucked it through square leg and scampered back for the second. Chahal with a good and flat throw to the keeper, but Gunathilaka's dive saves him in the end, despite DK flicking off the bails in a flash
Unadkat to Kusal Mendis, 1 run, this time opens the bat face and finds the gap to guide it to third man
Unadkat to Kusal Mendis, no run, skips back in his crease and pats it defensively

Unadkat to Kusal Mendis, SIX, wow! How did he manage to get that away for a maximum? Outrageous. Unadkat slanted it wide of off, Mendis went after it albeit his bat handle came off the bat which meant that he didn't time that as he would've liked. But it hit the meat perhaps and flew over extra cover. All the way!

Unadkat to Gunathilaka, 5 runs, auspicious start for Sri Lanka. Rohit is not happy one bit. A harmless length delivery on off, Gunathilaka softly taps it towards cover and they set off for a single. KL Rahul rushes forward, collects the ball and fires a throw at the stumps. But the throw deflects off Mendis' bat and runs away to the fence. Bonus runs for Sri Lanka. What a start

Pradeep to Karthik, 1 run, yorker length delivery just outside off, Karthik steers it just in front of deep point for a single. India win the game by 6 wickets. More importantly, they sit pretty at the top of the table now!
Pradeep to Karthik, FOUR, full toss outside off, Karthik cross-bats it down to long-on for a one-bounce four. Scores level.
Pradeep to Karthik, FOUR, just a tad short outside off, Karthik twists his torso into a lofted pull through to deep mid-wicket fence for four.
Chameera to Karthik, 1 run, length delivery on the pads, DK nudges it to mid-wicket for a quick single
Chameera to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short of length delivery just outside off, Manish Pandey punches it with firm forearms to sweeper cover for another single
Chameera to Karthik, 1 run, back of a length delivery seaming in just a tad from outside off, Karthik stays in the crease and drops it to third man for a single

Chameera to Karthik, FOUR, full delivery on middle, angled in, Karthik heaves it away to the deep mid-wicket fence for four. Not quite out of the meat - more of a thick inside edge. But useful runs nonetheless.

Chameera to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short of length delivery just outside off, Manish Pandey shuffles across and runs that down to third man for a single. Just taps it on the head to deflect it and the pace on the ball does the rest
Chameera to Manish Pandey, wide, a vile wide. Extremely short outside off, Manish Pandey backs away and just watches it sail past and ridicules the waywardness of the delivery
Chameera to Karthik, 1 run, the partnership between Karthik and Manish Pandey is now 50! A short of length ball just outside off, Karthik steers it down to third man for a single.
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, full delivery on the pads, Manish Pandey comes forward and whips it away to mid-wicket for a quick couple
J Mendis to Karthik, 1 run, just a tad short was that leg-break and it keeps low, Karthik drag-pulls it away to long-on for a single
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tossed up leg-break just outside off, pushed away to cover for a single
J Mendis to Karthik, 1 run, length ball fired in flat outside off, Karthik taps it to covers for a single

J Mendis to Karthik, 2 runs, just a tad short outside off, Karthik chops it off the under-edge to point and runs across. Akila scores a direct-hit at the non-striker's end and they steal a second as it is sent up to the third umpire. A close one, but not out is the verdict
J Mendis to Karthik, FOUR, tossed up and tossed away by Karthik, as Sunil Gavaskar would eloquently put it. A short-ish one outside off, Karthik slapped away to sweeper cover for four
Perera to Karthik, 1 run, length delivery on middle and off, Karthik tries to whip it away but it stops on him and he gets a leading edge towards point and runs across for a single
Perera to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower delivery, full on the pads, semi-coptered away to mid-wicket for a single
Perera to Manish Pandey, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, opens the face and steers that straight to backward point and can't quite get it through the in-field
Perera to Manish Pandey, SIX, short one, sat up to be punished, Manish said to himself "Why not?" and opened up his stance to pull that over deep mid-wicket for six! Massive hit...
Perera to Manish Pandey, no run, short of length delivery just outside off, Manish Pandey stands tall and taps it on the head towards cover
Perera to Karthik, 1 run, short and into the rib-cage, Karthik swivels on his heel and pulls it away to backward square leg for a single
Dananjaya to Karthik, 1 run, another carom ball with very little overspin on off stump, turning away, Karthik rocks back and whips it expertly away towards mid-wicket for a single
Dananjaya to Manish Pandey, 1 run, loopy carom ball on off, Manish Pandey drives it with the spin to wide long-off for a single
Dananjaya to Karthik, 1 run, another leg-break but dragged down short on off and middle, Karthik gets deep in the crease and pulls it away to deep mid-wicket for a single
Dananjaya to Karthik, no run, tossed up on leg and middle, leg-break, Karthik gets well forward and dead-bats compactly
Dananjaya to Manish Pandey, 1 run, flat delivery on off, Manish Pandey taps it to cover and hurries across for a single
Dananjaya to Karthik, 1 run, googly outside off, flattish in trajectory, Karthik tries to push that to cover but gets a thick inside edge to short mid-wicket for a single
Pradeep to Karthik, 1 run, good length delivery on the pads, Karthik whips it away to deep square leg for another comfortably single. Boundaries are rare, but runs coming at a quick pace
Pradeep to Manish Pandey, 1 run, back of a length delivery on the pelvis, Manish Pandey tucks it into the on-side in front of square for a single

Pradeep to Manish Pandey, no run, length delivery on off, Manish Pandey taps it back to the bowler, and casually strolls out of his crease before Pradeep fires in a throw at the stumps to send him hurrying back
Pradeep to Karthik, 1 run, fuller length delivery on middle, Karthik shuffles across and clips it away to deep square leg for a single
Pradeep to Manish Pandey, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Manish Pandey steers it down towards deep backward point for a single. Deft touch

Pradeep to Manish Pandey, FOUR, short of length delivery on off, Manish Pandey backs away towards the on-side and advances down to punch that to deep extra cover for four with his weight on the back foot. Put his entire bodyweight behind that shot

J Mendis to Karthik, no run, leg-break outside off, Karthik tries to chase and gets a little too cute with the late-cut, misses. In fact, it has been sent up to the third umpire as a stumping chance, but I think DK is safe. And I'm right :)

J Mendis to Karthik, 2 runs, tossed up on the pads, Karthik shimmies down and flicks it to deep mid-wicket where Kusal Mendis lobs it back to Gunathilaka to keep the momentum taking the ball over the fence
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 1 run, another drag-down just outside off, tapped away off the back foot to sweeper cover for a single
J Mendis to Karthik, 1 run, full and flat on leg-stump, Karthik is quick down the track and whips that to long-on for a single
J Mendis to Karthik, FOUR, leg-break just a fraction wide and short-ish outside off, Karthik gets low in his stance and carves that away to the deep backward point fence for four
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fuller length delivery angled in on middle and leg, whipped down to deep mid-wicket for a single
Chameera to Manish Pandey, 1 run, back of a length delivery angling towards off, Manish Pandey gets on the back foot and taps it down to mid-on for a single
Chameera to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, short and just a fraction wide outside off, Manish Pandey hops and slaps that with oh-so-much wrath to sweeper cover for another brace

Chameera to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, just a fraction short on off-stump, Manish Pandey gets front-on and plays a short-arm swat-pull to deep square leg for a brace. Had to hurry for the second but made it comfortably in the end

Chameera to Manish Pandey, no run, length delivery just outside off, Manish Pandey opens the face and tries to run it down to deep backward point by piercing the gap. Ends up getting it straight to the man stationed at backward point inside the circle
Chameera to Karthik, 1 run, back of a length delivery just a fraction wide outside off, Karthik sticks out his bat and helps it on it's way to third man for another single. Delicately played
Chameera to Manish Pandey, 1 run, length delivery on off, Manish Pandey stays in the crease and whips it rather VVSly to mid-wicket for a quick single
J Mendis to Karthik, no run, flat outside off, slaps the drive to extra cover

J Mendis to Rahul, out Hit Wkt!! First Indian batsman to be dismissed hit wicket in T20Is. It seems to be going all well for the Karnataka batsman, but Rahul moved too far inside the crease and got out in the most bizzare fashion. He tried to tuck this delivery into the leg-side, as he went inside the crease, his back foot slid accidentally towards the stumps and the bails come off in a flash. Rahul hit wkt b J Mendis 18(17) [4s-1]

J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 1 run, made room and pushed this slower delivery to backward point, the call was instinctive. Both the batsmen were quick to react, and that commendable dive from Rahul saved him there. Thisara was quick to get to the ball and he fired it flat to the keeper
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, no run, looks to nudge this into the leg-side, fails to make any contact. Knocks the pads and dribbles into the leg-side. Too far down leg to be adjudged lbw
J Mendis to Rahul, 1 run, cuts fiercely off the back foot to backward point and hustles for a quick single
J Mendis to Rahul, no run, shortish and spins away outside off, Rahul looks to reach out, but can't get there
Perera to Rahul, 1 run, easy peasy these for the Indian batsen, just nudging and nurdling around after smashing a boundary off the first ball. Into the mid-wicket region now
Perera to Manish Pandey, 1 run, sits on the back foot, neatly guides the length ball to third man for a yawning single
Perera to Rahul, 1 run, short of length on the pads, tucked round the corner
Perera to Manish Pandey, 1 run, lets the ball dart in, dabs with an open bat face and manages a single into the third man area
Perera to Manish Pandey, no run, opens up late and punches with an open bat face to backward point
Perera to Manish Pandey, FOUR, short and wide, Manish Pandey says thank you and belts that after transferring his weight onto the back foot, blazed away through covers
J Mendis to Rahul, 2 runs, times the pants of this full ball through covers, adds another two to his and India's tally
J Mendis to Rahul, 2 runs, works the ball towards mid-wicket and they sense a two with no fielders patrolling that region. Good running between the wickets
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tossed full outside off, milked down to long-off for an easy single

J Mendis to Manish Pandey, FOUR, now then! That's a prime example of picking the length early. It was short and Manish Pandey decided the best option to against the delivery is with a fierce pull, he clears his front leg and goes through with the shot, just past the outstretched hand of mid-wicket
J Mendis to Rahul, 1 run, lunges forward and eases a single to long-off
J Mendis to Rahul, wide, down leg, wided
J Mendis to Manish Pandey, 1 run, floated up outside off, driven to deep cover

Pradeep to Manish Pandey, 1 run, whew! What happened there? Pradeep's towel seems to have come off while he's on his delivery stride and that clearly put Manish Pandey off. Despite that, he managed to push this full ball firmly to long-on. Oh wait, more replays on. The towel actually seems to have come off along with the bowling arm. Manish Pandey has every right to complain and he does so swiftly to umpire Ranmore Martinesz who sports a baffled expression indicating something similar to *Let's get on with the game fellas*

Pradeep to Raina, out Caught by Perera!! Shuffles out of his leg stump and reveals his cards way too soon. Pradeep tried his best to dart it in to curb all the room Raina wanted and the result? A mistimed flat-batted slap straight into the safe hands of Thisara Perera at mid-off. Poor from Raina. Raina c Perera b Pradeep 27(15) [4s-2 6s-2]

Pradeep to Raina, SIX, Lakmal first, Chameera next and Pradeep now. Looks like the SL bowlers are in total sync regarding their plans. *Excuse the sarcasm please* Short and down leg, much like his partners and the result refuses to change. Raina puts it away with ease
Pradeep to Rahul, 1 run, drop-and-run single, just taps it on its head and off they go
Pradeep to Rahul, FOUR, there's KL Rahul special. Fast hands. Moves across his off-stump, and treats it like a leg-stump length ball to slap the pull past fine leg
Pradeep to Raina, 1 run, short ball outside off, agricultural slog from Raina, drags it off the bottom half wide of long-on
Dananjaya to Raina, 1 run, stays leg-side of the delivery, but manages to tap this delivery towards mid-off with an angled willow. Runs are runs, doesn't matter how they come
