Dananjaya to Raina, no run, gives himself some leeway outside off and cuts, can't get it past cover though
Dananjaya to Raina, wide, fired it down leg with the arm, 92ks, Raina swipes and misses
Dananjaya to Rahul, 1 run, this one turns away, legbreak perhaps? Rahul camps back and punches to long-on
Dananjaya to Rahul, no run, flighted around off, classic textbook defence from Rahul
Dananjaya to Raina, 1 run, ups his pace and keeps it slightly outside off, Raina comes down the track and miscues the loft, on the bounce to the man at long-off
Dananjaya to Raina, no run, spears it in with the angle, Raina backs away and forces it back to the bowler
Chameera to Raina, 1 run, gives himself room once again, but this time the bowler followed him and speared it into his body, Raina squirts it wide of the bowler and gets across for a quick single

Chameera to Raina, SIX, typical Raina! Makes room, pulls the short ball and causes damage to the digital scoreboard placed over the mid-wicket fence. Went flat and carried the fire Raina generated off his bottom hand
Chameera to Raina, FOUR, back to mediocre bowling, short and sliding down leg, Raina smashes the pull over square leg
Chameera to Raina, no run, excellent comeback delivery. 136ks jaffa on off-stump, had Raina dancing to his tunes. Raina must thank his stars for he is lucky enough to have not nicked that
Chameera to Raina, FOUR, that's a gimme. Short sans any height down leg, Raina gets inside the line and helps it away with a flick-pull, off she goes...
Chameera to Rahul, 1 run, digs it short outside off, hurries the batsman for pace, Rahul cuts it down to third man
Dananjaya to Raina, 2 runs, in the air and safe! Raina decides to go for a slog, miscued it high into the night sky off the toe end, drops just short of the man gliding in from deep mid-wicket
Dananjaya to Raina, no run, quicker outside off, Raina pushes it into the off-side
Dananjaya to Rahul, 1 run, spinning into the pads, worked away into the leg-side

Dananjaya to Rahul, no run, flicked to short fine and there's horrible indecision between the duo. Rahul never wanted the single, but Raina charged forward and had to reverse his gears to make it in. He put in a splendid dive which saved him there. The throw was sharp and accurate, but Raina's athletic abilities are second to none
Dananjaya to Raina, 1 run, sets himself on one knee and goes for the slogsweep, lands short of the fielder at deep mid-wicket
Dananjaya to Rahul, 4 wides, oh! Drifts this down leg and past Rahul's paddle. The fielder at short leg hunts it down and just pulls it back inside the ropes

Dananjaya to Dhawan, out Caught by Perera!! A nothing shot from SD. Dananjaya gets his second wicket. Shimmies down, nowhere near the pitch of the delivery and what's worse? The ball was spinning away from him, so Dhawan had to do something unorthodox; he opts to flick the loft over mid-wicket, but his timing got restrained by the angle and thus, chips meekly to mid-on. Thisara Perera's bucket hands does the rest. Dhawan c Perera b Dananjaya 8(10) [4s-1]
Lakmal to Dhawan, 1 run, steers a single behind point to keep strike
Lakmal to Dhawan, FOUR, that was begging to be hit. Short ball sprayed down the leg-side, Dhawan picks it up late but gets enough contact on the hurried pull to send it racing to the fine leg fence
Lakmal to Rahul, 1 run, drops the ball in the vacant spaces around short mid-wicket and nabs a quick single. Smart batting from KL
Lakmal to Dhawan, 1 run, charges out of his crease, realizes there's no pace to go through his shot, adjusts well to glide a single down to third man
Lakmal to Rahul, 1 run, waits for this 132ks outside off tester to arrive and calmy runs it down to third man with an open bat face
Lakmal to Dhawan, 1 run, comes down the track and pushes this to mid-off, sprints for a quick single

Dananjaya to Rohit, out Caught by Kusal Mendis!! Spots Rohit's intentions - comes down the track - early and drifts it in into his pads, Rohit tries to whip-flick that over mid-wicket, but terrible mistiming on that. Right off the cue end and straight it goes as a dolly to the man stationed at the edge of the mid-wicket circle. Ah, the usual Rohit Sharma blues. Lures with some glorious strokes and then gets out in this fashion. Rohit c Kusal Mendis b Dananjaya 11(7) [4s-1 6s-1]
Dananjaya to Rohit, no run, this offspinner fizzes in quickly to cramp Rohit for room, blunted back to the bowler
Dananjaya to Dhawan, 1 run, drags the length back, Dhawan goes on the back foot and drags the pull through mid-wicket
Dananjaya to Dhawan, no run, quicker delivery, Dhawan cuts straight to cover
Dananjaya to Dhawan, no run, stays outside leg stump and punches this offbreak to the left of short cover, a diving stop from the fielder there
Dananjaya to Rohit, 1 run, advances down the pitch and tucks to the right of Dananjaya who attempts a needless dive to enable a single. Of course, there's a misfield
Lakmal to Dhawan, no run, width on offer, Dhawan gets on top of it with a fierce cut, but he fails to pierce the gap on the off-side. Fielded at cover-point
Lakmal to Dhawan, no run, much better. Hits the good length area and keeps it around off-stump, Dhawan blocks from the crease
Lakmal to Rohit, leg byes, 1 run, strays into the pads once more, Rohit can't lay bat on this, snicks his pads and rolls wide of the keeper
Lakmal to Rohit, FOUR, gone again! Can't bowl there to Rohit Sharma. Length ball on the pads, Rohit swivels and dispatches the pull backwards of square leg
Lakmal to Rohit, SIX, not wasting any time is Rohit Sharma, the synonym of talent and the sibling of elegance. Gets a short ball and bam! Unveils those whippy wrists through the pull over square leg
Lakmal to Rohit, no run, starts with a back of a length dart on middle stump, Rohit happy to nudge it with soft hands into the leg-side

Khaleel Ahmed to Southee, out Bowled! Slower ball and he's missed it. Southee wanted to slog across the line, the ball hits the top of middle stump. Excellent outing for Khaleel, 4-0-27-2. Southee b Khaleel Ahmed 3(3)
Khaleel Ahmed to Southee, 2 runs, brilliant executed yorker from round the wicket, Southee takes his front leg away and flicks, hinted at playing the paddle and then changed the shot
Khaleel Ahmed to Kuggeleijn, 1 run, yorker outside off stump, Kuggeleijn digs it out onto his boot
Khaleel Ahmed to Southee, 1 run, very full delivery, flicked away to deep square leg

Khaleel Ahmed to Santner, out Bowled!! Chopped on. Wide yorker outside off stump, Santner tries to drill hard through cover, the balance and the feet weren't there for the shot and the off stump was shattered. Santner b Khaleel Ahmed 7(8)

Khaleel Ahmed to Kuggeleijn, 1 run, in the airrr, taken, oh he's dropped the ball. Kuggeleijn stays deep in the crease to power this good length ball, Hardik ran to his left and rolled for the catch, the ball hit the wrists and popped out. Gee, how hard and flat was that hit!

Bhuvneshwar to Santner, out Ross Taylor Run Out!! 1 run completed. Direct-hit from long-on. Oh yeah! What a throw. Santner worked this away to the left of long-on, Taylor was trying to push that second run, was in trouble with the fielder quickly getting to the ball and Bhuvi let the ball go onto the stumps and the lights flashed. Lovely piece of fielding. Ross Taylor run out (Shankar) 42(36) [4s-3]
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, 1 run, toe-crusher at the base of off stump, Taylor digs it out to long-off
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, wide, another very wide ball outside off stump
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, wide, very full and wide outside off stump, Taylor tries to reach out and play but it was very wide
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, no run, Taylor wanted to paddle-sweep this yorker past short fine leg, but missed it
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, 2 runs, low full toss on the leg stump, Taylor slogs it to deep square leg
Bhuvneshwar to Santner, 1 run, low full toss, Santner wanted to flick over wide mid-on, but leading edges it to long-off
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, 1 run, Bhuvi executes a very good wide yorker, Taylor reaches out and digs it out to deep cover
Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, 1 run, slower delivery outside off stump, slapped hard and straight to Shikhar at mid-off
Hardik Pandya to Santner, 1 run, low full toss just outside off stump, Santner slogs it to deep mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, 1 run, wide yorker outside off stump, Taylor reaches out and drills it to deep cover
Hardik Pandya to Santner, 1 run, slower delivery, Santner helps it away to short fine leg
Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, 1 run, mistimed drive to long-off

Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, FOUR, lovely flick shot, such a delight watching Taylor target deep mid-wicket, although that trademark slog-sweep is even better to watch. Pandya misses the yorker, bowl full and disappears
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, 1 run, low full toss, Taylor flicks it to backward square leg

Bhuvneshwar to Santner, 1 run, Mitch wanted to pull that hard over mid-wicket, got an under edge, oopsy! Looks like he's smashed this into his right knee, that can be really painful, straight on the bone, ice it ASAP sir
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, 1 run, low full toss outside off stump, Taylor toe-ends the slap to cover
Bhuvneshwar to Santner, 1 run, pushed away to long-on

Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, 1 run, low full toss, another flick shot to mid-wicket, Taylor wants two, realizes Krunal wants to break the sticks with his throw, decides to dive back in the crease, funny dive, not well timed, ends up rolling on the floor

Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, 2 runs, starts with a nicely bowled yorker, but Taylor is experienced enough to nudge with soft hands to mid-wicket and rush back for two. Bhuvi will be wondering, I bowled a good ball, they have actually taken two!
Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, 1 run, shortish slower ball outside off stump, Taylor cuts it to deep backward point
Hardik Pandya to Santner, 1 run, short delivery on the leg stump, pulled to long leg

Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Rohit!! Oh dear! The bowler bowls in your slot and you smash it hard in the air, but hit it straight to the fielder. Massive wicket for India. CDG was threatening to make this really big. He went for the cover-drive, the bat turned in his hands on impact with the ball, so didn't get the right placement and Ro didn't have to move an inch at extra-cover. End of an entertaining knock. de Grandhomme c Rohit b Hardik Pandya 50(28) [4s-1 6s-4]

Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, 2 runs, flicked to deep mid-wicket and it's a maiden T20I fifty off just 27 balls, came out positive and now has put his side in a great position to really push towards 180
Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, wide, slower delivery wide outside off stump, de Grandhomme tries to cut and misses, that was well over the line
Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, 1 run, slower delivery outside off stump, Taylor cuts it square of the wicket on the off-side
Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, wide, sprayed down the leg-side attempting a yorker

Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, 1 run, excellent effort from Khaleel because he was brave enough to run forward to attempt a catch when this thick outside edge was dipping on him, slower delivery outside off stump, de Grandhomme tries to slash hard, gets away with the edge
Khaleel Ahmed to de Grandhomme, 1 run, oh he's cut this straight to backward point, would have been a boundary had it been a yard or two either side of the fielder
Khaleel Ahmed to Ross Taylor, 1 run, round the wicket, short ball, Taylor mistimes the pull shot to deep mid-wicket

Khaleel Ahmed to Ross Taylor, FOUR, it's a bit of disgrace if you are a fast bowler and you are being swept to the boundary. Full credit to Taylor for the execution. The bowler actually bowled a pretty decent full ball, but the bloke was too good to get inside the line and place it to the left of short fine leg
Khaleel Ahmed to de Grandhomme, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, de Grandhomme cuts it square of the wicket on the off-side
Khaleel Ahmed to de Grandhomme, no run, good length angled across the right-hander, de Grandhomme tries to slice and misses
Khaleel Ahmed to de Grandhomme, no run, full and angled across outside off stump, de Grandhomme tries to drive hard and misses
Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, 1 run, lovely yorker from Hardik Pandya, de Grandhomme adjusts and flicks to deep mid-wicket. CDG now has recorded his highest score in T20Is. Previous best was 41*

Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, 2 runs, don't think he's timed this well, slower ball wide outside off stump, de Grandhomme tries the loft over cover, hits the bottom of the bat and lands safely in the deep
Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, 1 run, 112kph slower ball outside off stump, Taylor lofts it to long-on
Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, 1 run, that's a juicy full ball, but de Grandhomme has only managed to crunch it on the bounce to the man at long-off
Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, wide, now Hardik Pandya tries the slower ball yorker, and fires it way outside off stump
Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, wide, this is way down the leg-side, tried the yorker there and missed
Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, no run, nice yorker length delivery, de Grandhomme had to take his right leg away to prevent injury as he tried to dig this out back to the bowler
Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, 2 runs, slower ball, thumped hard through cover, Shikhar runs to his left and cuts it off in the deep
Chahal to de Grandhomme, 1 run, shortish delivery on the leg stump, de Grandhomme flicks it to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Ross Taylor, 1 run, shortish and on the stumps, Taylor flicks it wide of mid-wicket
Chahal to Ross Taylor, FOUR, cheeky little paddle sweep and fine leg is very square, it's a odd-shaped ground, so your fine leg could be a lot wider and Taylor was exactly aware of the field
Chahal to de Grandhomme, 1 run, shortish delivery on the off stump, de Grandhomme flicks it towards long-on
Chahal to Ross Taylor, 1 run, short and spinning away outside off stump, Taylor reaches out and cuts it to sweeper cover
Chahal to Ross Taylor, no run, flighted delivery down the leg-side, Taylor tries to flick behind square on the on-side, gets hit on the pad
Krunal Pandya to Ross Taylor, 1 run, another soft tuck towards square leg, but just a single
Krunal Pandya to Ross Taylor, 2 runs, nudged with soft hands towards mid-wicket, CDG calls for two and rushes back in time before Rohit collected the throw

Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, 1 run, there's the good old defensive response from a spinner when he's been smashed around, throw it flat and wide outside off stump, de Grandhomme slices it to deep point

Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, SIX, the length to de Grandhomme hasn't been correct from the Indians, they have bowled way too full and allowed the batsman to get under the ball, easy loft down the ground and he hits them alright towards the long-off/long-on region. Dhoni immediately has a word with Krunal Pandya
Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, SIX, de Grandhomme is timing the ball so sweetly, Krunal Pandya fires full and down the leg-side, just a flick shot and it travels all the way upto the second tier
Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, 2 runs, short ball and on the stumps, de Grandhomme flicks it along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Ross Taylor, no run, flatter in trajectory, Taylor tucks it into the on-side
Chahal to Ross Taylor, 2 runs, pushed away to deep extra-cover, de Grandhomme returns for the second run
Chahal to de Grandhomme, 1 run, again hit hard on the drive as Chahal bowls too full, powered down to long-on

Chahal to de Grandhomme, SIX, oh he's absolutely muscled this ball hard, Chahal has the right idea to bowl full, but you can't bowl at 89kph, got to be a lot more slower to enforce a false shot from the batsman, de Grandhomme lofts and it just clears the long-off boundary
Chahal to de Grandhomme, FOUR, now Chahal throws this wide outside off stump, but that doesn't stop de Grandhomme freeing his arms, reaches out and slices it hard over deep point for one bounce four
Chahal to de Grandhomme, SIX, lofted nicely as Chahal overpitches, too full from the bowler and de Grandhomme went really hard at this, powered all the way into the sightscreen
Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, 1 run, tossed up at the stumps, eased back past the bowler for a single
Krunal Pandya to Ross Taylor, 1 run, flatter and on Taylor's pads, worked in front of square on the on-side for a single
Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, 1 run, pushed through on the pads, CDG clips it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Krunal Pandya to Ross Taylor, 1 run, very full and at the stumps, flicked wide of mid-wicket for a single
Krunal Pandya to Ross Taylor, no run, Krunal drifts this one slower and on Taylor's pads, he was looking to nudge and is hit on the pad
Krunal Pandya to Ross Taylor, no run, slower and just outside off, Taylor drops it in front of cover-point
Chahal to Ross Taylor, 1 run, tossed up at the stumps, eased down towards long-on for a single
Chahal to Ross Taylor, no run, nicely tossed up outside off, Taylor drives and finds the man at cover
Chahal to Ross Taylor, wide, too full and too wide from Chahal, called by the umpire
Chahal to de Grandhomme, 1 run, another wrong 'un from Chahal, clipped towards mid-wicket for a single
Chahal to Ross Taylor, 1 run, tossed up just outside off, driven down towards long-off for a single
Chahal to de Grandhomme, 1 run, the wrong 'un from Chahal, CDG spots it and drills it down towards long-on, one bounce and to Hardik at long-on
Chahal to de Grandhomme, no run, tossed up well outside off, driven straight to the fielder at cover
Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, 1 run, tossed up just outside off, eased down towards long-off for a single

Krunal Pandya to Williamson, out Lbw!! Krunal is on fire and he has his third wicket. This looked adjacent and KW should have no complaints, pushed through flatter and quicker, pitched around middle and skidded onto the right-hander, KW was rocking back on the pull and was beaten by the pace, struck on the back-thigh, bang in front of middle. At worst, would have been hitting the top of middle. India are now beginning to control this match. Williamson lbw b Krunal Pandya 20(17) [4s-3]
Krunal Pandya to Ross Taylor, 1 run, flatter and well outside off, worked in front of long-on for a single
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, slower and spinning away from off, dabbed to the left of short third man for a single
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, no run, tossed up on off, defended back at the bowler
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, no run, slower and wider of off, KW chops it behind point, but can't get it past Khaleel at short third man
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, the leg-break from Chahal, but it's too short and wide of off, cut square past cover for a single
Chahal to Ross Taylor, 1 run, pushed through quicker and on Taylor's pads, nudged backward of square on the on-side for a single
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, slower and well outside off, eased down towards long-off for a single
Chahal to Ross Taylor, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle, worked away towards long-on for a single
Chahal to Ross Taylor, no run, tossed up on off, driven back at the bowler who makes a tumbling stop
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, dropped short and at the stumps, pulled away to mid-wicket for a single

Krunal Pandya to Daryl Mitchell, out Lbw!! Daryl Mitchell has been given out LBW and he wants a review. Did he get an inside edge? Only that can save him. It's a fair delivery, think there's a slight deflection, could it be the inside edge? HotSpot in and there's a mark, but was it bat hitting ball? We need to confirm with RTS, it doesn't show any spike as the ball went past the bat, he says there's no bat involved, three REDS on Hawk-Eye and it stays OUT. Mitchell looks stunned, he doesn't want to go, he thinks there's a clear inside edge, now, the two on-field umpires converge and Rohit joins in as well. 'It's ridiculous', says Simon Doull on air, he says there was a clear inside edge. Controversy in Eden park, now Dhoni joins in and Mitchell is being sent on his way. Unfortunate way to go, think there was an inside edge, HotSpot showed something when the ball went past the bat, but the third umpire, Shaun Haig, decided that it wasn't bat hitting ball. Coming to the ball, it was pushed through with the angle, Mitchell was caught in the crease as he went back, the bat came down hurriedly as he jabbed at it. Was there an inside edge? I thought so, but the third umpire didn't. Daryl Mitchell lbw b Krunal Pandya 1(2)
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, slower and on middle, KW leans forward and pushes it into the space - in front of mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, no run, dropped short and wide of off, KW makes room and finds cover with the cut
Krunal Pandya to Daryl Mitchell, 1 run, tossed up around off, worked in front of square on the on-side for a single

Krunal Pandya to Munro, out Caught by Rohit!! Krunal has struck with his second ball and it's an all Mumbai Indians show in the field. Nicely tossed up around middle, Munro backed away, was looking to go over the in-field, ended up slicing it uppishly and straight to cover. It came at a great pace and at an awkward height, but Rohit ensured that he ain't dropping those. Munro c Rohit b Krunal Pandya 12(12) [6s-1]
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, tossed up on middle and angling into the right-hander, worked wide of mid-wicket for a single
Hardik Pandya to Munro, no run, yorker length delivery outside off, Munro jams his bat down and squeezes it back at the bowler
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, on a length and on the pads, clipped behind square on the on-side for a single

Hardik Pandya to Williamson, FOUR, lovely, nice use of the feet from KW, gets close to the pitch and then extends his arms on the drive, places it past the diving cover fielder and runs away to the ropes
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, no run, fuller length delivery on KW's pads, clipped straight to the fielder at mid-wicket

Hardik Pandya to Williamson, FOUR, cheeky and four, on a good length and just outside off, KW waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment, played with soft hands and runs it past the keeper
Hardik Pandya to Munro, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, Munro drops it in front of cover-point for a quick single

Khaleel Ahmed to Williamson, FOUR, classy, on a good length and well wide of off, KW leant into the drive, played with an open face and found the gap to the right of cover-point, the ball slowed down as it neared the fence, but has enough to hit the ropes, 13 from the over
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, 1 run, almost a perfect riposte from Khaleel, yorker length delivery on Munro's toes, he just about squeezes it to the on-side and calls his partner across for a quick single
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, SIX, massive, length ball outside off and Munro loves it in that area, picks it up cleanly, a nice swing of the bat and sent it way into the stands over long-off
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, no run, short of a length and tucking Munro for room as he prodded forward, pushed to the on-side and Munro wanted a run, sent back by his captain
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, no run, tad fuller and in that channel outside off, Munro swung across blindly and missed his heave

Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, 2 runs, on a good length and just outside off, Munro bends down low and swipes it over mid-wicket, didn't come off the middle of the bat - DK ran across to his left from deep mid-wicket, puts in the slide and saves a couple of runs

Bhuvneshwar to Williamson, no run, loud shout for LBW and India will not review. Might have been an inside edge there and that's what Rohit felt as well, KW was caught in his crease to an inswinger as he looked to nudge it to the on-side, struck well below the knee-roll and the impact was around off
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 1 run, short of a length and angling into Munro's pads, pulled away behind square on the on-side for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Williamson, 1 run, on a good length and at the stumps, worked wide of mid-on for a single

Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, out Caught by Dhoni!! Edged and caught! No Wellington heroics from Seifert, short of a length and holding its line outside off, Seifert was swinging across the line - a fat outside edge, audible through to the umpire and Dhoni snaffles it. Good comeback from Bhuvneshwar after conceding 10 runs from the last 2 balls. Seifert c Dhoni b Bhuvneshwar 12(12) [4s-1 6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, SIX, four and now the first six of the match, the knuckle ball from Bhuvneshwar, but the length was a tad too short, allowed Seifert to free his arms and pull it wide of mid-on - short boundaries here at the Eden park and the ball sailed over the ropes

Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, FOUR, Seifert breaks the shackles, Bhuvneshwar shortened his length and angled it on his body as Seifert came down the track, the fast hands came into play as Seifert swivelled, rolled his wrists over it and pulled it backward of square on the on-side for a boundary
Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, 1 run, the slower ball from Khaleel, on Seifert's hips and it's clipped behind square on the on-side for a single

Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, no run, another play and another miss from Seifert, short of a good length and shaping away from the right-hander, Seifert's feet was rooted to the crease as he drove and missed
Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, no run, change of pace now, slips in the slower ball after rolling his fingers across the seam, Seifert has a feel for it and is beaten on the outside edge
Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, no run, much better from Khaleel, on a good length and slanting across the right-hander, seamed away with the angle and beat Seifert's ambitious looking drive
Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, no run, fuller length delivery and well wide of off, Seifert went chasing after that and is beaten on the slash
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off, drew Munro into an ambitious drive and rolled towards deep mid-wicket - off the inner half of the bat

Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, no run, beautifully bowled, on a good length and a hint of shape away from the right-hander, the length drew the right-hander forward before the swing took it past the outside edge
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, wide, swing for Bhuvneshwar, but he swung this one way down the leg-side, called as a wide

Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, no run, that's a ripper, saw Seifert coming down the track and shortened his length, gets it to shape away late and opened up Seifert completely - good for him that he didn't attempt to play it
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, leg byes, 1 run, on a good length and angling into Munro's pads, he was looking to flick and missed, off the thigh-pad and rolls away towards fine leg
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Munro takes a step down the track and pushes it to the off-side

Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, 1 run, edged, nice shape for Bhuvneshwar, on a good length and slanting across the right-hander, had Seifert feeling for the ball and found the edge, wide of the lone slip and a single to third man
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, no run, short of a length and well outside off, Seifert reaches out and mistimes the cut towards cover-point

Kuggeleijn to Pant, FOUR, India win the Auckland T20I, and the series is level 1-1. Half-volley on off-stump, Pant drills it with a bottomhand of steel straight down the ground for four. A clinical win here for the Men in Blue, as they bounce back in style...

Kuggeleijn to Pant, no run, short of length ball down leg-side, Pant misses the glance, and the umpire doesn't signal a wide - I saw his arm flinching, but nope. Even he doesn't want an anticlimactic end to the game...
Kuggeleijn to Pant, no run, fuller length delivery on the stumps, a bottom-handed swat towards midwicket
Kuggeleijn to Dhoni, 1 run, shortish into the hip, Dhoni misses the pull, gets stuck on his thigh and dribbles past the leg-stump
Kuggeleijn to Pant, 1 run, slower short one angling in from round the wicket towards the thigh, pulled away without great timing for a single towards fine leg.
Ferguson to Dhoni, 2 runs, round the wicket, half-volley outside off, Dhoni, with an open stance, bottomhand-whips it away towards deep extra cover for a couple
Ferguson to Dhoni, no run, yorker length delivery on the stumps, dug back out off the toe-end towards the bowler
Ferguson to Dhoni, 2 runs, shortish outside off, and that's a signature bottom-handed slap by MS towards sweeper cover for a couple
Ferguson to Pant, 1 run, short of length from round the wicket, slower I suppose, Pant crabwalks across, and laps it away towards fine leg for a single
Ferguson to Dhoni, 1 run, yorker length delivery on the 4th stump line, Dhoni jams his bat into the wicket to allow it to come on, steers it towards point for a sharp single
Ferguson to Dhoni, 2 runs, fuller length ball on the pads, whipped away towards backward square leg

Southee to Dhoni, 1 run, slower one on a back of a length outside off, a bit of width, a delayed chop towards point for a quick single. A throw at the non-striker's, misses, there's an overthrow, and that allows the single
Southee to Dhoni, 2 runs, good length delivery on the off-stump, Dhoni reaches out and plays a swatty pick-up towards deep mid-wicket for a couple
Southee to Pant, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the stumps, drilled down to mid-on for a single

Southee to Pant, SIX, WHAT! That's a length ball, a slower one, Pant is early into the batswing and hoicks that with the bottom-hand off high into the cow corner skies for a colossal six! Phenomenal hit!
Southee to Pant, wide, short one, far too short, Pant shapes up to pull, aborts it. Okay I can do better. He pulls out of it. Okay that one's gettin' dry...
Southee to Dhoni, 1 run, a tad short, Dhoni rocks back and nails the pull in front of deep square leg for a single

Southee to Pant, leg byes, 1 run, off-cutter on a back of a length, 106km/h, Pant is too early on the sweep, with his head turned towards fine leg when it strikes him on the pad, deflects into the off-side and they steal a leg-bye
Ish Sodhi to Pant, 1 run, angled in towards leg, Pant gets on his knee and lap-sweeps it away with a pinch of oomph towards fine leg for a single
Ish Sodhi to Dhoni, 1 run, fired in flat and wide outside off, Dhoni shimmies down but realizes it's out of reach, lets his bottom-hand go and glides it to point for a single
Ish Sodhi to Dhoni, no run, tossed up just outside off, spinning away, pushed off a lunge towards cover
Ish Sodhi to Pant, 1 run, tossed up and full, drilled away towards long-on for a single

Ish Sodhi to Pant, 2 runs, some topspin on that one from a back of a length, and that's a drop by Ross Taylor running backwards at fine leg! Tries helicoptering a pull-shot, and gets a top-edge just over Taylor who would have gobbled this up in his prime. I imagine there was a shake of the head by Dhoni from the other end...
Ish Sodhi to Dhoni, 1 run, tossed up on the pads, Dhoni shimmies down the wicket and whips it away towards long-on for a single

Southee to Dhoni, 1 run, back of a length ball on the thigh, Dhoni shuffles across and tucks it away behind square leg for a single to retain the strike - and a huge roar of approval from the Auckland(?) crowd
Southee to Dhoni, no run, back of a length delivery on off-stump, bottomhand-punched off the backfoot towards cover, a shimmy down the wicket, and he aborts the single
Southee to Pant, 1 run, low full-toss just outside off, checked down towards mid-off for a quick single. A throw at the non-striker's end, but he misses
Southee to Dhoni, 1 run, oh no delays in picking up the length this time, a tad short and at the body, pulled away towards deep square leg for a single

Southee to Dhoni, FOUR, on the hips, Dhoni swivels on his heel with a pull and gets a deflection off his gloves towards the fine leg fence for four. A little slow in picking up the length, but that's a boundary
Southee to Dhoni, no run, back of a length delivery on middle, Dhoni advances down the track and nudges it towards midwicket - a signature dot ball to start off Dhoni's innings

Daryl Mitchell to Pant, no run, short one but angling towards the off-side this time, Pant throws his hand at the width-less delivery, almost a double-armed forehand (You've missed the Australian Open by a few weeks Rish), and he misses it altogether
Daryl Mitchell to Pant, FOUR, shortish down leg, Pant guides it to fine leg fence with a guided pull. Just assisted along to the unmanned fine leg fence

Daryl Mitchell to Shankar, out Caught by Southee! The slower bouncer does the trick! It's a ball where you need to generate your pace with the bat, and if the timing is off, you're dead meat (Well, Shankar is vegetarian). Drags a pull out from outside off-stump and holes out to cow corner where Southee taking a tumbling catch. Shankar c Southee b Daryl Mitchell 14(8) [4s-1 6s-1]

Daryl Mitchell to Shankar, SIX, WHAT A SHOT! A low full-toss outside off, Shankar gets on his knee and waits for it to arrive, watches it onto the centroid of the blade, and caresses it with a slow-mo followthrough over long-off for six
Daryl Mitchell to Pant, 1 run, half-volley on off-stump, Pant drills it with a dominant bottom-hand towards long-off for a single
Daryl Mitchell to Pant, FOUR, cross-seamer on a back of a length headed for the pads, a pick-up swat by Pant towards deep backward square leg for four

Kuggeleijn to Shankar, FOUR, on a back of a length, Shankar lofts half-blindly, trusting the bounce and the lack of lateral movement, through the line, gets it over Williamson, who is running back, but can't prevent a one-bounce four - nearly injures himself running into the advert-boards
Kuggeleijn to Shankar, wide, short ball, tennis ball bounce, loops over his head, Shankar doesn't even bother ducking - shaped up to pull and aborted it in the end

Kuggeleijn to Shankar, no run, back of a length delivery on off-stump, Shankar punches it off the backfoot right back to the bowler, who can't collect cleanly on his followthrough but doesn't allow the single

Kuggeleijn to Shankar, 2 runs, shortish at the fulcrum, Shankar rocks back into a flamingo position and imparts topspin on that pull towards fine leg for a couple, as Sodhi puts in an acrobatic effort at the fence to cut it off
Kuggeleijn to Pant, 1 run, short one at 140km/h, Pant is too side-on for the pull, plays it late into the on-side, in front of square leg, off the sticker of the bat, for a quick single
Kuggeleijn to Shankar, 1 run, back of a length delivery on middle and leg, punched off the backfoot towards long-on for a single
Kuggeleijn to Pant, 1 run, short one at the body, Pant doesn't have enough room to deal with that ball, under-edges a pull into the off-side and sneaks a sharp single
Ish Sodhi to Pant, 1 run, dropped short on the thigh, nudged politely towards mid-on for a sharp single
Ish Sodhi to Pant, no run, googly from a back of a length, Pant attempts the reverse-sweep, misses. If he'd just backed away and gone for the orthodox cut...

Ish Sodhi to Pant, FOUR, lots of loop, but wide outside off, Pant gets on his knee and flat-bats it wide of mid-off for four. Threw his entire weight behind it and it blazed away for four towards wide long-off
Ish Sodhi to Shankar, 1 run, lots of loop on leg-stump, checks an on-drive towards long-on for a single
Ish Sodhi to Pant, 1 run, drops it a tad short on the pads, Pant stays low and pulls it away towards deep square leg for a single
Ish Sodhi to Pant, 2 runs, on the pads, nudged softly into the on-side towards square leg, and they rush through for a couple. A throw at the striker's end, but he dives in to make his ground

Ferguson to Shankar, no run, 146km/h, in the channel outside off, on a good length and enough room for it to straighten off the seam, Shankar is stuck on the backfoot, might have struggled to sight it on the cream-coloured pitch as it whizzes past his outside edge - What a pacy over!

Ferguson to Dhawan, out Caught by de Grandhomme! Beaten for pace! 145km/h, shoots off the surface, from a short of length, attacking the fulcrum so a width-player like him is unable to use his levers. Finds his Achilles' heel, and he goes for the blind hook - far too late on it, and manages to get a top-edge on it towards backward point for a dolly to CdG. Chin music at its best! Dhawan c de Grandhomme b Ferguson 30(31) [4s-2]
Ferguson to Pant, 1 run, whoof - 152km/h! full-toss on the pads, whipped away hastily to deep square leg for a single

Ferguson to Dhawan, byes, 1 run, slower bouncer angling outside off from over the wicket, Dhawan misses with the pull, far too early, goes to Seifert on the bounce, but it deflects off him towards fine leg for a bye

Ferguson to Dhawan, 2 runs, 144km/h, that's more his kinda pace, short of length and slightly wide outside off, Dhawan short-arm pulls it straight past the outstretched arm of the bowler towards long-on for a couple
Ferguson to Pant, 1 run, 129km/h on a good length from round the wicket, Pant gets forward and steers it off the outer half towards third man for a single
Ish Sodhi to Pant, 1 run, the usual - fired in drag downs. Swatted away through mid-wicket
Ish Sodhi to Pant, wide, short again, outside off and spinning further
Ish Sodhi to Pant, no run, short, scooting low, and under Pant's big heave-ho
Ish Sodhi to Dhawan, 1 run, low full toss outside off. A crouched leaning stroke down to long-off

Ish Sodhi to Pant, byes, 1 run, beaten first. A missed stumping then. And then a missed run-out. So a googly first, Pant drives inside the line, the keeper fumbles and when they're trying to steal the ricochet, the fielder at short fine leg throws it on Pant's calf en route

Ish Sodhi to Rohit, out Caught by Southee!! When rippers, 150kph stuff don't do it, trust the worst of half-trackers to. Sodhi is in no control of this, digging it short, with no real spin either. So Rohit quite naturally has taken it on his ego to muscle it into the ocean, so goes hard, so hard that he loses all shape, pulling it with a top-edge of sorts down deep mid-wicket's throat. Rohit c Southee b Ish Sodhi 50(29) [4s-3 6s-4]
Ish Sodhi to Dhawan, 1 run, back deep in the crease, making some room as well to drag the whip from somewhere around middle down to deep mid-wicket
Ish Sodhi to Dhawan, wide, down leg, spinning further down. Dhawan, despite his best attempts can't heave it right
Santner to Dhawan, 1 run, more of the negative fired in leg-lines. Wrists, clipping them through mid-wicket
Santner to Rohit, 1 run, a calm flick to follow up, through mid-wicket. Oh and yes, it's a personal fifty - he's making this a joke
Santner to Rohit, SIX, on the dance down, Santner decides to go wider, but that only helps Rohit to swing better, tonking it, perhaps even breaking the sightscreen
Santner to Dhawan, 1 run, fired in full on the legs. Tickled, behind square
Santner to Rohit, 1 run, lines beside, showing the full bat face in punching it past a mock-diving short cover
Santner to Dhawan, 1 run, glides backwards, taking it off his pads and tucking it away with the spin through square leg
Ish Sodhi to Dhawan, 1 run, short again. Dhawan makes a bit of room to carve it away through sweeper
Ish Sodhi to Dhawan, no run, flights it outside off, teasing a drive, gets one, straight to mid-off
Ish Sodhi to Rohit, 1 run, actually full now, outside off. Sharma leans low, ramps out an opened up bat face and steers it away through the empty cordon
Ish Sodhi to Rohit, 2 runs, a touch fuller, but still short by most measures. Rohit uses the spin to guide his cut through point

Ish Sodhi to Rohit, SIX, Rohit Sharma > Martin Guptill > Everybody on this bloody planet -- becomes the highest T20I run-scorer. Sodhi helps with a filthy long hop to get there - letting him swivel as he pumps this into the first floor over backward square leg.
Ish Sodhi to Dhawan, 1 run, skidding in drag down. Dhawan shapes up big for the pull, but then realizes the bounce is nowhere there to drag it away in front of square
Santner to Dhawan, 1 run, full-leg-lined again. Clipped again. Mid-wicket again
Santner to Rohit, 1 run, back to the stump-to-stump darts. Nudged away behind square
Santner to Rohit, no run, loopy for a change. Rohit under-chops, early into it
Santner to Dhawan, 1 run, shuffles away, wristing it neatly from the middle-stump line through mid-wicket
Santner to Rohit, 1 run, rocks behind, knocks in front. Mid-wicket
Santner to Dhawan, 1 run, fired in flat on the feet, a squeezy-flick away to short fine leg
Ferguson to Dhawan, 1 run, all wrists and all bottom-hand in this flick down the ground .. 50
Ferguson to Dhawan, no run, arches behind a touch, sticking out a stabbing blade to point
Ferguson to Rohit, 1 run, leg-cutter. One of the standing on-drives on the up, coming off the cue-end to long-on
Ferguson to Rohit, wide, shuffles across his stumps, looks to glance, but the line's lost down leg
Ferguson to Rohit, FOUR, 145kph. Slight width. Just slight. But Rohit swings hard, slicing it away uppishly over point. Not really off the middle, but really again, who cares
Ferguson to Dhawan, 1 run, 143kph, tighter on middle. Bunted away just next to the pitch, and before cover can come in, Rohit's already switched ends
Ferguson to Dhawan, no run, 141kph, length, slanting away, but not the room for Dhawan to lay into as he miscues the flay to cover
Southee to Rohit, no run, 109kph, more of the off-paced stuff. This time on the top of off, which Rohit opens his bat face and runs out to short third man
Southee to Rohit, no run, 110kph, slow, into the pitch. Knocked away, closing the bat face as he does, mid-wicket
Southee to Dhawan, 1 run, pitched up for a change, squeezed out in front of mid-off for a quick one
Southee to Dhawan, FOUR, 135kph. More of that in-between length. Waist high, Dhawan's taller and smoking these flat-bats through mid-wicket
Southee to Dhawan, no run, low full toss. Stroked through the line, mid-off

Southee to Dhawan, FOUR, tries the leg-cutter. 113kph. But Dhawan's documented problems are with pace, not the lack of it. He spots it early, clears his front leg and hoicks it firmly over a leaping mid-on
Kuggeleijn to Dhawan, 1 run, gets across, whipping it away off the legs behind square
Kuggeleijn to Rohit, 1 run, short, pulled. No, not pulled, whacked. But picks out cow corner in the deep
Kuggeleijn to Rohit, SIX, oh it's just a flick, an airy flick, and he's got THIS OVER. The line straightens on the pads and Rohit's on it - putting it into fine leg for his 100th six in T20Is
Kuggeleijn to Rohit, FOUR, wow, there's nothing late in here. Rohit stays forward, swinging through the arc and smashing the in-the-slot length into long-on, one-bounced
Kuggeleijn to Rohit, no run, 142kph. Hurries in, beating the bat and smashing him flush on the box. Angles in, Rohit's a touch late and well, it's painful
Kuggeleijn to Rohit, no run, 108kph, picks out the cutter late, but then adjusts well, crouching down to sweep it to short fine leg
Ferguson to Dhawan, no run, a bit of an angle going across. Stabbed away to point

Ferguson to Dhawan, 2 runs, 147kph, quick skiddy bouncer. Dhawan is in no control at all with his pull, skewing it away off the toe-end -- but then, it's the powerplay, Southee, despite his best attempts can't reach out, running back from mid-on
Ferguson to Dhawan, no run, 147kph, hurrying in on middle. Dhawan tries a drop-and-run, but Ferguson's pace means there's nothing soft in this
Ferguson to Rohit, 1 run, 148kph, lets him cut, which he does behind point
Ferguson to Rohit, 2 runs, 152kph. Pitched up outside off, driven so damn crisply, wide of mid-off
Ferguson to Rohit, SIX, 143kph. And double of that in the bat speed. Sits up nicely to be carted. And Rohit obliges, with these tiny boundaries letting it drop in the second tier over deep mid-wicket
Kuggeleijn to Dhawan, no run, 106kph, slows it up well, foxing Dhawan to go through early with his hack across the line. The result - an eventual glove to short fine leg
Kuggeleijn to Rohit, 1 run, 141kph, leg-lined. Whipped away cleanly now, fine leg
Kuggeleijn to Rohit, no run, 139kph, skidding in from a shortened length, but Rohit goes for a heave off his hips, only for the ball to comfortably beat the under edge and then find the same hips
Kuggeleijn to Dhawan, 1 run, 140kph, back of a length tummy-lined. Softly dropped past the pitch, runs, hard
Kuggeleijn to Dhawan, 2 runs, 137kph, another off-drive, checking it a touch as he drills it to mid-off, who fumbles, palming it away
Kuggeleijn to Dhawan, no run, 134kph, full, gives it the chance to swing in. But Dhawan commits to a big booming cover drive with zero feet, ending up getting an inside edge onto his pads
Southee to Dhawan, 1 run, 136kph, nipping back in off a back of a length to cramp Dhawan up on the ribs, which he jabs away into square leg
Southee to Rohit, 1 run, 135kph, pitched up, stroked away firmly through the line .. and there's a long-off already. Hmmm
Southee to Rohit, no run, 135kph, good length, off-lined. A forward press, covering the line to defend to cover
Southee to Rohit, no run, back on the full length, and Rohit's back leaving

Southee to Rohit, FOUR, 133kph, quite short. Lots of width. And trust Rohit with his cut shots, getting up tall quickly to ride the bounce and slap it away behind point. Ferguson tries chasing, gives up and then jams his foot into the hoardings
Southee to Rohit, no run, good shape first up -- full, outside off, swinging away. Rohit knows, gets out a stride, leaves

Paterson to Dhoni, 1 run, that seemed to be clearing the fence, but went one bounce to deep mid-wicket, the bottom hand coming into play as he whips the full delivery straight to the fielder. Either side and that would have been a boundary

Paterson to Dhoni, 2 runs, fifty for Dhoni. He certainly comes to the party. Bit of glove love between the two batsmen. Full and outside off, Dhoni does not get hold of the loft and mistimes it in front of long-off, Miller runs forward and dives, makes a half stop. The duo scamper back for the second

Paterson to Dhoni, FOUR, once more not where he intended but Dhoni is one short of a fifty. Full and just short of yorker length, Dhoni swings as hard as possible and the thickish inside edge runs away past short fine leg. 15 off the over already

Paterson to Dhoni, FOUR, full and on the stumps, Dhoni wanted to go over cow corner, but the bat face turns on impact and the shot is dragged over square leg, who is inside the ring, but Dhoni won't mind as the ball hobbled away to the fence

Paterson to Dhoni, SIX, oh Dhoni! How strong is he? A back foot punch for six. Slower short of length delivery outside off, Dhoni stands tall and smacks it with all his might over extra cover, flat and all the way into the ad boardings
Paterson to Manish Pandey, 1 run, missed out there. Good length ball around off, Pandey went a bit too hard on the heave and mistimed it towards mid-wicket, just a single

Chris Morris to Dhoni, no run, good finish. But Morris is frustrated. Sees Dhoni makes room and charge down, spears in the yorker length delivery and beats the inside edge. Klaasen had to dive to his left to glove that. Dot to end

Chris Morris to Dhoni, SIX, dropped! Tough one. But in the modern age, you expect those to be taken. Banged in and Dhoni takes it on, rushed for pace and the spliced pull skies up towards deep mid-wicket. Dala runs to his right and goes reverse cup, very close to the ad cushions, the ball bursts through the hands. He could have judged it better and relayed it to his mate running across from deep square leg
Chris Morris to Manish Pandey, 1 run, now the variation in length, drags it back and cramps up Pandey, knocked with a closed bat face to long-on
Chris Morris to Dhoni, 1 run, races down and kind of yorks himself, squeezed out drive to long-on and he is not happy with himself. Had he stood his ground, that ball would have been right in his arc

Chris Morris to Dhoni, FOUR, small margin for errors. It was the low full toss and Dhoni was standing deep in the crease, crouches a bit to bring those steel like forearms into play, whipped in front of square bisecting deep square leg and deep mid-wicket
Chris Morris to Manish Pandey, 1 run, pinpoint yorker, right in the crease and not much Pandey can do about that, jammed out to long-on
Junior Dala to Dhoni, no run, slower delivery and Dhoni knocks it back to Dala, who ends a fine spell. Accounted for Rohit and Kohli early on and also kept a check on the scoring rate, 4-1-28-2
Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short of length outside off, Pandey stands up and punches to sweeper cover

Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, FOUR, now the premeditation. Pandey knows that Dala is bowling back of a length outside off, he walks across his stumps and then once inside the line, he helps it with a pull/scoop over short fine

Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, no run, tries to repeat the shot but hits it straight to the fielder this time, Dala once more giving room for Pandey, sliced cut to backward point and no single taken as well

Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, FOUR, superb execution. Pandey stands on leg-stump, waits for the length delivery outside off, opens the bat face and carves it over cover-point, sweeper runs across to stop but the dive goes in vain

Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, slower ball bouncer, Pandey sits down and then plays a forehand hook over backward square leg. He has his own unique style and it is effective, two added to the total
Paterson to Manish Pandey, 1 run, full and following a backing away Pandey, drilled to long-on
Paterson to Dhoni, 1 run, back of a length just outside off, Dhoni punches it square and settles with a single to sweeper cover
Paterson to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fuller and around off, Pandey drives it down to long-on
Paterson to Dhoni, 1 run, much better. Short of length and close to the body, Dhoni hops across and tucks it to deep mid-wicket
Paterson to Dhoni, FOUR, can't give room of any sort. Dhoni saw the length short and outside off and he threw the kitchen sink at that, the thickish outside edge runs away to the third man fence

Paterson to Manish Pandey, 5 runs, needless from Morris. Conceded four extra runs. Back of a length and cramping the batsman for space, Pandey somehow bunts it to mid-off and sets off, Morris aims for the bowler's end and with no one backing up, the ball races away
Chris Morris to Manish Pandey, 1 run, very full and on the stumps, Pandey squeezes the flick out to deep mid-wicket
Chris Morris to Dhoni, 1 run, short of length and Dhoni had to get on top of it, does so and turns it to the right of Morris. Pandey is quick to scamper across for the single
Chris Morris to Dhoni, no run, banged in and Dhoni is kept quiet, he was giving the charge but saw the delivery and let it pass. Good thinking by Morris
Chris Morris to Manish Pandey, 1 run, close to yorker length and Pandey squeezes it towards backward point
Chris Morris to Manish Pandey, no run, short of length outside off, Pandey attempts a cheeky steer to third man and misses. Morris robbed the pace off the ball and Pandey was through the shot early

Chris Morris to Manish Pandey, SIX, that is the third six Morris has conceded in his last six balls. And he bowled a maiden before that. Good length delivery right in the slot, Pandey tees up for the mighty swing by clearing his front leg and smashes it into the night sky over deep mid-wicket

Phehlukwayo to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fifty for Pandey. Looked iffy when he came out to bat, but the one over from Shamsi settled him down. Now he has to bat through and help India post a good total. Fuller and outside off, Pandey eases the drive towards sweeper cover and wanted two, but Dhoni declines and it was the right call
Phehlukwayo to Dhoni, 1 run, back of a length on off, slower delivery and Dhoni delays the nudge to short fine
Phehlukwayo to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower delivery sat up for Pandey outside off, slaps it hard and straight to sweeper cover
Phehlukwayo to Dhoni, 1 run, shortens the length and Dhoni rides the bounce to glide it to third man

Phehlukwayo to Dhoni, 2 runs, fuller and outside off, Dhoni emphasis on timing and placing the drive rather than smacking the cover off the leather, the idea worked as the sweeper had some ground to cover and the duo collect two more
Phehlukwayo to Dhoni, 2 runs, rolled his fingers across the ball, Dhoni advances and wrists it off the inner half to long-on, since it was not middled, the pair had time to come back for the second
Smuts to Dhoni, 1 run, shortens the length and Dhoni works it through vacant mid-wicket, retains strike
Smuts to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fired in full and around off, Pandey swipes it along the ground past Dhoni, called for two but the fielder from long-on does well to keep it to a single

Smuts to Manish Pandey, no run, once more Pandey is tad early in leaving the crease, Smuts saw him coming and dragged the length back, flat-batted back to the bowler and Smuts has a shy at the stumps, Pandey back in
Smuts to Dhoni, 1 run, flatter and on the stumps, nurdled backward of square leg, for a single

Smuts to Dhoni, SIX, left-arm spin problems? Who said! That's as clean a strike as you would see. Waits for Smuts to release the ball and then leaves the crease, gets close to the flighted delivery and hammers the loft near the sightscreen
Smuts to Manish Pandey, 1 run, charges down and miscues the loft to long-on, luckily for him it went on the bounce to the fielder. He wanted to go straight, but the drift made him drag it to long-on

Junior Dala to Dhoni, no run, well-directed short delivery. Not many times you see Dhoni getting into a tangle with the short pitched stuff, but he does this time and somehow manages to fend it into the leg-side, the ball lobbed off the shoulder and dropped at the vacant short leg region
Junior Dala to Dhoni, no run, back of a length outside off, Dhoni guides it to point with an open bat face
Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, 1 run, off-cutter on a length, drifted in and Pandey eases it to long-on

Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, FOUR, streaky! But Pandey won't mind. He's keeping the momentum going for India. Dala once again with a bit of extra zip, Pandey is lateon the pull and the top-edge flies down to third man, one bounce four

Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, FOUR, off-pace delivery dropped short, Pandey had a bit of time on hand to adjust to the shot, crouched low and swatted the pull in front of square, beating deep square leg to his left
Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, no run, anticipates Pandey to shimmy down and bangs it short, cramped for space Pandey knocks it back down the wicket
Smuts to Manish Pandey, 1 run, sliding on with the angle, tucked towards short fine leg, Pandey keeps strike

Smuts to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, floated up outside off, Pandey with no footwork places the square drive wide of sweeper cover, opened the bat face at the last instant to get the placement right, two more
Smuts to Dhoni, 1 run, steps out and has to adjust to the drift, does so and nudges it to deep mid-wicket
Smuts to Dhoni, no run, quicker and attacking the stumps, Dhoni knocks it to the right of Smuts
Smuts to Manish Pandey, 1 run, shimmies down and takes it on the full, in an attempt to reach that the bottom hand comes off the bat handle, whipped to widish long-on, just a single
Smuts to Manish Pandey, no run, nice slow from round the wicket, Pandey pats it towards cover

Phehlukwayo to Dhoni, 2 runs, fraction short and around off, too close to play the cut shot, but Dhoni thinks otherwise and goes for it, chops it off the under-edge past the off-stump. Klaasen runs back and keeps it to a couple
Phehlukwayo to Dhoni, no run, full and angled in on off, Dhoni watchfully pushes it to mid-on

Phehlukwayo to Raina, out Lbw!! Appeals and appeals some more before getting a reaction from the umpire. It was an ugly shot from Raina and he has to pay with his wicket. Chooses a very full delivery to play the hoick to the leg-side, shuffled across his stumps and missed it altogether, struck in front of off-stump. Might have gone on and hit the off-pole. Just when the partnership had started to flourish, South Africa have struck. Raina had a word with Pandey and decided against the review. Raina lbw b Phehlukwayo 30(24) [4s-5]

Phehlukwayo to Raina, FOUR, that is trademark Raina. Runs down the wicket to the medium pacer, gives himself some room as he does so and opens up the off-side field, carves the inside out loft over extra cover, couple of bounces and into the fence

Phehlukwayo to Raina, no run, another cross-seam delivery from Phehlukwayo, refuses to bounce and Raina misses the steer to third man. The lack of bounce did him in there and it barely carried to Klaasen
Phehlukwayo to Manish Pandey, 1 run, cramps Pandey for room with a cross-seamer, the right-hander gets into a bit of tangle, but tucks it away awkwardly square on the leg-side
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, 1 run, another short googly turning away from off, Manish Pandey gets back and short-arm pulls that to deep mid-wicket for a single
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, SIX, even flatter outside off, the googly, Manish Pandey drags that over the deep mid-wicket fence with a flat slog sweep
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, SIX, flatter and on a length just outside off, Manish Pandey lays into the slog sweep and deposits that clean over the deep mid-wicket fence for six
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, no run, short outside off, the googly, Manish Pandey carves it without any feet straight to the man at short third man
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, just a tad short on middle and off, Manish Pandey pulls it away with an exaggerated fololw-through and some top-spin away to backward square leg for a couple
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, FOUR, loopy chinaman on middle and a tad too full, Manish Pandey comes inside the line and swat-sweeps it with the turn into the deep square leg fence for four

Paterson to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short ball on the chest, Manish Pandey comes down the track and rotates on his heel into a pull to wide long-on for a single. That was headed for the solar plexus, but he made contact. Good adjustment by the bowler, who saw Pandey coming
Paterson to Manish Pandey, FOUR, short of a length delivery outside off, Manish Pandey makes room and gets it finer than intended to the third man fence for four
Paterson to Raina, 1 run, full delivery on leg and middle, Raina swats a heave to backward square leg for a single
Paterson to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fuller length delivery, driven to Miller at mid-off and who fires in a throw at the non-striker's end. Pandey had given up, and he was gone if he had hit

Paterson to Manish Pandey, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Manish Pandey comes down the wicket and tries to steer it away from the body into the off-side. The leg-cutter, that was, and Manish Pandey was beaten
Paterson to Raina, 1 run, good length ball outside off, Raina somehow gets on the back foot and squeezes it out into the off-side as they scramble through for a single

Shamsi to Manish Pandey, no run, tossed up on an enticing length outside off, Manish Pandey stretches forward but doesn't read the chinaman, tries to swat-drive it towards cover but manages it get it off the inside half back to the bowler
Shamsi to Raina, leg byes, 1 run, the googly, good thinking, but on leg-stump, Raina misses the flick and it trundles into the on-side as they sneak a leg-bye
Shamsi to Raina, no run, the orthodox chinaman again outside off, Raina chops it off the back foot towards cover
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, 1 run, back of a length and flatter, clipped off the back foot to backward square leg for a single
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, loopy delivery on off, Pandey swats it with an open stance towards deep square leg as there is some good teamwork at the boundary to cut it off
Shamsi to Raina, 1 run, just a tad short outside off, the normal chinaman, Raina crouches low and carves it away square of the wicket for a single as the man in the deep cleans up

Duminy to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, loopy delivery on off, Manish Pandey swat-flicks it to deep mid-wicket as Dala dives to his left to make an athletic save at the boundary to restrict the batsman to a couple
Duminy to Manish Pandey, wide, down leg side, Manish Pandey overbalances and the keeper knocks off the bails. Not out. He never left the crease
Duminy to Raina, 1 run, good length ball on middle, Raina stretches forward to get to the pitch and nurdles it to backward square leg for a single
Duminy to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tossed up on off-stump from round the wicket, Manish Pandey gets across and nudges it to long-on for a single
Duminy to Raina, 1 run, full delivery on middle and leg, clipped away to short mid-wicket for a quick single
Duminy to Manish Pandey, 1 run, lots of turn on a length outside off, Pandey gets back and short-arm jabs it towards long-on for a single
Duminy to Raina, 1 run, loopy delivery outside off, Raina comes forward and check-drives it to long-off for a single

Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, no run, back of a length delivery again just outside off, Manish Pandey gets back and watchfully plays it late towards cover. Wicket-maiden for Dala. More specifically Kohli-wicket-maiden for Dala.
Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, tapped towards cover point off the back foot
Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, no run, fuller length delivery just outside off, bunted down to cover

Junior Dala to Kohli, out Caught by Klaasen!! Would you believe it? Back of a length delivery on off-stump, straightening off the seam and climbs steeply, Kohli plays beside the line and commits to the line too early, gets it off the glove through to the keeper. Massive wicket for SA. First single digit score for Kohli in coloured clothing in this tour. Kohli c Klaasen b Junior Dala 1(5)
Junior Dala to Kohli, no run, good length delivery in the channel outside off, Kohli steers it from the crease to backward point with an angled bat
Junior Dala to Kohli, no run, back of a length delivery on off, Kohli comes across and then goes back to get behind the line and defends it solidly off the back foot
Duminy to Raina, no run, good length ball fired in flat on off, a hint of turn, and Raina steers it off the front foot towards cover-point
Duminy to Raina, no run, fired on a length and on leg-stump, Raina misses the back foot glance
Duminy to Kohli, 1 run, flatter and full on middle and leg, clipped away to long-on for a quick single
Duminy to Kohli, no run, loopy delivery on middle, Kohli reaches out and whip-drives it to mid-off

Duminy to Dhawan, out Caught by Behardien!! Full-toss, Dhawan comes down the wicket and just chips it to Behardien at mid-on as the South African skipper manages to buy the wicket of the imperious-looking Dhawan, who can't believe he hasn't managed to clear the in-field. Duminy certainly thought he would bowl off-spin to the two left-handers. That logic hasn't gotten him the wicket; it is sheer luck! Dhawan c Behardien b Duminy 24(14) [4s-3 6s-2]
Duminy to Dhawan, FOUR, dropped short just outside off, Dhawan clears his front leg and clouts that pull flat to the deep mid-wicket fence for four
Paterson to Raina, FOUR, another good length ball but straying down leg side, Raina tickles it away with a flick to the fine leg fence for four
Paterson to Raina, FOUR, full delivery on middle, whipped away to deep mid-wicket for four
Paterson to Raina, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off , Raina makes room, comes down the track and flat-bats it to Behardein
Paterson to Raina, FOUR, short and fractionally wide, Raina backs away and gives himself some room, steers it away to square third man for four. Excellent placement and timing
Paterson to Raina, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Raina shuffles across and taps it back to the bowler
Chris Morris to Dhawan, no run, full delivery pitching marginally outside leg, Dhawan misses the exaggerated flick and it thuds into his pads. There is a stifled appeal, but they know it isn't out
Chris Morris to Dhawan, SIX, wow! Massive! Short ball again and Dhawan twists his torso again to use the pace and lofts over to the fine leg fence for six! Into the grass-banks
Chris Morris to Dhawan, no run, good length ball on leg-stump, Dhawan misses the glance and it goes through to the keeper after deflecting off his pad
Paterson to Raina, no run, back of a length delivery on mdidle, defended back to the bowler off the back foot
Chris Morris to Dhawan, SIX, short delivery again, and Dhawan gets into position quickly to deposit the pull over the deep backward square leg fence for six! Dhawan on a roll here!

Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, short delivery on middle, Dhawan twist-pulls that to the deep mid-wicket fence for four. He was a little late on that and it came off the top-half, but these bats... the entire thing is the middle

Junior Dala to Raina, 2 runs, fuller length delivery on middle and off, Raina comes into a half-forward stance and push-drives it straight down the ground, but the moisture in the surface slows it down and the fielder cuts it off and restricts them to two
Junior Dala to Raina, no run, short of a length delivery leg and middle, Raina hops and taps it to the man at cover-point

Junior Dala to Raina, FOUR, edged and wide of a diving second slip! Back of a length delivery straightening a tad, and Raina is stuck on the back foot, pokes tentatively and gets a thick outside edge towards the third man fence for four
Junior Dala to Raina, 2 runs, another slow-ish delivery on a length outside off, Raina comes forward and steers it into the gap between point and cover for a quick couple
Junior Dala to Raina, no run, good length delivery on off and middle, Raina taps it to cover and takes off for the run, then rightly decides against it

Junior Dala to Rohit, out Lbw!! That's plumb, good length ball on off, seaming in sharply and the moisture making the ball skid. Rohit is late in getting the bat down and his usual lazy elegance works against him now. Strikes him in front of middle and leg (as perceived by the naked eye) and that looked plumb. HawkEye shows it to be crashing into leg-stump. Rohit lbw b Junior Dala 0(1)
Chris Morris to Dhawan, no run, low full toss on off-stump, Dhawan steers it to the man at cover-point with an angled bat after walking down the wicket
Chris Morris to Dhawan, no run, back of a length delivery in the channel outside off, straightening off the seam and left alone by Dhawan

Chris Morris to Dhawan, no run, inswinger on middle on a good length, Dhawan tries a cross-batted lofted flick and gets an inside edge onto the pad which saved him. Another appeal, and turned down again

Chris Morris to Dhawan, no run, the wobbly seam delivery on a back of a length on leg-stump, Dhawan heaves across the line for a pull and misses by a long way. A stifled appeal, but it was a little high
Chris Morris to Dhawan, no run, good length ball on middle and off, Dhawan is hurried onto the back foot again and gets it off an inside edge onto the pad and it trundles into the off-side

Chris Morris to Dhawan, no run, Morris appeals, and Dhawan has been given out LBW! Dhawan reviews. It is a fair delivery. Snicko says there is an inside-edge, and the decision will be overturned. Dhawan is not out! Coming to the ball - it was a back of a length delivery on middle, seaming in sharply from over the wicket, and Dhawan gets cramped for room as he tries to defend off the back foot. Gets an inside edge onto the pad
Unadkat to Duminy, SIX, launched over long-on to get South Africa level! 1-1. Full pitched ball, right in the slot, and it disappears. The fireworks go off in the rain

Unadkat to Duminy, SIX, here's the hit, and here's the game for South Africa. Can't lose it from here. It slipped out of Unadkat's fingers and ended up being a pretty high full toss. Duminy swings it into the deep square leg stands
Unadkat to Behardien, 1 run, another off-cutter, this one's short and wide. Behardien slashes it off the edge to third man. SA one hit away really. Can they get that hit in the 10 balls left?
Unadkat to Behardien, wide, full and very wide outside off, left alone. Bonus run
Unadkat to Behardien, 2 runs, slower off-cutter, Behardien heaves and drags it off the inside half wide of deep square leg. Easy two

SN Thakur to Duminy, FOUR, ugly slog, it comes off the inside edge and runs away for four. Duminy lost his shape looking to hoick this off-cutter and was a whisker away from chopping it back onto his leg-stump
SN Thakur to Behardien, 1 run, slower short ball around off, Behardien drags his pull to deep square leg. Bhuvneshwar gets lucky there. It had slipped through his hands, but his foot was behind it
SN Thakur to Duminy, 1 run, carved off a thick outside edge in front of Bhuvi at deep point. It goes on the bounce to him, falling just short
SN Thakur to Behardien, 1 run, slower ball outside off, driven to mid-off
SN Thakur to Behardien, 2 runs, back of a length delivery on middle and leg, Behardien shuffles inside the line of it and tickles it to the right of fine leg. Scurries back for two
SN Thakur to Duminy, 1 run, short of length around the chest, 130kph, Duminy smacks the pull shot to deep square leg
Bhuvneshwar to Duminy, 1 run, flicked off the pads to deep mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Duminy, no run, slower loopy bouncer, Duminy ducks underneath. Well bowled
Bhuvneshwar to Duminy, 2 runs, slower ball on off, Duminy flicks it wide of long-on. Two more. Doing it easily now
Bhuvneshwar to Behardien, 1 run, steers this through point for one
Bhuvneshwar to Duminy, 1 run, clipped away through mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Duminy, 2 runs, back of a length delivery outside off, chops it through point. It's been placed wide of sweeper cover, so they come back for two

Chahal to Behardien, 2 runs, dropped! Chahal is not forgetting this day in a hurry. An absolute nightmare. He walks away dejected. Flighted leg-break, Behardien chips it straight back. It's above head high, but it's one of the more regulation overhead catches. But it pops out of Chahal's fingertips
Chahal to Behardien, wide, very wide outside off, wided
Chahal to Behardien, no run, leg-break on a length, pushed through the air, defended
Chahal to Behardien, SIX, slog-sweep for six! Grounds his back knee and hits it clean into the deep mid-wicket stands

Chahal to Behardien, no run, so ugly from Behardien. What was that even? The ball has pitched outside leg, and he's left it alone like Chahal's some off-spinner. Of course the ball will turn back in. Then he somehow catches the ball between his two legs

Chahal to Duminy, leg byes, 1 run, really well bowled. Sees Duminy dance down, slows it up and pulls the length back. Duminy is nowhere near to the pitch of it. Eventually, it's his pad which saves him from being stumped

Chahal to Duminy, FOUR, this is just not his day. Should it have been Raina? Doesn't matter now as Dhoni groans with a big "Naaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa". Short ball, width on offer too, Duminy slaps it through extra-cover
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, short of length delivery on leg, pulled away awkwardly to fine leg

Hardik Pandya to Miller, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Big wicket. The dangerous Miller is gone early. Pandya rushes him with a short ball, there's good height on it too and the top-edge balloons straight to fine leg. Miller took his eyes off the pull there. He was surprised by it. This game is on. Miller c SN Thakur b Hardik Pandya 5(6)
Hardik Pandya to Miller, 2 runs, stuck on the crease to a length ball, his bottom hand comes to his rescue as he wrists it away wide of deep mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, low full toss on leg, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Miller, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, dabbed in front of backward point
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, back of a length delivery on middle and leg, clipped through mid-wicket
Unadkat to Duminy, 1 run, back of a length delivery on off, clipped through backward square
Unadkat to Miller, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, stabbed in front of point for a quick single
Unadkat to Miller, wide, sharp short ball, Miller lets it sail over. Too high

Unadkat to Duminy, 1 run, slower ball at the stumps, nudged beside the pitch for a quick single. Brilliant from Unadkat as he gets to the ball in a flash. He would have caught Miller well short with a direct-hit. Not to be
Unadkat to Miller, 1 run, good length ball outside off, patted wide of point
Unadkat to Miller, no run, full ball on off, clipped to mid-wicket

Unadkat to Klaasen, out Caught by Dhoni!! Unadkat's off-cutter has done it for India. Is it too late though? Time will tell. To India's great relief however, Klaasen's carnage has come to an end. He made room looking to slog this over mid-wicket, but the ball just straightened a tad and that was enough to take the edge to Dhoni. Huge cry of "Come on" from Unadkat. Klaasen c Dhoni b Unadkat 69(30) [4s-3 6s-7]

Chahal to Duminy, SIX, pretty wide of off again, this time Duminy gets a proper hold. He bends across, fetches it, and muscles it over deep mid-wicket. 23 off the over. Chahal's gone for 51 in his three overs
Chahal to Duminy, no run, nicely bowled. Gets it very wide of off. Duminy can't lay bat to it
Chahal to Klaasen, 1 run, not short enough this time. Klaasen thought that it was there to be pulled, and he's lucky to only under-edge it onto his pad
Chahal to Klaasen, FOUR, short again, punished again. A reverse-pull from Klaasen through backward point. Premeditated shot, poor bowling
Chahal to Klaasen, SIX, six more! Klaasen pats the back of his bat repeatedly. Probably trying to cool it down. It's on fire. Chahal drops it short and he's been smoked over deep mid-wicket

Chahal to Klaasen, SIX, and the leg-spinner continues to be smacked! The method of flighting the ball isn't working today, and the game is running away from India. He's gone round the wicket this time, Klaasen moves to the leg-side to get in the line of it and then slog-sweeps it over mid-wicket

Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 2 runs, Pandya is absolutely livid. He slams the ball down in disgust as Unadkat concedes two at deep mid-wicket. Kohli is giving him a mouthful too. This ball was flicked wide of him, and maybe he was slow getting to it. Good running
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, 1 run, pretty full, following Klaasen down leg. He hits it along the ground to mid-off
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, no run, now dances down and swings hard, but Pandya is clever here. He bowls this pretty wide of off, and beats Klaasen's outside edge. Took it out of his arc
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, no run, cramped for room. Was looking to carve it through the covers, gets an inside edge onto pad. Ball rolls to Dhoni

Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, FOUR, fifty off just 22 balls! Klaasen's maiden T20I fifty. He swings his bat in celebration. It seemed that he was rushed by this short ball, but he somehow got it over short fine leg
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, back of length off-cutter outside off, chopped down to third man
Chahal to Duminy, 1 run, loops it up wide of off, Duminy drives to long-off
Chahal to Klaasen, 1 run, uses his feet but gets a little too close to the ball, can't get any elevation. Drilled to long-on

Chahal to Klaasen, SIX, Klaasen is really hurting India here. He's taking Chahal on, and taking him to the cleaners. Now the reverse-sweep. Gets a low full toss and slaps it over backward point. It's gone all the way
Chahal to Duminy, 1 run, bowls this full and pretty wide outside off, Duminy drives to Bhuvi at cover. Bit sloppy with the throw, but they decide against the extra run. There was someone backing up
Chahal to Klaasen, 1 run, backs away again, Chahal shortens his length and is thwacked to long-off

Chahal to Klaasen, SIX, woah, what a shot! The one facet of his batting most people thought was lacking. But he's dispelled all that. Makes some room, goes with the turn and lofts it beautifully over extra-cover. Magnificent inside-out hit
SN Thakur to Klaasen, 1 run, heaves at a length delivery and gets an inside edge towards deep mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Duminy, 1 run, nurdles the length delivery around the corner and takes an easy single. It was a full length delivery on middle and leg
SN Thakur to Klaasen, 1 run, full in length on middle and leg, Klaasen plays across the line with a heave and gets an inside edge that rolls down to fine leg
SN Thakur to Duminy, 1 run, short of a length outside off, cuts it past point and gets a single, does Duminy

SN Thakur to Duminy, no run, another appeal! This time around it's for a caught behind. There was a sound there but that came off the pads, yet again. Duminy was cramped for room as he tried to work that short delivery to the leg side. Came off the pads and went straight to Dhoni.
SN Thakur to Duminy, no run, shortish in length and outside off, Duminy knocks that off his back foot towards cover

Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, FOUR, boundary to end the over. Just what the doctor ordered for the hosts. Short of a length around off again, Klaasen picks the length early and thrashes it over mid-wicket. Just as we were thinking Pandya is bowling so well, he concedes a boundary. Jinxed by few of my colleagues in here
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, 2 runs, full length delivery on middle and leg, Klaasen whips it down to long-on for a couple of runs. A strong bottom hand on that shot
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, pushes the length delivery to extra-cover and gets off the strike

Hardik Pandya to Duminy, no run, appeal for a caught behind by India, but that clearly came off the pads. Short of a length delivery around off, Duminy looks to flick that away wristily before the ball clips his pads and goes through to Dhoni. That appeal was for an lbw, scratch that. That was pitching down the leg side
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, 1 run, short in length and just outside off, Klaasen plays that late and steers it down to third man

Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, wide, yes, he does. Comes down the wicket but Pandya bangs it short, goes past the batsman's helmet but the leg umpire signals that was above his head. Harsh call on the bowler
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, moves inside the ling and pulls the shortish deilvery down to fine leg
Chahal to Duminy, 1 run, darted on the pads, Duminy tucks it in front of square leg and retains strike with a single
Chahal to Klaasen, 1 run, eases the loopy delivery down to long-on after playing couple of aggressive shots against the leggie

Chahal to Klaasen, 2 runs, loopy delivery around off, Klaasen is on his knee as he goes for a slog sweep. Gets a top edge that flies down to third man, very fine though. Could have easily gone anywhere, luck favoring the batsman

Chahal to Klaasen, SIX, there's no stopping Klaasen today. He's looking in sublime touch. That's his third maximum in a matter of 10 deliveries. Waits for the tossed up delivery and smokes it over mid-wicket for half a dozen
Chahal to Duminy, 1 run, a lot of flight on that and Duminy has plenty of time to charge down the wicket and drive it down to long-on
Chahal to Klaasen, 1 run, floated on middle and leg, Klaasen whips it towards deep mid-wicket and gets to the other end
