Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, 1 run, edged but safe! Short and wide outside off, Klaasen throws his bat at it and gets an outside edge that flies to third man. Just falls ahead of Thakur who's shielding the boundary there. Should have gone for the catch
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, leg byes, 1 run, short in length and coming into the batsman, surprises Duminy who gets hit on the thigh pad as he fails to connect his tuck
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, 1 run, pacy length delivery around off, Klaasen moves away and knocks it front of mid-off. The fielder is near the circle, hence finds it difficult to save the single
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, 1 run, turns the shortish delivery to the on-side and gets off the strike
Hardik Pandya to Duminy, no run, that short delivery skid on to beat the batsman. Duminy attempted a pull shot but got beaten due to the lack of bounce

Hardik Pandya to Duminy, FOUR, that's a warm-up delivery. Short in length and the line is outside off, Duminy latches onto it and chops his cut. Beats the fielder at backward point and finds the fence

Unadkat to Klaasen, no run, slowish and outside off, quite similar to the two deliveries Unadkat bowled earlier in the over. The lack of bounce gets the better of the batsman, for the third time in the over...

Unadkat to Klaasen, SIX, that's the second biggie by Klaasen. Another short delivery that gets the treatment it deserved. Stays put and pummels that over the cow corner, does Klaasen. Also that big hit brings up the 50 for South Africa
Unadkat to Klaasen, no run, another slow and low delivery outside off, leaves Klaasen clueless again. Can't bring his bat down in time as it misses his bottom edge
Unadkat to Klaasen, no run, change of pace in that and keeps a tad low outside off, Klaasen tries to defend that, gets beaten all ends up

Unadkat to Klaasen, SIX, that's what he's here to do! South Africa need someone to take charge and Klaasen's the man, I guess. It's a short of a length delivery around off and Klaasen picks the bones out of it. Connects his pull and sends it soaring over the mid-wicket fence for half a dozen
Unadkat to Klaasen, no run, short and just outside the off-stump channel, Klaasen pokes at it, fails to make contact though

SN Thakur to Hendricks, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! So, both openers are back in the pavilion. Looks to go after a short delivery but fails to get the desired timing on that shot. The ball skies up towards deep mid-wicket where Hardik Pandya pouches it safely. Not the ideal start South Africa were looking for in such a challenging run chase. It was the knuckle ball that fooled Hendricks. Hendricks c Hardik Pandya b SN Thakur 26(17) [4s-5]
SN Thakur to Hendricks, wide, bangs it short but well outside off, no need to play at those. Hendricks does rightly so

SN Thakur to Hendricks, FOUR, edges are flying! Goes hard at a length delivery on middle. Gets a thick top edge as he attempts a pull and evades the man at short third man. Not what the batsman was looking for, but the end result is what matters. He'll take that
SN Thakur to Duminy, 1 run, mistimes his pull towards mid-on and calls for a single. There's a shy at the bowler's end that doesn't connect

SN Thakur to Duminy, 2 runs, good running between the wickets! Short of a length around off, Duminy swivels in order to pull and ends up getting a bottom edge to that. The ball crawls towards deep square leg and the batsmen add two more runs to the tally
SN Thakur to Duminy, 2 runs, straying on the pads, Duminy glances it away to deep square leg and gets two more

SN Thakur to Duminy, FOUR, stand and deliver! Duminy has announced his arrival to the crease in style. Gets hold of the length delivery and clubs it over mid-on. One bounce over the fence and the southpaw is off the mark in style
Unadkat to Hendricks, no run, keeps low and goes through Hendricks' defence outside off

Unadkat to Smuts, out Caught by Raina!! What kind of a shot was that? Dances down the wicket and ends up just offering a nothing shot. That comes off his leading edge, balloons up towards cover-point where Raina comes running in and latches onto that. The batsman got surprised by the slower delivery on that occasion, good change in pace by the left handed pacer. Smuts c Raina b Unadkat 2(9)
Unadkat to Smuts, no run, short of a length around off, Smuts slaps it horizontally but can't beat the fielder at mid-on
Unadkat to Hendricks, 1 run, hops in his crease as he chops the shortish delivery towards point. The fielder there puts in a dive but can only manage to get some pace off the ball

Unadkat to Hendricks, FOUR, two in two for the opener! Keeps his head still and slaps the length delivery through the gap at point this time around. Was well outside off and asking to be hit. Does well on that occasion to put that away to the boundary yet again

Unadkat to Hendricks, FOUR, welcomes Unadkat into the attack with a boundary, does Hendricks. Full length delivery that's around off, Hendricks carves it aerially and over point. Has enough on it to take it away to the fence
Bhuvneshwar to Smuts, no run, drags his length back on this delivery as Smuts knocks it back to the bowler from within the crease
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, 1 run, steers the short of a length delivery and beats the fielder at point

Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, FOUR, that's slammed! Half-volley on middle and leg, Hendricks does miss out on the gift and pummels it over the fielder at mid-on. On a few bounces and into the fence she goes
Bhuvneshwar to Smuts, 1 run, another full length delivery that stays low, Smuts does well to make contact and flick it to the on-side. Gets off the strike with that
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, 1 run, bowled on a length and on middle and leg, Hendricks flicks it aerially over square leg and scurries across

Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, FOUR, first one of the innings! Width on offer and Hendricks pounces on it. Carves the length delivery over backward point and beats the man at third man who makes a mess of it
SN Thakur to Smuts, no run, shortish delivery outside off, Smuts thinks of playing a pull-shot but yet again he decides to leave it alone. Quite similar to earlier in the over
SN Thakur to Smuts, no run, that kept low. Pitches around the off-stump channel and keeps low as Smuts gets beaten. The batsman was too late in getting his bat down in time

SN Thakur to Hendricks, 1 run, another quick run here. Hendricks knocks the length delivery in front of the fielder at mid-on and calls for a single. His partner obliges as the pair completes the run without no harm
SN Thakur to Smuts, 1 run, length delivery on middle and leg, Smuts nurdles in front of mid-wicket and takes a quick run

SN Thakur to Smuts, no run, Smuts was in two minds there and decides to withdraw from his shot, at the last moment. Shortish in length around off, thinks of attempting a pull shot, but then drops his bat and lets it through
SN Thakur to Hendricks, 1 run, starts off with a short delivery and aims at the batsman's hips. Hendricks does well to tuck it off his hips and get a single as the ball rolls back to the keeper

Bhuvneshwar to Smuts, no run, short and wide just outside the off-stump channel, Smuts punches that firmly but can't pierce the gap on the off-side. South Africa conceded nothing in their first over, India concede only one. Quite a familiar start to both innings
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, 1 run, knocks the length delivery in front of cover-point and gets across to the other end in a jiffy, does Hendricks
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, no run, beaten! That almost got his outside edge. Full in length and swinging away a tad, beats Hendricks who pokes at it tentatively
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, no run, back of a length around the off-stump channel, Hendricks stays put and blocks it firmly
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, no run, short of a length and outside off, throws his bat it but the ball skids on and beats his outside edge. Good start by Bhuvi this
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, no run, swing on offer straightaway. Full and swinging into the batsman, Hendricks looks to flick gets an inside edge onto the pads

Rubel to Rohit, out Rohit Run Out!! Excellent last over from Rubel Hossain. Just four off the over. He executes another yorker superbly and Rohit can't get underneath it. Smacked back at the bowler, who fails to gather it in the first attempt. However, quickly gobbles it and takes off the bails at the bowler's end. The duo, went for a non-existent run and Rohit gets out off the last ball of the innings. Rohit run out (Rubel) 89(61) [4s-5 6s-5]
Rubel to Karthik, 1 run, another good ball! In-angling yorker length ball, Karthik opens his bat-face to squeeze it through covers
Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, he can't get to the 3-digit mark. Full and tailing in, Rohit can only get an inside edge onto his pad trying to hack it over the mid-wicket region
Rubel to Karthik, 1 run, length ball on the stumps, jabbed to the right of long-on

Rubel to Rohit, leg byes, 1 run, pacy in-angler, Rohit is cramped for room and fails to make connection. Gets hit on the thigh and the ball rolls towards backward point. They scamper through for a run

Rubel to Raina, out Caught by Soumya Sarkar!! In the air and taken! Raina perishes trying to play the big shot. A length ball on the pads, was there to be hit. Raina crouched low and played the pick-up flick shot. Made decent contact, but didn't get the required elevation. Soumya Sarkar runs across from deep mid-wicket and takes a good catch in front of the boundary rope. Raina c Soumya Sarkar b Rubel 47(30) [4s-5 6s-2]
Mustafizur to Raina, 1 run, inside-edges to square leg trying to heave. Off the splice
Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, chips down to take it on the full and then follows it up with a miscued drive to long-off

Mustafizur to Rohit, FOUR, four more! And that brings up the 100-run stand! A full toss outside off, asking to be punished. Rohit stays leg-side of the ball and opens his bat-face at the last moment to run it down to third man. Got it fine of the short third man fielder
Mustafizur to Rohit, FOUR, shot! Full toss with loads of width outside off, Rohit moves across slightly in his crease and elevates it over backward point. Top shot
Mustafizur to Raina, 1 run, flat-batted pull to long-on
Mustafizur to Raina, no run, full ball outside off, Raina can't reach out for that

Abu Hider to Rohit, SIX, doesn't quite time it as good as he would have liked it to, but Rohit's got enough wood on that. A full toss, Rohit bludgeoned it over cow corner. High and handsome. And make that 75 sixes by Rohit Sharma in T20Is, the most sixes by an Indian in the format. He's gone past Yuvraj Singh
Abu Hider to Raina, 1 run, in-angling fuller length ball on the stumps, Raina mistimes the drive off the inside part of the bat to long-on
Abu Hider to Raina, SIX, now, it's Raina's turn. Spots the slower ball quickly, waits on the back foot and pulls it powerfully over mid-wicket. Off the meat of the bat
Abu Hider to Rohit, 1 run, good comeback! Slips in the perfect yorker, Rohit jabs his bat down at the right time and manages to squeeze it towards short fine leg off the inside edge
Abu Hider to Rohit, SIX, short ball and that's been dispatched. Just a small stride across with his front foot and then pummells the pull over deep mid-wicket. Fetch that!
Abu Hider to Raina, 1 run, slower ball wide of off, Raina waits for the ball and slashes it through point
Mustafizur to Raina, 1 run, shortish outside off, a backing away Raina scythes it to sweeper cover. 14 runs came off that Mustafizur over
Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, pacy pitched up delivery outside off, Rohit, with a huge back-lift, smashes the drive down to long-off. Just a single

Mustafizur to Rohit, SIX, into the stands and that's been taken by a spectator! 121kph cutter from a short of length, Rohit gets down on a knee and clouts it over deep square leg with a massive swing of the bat
Mustafizur to Raina, 1 run, again Raina moves leg-side and this time punches the back of a length ball to sweeper cover
Mustafizur to Raina, FOUR, backs away a long way does Raina to go over covers. The length was on the shorter side. Trims the outside edge and flies fine of short third man

Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, leading edge goes up in the air, but falls in the no-man's land. Rohit was a touch early to close his bat-face against this cutter on leg-stump line. The ball rolls to long-off and Rohit has to settle with a single

Mahmudullah to Rohit, 1 run, no flight on this short of length delivery from Mahmudullah. Just darted across the right-hander, Rohit goes hard against it and loses his shape a bit. A mistimed slap towards deep extra cover
Mahmudullah to Raina, 1 run, short of length, Raina pulls it and deep mid-wicket runs across to his right to stop that
Mahmudullah to Rohit, 1 run, saw the batter step down and shortened his length, Rohit miscues the heave to long-on
Mahmudullah to Raina, 1 run, driven all along the carpet to deep extra cover

Mahmudullah to Raina, FOUR, the partnership between Raina and Rohit is now 52! Finds the gap beautifully does Raina! Wasn't too short, Raina went deep in his crease and despite not being in a great position, managed to pull it away between long-on and deep mid-wicket
Mahmudullah to Rohit, 1 run, starts with a quick and flat ball wide of off from round the wicket, cut away to sweeper cover
Rubel to Raina, 2 runs, another low full toss, wristy clip through mid-wicket for a brace. 13 runs came off the over
Rubel to Raina, FOUR, just a chip and Raina collects another boundary. A full toss from Rubel and Raina crouches low to lift it over mid-on. There's no one stopping that

Rubel to Raina, FOUR, sloppy! Got to feel for the bowler. A well-directed bouncer from Rubel, Raina was backing away and was in no position to play the pull shot. Persists with the shot and gets a top-edge that goes fine. Well, Fizz at fine leg, has made an absolute mess of it. He went all around it and in the end the ball goes over the boundary rope. Rubel is rightly miffed
Rubel to Raina, no run, another full ball, Raina exposes all his stumps by backing away. Stroked away, but straight to the fielder at extra cover
Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, in the blockhole, once again Rohit takes his front leg out of his way and jams it down to long-on

Rubel to Rohit, 2 runs, tries to bowl a yorker and ends up delivering a low full toss, Rohit clears his left leg to whip it to the right of long-on. A fumble there allows the batters to easily come back for the second
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, another dot to end the over. Raina comes down the track, but is nowhere close to the pitch of the ball. Tries to work it away and inside-edges it onto his pad
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, too close to cut and Raina ends up chopping it to backward point
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, FOUR, now he goes downtown and makes good contact. A dance down the track and then a chip over the bowler's head. Long-off can't cut it off
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, SIX, Raina breaks the shackles with a six. He gets down on a knee to slog-sweep this in-drifter over mid-wicket for a maximum

Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, catch it is the cry, but the ball fell well in front of the fielder. This off-break may held onto the surface a tad, Raina was early into his push and the ball goes to the cover fielder on the bounce
Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, 1 run, no timing on the lofted shot. Flighted offie on middle and leg, Rohit toe-ends it to long-on
Abu Hider to Rohit, 1 run, full and just outside off, a hammering drive down to long-off
Abu Hider to Raina, 1 run, slower ball outside off, a backing away Raina cuts it to sweeper cover

Abu Hider to Rohit, 1 run, fifty for Rohit Sharma! His 13th in T20Is. Personally, he needed this knock. Gets to the milestone by dabbing a shortish ball square of the wicket on the off-side. Just a raise of the bat, and he gets a tap on the back from Raina
Abu Hider to Rohit, FOUR, swept away for a boundary! Superbly done by the Indian captain. Full and angling down leg, Rohit gets down on a knee and sweeps it over short fine leg

Abu Hider to Raina, 1 run, a direct hit at the keeper's end would have made things interesting. Wide-ish full ball outside off, Raina had to reach out as he stayed leg-side of the ball. Manages to mistime it off the toe end with a horizontal blade to the left of backward point
Abu Hider to Rohit, 1 run, a low full toss from round the wicket, Rohit drives it firmly to long-on

Mustafizur to Raina, no run, optimistic appeal for lbw from the bowler, rightly turned down by the umpire. Tweaks in from a short of length and cramps up Raina for any room. The left-hander doesn't account for the movement and gets beaten on the inside edge. Got hit high on the pad and the impact was on leg-stump. Was surely going down, with height being another factor. Just four off the over
Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, a bad ball, but Rohit can't put it away. Short ball down the leg-side, pulled off the glove to short fine leg. Just a single
Mustafizur to Rohit, 2 runs, on the ribs, tucked through square leg
Mustafizur to Rohit, no run, beaten! Cutter from a back of a length that goes away from the right-hander, Rohit doesn't pick it and misses it trying to dab it behind square
Mustafizur to Rohit, no run, no room on offer for Rohit to free his arms as he walks down the track. Just a push back to the bowler
Mustafizur to Raina, 1 run, 130kph length ball jagging in around off and middle, Raina hops across and nudges it to the left of the bowler. A single towards mid-on
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, 2 runs, darted in full on middle and leg, mworked through mid-wicket for a couple

Nazmul Islam to Rohit, SIX, much-needed for India. Good use of the feet from Rohit. Waltzes down the track to get close to the pitch and then follows it up with a thumping lofted on-drive over wide long-on. Sails into the stands
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, no run, drifting in towards leg, Rohit comes forward to push, doesn't time well and the bowler is quick to go to his right and mop it up
Nazmul Islam to Raina, 1 run, shorter in length, Raina moves across to nudge it behind square leg
Nazmul Islam to Raina, no run, turning in from a short of length, Raina jabs it to mid-wicket
Nazmul Islam to Raina, no run, juicy high full toss and Raina pushes it straight back to the bowler. Misses out on a freebie
Rubel to Raina, 1 run, almost holes out to fine leg first ball. That short ball again. Didn't read it early, swiveled and played at it late. One bounce to the fielder

Rubel to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Middle stump uprooted.. That's quite the ball to get an in-form Dhawan. Outswinging yorker from over the wicket to the left-hander, Dhawan was making some room, has to makeshift with an urgent dig-the-ball-out but really can't. Few can be upto it, so good was Rubel here. And courtesy that, Bangladesh have a wicket, finally. Dhawan b Rubel 35(27) [4s-5 6s-1]
Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, good ball on a near yorker length, Rohit is making a move down leg and has to check the squeeze-out to long-on

Rubel to Dhawan, 1 run, now Dhawan will hit Rubel through mid-wicket. He's made up his mind. Slower ball that before, Dhawan takes his front leg out and gives it a good heave-ho against the angle, only to find mid-wicket again
Rubel to Dhawan, no run, late onto this 140ks short ball angled across him. Pulls awkwardly and finds mid-wicket with the placement

Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, another big hit attempted, another near fail. Steps out and looks to heave it over cow corner. Inside-edged to the left of Mushfiq, the keeper. Stumps hit but Dhawan had made it in
Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, no run, allows the ball to come right upto him and pushes it back to the bowler. Not much room to work
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, 1 run, opens his stance front-on to cover the line of this ball going down leg. And punches it to deep mid-wicket
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, no run, blocked out from the crease

Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, 1 run, flat skidder on leg-stump, Dhawan looks slightly late on that glance. Mushfiq thinks it's hit the pad but umpire thinks otherwise. Just some inside edge on that to backward square leg
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, 1 run, rocks back and plays against the turn to long-on
Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, 1 run, reverse-sweeps it from a off and middle line through point
Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, no run, lovely dip this time, Rohit counters it with a checked flat-footed punch to cover
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, flicked off the pads to backward square leg
Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, 1 run, bottom-handed drive through covers for a single
Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, wide, full ball drifting down. Beats Rohit's glance-sweep but that's no win
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, quick delivery angled into the pads, Dhawan sneaks a single to backward square leg
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, FOUR, easily rocks back, deep into the crease, and punishes this short ball with a pull round the corner
Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, 1 run, pinches a single to long-on
Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, no run, Dhawan can't stay put. Steps out and inside-edges it onto his pad
Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, no run, misses the sweep here. Loud appeal but it looked like the impact was outside off. Deflected off the forearm onto the pad, which is a long way down the crease
Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, no run, blocked towards mid-wicket

Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, FOUR, Liton Das has dropped Dhawan. Use of the feet but Dhawan got too close to the pitch of the ball. Bit of a miscued top-edge, Liton covers some ground from deep mid, stretches to his side one-handed but can't get to the ball. And embarrassingly allows it to touch the ropes. Could have done better
Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, no run, some flight this time, Dhawan reaches out on his front foot and finds mid-wicket with his half-sweep
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, 1 run, fifty up for India. Nazmul Islam gets some indrift on this full dart, Rohit pokes a single to long-off
Abu Hider to Dhawan, FOUR, that was there to be hit. Fullish outside off, Dhawan goes with a free swing of the bat and clears mid-off
Abu Hider to Dhawan, no run, punched to mid-off, Dhawan as usual is off the blocks. Is sent back, fielder hits the stumps at the bowler's end, Dhawan takes off again. Sent back again. Phew
Abu Hider to Rohit, 1 run, that's his fodder, so Rohit will be disappointed. Short ball angling into him, Rohit slaps the pull straight to deep square leg
Abu Hider to Dhawan, 1 run, slower delivery to the left-hander this time, Dhawan intends to come forward but then holds back. Opens the bat face to point
Abu Hider to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length and normal pace this time, Rohit opens the face of the bat and pokes a single to backward point

Abu Hider to Rohit, FOUR, you know what, that's a 100ks ball. Mehidy bowled a 101ks in the last over. Things we see. Sharma didn't read it at all. Drives and elicits an outside edge through the vacant third man region

Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, 3 runs, Rohit uses his feet and converts an okay length into a half-volley. Reaches the ball with protracted arms, and drives it out behind point, almost squeezing out a boundary. Cut off in the deep
Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, no run, quick dart, gee, Rohit blocks
Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, SIX, yeah, that's big. Plays the slog-sweep, going with the turn and punishing the flight over deep mid-wicket. Will we see another flighted delivery to Rohit?
Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, no run, sees Rohit run down and fires a 101ks quick and full ball. Nothing much Rohit could do, except get his toe end
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, wide from round the wicket to the left-hander, Dhawan compensates for an iota of turn and softs a single off the back foot to long-off
Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, 1 run, starts with a quickish delivery from over the wicket, Rohit goes back and skims it out to long-on
Mustafizur to Dhawan, SIX, golly gosh, Mustafizur's been hit out like a spinner here. Dhawan gawks the slower delivery, comes out of the crease and mows him straight down the ground
Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, a leading edge to cover. He's not quite looked the part again tonight. Early into the shot this time
Mustafizur to Dhawan, 1 run, slowish cutter, Dhawan waits for it and and jabs out a single to mid-on
Mustafizur to Dhawan, no run, uses the room but can't slice the ball past short third man say (the fielder's quite in actually)
Mustafizur to Dhawan, no run, almost beaten by pace there. Ball's there before Dhawan expects, trapping him in the crease, but he just about gets his bat out and prods a defence
Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, starts from over the wicket and drops it on middle and leg. Easy single round the corner
Rubel to Dhawan, FOUR, this is brilliant. Opens the blade and drills this through cover-point, placing this full ball away superbly

Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, that could have been a stunning catch at mid-on by Hider. A miscued big hit by Rohit (and that after he wanted to bide his time, as said at the toss). Wanted to go big over cow corner but manages just some toe-end and spoons it straight down the ground. Mid-on runs across, dives to his left, but isn't quite upto it
Rubel to Dhawan, 1 run, full on middle this time, Dhawan drills it straight down the ground

Rubel to Dhawan, no run, from over the wicket to the left-hander, and Rubel does well in not allowing Dhawan the room outside off. Chopped with an opening blade towards point, Dhawan intended the single too, but has to run back to the crease
Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, back foot punch that Rohit opens behind point, third man runs across and cuts it off
Rubel to Rohit, no run, starts with a back of a length ball that's been punch-defended straight down the ground

Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, FOUR, that's a very poor ball. Bowled from over the wicket, Nazmul Islam wanted to fire it quick on the pads but ends up erring down leg. And Dhawan was upto it: swivels and vertical-bats the sweep through fine leg, wide of the fielder at leg slip
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, 1 run, drops it a touch short, allowing Rohit the time to pat it down to long-off
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, no run, and again. A carbon copy of the last ball
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, no run, slows top-edge pace down considerably, does Nazmul Islam. Cut away with the turn but straight to the point fielder
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, FOUR, this one skids on straight, Rohit is quick to rock back and uppishly punch it wide of mid-on
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, no run, some turn first ball from the left-arm spinner, Rohit slaps that out to cover
Abu Hider to Dhawan, no run, outswing from over the wicket to the left-hander, Dhawan opens the face of the bat and blocks it out
Abu Hider to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length delivery punched softly to cover, where the fielder flies to parry the ball to the bowler's end. Nothing. Easy single
Abu Hider to Rohit, no run, bowls it nice and full from wide of the crease again, not allowing Rohit any room. Stuck in the crease is Rohit, crouching to defend it
Abu Hider to Rohit, no run, brings the ball back from wide of the crease, Rohit gets behind
Abu Hider to Rohit, wide, moves away quite a touch from a back of a length, Rohit stretches his hands out but can't get to it. Wide.

Abu Hider to Rohit, no run, gets the ball to come in from round the wicket, Rohit is trapped in the crease. A slight appeal there but two sounds. Hitting both the pads and the angle was taking it down leg
Abu Hider to Rohit, no run, gets some movement away from a good length, Rohit chops it down to cover

Siraj to Rahim, no run, that's that. Siraj digs it into the pitch, Rahim tries cutting, and he cuts thin air. India can celebrate -- they've made it to the finals .. their Lankan visas have been extended. Perhaps demands for citizenship too
Siraj to Rahim, no run, slow, outside off and Mushy lets it go. Tries pocketing the extra, when there's none
Siraj to Rahim, FOUR, oh the power. Brute. Stretches, creaming it away through the covers. Sadly, the equation doesn't allow beauty to translate into runs
Siraj to Rahim, wide, short, too much so. Loops over the short Mushy

Siraj to Rahim, FOUR, tries following him with the bouncer. But Rahim's cleverer, he arches back, opens the bat and upper-ramps it over short third. But it's India who seal the deal .. without freebie extras being let out of course

Siraj to Mehidy Hasan, out Caught by Raina!! Oh he has a knuckle ball too. Wonder why he was hiding these. So with the length short too, Mehidy tries going uppish with a lofted tonk. Swishing his bat across as he does so. High, but not long. And put that cobra back in the pit. Long-off retracts, reverse-cups. Mehidy Hasan c Raina b Siraj 7(6) [4s-1]
Siraj to Rahim, 1 run, to short third man, that back of a length, gets it right for a change. Mushy misses, with that dab going to short third man
SN Thakur to Mehidy Hasan, no run, follows him in with the yorker on leg. Opened up to point, denies the single too. Oh my
SN Thakur to Rahim, 1 run, another single. Only. Just five off it, so far. Courtesy, a carve away through the off-side
SN Thakur to Mehidy Hasan, 1 run, moves away, tries manufacturing room. But what you do for the pace .. slices, mis-more and finds extra cover
SN Thakur to Rahim, 1 run, nails the yorker. Rahim gets his leg out, and it is only a single, with an angry jam down the ground
SN Thakur to Rahim, no run, slows with the knuckle. Rahim, early into a poke, finds himself beaten
SN Thakur to Rahim, 2 runs, to deep extra cover, absolutely crunched through the covers. Oh the sound. But Pandey's out there in the deep, mopping it up to keep it to a couple
Siraj to Mehidy Hasan, FOUR, it's a free-hit .. literally. Throws his hands out, all the width to aid and slices it away behind point

Siraj to Rahim, no ball, 1 run, he's caught. And is almost run-out as well. And he lives to see another day. Siraj wants to try the yorker, misses it by a couple of feet .. so much so that it goes over Rahim's waist. He skews it up, Siraj catches and with all the time to run and break the non-striker's stumps, decides to chance his dart skills. Sadly for him, there are none to boast of
Siraj to Rahim, no run, goes for the double bluff. Short, with venom and with fine leg inside. It's enough this time to take Rahim by surprise
Siraj to Mehidy Hasan, 1 run, mix up. No, not quite when there's no direct hit. Just a tap to mid-off, where Raina's waiting, can see all three stumps. And misses
Siraj to Rahim, 1 run, shows width, but Rahim can only slice it to extra cover in the deep

Siraj to Rahim, FOUR, celebrates it with some innovation. Walks across his stumps, sits down, scooping it away straight over the keeper. You really aren't expected to have fielders out there .. but you're expected to bowl better lengths
Siraj to Rahim, FOUR, bangs it into the pitch. Never the right length, even you take all the pace off it. Siraj learns it the hard way, with Rahim carting him through point. It's a fifty too
SN Thakur to Rahim, 1 run, spots the cutter, stays back, lines himself beside and dabs it beside point
SN Thakur to Mehidy Hasan, 1 run, opens up his bat face, keeping his head and guiding it behind point to give the strike back

SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, out Bowled!! It's the slower one. No, don't credit the knuckle, credit the fingers. Rolls his fingers on the seam, hits that perfect irritating channel on off. Rahman can't wait for it to get close, he's already into his across-the-line hack, and in the process the stumps are shown. And off of it is pegged back. Sabbir Rahman b SN Thakur 27(23) [4s-2 6s-1]
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 2 runs, corrects with a full one outside off. A jamming drive follows, going over point in the process

SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, gives him the pace. Gives him the length. And gives him the boundary. The friendly kind of short, angling back in and Rahman goes one-legged, muscling it flat and into mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run, one knuckle ball too many? No, not as yet. Rahman, confused as he steps down, pulls all over it with the ball slipping under the radar
Washington Sundar to Rahim, 2 runs, throws up some air. Mushy lofts it straight down. Long-off's there, and so is a couple. But this has been some spell - 4-0-22-3
Washington Sundar to Rahim, no run, darted flat, Rahim waits, loads, but just can't squeeze it out

Washington Sundar to Rahim, no run, nigh perfect. Never mind Mushy reversing. Never mind the 18-year old age, officially. He thinks, sticks to his basics and sticks to his plan of flighting it outside off. Beaten
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, full again, perhaps taken on it too as he goes on a knee to slice it square
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, on the move, too close for comfort as he squeezes it back
Washington Sundar to Rahim, 1 run, tempts him wide. A stretch, a carve and a mistime through point
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 2 runs, some more of the usual. Fiercely heaved away, through square leg

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, dips in low, foxes Rahman as he sits to sweep. Under, on the boot. Scoots back to Shankar, who has half a chance at running Sabbir out. Misses as the batsman rushes back
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, leggie. Tight around off, despite Rahim's moves all around. Has to manufacture all his pace on this to slap it square
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, another leg-spinner. High full toss this time, one that's slapped, against the dip, Mid-wicket
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 2 runs, walks, flicks, doesn't keep it down. Thakur, from behind square runs in, slides, dives but can't get there. Nothing in that pleases Rohit
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, loopy leg-spin. And it's with a run up that starts from the edge of the circle. Is carved out eventually through sweeper
SN Thakur to Rahim, 1 run, 131kph, stabbed out to point, who's fumbly. So as the trend goes, Thakur pulls things back in his second spell
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, on the move across his stumps to tuck it through mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Rahim, 1 run, pitches it up wide, giving it the pace too and is drilled away through the covers
SN Thakur to Rahim, no run, slows it up, obviously with the knuckle, fuller on the stumps and Rahim early into his flick has to check. The outcome - leading edge back onto the pitch
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, 130kph, chopped, angle-batted, backward point runs and intercepts
SN Thakur to Rahim, 1 run, good length, 118kph in the knuckle ball, with some width for Rahim to run it down to third man
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, SIX, snatches the over. Chahal gets greedy, drags it down half way, it sits up and Rahman rocks deep inside to mow it into cow corner
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, no run, slowed up wide tease again, tempts Rahman into a cut .. and then refuses to get up
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, backs, and with Chahal offering nothing in terms of pace, with Colombo sucking some more of it, the flashy cut gets only an under edge, ricocheting off Karthik's pads
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, 75kph. Slows it up, tossing it wide too. Rahman doesn't ditch his sweep
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, middle-lined. Under the length, nailing the sweep behind square
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, leg byes, 1 run, 78kph, tries to sweep, manages a glove, and the pop up luckily is over the keeper
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 2 runs, 132kph, full, coming in from wide of the crease. A waited whip follows, and so does a couple. 14 off this one now .. Bangladesh have a move on
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, sensible. 127kph of a good length and is just checked, softly into off
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, raw meat. Feeds him on the tummy, Rahman makes it worse with his violent jump down and lays into it with a heave, flat-batting it round the corner
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, leg-cutter this time. 92kph. Full, off-base and jammed through the covers
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 2 runs, on the move inside the line, nudging the cutter through mid-wicket. Wide gaps
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, FOUR, finds the friendly length. Width too. Mushy stretches, full and slices it away. Airy, sweeper and you aren't expected to stop these
Siraj to Sabbir Rahman, no run, stays put, with the bat stuck in front of the pad in defence. 16 off this one
Siraj to Rahim, 1 run, tightens up on the ribs, bunted down to leg
Siraj to Rahim, SIX, step, step, room and inside-out. He's toying around here with Siraj's mind. Knew he'd go full, he had to, and lofts it over extra cover, on the ropes too
Siraj to Rahim, wide, too short. Rahim, surprised, shapes up to hook, but is happy to leave and pocket the extra
Siraj to Rahim, FOUR, rubs it in with cheek. Followed in, Mushy stands, gives the impression of a defence, but the defence is opened up. There's enough on the dab to take it away through the cordon
Siraj to Rahim, FOUR, walks down, never mind the shortened length, he takes it on off the front foot with a murderous pull, punishing it in front of square

Siraj to Rahim, no run, returns with a peach. The seam is perfect, and it jags away. Nothing Rahim's flirt can do with it. Somebody somewhere on the field has heard something .. and that something is the bat grazing the pad
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Sabbir Rahman stays back in his crease and steers it to backward point

Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, full and wide outside off, Rahim throws his hands at it and the bat turns in the hands as it trundles away to mid-off as they run across for a quick single. A throw from Dhawan at the non-striker's end misses the target. Could've been trouble if he'd hit...
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, short delivery just outside off and Sabbir Rahman twists his torso into a side-on pull to deep square leg for a single
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, length ball outside off, Rahim trusts the bounce and plays a transfer-of-weight drive through the line to mid-off where Dhawan makes a diving stop
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, no run, full and wide outside off, Rahim makes room and tries to reach it, can't. Goes through to the keeper, and Vijay Shankar hoodwinks Rahim
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, no run, fuller length delivery on the pads, whipped to mid-on
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, no run, tossed up on middle and off, the leg-break turns away, Sabbir Rahman comes forward and pushes it with the turn to cover
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, no run, fuller delivery on leg and middle, tapped back softly to the bowler off the front foot

Chahal to Mahmudullah, out Caught by Rahul!! Drops it just a tad short and Mahmudullah is quick to get onto the back foot as he rocks back to nail the pull towards deep mid-wicket. But wait, Rahul comes in and settles under it! Could've hit it anywhere, but he picks out the fielder. What's with Mahmudullah and mid-wicket dismissals against India? The last game, this game, and that game in Bangalore... Mahmudullah c Rahul b Chahal 11(8) [4s-2]

Chahal to Mahmudullah, no run, perfect delivery on off, leg-break, turns away and catches the outside edge of Mahmudullah who was on the back foot and trying to whip it away off the back foot since he was anticipating the original line. The leading edge takes it to backward point
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, loopy delivery drifting in towards leg-stump, Rahim comes forward and cuts off the angle to sweep it to backward square leg for a single
Chahal to Rahim, wide, another wide on the off-side and constant words of advice from the keeper
Chahal to Mahmudullah, 1 run, tossed up and pitched up on off, Mahmudullah clears his front leg and flat-bats it past the outstretched arms of the bowler to long-off for a single
Chahal to Mahmudullah, wide, leg-break wide outside off, and the turn takes it past the tramline and gives the umpire some exercise

Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, 1 run, good length delivery just outside off and stays a tad low, Mahmudullah waits for it, adjusts to the bounce, and dabs it off a low stance down to third man for a single
Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, no run, back of a length delivery in the hallway of hesitation outside off, Mahmudullah waits for it and taps it on its head right under his eyes into the off-side
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, fuller length on middle and leg, Rahim comes forward and expertly whip-drives it to long-on for a single

Vijay Shankar to Rahim, no run, short and just a tad wide outside off, Rahim steps across and carves that meticulously to the left of backward point but Rahul is alert at that position as he dives and saves the single
Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, 1 run, full and on the pads, Mahmudullah shuffles across and whiplashes that away to deep backward square leg for a single
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, fuller length delivery on middle, punches down to long-on for a single
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, tossed up this time and overpitches a little, Rahim gets half-forward and plays a courteous nudge to deep mid-wicket for a single
Chahal to Rahim, no run, googly on a shortened length on middle and leg, Rahim nudges it off the back foot into the on-side hurriedly. That was a little flatter in trajectory
Chahal to Rahim, no run, leg-break on leg-stump, Rahim nudges it towards the on-side off the front foot against the turn
Chahal to Rahim, no run, yorker length delivery just outside leg, Rahim comes down the track, makes room, and digs that out to cover
Chahal to Rahim, FOUR, leg-break just outside off, Rahim premeditates the reverse-sweep and gets it just past the leaping backward point fielder to deep backward point for four
Chahal to Rahim, no run, leg-break tossed up on middle and leg, Rahim taps it down the wicket back to the bowler
Washington Sundar to Mahmudullah, FOUR, tossed up just outside off, Mahmudullah advances down quickly to get to the pitch of it and flat-bats it to the long-off fence for four
Washington Sundar to Mahmudullah, FOUR, dropped short and just a tad wide outside off, Mahmudullah makes room and slaps it to sweeper cover for four

Washington Sundar to Tamim, out Bowled!! Got him! Tried to be too cute, and found that that he couldn't be. From round the wicket that was one angling towards leg-stump and it held its line. Possibly the floater. Tamim went for the lap-sweep and misses it completely as it clips the top of off and dislodges the leg-bail. Screams of joy from around the bat. Tamim b Washington Sundar 27(19) [4s-4 6s-1]
Washington Sundar to Tamim, no run, just a tad short and flat, Tamim makes room and chops it in front of point
Washington Sundar to Tamim, no run, off-break on middle and off, Tamim is beaten on the back foot defence and it hits the pad. Big appeal, but I think that was too high.
Washington Sundar to Rahim, 1 run, tossed up wide outside off, Rahim gets on his knee and throws his hands at it and drags it to cover for a single
Chahal to Tamim, no run, leg-break dragged a little short on middle and off, Tamim gets deep in the crease and whips that to short mid-wicket
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, full leg-break on off, Rahim makes room and drives inside-out to extra cover where Rohit makes a diving stop and prevents a certain boundary
Chahal to Tamim, 1 run, tossed up on the pads, nurdled away off a full-forward stretch to mid-wicket for a quick single
Chahal to Tamim, no run, full delivery angling away from off, Tamim misses the sweep and it strikes him on the pad. Big appeal, but clearly missing off
Chahal to Tamim, no run, tossed up leg-break on middle, Tamim gets a leading edge back to the Chahal
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, gets away with a low full-toss, push-driven away inside-out to long-off for a single
Washington Sundar to Rahim, 1 run, loopy and slow again on middle, Rahim comes forward and politely taps that to long-on for a single
Washington Sundar to Rahim, no run, tossed up again on middle, Rahim waits and tickles that to the on-side for a single

Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, out Bowled!! GONE! No turn on that one, seemed like a floater. Oh no, the side-spinner, and that goes with the surface facing forward. Soumya Sarkar tries a slog-sweep across the line and he misses as it crashes into leg-stump and lights up the bails (and Dinesh Karthik's face). Brilliant powerplay bowling by the teenager - mature beyond his years. Soumya Sarkar b Washington Sundar 1(3)
Washington Sundar to Tamim, 1 run, fuller and flatter on the pads, whipped away to deep mid-wicket for a quick single
Washington Sundar to Tamim, wide, flatter and down leg, Tamim misses the glance and DK collects
Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, loopy off-break on middle, Soumya Sarkar opens the face to guide it to cover for a single
Washington Sundar to Tamim, 1 run, back of a length delivery on middle, punched away to wide long-on for a single

SN Thakur to Tamim, 1 run, back of a length delivery on the thighs, tucked away off the back foot to backward square leg for a single. 19 off the over and Thakur's first-over jitters are back again. Some Mumbai-Orissa banter in our commm-box too...
SN Thakur to Tamim, FOUR, just a fraction short again and Tamim is on the back foot in the blink on an eye and dispatches that pull to the deep mid-wicket fence for four
SN Thakur to Tamim, SIX, short ball on leg with the fine leg inside the circle, Tamim shuffles across, gets front-on and guides that hook over fine leg for six
SN Thakur to Tamim, FOUR, on a good length but wide outside off, Tamim gets on his back knee and leans into a square drive through deep backward point for four
SN Thakur to Tamim, FOUR, fuller length delivery on off, Tamim makes room and bludgeons that through the extra cover region for four. Clean strike. Split the gap perfectly
SN Thakur to Tamim, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Tamim shuffles across and push-drives off the back foot towards mid-on
Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, fuller and flatter on the pads, tickled away towards short fine leg

Washington Sundar to Liton Das, out Stumped!! Gone this time! Tossed up just outside off again, the off-break, and the sly Sundar beats him in the flight as he charges down the track to loft it into the on-side and misses. Karthik collects and breaks the stumps and Das looks embarrassed and seems to have some doubts about the size of his pre-frontal cortex. Walks off. First blood for India. Liton Das st Karthik b Washington Sundar 7(7) [4s-1]
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, FOUR, tossed up outside off, flatter because he saw the batsman coming, he goes for it anyway and lofts it towards the wide long-off fence for four
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, no run, yorker length delivery just outside off, digs it out along with a bit of the pitch into the off-side
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, no run

Washington Sundar to Liton Das, no run, full-toss on the pads, Liton Das comes down the track and tries a cross-batted heave into the on-side. Big appeal, and not given. India review! No bat on it. Hits him on the thigh. Impact waaaaay outside off. Decision not overturned. Remains not out.

Siraj to Liton Das, 1 run, just a tad short and wide outside off again, Liton Das has his feet cemented on leg-stump as he reaches out and steers it to third man for a single. Good pace throughout the over, that last one @140km/h...
Siraj to Liton Das, 2 runs, back of a length delivery on middle, Liton Das shuffles across and nudges that politely to deep mid-wicket for a brace

Siraj to Tamim, 1 run, just a tad short, Tamim makes room and tries a slash into the off-side. Rahul tries to run forward and collect but it spins past him as he ends up conceding a single. Poor fielding
Siraj to Tamim, no run, back of a length delivery in the channel outside off, better area, Tamim drops it off the back foot into the off-side and runs across for a single
Siraj to Tamim, FOUR, short and wide-ish outside off again and this time, Tamim flashes and blazes that square of the wicket for four to the point boundary
Siraj to Tamim, no run, short and just a tad wide, @145km/h, tapped off the back foot to point
Kevin O Brien to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, fuller and outside off, Pandya swings as hard as possible, almost off his feet, miscues it off the toe-end down the ground to long-off. Just a single
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Hardik Pandya

comm: Kevin O Brien to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, first boundary for him. He was dealing in sixes till now. Shortens the length and Pandya flat-bats it over Pandey. Long-on tries to get around but the pace on the ball is a bit too much for him
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Hardik Pandya

comm: Kevin O Brien to Hardik Pandya, SIX, this is carnage from Pandya. Fourth six for him. Even O Brien is put under the pump. The pressure of the last over getting to him. Length ball right in the slot and Pandya nonchalantly smokes it over the sightscreen. Mighty hit!
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Hardik Pandya

comm: Kevin O Brien to Hardik Pandya, SIX, wow! That is some hit from Pandya. The bat flies towards square leg and the ball clears the long-off fielder. Fuller and slower outside off, Pandya goes through the line and since he had to reach for it, the bottom hand comes off and the bat slips out of his hand. However, the ball has enough to clear the field
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Hardik Pandya

comm: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower delivery outside off, Pandey shuffles across to hoick it into the leg-side, went too hard and lost his shape, a thick inside edge rolls to backward square leg
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey

comm: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, fuller and outside off, Pandey reaches out and hammers the drive wide of long-off, two more
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey

comm: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey, wide, O Brien trusted with the final over and he starts with a wide outside off, Pandey lets go
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey

comm: Chase to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, missed out there. Similar to the whip six delivery, but this time gets it off the toe-end and the ball rolls in front of long-on, Pandey is quick and he pushes Pandya for the second. Big over for India and they have made up for O Brien's tidy over

Chase to Hardik Pandya, SIX, back to back sixes and India are on course for 200. Another full length ball and Pandya has picked the leather out of that, clears his front leg and muscles it with all his might over cow corner fence

Chase to Hardik Pandya, SIX, ufff! That is some flick shot from Pandya. Length ball on middle, Pandya shuffled around in the crease before getting in line and whipping it over deep backward square. The flourish after the connection made it look more stylishly
Chase to Hardik Pandya, wide, loses his radar for once on the slower delivery, sprays it down leg and concedes a wide
Chase to Manish Pandey, 1 run, back of a length with no pace, Pandey swats it with a cross-bat to deep mid-wicket
Chase to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, fuller and slower, Pandya goes through the line and drills it to long-on

Chase to Manish Pandey, 1 run, the bottom of Pandey's bat is flying everywhere. A yorker from Chase and Pandey had to bring his bat down to keep it out, does so and loses his bat in the process. Calls for a replacement

Kevin O Brien to Hardik Pandya, no run, fuller and outside off, Pandya drives it straight to cover. Excellent over from O Brien, just the 7 off it and the wicket of Raina. Will he be given the last over?
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Hardik Pandya

comm: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey, 1 run, shortens the length outside off and Pandey glides it past backward point, sweeper tidies up
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey

comm: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey, FOUR, finally something off the middle. Rolls his fingers across does O Brien and Pandey gave himself room to go inside out, connects well to beat extra cover and a diving long-off
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey

comm: Kevin O Brien to Raina, out Caught by Dockrell!! Third wicket for Kevin O Brien. The slower deliveries are doing the trick for him. The off-cutter dragged short and Raina had to manufacture all the power, he camps back and muscles the pull straight to deep mid-wicket. Dockrell did not have to move much to take that. A fine knock comes to an end. Raina c Dockrell b Kevin O Brien 69(45) [4s-5 6s-3]

Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fraction short to Pandey and he mistimes the on-the-up drive to the right of O Brien, a deflection allows him to get off strike. Pandey is really struggling with his timing
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey

comm: Kevin O Brien to Raina, 1 run, speared into the yorker range and Raina digs it out to long-off
Stirling to Raina, 1 run, low full toss close to yorker length and Raina squeezes it out to deep extra cover
Stirling to Manish Pandey, 1 run, third full toss in the over and Stirling is getting away with it, drilled to long-off
Stirling to Raina, 1 run, low dipping full toss, Raina kneels and slog sweeps it to deep mid-wicket
Stirling to Manish Pandey, 1 run, heaved away on the bounce to deep mid-wicket. Pandey is trying his best to clear the field
Stirling to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, flatter on middle and leg, Pandey whips it between long-on and deep mid-wicket, two more

Stirling to Raina, 3 runs, the relay allows the duo to pick a third. A low full toss outside off, Raina bends his back knee to lift it over extra cover. Long-off runs across to his right and flicks it to the man running in from deep extra cover, the throw is wide and the extra run is given away
Stirling to Raina, wide, starts with a dart outside off, well away from the tramline, Raina leaves it to pocket a wide
Chase to Raina, 1 run, full and on the stumps, Raina heaves it on the bounce to deep mid-wicket

Chase to Raina, FOUR, the attempted yorker from Chase and it does not come off, ends up as a juicy full toss on the pads and Raina brings that strong bottom hand into play, whipped towards deep mid-wicket where Dockrell tries his best to take a one-handed blinder running to his left, just falls short and escapes past him
Chase to Manish Pandey, 1 run, backs away and Chase follows him with a full delivery, driven to long-on
Chase to Raina, 1 run, short and around the ribs, helped along the way to fine leg

Chase to Raina, SIX, geez! This is murdered. The slower ball on a similar length as the previous one and Raina spotted it early, camped back and muscled the pull over the cow corner fence. Struck flat and straight into the ad boardings

Chase to Raina, no run, short of length couple with a finger roll, Raina is through the pull shot and the ball arrives later. Clever bowling from Chase and Ireland have realised that taking pace off the ball is the way to bowl on this surface
Kevin O Brien to Raina, 1 run, fuller and on the stumps, drilled along the ground to long-on

Kevin O Brien to Raina, FOUR, fifty for Raina. He did not have much time in the first game, but today batting at his favorite number three position, he's made the most of the chance. Lifts his bat and waves it to all parts of the ground. A juicy half volley on the pads and Raina tickles it past a diving short fine leg

Kevin O Brien to Raina, wide, excellent bit of work from the skipper, standing up to the stumps. O Brien slants it outside off and Raina misses out on the drive, Wilson is quick to glove it and whip the bails off. Raina was always inside the crease
Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey, 1 run, off-pace on middle and leg, a gentle twirl of the wrists and a single to long-on
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey

comm: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey, no run, punched straight to cover
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey

comm: Kevin O Brien to Raina, 1 run, Pandey was in trouble. Raina flat-bats the slower short of length delivery back to O Brien and he tries to parry it onto the stumps, missed it by a whisker and Pandey was diving in to make it back. They run as the ball rolls away to long-on
Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey, 1 run, goes a bit hard on the shot and does not get it where he wanted, hits the inner portion and races away towards long-on, just a single
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey

comm: Dockrell to Manish Pandey, 1 run, shimmies down and drills it on the bounce to long-on. Pandey needs to get going and not allow the momentum to slip away
Dockrell to Raina, 1 run, stepped out and Dockrell fired it outside off, Raina reaches for it and eases it through cover
Dockrell to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fraction short and that allows Pandey to get the ball away to sweeper cover
Dockrell to Manish Pandey, no run, bit of air and Pandey pushes it towards cover, where Porterfield makes a fine save
Dockrell to Manish Pandey, no run, slides on from round the wicket and Pandey backs away to defend it back
Dockrell to Raina, 1 run, pushed through outside off, glided with an open bat face to short third man
Kevin O Brien to Raina, 1 run, short of length close to off, whipped off the back foot to deep mid-wicket
Kevin O Brien to Raina, wide, splays it down leg to the left-hander, no chance for Raina to meet with the tickle
Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey, 1 run, shortens the length and Pandey stays leg-side to punch it to deep cover
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey

comm: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey, no run, on a length and around off, stabbed in Pandey style in front of cover
batsman_bowler: Kevin O Brien to Manish Pandey

comm: Kevin O Brien to Rohit, out Caught by Stirling!! Two in the over for Kevin O Brien. Rohit gone for nought. Ireland back in it. Batting in the middle order has not suited Rohit, did him no good in the IPL and it didn't help him here either. Rolled his fingers across and landed it full outside off, Rohit leans across to play the drive, but with no pace on offer he slices it towards backward point, where Stirling is close in to pouch that. Grabbed it inches from the ground. Rohit c Stirling b Kevin O Brien 0(2)
Kevin O Brien to Rohit, no run, once again the ball does not arrive and Rohit is squared up slightly as he bunts it into the off-side

Kevin O Brien to Rahul, out Caught&Bowled!! What happened there? Kevin O Brien strikes with his first delivery. Has his arms aloft in what-the-fuss is kind of gesture. Soft soft dismissal. Nothing but a length delivery, might have held up on the surface, Rahul was through his shot and had to check it at the last second, pops a dolly back to O Brien, who accepts it gleefully. The partnership is broken and Ireland have some breathing space. O Brien took pace off the ball and that deceived Rahul. It was a clever change up from the Irish all-rounder. Rahul c and b Kevin O Brien 70(36) [4s-3 6s-6]

Dockrell to Rahul, 1 run, Dockrell gets away with another full toss, this time Rahul is the one to miss out and he is livid, lost his shape while trying to heave it into the leg-side and the resulting inside edge rolls away towards square leg

Dockrell to Raina, 1 run, Raina has missed out on a few full tosses today. Another one on leg-stump and seemed like he went a bit too hard on the cross-batted swipe, not off the middle and the man tidies up near deep backward square
Dockrell to Rahul, 1 run, no air whatsoever from Dockrell, Rahul waits on the back foot and wrists it to long-on
Dockrell to Raina, 1 run, quicker and outside off, Raina is happy to tap it square on the off-side and hand the strike to Rahul
Dockrell to Rahul, 1 run, flatter and drifting in, punched down to long-on

Dockrell to Rahul, SIX, thumped! Rahul has switched gears. Sees the flighted delivery on a fullish length, clears his front leg out of the way to give him a free swing of the arms, sends it sailing onto the sightscreen

Rankin to Raina, no run, Raina looks at the bottom of his bat. Fuller and just outside off, he wanted to ease it down the ground but the ball did not bounce as much as he expected, off the toe-end and rolls to Wilson
Rankin to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length around off, Rahul drops it with soft hands in front of backward point and Raina responds to his call
Rankin to Rahul, wide, strays it down leg and Rahul can't quite get hold of the glance, wide called

Rankin to Rahul, SIX, wow! This is a shot of a man in superb form. Slightly overpitched and Rahul went through the line with minimal footwork, his hands did all the work as he struck it over extra cover. Flat and all the way
Rankin to Raina, 1 run, slanted across the right-hander, Raina uses the angle and steers it to third man
Rankin to Rahul, 1 run, once again on the shorter side is Rankin and Rahul gets inside the line to play the pull, couple of bounces and straight to fine leg

Rankin to Rahul, SIX, fifty for Rahul. Grabs his opportunity with both hands. Missed out in the first game and here he is showing what a quality player he is. Raises the bat and soaks in the applause. Short ball and looked like Rahul was waiting for it, went deep in the crease and helped the pull over a leaping fine leg - just over the fielder
Dockrell to Raina, 2 runs, juicy full toss and Raina wrists it away nicely into the gap at deep mid-wicket. The fielder stationed there had to put in a sliding stop to save a brace
Dockrell to Raina, no run, more of the flatter trajectory, on the pads and it's glanced to short fine leg
Dockrell to Rahul, 1 run, speared in on middle and leg, Rahul gets across and nudges it towards the gap at backward square leg
Dockrell to Raina, 1 run, probably spotted Raina giving the charge and fired it on the pads, low full toss and clipped through backward square leg

Dockrell to Raina, FOUR, Raina's turn to up the tempo now. A half-tracker from Dockrell, unusual from the left-arm spinner and it vanishes to the deep mid-wicket fence. Raina rocked back in a jiffy and nailed the pull
Dockrell to Rahul, 1 run, very full and outside off, Rahul skips down and drills it down to long-off

Stirling to Raina, FOUR, a full toss too many and Raina doesn't miss out this time. Holds his shape and lofts it nonchalantly over extra cover. Bisected long-off and sweeper cover with precision. Nicely done by the southpaw. Looks so dangerous when he is playing shots like these but yet, ends up losing his shape over ugly slogs and hoicks
Stirling to Rahul, 1 run, once again keeps it well outside off to Rahul, very full as well, dug out down to long-on
Stirling to Raina, 1 run, a full toss on leg but Raina cannot put it away. Miscues the slog sweep that nearly carried to deep backward square leg. What's with these full tosses going unpunished?
Stirling to Rahul, 1 run, better tactics against Rahul, full and wide, forces him to squeeze it through the covers
Stirling to Rahul, wide, fired well down the leg-side, Wilson does well to take this. Pressure on the Ireland bowlers with Rahul on strike
Stirling to Raina, 1 run, slower and wider outside off this time, Raina tries the inside out loft through extra cover but hasn't quite middled it. Through the gap though and towards sweeper
Stirling to Raina, no run, fired in around off, not much room and Raina pats it back to the bowler
Simi Singh to Raina, 1 run, quicker and slanting in around off, Raina flicks it through mid-wicket and they ran the first one quickly but decided against the second
Simi Singh to Rahul, 1 run, fired in around leg, not much room and it's worked to deep mid-wicket

Simi Singh to Rahul, FOUR, raining boundaries now. Simi loses his head and doles out a full toss which Rahul dispatches with glee. A wristy whip and ensures that he finds the gap at deep mid-wicket. Ominous signs for Ireland here, Rahul is on the rampage

Simi Singh to Rahul, SIX, there he goes again. Rahul has decided to switch gears now and Simi Singh is facing the brunt of it. Too full this time and he goes down on one knee to maul it over deep mid-wicket with a slog sweep. Picked the bones out of that one
Simi Singh to Rahul, wide, pushed through quicker but well down the leg-side, no need to play at those

Simi Singh to Rahul, SIX, M-A-S-S-I-V-E! What a mighty blow from Rahul! Came down the track and although there was a pause from Simi while he delivered this, it didn't make any impact on the batsman. Lofted cleanly through the line to send it soaring over long-on. Went out of the ground probably
Simi Singh to Raina, 1 run, flatter delivery on the pads, worked through deep square leg for a single. These two are content in milking it around for the moment
Dockrell to Raina, 1 run, full toss, another one that's not put away. Don't think Raina expected this and ends up working it to deep mid-wicket
Dockrell to Rahul, 1 run, Dockrell continues to operate on that good length, Rahul was on the charge but didn't get it in the slot for the big shot. Adjusts with a drill down to long-on
Dockrell to Raina, 1 run, drifting in from around off, Raina gets across and nurdles it through backward square leg
Dockrell to Rahul, 1 run, sliding into the pads, fractionally short and Rahul whips it away to deep mid-wicket
Dockrell to Raina, 1 run, fired in on a length outside off, Raina works it towards mid-wicket
Dockrell to Rahul, 1 run, flatter and around middle, worked away off the back foot towards deep mid-wicket

Chase to Rahul, 1 run, quick single, the shy misses and that probably saves Rahul who however seems to be in trouble. Full toss that was drilled to mid-off and they went for the run immediately. The throw didn't hit the target but ended up sneaking into Rahul who is hobbling a bit, visibly in discomfort. Let's hope he is fine, he does have a history of picking up freak injuries. Seems to be fine to resume
Chase to Raina, 1 run, short of a length and Raina helps the pull past square leg by moving across a touch

Chase to Raina, FOUR, connects this time! Made room and was down the track but Chase did well to follow him. Raina still adjusted well to clobber it through the mid-wicket region. Beat the man in the game comfortably
Chase to Raina, no run, swing and a miss! Ugly hoick from Raina and he tried to back away to make room, lost his shape totally in the end
Chase to Raina, no run, beaten! Good delivery, seamed away off the deck from a shorter length as Raina was on the shuffle. Poked at it and got lucky in the end
Chase to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length around middle and leg, Rahul gets across and clips it towards mid-wicket
S Thompson to Raina, no run, back of a length, Raina stayed back to push this towards mid-off. Wanted the single but rightfully sent back
S Thompson to Rahul, 1 run, very full and around off, Rahul walks across a bit and drills it down the ground towards long-on
S Thompson to Raina, 1 run, tight single, well-taken. Raina made room for the inside out drive but had to adapt to the length. Dabs it towards mid-off and finds quick response from Rahul
S Thompson to Raina, wide, this time errs down leg, does Thompson, another to the extras column. Thompson feeling the heat
S Thompson to Raina, wide, and another, another slower ball that is once again way too wide outside off
S Thompson to Raina, wide, pressure telling on Thompson now. Tries the slower ball but it's well wide outside off stump, beyond the tramline

S Thompson to Raina, SIX, on the leg-side this time. Raina has begun with a bang here. Have to say that Thompson helped him with a half-volley on the pads but it still had to be put away. Raina just bent low to launch this over mid-wicket. Clubbed it with elan
S Thompson to Raina, no run, back of a length outside off, stabbed off the back foot to the off-side

S Thompson to Raina, SIX, vintage Raina! When he isn't moving around and playing shots like these, he is extremely dangerous. Thompson errs on the fuller side and there is width as well, Raina unleashes the loft over extra cover and it's struck so well that it goes all the way
Rankin to Rahul, no run, fullish length this time and Rahul goes orthodox in his strokeplay, cover drive but fails to beat the ring on the off-side
Rankin to Rahul, no run, lost his shape a bit, back of a length and Rahul was backing away for the inside out drive. The length isn't there and forces him to mistime it back towards Rankin

Rankin to Rahul, SIX, that's in the crowd! Not that bad a ball but this lad is in such form that he will pounce on anything marginal. Fractionally short, he swivels across to play the pick up pull stroke. Into the stands at fine leg. Lovely timing!
Rankin to Raina, 1 run, more of the shorter length, Raina walks across a bit and helps the pull through backward square leg. The man at deep square leg gets around to tidy up
Rankin to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length angling into Rahul, he stays back and clips it towards short fine leg
Rankin to Raina, 1 run, shortish length, always is the staple length to bowl to Raina. Jabbed towards the mid-wicket region
Chase to Raina, 1 run, banged in short but doesn't rise much, Raina shuffles a bit to work this softly towards square leg to get off the mark
Chase to Rahul, 1 run, too straight in line and full as well, worked away through square leg for a single

Chase to Kohli, out Caught by Dockrell!! Massive wicket! Chase has Kohli yet again and unlike the last game when the situation brought about the wicket, this is an excellent delivery. The effort ball, bouncer, that's well-directed too and Kohli had to fetch it from outside off. Goes for the stroke but it kept climbing on him, thereby forcing a top edge. Was in the air for ages and Dockrell who ran all the way to fine leg from deep square leg, held his nerve to settle under it. Kohli was on the charge which is another reason that he couldn't control the stroke at all. Just the start Ireland would have wanted. Kohli c Dockrell b Chase 9(8) [4s-1]

Chase to Rahul, 1 run, ahhh, Rahul will be gutted at missing out on this gift. Juicy full toss it was but he was moving around in the crease to manufacture a stroke. As a result, couldn't get hold of this and it went off the inside half down to fine leg
Chase to Rahul, no run, a bit of inward movement off the track, Rahul was on the shuffle and had to adjust, which he did well. Nudged towards short mid-wicket
Chase to Kohli, 1 run, walks down the track and takes this one on the full, worked through square leg for a single
Rankin to Kohli, 1 run, on a length wider outside off, Kohli dabs it towards point where Porterfield makes a good diving stop. Wasn't a clean save but did enough to keep the batsmen to just a single

Rankin to Kohli, no run, in the air...safe! A slight moment of worry for Kohli, got cramped on this shorter length delivery directed at his ribs. Got a soft leading edge which fortunately for him, didn't carry to the off-side pack of fielders

Rankin to Kohli, FOUR, lost his shape a bit, did Kohli but still cleared the infield. Made some room to go for an ugly slog, got it off the inside half of the blade but managed to evade the mid-on fielder. First boundary for the skipper
Rankin to Kohli, 2 runs, brisk running allows them to convert a single into a brace. Too full and a bit too straight as well in line, Kohli unleashes that wristy flick through mid-wicket
Rankin to Kohli, no run, pitched up outside off, Kohli presses forward and defends it towards cover
Rankin to Rahul, 1 run, very full and on middle and leg, Rahul gets across and clips it wide of the mid-on fielder
Simi Singh to Rahul, 1 run, speared in around middle and leg, jammed towards mid-on for a quick single

Simi Singh to Rahul, FOUR, excellent shot! Lovely stroke from Rahul, makes room and lifts it inside out comfortably over wide mid-off. Sweet connection to clear the infield with ease. Intentions clear from Rahul. He ain't messing around
Simi Singh to Rahul, wide, marginal call, fired down leg but wasn't far from the leg stump as Rahul missed the sweep

Simi Singh to Rahul, FOUR, bang! Rahul wastes no time, he usually doesn't and we saw that in the recent IPL, didn't we? Walks down the track to this tossed up delivery and lifts it easily straight over Simi's head. Races away
Simi Singh to Kohli, 1 run, the skipper is also off the mark. Tossed up off break, too full and it's whipped down the ground to long-on
Simi Singh to Rahul, 1 run, flatter this time and straying onto the pads, worked away and beats the diving mid-wicket fielder this time. Off the mark
Simi Singh to Rahul, no run, a bit of turn on the off break, sticks onto the surface from a shorter length. Tucked to short mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Rankin, out Stumped! Yikes! India steamroll Ireland 2-0. 13 out of 20 wickets in these 2 games by spinners is a statement. The wrong'un by Kuldeep, Rankin charges him and has a wild heave, trying to hit through the line, and is beaten as Karthik collects it on the on-side and breaks the stumps - heck, he could've broken them a few times, that's how far Rankin was down the wicket. And that's that for the series. Done and dusted. Rankin st Karthik b Kuldeep Yadav 10(8) [6s-1]
Kuldeep Yadav to Rankin, 2 runs, a tad short, turning away from the left-hander, slapped away towards deep extra cover for a brace
Kuldeep Yadav to Rankin, no run, skidder, stays low, tucked into the on-side
Chahal to Chase, no run, leg-break, beats the defence of Chase

Chahal to S Thompson, out Bowled! Ireland still in danger of equalling their lowest T20I total. Thompson has a rush of blood after seeing the flight, charges down the wicket and is stumped (figuratively) by the leg-break as it sneaks past his inside edge onto the stumps. That would've been stumped if that had missed the stumps. S Thompson b Chahal 13(9) [4s-2]
Chahal to Rankin, 1 run, too straight and the leg-break too, Rankin gets back and tucks that round the corner for a single. Ireland equal their lowest T20I score.
Chahal to Rankin, wide, too far on the off-side and Rankin lets it go
Chahal to Rankin, no run, another leg-break but a tad wide outside off, but rather than top-spinning, it skids, making Rankin miss the cut
Chahal to S Thompson, 1 run, straighter from round the wicket, turning in, Thompson gets deep in the crease and whips it towards mid-wicket for a quick single
Chahal to S Thompson, no run, short and wide, Thompson tries the cut, misses out

Kuldeep Yadav to Rankin, SIX, another stock ball by Kuldeep, on a perfect length, but T20 is fast and you can't become predictable. Rankin made the adjustment this time, coming down the wicket with nimble feet, and lofted it with great timing and charisma straight down the ground for six. The Irish getting closer to their lowest T20 total.. Saves them some blushes
Kuldeep Yadav to S Thompson, 1 run, the stock ball again, but a tad shorter than Kuldeep would like, slapped away square of the wicket for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Rankin, 1 run, a little less flight on that, and Rankin gets in line to play the pick-up towards deep mid-wicket for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Rankin, no run, fuller length skidding towards the batsman who taps it towards mid-off
Kuldeep Yadav to S Thompson, 1 run, a rare half-tracker just outside off, and Ireland are so surprised that they forget to cash in - a carve straight to sweeper cover for a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Dockrell, out Caught by U Yadav! Oh this is no fun. The chinaman's stock delivery, turning in, Dockrell tries to loft it over long-on with the spin this time, but gets no timing on that as Umesh runs forward and comes around in time to get under that catch - a simple one. Ireland in tatters. Dockrell c U Yadav b Kuldeep Yadav 4(8)

Chahal to S Thompson, FOUR, another googly and another clueless slog across the line, some component of top-spin not taken into account and the top-edge goes over the ring into the long stop boundary for four
Chahal to S Thompson, FOUR, leg-break on middle and off, Thompson is already across to the off-side and lap-sweeps it to fine leg for four
Chahal to Dockrell, 3 runs, another flighted ball full of chicanery, another sweep across the line, gets a top-edge over slip to third man for three
Chahal to Dockrell, no run, leg-break on off and middle, straightening, Dockrell hurriedly jabs it into the pitch
Chahal to Dockrell, no run, loads of flight on that, outside off, Dockrell gets on his knees and tries an almighty heave, and gets it off the toe-end towards short mid-wicket
Chahal to Dockrell, no run, full delivery on middle, clipped away to mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Dockrell, 1 run, loopy again, tempting delivery but not quite there in the arc, Dockrell gets back to pull but it skids and turns into him sharply (the chinaman into the right-hander), and the miscued pull takes the inside edge to square leg. They steal another single
Kuldeep Yadav to Dockrell, no run, on a good length, not much turn on that, Dockrell gets to the pitch of it and dead-bats
Kuldeep Yadav to Dockrell, no run, on the pads and nudged into the on-side

Kuldeep Yadav to Wilson, out Bowled! Oh the mastery over guile that this man has. I might as well be watching him in black and white, so much tradition and pure cricket in that. Very loopy chinaman outside off, and turning back in, but the image changes to high frame-rate 21st century cricket again with an attempted drive through the off-side, but ends up looking like a slog across the line by an Irishman who is unable to read it off the hand. A horizontal-batted swat, and the ball crashes into the stumps. Wilson b Kuldeep Yadav 15(18) [4s-2]
Kuldeep Yadav to Wilson, no run, the googly, turning away, Wilson gets forward and calmly taps it late on the head and into the off-side

Kuldeep Yadav to Wilson, FOUR, too full and outside off, Wilson gets forward to smother the turn and plays a whippy reverse sweep. Very well-controlled and well-timed. Away she goes to the third man fence for four
Chahal to Wilson, 1 run, dragged down, turning away, Wilson treks back to cut it to sweeper cover
Chahal to S Thompson, 1 run, a nudge behind square on the short of length
Chahal to Wilson, 1 run, fetches this full ball from outside off and sweeps it to long leg
Chahal to S Thompson, 1 run, too straight, nurdled behind square leg

Chahal to Simi Singh, out Lbw!! Yuzvendra Chahal has his man. Was denied a wicket off the previous ball. Simi Singh moved across to play the premeditated sweep. It was a straight ball and Singh failed to put bat on ball. The impact was in front of off and that looked plumb. Simi Singh lbw b Chahal 0(2)
Chahal to Simi Singh, no run, the Indians are pleading. Looped up leg-break outside off, Simi Singh looks to defend by sticking his bat out. Replays show that there was a faint outside edge
Hardik Pandya to Wilson, no run, pitched up delivery, driven towards cover
Hardik Pandya to Wilson, no run, seaming away outside off from a good length, Wilson pokes and is too late to withdraw the bat from it. Beaten on the outside edge

Hardik Pandya to Wilson, FOUR, Kuldeep has made an absolute mess of that. Wide ball outside off and Wilson wafted his bat at it. The ball went straight to third man and Kuldeep fails to field it. Allows it to go for a boundary

Hardik Pandya to Kevin O Brien, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! Ireland are falling apart here without a fight. Kevin O Brien is gone for a duck. Tried to play the extravagant heave against a normal-paced length ball. The ball flies off the outside edge and lobs up towards third man. Kuldeep, the fielder there, comes forward and completes a low catch. Kevin O Brien c Kuldeep Yadav b Hardik Pandya 0(2)
batsman_bowler: Hardik Pandya to Kevin O Brien

comm: Hardik Pandya to Kevin O Brien, no run, slants this short of length delivery on off, Kevin O Brien turns it towards short mid-wicket, Pandya mops up
batsman_bowler: Hardik Pandya to Kevin O Brien

comm: Hardik Pandya to Wilson, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, flashed through point off the back foot
