Hardik Pandya to Wilson, wide, what was that from Hardik Pandya? Too short and down leg, Wilson lets it go

Chahal to Andy Balbirnie, out Bowled!! That's a teaser and Balbirnie falls for it. Chahal tosses this up, lands it around leg and gets the ball to turn. Balbirnie presses forward to push and ends up playing down the wrong line. The ball turns past the outside edge to crash into the stumps. A wicket in the very first over for Yuzvendra Chahal! Ireland - 30/4!Andy Balbirnie b Chahal 9(7) [4s-1]
Chahal to Wilson, 1 run, clears the front leg to hack over mid-wicket. Gets itt off the bottom part of the bat and a diving Pandya at mid-on saves three runs
Chahal to Wilson, no run, googly outside off, Wilson transfers his weight onto the back foot to cut. Can't beat point
Chahal to Andy Balbirnie, 1 run, plays in the direction of the turn. Balbirnie allows the ball to come to him by staying leg-side of the ball and push-drives it to long-off
Chahal to Wilson, 1 run, very full, swept hard to deep square leg
Chahal to Wilson, no run, starts with a quick googly on the stumps and thus cramping the batsman for room. Defended back to the bowler
Hardik Pandya to Wilson, 1 run, uses the width provided by Pandya to run it down to third man

Hardik Pandya to Andy Balbirnie, 1 run, slower ball - the off-cutter and Balbirnie is early into his drive. Decides to check the stroke, but is too late to do so. Ends up chipping it in the air. Luckily for the batsman, the ball fell well in front of the mid-off fielder
Hardik Pandya to Andy Balbirnie, no run, straight-batted punch to mid-on
Hardik Pandya to Wilson, 1 run, looks to drive on seeing the length on the fuller side. It was angled in and the ball trims the inside half before rolling towards mid-on

Hardik Pandya to Wilson, no run, out-seamer on a good length and around the fifth-sixth stump line, Wilson pokes with an open face of the bat. Lucky not to get an edge there. Missed the nick by a whisker
Hardik Pandya to Andy Balbirnie, 1 run, jabs a length ball towards mid-wicket and hares to the other end. A fumble from the fielder helped Balbirnie's cause
S Kaul to Wilson, no run, slower ball tweaking away from the right-hander, Wilson waits to cut, finds point
S Kaul to Wilson, wide, the quick bouncer, slightly too high and Wilson half-ducks under it. Called as a wide for height
S Kaul to Wilson, no run, punched off the back foot, can't find the gap in the point region

S Kaul to Shannon, out Caught by Rahul!! Maiden international wicket for Siddarth Kaul! A moment that he'll never forget. Oh, wait! The umpires go up to check if it is a fair delivery. Don't think there's anything behind the popping crease. The TV umpire takes his time to make the call. Looks like a no-ball to me. Well, I probably need to check my eyes. It's been deemed as a fair delivery. Was a pacy short ball that got big on the batsman. No room too and Shannon went with the pull shot. The ball ballooned up off the splice and settled into the hands of Rahul at extra cover. Probably, there was no sufficient evidence to overturn it to a no-ball. Shannon c Rahul b S Kaul 2(7)
S Kaul to Shannon, no run, now the normal-paced in-angler from a short of length, bunted into the leg-side
S Kaul to Shannon, no run, another slower ball at 115kph. Was the knuckle ball again. Shannon steps out of his crease and wafts his bat. Connects with thin air
S Kaul to Shannon, no run, the knuckle ball and Shannon is way too early into the shot. He looked to play the on-the-rise-punch and got beaten on the inside edge

U Yadav to Andy Balbirnie, FOUR, lovely drive! Doesn't overhit. It was a half-volley outside off, Balbirnie leant forward and caressed it through extra cover. No chance for the mid-off fielder. 18 runs and a wicket off the over
U Yadav to Andy Balbirnie, 2 runs, too straight, ends up bowling this in-tailing full ball on the pads, Balbirnie inside-edges the flick to fine leg

U Yadav to Porterfield, out Bowled!! Porterfield is miffed! He has himself to blame. Bowled around his legs trying to be cheeky. Shuffles across towards off to try the paddle sweep. Umesh bowled it full and on the stumps. Porterfield doesn't connect and the ball makes a mockery of the stumps. Second wicket for Umesh and Ireland are already under pressure. Porterfield b U Yadav 14(11) [4s-1 6s-1]

U Yadav to Porterfield, SIX, that's been kaboomed over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. Back-of-the-hand slower delivery from Umesh, Porterfield picked it early and dispatched it with distain. Got down, waited for the ball and clouted it over cow corner
U Yadav to Porterfield, 2 runs, loads of width on offer and Porterfield scythes it through point for a brace
U Yadav to Porterfield, FOUR, the bumper, but errs in line. Down leg and Porterfield gets some wood on his pull. That's enough as the ball runs away fine into the fine leg fence

S Kaul to Shannon, 2 runs, nicely picked up! Shannon moves across in his crease and whips this fullish ball on off over mid-wicket. Got more elevation than distance. Rohit Sharma mops it up. Just 3 runs off Kaul's maiden over in international cricket
S Kaul to Shannon, no run, slower delivery at 116kph, Shannon spots it late and pushes it to cover off the front foot

S Kaul to Shannon, no run, in-angler and Shannon has a shuffle across to hit across the line. Doesn't account for the inward angle and gets pinned on the pad. No major appeal for lbw as the angle would have taken it down leg
S Kaul to Porterfield, 1 run, back 131kph shortish ball just outside off, Porterfield mistimes the pull to the left of mid-on
S Kaul to Porterfield, no run, angling away length ball outside off, Porterfield flashes his bat hard at it. The ball doesn't bounce much and scoots under the bat of the left-hander
S Kaul to Porterfield, no run, tries to go after the debutant straightaway does Porterfield. Was a good length ball and Porterfield horribly mistimed it.. Off the toe end and the ball rolls to mid-on
U Yadav to Porterfield, 1 run, Umesh Yadav gets away with this leg-stump line ball. Was a full ball and Porterfield helps it along its way to long leg. Good start for Umesh and india
U Yadav to Porterfield, no run, very full, with width on offer, Porterfield jams it out to backward point
U Yadav to Porterfield, no run, nips in from a short of length and Porterfield is surprised by it. He is late to close his bat-face and he gets beaten on the inside edge. Got struck high on the thigh
U Yadav to Porterfield, no run, pitched up delivery, a crouched stance Porterfield pats it to cover

U Yadav to Stirling, out Caught by Raina!! Edged and gone! Umesh Yadav gets the early breakthrough. Outswinger from a short of length and Stirling drives without any feet movement. A bit of extra bounce catches the outside edge and goes towards first slip, where Raina cups it with ease. So, Umesh, who is playing his first T20I since August 2012, has a wicket off his second ball on comeback. Stirling c Raina b U Yadav 0(2)
U Yadav to Stirling, no run, starts with a shortish ball shaping away outside off, Stirling stands tall and pats it to cover

S Kaul to Adil Rashid, out Jordan Run Out!! Does MS Dhoni have the smartest cricket brain? He removed the right glove anticipating that England will try to steal a bye if Rashid doesn't make contact. Kaul beat the bat with a shortish ball and Jordan was rushing to the other end for a run. Dhoni collected the ball, took aim and bangggg, smashed the stumps to deny England a freebie. You never know, it could all come down to this one run saved. It did matter in the 2016 World T20 against Bangladesh! Jordan run out (Dhoni) 3(3)
S Kaul to Adil Rashid, no run, short of length was working for Pandya, short of a length will work for any bowler, so Kaul learns and ekes out a dot ball as Rashid swings and misses

S Kaul to Adil Rashid, FOUR, that's a good presence of mind from Adil Rashid. Third man and backward point inside the ring, so Rashid gives so room and guides the full toss along the ground and splits both the fielders

S Kaul to Plunkett, out Caught by Dhoni!! Edged and gone! Five catches for MS Dhoni, the first wicket-keeper to achieve the feat. Full and outside off stump, Plunkett wanted to play the scoop, but realised the ball was well outside off stump, so tried to hit to third man and ended up edging it to the keeper. Plunkett c Dhoni b S Kaul 9(4) [6s-1]
S Kaul to Plunkett, 2 runs, moves across the stumps, but Kaul bowls a fine yorker, Plunkett digs it out wide of mid-wicket
S Kaul to Jordan, 1 run, very full and outside off stump, hit away to sweeper cover
U Yadav to Jordan, 1 run, low full toss, squeezes it square of the wicket on the off-side
U Yadav to Plunkett, 1 run, very full and outside off stump, Plunkett drives it square of the wicket
U Yadav to Plunkett, SIX, full toss and muscled over mid-wicket. Pandya at deep mid-wicket was livid with Umesh for bowling a full toss, he wants the bowler to land the ball and not offer gifts

U Yadav to Willey, out Bowled!! India are doing well to keep the wickets column ticking. Fine yorker outside off stump, Willey tries to dig it out, drags it back onto the stumps. Willey b U Yadav 1(2)
U Yadav to Jordan, 1 run, full and outside off stump, Jordan drives it to mid-off
U Yadav to Willey, 1 run, yorker outside off stump, Willey digs it out to backward point

Hardik Pandya to Bairstow, out Caught by Dhoni!! Four wickets for Hardik Pandya, career-best for him. What a game he's having. First over went for 22, and then he takes 4 wickets for 16 runs in his next three overs. Full delivery outside off stump, Bairstow backed away and then tried to reach out to play this ball through the off-side, got a thick edge and Dhoni takes his fourth catch. Bairstow c Dhoni b Hardik Pandya 25(14) [4s-2 6s-2]
Hardik Pandya to Bairstow, FOUR, slower ball in the slot and Bairstow has a solid base to muscle this off over extra-cover

Hardik Pandya to Stokes, out Caught by Kohli!! That's not going where it was intended. Straight to long-off and Hardik Pandya has his third wicket. Back of a length delivery just outside off stump, Stokes tries to pull, ends up hitting it very straight and holes out. Stokes c Kohli b Hardik Pandya 14(10) [4s-2]
Hardik Pandya to Stokes, no run, slower ball, Stokes goes for a big heave, but misses, beaten for change of pace
Hardik Pandya to Bairstow, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Bairstow slogs to deep mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Stokes, 1 run, shortish from Hardik Pandya, Stokes flat-bats it to long-off
U Yadav to Bairstow, no run, oh that goes between Bairstow's legs as he backs away to make contact with the ball
U Yadav to Stokes, leg byes, 1 run, full ball, Stokes misses the flick, the ball pitched outside leg

U Yadav to Stokes, FOUR, oh these batsmen. They are allowed to dance around in the crease at will. This is actually a leg stump yorker, but Stokes was so much across the stumps that he managed to tickle it fine to fine leg. For a moment it looked like he would be out bowled

U Yadav to Bairstow, leg byes, 1 run, yorker, appeal for LBW as Bairstow swings and misses, the ball was probably missing leg, they sneak a run, Umesh tries to kick the ball onto the stumps but misses the target

U Yadav to Bairstow, SIX, how did he manage to hit that so well? Umesh went for the wide yorker, but went as a full ball, Bairstow wasn't there with the feet moving towards the leg-side, but he reached out and managed to loft the ball handsomely over deep cover
U Yadav to Bairstow, FOUR, that's a really bad full toss down the leg-side, Bairstow helps it away fine and beats fine leg. The yorker went awfully wrong
S Kaul to Bairstow, 1 run, full toss, Bairstow swings it away to mid-wicket. Bairstow missed out on a freebie there
S Kaul to Stokes, 1 run, oh Stokes has lost the bat from his hand as he swung hard at this ball, it flew towards short fine leg and the ball went to deep cover
S Kaul to Bairstow, 1 run, misses the yorker and bowls a full ball, Bairstow drills it hard to long-on
S Kaul to Stokes, 1 run, very full and outside off stump, Stokes drills it to sweeper cover
S Kaul to Stokes, FOUR, that's cleverly done! Low full toss way outside off stump, tried the yorker and got it wrong, third is inside the ring and Stokes sliced that to the right of the fielder
S Kaul to Bairstow, 1 run, full delivery outside off stump, Bairstow wanted to muscle that over cover, but got an inside edge that rolls to short fine leg
Chahar to Bairstow, 1 run, shortish slower ball, Bairstow pulls it to mid-wicket
Chahar to Bairstow, SIX, whipped away nicely. Full and on the leg stump, Bairstow stays leg-side of the ball and smashes it with his wrists over mid-wicket
Chahar to Bairstow, no run, good length delivery outside off stump, Bairstow drives it towards cover
Chahar to Bairstow, no run, short of length delivery down the leg-side, Bairstow misses the flick and the ball rolls into the on-side off the pad
Chahar to Stokes, 1 run, outside off stump, guided to third man
Chahar to Stokes, 2 runs, moves across and flicks the length ball to deep mid-wicket

Hardik Pandya to Hales, out Caught by Dhoni!! This is another wicket for Hardik Pandya and another catch for Dhoni. Third thus far for MS. The hard length again working for Pandya, Hales was hanging back and trying to guide the ball to third man, maybe the extra bounce did him in and took the edge through to Dhoni. Hales c Dhoni b Hardik Pandya 30(24) [4s-3 6s-2]

Hardik Pandya to Hales, SIX, now that's timed so sweetly. Hardik Pandya targets the head of the batsman, but Hales hooks the ball despite not having his eyes on it and gets it from the middle of the bat, flies over deep backward square leg
Hardik Pandya to Hales, no run, slower delivery outside off stump, Hales swings and misses
Hardik Pandya to Hales, no run, shortish delivery from Hardik Pandya, Hales defends

Hardik Pandya to Eoin Morgan, out Caught by Dhoni!! Now then, this is again high in the air, this time Dhoni calls for it and ohh he takes the catch despite crashing into the stumps at the striker's end. A similar ball to the previous ball, similar shot as well, a massive slog, gets the outside half of the bat and flies way high in the air, Dhoni runs forward and takes responsibility after seeing the previous catch not being taken. Pandya actually called for it, but Dhoni was clear in his communication that he wanted to go for it. Eoin Morgan c Dhoni b Hardik Pandya 6(9)

Hardik Pandya to Eoin Morgan, 2 runs, Chahal has banged his head hard on the ground while trying to take this catch. This was a full delivery outside off stump, Morgan lost shape on the attempted big hit and sliced it high in the air towards extra-cover, Chahal was back-tracking a bit and realised the ball was going further back over his head, tries to catch it above his head and lost it. Immediately makes impact on the ground with his head and is down in pain. Indian players check on him
Chahal to Hales, FOUR, now the bowler gets the length wrong and Hales takes full toll. Full and in the slot, bunted down the ground and long-on is very wide

Chahal to Hales, FOUR, that's a decent ball, but credit to Hales for managing to reach out far, yet time the ball well to beat the man sweeping the off-side boundary. Hales' long reach helped there and he met the well despite being off balance. Chahal wanted to outsmart the batsman by bowling wide outside off stump, but Hales was up for the challenge
Chahal to Hales, 2 runs, down the pitch, big heave attempted, not to the pitch of the ball, so the ball goes off the inside half of the bat and rolls towards deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Hales, no run, slapped away straight to the man cover
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, well bowled, Morgan rushed down the pitch, Chahal spotted him and dragged the length ball, mishit slog along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Hales, 1 run, Dhoni applauds Chahal for bowling a disciplined flatter delivery on the leg stump, Hales was cramped on the cut shot, played to sweeper cover

Hardik Pandya to Hales, 1 run, oh hit the helmet, was there an edge as well? The ball lands beyond the fielders at backward point and short third man. Surprise short ball, Hales probably was expecting short of length, was so late on the pull, may have just got a tickle. Calls for a drink, looks alright

Hardik Pandya to Hales, no run, this is excellent stuff from Hardik Pandya. He kept Morgan calm by bowling the hard length, so doesn't want to try anything fancy, bowls short of length delivery and Hales goes for a big slog, misses completely
Hardik Pandya to Hales, no run, another one that's just outside off stump on a good length, Hales defends to point
Hardik Pandya to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, this time he gets the guide fine enough and sends it to third man
Hardik Pandya to Eoin Morgan, no run, tight line, good length on the stumps, Morgan stays leg-side and tries to glide the ball in the gap, but finds backward point
Hardik Pandya to Eoin Morgan, no run, short of length delivery on the stumps, Morgan defends to the left of the bowler
Chahal to Hales, FOUR, the fuller length helps Hales with a boundary. Down on one knee and then a slog across the line, to the left of deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Hales, no run, Chahal hurries Hales with a quick ball, Hales wasn't in a great position, no feet, just managed to defend from the crease
Chahal to Hales, no run, flatter in trajectory, blocked into the on-side

Chahal to Eoin Morgan, leg byes, 1 run, off the pad, but not given LBW because the ball pitched outside leg stump, may have been slipping down as well. Morgan failed to connect the glance/flick on that occasion
Chahal to Hales, 1 run, flatter delivery on the leg stump, Hales punches to long-on
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, spinning back in, Morgan goes back and works it wide towards mid-on, Chahal dives to his left and gets a hand on the ball
Chahar to Hales, no run, length ball and tapped away into the off-side. Morgan wanted a single but Hales sends him back witha loud call of 'no'
Chahar to Hales, SIX, low full toss, does not hit it well but lends enough power and gets it well over long-on. Second six of the over!
Chahar to Hales, no ball, tries the short ball again. That was down leg and was over the shoulder. Second short ball and has been penalized. Free hit coming up
Chahar to Hales, no run, short ball, carries well into the mitts of the keeper. The batsman lets it go as he did not want to drag the ball away from well outside off
Chahar to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, edge or an educated edge? The ball runs away off the outer edge and runs fine to third man. The fielder covers good ground to his right and hauls it back

Chahar to Roy, out Caught by Dhoni!! The debutant strikes. Must be a delighted and relieved man after the first ball that he bowled. Drops it short but angles it in. The batsman is cramped for room and still looks to cut it away. The ball takes a faint edge and almost dies down to the keeper, who does enough to have his gloves under the ball. Soft dismissal but India will take it. Roy c Dhoni b Chahar 67(31) [4s-4 6s-7]
Chahar to Roy, SIX, insanity returns.. That was a length ball and the recipe to hit it away is just power the shot through. Drop kicks the ball over widish long-on for a massive sixer

Chahal to Roy, 1 run, walks at the ball and nudges the ball away into the cow corner region for a single. They thought of a couple but the man at long-on did well to cut the angle and got to the ball pretty quickly
Chahal to Hales, 1 run, punches it with the turn and sends it to long-off
Chahal to Hales, no run, back to the leggie, but a bit leg-sidish line confused the batsman. Soft leading edge sends it back to the bowler
Chahal to Hales, no run, might have been the googly and has been defended into the off-side as the batsman picked it late
Chahal to Roy, 1 run, backs away and jabs the ball down into the covers to earn a single. That again did not turn and went straight through
Chahal to Roy, no run, flatter ball, pushed back to the bowler
S Kaul to Hales, no run, back of a length delivery outside off and has been pushed away into the covers. The man at cover got to it quickly and denied the single

S Kaul to Buttler, out Bowled!! Timbahhhh! That was a fuller length ball and the swipe across the line is missed for the wood work to be in a mess. Kaul exults in delight. They were in the top gear mode and wanted to cash in more and that I guess resulted in this rush of blood stroke. An ugly cramped up slog resulted in the downfall. Buttler b S Kaul 34(21) [4s-7]
S Kaul to Buttler, FOUR, top-edge over the keeper and that is a four. The batsman was late on that short ball and it flew away towards the fence on a few bounces
S Kaul to Roy, 1 run, uses the pace on that length delivery and steers it for the man at short third to dive and stop it

S Kaul to Roy, SIX, slower delivery, the knuckle ball but that has gone the journey as well. The batsman got into position and picked the bones out of that dead meat of a delivery. Fetch that was a silent cry from the batsman
S Kaul to Buttler, 1 run, pummels the drive down the ground to find the man at long-off
Chahal to Roy, no run, goes for the reverse and may be managed an inside edge to send the ball bobbling away into the off-side

Chahal to Roy, SIX, fetches the ball from outside off and slams it over long-on. Powerful hit from Roy to the shorter part of the ground. Not a bad ball but was slightly fuller and that allowed the batsman to target the straighter boundary. Fifty in no time for the opener as well. Has been a superb knock

Chahal to Buttler, 1 run, does well to get there does Sid Kaul but the ball pops out. That was a mistimed slog sweep and it went really high. The man from deep mid - Kaul - came charging in and got there. Put in the slide and got both hands as well but the ball popped out. Buttler gets a reprieve
Chahal to Roy, 1 run, drags the ball short, the batsman exposes his sticks and chops the ball away to deep cover. Took it from the sticks there
Chahal to Buttler, 1 run, on the pads, clipped away into the on-side for a single
Chahal to Buttler, no run, goes for the reverse straightaway and inside edges the ball on to the pads. There was an optimistic appeal from Chahal which died down quickly

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, muscles the drive towards long-on for a single as it was pitched up. 22 of the over. Pandya taken to the cleaners. England are motoring away on this highway of a wicket
Hardik Pandya to Roy, 1 run, jabs the ball out into the off-side for a single

Hardik Pandya to Roy, SIX, another one over the ropes. This time just.. That was fuller and Roy took it on. Lofted it high and is saved by the smaller dimension towards that region. Chahar there was at the boundary line and puts in a lame effort to take that. Could have done better but I feel still would have been a sixer
Hardik Pandya to Roy, SIX, short ball disappears again. The batsman pivots on the back foot to send it over deep square leg for a sixer. Did not break a sweat. 14 of the over already
Hardik Pandya to Roy, FOUR, action replay! May be a little squarer. The result is the same. Short ball, the batsman gobbles the ball up with a pull
Hardik Pandya to Roy, FOUR, short ball on a grassy wicket..mmm..poor. The batsman just helps himself with a pull to fine leg and one bounce into the fence

S Kaul to Roy, 1 run, in the blockhole and the batsman digs the ball out to short fine leg. The fielder there has a shy at the batter's end but that was an easy single. 51 for nought in 5 overs. England will take it with open arms
S Kaul to Roy, no run, full, too full, a screaming drive but it fails to beat the man at mid-off. That should have been put away
S Kaul to Roy, no run, angles the ball in and that missing the sticks. The batsman missed the clip and is rapped the pads. No appeal as it was easily going down

S Kaul to Roy, SIX, length ball and you know the rest of the story..The fielder fetches it from the long-off fence. Roy moved forward and bulldozed the ball over long-off for a maximum to bring the fifty up. England are off to a flier
S Kaul to Roy, no run, knuckle ball unleashed. The batsman delays his drive and powers the ball on the up to find mid-off

S Kaul to Buttler, leg byes, 1 run, yorkerish delivery but was easily going down. The bowler appeals in vain as the umpire signals it leg byes. Even MS did not show any emotion. That was really full and crashed into the boot of the batsman to dribble away to fine leg
U Yadav to Roy, SIX, thumped down the ground. Over long-off for a flat six. That was in the slot and Roy made it into a journey ball. The right destination was found. India under the pump
U Yadav to Roy, no run, drops the ball short and the batsman inside edges it on to the pads as the ball skidded on. That was bread and butter for Roy but he tried hitting it too hard I guess
U Yadav to Roy, FOUR, too full, drive is powered to mid-off and it bursts through Pandya. Poor effort as that one should have been stopped. Got into an awkward position and let it through
U Yadav to Roy, no run, jabs the ball away into the off-side as it decked in again. More the length to bowl if the batsman are not charging at you
U Yadav to Roy, no run, length delivery and zoning in, pushed back to the bowler as the ball was aimed for the sticks
U Yadav to Roy, FOUR, charges out and drives the ball down the track. Beats the mid-off easily as the batsman had got to the pitch of the ball to work his angle out and get it in the gap
Chahar to Roy, 1 run, stays rooted to a fuller ball and works the ball to mid-on. Single is on as again the fielder was at the edge of the circle and he had played it with soft hands
Chahar to Buttler, 1 run, camps out and pushes the ball out into the off-side to scamper a single. Kohli has a powerful throw to make at the batter's end but finds no gains
Chahar to Buttler, no run, short of length delivery and it shapes away to beat the outer edge on the attempted drive. Beaten comprehensively. Lovely swing on that, finally

Chahar to Buttler, FOUR, short ball, not his forte and the batsman hacks the ball away with a pull. The ball flies away between mid-wicket abd mid-on for a four. Hands on head for the bowler but that was well placed
Chahar to Buttler, no run, walks down the track and drops the ball dead as the bowler had seen him coming down the track. That meant he bailed out of his intentions
Chahar to Buttler, no run, drops his length a bit, the batsman stays his crease and punches the drive on the up to find the man at extra cover

U Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, shortens his length and the batsman tucks the ball away to mid-on with soft hands to eke out a single. The man at mid-on I guess was on the edge of the circle and that prompted the opener to take the single
U Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, bad ball, short ball, hammered off the back foot with a swivelled pull. No one at the deep behind square and that was easy peasy for the aggressor

U Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, Buttler is in the form of his life. Full, tailing away a bit but thumped over the bowler's head. The bat face turned on impact but he lent enough power on it to send it away. More of a sliced hit
U Yadav to Roy, 1 run, gets the ball to slant away as the shape was nice. The batsman plays within himself and checks his push drive into the covers for a single
U Yadav to Roy, no run, length ball, channelling away and has been left alone

U Yadav to Roy, no run, away swinger as Umesh finds his mark straightaway, quite unlike the newbie. The batsman was drawn into a drive and the ball misses the bat not by much. The ball dies down to the keeper

Chahar to Buttler, FOUR, that swung! Went wide of the crease and angled it in. The batsman manages a thickish inner half of the bat trying to drive it on the up. The ball runs away through the square leg region and into the fence for a four. Short boundary and a quick outfield helping the cause of the batsman
Chahar to Buttler, no run, chops the ball away outside off and it finds the man just behind square. There was room but the batsman played it with caution
Chahar to Buttler, FOUR, it is not swinging! That was full and has been drop kicked over mid-on for a four. Buttler is off to a flier again. Chahar is under the pump here
Chahar to Buttler, FOUR, walks into the drive and places it between the man at cover and mid-off for a four. Superb stuff. Aggressive from Buttler
Chahar to Buttler, no run, little short with his length outside off and has been punched off the back foot into the mid-off region. More off the toe-end making contact
Chahar to Roy, 1 run, full ball on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg for a single. Nervy start for the young man

Jordan to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Hardik Pandya finishes it off in style. What a way to finish the game. Pandya sees the slower delivery and then thumps it high over long-on. Caught it sweetly and that's India wrapping up the series 2-1. End of story
Jordan to Hardik Pandya, no run, backs away and slaps the slower delivery, but finds extra-cover

Jordan to Rohit, 1 run, 100 for Rohit. Dabbed to the left of Roy at backward point and an easy single. No extravagant or exuberant celebrations as he raises the bat and soaks in all the mad applause. Hardik Pandya comes up to Rohit to hug him. Cometh the hour, cometh the man kind of thing

Jordan to Rohit, FOUR, on 99 now. Full outside off, Rohit crashes it over extra-cover. Enough elevation on the hit and it scorches away to the ropes. Jordan bowled a half-volley and didn't get away with it

Willey to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Hardik Pandya is putting Rohit at risk of not getting 100. But that's the minor picture here, short of length outside off, dabbed wide of Ball at short third, well wide of him and 20 off that over

Willey to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, this is getting over quickly. Hardik Pandya applying the finishing touches. Low full-toss outside off, Hardik Pandya sliced it again, one hand came off the bat but the timing was so good that it left sweeper with no chance, he dived but it skimmed away, four more
Willey to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Hardik Pandya slices it and over wide long-off. Dropped in the crowd. Willey missed his length there and Pandya teed off, deep in his crease and didn't hold back
Willey to Rohit, 1 run, yorker length outside off, Rohit toe-ends the drive to sweeper cover. One hand came off the bat

Willey to Rohit, FOUR, a grimace from Rohit as he gets four. Shuffled across well outside off and then paddled it to the deep backward square leg fence, nearly all the way, one bounce over the ropes. Outthought the bowler there
Willey to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, very full outside off, Hardik Pandya drives to deep cover
J Ball to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, an yorker, arrowing in at the base of off, Hardik Pandya digs it out to third man and will keep strike
J Ball to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Rohit steers it to third man
J Ball to Rohit, FOUR, he is pulling them so well today. Takes the short ball from outside off and pulls hard, bisects deep square and deep mid, right into the gap and the third boundary of the over
J Ball to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, short into the body, cramps Hardik Pandya up, but they get the single to the left of Roy at backward point

J Ball to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, this is a fine fine shot. Full outside off, Hardik Pandya opens the face of the bat and directs it well wide of third man. That should be the game - or is too early to call?
J Ball to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, mid-off was in and Hardik Pandya lofts cleanly over that man. A cutter on a length, sat up for the batsman to stand tall and use his long levers
Adil Rashid to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, speared in full on the middle and leg line, Hardik Pandya heaves it straight to the fielder at deep mid
Adil Rashid to Rohit, 1 run, cut away to the man at sweeper, another single
Adil Rashid to Rohit, no run, Hardik Pandya has to be sent back after Rohit advanced and dabbed it to short third, the ball went too quickly and there was never a chance of a run there
Adil Rashid to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, fired in fuller on the stumps, Hardik Pandya drills it to long-on
Adil Rashid to Hardik Pandya, no run, tossed up outside off, Hardik Pandya has a sighter, leaves to Buttler
Adil Rashid to Rohit, 1 run, shortish outside off, Rohit chops it to the right of backward point, a single stolen
Jordan to Hardik Pandya, no run, slower delivery on a short of length outside off, Hardik Pandya pushes to the left of Roy at backward point, wants a quick single, Rohit sends him back

Jordan to Kohli, out Caught&Bowled!! Rule 1 - never hit anything in the air near Jordan's vicinity. He can catch aeroplanes if he could. What a fielder. What an athlete. What a catch. This is drilled hard and at his belly, what does he do, nonchalantly hangs on and leaves Kohli shell-shocked. But has this come too late? Or can England break open the door through this opening. Kohli c and b Jordan 43(29) [4s-2 6s-2]
Jordan to Rohit, 1 run, low full-toss on off, flicked to deep mid
Jordan to Rohit, no run, backs away to clear extra-cover, but Jordan keeps it full and denies Rohit the width, bunted to cover
Jordan to Rohit, no run, pitched up outside off, Rohit tried to hit it too hard, skims off the thick inside half, to the right of Jordan who fields
Jordan to Kohli, 1 run, slower delivery down hit into the pitch, Kohli picks it, waits and shovels it to deep mid
Jordan to Kohli, wide, just wide of the tramline outside off, Jordan won't get away
Plunkett to Rohit, FOUR, not the purest of connections but it is in the gap and four more. Full outside off, may have been cross-seam as well, Rohit lofts and finds the gap at cover
Plunkett to Kohli, 1 run, very full outside off, Kohli on the walk wrists it to long-on
Plunkett to Rohit, 1 run, pitched up outside off, Rohit drives square of the wicket, and the ball has travelled at the rate of light. Kohli says no to the second
Plunkett to Kohli, 1 run, short outside off, pulled handsomely, but straight to the fielder at deep mid

Plunkett to Kohli, SIX, the back foot stumbled but such power from Kohli as he sends this full delivery outside off over long-off. Even Kohli is surprised by the hit, flashes a big smile on his face. He was forcing all his body weight into the shot, when his back leg was dancing in all directions. But those forearms built like tree-trunks powers the ball. Wow
Plunkett to Kohli, no run, Kohli is beaten as he advanced and attempted to carve Plunkett over cover. Lost shape and that's why he couldn't connect

Jordan to Rohit, SIX, one bad ball in the whole over and that has spoilt everything. Low full-toss, angling into middle, Rohit flicks and it goes flat over deep backward square leg. No effort at all put into the shot, pure timing
Jordan to Rohit, no run, defeated by the slowness of the delivery, Rohit is down the wicket, looking to pull, swings too early, toe-ends it back and Jordan fields
Jordan to Kohli, 1 run, low full-toss on off, thumped flat to long-on where Stokes fields
Jordan to Rohit, 1 run, Jordan bowls another slower delivery on the stumps, deftly guided fine of third man, but still only a single
Jordan to Kohli, 1 run, slower delivery down leg, nudged to deep mid, Kohli wants two, but Rohit isn't that quick
Jordan to Rohit, 1 run, full outside off, sliced to the left of Roy at backward point who dives and keeps it to a single
Adil Rashid to Rohit, 1 run, still short, Rohit punches to sweeper
Adil Rashid to Kohli, 1 run, this is slightly on the middle and leg line, nudged behind square
Adil Rashid to Kohli, no run, skidder, hurries off the deck, turned to mid-wicket
Adil Rashid to Kohli, SIX, huge. Down the track, to this tossed up delivery outside off and a clean swing of the bat sends the ball into the stands at long-on. What timing and footwork
Adil Rashid to Kohli, no run, skidder on middle, Kohli rocks back to punch, finds cover
Adil Rashid to Rohit, 1 run, comes down the track and looks to go big, got too close to the pitch, that's why he dragged it to long-on
Plunkett to Rohit, 1 run, low full-toss, on the stumps, Rohit clips it to long-on. Retains the strike

Plunkett to Rohit, FOUR, that's cheeky. Another good delivery and it has gone for four. Short into the body of a backing away, who allows the ball to deflect off the bat fine of Buttler and for four. Kohli punches the gloves with Rohit

Plunkett to Rohit, SIX, smashing blow. That's Rohit at his very best. A cross-seam length ball outside off and Rohit has deposited it miles over deep mid. Stayed back and biffed it with all his power. He now wants to get going
Plunkett to Kohli, 1 run, a step forward and another short delivery into the ribs of Kohli, who pulls to deep backward square
Plunkett to Kohli, 2 runs, can deep square get there? No he can't. Bounces in front of him and they take two. Kohli splicing the pull as Plunkett dug it in short
Plunkett to Kohli, 2 runs, a slower delivery to re-enter, Kohli charges and gets a thick inside edge in front of long leg. Since the ball went slowly, they charge back for the second
Adil Rashid to Rohit, 2 runs, wants to charge Adil Rashid, but the leggie has dragged it down after seeing Rohit use his feet. Punched to the left of sweeper

Adil Rashid to Rohit, no run, this tossed up delivery goes straight on and beats Rohit's big attempt at a slog-sweep. Kept low and a good take by Buttler. Whipped the bails off, but Rohit hadn't gone anywhere
Adil Rashid to Rohit, no run, tossed up a bit, Rohit dabs to backward point
Adil Rashid to Kohli, 1 run, skidder on middle, short-arm jabbed to deep mid

Adil Rashid to Kohli, 2 runs, when it is tossed up like that, Kohli will get forward and then power the weight into the shot, using his bottom hand, long-off has to be quick to prevent the boundary and he is
Adil Rashid to Kohli, FOUR, too short. Can't do that. Kohli waits and then cuts hard through backward point. Raced away beating sweeper cover. Top shot
Stokes to Kohli, 1 run, comes forward and flicks the full ball to deep mid
Stokes to Rohit, 1 run, short of length outside off, Rohit punches and again Roy at backward point does ever so well, dives to his left and parries it to third man
Stokes to Kohli, 1 run, short of length on the pads, swatted away to fine leg
Stokes to Rohit, 1 run, "catch" was the cry as Rohit sliced it and the bottom hand came off as he flayed at a wide delivery outside off, doesn't carry to third man though

Stokes to Rohit, FOUR, 50 for Rohit. Not the most convincing way to get there, but he will take it, pacy short delivery over the shoulder of Rohit, who is beaten for pace, gloves it and it loops wide of Buttler. Beats fine leg who is too square
Stokes to Kohli, 1 run, yorker length outside off, dug out to third man
Adil Rashid to Kohli, 1 run, conventional leggie outside off, Kohli drives to sweeper
Adil Rashid to Rohit, 1 run, another one that skids on, this arrows in towards middle and leg, tucked to deep mid
Adil Rashid to Rohit, FOUR, brilliant back-cut. Fraction short outside off and spinning away, Rohit delays the cut to the nth second and beats both backward point and sweeper
Adil Rashid to Kohli, 1 run, this stayed low, around off, but Kohli punches it wide of cover
Adil Rashid to Rohit, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Rohit pushes it to sweeper cover
Adil Rashid to Rohit, 2 runs, the front of the hand skidder, cut square of the wicket, and Bairstow does well to run around at sweeper, dive and that saves two
Stokes to Kohli, no run, angled in on off and middle, Kohli flicks and finds mid-wicket
Stokes to Rohit, 1 run, cross-seam yorker length delivery outside off, Rohit reaches out and squeezes it out, they scamper across for a quick single
Stokes to Rohit, no run, short of length outside off, Rohit mistimes the cut, dribbles away to Roy at backward point
Stokes to Rohit, no run, just inside the tramline and beats Rohit's attempt to squeeze it out. The sound was bat hitting the ground
Stokes to Kohli, 1 run, great sound of the bat as Kohli gets forward and crunches the cover-drive to the sweeper

Stokes to Kohli, no run, great fielding by Roy at backward point. Saved four. Exquisite square drive and Roy dove to his left, came up with the ball and even had a shy at Rohit's end. All this after Stokes overpitched
J Ball to Kohli, 1 run, short of length outside off, dabbed down to third man
J Ball to Kohli, FOUR, trademark Kohli. Can't get anywhere near his pads, this is around off and middle, flicked stylishly and beats mid-wicket. Timing is great and it scorches across the turf
J Ball to Kohli, 2 runs, poor from Hales at third man. Granted there was a bad bounce, but he fumbles and that allows Kohli to get off the mark with two
J Ball to Rohit, 1 run, slower delivery on the pads, nudged away behind square

J Ball to Rahul, out Caught by Jordan!! Monster catch. By a monster athlete. I daresay that only Jordan could've pulled off something like this out of anyone involved in the match. When Rahul hit it, it looked it was going all the way, but that was not the case - more height than elevation, it stayed in the air forever, Jordan at mid-on backtracked and when he held on, his body was parallel to the ground as he flew to cup it. Unbelievable catch and that leaves KL dumbfounded. He can't believe that it has been taken. Turning point? Let's wait and watch. Rahul c Jordan b J Ball 19(10) [4s-1 6s-2]

J Ball to Rahul, SIX, what a shot. This is a back of a length delivery outside off and what does Rahul do? He unleashes his inner Kevin Pietersen, flamingo-pulls and connects beautifully which sends the ball soaring over deep backward square leg. Some shot as Ball didn't do much wrong. That's all class of Rahul on display
Plunkett to Rahul, 1 run, knocks the slower delivery to the left of Jordan at mid-on

Plunkett to Rahul, SIX, Plunkett blows his cheeks and that's all he can do. "Children size boundaries" is the comment from Swann on air. This full delivery outside off had too much width, allowed Rahul a full extension of the arms on the lofted hit. Slicked over deep point and all the way
Plunkett to Rahul, no run, back of a length outside off, Rahul went too hard on the cut, mistimed it to Roy at backward point
Plunkett to Rohit, 1 run, full on the pads, a slower delivery too, flicked to the man at mid-wicket who is deep

Plunkett to Rohit, FOUR, sliced in the air and good enough to clear the infield. Pitched up outside off, Rohit aimed over extra-cover, this went over cover-point sort of but since this is the powerplay, the off-side ring is packed so easy four
Plunkett to Rahul, 1 run, short of length outside off, guided away with an open face to third man
Jordan to Rohit, no run, slower delivery outside off, pushed past Jordan, Rahul wanted the quick single, Rohit too did, but then decided against it

Jordan to Rohit, SIX, now six over deep backward square leg. These short ones won't trouble Rohit. Not when it is not near his shoulder or above it, here he swivels and pulls effortlessly and that brings a fist pump from captain Kohli and smiles from the others

Jordan to Rohit, SIX, hint of arrogance and a smirk of anger dotted Rohit's face after the ball flew over the fence for a biggie. Not an overtly emotional guy, but that's his way of showing he means business. Length delivery in the slot, Rohit clears his front leg and middles it high over long-on. Clean hit
Jordan to Rohit, no run, good line and length on the stumps, tight, Rohit defends

Jordan to Rohit, no run, this time Willey does well to dive forward and get the body in front of him to stop another fierce slap from Rohit's bat. Or else this one would have gone to the fence as well
Jordan to Rohit, FOUR, bashed. No respect for that half-volley outside off as Rohit stays where he is and then uses the bat to flow through the line, cover-point was just a spectator
Willey to Rohit, 1 run, full with no swing, Rohit flicks to deep mid to keep the strike
Willey to Rahul, 1 run, full on off, a punchy drive to mid-off, easy single
Willey to Rahul, no run, short of length on the stumps, Rahul defends with soft hands but Roy is quick at backward point
Willey to Rahul, no run, pitched up outside off, Rahul pushes it to cover

Willey to Rahul, FOUR, that's the class and the form he is in at the moment on display. A step forward even before Willey delivered that one, a straight-batted punch down the ground and it beats both mid-off and mid-on. Classy and Raina and Kohli appreciate that shot by clapping from the dug-out

Willey to Dhawan, out Caught by J Ball!! What a catch and all Dhawan can do is shake his head with a smile and go off. Soft dismissal it must be said though, on the pads, there to be flicked away, with short fine inside the ring, Dhawan does so, but fails to keep it down and Ball with that tall frame of his, dives to his left and clings on. Dhawan c J Ball b Willey 5(3) [4s-1]
J Ball to Rohit, FOUR, how easy. So easy. Ball follows Rohit with a slower delivery on the pads after the batsman made room, just a clip and it gives deep square no chance. Placed right into the gap
J Ball to Dhawan, 1 run, Ball is running in and hitting the pitch hard, tucks up Dhawan with a short of length delivery on the stumps, defended to the backward point region for a single
J Ball to Rohit, 1 run, slower delivery on the pads, turned wide of mid-wicket
J Ball to Rohit, no run, good bowling. Hitting the pitch hard again, Rohit wrists it back to the right of Ball
J Ball to Rohit, no run, that's a good riposte. On a short of length and around off, hint of away movement, nearly squared Rohit up, who defends to cover, awkwardly it must be said though

J Ball to Rohit, FOUR, last match he got Rohit with a short ball at the chest and above it, this is on the waist, easy for Rohit to swivel and place the pull wide of short fine leg inside the ring. Not the ideal start for Ball

Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, what a shot. What a way to get off the mark. Glorious from Dhawan. Leans into the cover-drive and beats a host of fielders on the off-side, supreme timing on the drive and it raced away. The balance was also magnificent that time
Willey to Rohit, 1 run, again a step out, to counter the swing, nudged wide of mid-wicket for a single
Willey to Rohit, no run, the tempter outside off, full and with the angle, away, left alone
Willey to Rohit, SIX, six and off the mark in style. A shimmy down the track to get to the pitch, flicks effortlessly, with the swing and over mid-wicket. Goes all the way
Willey to Rohit, no run, now beats him. Lovely away-slanter, Rohit's feet goes nowhwere and he is lucky not to edge that

Willey to Rohit, no run, ooh! Close. First ball. And they don't take the review. Willey was interested, after he pinged Rohit on the move on the pads, swung in and the impact was around middle, middle and leg. The umpire shakes his head. Good start by Willey

SN Thakur to Mehidy Hasan, 2 runs, again down the track, but the length is shorter, Mehidy Hasan slaps it wide of Vijay Shankar and they come back easily for the second. Bangladesh end with 166 with 84 coming off the last 8 overs
SN Thakur to Mehidy Hasan, 2 runs, uses his feet and drives well, to the right of sweeper cover. They take two

SN Thakur to Mehidy Hasan, FOUR, these knuckle balls are going for runs. Right between backward point and short third, Mehidy Hasan threw his bat at that, even though it came off the toe of the bat, importantly for Bangladesh it was in the gap
SN Thakur to Mehidy Hasan, no run, had he left that, would've been a wide, but he reaches out to this full and wide delivery, toe end it to Dhawan at backward point, they don't take the single

SN Thakur to Mehidy Hasan, SIX, looked high, but Mehidy Hasan had advanced and replays show that it was ok as far as height was concerned. Mehidy Hasan takes it on the full and swings it high and over deep mid. Big hit
SN Thakur to Mehidy Hasan, FOUR, the knuckle ball, slower outside off, Mehidy Hasan gets down low, shuffles across and then scoops it over short fine. Did enough to clear the fielder

Unadkat to Mustafizur, no run, slower delivery to end, Mustafizur pushes it to extra-cover who is at the edge of the ring. India want Mustafizur to be on strike, but they don't take the single. Just 3 runs off the penultimate over! Top bowling by Unadkat
Unadkat to Mustafizur, no run, crisp drive, with a good bat-flow but again straight to the fielder at mid-off. Good captaincy by Rohit to deny Mehidy Hasan the strike
Unadkat to Mustafizur, no run, very full now, Mustafizur pushes it to mid-off, Mehidy Hasan wants the strike, but the ball finds the fielder too quickly

Unadkat to Rubel, out Bowled!! Unadkat is fired up. And how. Cleans up Rubel much like how he did Sabbir. A cutter, came very slow, completely does in Rubel who awkwardly slogs to leg and misses. Game over. Rubel b Unadkat 0(1)
Unadkat to Rubel, wide, too high and way too short, rightly called a wide

Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, out Bowled!! Bowled him. Uses the slower delivery to good effect and it goes through Sabbir Rahman's defences. Was too early into the swipe, the ball came much later, falls on the stumps. Massive wicket for Sabbir Rahman was striking it really well. He goes back with the highest score by a Bangladeshi batsman against India in T20Is. Sabbir Rahman b Unadkat 77(50) [4s-7 6s-4]

Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, 2 runs, Review again by India. For lbw against Sabbir Rahman. Looks like an inside edge onto the pad. The third umpire wants UltraEdge - clear spike and India will lose their review. Sabbir Rahman moved across, to get himself outside the line, the thin snick on the attempted scoop, saved him. Ricochets off the pad and they take two
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, slower one, stands up short, Sabbir Rahman rocks back and pulls to deep mid. Just the single
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, now to the other side. Pre-meditated scoop, gets low and takes the fuller one around off, to get it over short fine's head. Lovely batting
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, uses the slower delivery and the width on that, it was outside off, so Sabbir Rahman glides it wide of the short third fielder. Showing finesse there

SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run, Review time. From India. For lbw against Sabbir Rahman. No bat. Is it slipping down? Umpire's call on hitting, so Sabbir Rahman will survive Just clipping and since the onfield ump didn't give it, he survives. Cross-seam delivery in the blockhole, hits the front pad after missing the bat, Sabbir Rahman again was looking for a quick single, was almost halfway down, but SN Thakur missed the under-arm flick. Had that hit, the batsman would've been walking back

SN Thakur to Mehidy Hasan, 1 run, another chance of a run-out, Sabbir Rahman may have been just in even as Dhawan from backward point missed his throw, Mehidy Hasan had ran a long way forward, so they can't steal another run as the ball is fielded on the dive at deep mid. SN Thakur again isn't happy about something
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, full on the pads, flicked to deep mid-wicket. Mehidy Hasan is happy with just a single
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, slower delivery to end, Sabbir Rahman keeps the strike with a single to sweeper cover

Vijay Shankar to Shakib, out Shakib Run Out!! They take on Rahul and the tag-team of KL Rahul and Vijay Shankar do an exceptional job to get Shakib. Driven to extra-cover, straight to the fielder, KL fires in an awkward throw on the bounce to Vijay Shankar who manages to parry the ball onto the stumps. Shakib was just short. He didn't dive either. Had he done so, would've survived. But credit to the bowler for handling such a fast throw near his feet. Shakib run out (KL/Vijay Shankar) 7(7) [4s-1]

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, thank Masuri and other companies who manufacture helmets. Sabbir Rahman should thank them, because if there was no grille, it would've smashed into his face and broken a few teeth. Another full-toss, he attempts the cheeky ramp scoop and edges it onto the grille, the helmet takes the brunt of the blow even as Sabbir Rahman's head is pushed back by the impact. The ricochet goes near mid-wicket

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, SIX, back-of-the-hand slower delivery gone horribly wrong. Ends up being a juicy full-toss, Sabbir Rahman smashed that over deep mid's head. Just over even as the fielder tried to leap and catch that. Sails over him
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, Vijay Shankar comes back well. Right into the blockhole, dug out back to the bowler

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, SIX, Sabbir Rahman is teeing off now. One too many slower balls. Sabbir Rahman waits on the crease and sits down to slog it over cow-corner. Got enough bat to get it all the way
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, too full on the stumps, Sabbir Rahman drives to long-on to keep the strike
Washington Sundar to Shakib, 1 run, slower and on the pads, worked through mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Shakib, no run, slower and following Shakib, as he made room to cut, it hurried on and spoilt his timing, chopped to backward point
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, 50 for Sabbir Rahman. Got there with a drive to long-off after using his feet. He needs to kick on though and be there till the end

Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, SIX, fine shot. Saw the slower tossed up delivery outside off and heaved it with all his might. Got hold of the shot too and it sails over deep mid. Much-needed six
Washington Sundar to Shakib, 1 run, slower, drifting into the pads, whipped off the back foot to leg
Vijay Shankar to Shakib, 1 run, angled in on a good length on off, Shakib defends in front of backward point, easy run
Vijay Shankar to Shakib, no run, goes under the bat of Shakib who was trying to cut that, may have kept a shade low to beat the bottom edge

Vijay Shankar to Shakib, FOUR, edged and four. Shakib flashes at a full ball outside off, with no slip, the edge was always going away, third man is too square to get across. Raced off the bat and well wide of DK
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, another slower delivery, on the stumps, pushed to mid-off

Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, out Mahmudullah Run Out!! Serious brainblast from both batsmen especially Sabbir Rahman. Mahmudullah was concerned about the lbw call, because it was close, totally done in by the slower delivery, trying to work to leg and missed. Off the pad to DK, Sabbir Rahman though wanted the strike and was at the other end. DK threw it back to Vijay Shankar who was sliding, scrambling but manages to get to the stumps to run Mahmudullah out. Totally Sabbir Rahman's fault. Mahmudullah sacrificed his wicket, initially thought to stay his ground, but seeing Vijay Shankar's awkwardly body movements, may have felt a tiny chance to escape. He didn't and Bangladesh have lost a wicket at the wrong time. And the big one of Mahmudullah too. Mahmudullah run out (Karthik/Vijay Shankar) 21(16) [4s-2]

Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, FOUR, poor bowling. With short fine inside the ring, full and on the pads, Mahmudullah flicks wide of short fine and deep square is too far away from the ball to get across
SN Thakur to Mahmudullah, 1 run, full-toss, may have been another knuckle ball attempted, tapped down to long-on

SN Thakur to Mahmudullah, no run, now the cross-seamer, on a fuller length and this swung away to beat the drive of Mahmudullah, close to taking the snick. DK liked that and well bowled. Using all his variations
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, another knuckle ball, Sabbir Rahman taps it through cover and takes the single on offer

SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run, beautiful knuckle ball and it swung from the hand, and in the air, Sabbir Rahman wanted to run it down wide of DK, could only get a feather, not good enough to beat the keeper
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, Sabbir Rahman goes straight over SN Thakur now. Consecutive fours. Uses his feet and thumps the length delivery straight. Long-off and long-on can't get to the ball

SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, first bit of bad fielding in the field and it comes from Chahal. SN Thakur and Rohit aren't happy. Chahal at short fine, was slow to dive and when he did, allowed the ball to slip under his fingers, got up and chased it, as did DK and one more fielder, but the trio weren't able to cut the boundary
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, slower delivery on off, Sabbir Rahman defends with soft hands, in front of cover, easy run

Unadkat to Mahmudullah, 1 run, had Unadkat hit, Mahmudullah was gone. Unadkat covering ground to his right on his followthrough, was quick to get across, picked it up with his right-hand and then transferred it to his left, before firing a throw, it missed and the diving Mahmudullah scraped home. But what backing up by Rohit at extra cover, the ball was speeding across the turf, he slid to his right and came up with the cherry in one hand - before hurling a throw to DK. Top quality fielding - shows how intense India are tonight. The captain setting the example

Unadkat to Mahmudullah, FOUR, beautiful shot. Third man was inside the ring, on a back of a length outside off, width there to play the late glide, Mahmudullah opens the face of the bat and gets it right between backward point and short third. Lovely batting
Unadkat to Mahmudullah, no run, off-cutter, slowed down the pace, tricked Mahmudullah completely, defended back to Unadkat
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, short of length angling in, towards off and middle, nudged to the left of short fine leg
Unadkat to Mahmudullah, 1 run, angled in from round the wicket, on a good length, dabbed down to third man

Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, 1 run, short delivery on off, pulled to the right of Manish Pandey who almost overruns it but reads the spin on that and comes up with the ball. He must be the best in this lot, isn't he?
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, slower delivery, Sabbir Rahman uses his feet and can't get hold of the big hit, slugged to deep mid
Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, 1 run, too straight, nudged to short fine leg, easy run taken
Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, 2 runs, the slower delivery, on the pads, gently worked in front of long-on, even Raina isn't able to prevent the quick two this time
Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, wide, down leg

Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, 2 runs, Raina has put on some weight, I can see that but still is a top fielder. He sprints to his right from long-on and then puts in the dive to come up with the ball with his right-hand when he got up, saved two. Super effort from the senior man after running across

Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, 2 runs, Mahmudullah comes down the track and is lucky that he didn't time the slog, if he had got it off the middle of the bat, would've found deep mid, it bounces well wide of the fielder
Chahal to Mahmudullah, 1 run, slower and width outside off, Mahmudullah reaches out and cuts to sweeper cover to keep the strike
Chahal to Mahmudullah, no run, lovely. Lovely. Variation. From Chahal, the flipper, zoots off the track, Mahmudullah defends off the back foot
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, takes it from outside off and swipes along the ground to deep mid

Chahal to Mahmudullah, 1 run, nearly through Mahmudullah's defences. Beautifully bowled googly, on a fuller length, Mahmudullah has trouble against the wrong'uns, he pushes at the ball with a gap between bat and pad. Thick inside edge saves him
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, shortish, Sabbir Rahman goes back and pulls hard, on the bounce to deep mid

Chahal to Rahim, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! Rahim goes now. He was itching to go after Chahal, does so but perishes. Another well-held catch by the Indians in the field. But it is Chahal's wicket. Slowed it down, made Rahim reach out for it as he advanced, the left leg's balance was shot with the weight not going into the attempted carve, skied to the right of backward point where Vijay Shankar covers good ground to take a tumbling catch. Replays shows that it was the attempted googly. Rahim c Vijay Shankar b Chahal 9(12)

Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, superb bowling. This kid is a serious talent. Rams in the yorker, on seeing Sabbir Rahman advance, the batsman can only dig it out. Would've seen Rahman advance previously, so knew what he was doing there
Washington Sundar to Rahim, 1 run, full and wristed to long-on
Washington Sundar to Rahim, no run, fired in full, Rahim squeezes it out straight to the fielder at cover

Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, was that the slower overspinner? Could well have been, Sabbir Rahman had to wait for an age for the ball to arrive, when it does, he can only get a tiny part of the bat on the reverse sweep which is good enough to give him only a single
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 2 runs, down the track again, takes it on the full, didn't get hold of it, but wide of the fielder in the deep for two more

Washington Sundar to Rahim, 1 run, superbly bowled. Not sure whether he saw Rahim charging or he decided to bowl what he did, Rahim who is down the wicket, sees the length short and the ball spinning, dabs to the off-side for a single
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, flat trajectory, pushed through on off, Rahim was making room to go over cover, had to adjust and dabbed it wide of backward point in the end to get the single
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, back to slowing it down, tossed up outside off, Sabbir Rahman fetches the sweep from there and finds deep mid

Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, no run, quicker one now and raps Sabbir Rahman on the pad, but it was sliding down, Sabbir Rahman was beaten for pace as he tried to flick, rushed through - the attempted flipper
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, no run, slower and outside off, fullish length, Sabbir Rahman steers it straight to the fielder at backward point

Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, Vijay Shankar does well and Rohit applauds that effort by clapping. Swept wide of him at short fine and he slides across to pick the ball up with one hand, keeps it to a single
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, tossed up slower and outside off, making Sabbir Rahman reach out for the drive, through cover and wide of the fielder

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, unnecessary from Dhawan at short third. The batsmen had decided against the quick single, but he hits direct and the ricochet slips away from Vijay Shankar's grasp who was backing up. Gives the run to Sabbir Rahman
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, now Rahim charges Vijay Shankar, with the bowler following the batsman, swiped straight to the fielder on the bounce to deep mid
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, very full outside off, dug out wide of the diving Vijay Shankar

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, clever and cheeky from Sabbir Rahman. Full around off, he just bends his head down a tad and then uses the bat as a broom, paddling it over the fielder. 10 off 2 and suddenly there's some momentum being injected

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, SIX, good hit. Maybe they have seen what Vijay Shankar bowls, which is hitting the pitch hard on a back of a length, so Sabbir Rahman walks down the track and then thumps the pull flat to the deep backward square fence. There was a fielder at deep square, but this was placed well wide of him
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, full outside off, Rahim wrists an on-drive to long-on
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, pushed through flat outside off, Rahim dabs wide of backward point, Sabbir Rahman races across to complete the single
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, drags the length back, but keeps it slower and on a flat trajectory, Sabbir Rahman waits for it and then controls the pull to send it to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, tried the topspinner, went full and straight outside off, Rahim sweeps it along the ground to deep mid
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, shortish and that allows Sabbir Rahman to go back and cut that to sweeper cover
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, no run, good reverse sweep, but straight to the fielder at backward point. Unadkat makes a good stop
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, tossed up outside off, steered in front of backward point, easy single taken

SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run, Thakur is the one who is frantically appealing for lbw, even when DK tells him that there's bat involved. Low swinging full-toss, drifting down, Sabbir Rahman shuffles across and there's a tickle to DK, who catches it on the bounce and indicates to the bowler who still is appealing. Rohit comes across and finally they don't take the review
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, wide, fires it outside the tramline way outside off, called a wide
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run, another cross-seam short delivery, hurries onto Sabbir Rahman who mistimes the pull to mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, top edge and over DK's head. Cross-seamer from SN Thakur, on a short of length, pacy, but Sabbir Rahman pulls and gets lucky

SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run, short of length on middle, tucked to the right of mid-wicket. There was an easy single on offer, but confusion between the two batsmen, eventually they don't go for it with Sabbir Rahman sent back
SN Thakur to Rahim, leg byes, 1 run, sliding down, raps the pad, but never going to get that, so SN Thakur's appeal is academic. They take a legbye
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, Sabbir Rahman wants to keep attacking. He charges at SN Thakur, swipes the length ball off the inside half of the bat to deep square

Chahal to Soumya Sarkar, out Caught by Dhawan!! Another one for Chahal. Bangladesh are falling apart here. The sweep doing the damage for Soumya Sarkar. Was there to be put away, sliding down, but Sarkar hit it straight to the fielder at backward square, just beside the umpire. Hit with power but no placement. Dhawan did well to grasp that as it was travelling. When it is not going your way, this happens. Two for Chahal in the over. Soumya Sarkar c Dhawan b Chahal 1(2)
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, leg byes, 1 run, down leg, off the pad and going down
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, dangerous shot, but Sabbir Rahman has hit that well. Full on middle, swept hard and flat over mid-wicket's head. Good blow
Chahal to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, Chahal dived across but couldn't stop that crisp drive to his left. Soumya Sarkar gets off the mark with a single

Chahal to Tamim, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Take a bow Shardul. What a catch under pressure and with a moonball to boot. Tamim holes out. All smiles in the Indian camp as they rush towards the pacer to congratulate him. Tamim used his feet and even though he didn't get to the pitch of that one, decided to loft, went a mile up in the air, towards long-on. Thakur was positioned inches inside the cushions, reverse-cups it and manages to hold his left leg's momentum, arrested and stopped the foot there even as he balanced his weight on the other leg. Then when the ball and body was totally in control, ran forward to celebrate. He could've thrown it up, gone out, come in and taken it. But trusted his instincts and strength to not do that. Superb effort and Bangladesh have lost both the openers. Tamim c SN Thakur b Chahal 15(13) [4s-1]
Chahal to Tamim, no run, on the pads, Tamim sweeps and finds Dhawan at backward square. Chahal lucky that it went straight to the fielder, either side of the fielder and it was four
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, very full, Sabbir Rahman could've driven that if he wanted or gone over cover, instead he opts to defend this to cover
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, flat and angled in on off and middle, nudged to mid-wicket

Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, superb bowling. Sabbir Rahman is beaten playing for the turn. This is bowled on a good length and it skids after pitching, since the batsman was playing for the turn, it held its line and beat the outside edge. Top class stuff from the youngster

Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, first ball and what does Sabbir Rahman do? Pre-meditation again, went for the reverse sweep, bit of glove and bat, it rolls to backward point. No chance of a quick single

Washington Sundar to Liton Das, out Caught by Raina!! That's the first blow. Well bowled by Washington Sundar, slowed it up and flighted it up above the batsman's eyeline, the length was full but Liton Das had pre-meditated his sweep even before he saw the ball, shuffled across to get it over square leg, top edge straight up and Raina cups a dolly near short fine. Liton Das c Raina b Washington Sundar 11(9) [6s-1]
Washington Sundar to Tamim, 1 run, sliding down and a gentle tickle off the pads, short fine is Unadkat, they take him on and complete an easy single
Unadkat to Tamim, 1 run, another cutter, the offie variety, on a length on off, Tamim calmly keeps the strike with a single to deep square
Unadkat to Liton Das, 1 run, shuffles across expecting to work it across the line, a slower delivery around off, he does hit the gap with a turn of the wrists
Unadkat to Tamim, 1 run, over the wicket now to Tamim, angles a good length delivery on middle, turned to mid-wicket who is deep and it's an easy single
Unadkat to Liton Das, 1 run, pitched up outside off, Liton Das push-drives to the right of mid-off

Unadkat to Liton Das, SIX, the first biggie of the game. Liton Das charges Unadkat and since the ball was angled across him, he opened his arms and carved it over sweeper cover, the ball lands beyond the boundary ropes. Opened the bat face at the last moment and got the elevation to get the ball to go all the way

Unadkat to Tamim, 3 runs, brilliant fielding by Manish Pandey. Running to his right from deep square leg, he dives to his right after that sprint and pushes the ball back. Saves a run for his side. Every run counts in this format
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, no run, nicely tossed up, Liton Das watchfully pushes it back to Washington Sundar. Another good first over from the youngster
Washington Sundar to Tamim, 1 run, very full on the pads, flicked to deep mid-wicket, for a single
Washington Sundar to Tamim, 2 runs, slowed it up, shorter, Tamim rocks back and pulls it to the right of deep mid for a couple

Washington Sundar to Tamim, no run, DK and slip went up for a big appeal asking for LBW, but Washington Sundar isn't keen. Angling in, rushing through and hitting the front pad above the kneeroll. Missed the forward defence. Would've been going down. India rightly don't take the review
Washington Sundar to Tamim, no run, very full, hint of drift in, Tamim pushes it to the left of Washington Sundar. That came off the inside half of the bat
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Liton Das gets forward and pushes it to long-on to get a single

Unadkat to Tamim, FOUR, good batting. Intelligent stuff from Tamim. He knows that short fine is inside the ring and anything over and wide of him will fetch him a boundary. So gets inside the line of this short of length delivery on the hips and flamingo-flicks over the man's head. Spoils the over for Unadkat
Unadkat to Liton Das, 1 run, on a length and around off, Liton Das turns the wrists on the ball and sends it to the vacant square leg region
Unadkat to Tamim, 1 run, short of length on middle, whipped straight to the fielder at deep square leg
Unadkat to Liton Das, 1 run, short of length outside off, dabbed down to third man to get himself off the mark
Unadkat to Liton Das, wide, slips it down leg. Radar went astray there
Unadkat to Liton Das, no run, fullish outside off, Liton Das tentatively pushes it down the track, the ball rolls to the left of Unadkat
Unadkat to Tamim, 1 run, hint of swing in the air for Unadkat, curved in the air and Tamim is off the mark with a tapped single wide of mid-on

Soumya Sarkar to Karthik, SIX, DK! He has done it. And he outdoes MSD! In staying cool. The Indians are piling on him. Let him breathe lads. There's kisses, cuddling, hugs and what not for DK. Look at Soumya Sarkar, he is in tears and is inconsolable. A couple of Bangladeshis in the dugout are in tears as well. DK has won the Nidahas Trophy single-handedly. How cool was DK though! A flat six over extra cover. Skimmed over the rope. Just. But this game is about margins. Inches will do. Soumya Sarkar who had done really well till then, suddenly lost the plot and served up an overpitched delivery outside off, DK crashed that lofted drive and this shot will be etched in every Indian's memory - maybe on par with MSD's loft off Kulasekara on that magical Mumbai night on 2nd April 2011. That gave India the World Cup. This Sri Lanka's Independence Trophy. Unbelievable end to a near unbelievable game. What more can I say?

Soumya Sarkar to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Mehidy Hasan!! My word. I'm out of words actually. Rebound taken by long-off. What a moment in the game. Lofted the slower delivery straight up, both the fielders almost collided, there was a slight contact between the two, where the shoulders brushed, that's why the catch popped out - but Mehidy who was nearby hung on. A wicket and a dot - but it is DK who is on strike next ball - some consolation for India. Vijay Shankar c Mehidy Hasan b Soumya Sarkar 17(19) [4s-3]

Soumya Sarkar to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, Vijay Shankar gets four. India needed that. Very full around off, Vijay Shankar opens the face of the bat at the last moment and directs it between backward point and short third. It rolls away to the fence. This is getting unbearable now
Soumya Sarkar to Karthik, 1 run, yorker length on off, dug out to sweeper cover, superb ball

Soumya Sarkar to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, driven hard to extra cover, direct hit and Vijay Shankar would've been out. There's a ricochet off the bowler's hand, Vijay Shankar sends Karthik back, who wanted two

Soumya Sarkar to Vijay Shankar, no run, half-volley outside off, the right length to hit it for six, but Vijay Shankar is under extreme pressure, swings and misses. They can't take a bye as well. Dot and the pressure on the youngster
Soumya Sarkar to Vijay Shankar, wide, had Rahim hit, Vijay Shankar would've been out. But called wide. Rightly so. Low full-toss slipping down leg, Vijay Shankar didn't get a tickle. This is manic

Rubel to Karthik, FOUR, amazing from DK. What batting. Under pressure. With his place not assured when some of the big guns return. But he has the nerve tonight. Is he Steve Waugh in disguise? Shuffles across and almost sits under this delivery to scoop it over short fine's head. Almost a six, one bounce over the ropes. Rubel who has bowled so well in the tournament, has gone for 22 in the penultimate over

Rubel to Karthik, 2 runs, Karthik comes down the track and flat-bats the length delivery wide of Rubel, Vijay Shankar races to the other end, they make it across for two. DK on strike and that's what India want
Rubel to Karthik, no run, Rahim appeals for a caught behind, then calms down. Slower delivery outside off, Karthik cuts and misses, wanted to hit it too hard, missed. Good change up from Rubel

Rubel to Karthik, SIX, he is playing the innings of his life. Six over deep mid now. The Indians are going mental as do the Sri Lankans. The dugout is up and clapping. What drama. What tension. Length ball angling in, on middle, slogged with power and timing into the deep mid fence, just sat back and didn't hold back. Just six, but will do

Rubel to Karthik, FOUR, the crowd have got their voice back. This was tailing in late, but Karthik somehow slugged it after having got under it, long-on was beaten by the pace and bounce off the deck, it just skipped past his right-hand, goes away for four. DK has 10 off 2

Rubel to Karthik, SIX, DK! What a blow. First ball and he has launched it for a biggie. Low full-toss, low backlift from Karthik as Rubel missed the yorker, incredible power from DK to lift it flat over long-on's head. The start India needed

Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Sabbir Rahman!! Slogged and caught at long-on. Right off the toe end of the bat. Slower delivery on off, Manish Pandey was waiting on the back foot to launch, he hasn't found his timing at all tonight. Holes out. Just a legbye and the wicket off the over. Incredible stuff from the Fizz. Manish Pandey c Sabbir Rahman b Mustafizur 28(27) [4s-3]

Mustafizur to Vijay Shankar, leg byes, 1 run, quick short of length delivery, Vijay Shankar got inside the line to help it, off the thigh pad and the ball just rolls wide of the stumps. They take a legbye

Mustafizur to Vijay Shankar, no run, wow. Wow. What bowling from Mustafizur. Vijay Shankar thumps the bat hard into the pad. He clearly is under pressure. Action replay of the previous delivery. Nothing going right for the youngster, he drives and misses

Mustafizur to Vijay Shankar, no run, superb bowling. Three dots in a row. Vijay Shankar made it difficult for himself by shuffling across, Mustafizur just followed him with an off-pace delivery, going across, Vijay Shankar drives and misses. Looks at the umpire for a wide, but his movement costs him

Mustafizur to Vijay Shankar, no run, beaten again. Beautiful bowling. Another cutter, again angling it across Vijay Shankar, who clearly doesn't seem to pick it out of the hand. This is shorter than the previous delivery. Manish Pandey at the other end is itching to get the strike
Mustafizur to Vijay Shankar, no run, Mustafizur angles one across Vijay Shankar and beats him. Good start by Bangladesh. The cutter doing the trick, pitches and goes past the slog

Soumya Sarkar to Manish Pandey, no run, has Manish Pandey got in? Yes he has. Third ump again into the action. Driven back to the bowler, who shied back at Manish Pandey's end, just got the bat down in the nick of time. More importantly it is a dot as far as Bangladesh are concerned

Soumya Sarkar to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, had Soumya Sarkar's flick hit, Vijay Shankar would've been gone. Manic action all around. Yorker dug out to the right of Soumya Sarkar, who does exceptionally well to get across, slide and then attempt the flick even as Vijay Shankar had given up

Soumya Sarkar to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, Vijay Shankar finds the gap, wide of the diving deep mid. Soumya Sarkar after aiming at the blockhole all over, goes for the slower delivery, it is outside off and the right length to slog, Shankar gets a crucial boundary
Soumya Sarkar to Manish Pandey, 1 run, very full on off, smashed straight to the fielder at long-on. Couldn't get under that

Soumya Sarkar to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, yorker length on off, dug out to sweeper cover and Manish Pandey's long reach enables him to make it. The throw was a bit wide of Rahim, he had to get the ball back to the stumps, that's the reason Pandey made it in. He is panting after getting there. Third ump was called for and he made the decision
Soumya Sarkar to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, full on off, lofted with no great timing, bounces through to long-off
Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, no run, Mustafizur comes back superbly. A slower delivery outside off, Manish Pandey slogs to leg and misses. Rahim thinks there's an edge, but the ball missed the bat

Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, FOUR, Manish Pandey gets the four. Low full-toss outside off, Manish sliced it wide and over backward point's head. Splits third man and sweeper cover to perfection. Deft touch as well, reached out to play and connected well

Mustafizur to Vijay Shankar, leg byes, 1 run, well bowled Fizz. Dug the shortish delivery into the pitch, but took the pace off it, Vijay Shankar was through the pull way too early. Completely done in, off the body and they take a legbye
