Mustafizur to Vijay Shankar, no run, off-cutter, no pace, slanted across Vijay Shankar, who drives and misses. He wanted to go over cover, but didn't connect
Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slanted across Manish Pandey, on a length, he biffs it to long-on

Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, slashed to deep backward point, it bounced in front of Nazmul and that made it a difficult stop. On top of that he was under pressure by the screaming of Rahim, they take two and the keeper shows his displeasure known to the left-arm spinner by shouting. He wanted just one out of that
Soumya Sarkar to Vijay Shankar, no run, good finish. Yorker at the base of off, dug out. Well bowled
Soumya Sarkar to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower delivery, off-cutter, Manish Pandey gets a thick edge to short third

Soumya Sarkar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, gets four more. This over is proving to be costly. Down the track and slugs the length ball hard and straight down the ground, too much timing and power on the shot, long-on gets across but the ball beats him

Soumya Sarkar to Manish Pandey, FOUR, another boundary. But it has come off a thick outside edge, Manish Pandey and India won't mind, flies over short third's head. Manish threw everything at the full and wide delivery outside off
Soumya Sarkar to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, another slower delivery, sits up for Vijay Shankar, who pulls to deep backward square leg, but just a single
Soumya Sarkar to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower delivery on the pads, glanced to short fine, Vijay Shankar rushes to the other end to complete the single
Nazmul Islam to Vijay Shankar, no run, very full on off, dug out to cover

Nazmul Islam to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, Vijay Shankar breaks the shackles and releases the pressure valve with a boundary. Sweep-pull to a length delivery on middle, right in between deep square and deep mid. Much needed for the Indians
Nazmul Islam to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, Manish Pandey makes room and lofts this off the middle of the bat, but straight to the fielder at long-off, on the bounce
Nazmul Islam to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, Vijay Shankar is off the mark with a back foot punch to long-on

Nazmul Islam to Rohit, out Caught by Mahmudullah!! Is that the game? Is that the Nidahas Trophy? Could well be. Cacophony out there - the Bangladeshis going wild, shouting, screaming with Nazmul Islam doing the "Naagin dance". They feel Rohit is the big fish. The pressure was building and Rohit had to go for the big hit. Got under a full ball, but didn't have the room to free his arms, sliced it straight to the fielder at long-on. Easy for Mahmudullah. Pressure catch but he never looked like dropping it. Rohit c Mahmudullah b Nazmul Islam 56(42) [4s-4 6s-3]
Nazmul Islam to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tossed up and Manish Pandey on the charge drives to long-on

Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Liton Das and he misses from extra cover. Even the very quick Manish Pandey wouldn't have made it. He punched this to the fielder, good bounce as well, but no direct hit and Pandey will survive
Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, no run, another mistimed hit. Cutting short ball, into the pitch, Manish Pandey drags it to short fine off the bottom edge
Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, short of length on off, punched to the left of extra-cover for a run
Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Manish Pandey hasn't found his timing as yet. Is lucky that he miscued this, on the bounce to long-on
Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, good bowling by Mustafizur, followed Rohit as he gave him the charge, punched to sweeper cover
Mustafizur to Rohit, 2 runs, slower delivery from round the wicket, on off, Rohit drives in the air, but wide of extra cover. Long-off prevents the boundary
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, 1 run, Rohit comes down the track and smashes this right through Nazmul Islam's hands, who took some pace off the shot, that would've stung him for sure, keeps it to a single
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, no run, very full, in the blockhole, dug out to cover
Nazmul Islam to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fired in outside off, Manish Pandey lofts to long-off, bounces to the fielder
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, 1 run, full on the pads, on-driven to long-on
Nazmul Islam to Manish Pandey, 1 run, uses his feet does Manish Pandey, the bat flows through the line as he finds long-off
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, 1 run, 50 for Rohit. Just a raise of the bat and back to work. On the back foot and works it through mid-wicket

Shakib to Manish Pandey, no run, make that four! And what an over it has been. Dragged it down, flat outside off, Manish Pandey went for too much power on the cut, off the thick inside edge and to the fielder at mid-wicket
Shakib to Manish Pandey, no run, bit quicker, on middle, turned straight to the fielder at mid-wicket
Shakib to Manish Pandey, no run, slows it up and pulls the length back, Manish Pandey on the charge can only find Shakib
Shakib to Manish Pandey, no run, nicely tossed up on off, Manish Pandey gets forward and pushes it watchfully to cover
Shakib to Rohit, 1 run, cuts late and to the right of backward point, easy single
Shakib to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Manish Pandey gets forward and drives to sweeper cover for a single
Rubel to Manish Pandey, 1 run, back of a length on the hips, nudged to deep square leg, they wanted two initially but settle for one as the fielder gets in quickly from the deep
Rubel to Manish Pandey, no run, fuller than a good length, at good pace, Manish Pandey defends half-forward to cover
Rubel to Manish Pandey, no run, skiddy short of length delivery outside off, Manish Pandey mistimes the pull to mid-on. Hurried onto the bat

Rubel to Rahul, out Caught by Sabbir Rahman!! Short ball does it for Rubel and he is pumped. Rahul cannot control the pull as the bounce gets big on him and the top edge lands safely at deep square leg in one of Bangladesh's safest fielders' hands. Rahul c Sabbir Rahman b Rubel 24(14) [4s-2 6s-1]
Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, short of length on off, Rohit steers it to the right of backward point. The run counter is ticked along
Rubel to Rahul, 1 run, short of length outside off, dabbed down to third man
Nazmul Islam to Rahul, 1 run, keeps the strike with a single to long-on. Played off the back foot as the length was short
Nazmul Islam to Rahul, wide, Rahul is disappointed that he has missed out. Fired down leg, he cannot lay bat on the paddle

Nazmul Islam to Rahul, FOUR, superb use of the crease. Not short, just a smidgen, if you can be ultra-critical, but Rahul was on the back foot in a flash, cut it late and beat two men - backward point to his right and sweeper easily to his left
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, 1 run, reads it off the pitch, bunts it to long-on off the back foot

Nazmul Islam to Rahul, 1 run, right in between cover running back and sweeper coming in. KL survives. He charged the bowler and was beaten in flight, he too like Dhawan tries to go across the line, the leading edge falls safely
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, 1 run, full on off, wristed to long-on
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, no run, tossed up on middle, forward and pushed to short cover
Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, shortish outside off, Rohit slashes hard and in the air, wide of backward point, third man gets the body behind the ball and keeps the duo to just one
Rubel to Rohit, no run, lazy waft from Rohit. Length delivery outside off, he wanted to deflect it to third man. Missed. So easily could've edged it

Rubel to Rahul, 1 run, Mehidy again and he misses! From backward point even as Rohit had given up. Pushed off the front foot to the right of Mehidy who did really well to come up with the ball as he got up, had time to line it up, but misses. Huge huge moment in the game

Rubel to Rahul, 2 runs, nice back foot punch with an open bat face, wide of the diving backward point fielder, third man gets across to cut off the boundary, Rahul used the depth of the crease to good effect there
Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, misfield from Liton Das at cover and that won't please the bowler. Straightforward stop and he fumbles to let Rohit get off strike
Rubel to Rohit, no run, went for the attempted yorker, turned out to be a low full-toss, clipped to mid-wicket inside the ring. Swung in the air
Shakib to Rohit, 1 run, shortish on off, Rohit easily punches it to long-on
Shakib to Rohit, no run, that gripped off the pitch, nearly squared Rohit up on the back foot, but didn't turn square to cause problems, Rohit defends to backward point

Shakib to Rohit, 2 runs, floated up outside off, too much air, attempting to lure Rohit into the big hit, instead the Mumbaikar square-drives with elan behind backward point for two more. Hit all along the ground
Shakib to Rahul, 1 run, uses his feet and gets a thick inside edge on the forward defence, but short fine is deep, so they take a single
Shakib to Rahul, SIX, too short, second time that Shakib has gone for a six against the short ball, Rahul rocks back and thumps a flat six over deep mid. That skimmed over the fielder's head
Shakib to Rohit, 1 run, slower and shortish outside off, Rohit punches off the back foot to long-on
Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, short of length into the hips, turned through mid-wicket for a run
Mustafizur to Rohit, no run, another free-flowing drive but finds cover. Such timing from Rohit
Mustafizur to Rohit, 2 runs, leans and drives this overpitched delivery outside off gloriously through the covers. Easy two by the time sweeper gets across

Mustafizur to Rohit, no run, direct hit from the sub Ariful Haque would've been interesting? No. The throw is well wide and Rohit dives back in. He dabbed this to the left of short third, wanted a quick single but Rahul sent him back in time

Mustafizur to Rohit, FOUR, finesse. We saw that from Mahmudullah earlier on, this shot is even better. More classier. Width outside off, Rohit opens the face of the bat and steers it right between backward point and short third. Mehidy dived but to no avail
Mustafizur to Rahul, 1 run, short of length and angling in from round the wicket, Rahul defends with soft hands in front of backward point, Rohit gets across for the quick single
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, no run, sliding down, nudged behind square
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, no run, tossed up outside off, driven straight to the fielder at extra-cover

Nazmul Islam to Rohit, SIX, that is big. Nazmul Islam watches the ball fly over long-off. Stayed back, launched the tossed up delivery on off for a big six. Remember these aren't small boundaries here at the Premadasa

Nazmul Islam to Rohit, FOUR, one ball from Nazmul Islam is enough for Rohit even as the crowd chant his name. Even the Sri Lankans rooting for him. Not a surprise. Coming back to the shot, he used his feet and then made room slightly to open his body up, ensured he got it over mid-off inside the ring
Nazmul Islam to Rohit, no run, hint of turn, from a fuller length, Rohit defends watchfully to backward point
Nazmul Islam to Rahul, 1 run, uses his feet, gets too close to the pitch of the ball, but squeezes it out to mid-on. Quick single completed
Rubel to Rahul, 1 run, short of length and angling in, worked away through mid-wicket, there was confusion between the duo, but no harm done in the end

Rubel to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul is off the mark in superb fashion. Sees the short and wide delivery outside off, carves it off the back foot, a slashing cut and nearly all the way, one bounce over the ropes at sweeper cover. Too much width and KL latched on
Rubel to Rahul, no run, pacy short of length delivery on off, calmly defended back down the track. Bang on the money is Rubel

Rubel to Raina, out Caught by Rahim!! Rahim is confident, so confident that he has taken the review. Called a wide. But he convinces Shakib and they take it. Looks to be a bottom edge. UltraEdge confirms the same. Raina goes for a blob. Big wicket. Full marks to Rahim for spotting the tiny edge. Raina looked to flamingo-pull that, with one leg off the ground but could only feather a snick behind. Rahim dived to his right to grab that and when the umpire didn't give it out, was perplexed. Bangladesh hit back with two quick wickets. Raina c Rahim b Rubel 0(3)
Rubel to Raina, no run, beaten for pace. Right through Raina as he advanced and swung, Rubel followed Raina and the ball goes past the inside edge
Rubel to Raina, no run, short of length on the pads, Raina tucks it to mid-wicket
Shakib to Rohit, no run, tossed up outside off, driven straight to the fielder at extra-cover. Didn't hit the gap
Shakib to Rohit, no run, short and wide outside off, Rohit cuts straight to the fielder at cover-point, there's a fumble, runs, but sent back in time by Raina

Shakib to Dhawan, out Caught by (sub)A Haque!! Leading edge and taken. Bangladesh needed that. Beaten in flight was Dhawan as he advanced, but decided to go through the shot, problem was he was looking to go across the line, leading edge is smartly held at mid-off by the sub running to his right and tumbling to take it. Dhawan c (sub)A Haque b Shakib 10(7) [6s-1]
Shakib to Rohit, 1 run, sliding on, into the pads, worked away behind square
Shakib to Dhawan, 1 run, wrists it to mid-on to take the single
Shakib to Dhawan, SIX, now Dhawan gets into the act. Rank long hop, Dhawan murders the pull off the back foot, was waiting for it on the back foot and over deep square leg, India off to a flier
Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, no run, faster and sliding straight on, pushed back watchfully to the bowler

Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, SIX, that is a monster. Rohit is in the mood today. Just the look on his face says it all. He is determined as ever. Uses his feet and lofts the tossed up delivery over wide long-on. The bowler and the fielders could just see the trajectory of the ball as it sailed over their heads
Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, FOUR, predictably the length is shortened, Rohit is an experienced campaigner, sits back and pulls hard and wide of the diving backward square fielder inside the ring. 10 off 2
Mehidy Hasan to Rohit, SIX, tonked over cow corner. Sees the flight on that, doesn't hold back, biffs it with all power and off she goes

Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, good bowling. Dhawan had to adjust his shot, wide of the crease and angled in, Dhawan was looking for the sweep, but it skidded on, Dhawan works it in front of him and off they go
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, no run, tossed up from round the wicket, on off, Dhawan pushes it to cover-point and wants a quick single, nothing doing from Rohit
Shakib to Rohit, no run, fired in full, around off, driven straight to the fielder at extra-cover
Shakib to Dhawan, 1 run, brilliant running between the wickets from both batsmen, Dhawan used his feet and nudged it to short fine, Rohit was backing up a long way and made it easily
Shakib to Rohit, 1 run, hurries off the pitch, Rohit works it off the back foot through mid-wicket
Shakib to Rohit, FOUR, Rohit is off the mark in grand style. Down the track and lofts cleanly over mid-on. Got to the pitch and didn't hold back
Shakib to Rohit, no run, slower and tossed up on off, Rohit's feet didn't move as he stood beside the line of the ball, inside edge onto the pad and it dribbles away
Shakib to Dhawan, 1 run, Rahim shouts encouraging words to Shakib as Dhawan flicks uppishly from middle through mid-wicket. May have been the seam-up ball first up for it swung in

Navdeep Saini to Thomas, no run, M-A-I-D-E-N. Not often you see, a final over in the innings ending in a maiden. It's been that kind of a day for the Indian bowlers. Short and pacy, followed the batsman as he was backing away. Thomas tries his luck again, wielding his bat and comes up with zilch
Navdeep Saini to Thomas, no run, four dots and a wicket in this over. Stroked straight to extra cover
Navdeep Saini to Thomas, no run, slips in a bumper, Thomas pulls and misses

Navdeep Saini to Pollard, out Lbw!! It was Pant, who suggested his captain to take the review and it's turned out to be a great one. Virat smiles and claps. Pollard missed out a half-century by a solitary run but it was a fine knock. This full toss dipped and Pollard missed as he was lining up for a slog. The umpire turned the appeal down, India took the review and they got their man. Pollard lbw b Navdeep Saini 49(49) [4s-2 6s-4]

Navdeep Saini to Pollard, no run, back-to-back dots in the final over. Top-notch delivery from Saini again, in the similar zone and Pollard shuffled a bit across his stumps, flashing his bat at it. However couldn't make any contact
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, no run, outstanding yorker from Saini. Aimed at outside off and executed it perfectly. Pollard tried his best reaching out but failed in doing so

Bhuvneshwar to Cottrell, no run, slices it up in the air, Manish Pandey bolts in from deep mid-wicket throws himself across but it eludes him. Cottrell loses his balance as he wanted to launch it out of the park
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, 1 run, Kumar throws it well wide of off, Pollard fetches it from there and drags it to long-on

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, SIX, Kumar's slower ball becomes too predictable and Pollard takes full toll of it. Takes on the short ball and generates enormous power to hook it a mile back over deep square leg
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, wide yorker from Kumar. Squeezed to long-off, again Pollard doesn't take the single
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, 122kph, snaking on middle. Whipped away to deep mid-wicket. Pollard refuses to take the single

Bhuvneshwar to K Paul, out Caught by Kohli!! Despite Pollard holding the innings at one end, wickets continue to tumble from the other. Cutter from Kumar which grips and moves away just outside off, Paul was aiming for a cross-batted mow, but his attempt is foiled because of the slowness of this surface. Skies it up in the air, Virat Kohli from extra cover circles around and completes the catch. K Paul c Kohli b Bhuvneshwar 3(11)
Navdeep Saini to K Paul, 1 run, 144kph, low full toss just outside off. Paul toe-ends the drive to mid-off and hustles through for a single
Navdeep Saini to K Paul, wide, whangs in a bouncer outside off, Paul throws his bat but it's out of his reach. The umpire spreads his arms and calls it a wide
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, 1 run, swerving in, again a full toss and Pollard's bat face turns on impact as it dribbles to mid-wicket

Navdeep Saini to Pollard, SIX, if you miss your length against Pollard, you should be ready to face the penalty, especially at this stage. Juicy full toss, Pollard gets under it and smokes it over deep mid-wicket
Navdeep Saini to K Paul, 1 run, pacy low full toss, driven to mid-off
Navdeep Saini to K Paul, no run, 141kph, nails it into the blockhole. Jammed out by Paul
Navdeep Saini to K Paul, no run, nippy short ball, getting big on Paul, who gets into a terrible position but somehow fends it
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, 117kph, Kumar goes fuller just outside off. Pollard with a mini-shuffle and defends it back

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, FOUR, big bat swing. Cross-batted swipe and Pollard manages to find the gap in front of square on the leg-side. Gets under this slower short ball and pulls it along the ground and splits deep square leg and deep mid-wicket with precision
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, 2 runs, knuckle ball from Kumar, Pollard mistimes the heave towards mid-wicket. Bhuvi chases but can't prevent the duo from stealing the second
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, this is a resourceful option for a dot-ball. Slower bumper, Pollard is content to sway his head away from the line
Bhuvneshwar to K Paul, 1 run, cutter from Kumar, Paul waits for the ball to arrive and guides it past point
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, 1 run, Pollard walks down and clips this through square leg
Jadeja to K Paul, no run, gets behind the line and stonewalls it
Jadeja to K Paul, no run, flighted on middle, defended
Jadeja to K Paul, no run, straighter and keeps a tad low, Paul nullifies the threat by getting his bat in-line
Jadeja to K Paul, no run, quicker and skidding on, blocked off the back foot
Jadeja to K Paul, no run, forward and meets the defence high on the bat

Jadeja to Narine, out Caught by Khaleel Ahmed!! Virat Kohli is all smiles as the camera pans towards him. Why not! Another one bites the dust. Hold on! They are checking for the no-ball. Concerned look on Jadeja's face? Front foot is okay but has he cut the side-line? Nah! It's fine. Narine can continue his walk back to the hut. He's not that kind of a player who is going to hang around for too long. Spots a quickish delivery and treks back pulling it across the line. Didn't bother to keep it along the ground nor did he find the gap. Slams it straight to Khaleel at deep square leg, who judges it decently well and clasps onto it despite the sun being in his eyes. West Indies quaking at 70/7.. oh dear! Narine c Khaleel Ahmed b Jadeja 2(4)
Krunal Pandya to Narine, 1 run, takes this one away from the left-hander, Narine sits back and flat-bats it to long-off. Slight misfield from the fielder there but they won't risk the second
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, rifled quick outside off, Pollard reaches out and drives it to sweeper cover
Krunal Pandya to Narine, 1 run, drops it short and Narine rocks back to muscle it towards deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Narine, no run, tickled to mid-wicket

Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, out Caught&Bowled!! Woah! Krunal Pandya has made this catch look extremely easy. Tell you what, it was absolutely clobbered by Brathwaite back at the bowler. But the senior Pandya has great reflexes and has a safe set of hands. So, jumps across in a jiffy and holds onto it. The partnership has been broken and Brathwaite's painful stay comes to an end. The West Indies captain didn't find the placement he wanted there. Brathwaite c and b Krunal Pandya 9(24)

Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, 2 runs, leading edgeee but it eludes Dhawan at backward point. Looped up and extracts a hint of turn, Brathwaite wanted to hoick it across the line after getting low and lost his shape. Fortunately, it didn't carry to the fielder and Dhawan gives the chase to pull it back
Jadeja to Brathwaite, 1 run, armer on leg, Brathwaite rolls his wrists and places it to mid-wicket
Jadeja to Brathwaite, no run, flighted just outside off, standing punch to extra cover
Jadeja to Pollard, 1 run, slapped away to long-off
Jadeja to Pollard, no run, shifts his line and angles it in quicker, Pollard is chained to the crease and gets beaten for pace. Gets a thud on the thigh pad

Jadeja to Pollard, no run, ooh! Pollard wanted to have a piece of this. Jadeja shortened his length and it fizzed through outside off. With no feet, Pollard swung his bat at that but couldn't reach for it
Jadeja to Pollard, no run, 95kph, slanted in with the arm. Pollard checks his push back to the bowler
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, slower and on middle, Pollard waits and turns it to the right of the bowler. Pandya does his best to try and reach for it but in vain
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, SIX, shovelled over cow corner. Bye-bye cricket ball, get ready for landing. On the pads, easy for Pollard, who gets across and it's a proper whippage!
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, no run, darted in, zips through and crashes Pollard's pad as he was caught playing across the line. Stifled appeal for lbw but it was going down leg
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, 1 run, Brathwaite emulates Pollard and stays back to flick it down to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, shorter and quicker, picked away to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, no run, stunning ball from Pandya. Pitched up around off, Pollard hung his bat forward and gets beaten by the sharp turn. Swift work from Pant too but Pollard was okay there
Jadeja to Brathwaite, no run, accurate line at the stumps, hurried push back to the bowler
Jadeja to Pollard, 1 run, Jadeja pulls his length back and Pollard answers it with a wristy knock to long-on

Jadeja to Pollard, SIX, any another batsman would've had their heart in their mouths because this was a miscue, but not Pollard. He knew straightaway despite one-hand coming off, it had gone all the way. Steps out, wasn't to the pitch but still wanted to tonk it down the ground. Goes hard, doesn't panic and sends it down the ground for half-a-dozen
Jadeja to Pollard, no run, 99kph, flat trajectory just outside off. Punched back
Jadeja to Brathwaite, 1 run, back and across to tuck it to square leg
Jadeja to Pollard, 1 run, flatter and shorter, Pollard jumps back to work it away to long-on

Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, and it's a maiden. If you'd blinked, you would've missed that over. Wicket-to-wicket line, Brathwaite once again squirts an inside edge which bobbles away to the leg-side
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, string of dots continue. Fired in, coming in with the arm and Brathwaite thrusts his bat forward, eking out an inside edge onto his pad
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, quick again, driven back
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, slows it up and gets some turn with an extra zip off the surface, Brathwaite was committed on the front foot and ends up stabbing it tamely under his eyes
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, quicker and Brathwaite with a mighty stride to ease it back
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, brings Brathwaite forward with a darter, meek push to cover
Jadeja to Brathwaite, 1 run, this was down the leg-side and Brathwaite nudges it to the on-side and collects a single
Jadeja to Brathwaite, no run, opens the face of the bat and guides it to backward point again
Jadeja to Brathwaite, no run, very full and attacking the stumps, pushed back to Jadeja
Jadeja to Brathwaite, no run, flatter and wider, Brathwaite steers it to backward point
Jadeja to Pollard, 1 run, down the leg-side and Pollard clips it to the on-side
Jadeja to Pollard, no run, defended to the on-side
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, knocks it down to long-off and retains th strike

Krunal Pandya to Pollard, FOUR, that's edged and four! Pollard won't mind the result but not sure he will like the manner in which the boundary came. For the first three balls, there was a slip in place but not on this delivery. And the push from Pollard went exactly where first slip would have been. It beats short third and races to the fence
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, 1 run, slows this one up, Brathwaite waits and punches it to sweeper cover
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, flatter delivery on a fuller length, Brathwaite plunges forward and defends, inside halves it to the on-side
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, fuller and wider, taps it to the off-side
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, 91 kph delivery on a fuller length, punched back to the bowler off the inside half

Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, 125 kph delivery on a fuller length, Pollard was early into the shot as he was looking to drive it away from the body. He was deceived by the slowness on the ball and it went past his outside edge
Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, fuller and wide of off, Pollard comes a long way forward and drives it to cover
Khaleel Ahmed to Brathwaite, 1 run, another slower delivery, this was wide of off and Brathwaite runs it down to third man
Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, 1 run, slower one on the stumps, Pollard clips it to the on-side. He played it down the wrong line and it came off the inside half of the blade
Khaleel Ahmed to Brathwaite, 1 run, this was angling down the leg-side, Brathwaite opens the face of the bat and dabs it to third man
Khaleel Ahmed to Brathwaite, no run, on a length and on the stumps, Brathwaite stays in the crease and defends it back with a straight bat
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, no run, hits that hard length again, it was just wide of off and Pollard pushes it straight to backward point
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, wide, he signals wide now. It was clearly down leg this time
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, no run, down the leg-side and strangely umpire didn't call it a wide. He signaled one for the over

Navdeep Saini to Pollard, no run, short and wide, Pollard would have taken out the cut shot against any other bowler but he can't do that against Saini as he is a skiddy customer. And he decides to push it to cover
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, no run, back of a length delivery angling into Pollard, he was late on the whip shot. It clipped his thigh pad and ended up on the off-side
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, no run, decides to bang in short, Pollard sways away from the line of the ball and ducks under it
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, no run, on a back of a length and on the stumps, Pollard gets behind and blocks it to the on-side. It kept a shade low and Pollard adjusted well

Khaleel Ahmed to Powell, out Caught by Pant!! Khaleel Ahmed joins the party too and West Indies are in a serious crater here. It was a slower one and was well wide of off, Powell reached for it for some reasons. He threw his bat at it in an ungainly fashion. It clipped the bottom half of the bat and Pant takes a good diving catch coming forward. Powell c Pant b Khaleel Ahmed 4(5) [4s-1]
Khaleel Ahmed to Powell, no run, bangs this one short, it was wide of off and Powell leaves it alone
Khaleel Ahmed to Powell, FOUR, it was short and wide, there was enough. Powell rocks backs and cuts it past backward point for a boundary
Khaleel Ahmed to Powell, no run, this was wide of off and it went past the outside edge of Powell as he played inside the line of the ball
Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, 1 run, it was down the leg-side, Pollard tucks it to the on-side and takes a single
Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, outside off delivery angling away from Pollard, he lifts his bat and lets it go
Navdeep Saini to Powell, no run, on a fuller length and wide of off, left alone

Navdeep Saini to Hetmyer, out Bowled!! This is turning out to be a dream debut for Navdeep Saini. Who said international cricket is tough? It was bowled on that back of a length again, Hetmyer was looking to steer it down. He was beaten for pace and had no room to steer it too. It clipped the inside half of the bat and came back to clatter the stumps. Hetmyer departs for a golden duck, first of the innings. Hetmyer b Navdeep Saini 0(1)

Navdeep Saini to Pooran, out Caught by Pant!! So, it takes only four balls for Navdeep Saini to get his maiden international cricket. And he is ecstatic! He knows how to celebrate like a Delhite too, punches the air in an animated fashion. We have seen in IPL that hitting against Saini isn't easy, he bowls that hard length. Pooran looks to replicate the shot he hit in this over. But this one came quickly off the deck, he was hurried onto the hoick to the on-side and it clipped his top-edge. It went a long way up in the air and ended into the gloves of Pant who just about takes it. Pooran c Pant b Navdeep Saini 20(16) [4s-1 6s-2]
Navdeep Saini to Pooran, no run, on a back of a length and on the stumps, Pooran pushes it to the off-side

Navdeep Saini to Pooran, SIX, this man is clearly not worried about Saini's pace. It was on a back of a length and was angling across, Pooran stands tall and just lifts it straight down the ground for a six. Stand and deliver stuff!
Navdeep Saini to Pooran, no run, starts with a fuller length delivery on the stumps, Pooran defends it to the leg-side
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, raps him on the pads, hint of appeal from the Indians. But umpires don't give those as Pollard was a long way down the crease and it would have missed the leg-stump
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, now, a slower one from Bhuvneshwar. Pollard reads it late, he delays his bat swing in the end and defends it to the off-side
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, another defensive shot by Pollard after coming down the track

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, again, Pollard was way down the ground. Bhuvneshwar showed composure and bowls it in that off-stump channel. Pollard defends and inside half of the bat takes it to the on-side
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, 2 runs, this was much fuller and was on the stumps, Pollard charges down again and clips it wide of fine leg for a couple
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, walks down the ground on the first ball, it was on a length and he presents the straight bat to defend it back to the bowler
Washington Sundar to Pooran, 2 runs, it was down the leg-side, Pooran stays put in the crease and clips it to the on-side for a brace
Washington Sundar to Pooran, no run, goes back and blocks it back to the bowler

Washington Sundar to Pooran, no run, throws it wide and there was lots of flight on that delivery, Pooran went after it. It clipped the outside half of the blade and went up in the air, fell in between short third man and backward point
Washington Sundar to Pooran, no run, tucks it to the on-side

Washington Sundar to Pooran, SIX, gee! That is a shot and a half. He is a mighty good hitter of the ball and he is flaunting it here. He comes on the front foot, comes close to the ball and lifts it over long-off for a maximum
Washington Sundar to Pooran, FOUR, top-shot. Touch short, Pooran rocks back and slaps it wide of mid-on for a boundary

Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, out Bowled!! Lewis follows his partner and departs for a duck too. This is proving to be a disaster of a start for West Indies. Bhuvneshwar bowls a clever knuckle ball, Lewis was completely deceived by it. He misses the heave, it clipped his pad and came back to shatter the stumps. India on top! Lewis b Bhuvneshwar 0(4)
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, no run, in that off-stump channel again, Lewis gets behind and blocks it back
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, 1 run, on a length and around off, Pooran pushes it wide of mid-off and takes a single

Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, no run, Bhuvi takes off the pace on this delivery, Pooran was taken aback by how slowly it came off the deck. He wanted to slam it wide of deep mid-wicket but ends up missing it as he was way too early onto the shot
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, no run, on a length and around off, Pooran gets behind it and taps it to the off-side, wanted a single but decides against it
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, wide, down the leg-side, wide called
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, no run, charges down straightaway, Bhuvneshwar bowls it on a back of a length. And it moves away just a touch, Pooran swings and misses
Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, fuller and wider, Lewis plunges forward and drives it straight to backward point. It came off the outer half of the bat
Washington Sundar to Lewis, 5 wides, down the leg-side, Pant fails to collect it. It misses him and goes for a boundary through fine leg
Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, fuller and on the stumps, Lewis pushes it to cover
Washington Sundar to Pooran, 1 run, taps it to cover point and takes a single
Washington Sundar to Pooran, no run, misses the cut shot

Washington Sundar to John Campbell, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! What a sensational start for Washington Sundar and India. And yes, Chak De India song is back in the background. John Campbell got down on his knees and went for that emphatic slog-sweep, he connected it decently but found the man at deep mid-wicket to perfection where Krunal Pandya makes no mistake. It went flat and was travelling, Pandya did really well to grab it in the end. John Campbell c Krunal Pandya b Washington Sundar 0(2)
Washington Sundar to John Campbell, no run, short and wide, John Campbell punches it straight to backward point

K Paul to Washington Sundar, SIX, a great hit to end the game, a six over long-on with a straight-batted loft. Paul bowled this short, Sundar had enough time on the back foot to get into a great position to send the ball over the rope
K Paul to Washington Sundar, no run, low full toss, defended to point. Bump ball but Pooran funnily appeals for a catch
Brathwaite to Jadeja, no run, very full, played out
Brathwaite to Washington Sundar, 1 run, outside edge but it rolls past the keeper, Thomas did extremely well to attack the ball quickly to his right to stop the ball
Brathwaite to Washington Sundar, no run, yorker on the stumps, Sundar defends
Brathwaite to Jadeja, 1 run, fullish delivery on the leg stump, Jadeja flicks it to deep square leg
Brathwaite to Washington Sundar, 1 run, slower delivery on the stumps, Washington Sundar played a little early, got a leading edge that rolled into the off-side
Brathwaite to Jadeja, 1 run, shortish delivery on the leg stump, Jadeja glances it to fine leg

K Paul to Krunal Pandya, out Bowled!! Oh what a brilliant delivery! Good length delivery angling in and then probably just leaving the left-hander. Pandya was completely squared up as he tried to play off the front foot and the ball hit the top of middle stump. Krunal Pandya b K Paul 12(14) [4s-1]
K Paul to Krunal Pandya, no run, shortish delivery down the leg-side, Pandya gloves it to backward square leg
K Paul to Jadeja, 1 run, low full toss wide outside off stump, Jadeja squeezes it past backward point
K Paul to Jadeja, no run, short delivery on the off stump, Jadeja pulls it to mid-wicket
K Paul to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slower ball full delivery, Pandya drives it to sweeper cover
K Paul to Jadeja, 1 run, to long-off
K Paul to Jadeja, 1 run, very full and outside off stump, Jadeja jams it out through mid-off
Thomas to Krunal Pandya, no run, oh almost dragged on, goes hard at this full delivery, got an inside edge onto pad, Pandya did well to turn and ensure the ball wasn't disturbing the sticks

Thomas to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, "beautiful ball striking," exclaims Ian Bishop on air. That was a lovely pull shot to Thomas's short delivery, weight on the back foot and powered from the middle of the bat, almost cleared deep mid-wicket
Thomas to Jadeja, 1 run, knocked to backward square leg

Thomas to Krunal Pandya, 3 runs, pulled away nicely between mid-wicket and mid-on, but this outfield is very thick and the ball almost stops an inch before the rope. The fielder anyway gave chase to pull it back to save a run

Thomas to Jadeja, 3 runs, sloppy from Lewis, he let this go right through his hands at deep cover, and there could have been an extra run taken for the overthrow if the batsmen had not backed up far. Jadeja drove this full ball off the front foot, should have been two maximum
Thomas to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, outside edge as Pandya throws his bat at this short of length delivery angled across, flies to third man
Cottrell to Jadeja, 2 runs, opens the face of the bat and guides this past the man at backward point, wide enough from third man for two
Cottrell to Jadeja, wide, another wide down the leg-side as Cottrell tries the yorker
Cottrell to Jadeja, wide, fired down the leg-side

Cottrell to Kohli, out Caught by Pollard!! It's a dolly for Polly. And there's the trademark salute from Cottrell. This is a sticky surface, so Cottrell bangs the slower delivery into the pitch and foxes the Indian captain. Kohli wanted to pull, played way too early as he didn't read the slower ball, got a top edge that flew straight up to mid-wicket. 27 more to get. Kohli's reaction said it all. He was staring at the pitch with a smile in disbelief. A wicket or two now would spice this up nicely. Kohli c Pollard b Cottrell 19(29) [4s-1]
Cottrell to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, nice yorker just around the off stump, Pandya digs it out to mid-wicket
Cottrell to Krunal Pandya, no run, slower delivery from back of a length, Pandya punches it to short cover
Cottrell to Krunal Pandya, no run, goes right behind the line and defends
Cottrell to Krunal Pandya, no run, short of length delivery on the leg stump, Pandya defended to mid-wicket
Narine to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, softly driven along the ground to long-off and Narine ends 4-0-14-2
Narine to Krunal Pandya, no run, doesn't read the knuckle ball, Pandya misses the flick, the ball rolls behind square off the pad
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, flicked off the front foot wide of long-on. The first time Narine allowed Kohli to come forward in the over
Narine to Kohli, no run, the away-going ball, punched off the back foot to cover
Narine to Kohli, no run, shortish delivery on the stumps, Kohli defends into the on-side
Narine to Kohli, no run, flighted delivery spinning back in, Kohli flicks it to short mid-wicket
K Paul to Kohli, 1 run, very full and outside off stump, Kohli digs it out through mid-on
K Paul to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, shortish and angling in from round the wicket, Pandya gloves the pull shot to backward square leg

K Paul to Manish Pandey, out Bowled!! This is what Keemo Paul can do. He bowled a few cutters, but also has a good yorker as a variation. Pandey couldn't figure this out and it hits the base of off stump to force a cartwheel. Lovely sight for a pacer. Full, fast, you miss, I hit! Manish Pandey b K Paul 19(14) [4s-2]
K Paul to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, change of pace again, Pandey cuts to the right of the man at deep cover
K Paul to Kohli, 1 run, picks the slower ball and wrists it nicely, finds long-on on the bounce
K Paul to Manish Pandey, 1 run, full toss, Pandey whips it away to deep square leg
Brathwaite to Kohli, no run, punches uppishly to short cover
Brathwaite to Manish Pandey, 1 run, pushed away to long-on

Brathwaite to Kohli, 1 run, quick single, the keeper attempts a direct-hit but Manish Pandey was home and the throw anyway was off target. Kohli dabbed this slower ball to the right of Pooran, looked at his partner and set off
Brathwaite to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fullish delivery outside off stump, Pandey reaches out and taps it square of the wicket on the off-side
Brathwaite to Kohli, 1 run, again gets a stride towards the bowler, but only manages to bunt this full toss along the ground to long-on
Brathwaite to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli steps out and slashes, hit high on the bat but manages to clear the man at backward point as he played this shortish delivery with an angled bat
Thomas to Kohli, 1 run, rides the bounce on that and dabs it down to third man for a single
Thomas to Kohli, no run, length delivery angling in and was pushed back to the bowler
Thomas to Manish Pandey, 1 run, gets on top of the ball and taps it down past point for a single
Thomas to Kohli, 1 run, clipped off the pads and the man at deep square picks it up
Thomas to Manish Pandey, 1 run, and it doesn't bounce as much as he expected it to. But still manages to hold his balance and steer it to deep third

Thomas to Manish Pandey, FOUR, fuller delivery outside off and a gorgeous looking drive from Manish Pandey. That was timed to perfection and placed as well for the batter to get it between cover and mid-off. Not a great welcome for Thomas

Narine to Kohli, 2 runs, shortish delivery outside off and was cut away past point for a double. Good running from Kohli to come back for the second as the throw from Thomas was a poor one. Easy couple in the end
Narine to Kohli, no run, fuller length delivery outside off and has been pushed out to point
Narine to Kohli, no run, turning in delivery and has been tucked to short mid
Narine to Kohli, no run, clips the ball off the pads and finds the man at mid-wicket
Narine to Kohli, no run, takes it from little outside off and knocks it out to short mid
Narine to Manish Pandey, 1 run, stabs the ball down to long-on with a horizontal bat face for a single
K Paul to Manish Pandey, 1 run, opens the face of the bat on impact and runs it down to third man for a single
K Paul to Kohli, 1 run, straight face of the bat on the drive down to long-on for a single
K Paul to Kohli, no run, length delivery and has been nudged out to mid-wicket with a closed face of the bat
K Paul to Kohli, wide, slower delivery bowled down leg and Kohli let it go. Big wide
K Paul to Manish Pandey, 1 run, guides the length delivery and gets it down to third man for a single
K Paul to Manish Pandey, no run, fuller ball again and has been knocked out to mid-wicket
K Paul to Manish Pandey, FOUR, starts his spell with a fuller one and has been drilled down the ground for a four
Narine to Kohli, no run, looks to tickle it away and fails to connect. That was going down
Narine to Manish Pandey, 1 run, knocks the ball away into the on-side and gets a single. Gets off the mark as well in his comeback game

Narine to Pant, out Caught by Cottrell!! Pant deals in extremes. He gets a duck today. But that's how he plays. But again not a shot that the situation demanded. Woobly seam delivery from Narine and Pant decided to slog sweep, the ball went off the top-edge and was taken by the man at deep square leg. The Windies unit are clawing back in to this. Or should I write, India allowing them to. The door has been left open. Pant c Cottrell b Narine 0(1)

Narine to Rohit, out Caught by Pollard!! Hoicks it across the line and finds the man at long-on. Was a poor shot. Don't the shot was needed in a situation like this. India could have done with singles but Rohit decided to clear the fence on the on-side but failed to get enough elevation. The bat face might have turned a little bit as well. Narine gets the breakthrough that WI needed. Rohit c Pollard b Narine 24(25) [4s-2 6s-2]
Narine to Rohit, no run, keeps a shade low outside off and Rohit stays back to dab the ball away to short third
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, stays back and wrists the ball square on the on-side for a single. India need 64 more
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, slower delivery and has been pushed out into the covers
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, length delivery and has been pushed out into the deck

Cottrell to Rohit, SIX, cricket can't be more beautiful! This man is an artist. A brutal one if you ask the bowlers. Fuller and angled across, Rohit gets behind the line of the ball and drills it over covers for a sixer. Superb hit!
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, uses the pace of the bowler and steers it but fails to beat the man at point
Cottrell to Rohit, FOUR, gets under the length delivery and hoicks it across the line to send it over mid-on. Didn't time it but got enough to send it over mid-on for a four
Cottrell to Kohli, 1 run, length delivery and Kohli looks to slog it and gets it off the inner half of the bat. The ball dribbles away behind square for a single
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, stays back and pushes it down to long-on for a single
Narine to Rohit, 1 run, uses the turn on offer and plays it with the spin to push it down to long-on for a single. The man at mid-wicket tried to intervene but failed
Narine to Rohit, no run, flatter delivery and has been knocked out into the on-side
Narine to Rohit, no run, looks to go for the slog sweep and misses. Hint of turn and that would have taken the ball down leg
Narine to Rohit, FOUR, short ball, Rohit stands up tall and cuts it between point and short third for a four. That was majestic
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, tossed up delivery and has been nudged away to long-on for a single
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, fuller delivery and has been pushed out into the off-side
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, length delivery and has been push driven on the up
Cottrell to Kohli, 1 run, looks to clip the ball away, was swinging in full and Virat played it a little early to get it off the leading edge. It never went uppishly and they get a single past gully
Cottrell to Rohit, 1 run, inswinging yorker! Rohit plays it well. Gets his boot out of the way and brings the bat down in time to squirt the ball away to deep third man. Only a single
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, fuller and angled across, Rohit looks to squeeze it out and misses. Was a little late on it
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, fuller ball angled across, Rohit looks to drive and gets it off the inside edge to mid-on
Thomas to Kohli, no run, length delivery with a little bit of nibble, turned away into the on-side
Thomas to Kohli, no run, back of a length delivery and Kohli is happy to trek back and push it out into the off-side

Thomas to Rohit, 1 run, and almost a catch for the man at deep third. Rohit used the pace of the bowler and just steered it. The man at deep third came charging in but the landed on the half-volley to him
Thomas to Rohit, no run, hops back and taps the ball down under his eyes
Thomas to Rohit, SIX, looks to pull, not in control and the ball sails over fine leg for a sixer. Rohit and India will take that. That went fine and the man at fine leg was never in the picture
Thomas to Rohit, no run, length delivery and has been turned away into the on-side

Cottrell to Dhawan, out Lbw!! And just as I said Dhawan is biding his time, he goes for a hoick across the line to miss it. The ball hit him low on the back pad and it seemed plumb enough for the batter not to review it. He started walking immediately once he was given out. India lose a wicket early. Not a pleasant start to the tour for Dhawan. Dhawan lbw b Cottrell 1(7)
Cottrell to Dhawan, no run, back of a length delivery and has been pushed out into the off-side off the back foot
Cottrell to Dhawan, wide, the ball spills down leg and Dhawan let it go. Wided. Poor delivery from Cottrell
Cottrell to Dhawan, no run, stabs at a delivery outside off and gets it down to point
Cottrell to Dhawan, no run, tucks the batter up with a short of length delivery and Dhawan stayed back to push it out into the off-side
Cottrell to Dhawan, wide, another length delivery but wide outside off and rightfully wided by the ump
Cottrell to Dhawan, no run, length delivery outside off and has been pushed out into the off-side
Cottrell to Dhawan, no run, back foot punch but it finds the man at point
Thomas to Rohit, no run, full toss on the pads, clipped to mid-wicket
Thomas to Rohit, no run, length, wide outside off and Rohit throws his bat at it only to miss it. Lot of carry for Thomas as the ball reared up as it reached the keeper
Thomas to Dhawan, 1 run, uses the pace of the bowler and runs it down to third man for a single
Thomas to Rohit, 1 run, taps the ball away into the off-side with soft hands and runs through for a single
Thomas to Rohit, no run, on the pads and knocked away into the on-side
Thomas to Rohit, no run, length delivery and Rohit pushes forward to get an inside edge on to the pads

Bhuvneshwar to Ramdin, 2 runs, slower short of length delivery, Ramdin flat-bats it past Bhuvi and Holder was always going back for the second. Kohli charges in and sends a throw to Pant but he cannot prevent the double

Bhuvneshwar to Ramdin, 2 runs, slower delivery outside off, Ramdin reaches out and lifts it over a backtracking Sundar, he gets there on the bounce and fumbles to allow the second to be taken with ease
Bhuvneshwar to Holder, 1 run, full and close to yorker length, Holder squeezes the drive to extra cover

Bhuvneshwar to Holder, SIX, in the air and over Kohli. It was a miscue from Holder but it kept sailing over the Indian captain. The off-cutter outside off, Holder goes deep in the crease and lofts it high into the night sky, not off the middle and hence just managed to clear long-off
Bhuvneshwar to Holder, 2 runs, full and outside off, Holder drives it wide of long-off and immediately called for two, easily done

Bhuvneshwar to Holder, FOUR, tough chance put down. It is Kohli this time. Slower back of a length delivery and Holder flat-bats it towards long-off, Kohli sprints across and goes with one-hand, the ball does not stick and it bounces before it reaches the fence
Chahar to Holder, 1 run, knuckle ball to end the over, Holder is through his heave early and the toe-end ricochets onto the back pad, rolls towards the backward point region and the duo cross over

Chahar to Holder, SIX, Holder got hold of that alright. Length ball right in the arc, Holder sets up a nice base with a cleared front leg and then uses long levers to smash it straight back over the sightscreen. Massive hit!

Chahar to Holder, 2 runs, banged the slower delivery into the surface, Holder is early into the pull and ends up dragging it in front of square to the left of deep mid-wicket, Kohli keeps it down to a brace
Chahar to Ramdin, 1 run, back of a length slower one, Ramdin nurdles it round the corner - to backward square leg
Chahar to Holder, 1 run, floaty full delivery outside off, Holder drives it down to long-off
Chahar to Ramdin, 1 run, short and outside off, Ramdin cracks it square on the off-side and Jadeja tidies up

Chahal to Ramdin, 1 run, drifting in with the angle and Ramdin wrists it along the ground to long-on. A fine spell from Chahal comes to an end, he has given India hope of keeping West Indies to under 200. Finishes with figures of 4-0-36-2

Chahal to Ramdin, FOUR, the epidemic is catching up with everyone. Chahar now does not bend down enough to make the stop. Flighted outside off, Ramdin drives it past extra cover and Chahar did the hard work of getting there from long-off, but allows it to roll into the ad cushions
Chahal to Ramdin, no run, tossed up around off, Ramdin camps back and knocks it to cover

Chahal to Pollard, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Two wickets in three balls and Chahal has made sure India are not batted out of the game. These are crucial breakthroughs especially in the final 15 balls. The quicker one that drifts in after pitching, Pollard plays down the wrong line as he looks to loft it over the bowler or long-off, beaten on the inside edge and the ball crashes into top of leg-stump. Pollard b Chahal 37(19) [4s-1 6s-4]
Chahal to Holder, 1 run, flighted outside off, Holder eases the drive to long-off

Chahal to Hetmyer, out Caught by Rohit!! Finally a catch has been taken and it is Rohit himself. The ball seems to be following him and Sundar a lot today. The leg-break turning down leg, Hetmyer kneels down and slog sweeps it with the spin, but the southpaw does not get the elevation to clear the long leg fielder. Rohit barely had to move as he lapped it up comfortably. Much needed wicket for India. Hetmyer c Rohit b Chahal 56(41) [4s-2 6s-4]
Chahar to Hetmyer, 1 run, short of length around off, Hetmyer mistimes the pull to deep mid-wicket
Chahar to Pollard, 1 run, full and close to yorker length, Pollard squeezes it out to long-on

Chahar to Pollard, SIX, Pollard making them pay. This was back of a length and around off, Pollard clears his front leg and waits for the ball to arrive, then uses his raw power to launch it way back into the stands near deep mid-wicket

Chahar to Pollard, SIX, dropped! India's horror day in the field just keeps getting worse. Rohit after making two top saves on the previous two deliveries parries one over the rope. Full and in the slot, Pollard muscles it flat to long-on, Rohit steadied himself and went reverse cup over his head, but the ball burst through them

Chahar to Pollard, 2 runs, Rohit almost pulls off a one-handed stunner. Short ball and Pollard fetches the pull from outside off, the top-edge skies towards long-on and Rohit stumbled a bit as he ran to his right, but got there by sticking his right hand out, caught the ball as well but the momentum was taking him over so he parried it back onto the ground

Chahar to Hetmyer, 1 run, dropped! Sundar is having a forgettable day. He misjudged a sitter in the previous one and now allows one to burst through his hands. Hetmyer miscues the loft towards long-on, Sundar runs to his right and slides across to get both hands under the ball, but it somehow escapes his grasp and Rohit puts in an acrobatic dive to flick the ball in play. He saved three there
Chahal to Hetmyer, 1 run, tossed up around off, Hetmyer nudges it to deep mid-wicket and retains strike

Chahal to Hetmyer, 2 runs, now Pant lets one through. India have been poor in the field. Hetmyer cracks the cut to deep extra cover and Jadeja flings a flat throw, the ball lands on the practice surface next to the main pitch and bounces over Pant, extra run conceded
Chahal to Hetmyer, no run, goes for a big slog sweep and drags it off the under-edge to short fine

Chahal to Hetmyer, SIX, fifty for Hetmyer. He raises his bat towards the dugout as Pollard walks up to congratulate him. Flighted delivery outside off, Hetmyer sits on his back knee and pumps it straight back, the flat hit goes sailing over the fence easily
Chahal to Pollard, 1 run, quicker and outside off, Pollard drills it powerfully to long-off

Chahal to Hetmyer, 1 run, oh Sundar what have you done? He has misjudged a sitter. Leg-break turning down leg, Hetmyer was through his pull a bit early and the top-edge ballooned up near short fine leg, Sundar thought it was coming to him and stayed put, by the time he decided to come forward the ball had already landed in front of him. The on air comms suggest that "he might have lost it in the light"

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, no run, good length ball at the stumps, Pollard works it to square leg and thought about the single but Iyer was placed perfectly and Hetmyer sent his skipper back. A fine over from Bhuvneshwar, just the 3 runs off it
Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, 1 run, dragged back length and Hetmyer punches it past a diving Bhuvi to his right, single to long-off

Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, no run, 115.8kph knuckle ball which curls in a bit, Hetmyer turns it off the inside half to square leg and Dube has a needless shy at the striker's end, so easily could have given away a run
Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, 1 run, back of a length around off, Pollard knocks it in front of long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, 1 run, 119.7kph angled across the left hander, chopped towards point
Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, no run, starts with a slower delivery, Hetmyer carefully knocks it to cover
Chahal to Hetmyer, 1 run, slower and around off, Hetmyer works it towards square leg and sets off, easily taken single
Chahal to Pollard, 1 run, flatter and drifting in, Pollard nudges it in front of square on the leg-side

Chahal to Pollard, SIX, the pressure-releaser. Just a chip and it ends up 20 rows back. Chahal errs in length and lands it right in the spot, Pollard uses his reach and lofts it handsomely over long-on. Pure timing!
Chahal to Pollard, wide, now this one slides on and strays down leg, Pollard misses the glance and Pant fumbles before lighting up the stumps. The back leg was firmly rooted to the crease
Chahal to Pollard, no run, three dots.. Now a floaty delivery outside off, Pollard tries to smash it out of the ground but is defeated by the away spin. Smart bowling from Chahal
Chahal to Pollard, no run, quicker and skidding on, Pollard clears his front leg to play the whip but is beaten by the pace, hit once again on the pad
Chahal to Pollard, no run, drifting in with the angle and Pollard misses the nudge to the on-side, struck on the pad down leg

Jadeja to Hetmyer, FOUR, oh no! That is a rare sight on a cricket field - Kohli misfielding. He is a very safe ground fielder but this ferociously struck drive finds its way past him. Fired in full and outside off, Hetmyer drills it to extra cover and for some reason Kohli is not able to get behind the ball. Those last two balls have ruined Jadeja's figures as he finishes with 4-0-30-1

Jadeja to Hetmyer, SIX, high into the night sky and long way back in the stands. Hetmyer knew it was a dart and set himself down with his back knee on the ground, then used the long levers to muscle the slog sweep over deep square leg
Jadeja to Hetmyer, no run, fraction short and outside off, Hetmyer steers the late cut straight to backward point
Jadeja to Pollard, 1 run, 100.9kph arrowing in at the stumps, Pollard nudges it through mid-wicket
Jadeja to Pollard, no run, flatter and close to off, Pollard is happy to knock it back to Jadeja
Jadeja to Hetmyer, 1 run, darted from round the wicket and Hetmyer nurdles it square on the leg-side
Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, 1 run, short of length around off, Hetmyer pulls it off the front foot to deep mid-wicket
Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, no run, 137.3kph good length ball around off, Hetmyer defends it back to Dube
Shivam Dube to Pollard, 1 run, walks down and tucks the back of a length delivery through mid-wicket, for a single

Shivam Dube to Pollard, SIX, Pollard is off to a flier now. The expected short delivery but Dube does not have the pace to trouble the big man, though the pull was not middled the power of Pollard ensured it sailed over the deep square leg fence comfortably

Shivam Dube to Pollard, FOUR, half tracker at 127.6kph and Pollard dismisses it from his presence. Stays back in the crease and nails the pull in front of square to the right of long-on, no chance for Kohli near the fence
Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, 1 run, gentle 130.7kph full delivery on leg-stump, flicked away to deep mid-wicket
Jadeja to Hetmyer, 1 run, fired across the left hander, Hetmyer prods forward and nudges it through the open mid-wicket area

Jadeja to Hetmyer, no run, appeal for caught behind by Jadeja and Pant. But the latter gestures there wasn't any bat on that. Another quick delivery and Hetmyer is beaten on the late cut, the ball almost trims the under-edge before Pant juggles to lap it up
Jadeja to Hetmyer, no run, waits for the dart outside off and dabs it straight to short third man

Jadeja to Hetmyer, FOUR, Hetmyer ensures the boundaries don't dry up. He uses the depth of the crease, converts it into a shortish ball and pummels the pull to wide long-on, Sundar's desparate dive goes in vain

Jadeja to Pollard, 1 run, arm-ball that skids on and keeps coming in with the angle, Pollard inside halves the forward block to the right of Jadeja and the duo sprint across for a quick single. Jadeja attacked the ball and fired a throw at the bowler's end but Pollard beats him comfortably

Jadeja to Brandon King, out Stumped!! Smart cricket from Jadeja. He saw the batsman advance and dragged the length back, there is a bit of grip and deviation from the surface and it beats King's swinging willow, Pant does the rest behind the stumps. King had adjusted well to such a delivery from Sundar earlier but the slight turn on this Jadeja's delivery defeated him. A fine knock comes to an end. Brandon King st Pant b Jadeja 31(23) [4s-3 6s-1]
Chahal to Brandon King, 1 run, gets it off the inside edge through mid-wicket as he swings across the line. West Indies - 101/2 after 10
Chahal to Hetmyer, 1 run, slightly short ball by Chahal, Hetmyer punches it through covers for one
Chahal to Hetmyer, no run, gets a leading edge towards covers, as he doesn't read the tossed up delivery as he would have liked to
Chahal to Hetmyer, 2 runs, punches this one through the gap at covers for a couple of runs

Chahal to Hetmyer, SIX, even Chahal isn't going to be spared, it seems. West Indies do struggle to play spin, but Hetmyer might have seen a bit of Chahal in the IPL, playing for the same franchise. Picks the googly to perfection, goes down on his knee and deposits it over the wide long-on fence, six runs
Chahal to Hetmyer, no run, shortish legbreak by Chahal, Hetmyer rocks back, opens his bat face and slices it to cover-point
Jadeja to Brandon King, no run, in the channel outside off, darted again by the spinner and it's been sliced to point
Jadeja to Hetmyer, 1 run, 100.0kph, Jadeja firing it in having conceded a six on the first ball. This was placed into the gap at point off his back foot, but that'll give him not more than one

Jadeja to Brandon King, 1 run, 97.3kph, flatter delivery by Jadeja, this one skids along the deck around middle and leg, Brandon King knocks it in front of long-on, in fact wide long-on, but the batsmen settle for one run
Jadeja to Hetmyer, 1 run, scythes this shortish delivery towards point for a run
Jadeja to Hetmyer, no run, eases this one into the off side, as he fails to read it late
Jadeja to Hetmyer, SIX, Hetmyer joins the party! On a length by Jadeja, Hetmyer treks back in his crease and tonks it over long-on for a huge six, that's his first one of the night
Washington Sundar to Brandon King, no run, fired on a short length by Washington Sundar, 95.6kph, Brandon King goes for a flat batted shot, gets beaten due to the pace and bounce though
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, 1 run, floated ball by Washington Sundar, it's on a slightly full length, Hetmyer pats it into the gap at covers, one run taken
Washington Sundar to Brandon King, 1 run, plays this one through covers for a single

Washington Sundar to Brandon King, FOUR, that was in the air for a while, but it has dropped just short of Rahul at long-on. Brandon King had pulled the short ball off his back foot, and for a moment he would have been anxious. Was a good effort by Rahul in the deep, but unfortunately couldn't get his fingers underneath, four runs is the end result
Washington Sundar to Brandon King, wide, fired down the leg side, Brandon King can't connect his glance

Washington Sundar to Brandon King, FOUR, this is what I was talking about. Although Lewis is back to the pavilion, King looks well set. He shimmies down the track and slaps the floated delivery over extra cover, there was a fielder sprinting across in the deep, but this was placed well past him
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, 1 run, knocks the flatter delivery to long-on and hands over the strike to the set batsman
Jadeja to Hetmyer, 1 run, short ball by Jadeja to end the over, Hetmyer pulls it towards long-on off his back foot and ends the over with a single
Jadeja to Hetmyer, no run, eases this one back to the bowler, played this one off his front foot

Jadeja to Brandon King, 1 run, Kohli suggests the bowler to have a go after the ball, Brandon King had worked it in front of mid-wicket but Jadeja is quick to scamper across, keeps the batsman down to a single
Jadeja to Hetmyer, 1 run, pitched up by Jaddu, floated ball and it's been driven through mid-on by Hetmyer
Jadeja to Hetmyer, no run, short in length and outside off, Hetmyer opens his bat face and slices it to the man at point

Jadeja to Brandon King, leg byes, 1 run, Jadeja bowls a shortish delivery to start his spell, this one has a good carry on it, Brandon King tries to work it through the leg side, but the ball rises up, hits the batsman's thigh pad and flies over the man at slip
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, no run, down the leg side, Hetmyer glances it fine, but straight to the man inside the ring
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, 2 runs, floated delivery by Washington Sundar to greet the new batsman, Hetmyer works it through the gap at mid-wicket for a couple of runs to open his account

Washington Sundar to Lewis, out Lbw!! Lewis has been adjudged lbw but the replays show that the impact might be outside off. But King thinks this was out and suggests the batsman to keep walking. Guess West Indies have missed out on a trick here. They should have taken the review, especially with the way Lewis was taking on the bowlers. Washington Sundar bowls an off-break around off and the batsman gets beaten on his sweep. The impact was impact off and this being an off-spinner, this would have probably missed the off-stump. Hang on. The impact was umpire's call and it was umpire's call on hitting too. So, the review wouldn't have made a difference. Lewis lbw b Washington Sundar 40(17) [4s-3 6s-4]
Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, shortish delivery outside off, Lewis slices it towards the fielder at point

Washington Sundar to Lewis, SIX, this is some exhibition of batting by Lewis. He's raced away to 40 only in 15 balls. This six also brings up the 50-run stand between this pair. A floated delivery outside off and the southpaw has chipped it over covers for six more
Washington Sundar to Brandon King, 1 run, shortish darter by Washington Sundar, Brandon King hacks it off his back foot to long-on and takes one

Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, FOUR, ends the over with a touch of finesse. Deft. Short ball by Bhuvneshwar on the batsman's pads, Lewis connects his glance and the ball races away to the fine leg fence at the rate of knots, just had to get some bat on it, which he did

Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, SIX, stand and deliver! That six also brings up the fifty for West Indies. Full in length outside off, Lewis stays put and swings hard, connects it to perfection and the ball sails over the deep extra cover fence, it's a maximum, yup, yet again!

Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, no run, good change in pace by Bhuvi, keeps this one slow, 120ks to be precise, Lewis plays a tentative drive towards extra cover where Rohit misfields and parris it towards mid-off. He tried to attack the ball there, but couldn't gather it cleanly
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, no run, 135.5kph, pitched on a full length by Bhuvneshwar, was meant to be put away, but Lewis can't pierce the gap at covers, the drive was decent enough, but not into the gap
Bhuvneshwar to Brandon King, 1 run, direct-hit by Kohli at the batsman's end, but Lewis is well in. King plays a check-drive towards mid-off and completes a comfortable single
Bhuvneshwar to Brandon King, no run, short ball by Bhuvneshwar, good carry on that, and King is forced to sway away from the firing line

Chahar to Brandon King, 1 run, 19 runs off the over. West Indies are off to a fine start. Short of a length delivery in the channel outside off, Brandon King knocks it off his back foot into the gap at covers and takes a single

Chahar to Brandon King, SIX, I'll have to take my words back, I suppose. Runs are coming from both the ends. Chahar drops this one short again, rising around the batsman's abdomen, Brandon King reads the length early, and although he takes his eyes off the ball for a moment, he manages to connect his pull. The timing and contact is just about fine as the ball flies over the man at deep square leg, six more!

Chahar to Brandon King, no run, some respite for India when Lewis is not on strike. Chahar keeps this one short outside off, this one skids along the deck and the batsman knocks it off his back foot towards cover

Chahar to Lewis, 1 run, speared into the batsman from round the wicket, it's a back of length delivery by Chahar, Lewis tries to work it through the leg side, but it comes off an inside edge and rolls into the pocket between square leg and mid-wicket
Chahar to Lewis, wide, pressure mounting on the bowler, attempts a slower delivery but he's sprayed this one well outside off, Lewis doesn't bother to flirt with it

Chahar to Lewis, FOUR, India are bleeding boundaries. Short of a length delivery, width on offer too, and although the off-side is packed, Lewis manages to pierce it. Treks back, opens his bat face and carves it through the gap at point

Chahar to Lewis, SIX, Lewis has hit two sixes and a four in the innings, and all have come in this region. Chahar fetches a back of length delivery on the batsman's pads, Lewis makes the most out of it, swivels and helps it over fine leg for half-a-dozen more. Onto the second tier, making merry is the left hander

Bhuvneshwar to Brandon King, no run, India slightly pulling things back after the first over. 14 runs have come in the next two. Short of a length delivery outside off, skidding along the deck, Brandon King goes for a punch off his back foot, but again the timing isn't good enough, mid-off it is..

Bhuvneshwar to Brandon King, 2 runs, back of a length delivery around off, 117kph, Brandon King pulls it through mid-wicket with lack of conviction, the timing wasn't that great, hence it won't fetch the batsman more than two
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, 1 run, 132kph, sharp inswinger by Bhuvneshwar, the length is just about full, Lewis eases it towards mid-on with an on-drive and takes a quick single
Bhuvneshwar to Brandon King, 1 run, in the channel outside off, on back of a length and it's been sliced through backward point by Brandon King, just one

Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, leg byes, 1 run, an appeal by Bhuvneshwar, rather an optimistic one. Swinging down the leg side and the impact was outside leg too. Lewis goes for a flick, but this one comes off his pads and rolls towards short fine leg, the keeper is quick to sprint across, but he can't deny the leg bye
Bhuvneshwar to Brandon King, 1 run, back of a length delivery to start his spell, Bhuvneshwar keeps it around the middle stump line, Brandon King works it through mid-wicket and takes one

Chahar to Brandon King, 1 run, drags back the length on this one, directs it on the middle and leg stumps, Brandon King flicks it through backward square leg and ends the over with a single. Windies going along a run-rate of 10-plus after the first two overs

Chahar to Brandon King, FOUR, he's a good batsman, is Brandon King. We all witnessed his heroics during the recently concluded CPL. Not that full a ball this one, Brandon King comes on his front foot and plays an uppish drive as he finds the gap at extra cover, once it's past the circle, there's no stopping that, such is the outfield!
Chahar to Lewis, 1 run, pitched up by Chahar, slightly straighter line around off, Lewis crunches his drive towards mid-off and quickly scampers across to the other end

Chahar to Brandon King, 1 run, another fine delivery by Chahar, swing on it, full in length around off and Brandon King gets a leading edge as he goes for a drive, it evades the fielder at point and King is on his way
Chahar to Brandon King, wide, sprays this one down the leg side, hint of swing the other way, Brandon King can't connect his glance as it's a wide one

Chahar to Simmons, out Caught by Rohit!! Chahar strikes in his first over, dream start for the pacer. Bowls an outswinger in the channel outside off, it's a length delivery and the batsman drives at it with lack of footwork. The outside edge is induced and it's a regulation take for Rohit Sharma at first slip, the only fielder in the cordon. All of a sudden the crowd have gone berserk, can clearly witness an increase in the decibel levels. Simmons c Rohit b Chahar 2(4)
Chahar to Simmons, no run, 129.7kph, hint of outswing on this shortish delivery, Simmons defends this one off his back foot
Washington Sundar to Simmons, 1 run, good start for the Windies, 13 runs of the first over. Darted at 93kph by Washington Sundar, Simmons works it into the pocket at mid-wicket for a single
Washington Sundar to Lewis, 1 run, darted around off, Lewis goes down on his knee and sweeps this one through square leg
Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, short in length, in the channel outside off, Lewis punches it into the off side, wasn't timed that well by the southpaw

Washington Sundar to Lewis, SIX, and things get worse for Washington Sundar as he drops this one short. Lewis latches onto it and deposits it over the deep backward square leg fence. As easy as it can get!

Washington Sundar to Lewis, FOUR, Lewis gets off the mark with a boundary. Short ball down the leg side, Lewis swivels early and helps it past the man at short fine leg with excellent timing, not a great delivery against the left hander

Washington Sundar to Simmons, 1 run, shortish off-break by Washington Sundar, spinning into the batsman around middle and leg, Simmons clips it through mid-wicket and gets off the mark with a gentle single

Kesrick Williams to Kohli, SIX, and he signs off with a stunning flat lofted drive over extra-cover too. India have chased 208 with 8 balls to spare. What scenes from Kohli. He points to the back of his shirt towards his name and then lets out an intense roar. Pollard looks away. And then he takes the helmet off and has his arms aloft to all corners of the ground. Never seen Kohli this intense and animated recently
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, 2 runs, advances and drives to extra-cover

Kesrick Williams to Kohli, SIX, hey you! Such stunning, proper cricketing hits in this so-called kaboom short form of the game. Full delivery outside off stump, Kohli spots the ball early and plays a delightful lofted extra-cover drive
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, 2 runs, just a chip to deep mid-wicket

Pollard to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught&Bowled!! Oh a stunner from Pollard in his followthrough. Brilliant catch and look at his reaction. He turns, looks at Kohli. Folds his hands, looks at the sky and points the finger. This is absolutely fine and good to watch than some needless words. Short of a length slower delivery outside off stump, Iyer lost shape trying to loft to long-off, hits it uppishly, Pollard flew full length to his left and pouched that. Made it look so simple. Shreyas Iyer c and b Pollard 4(6)
Pollard to Kohli, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Kohli drives to long-off

Pollard to Shreyas Iyer, leg byes, 1 run, fullish and angling down leg, Iyer misses the flick, impact almost outside leg, Pollard expectedly went for the review, just to drag the game and ball-tracker shows missing leg
Pollard to Kohli, 1 run, short of length delivery, Kohli flicks it towards short mid-wicket, Pollard takes aim at Virat's end but doesn't throw

Pollard to Kohli, SIX, that's a take that whip shot for six and look at the way he's staring at Pollard. Pollard better let the cricket do the talking. Slower delivery in the slot, picked, easily powered over mid-wicket
Pollard to Kohli, wide, Pollard fires it down the leg-side
Pollard to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, shortish slower delivery, Iyer pulls it over mid-wicket
Cottrell to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Shreyas Iyer shuffles, Cottrell bowls a slower delivery, flicked to mid-wicket

Cottrell to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, very full delivery, Iyer flicks it to mid-wicket, Cottrell attacks the ball and keeps it down to a run, has a real go with the throw to the keeper, who fumbles, and the man backing up, Simmons, too lets it go making the bowler furious. But he's got to question himself for that needless throw first!
Cottrell to Shreyas Iyer, no run, nice yorker, Iyer digs it out towards cover
Cottrell to Kohli, 1 run, guided to backward point

Cottrell to Pant, out Caught by Holder!! This is bad batting, but that's what Pant gives you. Some audacious hits combined with poorly-thought shots. This is a slower delivery way outside off stump and he's trying to smash it to leg, when extra-cover was a more sensible option. Sliced it completely, dolly for long-off with a few steps forward. And Cottrell does his customary salute. This is a bit more intense than normal though because of the situation around Kohli with Williams. Pant c Holder b Cottrell 18(9) [6s-2]
Cottrell to Kohli, 1 run, full delivery outside off stump, Kohli drives it to deep extra-cover
Kesrick Williams to Pant, 2 runs, Pant has whipped this yorker with strong wrists to deep mid-wicket, Kohli rockets to the bowler's end as the throw comes to his end
Kesrick Williams to Pant, no ball, 2 runs, dug out in front of long-on, yet another no-ball called from the third umpire for overstepping. Free-hit!

Kesrick Williams to Pant, SIX, Rishabh Pant! He's played a lofted shot over long-off on one knee. We have seen Raina do that often over extra-cover, but this bloke has hit it flat over long-off. Look at Kohli, he is super charged. He's screaming in the bowler's face or may be a statement to Pollard
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, 1 run, whipped away to deep mid-wicket

Kesrick Williams to Kohli, SIX, now wait! Is that a machine with rubber like flexibility? How do you even do that? The yorker from Kesrick Williams, again misses by half a yard or so, Kohli whips, I don't know how he managed so much power. Flat and hard over wide long-on. And look at Kohli immitating Kesrick Williams's notebook celebration from the CPL to Chadwick Walton. He's into the bowler. This is great entertainment from both sides. Pollard runs to the bowler to have a chat

Kesrick Williams to Kohli, FOUR, it's such a sight for a batsman to see the bowler duck for cover. You know you've middled it, you know you've won a mini battle. Williams bowls a yorker from round the wicket, just missed his mark, Kohli with his strong bottom hand grip powers the ball straight down the ground
Kesrick Williams to Pant, 1 run, nice off-side yorker, Pant digs it out to mid-wicket
Holder to Pant, 1 run, low full toss outside off stump, Pant guides to third man
Holder to Pant, no run, again loses his balance trying to swing too hard for the pull shot. Pant tries to pull and misses
