Holder to Pant, no run, oh Pant! Balance please, balance. Overpitched delivery outside off stump, normally you would see that go racing past extra-cover for four. But Pant loses balance while trying to reach out and finds the fielder
Holder to Kohli, 1 run, nice delivery to prevent the batsman from hitting. Short and rising, Kohli could only pull it wide of long-on
Holder to Kohli, no ball, 2 runs, low full toss, Kohli flicks it wide of long-on, rushes back for the second. Umpire Anil Chaudhary whispers no ball from the box again. Free-hit
Holder to Kohli, FOUR, edge, third man in, four! India motoring along nicely. Shortish delivery from Holder, Kohli gave room to cut late, thick edge and that was good enough

Holder to Kohli, SIX, this is as good as that back foot lofted drive Kohli played a few months ago, don't remember the opposition. Not easy to play the lofted shot to a slower ball because you need to manufacture all the power. But such is his timing on that it sails easily over long-off. That brings up Kohli's fifty

K Pierre to Pant, SIX, and there you go! This is the flair that Pant brings. He plays some audacious shots to get that excitement going. Pierre fired a full delivery, Pant slogged, off balance though. You expect him to lose shape while trying to slog, an area that he desperately needs to tinker with, but the contact was awesome and sailed over long-on
K Pierre to Kohli, 1 run, swiped to deep mid-wicket
K Pierre to Kohli, 2 runs, fullish delivery on the stumps, Kohli mistimes the slog along the ground to deep mid-wicket

K Pierre to Rahul, out Caught by Pollard!! He's mishit this and he knows immediately. Plugs the bat into the ground hoping for a dropped catch, but it's the bucket hands of Pollard at long-off. Rahul walks back gutted. Juicy full delivery, Rahul probably looked for a lofted drive over extra-cover, so didn't go really hard, hit that flat and straight to the fielder. Massive wicket for Windies. Rahul c Pollard b K Pierre 62(40) [4s-5 6s-4]
K Pierre to Rahul, SIX, that's a 101m hit from Rahul. Do not bowl length to a set batsman. Moved across to slog-sweep and connection was sweet, over deep mid-wicket
K Pierre to Kohli, 1 run, slogged to wide long-on off the bottom of the bat

Kesrick Williams to Rahul, SIX, finally! There's the contact he wanted to make with that short-arm jab pull shot that he was trying for a while. Shortish delivery from Kesrick Williams, Rahul backs away and pulls and it over backward square leg

Kesrick Williams to Kohli, 1 run, India struggling for timing now. Pace of the ball, Kohli trying to hit too hard, gets an under edge that rolls past the stumps. Oh Kohli is angry. He complains to the ump about the bowler coming in his line, but replays show that the bowler was only trying to go towards the ball. No contact made. Maybe Kohli was saying the bowler had no chance of getting to the ball so that attempt was needless
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, wide, clever from Kohli. Moved inside the line to this leg-side yorker to get the wide
Kesrick Williams to Rahul, 1 run, he's horribly mistimed this short of length slower delivery to the left of the bowler. He's livid with himself, but that run also raises the fifty for KL

Kesrick Williams to Rahul, no run, why! Why attempt fancy swipes when you are so gifted with shots all around? This is a free-hit ball too. Short delivery, Rahul can't get into position to pull, misses

Kesrick Williams to Kohli, no ball, 1 run, low full toss, Kohli flicks to deep square leg. Suddenly there's buzz around the ground. Oh that's the first no ball called from the air-conditioned box. Free-hit for overstepping

Kesrick Williams to Rahul, 1 run, in the airrrr, King's put that down! Toughie! In fact he didn't get there. Really ugly swipe with the front leg getting into a tangle trying to whip-flick the short of length delivery behind square, the ball lobs in front of backward square leg off the top-edge, King ran forward from short fine leg, couldn't get there despite a dive
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, 1 run, he wanted to loft that slower ball over cover, but toe-ended this short nut to long-off. Looks at the bottom of the bat and smiles
Holder to Kohli, 1 run, short of a length outside off, Kohli stands tall and slaps it down to long-off for one - 14 runs of the over
Holder to Kohli, wide, goes for the wide yorker but misses it by an inch, it's an easy call for the umpire

Holder to Kohli, FOUR, that's a very high full toss and should have been called a no ball. The umpire isn't convinced though, he thinks this was just below the waist. Kohli hacks it over deep mid-wicket and takes four more

Holder to Kohli, SIX, that's a six by a rather rusty Virat Kohli. A slower bouncer by Holder and Kohli takes his eyes off the ball as he attempts a hook, the ball comes off the top edge and flies well over the fielder at deep backward square leg, just the kind of kickstart he needed to get going
Holder to Kohli, no run, that's a good leave by Kohli. Full length delivery and well outside off, Kohli has a look and leaves it alone
Holder to Rahul, 1 run, full toss by Holder and the batsman has failed to put it away. He whipped it away aerially and connected well, however, it dropped well short of the man at deep mid-wicket

Holder to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, on a length and outside off, Kohli shuffles in his crease and looks to play a ramp shot, but the bowler follows him up nicely, the ball eventually comes off his thigh pad and drops in front of the keeper

Hayden Walsh to Rahul, no run, drops it really short, Rahul sets up to pull, gets it off the toe-end back to the bowler who threatens to break the stumps at the non-striker's end, but Kohli does a backward split to get back into the crease! Fitness, worrrrd!
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, no run, skids through, hurries onto the batsman, who plays another low-margin cut towards point
Hayden Walsh to Kohli, 1 run, zips through just outside off, no width on offer, Kohli opens the face and glides it softly to short third man for a single - overthrow, but no damage done
Hayden Walsh to Kohli, FOUR, skids through, does the flipper, Kohli has a go at the pull, gets a thick inside edge past the leg-stump to deep fine leg for four!
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, 1 run, short, not particularly wide, a bottom-handed slapp off the backfoot towards sweeper cover for a single
Hayden Walsh to Kohli, 1 run, loopy, a tad too full to sweep, gets a thick inside edge towards backward square leg for a single
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, 1 run, low full-toss, attempted blockhole ball, 137.1km/h, Kohli uses the depth of crease and whips it down towards deep midwicket for a single
Kesrick Williams to Rahul, 1 run, onto the hips, and that's tucked away from the crease to deep midwicket for a single
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, 1 run, short and angling in, sliced away whilst on his toes for a single - over the in-field towards sweeper cover
Kesrick Williams to Rahul, 1 run, onto the thigh, tucked away off the backfoot towards midwicket for a single
Kesrick Williams to Rahul, FOUR, not a lot of width, a bottom-handed, crouched cut, in the air, and a flying Walsh can't cut it off! Flayed away to the deep backward point fence for four...
Kesrick Williams to Rahul, no run, 133.8km/h, back of a length delivery without any width, punched off the backfoot towards a diving backward point - great work by Walsh Jr.!
Holder to Rahul, 1 run, lands that on the boots, just short of the blockole at 131.5km/h, deflected away towards deep midwicket for a single
Holder to Kohli, 1 run, that's the fifty-run stand! Shortish one without any width again, and that's carved away off a top-edge towards third man for a single
Holder to Rahul, 1 run, another slower bouncer that sticks in the wicket, 110.9km/h, a delayed pull down towards backward square leg for a single
Holder to Rahul, no run, attempted yorker length delivery, ends up a low full-toss at 133.1km/h, a single-handed drive back to the right side of the bowler's followthrough
Holder to Rahul, no run, slower one at 123.2km/h, marginally slower, Rahul is into the blind hook rather early and that's soared over him into the 'keeper's gloves
Holder to Rahul, wide, down the leg-side, and that's called a wide
Holder to Kohli, 1 run, short at the body at 134.8km/h, pulled away off the frontfoot towards wide long-on for a single
K Pierre to Kohli, 1 run, skids through, as full as can be, steered late to backward point for a single
K Pierre to Kohli, FOUR, staying off the straighter line, Kohli backs away and runs his hands through the slap over the in-field towards the deep extra cover boundary for four
K Pierre to Rahul, 1 run, flat and quick on a good length, tapped off the frontfoot into the off-side for a sharp single - that's effectively a six for India
K Pierre to Rahul, 5 wides, fired down leg, Rahul leaves it alone, Ramdin, is blinded and misses it too, and that's five free runs!
K Pierre to Kohli, 1 run, flat and quick, wristily swatted away aerially towards long-on for a single
K Pierre to Rahul, 1 run, angling into the stumps, slow through the air, whipped away towards cow corner for a single
K Pierre to Kohli, 1 run, thrown up rather wide, Kohli charges down and slaps it cross-batted, with every chance of getting stumps, over the in-field between extra cover and long-off for a single

Hayden Walsh to Rahul, FOUR, zips through, spins away from a good length, Rahul is low and just manages to open the face of the blade to guide that fine down to the third man fence for four! He's gotten off to a fantastic start - time to take his side home now...
Hayden Walsh to Kohli, 1 run, straightens off a back of a length, a crouching position and another slap down towards sweeper cover for a single
Hayden Walsh to Kohli, wide, zips through down the leg-side, and that's called a wide
Hayden Walsh to Rahul, 1 run, rank half-tracker, hasn't been encashed, slapped away towards sweeper cover for a single

Hayden Walsh to Kohli, 1 run, googly, spinning back in, Kohli is really low to cut, and Cottrell at short third man dives to his right, throws himself, to cut off a potential boundary and just concedes a single
Hayden Walsh to Kohli, FOUR, lots of loop, Kohli waits on it and thumps it straight down the ground past the grabbing left hand of the bowler for four
Hayden Walsh to Kohli, no run, skids through on off-stump, Kohli stays low and chops it away towards point
K Pierre to Kohli, 1 run, skidder outside off, Kohli stays low and slaps it cross-batted to cover where Pollard cuts it off, and deflects it towards mid-off to keep it to a single
K Pierre to Kohli, no run, onto the pads of Kohli, and easily worked away towards midwicket
K Pierre to Rahul, 1 run, onto the boots, clipped away to mid-wicket for a single
K Pierre to Rahul, no run, skids through on off, a crouched cut towards point
K Pierre to Rahul, SIX, backs away into the on-side, the idea was right from Pierre, but it's right in the slot, as he nails the slog-sweep over deep square leg for six!
K Pierre to Kohli, 1 run, angled in from round the wicket, worked away off the frontfoot to long-on for a single

Cottrell to Rahul, SIX, hooked over fine leg off a top-edge for six! Bangs it in short, 138.5km/h, no width, Rahul has gone blind on that hook just hoping for the best and eventually gets enough on it into the Indian dug out for a massive six!
Cottrell to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length ball just outside off, a hop and a tap on the head to backward point for a single
Cottrell to Kohli, no run, 106km/h slower one on a short of length, Kohli tries slapping it through cover, gets a thick inside edge miscued towards the bowler
Cottrell to Kohli, no run, massive inside edge, by the sound of it, huge appeal for that, 139.8km/h, no response from the umpire. Th replays reveal that Kohli has in fact got a big inside edge on it
Cottrell to Kohli, no run, short and angling away, 139.6km/h, gets big on Kohli and that's a poor choice of shot - the pull - dragging it from wide outside off-stump, which he misses by a mile
Cottrell to Rahul, 1 run, slower one, 112.2km/h, Rahul delays the checked drive towards mid-off for a quick single
K Pierre to Kohli, no run, flat, short, fast, Kohli has to make room and slaps it towards cover
K Pierre to Rahul, 1 run, dropped short, onto the hips, tucked away off the backfoot towards deep square leg for a single
K Pierre to Rahul, no run, flat and quick on off-stump, check-driven straight to the man at cover
K Pierre to Rahul, no run, looped up on a length, a crouched chop away towards point
K Pierre to Kohli, 2 wides, fired down the leg-side, another couple of wides as the 'keeper continues to struggle

K Pierre to Rohit, out Caught by Hetmyer! He was always going to charge down the track, before the ball had left the hand, and Pierre boldly feeds him a flat, quick one on the middle-stump. Sharma is really quick and goes aerial with the whip, but ends up picking out Hetmyer at the cow corner fence who gobbles it up! India's main man departs. Rohit c Hetmyer b K Pierre 8(10) [4s-1]
K Pierre to Rohit, no run, flat and fast on the boots, dug out off the toe-end
K Pierre to Rahul, 2 wides, flat one down leg-side, Rahul tries a paddle-sweep and misses, the 'keeper does too, and that's a couple of wides
Cottrell to Rohit, FOUR, 136.2km/h, skidder off a good length, Rohit crouches low and gets a finer-than-intended edge to the third man boundary for four
Cottrell to Rohit, byes, FOUR, 133.9km/h, seemingly faster than that due to the bounce and the angle across the right-hander, Rohit goes for the hook but that flies over the 'keeper for four byes!
Cottrell to Rahul, 1 run, late into the pull, to a slower ball - 129km/h! A bit of a top-edge on the pull, and falls short of short fine leg as they rush across
Cottrell to Rohit, 1 run, 143.3km/h, short of length delivery without a lot of width, steered late down to third man for a single

Cottrell to Rohit, no run, 137.7km/h, struck hard on the rear-arm! A short of a length ball, early into the off-balance pull with that frontfoot-across trigger, hops and falls into the off-side, flinching - Rohit's wincing, and there will be a break in play. The Indian physio is out to tend to him
Cottrell to Rahul, 1 run, absolutely no width on offer, once again Rahul rides the bounce and just deflects that with the latest of cuts towards fine third man for a single
Holder to Rahul, 1 run, good length ball, seaming away a little at 132.9km/h, Rahul gets forward, opens the face and slices that towards point for a single as the man stationed fumbles
Holder to Rahul, no run, short of length ball, no width once again, a hop to get on top of the bounce and a tap on the head late to glide it towards short third man

Holder to Rahul, FOUR, another one on a back of a length, hardly any width on offer, but Rahul uses the tiny margin with the his strong bottom-hand to maneuver the ball past the right of a diving backward point for four! Rahul's looking in fine form today!
Holder to Rahul, FOUR, a short ball, but that skids through off the leather, Rahul goes for the pull but gets a healthy under-edge fine past the wicketkeeper for four!
Holder to Rahul, no run, 132.2km/h, short of length ball without a lot of width, a hop and a tap on the head towards the left of backward point
Holder to Rahul, FOUR, 133km/h, skids through on a back of a length, Rahul stays low and carves it away behind deep backward point for four
Cottrell to Rohit, 2 runs, pitched on a length, Rohit whips it off a length, mistimes it off the inside half towards cow corner for a couple
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, full-toss, fairly high and offering a lot of width, sliced away towards cover - fails to find the gap
Cottrell to Rahul, 1 run, far too straight, onto the pads, clipped off his boots in front of deep square leg for a single

Cottrell to Rahul, no run, back of a length on the pads, Rahul is late on the glance off the backfoot, onto the pads and into the off-side, Sharma is half-way down and there's a genuine run-out chance, but Cottrell can't collect cleanly! He's been spared his wicket, has Rohit...
Cottrell to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length ball on off-stump, a late glide away towards short third man for a quick single to get India off the mark
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, hits the back of a length mark, Rohit hops onto the backfoot and taps it on the head with a backfoot defensive
Paterson to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, great control of the yorker again, Pandya squeezes it out to backward square leg
Paterson to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fullish and outside off stump, Pandey drills it to mid-off
Paterson to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, this is a great over from Paterson, he's nailing those yorkers right, jammed out to mid-on, Pandya rockets back for the second
Paterson to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, fullish and on the stumps, Pandya mistimes the slog to the bowler, who half stops the ball and sends it to cover

Paterson to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, lovely yorker, Pandya just about managed to get his bat down in time, hit to mid-on and Pandey rushes back for the second, Pandya too was home before the throw came to his end
Paterson to Hardik Pandya, wide, slower ball bouncer, too high, has to be rebowled
Paterson to Manish Pandey, 1 run, finally a decent connection from Manish Pandey, but he only pulls it to deep mid-wicket
Chris Morris to Manish Pandey, 1 run, low full toss and Pandey only manages to mistimes the slog to deep mid-wicket
Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, wide low full toss, Pandya toe-ends the drive to cover

Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Chris Morris will argue that he actually bowled a pretty good ball. Low full toss but it swung into the right-hander, Pandya had to adjust late by moving his front leg out of the way, looked surprised by the swing for a moment but he managed to flick it in the gap between backward square leg and short fine leg
Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, did he even see that ball? Swung really hard at it, got into a good position to pull this short ball and square leg had no chance
Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, no run, excellent yorker outside off stump, looked like it swung back in late again, Pandya tried to squeeze it out but missed
Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, wide, the yorker goes down the leg-side

Chris Morris to Dhoni, out Bowled!! He's walked across the stumps and missed a low full toss. Dhoni wanted to flick this ball over backward square leg, but missed the line totally and the ball crashed into the base of leg stump. Maybe the ball just tailed in late there. Dhoni b Chris Morris 16(11) [4s-2]

Paterson to Dhoni, 1 run, Dhoni walks across and tries to place it wide of long leg but the bowler cleverly followed him with a back of a length and made it tougher for Dhoni, he wants two, but the fielder quickly attacked the ball
Paterson to Manish Pandey, 1 run, brilliant yorker, can't do much about it, manages to dig it out
Paterson to Manish Pandey, no run, beaten, slower delivery outside off stump, Pandey looks to cut but only connects with thin air
Paterson to Dhoni, 1 run, shortish and on the leg stump, Dhoni pulls it to fine leg
Paterson to Dhoni, FOUR, oh what power from Dhoni! Jumps out of the crease, converts it into a half-volley and muscles it past mid-off, thankfully the bowler didn't fancy stopping that with his boot
Paterson to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower ball and Pandey dabs it to short third man. Need the big hits, Pandya is still waiting in the dug out
Chris Morris to Dhoni, FOUR, low full toss and Dhoni slices it past backward point, teases the third man fielder, who can't cut it off either. Good finish to the over for India
Chris Morris to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Morris goes for the yorker, not quite there but good enough, Pandey can only drill it to wide long-on
Chris Morris to Manish Pandey, wide, short and down the leg-side, Pandey misses the pull, called a wide. Pandey is targetting the fine leg boundary as the fielder is inside the ring
Chris Morris to Dhoni, 1 run, 128kph slower ball on the off stump, Dhoni knocks it to square leg

Chris Morris to Manish Pandey, 1 run, strange shot and it's been dropped by Shamsi at short fine leg, Pandey moved across, it was a leg stump yorker, Pandey flicks uppishly, Shamsi was moving to his right and he spills the ball
Chris Morris to Dhoni, 1 run, moves across the crease to target the leg-side, but Chris Morris bowls back of a length and Dhoni could only nudge it towards square leg
Chris Morris to Dhoni, 2 runs, Dhoni goes aerial, wanted to hit over cover, but slices it over backward point as the bat turns in his hands
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, no run, tries to run it down to third man again, but doesn' get the connection right, the ball rolls towards the fielder at 45
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, no run, defended straight back to the bowler, hit the inside half of the bat
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, wide, short and spinning down the leg-side, called a wide
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, gets a stride forward and flicks this flighted delivery to deep square leg, throw comes to Shamsi but Dhoni was home
Shamsi to Dhoni, 1 run, leans forward and drives it to long-off
Shamsi to Dhoni, no run, short and spinning away, Dhoni tries to force it on the off-side and gets an edge that rolls to short third man
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, 3 runs, nicely opens the face of the bat at the last moment and guides it to third man, Phehlukwayo dives to his left at short third man but fails to stop the ball
Phehlukwayo to Manish Pandey, 1 run, sliced away to third man
Phehlukwayo to Dhoni, 1 run, short of length delivery on the off stump, Dhoni pushes it to mid-on

Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, out Caught by Klaasen!! This is an unfortunate dismissal for Dhawan. Phehlukwayo bowled the slower ball, Dhawan moved across and tried to scoop the ball, the keeper did well too to move quickly to his right as a reaction to the batsman's act at the crease. Dhawan ended up scooping it to the keeper, who completed the catch with a dive forward. Dhawan was looking ominous and this is a vital wicket for the Proteas. Pandey needs to up the ante, he's been pretty sedate. Dhawan c Klaasen b Phehlukwayo 72(39) [4s-10 6s-2]

Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, FOUR, oh hit so well! Didn't bother moving his feet, short and just outside off stump, Dhawan cuts and hits it in the air, gets it to the left of backward point and it runs away for four
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, wide, slower ball down the leg-side, Dhawan tries it help it on its way but misses
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, no run, clever bowling, saw Dhawan moving to the leg-side and followed him with a full ball, Dhawan gets an inside edge onto pad and it rolls back to the keeper
Phehlukwayo to Manish Pandey, 1 run, widish slower ball outside off stump, Pandey dabs and gets an under edge to gully

Junior Dala to Dhawan, FOUR, mistimed hit but the ball lands safely at deep mid-wicket. Shortish slower ball, Dhawan doesn't find the middle of the bat as he tries to pull, still manages to get a boundary

Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, 1 run, direct-hit would have been curtains for Manish Pandey. Hit and run from him, played it to mid-on and set off, Dala did well to run back and collect the ball, Pandey was in though when the stumps were broken

Junior Dala to Dhawan, 1 run, too good a pull shot, but just a run. Short and on the leg stump, Dhawan sends it to deep backward square leg, where the fielder does well to dive to his left and save three

Junior Dala to Dhawan, FOUR, oh my god! This game is so cruel for the bowlers. Thankfully it wasn't coming at Dala. This is a fast bowler bowling but Dhawan has got down on one knee to slog it him flat over mid-wicket and almost cleared the boundary as well. Gee, such power
Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, 1 run, down the leg-side, Pandey flicks it to long leg
Junior Dala to Manish Pandey, no run, good length delivery just outside off stump, Pandey stays leg-side of the ball and defends
Phehlukwayo to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short and outside off stump, guided to third man
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, 1 run, slower delivery on the leg stump, Dhawan flicks it to mid-wicket
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, 2 runs, brilliant running. Just a tap towards the vacant mid-wicket region, Dhawan always wanted two, pushed hard and his partner responded well too
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, leg byes, 2 runs, Dhawan tried to sweep Phehlukwayo there, it was the slower ball, Dhawan missed and it ball went through him, the keeper fails to stop
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, FOUR, this is good placement from Dhawan. Knew that the mid-wicket boundary was unmanned, so jumped out of the crease and flicked it in the air and got it over the infield
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, no run, good-looking cover drive, but Dhawan finds the fielder
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, no run, and again, opts to stay back to this incoming ball, somehow manages to defends

Shamsi to Manish Pandey, no run, just like Virat Kohli, Pandey too stays back to one that should have been played off the front foot, he fails to defend, gets hit on the front leg in line with leg stump, but the ball was bouncing too much. Shamsi was once again beyond the keeper in his running appeal and this time the review didn't go his way. South Africa retain their referral though, thanks to umpire's call
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, guided square of the wicket

Shamsi to Dhawan, FOUR, that's bludgeoned away for four more and that's fifty off 27 balls for Shikhar Dhawan. As soon as he spotted the length being short, Dhawan went back and pulled really hard for a one bounce flat four through mid-wicket
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, 1 run, pushed away to sweeper cover

Shamsi to Manish Pandey, SIX, that's a toughie for long-off and it just escapes past his jump. Flighted full and outside off stump, Pandey loft-drives looking for a maximum, hits it decently well, the fielder tried to grab it with his right hand but missed
Smuts to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short and on the stumps, punched towards short mid-wicket
Smuts to Dhawan, 1 run, shortish and on the leg stump, Dhawan pulls it to long-on
Smuts to Dhawan, 2 runs, advances and flicks into the vacant mid-wicket region, pressure on the fielder and they steal the second run
Smuts to Manish Pandey, 1 run, stays back and works it to backward square leg
Smuts to Manish Pandey, no run, very full and outside off stump, Pandey drives it to the left of the bowler, who dives to his left and stops the ball
Smuts to Dhawan, 1 run, shortish and on the stumps, Dhawan flicks it to short mid-wicket
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, full and outside off stump, Dhawan gets forward and drives towards extra-cover
Shamsi to Dhawan, no run, Dhawan tries to go hard through mid-wicket, but mistimes it
Shamsi to Manish Pandey, 1 run, leans forward and flicks to mid-wicket

Shamsi to Kohli, out Lbw!! Look at Shamsi running towards the keeper in his appeal. He was so confident that it was plumb out. The umpire though thought long and then raised the keeper, by when Shamsi almost crossed the keeper in his extended appeal. Kohli was beaten for the length and the ball turned just a bit more than he expected. He was pushing out to send it for a single towards long-on, missed and was struck right in front of middle and leg. Lack of feet there cost Kohli his wicket. Just stayed back and tried to put bat on ball. Kohli lbw b Shamsi 26(20) [4s-2 6s-1]
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, sweeps and sends it to backward square leg
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, spinning back in, Kohli dabs late to short third man
Smuts to Kohli, 1 run, neatly nudged through mid-wicket and he'll keep strike
Smuts to Dhawan, 1 run, worked away to mid-wicket
Smuts to Dhawan, FOUR, rank long hop and Dhawan punishes it. He went back and pulled powerfully through mid-wicket and beat the fielders in the deep
Smuts to Dhawan, no run, flatter delivery outside off stump, Dhawan chops the ball into the off-side

Smuts to Kohli, 1 run, the audacity with which Kohli is playing without worrying much about moving the feet tells that this is a belter of a pitch. He's very confident and it showed in this flick to mid-wicket
Smuts to Dhawan, 1 run, short on the off stump, Dhawan works it wide of long-on, fumble but they don't take the run. Fifty partnership up
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, short enough for Dhawan to go back and punch to long-on
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, goes back and nudges to short mid-wicket

Shamsi to Kohli, SIX, what a shot! Didn't try to hit that hard at all. Flighted delivery on the stumps, Kohli leans forward, just extends his arms and lofts the ball, timing was brilliant and it flew over the long-off boundary
Shamsi to Kohli, 2 runs, tucked to backward square leg and it's good enough for two
Shamsi to Kohli, FOUR, immediately hurts with a cut shot, short and wide outside off stump, Kohli places it past backward point and it runs away for four

Shamsi to Kohli, no run, now then, I can't believe my eyes! Virat Kohli has been dropped and it was a sitter for Behardien. This is a big moment in the game and he's been in unbelievable form. Flighted delivery on the stumps, Kohli lofts, doesn't get the connection right, hits it straight to long-on, who doesn't accept the offer. Strangely, Kohli didn't even take a run. Maybe he thought the catch would be taken
Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, short and wide, spoils the over. Dhawan allows the ball to come and cuts square of the wicket past point. Once it hit the gap, the ball sped away for four
Chris Morris to Dhawan, no run, good length delivery outside off stump, Dhawan toe-ends the push into the off-side

Chris Morris to Kohli, 1 run, this is good bowling from Chris Morris, knows Kohli is trying to get under the ball, so is banging it in in the short of length zone, Kohli mistimes the back foot drive in the air and mistimes it over cover
Chris Morris to Kohli, no run, Kohli goes back and punches this short of length delivery towards cover, can't find the gap
Chris Morris to Kohli, no run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Kohli defends
Chris Morris to Kohli, wide, down the leg-side, easy call for the umpire
Chris Morris to Kohli, no run, good length delivery outside off stump, Kohli drives it to cover
Junior Dala to Dhawan, FOUR, a boundary to round off the powerplay and India have scored 78 runs. Short and wide outside off stump, Dhawan cuts it away past backward point and moves into the 30s
Junior Dala to Dhawan, wide, short ball again, Dhawan lets it pass as it's too high
Junior Dala to Dhawan, SIX, you cannot bowl short and on the leg-side for Dhawan, especially with short boundaries. He waits for the ball to come and swivels and helps it away over the fine leg fence
Junior Dala to Kohli, 1 run, neatly turned away with the wrists to deep square leg
Junior Dala to Dhawan, 1 run, very full and outside off stump, Dhawan drives it to cover, good stop by Morris there diving to his left

Junior Dala to Kohli, 1 run, quick single and a direct-hit at the bowler's end would have been tight. Kohli was just in. He defended this short of length delivery to cover-point and set off, Miller had a shy at the stumps and missed

Junior Dala to Kohli, FOUR, stunning hit! Kohli and his cover drives. He actually had to reach out to meet this full ball as Junior Dala bowled way outside off stump, Kohli extended his arms and timed it from the middle of the bat to beat cover
Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, another edge and it beats the keeper again. Short and down the leg-side, Dhawan pulls, doesn't find the middle of the bat and it escapes to the fine leg boundary

Chris Morris to Dhawan, FOUR, top edge, but it goes straight behind the keeper and fine leg had no chance. Unlucky for the bowler. Short delivery on the stumps, Dhawan plays a half-hearted full, gets away with the edge
Chris Morris to Kohli, 1 run, good length delivery outside off stump, Kohli pushes it away to cover
Chris Morris to Kohli, 2 runs, lovely cover-drive to open the account, full and outside off stump, Kohli drives it past the fielder, but there is protection in the deep
Chris Morris to Kohli, no run, Kohli pushes this towards cover
Chris Morris to Kohli, no run, no feet, stabbed away into the off-side

Junior Dala to Raina, out Caught&Bowled!! Raina was always looking to slog his runs and he gets out in an ugly manner. Totally looked out of shape as he tried to hit this ball over the infield. Ended up hitting it straight up in the air and the bowler calls for it to take a returns catch. Junior Dala roars. Raina c and b Junior Dala 15(7) [4s-2 6s-1]
Junior Dala to Raina, FOUR, how did he hit that? Full ball outside off stump, Raina backed away and the bowler bowled wide outside off stump, Raina reached out and sliced the ball over gully for four
Junior Dala to Raina, no run, short delivery on the stumps, Raina hops and defends into the on-side
Junior Dala to Dhawan, 1 run, nudged away to backward square leg

Junior Dala to Dhawan, wide, I heard a noise, but the umpire calls a wide. Why didn't they review? Oh Dhawan edged that and UltraEdge shows a wave. Lucky break for India. Shortish delivery down the leg-side, Dhawan tries to glance, fails to connect well
Junior Dala to Dhawan, no run, oh he's almost guided this onto the stumps

Junior Dala to Dhawan, SIX, oh woww! What a shot! Dhawan and his pick up shots, that whip of the wrists is absolutely brilliant to watch. Fullish and on the leg stump, Dhawan doesn't move his feet much while playing this short, uses his wrists to power the flick

Paterson to Raina, FOUR, this is completely mistimed, a tough chance for Behardien back-tracking from cover and he spills it, the ball runs away for four as well. Raina backs away and slaps hard at this short ball, lucky that he managed to clear the infield
Paterson to Raina, SIX, this guy is unorthodox at times, but he hits those unbelievable sixes,
Paterson to Dhawan, 1 run, this short of length delivery hurries Dhawan on the pull, the under edge rolls to fine leg
Paterson to Raina, 1 run, Raina opens his account with a flick to mid-wicket
Paterson to Dhawan, 1 run, dabbed away towards backward point
Paterson to Dhawan, no run, beaten
Junior Dala to Raina, no run, good length delivery outside off stump, Raina moves across and defends into the off-side
Junior Dala to Raina, wide, full and down the leg-side, Raina misses the flick

Junior Dala to Rohit, out Caught by Klaasen at fine leg!! This is a massive wicket for South Africa and debutant Junior Dala is elated. Rohit was looking in great touch out there. This was a short ball that cramped the batsman for room, Rohit was backing away and trying to guide it over third man, got a faint edge. It was quite audible, but the umpire and the bowler didn't hear that. The keeper and the fielders were convinced and they sent the case upstairs. UltraEdge picked up the wave Rohit c Klaasen b Junior Dala 21(9) [4s-2 6s-2]
Junior Dala to Rohit, no run, blocked off the back foot
Junior Dala to Rohit, no run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Rohit defends off the back foot

Junior Dala to Rohit, FOUR, this is strange captaincy. No third man and Rohit has scored 14 runs in that region thus far in 8 balls. Like his partner, Junior Dala too bowls short and Rohit cuts uppishly, went at a catchable height but the ball flew in the gap between backward point and gully
Paterson to Rohit, FOUR, that's hit in the air again, short and just outside off stump, Rohit upper cuts over backward point this time and it's 18 off the first over for India. Great start
Paterson to Rohit, SIX, Rohit is one of the good players of the pull shot in the team and he wont mind the short stuff from the bowler.
Paterson to Dhawan, 1 run, shortish and on the leg stump, Dhawan awkwardly pulls to backward square leg
Paterson to Rohit, 1 run, oh the inside edge is found as Rohit tries to push at this length delivery, the ball escapes past the sticks and goes towards short fine leg
Paterson to Rohit, SIX, in the airrr and there's no third man. True pitch, good bounce, Rohit doesn't bother to keep the ball down as he plays the upper cut and hits it well enough to clear the rope

Paterson to Rohit, no run, now then, there's a bit of Charl Langeveldt in Paterson there. The delivery stride looked very similar, short of a length ball outside off stump, Rohit defends into the off-side
Unadkat to Shamsi, no run, India go 1-0 up with a handsome win by 28 runs. The result ball: short, and the batsman missed the pull pretty easily. Another shellacking for the hosts
Unadkat to Shamsi, no run, slower ball arrived pretty early, the slog attempted very late. The ball bounces its way to the keeper

Unadkat to Phehlukwayo, out Caught by Chahal!! Unadkat opens his account. The slower delivery outside off and the batsman trying his hand at sending the ball into the orbit, has a crash landing. The ball scooped up off the outer half of the bat and the man at point takes a sitter. Can India bowl the hosts out? Phehlukwayo c Chahal b Unadkat 13(8) [4s-2]

Unadkat to Phehlukwayo, 2 runs, short ball, at the helmet, hooked away and the relay work from deep square leg, who put in the dive and from deep mid-wicket, who threw it back restrict the batsmen to a couple
Unadkat to Phehlukwayo, no run, waits an eternity for the slower ball outside off and under edges the ball away to the keeper. 31 off 4. Well. You know the result already
Unadkat to Phehlukwayo, FOUR, yorker but four. The batsman went for the drive and outside edged the ball away to beat the man at short third man. SA will take anything and everything
Bumrah to Junior Dala, no run, dug out to point. Rohit dives to his left and saves a few runs for his team as the ball was squeezed out. 35 needed off the final over!
Bumrah to Phehlukwayo, 1 run, too full, driven down the ground for a single towards long-off. India doing what they do best at the death, bowling yorkers at a metronomical accuracy
Bumrah to Junior Dala, 1 run, another yorker scuds in and the batsman digs the ball out just besides the 22 yards for a single
Bumrah to Phehlukwayo, 1 run, yorks the full ball out to covers and scampers through for a quick single
Bumrah to Junior Dala, 1 run, length ball, kept out into the off-side and a single is nabbed. 38 needed now. More academic if you ask me
Bumrah to Phehlukwayo, 1 run, back to the yorker we go. That has been carved down the ground to long-off for a single

Bumrah to Phehlukwayo, no ball, FOUR, Freebies for the Proteas. Free hit coming up. The highish full toss edged the outer edge of the bat and ran away into the fence after Dhoni made a languid effort to keep that

Bhuvneshwar to Paterson, out Paterson Run Out!! 1 run completed. Another one gone. They are going down like a lead balloon now. It is a team hat-trick. The shortish ball was punched off the back foot. Pandya made a half-stop but the batsmen wanted to risk the second run. Pandya recovered in no time and Dhoni had all the time in the world to knock the bails off. India have closed this game down now it seems. Paterson run out (Hardik Pandya/Dhoni) 1(1)

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Morris, out Caught by Raina!! Action replay of the previous delivery. This time more of a length ball and hit the batsman a bit too high on his blade. The result of it was the ball scooped up high and Raina is not going to drop those. Bhuvneshwar is on a hat-trick now. A fifer for the workhorse. Thoroughly deserved. Chris Morris c Raina b Bhuvneshwar 0(1)

Bhuvneshwar to Klaasen, out Caught by Raina!! Keep it simple like Bhuvneshwar to earn wickets. Full, straight and at the base of the sticks forces the batsman to go big without any success. The slug down the ground founds the hands of Raina at long-on. Best figures for Bhuvi in T20Is. He still has to bowl a few balls. Klaasen c Raina b Bhuvneshwar 16(8) [4s-1 6s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Klaasen, 2 runs, slower delivery and was toe-ended away towards the mid-wicket region. The ball hardly crossed the 30 yards barrier but they charge back for a two
Bhuvneshwar to Klaasen, 2 runs, almost a yorker, biffed down the ground and they hare back for a couple. The throw was not the best one to the bowler

Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, out Caught by Dhoni!! The slower wide ball does it for India and Bhuvneshwar. The ball soared up high and the revs in the air never mattered much for the coolest glovesman. He called for it and took it with elan. Has a rise smile on his face. That was a slower delivery and the batsman pulled the trigger on the shot way too early for the ball to go straight up. It never scaled any meaningful distance and was taken. Hendricks c Dhoni b Bhuvneshwar 70(50) [4s-8 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, FOUR, outer-edges the ball away over short third man. Does it matter? The short ball and the mistimed hit dribbles away into the fence for a four. 15 of the over. Now 50 needed

Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, SIX, going, going, gone! That will disturb the equation for the Indians. Stayed his crease and used the long handle in sync with his huge tentacles to power the ball over long-on
Hardik Pandya to Hendricks, 1 run, slashes the ball away sans any timing and they take only a single. This has been a fine over from Hardik Pandya. Only 5 of it so far
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, byes, 1 run, pressure, pressure! The batsman saunters out to slap it, misses and the usually safe MS fumbles to allow a sundry
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, wide, wild delivery as the ball shoots up like a climber and rears well over the head of the batsman. Wided
Hardik Pandya to Hendricks, 1 run, back of a length delivery and has been punched away into the covers for a single. 2 of 2 is what India would take with open arms
Hardik Pandya to Klaasen, 1 run, backs away and mistimes the ball away to cover for a single

Bumrah to Hendricks, FOUR, must have been good in maths at school. Gets his angles correct and opens the face of the bat on impact as the ball was bowled full. 10 of that over. SA need 65 runs of the last 4 overs
Bumrah to Klaasen, 1 run, gives himself room straightaway and carves the ball away. The ball is fielded by the man at point, who out in the slide to stop it
Bumrah to Hendricks, 1 run, the slower delivery outside off, the batsman backs away and thwacks the ball along the carpet to long-off
Bumrah to Hendricks, no run, the perfume ball and the aroma of it is too hot to handle for the batsman. Misses the pull as the ball sails into the mitts
Bumrah to Hendricks, FOUR, the hefty bottom hand comes into play and drop kicks the ball over mid-off. That was some statement from the young man. Was hit with a lot of sinews working in tandem
Bumrah to Hendricks, no run, full ball, just outside off and the batsman trying to sweep it, misses it

Chahal to Behardien, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Chahal ends the day with a wicket. The 81 runs partnership is broken. Lovely flight, the batsman again was beaten as the ball dipped on him. The bottom hand came off the handle and the man at long-on did the rest by coming in a few paces. He toe-ended the ball away in the fight for quick runs. Behardien c Manish Pandey b Chahal 39(27) [4s-3 6s-2]

Chahal to Hendricks, 1 run, almost, well almost a run-out! The batsman chopped the ball away to cover point and ran. The throw came in at the bowler's end and Chahal failed to gather it clean. A direct hit for sure would have had the batsman
Chahal to Hendricks, FOUR, beaten in flight, does not matter as he goes through with it. Slices the ball over backward point and the ball teased its way into the fence. SA are not complaining
Chahal to Hendricks, 2 runs, fetches it from the sticks and slog sweeps the ball away. Pandya was almost beaten by the over spin on it and fumbles a bit for an extra run to be stolen
Chahal to Behardien, 1 run, cramped for room by the fastish googly and mistimes the pull away to deep square leg. Only a run
Chahal to Behardien, no run, delivers the slider with aplomb and the batsman inside edges the ball on to the pads as he did not pick it
Bumrah to Behardien, 1 run, dug out into the covers as the yorker was heading towards the base of the sticks. Single nabbed
Bumrah to Behardien, no run, the slower ball foxes the batsman outside off. The batsman was into the drive outside off a bit too soon and missed it
Bumrah to Hendricks, 1 run, low full toss has been clouted away to deep cover for a single. Again the batsman was backing away there but could not hold his balance to power the ball away
Bumrah to Hendricks, no run, inch perfect yorker as the batsman was moving away. The batter fails to wood it
Bumrah to Behardien, 1 run, slower delivery at the sticks, pushed away into the off-side for a single
Bumrah to Behardien, SIX, welcome Mr. Bumrah says Behardien. Drifting on to the pads and clipped away with disdain over deep square leg for a flat six. That will boost the equation

Unadkat to Hendricks, 2 runs, first T20I fifty for Hendricks! Not a bad time to do it but the pace has to improve from here on. He has seen been in the eye of the storm from the beginning of it. Has to fight through it now. SA need 92 now
Unadkat to Hendricks, 2 runs, tucked away into the on-side and they race back for a brace in a trice. Moves to 49

Unadkat to Behardien, 1 run, it is trick or treat time from the bowlers. Either a slower delivery has landed with in the sticks or has been too short. This time was sans any room and punched into the off-side for a single
Unadkat to Behardien, no run, round the wicket delivery angling in a tad and the batsman trying to play the late cut, misses it. Again change of pace from the bowler tricking the batsman
Unadkat to Behardien, FOUR, short ball, slower ball, cut away past point. The fielder at point dived but in vain as the ball scorched across the turf. The runs needed are now less than 100
Unadkat to Behardien, no run, slower delivery angling away and the batsman trying a deft touch, fails to connect

Chahal to Hendricks, no run, a pearler to end! A leggie's delight. The ball landed on off and rip roared away past the outer edge as the batsman stayed back to poke at it. That line has been missing from Chahal today
Chahal to Hendricks, FOUR, add four more to the tally. Bowled it short, slightly wide and the batsman camped to place the cut away from the man at sweeper cover
Chahal to Hendricks, FOUR, crouches down and slog sweeps the ball away. There was no one at cow corner and the ball escapes into the fence
Chahal to Behardien, 1 run, bowls it full and flat, on-driven down to long-on for only a single
Chahal to Behardien, wide, spears a full and wide ball, wided by the ump
Chahal to Behardien, FOUR, reverse sweep and four! The batsman played it fine enough to send it past the man at short third man. The Proteas will take it
Chahal to Behardien, no run, the batsman was standing well outside off and the bowler drifted the ball further away. The umpire ruled it in favor of the bowler
Hardik Pandya to Hendricks, FOUR, slugged away! The closed face of the bat made contact and had enough legs on it to beat the man at deep square leg
Hardik Pandya to Behardien, 1 run, cavalcades out of his crease and looks o slap the ball down the ground. The ball connects the inner half of the bat and crawls away to mid-off
Hardik Pandya to Hendricks, 1 run, slower delivery angling in, clipped off the pads with ease to find the man at deep mid-wicket. These one's and two's are not going to help them much
Hardik Pandya to Hendricks, 2 runs, stays his crease and tucks the ball away into the on-side with soft hands. The players hurtle back for a couple
Hardik Pandya to Behardien, 1 run, driven uppishly but unconvincingly on the up. The man at cover mops the ball up
Hardik Pandya to Hendricks, 1 run, bottom hands the drive aerially down to long-on. only a single
Chahal to Hendricks, 1 run, leg-break, flatter trajectory on a length on middle and leg, tucked off the back foot to mid-wicket for a single
Chahal to Hendricks, no run, good length ball wide outside off, Hendricks decides to go for it but ends up scooping it uncertainly towards point. Nearly carried to Unadkat, but not quite
Chahal to Behardien, 1 run, good length leg-break outside off, Behardien caresses it with the turn to deep extra cover for a single
Chahal to Behardien, 2 runs, loopy yorker length delivery on leg and middle, scooped away off the toe-end to extra cover as they scamper through for two
Chahal to Behardien, SIX, too loopy and in the slot, cuts off the angle by coming down the wicket and lofts it high over the long-off fence for a commanding six! Massive hit
Chahal to Hendricks, 1 run, loopy delivery wide outside off, pitched up, lobbed off the front-foot to deep extra cover for a single as the sweeper cuts it off
Hardik Pandya to Behardien, no run, back of a length delivery on leg, Behardien gets a feather on it very fine off the bat and it falls just short of Dhoni
Hardik Pandya to Behardien, FOUR, half-volley on leg-stump, rubbish ball, even though he was trying the yorker, Behardien just gets some bat on it and deflects it away to fine leg for four
Hardik Pandya to Hendricks, 1 run, just a tad short on middle and leg, skiddy, Hendricks comes down the track and is hurried into the short-arm pull it to deep square leg for a single
Hardik Pandya to Behardien, 1 run, to back of a length delivery on middle, Behardien hops and mudges it away in front of deep square leg for a single
Hardik Pandya to Behardien, no run, back of a length delivery on middle, clipped off the back foot towards mid-wicket

Hardik Pandya to Hendricks, 1 run, half-volley just outside off, slower delivery , driven to extra cover and Chahal dives to his right to field that and scores an inconsequential direct-hit at the non-striker's end
Chahal to Hendricks, 1 run, a tad flatter but still a fairly loopy leg-break wide outside off, and Hendricks runs his hands through it and gets it away to to deep extra cover for a quick single
Chahal to Behardien, 1 run, too full and loopy outside off, laced away to deep extra cover for a single
Chahal to Hendricks, 1 run, flipper squeezed out of the fingers on off-stump, just a tad short on off, and whipped towards long-on for a single
Chahal to Behardien, 1 run, another leg-break on leg, loopy, Hendricks reaches out and clips it to mid-wicket for a single
Chahal to Hendricks, 1 run, leg-break just a tad short outside off, Behardien hangs back and slaps it to sweeper cover for a single
Chahal to Behardien, 1 run, loopy leg-break on middle and leg, Hendricks stretches forward and gets to the pitch to whip it away to long-on for a single
Hardik Pandya to Hendricks, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, jagging in off the seam, and cuts him in half. The batsman had no clue about it, says my colleague Varun
Hardik Pandya to Hendricks, FOUR, short and wide, Hendricks comes down the wicket, hops and gets under it to upper-cut it for a one-bounce four to the third man fence for four
Hardik Pandya to Hendricks, wide, off-cutter on a back of a length but straying down leg-side and Dhoni collects it, looking miffed. Wide called

Hardik Pandya to Behardien, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off , headed for off-stump, Behardien makes room and pokes it to third man for a single. 50 up for SA, but at what cost? 3 wickets...
Hardik Pandya to Hendricks, 1 run, another one just a tad short and into the gut, the batsman revolves on his heel and pulls it off his gloves to fine leg for a quick single

Hardik Pandya to Miller, out Caught by Dhawan!! Slower delivery on middle and off, on a length, Miller walks down and chips that high. Had to check his shot at the end, and Dhawan gobbles another skier well in front of the long-on boundary. Miller c Dhawan b Hardik Pandya 9(5) [6s-1]
Hardik Pandya to Miller, wide, short ball and over head-high, Dhoni not happy as he gestures to Pandya

Hardik Pandya to Miller, SIX, unbelievable fielding by Bumrah! Wow! It was a tad short on middle and leg, Miller went for the twist-pull, top-edge it, and Bumrah lobbed it over. However, he had stepped on the boundary first, so according to the new laws, that is six. More on the laws later.

Bumrah to Hendricks, no run, full toss by Bumrah on off, Hendricks drives it back but a little too straight as it hits the middle stump at the other end. Shaun Pollock comes up with a rather witty one on air: "Bumrah's 12th man doing the fielding for India"
Bumrah to Hendricks, no run, another back of a length delivery on the pads, Hendricks misses the attempted glance
Bumrah to Hendricks, no run, good length delivery seaming in a tad too much, heading down leg-side perhaps as Hendricks misses the flick. Virat Kohli's Indians do not appeal!
Bumrah to Miller, 1 run, short-ish ball outside off at 140kmph, zips off the wicket, Miller comes down the track and immediately regrets it as he is hurried into the pull to fine leg for a single
Bumrah to Miller, 2 runs, good length ball on middle, clipped away to mid-wicket for a couple as Unadkat misfields at mid-wicket
Bumrah to Miller, no run, back of a length delivery on off, Miller is cramped for room and hurried for pace as the batsman tucks it to mid-wicket off the back foot

Bhuvneshwar to Duminy, out Caught by Raina!! Wow! What a catch running backwards by Raina! A length ball on middle and ironically, a Raina-esque heave onto the on-side by Duminy, and Raina just ran back and showed immaculate judgement to grab that as it fell out of the night sky. The skipper departs. Duminy c Raina b Bhuvneshwar 3(7)
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, 1 run, 138kmph on a back of a length on off-stump, whipped away to Rohit at mid-wicket off the back foot
Bhuvneshwar to Duminy, 1 run, slower delivery at 123kmph, Duminy comes down the track and has to wait for it again, works it to mid-wicket for a quick single
Bhuvneshwar to Duminy, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Duminy dabs it to point
Bhuvneshwar to Duminy, no run, back of a length delivery on off, Duminy gets on the back foot and waits for it to coe on to the bat, punches it back to the bowler. ANother slower one
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, 1 run, back of a length delivery on off, Hendricks gets on the back foot and tucks it to short mid-wicket where Rohit dives to make a commendable save

Unadkat to Duminy, 2 runs, back of a length delivery on middle, Duminy comes across and whips that away to mid-wicket, as Pandya runs in from the deep and fires in a throw. Not before they scramble two though
Unadkat to Duminy, no run, a tad short just outside off, Duminy cross-bats it off the back foot towards mid-on as one hand comes off the bat. A slower delivery, that was
Unadkat to Hendricks, 1 run, short of a length delivery just outside off, Hendricks gets on top of the bounce and dabs it down to short third man for a single
Unadkat to Hendricks, no run, good length delivery angling away towards off, Hendricks shuffles across to cover the line and tries to heave it over the on-side boundary. Alas, he misses it completely
Unadkat to Duminy, leg byes, 1 run, another one on a back of a length and on the thigh, Duminy misses the glance and it drops on the leg-side as they hurry through for a single
Unadkat to Hendricks, 1 run, back of a length delivery jagging in towards leg and middle, Hendricks gets an inside-edge onto the pads and it trundles towards point as they scurry through for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, 1 run, good length ball sliding into the pads, clipped away to backward square leg for a single

Bhuvneshwar to Smuts, out Caught by Dhawan!! That has gone past the atmospheric layer and into the stratosphere. Full delivery on the pads, a lofted whip and the ball is launched into the clouds, before Dhawan judges it to perfection and settles under it. India draw first blood. Smuts c Dhawan b Bhuvneshwar 14(9) [4s-3]
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, 1 run, slower delivery on middle, clipped away off the pads to mid-wicket for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, SIX, out-swinger on a length and Smuts trusts his hands as he just runs his hands through the ball for an incredible lofted whip-drive for six over extra cover
Bhuvneshwar to Smuts, 1 run, short slower delivery on middle and leg, Smuts came down the track and made room but ended up just dropping it to mid-wicket before taking off for the run
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, 1 run, good length delivery on the pads, nurdled away to mid-wicket for a scampered single
Unadkat to Smuts, FOUR, fractioanlly short and a bit of width to free his arms, Smuts shifts his weight on the back foot and laces a bottom-handed drive to the extracover fence for four
Unadkat to Smuts, FOUR, length ball on middle, a no-no in this format, Smuts opens up his stance and lofts it through the line aerailly to the long-on fence for four
Unadkat to Hendricks, 1 run, back of a length delivery on middle, Hendricks is cramped for room and nudges it to mid-wicket for a single
Unadkat to Hendricks, no run, good length ball slanted across on off stump, Hendricks tries to cover drive through the line and misses
Unadkat to Hendricks, wide, oh dear! Unadkat has slipped and fallen down as this goes way too far down off-side. Called a wide
Unadkat to Hendricks, FOUR, short of a length just outside off, sat up and asked for the back foot punch to deep extra cover, and Hendricks obliged with a crisp shot
Unadkat to Hendricks, no run, length ball across the right-hander, defended back to the bowler
Bhuvneshwar to Smuts, no run, slower delivery, knuckle ball, on a length just outside off, Smuts waits an age for it and it goes through his attempted flick through to Dhoni behind the stumps
Bhuvneshwar to Smuts, no run, length ball just outside off, swinging in and jagging in of the seam as well, too much movement for Smuts who was into the almighty heave far too early. Swing-and-a-miss
Bhuvneshwar to Smuts, no run, short of a length delivery in the channel outside off, Smuts gets on the back foot and punches that firmly to mid-off
Bhuvneshwar to Hendricks, 1 run, outswinger on a good length on off, Hendricks is stuck on the crease and gets a thick outside edge to square third man as they scramble through for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Smuts, 1 run, back of a length delivery speared in towards the thigh, on middle and leg, tucked away to mid-wicket for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Smuts, FOUR, just a tad short and wide, given room to free his arms, thrashed away square of the wicket for four

J Ball to Dhoni, FOUR, and he finishes well. He has picked off Ball with ease. Reading him like a book. So easy. Short ball down leg, a swivel-pull and long leg can't get across in time. Indian end on a high

J Ball to Dhoni, FOUR, imagine Jordan's plight at long-on. He is one of the quickest and best in the field in the world currently, but Dhoni's flat-batted hit has comfortably beaten him. From long-on he ran across to field but the pristine power from Dhoni's bat left him with no chance. Ball's plan to bowl short not working against MS
J Ball to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, low full-toss, heaved straight to the fielder at deep mid

J Ball to Hardik Pandya, no ball, byes, FOUR, poor from Buttler. Very poor. It has been called a no-ball for height as well. Too many short balls in the over, Hardik Pandya is beaten by the slowness of the short ball, bounces in front of Buttler and he can't clasp his mitts around it. Runs away to the fence. Ball is a bit bemused at the no-ball call
J Ball to Dhoni, 1 run, short ball, this time Dhoni stays back, can only find deep mid. Didn't middle it
J Ball to Dhoni, wide, that's pressure. Pressure of having to bowl against Dhoni. The short ball, cutting into the pitch, goes down leg, past the advancing Dhoni
J Ball to Dhoni, FOUR, it doesn't matter to Dhoni. He will still pummel you past your legs. Down the track and marmalises a short ball hard which missed Ball and gave the rest no chance. Pure power
J Ball to Dhoni, 2 runs, a fumble from Willey at deep backward square but doesn't cost much. Short ball into the body, pulled hard but not in the gap
Jordan to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, what a ball. Right at Hardik Pandya's toes, who does really well to dig it out wide of long-on. Two more

Jordan to Hardik Pandya, SIX, one ball he misses his length and look what has happened. Hardik Pandya sits deep in his crease and all power as he smashes that over long-on. Length ball was there for the taking and he didn't miss out
Jordan to Hardik Pandya, no run, this is great death bowling. Yorker outside off, Hardik Pandya can't direct it between backward point and short third, which he was trying. Misses the ball
Jordan to Hardik Pandya, no run, well bowled. Right up there, Hardik Pandya deep in his crease can only dig it back to Jordan
Jordan to Dhoni, 1 run, full and wide of off, Dhoni can only find mid-off with a shot that he hasn't powered. Scampers for a quick single
Jordan to Dhoni, 2 runs, drilled to the left of mid-off, where Plunkett is a bit slow to get down, half-stops and that allows the second
Willey to Hardik Pandya, no run, ends well. Hardik Pandya on the shuffle, may have played it too early, the leading edge falls in front of the diving Willey who prevents the single
Willey to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, short-arm jabs the short of length delivery to the right of deep square. Two it is

Willey to Hardik Pandya, no run, wow! What pace and the ump reckons it is one short ball for the over. Touch and go as the short delivery flies past Hardik Pandya's left ear. He got inside the line to leave and was expecting a wide
Willey to Dhoni, 1 run, short and at the ribs of Dhoni, who swivels to pull and mistimes it to long leg
Willey to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, short of length on the hips, nudged to long leg

Willey to Kohli, out Caught by Root!! Root hangs on and he flashes his cherubic trademark smile. Shaking his head at how he managed to hang on, while the Indian skipper too does the same, unable to believe how his rival caught that. Short down leg, pulled hard and low in front of fine leg, Root fumbles but manages to grab the rebound. Another wicket at the right time for England. Kohli c Root b Willey 47(38) [4s-1 6s-2]

Jordan to Dhoni, no run, he misses out on a high full-toss and Jordan almost gets Dhoni. The Indian star advancing and may have been surprised with that full-toss, swings and misses. Inches away from falling on the off-bail
Jordan to Kohli, 1 run, back to very full, almost yorker lengths outside off, Kohli can only get a single to sweeper cover
Jordan to Kohli, SIX, so effortless. So pure. Such timing. Low full-toss on the pads, whippage from Kohli and it flies over deep backward square. Into the Indian crowd and they are going nuts
Jordan to Dhoni, 1 run, very full outside off, jammed out to sweeper cover
Jordan to Kohli, 1 run, full on off, Kohli drives and the ball flies off the thickish outside half, but in the gap at cover
Jordan to Dhoni, 1 run, low full-toss, speared in, knocked to long-on and Roy keeps it to one
Willey to Kohli, 2 runs, uses the angle from round the wicket to flick it wide of deep square, Hales is the fielder and they come back for two. Still no boundary for India
Willey to Dhoni, leg byes, 1 run, angled in on a fullish length, on the middle and leg line, Dhoni on the shuffle takes one on the pad. Going down, comfortably
Willey to Kohli, 1 run, once more charges Willey who fires it into the hips, guess there was a thin inside edge onto the pad, given as run as the ball deflects away near square leg

Willey to Kohli, 2 runs, what running. The ball has just gone past where a mid-on would've been but they steal two. Down the track, defended wide of Willey, even the athletic Jordan from long-on can't prevent two
Willey to Kohli, no run, third man was up and Kohli doesn't connect with the ramp. Angled in and short following Kohli, the ball flies over the top edge
Willey to Kohli, 2 runs, from round the wicket, angled in on the hips, turned through square leg, placed between two fielders, easy two
Adil Rashid to Dhoni, no run, again uses his feet, but is kept quiet by Adil Rashid, defended. Just the four off that
Adil Rashid to Dhoni, FOUR, out comes the helicopter and that gets the crowd going. What power. What wrists. Charges Adil Rashid and helicopters it over mid-wicket, one bounce over the ropes
Adil Rashid to Dhoni, no run, that was there to be hit but Dhoni mistimes the pull and finds mid-wicket. A real drag-down from Adil Rashid, Dhoni cannot cash in. Four dots in a row
Adil Rashid to Dhoni, no run, now beats Dhoni with a delivery that sharply turns from a length, past the outside edge as Dhoni tried to run it down
Adil Rashid to Dhoni, no run, well bowled. Tossed up and slower outside off, Dhoni was down the track, but since the length wasn't there, he pushes it to the off-side
Adil Rashid to Dhoni, no run, bunted past the dive of Adil Rashid, but Jordan from short mid runs across to boot the ball back near him
Plunkett to Kohli, no run, slower delivery outside off, Kohli loses all shape on the drive, mistimed horribly to cover
Plunkett to Kohli, 2 runs, exceptional running. In front of fine leg, turned with soft hands and as soon as Kohli hit that, he was looking for two, easily done in the end
Plunkett to Dhoni, 1 run, slower delivery on a short of length around off, Dhoni tucks it through mid-wicket
Plunkett to Dhoni, no run, Roy at backward point with a fine piece of fielding, dives to his right and cuts off the sharply timed square drive, ensures it is a dot
Plunkett to Dhoni, FOUR, splits long leg and deep square to perfection. Took on the short ball which had no pace and swivelled on the pull to hit the gap. That should get him going
Plunkett to Dhoni, no run, fuller than a good length on off, Dhoni respects it with a back foot block
Adil Rashid to Dhoni, 1 run, cut to backward point where Ball is slow on the dive, fumbles and MS wants the second but the fielder from sweeper cover charges across and keeps it to a single
Adil Rashid to Kohli, 1 run, opens the face of the bat and slides it to short third man, single is on and they take it
Adil Rashid to Kohli, no run, googly on a short of length, pushed off the back foot to mid-wicket. No chance of a quick single
Adil Rashid to Dhoni, 1 run, down the track first ball, nudged away in typical MSD style through mid-wicket, off the mark

Adil Rashid to Raina, out Stumped!! Raina gets out to the scoreboard pressure. Cleverly bowled by Adil Rashid too, dragged the length back, may have seen Raina charging him, Raina slogs across the line in hope, the ball turns away past the edge and Buttler does the rest. Raina st Buttler b Adil Rashid 27(20) [4s-2 6s-1]
Adil Rashid to Raina, no run, tossed up on the middle and leg line, flicked to mid-wicket
J Ball to Raina, 1 run, full outside off, Raina drives and finds mid-off inside the ring, still gets a single
J Ball to Kohli, 1 run, slower delivery on off, wristed away to long-on
J Ball to Kohli, wide, the slower short ball goes wrong, down leg, called a wide
J Ball to Raina, 1 run, backs away and the full ball is drilled to long-on
J Ball to Kohli, 1 run, charges Ball and slices the cut, was in the air, Hales though at third man doesn't go for the catch, prefers to catch it on the bounce
J Ball to Raina, 1 run, swings too early to a length delivery down leg, the ball came to him much later, dribbles off the not so meaty part of the bat

J Ball to Raina, SIX, consecutive sixes. Backs away to the leg-side and frees his arms to this short ball, when he is aggressive, he isn't that bad a player of the short ball, lots of muscle behind the hit and the ball sails over deep mid

Adil Rashid to Kohli, SIX, dropped by Roy at long-on. And what's more it is six. This time Kohli dances down and lofts, not the elevation he wanted, went low and flat to Roy running across and diving at long-on, got both hands to it, but can only see the ball miss his grasp and fall beyond the boundary. Is that the momentum-changer?

Adil Rashid to Kohli, FOUR, just wide of the diving Jordan at mid-wicket. And beats Roy at long-on as well. As soon as he saw the tossed up delivery outside off, came the swipe across the line, lots of bottom hand on that shot and a much-needed boundary for India
Adil Rashid to Raina, 1 run, flat and on the pads, whip-pull to deep backward square leg
Adil Rashid to Kohli, 1 run, slides straight on, to off, dabbed with soft hands, in front of short third

Adil Rashid to Kohli, 2 runs, comes down the track and whips it in the air, over mid-wicket, looked to be running away for four until YJB ran across and pulled it back with a dive, parries it to Roy coming across from long-on
Adil Rashid to Raina, 1 run, the big slog-sweep attempted, but comes right off the toe end and dribbles away to deep square
Plunkett to Raina, 1 run, with a shuffle, across, Raina flicks to fine leg, retains the strike with that run
Plunkett to Kohli, 1 run, a cutter, punched straight down the ground, past Plunkett's right-hand, only a single though
Plunkett to Raina, 1 run, short of length on off, Raina with a shuffle, works it to deep backward square leg
Plunkett to Kohli, 1 run, short of length delivery into the ribs, flapped to fine leg
Plunkett to Kohli, no run, back of a length outside off, beats Kohli on the steer, bounces over the edge as Kohli made room to play it through the backward point region
Plunkett to Kohli, no run, full outside off, Kohli strides forward to drive but finds Plunkett
Adil Rashid to Kohli, 1 run, use of the feet, whipped straight to the fielder at deep mid

Adil Rashid to Kohli, 2 runs, another two. This time due to the fielder being right on the fence. Remember these are huge boundaries square of the wicket, unlike what you see in the IPL or in the sub-continent. Whipped off the back foot and it is Kohli who wants two, gets it
Adil Rashid to Kohli, 2 runs, soft hands. Butter-soft. Turned in front of two men on the fence on the leg-side, easy two in the end
Adil Rashid to Kohli, no run, tossed up on off, Kohli gently defends from the crease
Adil Rashid to Kohli, 2 runs, throws it up full outside off, Kohli bottom-hands the cover drive wide of sweeper, easy two
Adil Rashid to Kohli, no run, slides straight on, pushed back to Adil Rashid
Jordan to Kohli, 1 run, width outside off and Kohli throws his hands on the cut, does well to get it wide of third man for it was in the air
Jordan to Raina, 1 run, slower delivery outside off, run down to third man
Jordan to Kohli, 1 run, short delivery and Kohli pulls with a swivel, again finds a fielder, deep square leg it is this time
Jordan to Raina, 1 run, slower delivery on middle, Raina gently turns it towards the square leg area, only a single
Jordan to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length outside off, well-timed and into the gap, but finds sweeper cover
Jordan to Kohli, no run, full on off, flicked well but straight to the fielder at mid-wicket
Plunkett to Raina, FOUR, that's a tennis slap over mid-on. Backs away to this short ball and muscles it. Clears the fielder to give India a much-needed boundary
Plunkett to Raina, no run, another cutter, on a good length, Raina wants to run it down wide of Buttler, misses, collected on the bounce
Plunkett to Kohli, 1 run, cutter on a good length outside off, run down to third man
Plunkett to Kohli, no run, Kohli wanted to smash the length ball outside off, wide of cover, mistimed it and found the fielder instead
Plunkett to Kohli, no run, throws his hand at the short and wide delivery, misses the cut. Flies to Buttler
Plunkett to Kohli, no run, short of length and rearing up at Kohli, who is back and across to keep it down
Jordan to Raina, no run, pings him on the thigh, with a short of length delivery, Raina shuffling across to play the flamingo pull and doesn't connect
Jordan to Raina, 2 runs, recipe for disaster, again he shuffles across his stumps and takes it from off and middle, nudges a couple wide of long leg
Jordan to Raina, no run, pitched up outside off, pushed from the crease to cover

Jordan to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli almost sold Raina down the river. A full-length dive saves Raina there. Dropped in front of his feet and Kohli instinctively wants the quick single, mind you Jordan is one of the best fast-bowling athletes in the world, if not the best, he is so quick to get across and hits direct too, but Raina's dive is good enough
Jordan to Raina, 1 run, good length on the middle and leg line, defended to short mid

Jordan to Raina, FOUR, that should encourage Jordan even though Raina got four. The stumps were visible when Raina shuffled across to clip this well wide of short fine. It was in the air too so Jordan shouldn't be too fussed
Plunkett to Raina, 1 run, ooh! Inswing, on a fuller length, comes back in, Raina pushes it wide of cover and is off the mark

Plunkett to Rahul, out Bowled!! Gone. What a wicket. India have lost the centurion from the last game. The pressure got to him and he tried an injudicious shot. Backed away to loft it in-to-out and missed the full ball completely. Just flicked the top of the bails and that's enough even as the ball flies away from Buttler. Rahul b Plunkett 6(8)
Plunkett to Rahul, no run, pitched up outside off, Rahul square-drives but finds backward point. Straight to the man
Plunkett to Rahul, no run, loose from KL. Lifting back of a length delivery outside off, tries to run it down and is lucky not to edge it

Plunkett to Dhawan, out Dhawan Run Out!! Comedy of errors. Morgan isn't too sure. He feels he has missed the stumps. But hang on, he may have got Dhawan. Banged into the elbow, he was in strife. Quick decision from the third umpire. OUT! First things first. Short ball into the body, Dhawan pulls and misses, gets hit and decides to run, Roy charged in from backward point and threw the ball, Dhawan was struggling with his running as well, lost his bat as he tried plonking it in. To his misfortune, Morgan just about had the ball in the hand when he flicked the bails off even as the bat hung in the air and didn't touch the ground. Dhawan didn't dive or try to slide his foot in. Still would've got away, but not to be. Another big wicket. Must say after seeing the replays, Dhawan has to blame himself for he was looking at the ball - when running - and was holding his bat in an awkward fashion. Everything wrong with the running and he rightly pays the price for it. Dhawan run out (Roy/Eoin Morgan) 10(12) [4s-1]
Plunkett to Dhawan, no run, a bottom edge on the drive, dribbles to Buttler. Full outside off, Dhawan completely loses the drive
J Ball to Dhawan, 1 run, the short balls from Ball are rearing up at the batsmen. This nearly produces another wicket as Dhawan splices it, just wide of mid-wicket

J Ball to Dhawan, FOUR, poor from Hales. One becomes four. Pulled to him hard at deep square leg, he allows it to nutmeg his hands and that runs away into the boundary. Ball isn't a happy man, but he isn't showing much emotion
J Ball to Rahul, 1 run, short of length outside off, Rahul takes a single to third man by opening the bat face
J Ball to Dhawan, 1 run, a cutter dug into the pitch, doesn't come onto the bat, Dhawan is a bit early on the pull, drags it straight to the fielder at deep backward square
J Ball to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Rahul runs it off the bat-face to third man
J Ball to Dhawan, 1 run, short of length on off, Dhawan drops it with soft hands wide of backward point, for an easy single
Willey to Rahul, no run, iffy poke and beaten. It angled away from him and he was drawn into the push, the ball kept on going away from him and left him
Willey to Dhawan, 1 run, on a good length outside off, Dhawan drives wide of mid-off for another easy single
Willey to Rahul, 3 runs, Rahul shows off his class. Slightly full outside off, he gets across and caresses it wide of cover. Two men track it down and that ensures the boundary is prevented
Willey to Dhawan, 1 run, pitched up outside off, Dhawan gets forward and drives wide of mid-off to take a quick single
Willey to Dhawan, no run, angling in, but always going down as Dhawan missed the flick. Bairstow was interested as was Willey, but rightly they don't take the review
Willey to Rahul, 1 run, Rahul gets a thick inside edge on the drive and gets lucky. It misses the leg-stump and they take a quick single. Streaky way to get off the mark

J Ball to Rohit, out Caught by Buttler!! Again beaten by pace and he top-edges it straight up in the air. Easy for Buttler to jog around and accept the offering. Another pacy short delivery at Rohit's chest/rib area, Rohit wanted to biff that over mid-wicket, but it cramped him and that resulted in him getting the edge. England have their early wicket. Maiden wicket for Ball. Rohit c Buttler b J Ball 5(9) [4s-1]
J Ball to Rohit, no run, beaten by pace. Searing short ball and Rohit misses the hook. Flew to Buttler
J Ball to Rohit, FOUR, smashed wide of mid-off. Full outside off, Rohit bashes it from the crease and leaves mid-off as a spectator
J Ball to Dhawan, 1 run, length delivery on the middle and leg line, tucked to the space near mid-wicket

J Ball to Dhawan, no run, ooh! Interesting had that hit, from short fine, but it didn't and Dhawan survives. Tucked to short fine and he sets off, then lazily tries to plonk his bat in, at the same time keeping an eye on the throw, he wanted to avoid getting hit and looked like the bat was in the air when the throw passed the stumps
J Ball to Rohit, leg byes, 1 run, angles it on a back of a length, hitting the pitch hard, Rohit misses the flick and they scamper across for an extra
Willey to Dhawan, no run, down the track first ball, drives well, but finds mid-off. End of a good opening over

Willey to Rohit, 1 run, now he does something really unlike him and is lucky to get away. Sits down to lap Willey even before having a look at the ball, it is full and around off, a tiny inside edge/glove saves him and rightly England don't review. They were interested for a while, but decided against it

Willey to Rohit, no run, opened up Rohit completely. Hint of pre-meditation in that shot. Pitched on a good length around off and the extra bounce ensured that it missed the top of off after Rohit had attempted to flick to leg. Rohit's body position was a shambles there
Willey to Rohit, no run, good length on off, Rohit is right behind that
Willey to Rohit, no run, this goes away with the angle and beats Rohit, on the tentative forward push, lovely bowling. That will sow the seeds of doubt in Rohit's mind
Willey to Rohit, no run, hint of swing back in, just a tiny bit, lands it on a fuller length on middle, Rohit cautiously defends it back to Willey

Bhuvneshwar to Willey, 1 run, shortish one on the body, Willey pulls it away short-armed towards the deep mid-wicket fence for four - but not before they complete the single, so the boundary will not be counted. The bigger picture: The redemption of England against Kuldeep and Chahal, as they deny India their longest streak of T20I wins ever
Bhuvneshwar to Hales, 1 run, Hales, backing away towards the on-side, Bhuvi following him, and a swift whip away towards deep mid-wicket for a single. Scores level!

Bhuvneshwar to Hales, FOUR, back of a length and angling in, Hales has his feet cemented and has as free a swing at the pull as he can, gets an inside edge into his pads and away to the fine leg boundary for four. Surely, that's the match

Bhuvneshwar to Hales, SIX, length ball, a big no-no, and that's a 360-degree swing straight down the ground and out of the ground into a different area code! Is that the match? A new box of Kookaburras comes into the field. Some time for Bhuvi to compose himself as Kohli, Rahul and Rohit get together with him to offer some advice. 50 for Alex Hales!
