U Yadav to Hales, 1 run, another marginally wide yorker outside off, squeezed away off the turf to sweeper cover for a single
U Yadav to Hales, FOUR, Hales is outside the crease and the yorker turns into a low full-toss: driven exquisitely through the in-field to the deep extra cover fence for four

U Yadav to Hales, 2 runs, slightly wide yorker length delivery outside off, squirted away with a steer to third man for a couple. Rohit in the deep cleans up and they manage a couple as Dhoni's signature deft deflection at the stumps isn't quite quick enough

U Yadav to Hales, no run, yorker length delivery outside off, Hales tries to dig it out and it only just misses the off-stump. Hales thinks about stealing a bye, but Dhoni fires one in with an under-arm whip and nearly hits the stumps

U Yadav to Willey, 1 run, fuller length, almost yorker length, following the batsman who is making room on the leg-side, and a leading edge off a flick goes square of the wicket and clear of point for a single into the deep

U Yadav to Willey, no run, inch-perfect yorker length on off, dug out back to the bowler, Umesh collects and tries to break the striker's stumps as Willey is down the wicket, but doesn't collect cleanly
Bhuvneshwar to Willey, leg byes, 1 run, yorker length delivery fired in on leg-stump, Willey misses the flick and gets it off the boot towards short fine leg for a leg-bye

Bhuvneshwar to Willey, no run, DOT BALL! Willey was backing away into the on-side, Bhuvneshwar follows him and bowls a full one on the pads, as Willey misses the whip away. Dot ball, as the close-in fielders charge in and don't allow them to steal a leg-bye
Bhuvneshwar to Hales, 1 run, good length just outside off, Hales is crouched extremely low in his stance and chops that late to short third man for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Hales, no run, back of a length and angling in, seaming back in, in fact, and no width, Hales goes for an ill-advised pull to one that wasn't short enough, and misses
Bhuvneshwar to Willey, 1 run, short one at the face, Willey gets back up from that predator position and cops one on the glove, as it lobs in front of square leg for a single

Bhuvneshwar to Bairstow, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav! Kuldeep makes amends, albeit in the field! Short, angling towards the chest, following a backing-away Bairstow, who hurriedly plays a short-arm pull, manages to make contact a little high up on the bat and Kuldeep takes a nice tumbling catch running in from long leg. Excellent stuff, and that tilts it back in India's favour a little bit. Bairstow c Kuldeep Yadav b Bhuvneshwar 28(18) [6s-2]
Kuldeep Yadav to Bairstow, 1 run, slower but once again finding that yorker length outside off, squirted down to long-on for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, 1 run, yorker length delivery on the stumps, @106km/h, and a dig out to long-on for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Bairstow, 1 run, tossed up, a tad shorter, and a clipped inside edge to backward square leg for a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Bairstow, SIX, once again far too full outside off, Bairstow is standing on middle and uses his reach to slog that over deep mid-wicket for a massive six! This turns the contest England's way!

Kuldeep Yadav to Bairstow, SIX, too full, in the arc, the googly, and an expansive clean sweep against the turn over backward square leg for six. An England fan is so happy that he isn't giving the ball back!
Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, 1 run, flatter yorker length delivery outside off, squeezed away towards backward point for a single

Hardik Pandya to Bairstow, 2 runs, perfect, inch-perfect yorker, Bairstow clears his leg and digs it out to wide long-on for a single where Umesh is put under pressure by two scampering batsmen and throws at the wrong end (striker's) to concede two
Hardik Pandya to Bairstow, 2 runs, short outside off and angling in, Bairstow clears his front leg and slugs a wristy pull towards deep mid-wicket for a brace
Hardik Pandya to Bairstow, no run, short one, the second of the over, Bairstow half-ducks under it and expects a reprimand from the umpire - doesn't get it
Hardik Pandya to Bairstow, 2 runs, short one outside off, Bairstow swivels and plays an afterthought of a drag-whipped pull in front of square leg where Umesh fumbles to allow two
Hardik Pandya to Bairstow, no run, short one at the body towards the batsman who was trying to make room. Forced to duck under it
Hardik Pandya to Hales, 1 run, off-cutter outside off and reducing the width with the inward movement, and a wristy carve towards sweeper cover for a single to compensate for the lack of width
Kuldeep Yadav to Bairstow, no run, finally! The toss-up, that Verity length gets Bairstow forward to defend, into the on-side off a thick inside edge
Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, 1 run, a tad short and coming back into the right-hander, Hales drags himself towards the on-side and punches off the back foot to long-on for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Bairstow, 1 run, again a little short, turning away, the wrong'un, punched to deep extra cover for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, 1 run, very flat, surprising from Kuldeep, 107km/h, and fired in on the pads. A soft nudge in front of square leg for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Bairstow, 1 run, short enough for Bairstow to get back deep in the crease and tuck it away behind square leg for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Bairstow, no run, the stock chinaman tossed up outside off and straightening, and a hurriedly back foot block back to the bowler
Hardik Pandya to Bairstow, 1 run, short of length once again on middle, Bairstow gets his weight onto the back foot and punches that down to long-on for another comfortable single

Hardik Pandya to Bairstow, 2 runs, angling towards middle and leg, half-volley, and Bairstow drags the front foot back to check that on-drive towards long-on for a brace as Kuldeep dives to his left to pick up a couple
Hardik Pandya to Hales, 1 run, once again too straight from Pandya, his usual back of a length, and another tuck away to deep mid-wicket for a single
Hardik Pandya to Bairstow, 1 run, on the thighs, and a nudge away to short mid-wicket for a single

Hardik Pandya to Bairstow, 2 runs, back of a length delivery just outside off, pushed to cover for a single and the fumble in the circle gives England a bonus run. These two are lightning quick between the wickets

Hardik Pandya to Eoin Morgan, out Caught by Dhawan! Wow! This is more of a recovery catch which has in turn made this a spectacular one. A slap on the thigh - yep, you guessed it, it's Shikhar Dhawan! Short one on the body, not much pace on it, Eoin Morgan gets into a front-on stance and hooks it inches from his chin towards deep fine leg where it looks like it'll be six. Dhawan is not right back at the fence, which he should be, but stretches upwards with a leap and falls over backwards, nearly twisting and spraining his neck! Nevertheless, the man is back up with a thigh slap, and picks up a spectacular catch. Surely, he would've had an earful from Kohli if that was not taken. Eoin Morgan c Dhawan b Hardik Pandya 17(19) [4s-2]
Chahal to Hales, no run, another leg-break on off and middle with a stronger top-spin component than side-spin, push-driven towards mid-off
Chahal to Hales, no run, straighter, not much flight, and a crouched deft cut to short third man
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, slightly shorter given the overspin and not too wide, but Eoin Morgan makes room with a bottom-handed cut square of the wicket for a single

Chahal to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, tosses it up this time, but terrible line again, towards leg, and Eoin Morgan's eyes light up as he sweeps it flat towards backward square leg for four. A mock-attempt by Pandya at the boundary; I'm sure he could've done better
Chahal to Hales, 1 run, flatter once again, abandons flight, some topspin towards the thighs, and a nudge away off the back foot towards mid-wicket for a single
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, flatter delivery straightening on off, skiddy, Eoin Morgan rocks onto the back foot and pulls that flat towards wide long-on for a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, SIX, too much flight, which becomes a problem when it is too full and offered in the batsman's swing zone. Despite the natural overspin, Hales just has to get slightly forward to reach the pitch of it and swings that cleanly over long-on and into the road near the stadium for six. That one ain't comin' back!
Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, no run, straying on the pads, turned away politely to short mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, no run, googly once again and turning past the clueless batsman's forward defence as Dhoni breaks the stumps

Kuldeep Yadav to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, tempting flight once again on a perfect length, middle stump, Eoin Morgan gets forward to defend, gets a thick inside edge towards backward square leg for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, tossed up, cuts off the angle, doesn't let it turn: step 1: smother the spin; step2: smash it aerially towards the long-on fence for four
Kuldeep Yadav to Eoin Morgan, 2 runs, googly tossed up and turning sharply in, Eoin Morgan hasn't read that I think but manages to chip it off a full-stretch to mid-wicket for a brace
Chahal to Hales, no run, wily flighted leg-break on middle, straightening off the turf as Hales' body and bat comes down in a stoic forward defence
Chahal to Hales, FOUR, the flipper squeezed out of the fingers, skidding a tad wide and giving him room, and a crouched late-cut down to the third man fence for four
Chahal to Hales, 2 runs, fuller in length on middle, drifting in and threatening to spin away, Hales gets forward to cut off the angle and turns it against the spin to mid-wicket for a brace
Chahal to Hales, SIX, leg-break tossed up wide outside off, very wide, but in the arc, and Hales reaches out to drag that from outside off-stump and slog-sweeps that over deep mid-wicket for six
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, leg-break outside off, a tad short, punched off the back foot to long-off for a comfortable single

Chahal to Eoin Morgan, no run, the top-spinner, Eoin Morgan's reverse-sweep doesn't account for the overspin, misses. Big appeal, but might have been going over the stumps. India have no review left. Hang on - replays show that Morgan got a glove on that
Kuldeep Yadav to Eoin Morgan, leg byes, 1 run, slides on and Morgan misses the nudge into the on-side, off the pad and an extra to short fine

Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, leg byes, 1 run, that shout never looked convincing. The quicker ball that ends up as a low full toss, Hales is down on his knee to play the sweep, beaten for pace and struck on the outer part of the front pad. The impact was always the question and that proved to be right
Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, no run, googly on the stumps, blocked back
Kuldeep Yadav to Eoin Morgan, leg byes, 1 run, slides down leg and Morgan fails to meet with the glance, off the pad and Rahul is quick to clean up

Kuldeep Yadav to Eoin Morgan, no run, Dhoni keeps looking at Morgan's stance as he finishes appealing for a LBW. The wrong 'un and Morgan did not pick it, played down the wrong line and the ball turns in to hit the pad. The impact might have been outside off and height was also an issue
Kuldeep Yadav to Hales, 1 run, half tracker and Kuldeep gets away with it, Hales's pull finds the deep mid-wicket fielder
Chahal to Hales, 1 run, much slower and Hales is into his sweep early, the top-edge lobs up and lands safely near the short fine region
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, eased away past cover and down to long-off
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, no run, quicker and just outside off, mistimed punch to cover

Chahal to Eoin Morgan, wide, that was very close to the leg-stump. A late call from the umpire for a wide. The conventional sweep this time and Morgan missed that as well, went over the leg-stump and that was harsh on Chahal

Chahal to Eoin Morgan, no run, huge shout for LBW. The Indians gather around and Dhoni explains them what might have happened. Morgan attempts the reverse sweep and misses, struck on the front pad and the ball was not turning in to hit the stumps. That is what Dhoni also suggested. Ball-tracking shows the same - hitting umpire's call
Chahal to Hales, 1 run, oh! What was Hales trying there? A slip in place and he plays the steer, luckily for him it bounces in front of Raina and a fumble allows him to get to the other end
Chahal to Hales, 2 runs, lopped up outside off, Hales uses his reach to drive it wide of long-off, two added
Hardik Pandya to Hales, 1 run, drifts on the pads and is picked away to fine leg

Hardik Pandya to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, Raina makes a fine stop at backward point, saved three. Short and outside off, Morgan cracks the cut to the left of backward point, Raina dives across to make a one-handed stop
Hardik Pandya to Hales, 1 run, good length ball on off, dabbed wide of backward point and the duo race across
Hardik Pandya to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, three quarter length and Morgan chops it past the point fielder, sweeper tidies up
Hardik Pandya to Eoin Morgan, no run, fuller and outside off, Morgan drives and picks Rohit at cover
Hardik Pandya to Hales, 1 run, back of a length just outside off, Hales runs it down to third man
Chahal to Eoin Morgan, no run, flighted close to off, Morgan prods forward and defends

Chahal to Root, out Bowled!! Root looks bemused. Chahal celebrates with a fist pump. He is completely done him in there. The googly and surely Root did not pick it, he was down on one knee to play the sweep, the ball turned in from outside off and hit off-stump. Beating Root comfortably. He was not expecting the googly and especially from that line, that is what surprised him. Wicket for spin in the first over. So that will make it interesting. Root b Chahal 9(10)
Chahal to Hales, 1 run, tossed up on middle, nudged wide of short mid-wicket and fumble from Pandya makes the single look easy
Chahal to Hales, no run, floats it up outside off, Hales lunges forward and drives to cover. Not off the middle
Chahal to Hales, no run, shade quicker and on the stumps, Hales blocks to the left of Chahal
Chahal to Root, 1 run, flatter delivery pushed through, Root stays back and knocks it to long-on

Hardik Pandya to Hales, FOUR, ruins the over for Pandya. Length ball and Hales just swung across the line, got plenty of height than distance as the ball plugs near deep mid-wicket before trickling into the fence
Hardik Pandya to Hales, no run, good length ball that is blocked into the off-side by Hales

Hardik Pandya to Root, 3 runs, Umesh has pulled off a superb save. He is one of the fast bowling athletes in the Indian team. Root improvises with a shuffle and kneel, laps it backward of square leg and the ball seemed to be heading to the rope before Umesh intercepts with a full length dive. Covered good ground deep mid-wicket and hauled it in with a flick, saved a run
Hardik Pandya to Hales, 1 run, short of length on off, Hales mistimes the pull through the vacant mid-wicket region
Hardik Pandya to Hales, no run, on a length close to off, Hales defends into the off-side
Hardik Pandya to Root, 1 run, fraction short on the stumps, Root helps it along the way backward of square leg

U Yadav to Buttler, out Caught by Kohli!! Third time lucky for the Indian skipper. Look at him celebrate. The drop catch only cost him and India four runs. Umesh has his second and this is a huge wicket. England's run-machine in the last few months has been sent back. Another full delivery just outside off, Buttler goes through the line with the lofted off-drive, he does not get the height to clear Kohli at mid-off. The skipper moves to his right and clings on. Buttler c Kohli b U Yadav 14(12) [4s-3]

U Yadav to Buttler, no run, backs away to the leg-side and Umesh smartly keeps it away from his range - outside off, no contact made. Buttler is trying too many things here, some are coming off and some are not

U Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, in the air and four. Another mistimed hit from Buttler and he gets away with it. Form also brings luck they say. Full delivery and he went through the line, right off the toe-end and over mid-off, Kohli ran back in hope to catch it, but the ball landed in front of him and bounced over the rope

U Yadav to Buttler, no run, dropped! Indian fans in the crowd can't believe it. A real sitter put down by the skipper. Buttler moved around in the crease before lining up for the full ball, does not get the elevation on the loft and Kohli goes reverse cup with a jump and he manages to shell it. That did not require a jump
U Yadav to Root, 1 run, Root is favoring the pull even though the length is not that short, mistimed one in the previous over and now inside edges it onto the pad, rolls to cover and Buttler is off
U Yadav to Root, no run, fuller and on the fourth stump line, Root knocks it to mid-on
Bhuvneshwar to Root, 1 run, not short enough to play the pull, but Root does not think so, he gets all cramped up and mistimes it to deep square leg
Bhuvneshwar to Root, no run, that is why Raina is at gully for Root. He likes to run the ball to third man and India are cutting that off, straight to Raina
Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, 1 run, strange field placing for Buttler. Deep point in place and third man in. Buttler uses an angled bat to steer a back of a length delivery to the deep point fielder
Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, no run, on a length and outside off, Buttler drives without timing towards cover

Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, no run, back of a length outside off, Buttler hangs back and nails the pull straight to square leg, either side of Umesh and that would have been four more for the England keeper
Bhuvneshwar to Root, 1 run, and Root still manages to get it down to third man, trifle short and outside off, chopped away past Raina

U Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, wow! That is the form of the man. Just a check and the ball races away to the boundary. Fuller and around off, Buttler does not commit fully to the drive, checks it at the last second and the ball whizzes straight of mid-off
U Yadav to Buttler, no run, fuller and attacking the stumps, Buttler pushes it with a straight bat to mid-on

U Yadav to Buttler, FOUR, fraction short and Buttler employs the pull to clear the short mid-wicket fielder. He was quick to pick the length and though the bat turned on impact, he had enough to get it over the man
U Yadav to Buttler, no run, shortens the length outside off, Buttler punches and finds Kohli in the way at cover-point
U Yadav to Root, 1 run, full and on the pads, that's a freebie for a new batsman, Root leans across and flicks to deep square leg

U Yadav to Roy, out Bowled!! There you go. Rewarded immediately for pitching the ball up. Yes, it is not a full length delivery, but a good length ball with inward movement. Roy was rooted to the crease waiting for the short of length delivery, he is beaten for pace as the ball skids through to beat the inside edge and crash into middle stump. Umesh is delighted as he has Roy twice in two games. Roy b U Yadav 15(12) [4s-2 6s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, 1 run, short of length close to off, Roy opens the bat face and steers it to third man
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, no run, closer to the off-stump and the short-arm jab comes into play, off the toe-end and to the left of mid-on, where Dhawan dives across to make a fine stop. Saved a few there

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, no run, finds the fielder at backward point. The ball is flying off Roy's bat. Short of length around off, Roy is on the back foot to punch and he middled it nicely, but picked out the Indian skipper
Bhuvneshwar to Roy, no run, the three quarter length from Bhuvi and Roy goes hard on the punch, mistimed towards the point region

Bhuvneshwar to Roy, no run, Roy is also on the move to Bhuvneshwar. Not sure if it is the right idea. The length was shortened and a bit of nip into the batsman, Roy closes the bat face to play the flick and is beaten on the inside edge
Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, 1 run, Buttler walks down the wicket to get close to the length ball, works it wide of mid-wicket and races across for the single

U Yadav to Roy, SIX, England are off to a flier. 14 runs off the first over. Umesh has to bowl to his strength. As of now he is trying to emulate what the England bowlers did - that is bowl short. Sits up for Roy, who plays the pull even though there is a man in the deep, clears him quite comfortably
U Yadav to Roy, no run, on a length close to off, Roy has his bat and pad close together before blocking it into the off-side

U Yadav to Roy, FOUR, the ball teases Kuldeep all the way. Too straight this time from Umesh, on middle and leg, Roy is still on the back foot while playing the flick and he manages to evade the dive from Chahal at mid-wicket. Kuldeep chases from mid-on and is reluctant to dive
U Yadav to Roy, no run, once more he is on the shorter side, the line is just outside off, Roy stands tall and crunches the punch to cover-point. It is a packed off-side field

U Yadav to Roy, FOUR, Umesh is trying to bowl the hard length - back of a length around off, Roy is waiting for it on the back foot, quick swivel and the pull is placed in front of square, wide of Chahal at mid-wicket
U Yadav to Roy, no run, starts with a short of length delivery around off, Roy is on his feet to defend to backward point
Brathwaite to Rohit, 1 run, and finally Brathwaite nails the yorker. Dug out to long-off. So it's only a 195
Brathwaite to Rohit, SIX, a damn overcook outside off. Rohit smokes it down, big, high, over the sightscreen. He's into that toying around zone

Brathwaite to Rohit, 4 runs, it was just meant to be a squeezed out yorker. But Brathwaite in anger throws it at the stumps - where Rohit is on a casual walk down - only to miss it by a cool few sets of stumps and roll away to the fence. Dear, oh, dear

Brathwaite to Rohit, FOUR, that'll do. Number four is here -- getting past everyone on this planet with the most T20I centuries anyone can boast of. And to think that he ate up a maiden at the start of it. Picks out the slower one, sitting quickly across his stumps and scooping it over the keeper. He's angry, yells in celebration. Wow, THIS is how you inaugurate a stadium.
Brathwaite to Rohit, FOUR, the edges will do. It's a juicy full toss, Rohit swings compulsively, and outside-halves it between the keeper and short third. 96 ..
Brathwaite to Rahul, 1 run, full, a squeezy-whip down to long-on
K Paul to Rahul, 1 run, a streching jump way across his stumps, slapping it on the bounce to sweeper
K Paul to Rahul, no run, can't quite make room for himself, cramping the cut out to point

K Paul to Rahul, 2 runs, put down -- Pollard of all people. Paul mixes it up well, fixing Rahul for the lack of pace as he drags his swing only off the toe-end, and Pollard covers good distance running in from the boundary, dives forward too, but then, the hard hands syndrome!
K Paul to Rahul, no run, reverses, but can't adjust to the lack of pace and the spongy bounce that takes it over
K Paul to Rahul, 2 runs, a whippy front footed cover drive, drilled where extra cover in the deep sweeps up
K Paul to Rohit, 1 run, 130kph, flicked from middle into mid-wicket. And Rohit always was coming back for the second, only for KL to point and show him the fielder
K Pierre to Rahul, 2 runs, a weird sort of a reverse-pull. Comes off the glove in the end, popping past the keeper
K Pierre to Rahul, SIX, darts it on the stumps. And Rahul has the freedom to swing, tonk, and launch it straight down
K Pierre to Rahul, wide, wider. The nerves of having to bowl to Rohit refusing to go away even when it is Rahul
K Pierre to Rahul, wide, thrown wide, too much so
K Pierre to Rohit, 1 run, fuller, squeezed out from the off-line, cover
K Pierre to Rohit, FOUR, responds with a nervous flat-full-toss. Rohit was already backing away, reaches out and slices it behind point
K Pierre to Rohit, SIX, he's down the pitch, but just not close enough by any standards. So he reaches out and swings, one-handed almost, but it's behind the sightscreen. It's becoming a joke, guys
K Pierre to Rohit, no run, a wide tease, gripping in the surface and eating into Sharma's timing. Bunted out off the inside half
Brathwaite to Rohit, 1 run, a calming drive through the line, long-off. But that's what he's wanted probably, his strike back
Brathwaite to Rahul, 1 run, paddle-sweeps it onto his helmet. A low full toss, deflected onto himself off the leading-edge .. and it ballooons high and lands just short of a running in short fine leg
Brathwaite to Rahul, FOUR, picks out the leg-cutter, makes room for himself and with a very violent-looking cut, gets it behind point
Brathwaite to Rahul, FOUR, punched on the up - which with mid-off in the circle was always waiting to come out. Brathwaite loses his line, lets out with and Rahul milks
Brathwaite to Rohit, 1 run, 132kph, middle and leg, full again. Flicked in front of square
Brathwaite to Rahul, 1 run, 129kph, full, drifting into middle. A chipped straight drive over the bowler to long-on
K Pierre to Rahul, 1 run, a loose chop, nearly deflecting the line already very close to off onto off. Bounces away past the keeper
K Pierre to Rohit, 1 run, keeps it wide outside off, smartly, removing all of Rohit's leg-sided swings. Will have to settle for a dab behind point
K Pierre to Rohit, no run, on the shorter side, but not quite the width. Chopped, point
K Pierre to Rahul, 1 run, steps out, closing the line to knock it down to long-on

K Pierre to Pant, out Caught by Hetmyer!! Pant gets greedy, yet again. And yet again, he flatters to deceive. It was a pretty fullish delivery to be able to get under in the first place, and also the line was very close to middle. But Pant being Pant, sinks on a knee to muscle a slog-sweep. Loses shape. Loses timing. And the top-edge is downed at mid-wicket. Pant c Hetmyer b K Pierre 5(6) [4s-1]

K Pierre to Pant, FOUR, oh his bottom-hand. He isn't worried to go airy either, with a flamingo-like whip .. a catching mid-wicket was close by, but with such power in the shot, he was always going to be just a spectator
Thomas to Pant, 1 run, stays beside the line, steering a punch through point
Thomas to Pant, no run, bumper. Pant sits under, early

Thomas to Pant, no run, 134kph, tries chopping, and almost chops on. Nearly does a Dhawan from some of the earlier matches - looking to cut a not-so-far-away delivery, but luckily for Pant, the inside edge falls behind his stumps
Thomas to Pant, no run, driven on the up, but Pant hasn't adjusted to the slowness of this track. More of a chipped drive to mid-off

Thomas to Rohit, 1 run, nearly another. Rohit squeezes it out to backward point and sets off, and had Pollard from out there hit the non-striker's, he'd have been a goner. In fact he'd given up as well
Thomas to Rohit, FOUR, short, sitting up nicely and Sharma gets inventive. Gets into an arch, backing and upper-carving it into third man

Fabian Allen to Dhawan, out Caught by Pooran!! Dhawan's slog-sweep ditches him. He had been setting up for the big swing for quite some time now, without really getting his timing right. He does it again, but Pooran at long leg does perfectly, anticipating, moving across and then diving one-handed to make it all the more beautiful. But finally, some respite from the thrashing. Dhawan c Pooran b Fabian Allen 43(41) [4s-3]
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, wide, goes to reverse pull, but Allen in his reaction has darted this outside off, too much so in fact
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 2 runs, whipped out, sinking on a knee as he does. Deep mid-wicket
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, no run, spots Dhawan on the charge and drags his length back. Mistimed pull eventually to mid-wicket
Fabian Allen to Rohit, 1 run, hammered straight back, Allen in his desperation to save his face palms it past him. No, it's NOT a drop. It's self-defence
Fabian Allen to Rohit, SIX, more brutal. Allen denies him the pace and Rohit with a big swing hoicks it away getting rid of his front leg, long-on now, loopier, higher, and long enough

Fabian Allen to Rohit, SIX, you said an 83-meter boundary? Well why bother when he can get a 100. It's that cardinal sin ball - right in the length slot to whack and Rohit slogs-sweeps it flat, long, big into cow corner
K Paul to Rohit, 1 run, slices a short-wide combo. Sweeper's waiting though
K Paul to Rohit, 2 runs, big fat outside-edge on his across-the-line hack. Flies away through the empty slip cordon
K Paul to Dhawan, 1 run, a one-kneed slog. Long-on
K Paul to Rohit, 1 run, slower off-cutter. Threaded down to long-off, fully bat flow, through the line, right off the meat

K Paul to Rohit, FOUR, delicately classy. A back of a length delivery with just a hint of room, and Rohit rocks back, lets it get close and cuts it surgically behind point and in front of short third man. India's 100 with it

K Paul to Rohit, 2 runs, a walking soft-flick. Strolls inside the line, carefully rolling his wrists to get it in the massive long-on gap. And a fifty .. with enough time to double. And if someone knows how to, and someone can, it is him
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, no run, too hard on the slog sweep, losing all shape, losing all timing. Literrally all of it - doesn't even connect
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 2 runs, goes reverse, using all of Allen's pace to dab it past the keeper - but then, it's off the toe-end and these boundaries are massive to give it the legs
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, no run, drifting into the legs. Flicked out to mid-wicket
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, no run, 104kph, quick, flat, from the front of the hand. Dhawan looks to heave it downtown, beaten for pace
Fabian Allen to Rohit, 1 run, a hint of air thrown up outside off. Rohit crouches in carving it through extra cover
Fabian Allen to Rohit, FOUR, top flick. A dance down, right to the pitch of it and then the bottom-hand comes in to steal the show .. with a top whip through mid-wicket
K Paul to Dhawan, no run, length, going across, sticking in the pitch. Dhawan goes up tall and slaps it straight to cover
K Paul to Dhawan, 2 runs, 99kph, back to the cutter. Drilled through the covers
K Paul to Dhawan, wide, loses his wrist, looking to make Dhawan stretch and in the process gets it way outside off
K Paul to Rohit, 1 run, goes inside-out, but the loveliness when it finds a fielder can get you only a single. And that single it is
K Paul to Rohit, no run, 133kph, full-throttle, hitting the hard good length outside off. Sharma has already made room for himself and just can't reach out
K Paul to Dhawan, 1 run, 99kph, a bigger miscued slice, with the cutter eating into Dhawan's timing. But it's chipped on the bounce to long-off
K Paul to Rohit, 1 run, 106kph, slow dipping full toss. Rohit waits to drive it to long-off
Fabian Allen to Rohit, 1 run, on a fuller length and at the stumps, Rohit drives it to long-off. He retains the strike with it
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 1 run, quicker and at the stumps, Dhawan flat-bats it to long-off for a single
Fabian Allen to Rohit, 1 run, slower and drags his length back, Rohit goes back and half-pulls it to long-on
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 1 run, at the stumps and Dhawan nudges it wide of mid-wicket
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, no run, drives it back to the bowler
Fabian Allen to Rohit, 1 run, plunges forward and works it to long-on
Brathwaite to Rohit, 1 run, hint of width and Rohit steers it to sweeper cover

Brathwaite to Rohit, FOUR, wow! Bat made a crunching sound as it made contact. He gets in a fabulous position and pulls it with disdain power. It was only a couple of meters away from that deep square leg fielder but it rockets to the fence and he had no chance of cutting it off
Brathwaite to Rohit, no run, yorker length delivery at the stumps, Rohit jams it to the leg-side

Brathwaite to Rohit, SIX, this is exceptional timing from Rohit! He gets inside the line of the ball and lifts it over short fine. He gets the desired elevation as well as the desired distance. It clears the ropes with ease
Brathwaite to Dhawan, 1 run, stands tall and pulls it, on a bounce to deep mid-wicket

Brathwaite to Dhawan, FOUR, Paul drops a sitter at deep square leg. Dhawan mistimes the pull shot, it keeps a little low and hits the lower half of the bat. It was in the air for an eternity, Paul misjudges it and spills it. It deflects off his hands to the boundary too. Keemo should have done better there
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 1 run, touch short and at the stumps, Dhawan rocks back and cuts it to sweeper cover
Fabian Allen to Rohit, 1 run, hint fo width and Rohit uses that to steer it wide of short third

Fabian Allen to Rohit, no run, in the air, just short of the bowler. Or is it? Fabian Allen is unsure and the umpire has gone upstairs. It clearly bounces before reaching Fabian Allen and NOT OUT is the decision from the third umpire
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 1 run, fuller length delivery at the stumps, Dhawan drives it to long-off
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, no run, cuts it straight to cover
Fabian Allen to Dhawan, 2 runs, at the pads and Dhawan whips it wide of deep mid-wicket for a brace
Brathwaite to Dhawan, 1 run, back of a length delivery at the body, Dhawan pushes it to long-on
Brathwaite to Rohit, 1 run, another short delivery outside off, Rohit half-pulls it to deep square leg for a single
Brathwaite to Dhawan, 1 run, short of length delivery at the stumps, Dhawan pulls it to the leg-side
Brathwaite to Dhawan, 2 runs, short of length deliver, Dhawan pulls it to deep square leg for a brace
Brathwaite to Rohit, 1 run, nudges it to square leg for a single

Brathwaite to Rohit, wide, misses his line. Down the leg-side, Rohit swivels and was looking for a deft touch. He ends up missing it. Umpire Anil Kumar Chaudhary was late in giving the wide call. Rohit had a stunned look on his face and that triggered umpire to signal it as a wide
Brathwaite to Dhawan, 1 run, 1000 runs for Dhawan in T20 internationals! It was a good length delivery around off, Dhawan stands tall and punches it off the back foot to sweeper cover
K Pierre to Dhawan, 1 run, aimed at the stumps and Dhawan drives it to long-on to retain strike
K Pierre to Dhawan, no run, this one holds in the pitch a bit and it comes slowly. Dhawan was forced to play a defensive shot and he is happy to block it to cover
K Pierre to Rohit, 1 run, uses straight bat to knock it to long-off, another single
K Pierre to Dhawan, 2 wides, down the leg-side, it deflects off the keeper and ends up short fine. They take a single too
K Pierre to Rohit, 1 run, now a push to long-off. Smart batting from Rohit

K Pierre to Rohit, SIX, this stadium is huge but not huge enough for Hit-man Sharma. He clears his front leg and climbs into it, smashes it down the ground and clears the long-on fence with ease. It went a long way back in the stands.
K Pierre to Dhawan, 1 run, astute bowling this from Pierre. Watches Dhawan advances and slows it up down the leg-side. Dhawan mistimes the heave to deep mid-wicket
Thomas to Dhawan, 1 run, on a good length and outside off, and Dhawan plays that most used shot in limited over cricket. A steer to third man

Thomas to Dhawan, FOUR, this is a gorgeous cover drive! He plunges forward on this fuller length ball and times the drive exceedingly well. He places it well too this time and it races to the fence in a canter!
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, on a fuller length and wide of off, Dhawan drives and drives well, finds cover
Thomas to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan identifies the line and length early, gets in a terrific position and powers it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary. Dhawan ensures he makes use of this free-hit!
Thomas to Rohit, no ball, 1 run, another no-ball! This is a cardinal sin in this format. It was outside off and Rohit steers it to third man
Thomas to Rohit, SIX, this is the Rohit Sharma we know! It was a length ball on the stumps, Rohit backs away, manufactures room and larrups it over long-off. It sails over the ropes!
Thomas to Rohit, no run, full-toss at the stumps, Rohit mistimes the drive to mid-on
K Pierre to Rohit, 1 run, yorker length delivery at the stumps, Rohit digs it out to deep mid-wicket for a single
K Pierre to Rohit, no run, Rohit advances down the track. Pierre watches that and slows it up. He bowls it down the leg-side too, away from the bat swing of Rohit. He could only clip it to short fine
K Pierre to Dhawan, 1 run, it skids off the deck, Dhawan pushes it wide of cover for a single
K Pierre to Dhawan, 2 runs, two is the call and they will come back easily. Shikhar uses his bottom hand to clip it wide of long-on for a brace
K Pierre to Rohit, 1 run, a gentle push to mid-off and a single
K Pierre to Rohit, FOUR, first boundary of the match! On a fuller length and at the stumps, Rohit backs away, clears his front leg and tonks it over mid-off for a boundary
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, steep bounce for Thomas on this delivery! Some are keeping low and some are bouncing swiftly. Dhawan hops in the crease a touch and keeps it down to the off-side

Thomas to Rohit, 1 run, in the air and just wide of point. It was a back of a length delivery around off, Rohit backs away, makes room. He wanted to cut it over point but ends up mistiming it wide of point
Thomas to Dhawan, 1 run, on a good length and targeting the stumps, Dhawan was cramped for room. He edges it back on the shoe and it deflects to the off-side. They charge for a single
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, it bounces low off the deck and that unables Dhawan to execute the cut shot. It hits him low on the bat and ends up to cover
Thomas to Rohit, 1 run, on a good length and outside off, Rohit runs it down to third man
Thomas to Dhawan, 1 run, on a fuller length and targeting the stumps, Dhawan uses soft hands to push it to mid-off. He was already on the front foot and that allows him to take a quick single
K Paul to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan walks into the shot to generate pace and drives it to mid-off for a quick single
K Paul to Dhawan, no run, slower delivery well wide of off, Dhawan went for an ugly heave across the line. It hardly bounces and went under the bat of Ramdin
K Paul to Rohit, no ball, 1 run, Paul has oversteped! Free-hit coming up! It was on a fuller length and at the stumps, Rohit pushes it to mid-off and charges for a single
K Paul to Rohit, no run, on a short of length and around off, Rohit mistimes the cut to cover
K Paul to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan plunges forward and pushes it to mid-off politely. An eye-contact between the pair and they complete a single

K Paul to Rohit, 1 run, at the stumps and Rohit went for that pick-up shot of his. It isn't coming nicely on the bat and it comes off the inside half of the willow of Rohit and ends up at deep square leg
K Paul to Rohit, wide, that's the problem with right and left combination. Paul misses his radar, it was well down the leg-side and umpire calls it wide
K Paul to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan and India are off the mark! It was a fuller length delivery at the stumps, Dhawan whips it wide of mid-wicket and complete a single
Thomas to Rohit, no run, maiden to start the match! This is very rare in T20 cricket. It was a short of length delivery around off, Rohit gets on top of it but mistimes the punch again to mid-off
Thomas to Rohit, no run, much fuller and at the stumps, Rohit gets behind it and defends it back to Thomas. Good start by Windies and Thomas!
Thomas to Rohit, no run, on a back of a length and outside off, Rohit attempts a cut but fails to time it. It ends up at cover. Already there are signs that you can't play on the up on this wicket
Thomas to Rohit, no run, Thomas drags his length back on this delivery. Rohit gets behind it and pushes it to cover

Thomas to Rohit, no run, lovely away shape off the deck on this delivery. The line was outside off and it ended well outside off, Rohit lifts his bat and lets it go. Test match like start to this T-20 match!
Thomas to Rohit, no run, on a good length and wide of off, not much bounce on it. Rohit identifies the line early and leaves it alone

Bumrah to Thomas, no run, that's a nasty delivery. Thomas was down the wicket to play at it, but Bumrah bangs it short and almost takes down the batsman's head. Nevertheless, India take down Windies by 71 runs
Bumrah to Thomas, FOUR, that's smashed. Right into the slot around middle and leg, Thomas drills it powerfully past the bowler and adds four more to his account
Bumrah to Thomas, FOUR, Thomas off the mark with a boundary. Not a bad shot. On the pads and Thomas flicks it through mid-wicket timing it to perfection
Bumrah to Thomas, no run, yorker outside off, Thomas tries to squeeze it out but it was too quick for him. Bumrah giving him a taste of his own medicine

Bumrah to K Pierre, out Caught&Bowled!! "India not even celebrating now," says Sanjay Manjrekar on air. But Rohit Sharma loves it as he keeps clapping and jogs towards the bowler. This was a length delivery around middle and leg, it got stuck in the pitch and Pierre ends up chipping it back to the bowler. Just a wicket away from victory are the Men in Blue. A thumping victory - that is. K Pierre c and b Bumrah 1(4)
Bumrah to K Pierre, wide, the slower delivery gone wrong, strays in line and the batsman doesn't bother to connect his glance
Bumrah to K Pierre, no run, yorker outside off, Pierre squeezes it out in front of covers
Bhuvneshwar to K Pierre, 1 run, on the pads and it's been gently worked down to fine leg
Bhuvneshwar to K Pierre, no run, slower bouncer around off and Pierre watches it sail to the keeper

Bhuvneshwar to K Paul, out Caught by Rohit!! You're going to get plenty of points if Rohit Sharma is in your fantasy teams. Twice - if he's your captain. That's his third catch to add value to the century he scored earlier in the evening. This was a short delivery around off and Paul looks to smash it over mid-off. Doesn't get the elevation right and Sharma does the rest. K Paul c Rohit b Bhuvneshwar 20(21) [6s-2]
Bhuvneshwar to K Paul, 2 runs, short of a length around middle and leg, rising delivery at the thigh and it's been helped down to long leg by Paul with an easy pull, two runs
Bhuvneshwar to K Paul, no run, the bouncer, the slower bouncer in fact. Outside off and Paul is way too early in his pull, beaten all ends up
Bhuvneshwar to K Paul, no run, a good length delivery outside off, Paul makes room and punches it firmly to cover. It went quickly to the fielder there, hence they didn't think of taking a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, SIX, 19 runs off that over, that'll spoil his figures. Brathwaite gets charged up looking at Paul and decides to have a go himself. Gets to the pitch of the flighted delivery and towers it over long-on with all his might. Such a powerful guy!
Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, no run, the loopy delivery around middle and leg, Brathwaite defends it
Kuldeep Yadav to K Paul, 1 run, rocks back and pulls the short delivery towards mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to K Paul, SIX, make that two in a row. Paul was quick to jump out the crease as he smokes another flighted delivery. It's the deep mid-wicket fence this time and it's huge
Kuldeep Yadav to K Paul, SIX, that's a perfect reply to the bowler. Gets hold of the tossed up delivery and sends it sailing over the wide long-on fence with a powerful slog

Kuldeep Yadav to K Paul, no run, Windies review. Not sure for what though! Was this an lbw or was it a caught behind? Paul immediately went up for the review and that's enough to prove that there was no bat involved. But is this is an lbw? The umpire was quick to raise his finger - so this can only be out by means of an lbw. And that's not-out. The umpire will have to overturn the decision as the ball was missing the off-stump, as it was the googly. He was trying to play the reverse sweep when he got beaten and was struck on the pads
Khaleel Ahmed to K Paul, 1 run, a high full toss around off and Paul slices it down to sweeper cover

Khaleel Ahmed to K Paul, no run, flicks the fullish delivery in front of square leg and a fired up Krunal is quick to gather the ball and have a go. Forces the batsman to put in a dive at the striker's end and get back in. The effect of that direct-hit, this
Khaleel Ahmed to Brathwaite, 1 run, spears in a yorker around middle and leg, Brathwaite lifts his bat and jams it down to long-on

Khaleel Ahmed to Brathwaite, 2 runs, the slower delivery around middle and leg, flicked down to deep mid-wicket with soft hands. Quick legs and they'll come back for two. The throw from the deep wasn't that powerful either
Khaleel Ahmed to Brathwaite, no run, goes for the bouncer around off, Brathwaite attempts a pull and ends up getting an underedge to the keeper
Khaleel Ahmed to K Paul, 1 run, the yorker around middle, Paul backs away and squeezes it through covers
Bumrah to K Paul, 1 run, ends the over with the off-cutter, Paul calmly pats it in front of point and retains strike
Bumrah to K Paul, no run, short of a length, skidding along the deck on off and Paul hops in the crease to bunt it down
Bumrah to Brathwaite, 1 run, the slower delivery outside off, Brathwaite was lining up for the big shot but ends up slicing it down to third man of an outside edge
Bumrah to K Paul, 1 run, fires in yet another yorker on middle and leg, Paul digs it past the bowler and manages to take a single
Bumrah to K Paul, no run, right into the blockhole, a toe-crushing yorker that's been jammed back to the bowler by Paul
Bumrah to Brathwaite, 1 run, short of a length outside off, Brathwaite scythes it down to deep point
Krunal Pandya to K Paul, no run, quicker delivery around off, keeps a touch low and Paul dabs it into the off side
Krunal Pandya to K Paul, no run, moves away and tries to play another wild heave, and it's another miss
Krunal Pandya to K Paul, no run, this could have been the eighth wicket. Was so close to the leg stump. Paul goes for the slog sweep and almost loses his leg-stump in the process
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, 1 run, flatter on midddle and leg, nudged into the leg side by Brathwaite
Krunal Pandya to K Paul, 1 run, another quicker delivery around off, chopped in front of backward point for a quick single
Krunal Pandya to K Paul, no run, flatter and quicker around off, knocked back to the bowler by Paul

Bhuvneshwar to K Paul, leg byes, 1 run, the slower delivery down the leg side, Paul's glance doesn't meet but the ball clips his pads and by the time DK can put in the dive and save it, the batsmen scamper across

Bhuvneshwar to Fabian Allen, out Fabian Allen Run Out!! Bull's eye! Krunal Pandya takes his time and scores a direct-hit to send Allen back to the pavilion. Windies sink further. To be honest there was never a run there. Allen dabs it in front of cover-point and sets off without even having a look at the fielder charging forward. Knowing Pandya, he's not going to miss those. Fabian Allen run out (Krunal Pandya) 0(1)

Bhuvneshwar to Ramdin, out Caught by Rohit!! He's everywhere. In the slips, in the outfield - everywhere. The ball is just following the Indian skipper. This was on the pads and Ramdin plays a gentle flick. Rohit at square leg times his jump to perfection and plucks it out of thin air. The ball almost popped out of his hands but then - it's his night. Ramdin c Rohit b Bhuvneshwar 10(17)
Bhuvneshwar to Ramdin, no run, the slower delivery, almost chops it on. Ramdin was way too early in his heave and has a go at it. Gets an inside edge that rolls past the stumps
Bhuvneshwar to Brathwaite, 1 run, drifting on the pads again, Brathwaite flicks it down to deep square leg and calmly moves across
Bhuvneshwar to Ramdin, leg byes, 1 run, pacy back of a length delivery on leg, Ramdin attempts a flick but quite get the connection right. The ball clips his pads and rolls into the leg side
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, flatter and quicker around off, pushed into the off side by Brathwaite
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, scythes the short delivery in front of point

Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, byes, FOUR, what was that? A bouncer, seriously? The batsman had no idea if this was coming, and so did the keeper. Pandya bangs it short and Brathwaite ducks underneath. DK tries his best to leap up and grab it but in complete vain goes his effort. Four bonus runs for the batting team
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, 1 run, chops the short delivery through point and gets one run
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, 2 wides, down the leg side, misses everything, the batsman's flick and the keeper's gloves
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, 1 run, touch short outside off and it's been cut away to deep point by Ramdin

Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, no run, it was a slider on middle and leg, Ramdin was trying to flick it but gets beaten due to the incoming delivery and gets pinned on the pads. The keeper wasn't convinced, just that they took a shot. Not out remains the call
Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, no run, gives this a toss, outside off and Brathwaite is beaten in flight as his sweep makes no connection whatsoever
Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, no run, the flatter delivery around off and it's been knocked back to the bowler
Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, 2 runs, loopy delivery down the leg side and it's been swept away to long leg. Courtesy of a slight fumble by Khaleel in the deep, Brathwaite manages to come back for two
Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, no run, flighted delivery around off and it's been eased back to the bowler

Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, no run, here's the googly and Brathwaite is all over the floor. Doesn't read the wrong' un, goes for a sweep and loses his balance after getting hit on the pads. Indian players in the cordon have a bit of laugh at that
Kuldeep Yadav to Ramdin, 1 run, touch short and a lot quick around middle and leg, Ramdin has to hop in the crease to work it down to deep square leg
Bumrah to Brathwaite, no run, quite similar to the previous ball, skiddy and on a length, dabbed in front of point by Brathwaite
Bumrah to Brathwaite, no run, welcomes the new batsman with a length delivery around off and it's been defended by Brathwaite

Bumrah to Pollard, out Caught&Bowled!! This is why Bumrah was brought back into the attack. Rohit Sharma and his leadership. He's got the midas touch for the night. This was a shortish delivery, skidding along the deck and Pollard was in no position to play at it. The short delivery climbs on him and gets his top-edge as KP goes for a pull shot. Bumrah charges forward and takes it just near the batsman. Pollard almost got in the way of Bumrah and the ball, but the bowler does well to cling on to it. Now the mission for Windies looks impossible. Pollard c and b Bumrah 6(11) [4s-1]
Bumrah to Pollard, no run, can't walk down the wicket against Bumrah. Pollard does so and the incoming back of a length delivery beats his flick and strikes him on the pads
Bumrah to Pollard, no run, another quick back of a length delivery around off and Pollard watchfully defends it in front of short mid-wicket
Bumrah to Ramdin, 1 run, skiddy short of a length delivery outside off, Ramdin chops it down to third man and hands over the strike to Pollard

Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, flighted delivery at the stumps, Pollard pushes it back towards the bowler and wants a cheeky single. Kuldeep is quick onto the ball and that forces Pollard to hurry back towards his end
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, another nice wrong 'un from Kuldeep, Pollard didn't spot it, but the pitch is on the slower side and he manages to nudge it to the off-side, despite being opened up
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, the wrong 'un from Kuldeep, Pollard spots it early and pushes it towards the off-side
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, very full and on off, jammed back at the bowler

Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, FOUR, lovely, more power from a batsman, this time it's Pollard, very full and just outside off, he gets close to the ball and thumps it back past the non-striker, another dive from Dhawan at long-off and once again he comes second best
Kuldeep Yadav to Ramdin, 1 run, tossed up outside off, eased down towards long-on for a single
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, 1 run, flatter and at the stumps, tucked in front of square leg for a single
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, Pandya tosses one on the leg-stump line, worked behind square on the on-side for a single
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, no run, flighted with a flatter trajectory, pushed back at the bowler
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, 1 run, flatter and at the stumps, worked away to long-on for a single
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, 5 wides, that's a gift from Pandya, fires this one down the leg-side, Ramdin was looking to tuck and missed, so did DK and the ball rolls away to the fence
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, flatter and on the pad, nudged behind square on the on-side for a single
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, leg byes, 1 run, pushed through on Ramdin's pads, he was looking to flick and missed, sneaks in a leg-bye as the ball rolled backward of square on the on-side

Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! The wrong 'un and Pooran was clueless, second wicket of the over for Kuldeep and India are on a roll. This was nicely tossed up just outside off, Pooran was stuck to his crease as he pushed at that - more in hope then any conviction, huge gap between bat and pad, the ball found its way and knocked out the off-stump. Pooran b Kuldeep Yadav 4(3) [4s-1]
Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, FOUR, much better from Pooran, bends down low, gets very close to the ball and then paddles it fine, rolls away to the fence
Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, no run, the attempted wrong 'un, not sure Pooran read it, was looking for an ambitious sweep and missed

Kuldeep Yadav to Darren Bravo, out Caught by Rohit!! Edged and caught! Rohit can't do anything wrong tonight, the ball was travelling and he clasped onto it nonchalantly, throws it in the air in jubiliation. A dumbstruck Bravo has to walk back and the visitors have lost their third wicket. Kuldeep dropped this one short and well outside off, Bravo backed away and went with hard hands on the cut, got a thick top-edge, to the left of the lone slip and Rohit caught it two-handed, moving to his right. Darren Bravo c Rohit b Kuldeep Yadav 23(18) [4s-4]
Kuldeep Yadav to Ramdin, 1 run, the pre-mediated lap sweep from Ramdin, bends down low and gets it behind square on the on-side for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Ramdin, no run, tossed up on off, pushed towards the on-side

Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, FOUR, lovely shot, sheer power from Bravo, very full and well outside off, he gets behind the line and bludgeons it back past the bowler, even a full-fledged dive from Dhawan at long-off can't prevent the boundary
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, no run, nicely bowled by Pandya, slower and angling away from the left-hander, Bravo went hard on the cut and missed
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, 2 runs, tossed up on off, worked away wide of long-on. Rahul sprints towards the ball and then fumbles, allows Bravo to get back for the second
Krunal Pandya to Ramdin, 1 run, flatter and on Ramdin's pads, worked behind square on the on-side for a single
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, 1 run, flighted delivery on off, eased down towards long-off for a single
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, no run, that stayed very low, was very wide as well, Bravo had to reach out as he toe-ended it back at the bowler. Bizzare start from Pandya
Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, dabbed behind square on the off-side for a single
Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, FOUR, that's easy pickings for Bravo, low full-toss on his pads and he nicely guides it to the long leg boundary
Khaleel Ahmed to Ramdin, 1 run, banged in short and at the stumps, Ramdin doesn't get hold of the pull, manages to lob it over square leg for a single
Khaleel Ahmed to Ramdin, no run, that's a good short ball, banged in short and just outside off, Ramdin drops his gloves and sways away from the line

Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, out Caught by Dhawan!! Oh dear! Hetmyer has thrown his wicket away once again, he's aghast with himself as he puts his head down. On a length and at the stumps, Hetmyer was making room for the big heave, doesn't get anywhere near the middle and all he manages to do is to lob the ball into the gleeful hands of Dhawan - running in from long-on. West Indies keep losing wickets at inopportune moments. Hetmyer c Dhawan b Khaleel Ahmed 15(14) [4s-3]

Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, FOUR, nicely played, back of a length and just outside off, Hetmyer waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment, uses the pace on the ball and runs it fine. Third man was inside the ring and has no chance
Bumrah to Hetmyer, 1 run, change of pace from Bumrah, the slower ball on Hetmyer's pads, nudged in front of square on the on-side for a single
Bumrah to Hetmyer, no run, Bumrah goes for the yorker and offers a wide full-toss, squeezed straight to the fielder at backward point - Manish Pandey it was
Bumrah to Hetmyer, no run, short of a length and on off, pushed back at the bowler

Bumrah to Darren Bravo, 1 run, on a good length and slanting across the left-hander, Bravo threw his hands at that and got a thick inside edge towards short fine. Khaleel was caught napping and by the time he realises that the batsmen are running through, it's too late to effect a run-out
Bumrah to Darren Bravo, FOUR, neatly played, length ball on Bravo's pads, he gets inside the line and gets a nice little deflection, past DK and into the ropes
Bumrah to Darren Bravo, no run, short of a length and around the off-stump line, Bravo was looking to clip and gets an inside edge onto the hips, rolled slowly to the lone slip

Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, FOUR, clubbed, length ball at the stumps, Hetmyer clears his left-leg and then heaves it wide of mid-wicket, there's a man in the deep, but he's got it square of him, one bounce and over the ropes
Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, no run, on a good length and at the stumps, Hetmyer was backing away and then pushes it in front of cover-point

Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, FOUR, that has been flat-batted, backs away to a short ball, frees his arms and clubs it back past the non-striker, didn't get hold of the shot, but has enough for the ball to race away to the fence
Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, 1 run, tad fuller and just outside off, pushed in front of mid-off for a quick single
Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, no run, short of a length and on off, Bravo gets across and tucks it to the on-side
Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, wide, Khaleel shortens his length and angles this down the leg-side, Bravo gets inside the line and lets it go, called as a wide
Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Bravo plays a crisp looking drive, but straight to the fielder at mid-off
Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, no run, short of a length and just outside off, Hetmyer prods across and pushes it back at the bowler - with a closed face
Bhuvneshwar to Darren Bravo, 1 run, back of a length and well wide of off, teered behind square on the off-side for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, 1 run, tight line from Bhuvneshwar, on a good length and around the off-stump channel, pushed in front of mid-off for a quick single
Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, no run, short of a length and on off, defended back at the bowler

Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, no run, swing and a miss, clever change of pace from Bhuvneshwar and he nearly had his man, the slower knuckle ball, angling across the left-hander, Hetmyer has a mighty mow - across the line and is beaten by the lack of pace
Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, no run, short of a length and on the off-stump line, defended back towards the bowler

Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, FOUR, banged in short and well outside off, Bravo swivelled across on the pull, didn't get hold of the shot, but has enough to beat the chasing fielder from mid-wicket. West Indies need a lot more of these if they are to chase down 195
Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, no run, Khaleel shortens his length outside off, pushed off the front-foot to the off-side
Khaleel Ahmed to Darren Bravo, no run, short of a length and at the stumps, Bravo prods across and turns it to the on-side

Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, out Bowled!! A nothing shot and West Indies have lost their first wicket. Lack of bounce or was it a lack of pace that was the undoing of Hope? The umpire checks for a possible front-foot no-ball, but Khaleel has a bit behind, Hope continues to walk back to the dug-out. This was a short of a length delivery that didn't bounce as much as Hope expected, he was way too early on the pull, the head fell away and the ball rattled the top of off-stump. A disappointing innings from the classy batsman, bar that one majestic blow. Shai Hope b Khaleel Ahmed 6(8) [6s-1]
Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, no run, back of a length and angling across the right-hander, Hope prods across and nudges it to backward point
Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, 1 run, short of a good length and well outside off, dabbed away to third man for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Shai Hope, no run, short of a length and holding its line outside off, Hope pokes at that and gets an inside edge past leg-stump, he wanted a single but is sent back

Bhuvneshwar to Shai Hope, no run, loud shout for a caught behind, Bhuvneshwar was pleading with the umpire, but I reckon it just brushed the thigh pad on its way to DK, he wasn't sure either and India do not review. Hope was looking to flick a leg-stump delivery and missed

Bhuvneshwar to Shai Hope, SIX, beautifully played, such elegance from the right-hander, a hint of shape back into the batsman, Hope leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and lifts it back over the bowler's head, high elbow and went sailing over the boundary fence
Bhuvneshwar to Shai Hope, no run, back of a length and in that channel outside off, Hope stands tall and punches it to mid-off
Bhuvneshwar to Shai Hope, no run, Bhuvneshwar shortens his length and gets it to shape away from outside off, left alone
Bhuvneshwar to Shai Hope, no run, short of a length and well wide of off, Hope was looking to pull in a lazy manner and missed

Navdeep Saini to Pretorius, SIX, 16 off the over. Saini goes for the slower delivery but gives the batsman a lot of time, Pretorius moves away and waits before launching it into the stands near cow corner
Navdeep Saini to Pretorius, 2 runs, fired into the blockhole, Pretorius squeezes it straight down the ground, Jadeja gets around from long-on and keeps it down to a brace
Navdeep Saini to Phehlukwayo, 1 run, low full toss outside off, Phehlukwayo makes room and slices the drive to sweeper cover

Navdeep Saini to Phehlukwayo, SIX, that's massive! Phehlukwayo almost sent it out of the ground. It ended up somewhere in the last row. Moved away and got underneath the back of a length delivery, then swings it as hard as possible to tower it over deep mid-wicket
Navdeep Saini to Pretorius, leg byes, 1 run, spears it full and at the batsman's legs, Pretorius is beaten for pace and is not able to lay bat on the flick, the ball deflects off the pad to third man
Navdeep Saini to Pretorius, no run, skiddy back of a length delivery and Pretorius is late on the cut shot, the ball was not far away from the off-stump

Hardik Pandya to Pretorius, leg byes, 1 run, full delivery right at the batsman's feet, Pretorius fails to connect with the flick and another leg-bye is all they get. Excellent recovery from Hardik after conceding 24 off his first two overs, next two overs - 2-0-9-1
Hardik Pandya to Phehlukwayo, leg byes, 1 run, another slower ball that is banged into the surface, Phehlukwayo is early into the pull and the ball deflects off the thigh pad into the leg-side

Hardik Pandya to Phehlukwayo, no run, umpire Shamshuddin gestures to Phehlukwayo that it brushed his shirt. Slower short of length delivery down leg, Phehlukwayo swivels and misses the pull, not given as a wide
Hardik Pandya to Pretorius, 1 run, 122.1kph off-cutter outside off, Pretorius drives on the rise and picks out mid-off
Hardik Pandya to Phehlukwayo, 1 run, good length ball on off, Phehlukwayo angles it with an open bat face to backward point

Hardik Pandya to Miller, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! South Africa's finisher has been sent back. The finger roller from Pandya at 121.7kph and Miller clears his front leg to send it out of Mohali, beaten by the lack of pace and the ball goes on to hit top of middle-stump. The wheels are coming off this South Africa's innings. Miller b Hardik Pandya 18(15) [6s-1]

Chahar to Miller, 1 run, full toss on middle and leg, Miller chips it to deep mid-wicket. Another fine over from India's point of view. Just the 3 runs off it and the set batsman was also sent back. And Chahar also finishes a fine spell with that - 4-0-22-2

Chahar to Miller, no run, slower bouncer outside off, Miller waits and waits before he attempts a cross-batted swat into the off-side, but still cannot make the connection. That's how much he was deceived
Chahar to Pretorius, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Pretorius punches it to sweeper cover
Chahar to Miller, 1 run, 120kph short of length delivery and Miller steers it to third man
Chahar to Miller, no run, slower delivery that is dug into the surface, Miller is through the pull even before the ball has arrived and misses it altogether, struck on the inner thigh

Chahar to Bavuma, out Caught by Jadeja!! This was on the cards. Bavuma was put under pressure with a few dot balls and he needed a release shot, doesn't get it and perishes in the process. Slower delivery at 114.5kph and Bavuma looks to heave it to cow corner, cannot generate enough power and hands Jadeja an easy catch. South Africa won't mind this wicket as it will send in a more capable hitter at this stage of the innings. Bavuma c Jadeja b Chahar 49(43) [4s-3 6s-1]

Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, leg byes, 1 run, full toss and Bavuma has missed out there, it was on the leg-stump line and he is beaten for pace this time, can't connect with the flick and the ball deflects off the pad into the on-side. Just the 4 runs off the over and more importantly for India it is Bavuma on strike

Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, 2 runs, top effort by Jadeja near the boundary. He saved a brace there. Full toss outside off, Bavuma drives it along the ground wide of sweeper cover, Jadeja covers good amount of ground and then dives full length to make the stop, gets up quickly and releases the ball

Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, no run, three dots.. The pressure showing on Bavuma. Saini has the wood over him. Slower delivery and Bavuma wanted to scoop it to fine leg, deceived for pace and the ball lobs off the pad in front of Pant
Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, no run, full and close to yorker length, Bavuma digs it back to Saini
Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, no run, full toss and Saini gets away with it, Bavuma does not time the drive and picks out Sundar at extra cover
Navdeep Saini to Miller, 1 run, back of a length on off and middle, Miller ekes out an inside edge onto the pad and the ball rolls towards point
Washington Sundar to Miller, 1 run, the slider which skids on and almost goes through Miller's defences, he brings his bat down just in time and squirts an inside edge towards short fine leg

Washington Sundar to Miller, SIX, that should get Miller going. Sundar gives it a bit of air and Miller pounces on it, he had the width to free his arms and he lofts it inside out over extra cover. Goes all the way

Washington Sundar to Miller, 2 runs, nudged it with soft hands between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket, even though it was Jadeja hunting the ball down the batsmen were able to scamper back for the second
Washington Sundar to Bavuma, 1 run, spotted the batsman advance and fired it at his pads, clipped to deep mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Miller, 1 run, slower and a bit shorter in length, Miller nurdles it backward of square leg
Washington Sundar to Bavuma, 1 run, quicker delivery at 95.7kph, Bavuma works it away to long-on
Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, 1 run, off-speed delivery and Bavuma drives through the line to mid-off, just a single
Hardik Pandya to Miller, 1 run, short and at the body, Miller pulls it along the ground to fine leg
Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, 1 run, full on middle and leg, Bavuma flicks it uppishly and on the bounce to deep mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Miller, 1 run, back of a length on the hip, tucked away backward of square leg
Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, 1 run, another slower ball and Bavuma lofts it on the bounce to long-on

Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, no run, stifled appeal for LBW from Hardik. Umpire Shamshuddin is not interested. Slower delivery and Bavuma wants to slog it across the line with a bent knee, misses and is struck on the front flap. The impact might have been just outside off and height was also an issue
Krunal Pandya to Bavuma, 1 run, flatter and quicker, Bavuma tucks it in front of deep mid-wicket, where Kohli has moved after the previous ball
Krunal Pandya to Bavuma, 2 runs, drifting in with the angle and Bavuma works it with soft hands into the leg-side - right between deep mid-wicket and long-on, Chahar cannot prevent the second
Krunal Pandya to Bavuma, 2 runs, fraction short and outside off, Bavuma cracks the cut square of the wicket and Jadeja is not able to stop it with a dive near point, Iyer tidies up from sweeper cover
Krunal Pandya to Miller, 1 run, slower through the air and Miller nudges it to the vacant mid-wicket area

Krunal Pandya to Bavuma, 1 run, direct hit and Bavuma was gone. He chose the wrong fielder to take on. Dabbed it towards point and sets off, Jadeja swoops down and fires at the bowler's end, he didn't miss by much
Krunal Pandya to Bavuma, no run, 90.9kph delivery around off, Bavuma chops it in front of cover
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, 95.3kph flatter delivery outside off, Bavuma eases it to sweeper cover. Jadeja is done with the ball for the day. He finishes with figures - 4-0-31-1
Jadeja to Miller, 1 run, drifting away with the round the wicket angle and Miller dabs it behind square on the off-side
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, shade slower than his usual speed and Bavuma waits for it before working it through the mid-wicket region
Jadeja to Bavuma, FOUR, in the air and past a diving Kohli. Bit of air given outside off, Bavuma drives inside out and was not able to keep it down, Kohli flies to his left but it is out of his reach
Jadeja to Miller, 1 run, quicker and on off-stump, Miller eases it down to long-on and opens his account

Jadeja to van der Dussen, out Caught&Bowled!! Soft dismissal! Back to back wickets for India and they needed that after the 50+ stand for the second wicket. Darted in at 96.6kph on middle and the ball holds up a bit, van der Dussen prods forward and closes the bat face to work it into the leg-side, the leading edge balloons to the right of the bowler, Jadeja leaps across and takes it with both hands. van der Dussen c and b Jadeja 1(2)

Navdeep Saini to van der Dussen, 1 run, back of a length outside off, punched away to sweeper cover. A much better over from Saini, picked up the important wicket of de Kock and conceded only three runs
batsman_bowler: Navdeep Saini to van der Dussen

comm: Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, 1 run, straying on the legs and Bavuma inside edges the flick to fine leg
Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, no run, very full delivery around off, Bavuma jams it out towards backward point

Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, no run, full and attacking the stumps, Bavuma pushes off the inner half towards mid-wicket, van der Dussen was off for the single and had Sundar gathered the ball cleanly and hit the stumps at the bowler's end, van der Dussen was a goner

Navdeep Saini to de Kock, out Caught by Kohli!! Stunner! The Indian skipper has plucked out a specky. de Kock backs away and is cramped by a 141.2kph short of length delivery, he goes for the pull and splices it straight back over Saini, Kohli runs across from mid-off and then stretches both his hands to take the catch, but the best part comes next - the momentum was taking him to the ground and he ensures that the ball does not pop out. He loved it and lets out a fist pump in celebration. de Kock c Kohli b Navdeep Saini 52(37) [4s-8]
Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, 1 run, back of a length close to off, Bavuma knocks it into the off-side and crosses over
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, fuller and on off-stump, Bavuma nudges it through the open mid-wicket pocket
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, flatter and dragged back length, de Kock mistimes the pull to long-on

Jadeja to de Kock, FOUR, fifty for de Kock. First game as captain and he is leading from the front. He raises his bat and acknowledges the applause from his mates. On the shorter side and de Kock pulls it towards deep square leg, Sundar is not sure whether to go for the catch or stop the boundary, he goes for the catch and dives to his right but the ball lands in front of him and bounces into the rope
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, quicker and outside off, Bavuma eases the forward push to sweeper cover
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, fraction short in length and de Kock swipes it along the ground to long-on
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, drifting in with the angle and Bavuma wrists it away to long-on
Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, 1 run, 134.4kph, pitched up delivery, Bavuma push-drives it towards mid-off and keeps the strike. 14 off the over!
Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, FOUR, Pandya doesn't learn and digs another one short and wide. Slapped away over point by Bavuma. No chance for Shreyas Iyer to cut that off
Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, FOUR, slow, short and wide outside off. Bavuma hops and cuts it over backward point with ease. A couple of bounces and into the fence
Hardik Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, low full toss, drilled all along the carpet to the left of mid-off

Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, 3 runs, punched away to deep point. Shreyas Iyer fumbles and that allows the batters to take the second run. There's overthrows too at the bowler's end as Pandya wasn't standing near the sticks. Kohli is certainly not happy
Hardik Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, high full toss, a hopping de Kock bunts it to long-on. Chettithody Shamshuddin - the square leg ump - feels that the ball was dipping and hence not no-balled

Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, darted on the pads from round the wicket and de Kock clips it to deep square leg. The man in the deep does well to get to the ball quickly and keep the batters down to a single. Jadeja applauds
Jadeja to de Kock, FOUR, easily put away! Shortish ball on middle and leg, de Kock moves across and gets low before pulling it over backward square leg for a one-bounce four
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, Bavuma jogs down the track to wrist it to mid-wicket

Jadeja to de Kock, leg byes, 1 run, de Kock shapes up to reverse sweep and misses it completely. The ball rolls towards cover and the batters take a run on leg-byes. An optimistic appeal for lbw from Jadeja, the impact was well outside off and height was a factor going against the bowler too
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, 93.6kph, angled in on leg, clipped to deep mid-wicket
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, 97.9kph, shortish in-turner, de Kock crouches and pulls it powerfully to deep mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, no run, 119.9kph, slower ball bouncer and Bavuma does pick it. But, fails to make contact with his attempted upper-cut

Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, SIX, authoritative pull! Normal-paced short ball at 131.4, Bavuma sees that coming and gets into a good position. Picked the length early and pummelled the pull over deep square leg for a maximum. Got it off the meat of the bat
Hardik Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, 121.9kph, short ball down leg, de Kock swivels and pulls it to fine leg. Pandya is lucky to get away with that
Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, 1 run, 129.3kph, slower short ball, pulled off the inner edge in front of square on the leg-side

Hardik Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, sees the batsman back away and Pandya follows him with a length ball. de Kock gets an inside edge onto his pad with his attempted flick and the ball rolls into the off-side
Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, 1 run, 135.3kph, dug in short, the line is wide of off, Bavuma rides the bounce with a hop and stabs it to sweeper cover
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, 97kph, doesn't turn and ends up on leg, Bavuma is happy to work it in front of square on the on-side for a single
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, 95.7kph, very full ball and de Kock drills it to long-on after clearing his front leg
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, 94.9kph, flat and full on the stumps, knocked down to long-on
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, 97.8kph, darted in marginally outside off, de Kock moves back and across to tuck it with the spin to backward square leg
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, 95.4kph, angled in from round the wicket, worked through mid-wicket off the front foot and the South Africans have to settle for a single
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, hint of in-turn on this shortish ball, scythed away to deep cover

Chahar to Bavuma, no run, back of a length delivery, Bavuma walks forward and across to jab it to mid-wicket. Couldn't find the gap and there's a shy at the bowler's end. de Kock was anyway in and the fielder missed the target too

Chahar to de Kock, 1 run, 121.8kph, bowled into the surface from a short of length and de Kock is early into his shot. The bottom hand comes off the handle and the batter manages to drag it towards mid-on
Chahar to de Kock, no run, 118.9kph, fullish ball, a backing away de Kock square-drives off the middle of the bat. Dhawan dives to his left at point to make a good stop

Chahar to de Kock, FOUR, half-volley at 133kph, de Kock makes room by moving leg-side and thrashes it through extra cover. That was struck very hard by the South African captain and more importantly he found the gap

Chahar to de Kock, no run, 120.9kph, another slower ball, on a good length and de Kock moves leg-side to force through the off-side. Gets an under edge that eludes the sticks and moves towards the keeper

Chahar to de Kock, 2 runs, 113.7kph, off-pace ball from a back of a length, de Kock backs away to pull and gets the timing wrong. Gets a top-edge that flies over Kohli at mid-on. The Indian skipper runs back and hunts it down

Washington Sundar to Bavuma, no run, 95.4kph, non-turner around the fifth stump channel and Bavuma wants to work it through the on-side, gets a leading edge that takes the ball to short third man. A tight over from the 19-year-old. Just one run off it
Washington Sundar to de Kock, 1 run, 99kph, de Kock waits for this length ball on the back foot and turns it towards mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run, 95.8kph, de Kock premeditatively shimmies down and yorks himself in the process. Dug out hurriedly
Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run, 92.7kph, width served outside off, de Kock gets down on a knee to cut, finds the fielder at point
Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run, 97kph, stump-to-stump line, blocked back to the bowler
Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run, 95.1kph, fullish ball angling in on middle, defensively pushed to the right of the bowler
Chahar to Bavuma, no run, with a slip in place, Chahar darts length ball just outside off and Bavuma taps it into the off-side

Chahar to R Hendricks, out Caught by Washington Sundar!! Chipped straight to mid-on! Fuller than a good length ball at 136.2kph, Hendricks decides to play an aerial shot downtown. But, the bat turned at the point of impact and hence robbed all his timing. The ball balloons up off the bottom part of the bat and Sundar gets a sitter at mid-on. Hendricks probably wanted to thrash it over the bowler's head, ended up throwing his wicket away. R Hendricks c Washington Sundar b Chahar 6(11) [4s-1]
Chahar to de Kock, 1 run, 136.5kph, loads of width outside off and de Kock cuts it to the right of cover for a single
