Chahar to R Hendricks, 1 run, 134.7kph, length ball on the sticks, Hendricks pats it in front of mid-on with a closed bat-face and hares to the other end
Chahar to de Kock, 1 run, 117.5kph, slower ball, but Chahar over-corrects with his line. Leg-stump line and de Kock whips it away to deep mid-wicket. Just a single, though
Chahar to de Kock, FOUR, you keep offering width and he'll keep punishing you. Good length ball well outside off at 135.2kph, de Kock bends his left leg and scythes it fiercely through point

Navdeep Saini to R Hendricks, no run, beaten! A skiddy, short of length delivery at 144.3kph and Hendricks is beaten for pace as he tries to play a cross-batted stroke through the off-side. The ball zips off the surface and goes past the inside edge
Navdeep Saini to de Kock, 1 run, 145.6kph, shortened length and that's been dabbed down to third man
Navdeep Saini to de Kock, no run, Saini is lucky to get away with this wide-ish half-volley at 145.3kph. de Kock droves it sweetly off the front foot, but straight to extra cover

Navdeep Saini to de Kock, FOUR, make that three in a row! Slightly too full and slightly too straight. A fullish ball on middle and leg at 146.2kph, de Kock nonchalantly flicks it away through mid-wicket

Navdeep Saini to de Kock, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries! Saini goes fuller at 145.1kph, de Kock slightly opens his bat-face at the point of impact and drives it through extra cover, beating mid-off to his right

Navdeep Saini to de Kock, FOUR, edged and four! Saini starts with a fullish ball wide of off at 144.5kph, de Kock stays leg-side of the ball and throws his bat for a flashy drive. Gets a fat outside edge and comfortably beats first slip. Third man was too square and hence couldn't cut it off
Chahar to R Hendricks, no run, 134.3kph, Chahar pitches it up on this occasion and Hendricks meets it off the front foot to drive it along the carpet, finds mid-off

Chahar to R Hendricks, no run, 134.2kph, Chahar shortens his length by a fraction, nips futher away and Hendricks chases with hard hands for a booming drive sans any feet movement. Whizzes past the outside edge
Chahar to R Hendricks, FOUR, ah! Two superb balls and Chahar sprays one on the pads. Easy pickings for Hendricks who stands tall and flicks it away to the long leg fence

Chahar to R Hendricks, no run, lovely delivery! Another outswinger, that nips further away off the deck and Hendricks pokes to get beaten on the outside edge. That was mighty close to the outside edge
Chahar to R Hendricks, no run, 129.4kph, good length, seam-up ball that swings away. A squared up Hendricks gets a soft leading edge that rolls to cover
Chahar to de Kock, 1 run, 130.9kph, short of length delivery with width on offer, de Kock fails to find the gap with his back-footed chop. Finds extra cover and has to settle with a single
Washington Sundar to R Hendricks, no run, Sundar gets away with this bad ball! Strayed on the pads and Hendricks wrists it straight to the man at backward square leg
Washington Sundar to de Kock, 1 run, pushed through fuller, attacking the sticks, de Kock stays leg-side of the ball and eases the drive to long-off
Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run, width dished again, de Kock hangs back to cut, ends up miscuing the chop to cover off the under edge
Washington Sundar to de Kock, FOUR, Quinton de Kock gets off the mark in style! Fullish, flat ball wide of off, de Kock crouches low and spanks it through the covers with a bent back leg
Washington Sundar to R Hendricks, 1 run, 93.9kph, fuller and straighter, strayed on the pads and Hendricks works it through square leg to get off the mark
Washington Sundar to R Hendricks, no run, starts from over the wicket, a 99.2kph flat ball on middle and leg, Hendricks knocks to mid-wicket
Fortuin to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, full and straight, drilled past the diving long-on fielder and that's it, curtains! India start their home season with an emphatic 7-wicket win over the Proteas
Fortuin to Kohli, 1 run, nudged away to mid-wicket, over to you Iyer says VK

Fortuin to Kohli, SIX, Kohli is just having a net out there. Ah, the ease at which he plays such shots. Skips out of his crease, doesn't get anywhere close to the pitch of the delivery but such is his hand-eye co-ordination that he marmalizes it for a 94-metre maximum over long-on
Fortuin to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, full and fast on leg-stump, Iyer gets a thick inside edge on the flick to short fine
Fortuin to Kohli, 1 run, curving into the pads once again, Kohli prefers to stay back and drags the pull in the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on
Fortuin to Kohli, no run, slow and sliding into the batsman, Kohli runs down the pitch and checks his drive back to the bowler
Rabada to Shreyas Iyer, no run, Iyer tries to do something cheeky, no dice. Opens up his stance and tries to ramp a 138ks short ball outside off, was late on the shot and missed it by some distance
Rabada to Shreyas Iyer, no run, short of length around fifth stump at 142ks, Iyer steers with an open face to backward point
Rabada to Kohli, 1 run, pacy short ball outside off, Kohli swivels and pulls to deep square
Rabada to Kohli, no run, back of a length outside off stump, punched into the covers
Rabada to Kohli, no run, slower ball on the stumps, Kohli tries to flick and cannot get it past the fielder at mid-wicket

Rabada to Kohli, SIX, look away Kagiso Rabada, look away fast bowlers! Clearly not the sight you would want to watch when you steam in and bowl a 141ks delivery on the stumps. Kohli just stays back, picks it nonchalantly off the pads and whiplashes it into the crowd over backward square
Phehlukwayo to Kohli, 1 run, picks the slower ball early, tucks it off his pads to deep square and he wants two.... Shreyas Iyer turns his back and the Indian captain is not happy one bit
Phehlukwayo to Kohli, no run, wobble seam full delivery outside off, Kohli leans into a drive and picks out the fielder at extra cover
Phehlukwayo to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slower short ball wide of off, Iyer opens the bat face and steers it square of third man
Phehlukwayo to Kohli, 1 run, slower delivery on the stumps, Kohli tucks this wide of long-on
Phehlukwayo to Kohli, FOUR, plenty of width outside off, Kohli slashes hard and slots it in the gap behind point. No-one in the deep and that's back-to-back boundaries for Virat Kohli

Phehlukwayo to Kohli, FOUR, 22nd T20I fifty for the Indian skipper. Races down the pitch, converts Phehlukwayo's attempted cutter into a full delivery and smashes it through covers. The fielder.....fielder....can't get there
Fortuin to Kohli, 1 run, no room on offer, Kohli biffs the drive to deep mid-off
Fortuin to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, uses his feet and mistimes the drive back to the bowler, a half-stop from Fortuin means an easy yet late single for the duo
Fortuin to Shreyas Iyer, no run, sticks with the same length, Iyer's flick finds mid-wicket
Fortuin to Kohli, 1 run, full again and Kohli's drilled this past the diving right hand of the bowler
Fortuin to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, saunters down the pitch and works this full delivery wide of long-on
Fortuin to Kohli, 1 run, very full and attacking the stumps, Kohli squeezes the drive down to long-on
Anrich Nortje to Shreyas Iyer, no run, bouncer on the stumps, Iyer ducks under it
Anrich Nortje to Kohli, 1 run, hangs back and hooks the short of length delivery to deep backward square
Anrich Nortje to Kohli, 2 runs, class! Kohli just betters Shreyas Iyer's shot off the first ball. Just a hint of feet movement and all hands on the drive through covers, easy two to deep extra cover
Anrich Nortje to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, gets the timing right this time around, a late cut square of third man

Anrich Nortje to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, was this deliberate? Nope. Shreyas Iyer wanted to pounce on the width on offer and opens the bat face quite late trying to steer it fine. The edge flies off the toe-edge and escapes past QDK's dive to his right

Anrich Nortje to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, what is it with Mumbaikars and drives? Shreyas Iyer does not do anything extraordinary, just follows the simple basics: Watch ball hit ball. Spotted the full length early and just leant into the drive with minimal power, all grace through covers....
Fortuin to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, tossed full outside off, Iyer leans across and gets off the mark with a drive to long-off
Fortuin to Shreyas Iyer, no run, full at the stumps, Iyer flicks and finds mid-wicket

Fortuin to Pant, out Caught by Shamsi!! Just Rishabh Pant things. The batting coach, Vikram Rathour, picks up his pen and I'm sure that's not the end of it as Pant heads back to the dressing room. Was a horrible drag down from Bjorn Fortuin, Pant could have gone to a movie, had a popcorn and still would have had the time to pick his spot and shot. Instead he trips over due to lack of pace and hacks it off the splice straight down the throat of Shamsi at short fine. Pant c Shamsi b Fortuin 4(5)
Fortuin to Pant, 2 runs, flatter and fuller on middle and leg, knocked away into the gap at mid-wicket and the Delhi duo pinch a quick couple of runs
Fortuin to Kohli, 1 run, slider on the pads, wristed away to square leg for a yawning single
Fortuin to Kohli, no run, tosses it full just outside off, Kohli drives firmly but cannot hit the gap on the off-side, straight to short cover
Anrich Nortje to Kohli, 1 run, yorker length delivery outside off, squeezed away towards point
Anrich Nortje to Pant, leg byes, 1 run, keeps it short and angles it on the pads, Pant fails to get bat on the leg-glance and it dribbles towards the keeper off the thigh pad
Anrich Nortje to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length on the stumps, Kohli mistimes the pull through mid-wicket. Was a tad early into the shot and hence couldn't find the desired timing on that

Anrich Nortje to Pant, 1 run, nudges the slower ball to mid-wicket and a direct hit at the bowling end would have been curtains for Pant. Bavuma was the fielder and he is disappointed with himself for missing the target
Anrich Nortje to Kohli, 1 run, gets ample width outside off, Kohli opens the bat face and steers it past the diving left hand of backward point
Anrich Nortje to Kohli, no run, back of a length outside off stump, Kohli checks his punch and its been intercepted by a diving fielder at cover
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, eases this down to long-on and keeps the strike does the Indian skipper
Shamsi to Pant, 1 run, full floater on the stumps, Pant is off the mark with a push down to long-on

Shamsi to Dhawan, out Caught by Miller!! Dhawan has a wry smile and to be fair, that is all he can afford. Even Kohli can't believe what he just saw, just stares in amazement. It's that brilliant, the catch from Killer Miller. Dhawan came down the pitch in a bid to go big straight down the ground, gets too close to the pitch of the delivery and drags the slog off the cue end of the bat. It seemed to be heading for a one-bounce boundary until Miller (from long-on) decided to flung himself to his right and pluck the cherry out of thin air while tumbling across to his right. This might well end up as the catch of the tournament? Time will tell. Dhawan c Miller b Shamsi 40(31) [4s-4 6s-1]
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, full on middle, flicked away wide of mid-wicket
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, full on off-stump, Dhawan leans on his front foot and pushes the drive wide of long-off
Shamsi to Kohli, 3 runs, flat and drifting into leg-stump, a neat flick away off the pads square on the leg-side. Bavuma does well to put in a diving effort in the deep to prevent the boundary
Fortuin to Dhawan, SIX, cannot bowl there to Gabbar! Full toss up right in the slogging slot and Dhawan has deposited it into the cow corner stands with a mighty slogsweep
Fortuin to Dhawan, no run, slower and drifting in outside off, tapped to backward point
Fortuin to Kohli, 1 run, quicker delivery outside off, punched to long-off
Fortuin to Dhawan, 1 run, sees SD skipping down the pitch and shortens his length on leg-stump, Dhawan looks to hack into the leg-side and manages a tiny inside edge to point
Fortuin to Kohli, 1 run, flat and fast outside off, Kohli loses the grip off his bottom hand as he slaps this to sweeper cover
Fortuin to Dhawan, 1 run, quicker and sliding into the pads, Dhawan jumps on his back foot and whips it through mid-wicket. Easy single
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, plonks the front leg inside the line, freeing up his arms in a one-kneed-drive to long-off. This is now Dhawan's highest score in eight T20I innings
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, leans out for a cover drive turned slog turned flick -- only down the pitch, helped by Shamsi's misfield to long-off
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, a checked wrist, softly flicking it down the ground
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, tosses it up fuller. Kohli presses, covers, taps through the line to long-off
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, gently nudged away with the angle, in front of square
Shamsi to Dhawan, wide, threatens to step away from his stumps. It's justa threat. But Shamsi, fooled, fires it down leg
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, short, spinning in, heaved away to deep mid-wicket
Pretorius to Kohli, 1 run, 130.9kph, full, on off, the bottom-handed-wrist, deep mid-wicket
Pretorius to Kohli, 2 runs, 126kph, full, makes him stretch away from his body as he creams it through mid-off, with long-off really straight to keep these to singles
Pretorius to Dhawan, 1 run, a defensive cramping line on the pads. Clipped away round the corner
Pretorius to Dhawan, FOUR, and Dhawan will up his batting elegance. It's pitched up in his slot, and he clears his front leg to smoke it straight down, one-bounced and in
Pretorius to Kohli, 1 run, delicately opens up his bat face, poking it in front of point for a quick single
Pretorius to Kohli, SIX, 130.4kph, gives it the charge, steps away, and then it's deliciously inside-out in the loft over extra cover. It. Cannot. Get. More. Beautiful
Shamsi to Dhawan, no run, a touch quicker on middle. Dhawan gets out a stride to the pitch of it, smothering then down the pitch
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, leans out now, head-on-ball in the flick, long-on
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, flat on middle. Back-footed, knocked, long-on
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, quickly a one-kneed-slog. Doesn't connect neatly though, dragging off the inside half to cow corner
Shamsi to Dhawan, 1 run, back, away, punched through the line to long-off
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, short, wide, slapped away easily through sweeper

Pretorius to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, missed a certain run-out. So Kohli looks to flick, is undone by the slower one as it merely ricochets onto the pitch off his pads. But, but, Dhawan's already committed to this quick single, surely one that doesn't even exist, but a running Pretorius in his natural followthrough just can't palm it onto the stumps
Pretorius to Dhawan, 1 run, 112.2kph, walks across, goes back in deep. And then punches away through extra cover
Pretorius to Kohli, 1 run, another flick, this time gets it down to deep square leg
Pretorius to Kohli, no run, walks across, gets behind the fourth-stump-line to flick, but can't get it past square leg
Pretorius to Dhawan, 1 run, 131.5kph, a slight backing away. Pretorius spots, follows Dhawan in - and a cramped tuck it is, mid-wicket
Pretorius to Kohli, 1 run, 129kph, length, middle-lined. A checked straight batted push, down the ground
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, no run, 107.6kph, another neat change-up. Dhawan - early in his hoick - will only manage an inside-half, straight to mid-wicket
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, no run, lines up in front, pushing it away, away from his body, cover
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, wide, short, but down leg. And Dhawan isn't bothered
Phehlukwayo to Kohli, 1 run, strays into the hips, glanced away behind square

Phehlukwayo to Kohli, no run, SA review a caught-behind. So Phehlukwayo's brought out this peach to cut Kohli in half, beating him in defence, appealing for a thin inside edge through to the keeper. Okay, there clearly is a sound. Alas, UltraEdge tells us it is off the ball clipping the top of the back pad. And more alas, it's umpire's call on the LBW too, with perhaps 51% of the ball not-hitting the top of middle
Phehlukwayo to Kohli, no run, opens his bat face a touch, running it down to third man

Phehlukwayo to Kohli, FOUR, there's something about Kohli, cover drives, teams in yellow-green jerseys, run-chases and Mohali. It's a 2016 rewind, leaning through the line and then executing just the perfect cover punches
Pretorius to Dhawan, no run, 102.2kph, knuckle ball into the pitch, takes some timing off Dhawan's cut, and he ends up dragging it to cover instead
Pretorius to Kohli, 1 run, a tad too straight - glanced away, round the corner
Pretorius to Kohli, FOUR, 126.6kph. Oooh. A smash of class all over this. Really full, but Kohli steals it with his walking shuffle, to then end up whipping it away through cow corner
Pretorius to Kohli, no run, 127.4kph, checked wrists, quietly nudging it away to leg after his early shuffle
Pretorius to Kohli, 2 runs, 129.8kph, a hopping tuck, off the hips, square leg again
Pretorius to Dhawan, 1 run, fullish, middle-lined. Quite a hoick this, round the corner
Phehlukwayo to Kohli, no run, 132.6kph, attempted flick, but again, Kohli even without having faced Rabada and Nortje is early into this, leading-edging it out towards point

Phehlukwayo to Rohit, out Lbw!! Again. It's all about bowling in partnerships that sets Rohit up here -- with Rabada and Nortje coming at him at over 145 clicks, before Phehlukwayo turning up turns into the proper sucker ball. It's full, and Sharma's whip is all around it, getting struck plumb on the crouched back pad in front of middle. Rohit lbw b Phehlukwayo 12(12) [6s-2]
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, 1 run, length, fifth-stumped, tapped away into the covers

Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, 2 runs, 132.1kph, Swivels, whips, and once again, it's that man Nortje, poor old Nortje, doing his best at deep square leg. And he tries to make it quite obvious that he isn't touching the ball, the ball trickling away onto his boots while the knee is a millimeter inside
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, no run, steps down, adjusting, stabbing away to point
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, no run, 130.7kph, and the 20kph difference means that Dhawan's a week early in his shot, alreafy through it before the ball sneaks under, and just over off
Rabada to Rohit, no run, 145.8kph, checks his defence, wristing it away to mid-on
Rabada to Rohit, no run, 141.9kph, half forward, sticking out a forward defence to mid-on
Rabada to Dhawan, 1 run, 144.5kph, arches behind, dabbing it off his tummy, to a now-deep third man
Rabada to Dhawan, no run, another attempted late chop - but no, he's a little too late here

Rabada to Dhawan, FOUR, 145.2kph, this one's angling further across. Third man's in the circle, Dhawan tries running it between him and point, but then has a thick toe-end to help, running it really fine through the empty cordon
Rabada to Dhawan, FOUR, feeds an overcook outside off. And at 146.5kph. Sliced. Easily. On the up. To extra cover's left. To mid-off's right
Anrich Nortje to Rohit, no run, 146.8kph, pitches it up on off. A neat crisp drive through the line, mid-on
Anrich Nortje to Rohit, SIX, 145.7kph, cross-seam, and another juicy drag down. Rohit does the usual -- fetches off his tummy, and into his pet deep square leg
Anrich Nortje to Rohit, no run, tighter. Back of a length, off-lined, dead bat

Anrich Nortje to Rohit, SIX, 140.6kph. Now, now, Sharma's superimposing himself typically. It starts with a shuffle, picks up the short of length sitter early, and cross-bats his pull deep over square leg
Anrich Nortje to Rohit, no run, 148.9kph, beats the cut. Sharma shuffles, cuts, and clearly he's late with the ball skidding under
Anrich Nortje to Dhawan, 1 run, 147.1kph .. and it's his first ball for heaven's sake. Short, wide, carved away fine to third man
Rabada to Rohit, no run, 146kph, forward, closing out the line, bat-in-front-of-pad, blocking
Rabada to Dhawan, 1 run, a rock behind now, letting the ball get close and cut it straight to third man

Rabada to Dhawan, FOUR, 141.5kph. An absolute no-feet-whack. It was quite close to be chopping, but Dhawan then rocks in front and times it well, really well over point. Nortje, from third man, tries tumbling down there, but he's just touched the cushions while throwing it back
Rabada to Rohit, 2 wides, 144.4kph, sharp swing, but all of it's wasted down leg. So much so that even Quinton will struggle to keep it out cleanly
Rabada to Rohit, no run, 147.3kph, more of a fuller faced block, leaning in through the line, tapping away to cover
Rabada to Rohit, no run, 144.2kph, length, middle-lined. Respect, lots of it, in a forward defence
Rabada to Rohit, no run, small LBW appeal. Seaming in off a length, hurrying past Sharma's defence to pin him on the front pad. Alas, this angle ..

Bumrah to K Pierre, FOUR, edged and four! Windies will take it. Yet another teasing slower ball wide of off and Pierre is again early to throw his bat at it. The ball flies off the thick outside edge. Hits one of the practice pitches and runs away
Bumrah to K Pierre, no run, third dot of the over - courtesy another dot. Was a slower ball and was angled away from the left-hander, Pierre swings and misses
Bumrah to K Paul, 1 run, normal-paced yorker length ball, helicopter-flick to long-on
Bumrah to K Paul, no run, oh! That was mighty close to the off-stump. Another off-speed delivery, drifted in and Paul got down on a knee to heave across the line. Misses
Bumrah to K Paul, no run, Bumrah bamboozles the batsman with a slower ball. Paul stepped down the track and swung his bat hard, no contact made
Bumrah to K Pierre, 1 run, full ball on leg, squirted towards mid-wicket and they go for a quick single. The throw at the bowler's end was way off target
U Yadav to K Paul, FOUR, poor ball and gets the treatment it deserved. Leg-stump full toss and Paul flicks it behind square with ease. Windies go past 100

U Yadav to K Paul, FOUR, wow! Where did this come from? A 141kph short ball, Paul is well equipped to get put it away past the boundary rope with a superbly executed pull shot. Got it off the meat. One bounce and into the deep square leg fence
U Yadav to K Paul, 2 runs, very full and Paul drills it back towards the bowler who was ducking for cover. Umesh managed to get a hand on it and ended up parrying it towards long-off
U Yadav to K Pierre, leg byes, 1 run, straighter line at 139kph, Pierre walks across to nudge it to fine leg
U Yadav to K Pierre, FOUR, 138kph, angling away outside off, Pierre sticks his bat out and gets a thick outside edge that comfortably beats DK and races away to the fence
U Yadav to K Paul, 1 run, low full toss, the batsman clears his front leg and smashes it to long-on

Khaleel Ahmed to Fabian Allen, out Caught by U Yadav!! Khaleel Ahmed has his man and therefore his first T20I wicket. Another off-pace delivery, Fabian Allen probably picked that as he stayed back to pull. Doesn't get the required elevation and ends up spooning it straight to Umesh at deep mid-wicket. A lollipop of a catch. Khaleel's figures on debut - 4-1-16-1. Fabian Allen c U Yadav b Khaleel Ahmed 27(20) [4s-4]
Khaleel Ahmed to Fabian Allen, no run, Allen walks down and in the process moves leg-side. Khaleel Ahmed saw that and shortened his length outside off. The batter can't make it contact
Khaleel Ahmed to Fabian Allen, FOUR, edged and four! Allen is beaten by the lack of pace as he is early to swing his bat across the line, the fat edge takes it fine of short third man
Khaleel Ahmed to K Paul, 1 run, slow and on the shorter side, Paul rocks back to get into a good position and nails the pull shot. But, that was hit straight to deep mid-wicket

Khaleel Ahmed to Fabian Allen, 1 run, another slower delivery, from a short of length, Allen tries another heave. Manages just an inside edge that deflected onto his body. The ball dies down on the off-side
Khaleel Ahmed to Fabian Allen, no run, off-speed delivery at 106kph, Allen doesn't pick it. Comes way down the track to heave across the line, misses
Bumrah to Fabian Allen, 1 run, another one that's in the yorker length and Allen can't get underneath it. Manages to squeeze it between his legs off the inside half. A single to fine leg
Bumrah to K Paul, 1 run, another one in the blockhole, jammed towards mid-on, just a single
Bumrah to K Paul, no run, muted appeal for lbw, going down with the angle. Yorker length and Paul was late to bring his bat down

Bumrah to Fabian Allen, 3 runs, very full ball on the stumps, Allen stays leg-side of the ball and drills it downtown. Manish Pandey at long-on sprints across, puts in the dive and flicks the ball back into play. With mid-off inside the circle, Pandey had to get up and let go of the ball. Three runs to the tally

Bumrah to Fabian Allen, 2 runs, another miscue, this time off the top edge as Allen attempts a pull shot to this back of a length delivery outside off. Went up a long way, but falls in the no-man's land around the mid-on region

Bumrah to Fabian Allen, FOUR, back of a length delivery at 134kph, Fabian Allen is slightly early into his heave as he fetches it from outside off. Manages to get decent connection and KL Rahul running across from deep mid-wicket can't get there in time
U Yadav to Fabian Allen, 1 run, clears his leg and thumps it straight down
U Yadav to Fabian Allen, no run, 137kph. Another yorker, this time not all that far from the base of off. Allen desperate swing can't get any ball on it
U Yadav to K Paul, 1 run, 142kph, wide yorker. Paul manages to get some bat on his squeeze, getting it to a fairly deep point
U Yadav to K Paul, no run, 136kph, a back of a length one outside off. Slapped, off the inside half into the on-side
U Yadav to Fabian Allen, 1 run, keeps the slog down this time, long-on

U Yadav to Fabian Allen, FOUR, could've been another, should've been another. Allen backs away and goes for a big heave-ho down the ground. The bat face turns, he miscues and KL Rahul runs in for the skier, before realizing the ball is dipping well behind him. Tries to adjust, but can only spoon it away into the fence

Kuldeep Yadav to K Paul, no run, some redemption for the Windies - India waste a review. Yadav foxes Paul with the googly, pins him on the pad too, and despite his over the wicket angle, convinces Rohit to go upstairs by telling him there is no bat involved. Rohit agrees, they review and the ball-tracking shows the ball to be pitching well down leg . Take nothing away though, it's been a top spell: 4-0-13-3

Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, out Lbw!! Trapped plumb in front. Well, well. Brathwaite wants a review, but Allen isn't allowing him one here. So he went back in the crease to look to tuck it through square leg, but in the process freezes in front of his stumps and the second line of defence after the ball goes past the bat doesn't do him any good - it's in front of middle. Brathwaite lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 4(11)
Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, no run, shuffles, behind, to defend
Kuldeep Yadav to Fabian Allen, 1 run, tries going inside-out against the spin, but the inside-edge takes it through mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Fabian Allen, no run, goes for a big sweep, doesn't connect
Kuldeep Yadav to Fabian Allen, FOUR, on the move down, close to the pitch of it, freeing up his hands and tonking it into long-on. This should help
Krunal Pandya to Fabian Allen, 1 run, once again, one more batsman doesn't read the spin, merely squirting it to mid-wicket. And Krunal has bowled out, perfectly
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, 1 run, a soft guide, straight to point and Brathwaite doesn't want any of the strike -- scampers, nearly selling himself down the river
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, squeezed out off the toe-end to point
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, behind the line with his shuffle, knocking it to short mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, slow. Gripping, turning, everything. Brathwaite wafts
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, attempts a lapped sweep from outside off, misses and gets it to lob up off the thigh pad
Kuldeep Yadav to Fabian Allen, no run, squared up. Looks to play at the turn, somehow. Misses everything
Kuldeep Yadav to Fabian Allen, no run, wrong 'un. Allen stays back, opens his bat face very late and dabs it to point
Kuldeep Yadav to Fabian Allen, no run, another floater across, spinning conventionally back in as Allen keeps it out off the back foot

Kuldeep Yadav to Powell, out Caught by Karthik!! Another googly, another misread, but this time an edge as well. Yadav floats it up generously, with the line drifting to get Powell driving as well. He obliges, inside it eventually and gets the tickle. In fact, Powell has also brushed his shoe on the drive, which could have well been the noise. Yup, there's no edge. But then again, why's there DRS? Powell c Karthik b Kuldeep Yadav 4(13)
Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, leg byes, 1 run, shuffles a little too much and tucks all around it. But, the ricochet off the legs has enough to run it behind square
Kuldeep Yadav to Powell, 1 run, top-edges a sweep .. nowhere in control, but somehow gets it to land safely in front of deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Powell, 1 run, backs away, slicing it away through sweeper

Krunal Pandya to Powell, no run, and another. Five dots, each one of them getting quicker than the one earlier, each one of them cramping Powell for room as he ends up going deep in the crease to defend
Krunal Pandya to Powell, no run, dart, back, block. Heard this before?
Krunal Pandya to Powell, no run, pushes him on the back foot with the length and the dart that keeps coming in. An eventual cramp out
Krunal Pandya to Powell, no run, a hurried trigger, forward, back, across and defends
Krunal Pandya to Powell, no run, fuller, on the stumps, blocked
Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, 2 runs, squeezed out backward of point. Khaleel and Umesh chase, nearly running into each other

Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, no run, another googly, and this time Brathwaite surely doesn't read .. not one bit of it. Presses forward in defence, as Yadav's ripper drifts away first, and spins further away past the edge
Kuldeep Yadav to Powell, 1 run, spots the googly, or maybe doesn't. But does well in getting outside the line and nailing the sweep behind square
Kuldeep Yadav to Powell, no run, front of the hand stuff. Kept out
Kuldeep Yadav to Brathwaite, 1 run, a hint of late tail back in as it slides into the legs. Turned away watchfully, mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Darren Bravo, out Caught by Dhawan!! This is falling rather quickly. The only way most of the Windies know to break shackes is to smoke one out, so Darren Bravo keeps up with the trend -- clears his leg and looks to tonk it over long-on. Miscues. And Dhawan, runs across, covers good ground and takes is airborne-sideways after appearing to have lost it in the backdrop of the crowd. Darren Bravo c Dhawan b Kuldeep Yadav 5(10)
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, 1 run, 97kph, spinning into the legs. Nurdled round the corner
Krunal Pandya to Powell, 1 run, 104kph, glides deep in the crease, wristing it down to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Powell, no run, dabbed away, angle-batted to short third man
Krunal Pandya to Powell, no run, forward in defence in looking to play for the turn, but when there's none, you only inside-edge it to mid-wicket

Krunal Pandya to Pollard, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! He goes quicker, 102kph now, Pollard can't stand defending him any more. So he goes to launch him downtown. But, but, the trajectory and the pace just don't allow him to get under, eventually holing out off the inside-half in the chip right down long-on's throat. Krunal sends off a flying kiss, some nice franchise love. Pollard c Manish Pandey b Krunal Pandya 14(26) [6s-1]
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, no run, full, flat. Pollard flicks all around it, missing eventually .. but with the drift always going down leg, the appeal doesn't stand
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, 1 run, damn soft wrists, tickling the leg-line further into leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, 108kph. It's a medium pacer, cross-seamed from the front of the hand. So it's back of a length on the tummy. Defended
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, 80kph, flights it across to land up on middle. Wristed back down the pitch
Kuldeep Yadav to Darren Bravo, 1 run, presses low, reaching to the pitch go it to pat it with the spin in front of point for a quick single
Kuldeep Yadav to Darren Bravo, no run, pitched up on off. Squeezy drive, cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, 1 run, loads of loop. So much so that it doesn't even pitch. Pollard controls his surprise, knocking it down to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, no run, risky from Bravo, was looking to play with the angled bat to one that slid across him, gets beaten on the outside edge
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, tossed up on Pollard's pads, worked in front of square on the on-side for a single
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, no run, much better from Krunal, pulls his length back and gets the ball to turn across the right-hander, opened up Pollard slightly as he defended, squirted to the off-side
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, SIX, that's so easy for the big man, gets underneath the well flighted delivery, uses his reach to good effect and lifts it nonchalantly over long-on for a maximum
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, wide, Krunal fires this one down the leg-side, back-to-back wides called
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, wide, slower and sliding down the leg-side, Pollard was looking to nudge and missed, called as a wide
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, no run, flighted just outside off, Pollard stays behind the line and pushes it to the off-side
Krunal Pandya to Darren Bravo, 1 run, tossed up on the leg-stump line, nudged behind square on the on-side for a single
Bumrah to Pollard, no run, short of a good length and angling back into the right-hander, defended back at the bowler
Bumrah to Darren Bravo, 1 run, banged in short and at Bravo's body, he was hopping across on the tuck and is beaten for pace, off the inside edge and towards square leg for a single
Bumrah to Darren Bravo, no run, on a good length and angling across the left-hander, Bravo was playing for the original line as he pushed forward, gets neaten as the ball slanted away

Bumrah to Pollard, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Pollard stands tall and punches it in front of mid-off, calls his partner for a quick single, then hesitates and then continues to run. Umesh with the throw and he misses, wouldn't have mattered though, Pollard was well home
Bumrah to Pollard, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, defended towards backward point
Bumrah to Darren Bravo, 1 run, on a good length and well outside off, Bravo leans across and pushes it into the gap past cover-point for a single

Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, short of a length and angling across the right-hander, might have held up a little on the pitch, Pollard makes the late adjustment and then drops it towards the off-side
Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, tad fuller and well outside off, Pollard went hard on the drive, didn't get hold of the shot and found mid-off - on the bounce
Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Pollard gets well forward and pushes it to the off-side

Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, that's a snorter, extra bounce from a length and Pollard was taken by surprise, was pressing forward and manages to play with soft hands, rolled in front of backward point
Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Pollard gets well forward and defends it towards the off-side

Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, 2 runs, fuller length delivery and at the stumps, Pollard was late in getting his bat down, ekes out an inside edge past Umesh at short fine, a long chase for the pacer and he saves the boundary with a tumble

Bumrah to Darren Bravo, no run, lovely delivery, Bumrah shortened his length and got it to keep going across the left-hander, drew Bravo half-forward and squared him up by the late shape, beaten on the outside edge
Bumrah to Pollard, 1 run, on a good length and on the stumps, Pollard prodded half-forward and got an inside edge towards mid-on, calls his partner across for a quick single

Bumrah to Hetmyer, out Caught by Karthik!! Hetmyer lived by the sword, he falls by it. A nothing shot really, backed away to a short ball, doesn't gauge the bounce, it got too big on him and all he managed was a massive top-edge on the pull, into the night sky near backward square leg, DK called for the catch, ran across to his right and completed it with ease. Hetmyer had a role to play in Hope's dismissal, he now falls himself and West Indies are in early trouble. Hetmyer c Karthik b Bumrah 10(7) [4s-2]

Bumrah to Hetmyer, FOUR, that's sheer timing from Hetmyer, he seemed to be cramped for room on the flick, managed to get decent bat on that and placed it into the gap wide of mid-wicket, kept teasing Umesh as he chased, only to come second best
Bumrah to Pollard, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Pollard takes a couple of steps down the track and tucks it past square leg for a single
Bumrah to Hetmyer, 1 run, short of a length and on Hetmyer's pads, nudged past mid-wicket for a single

Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, a maiden over from Khaleel, it's been a mighty impressive start from India, on a good length and shaping away from the right-hander, drew Pollard into a flat-footed poke before he withdraw at the last moment
Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, Khaleel shortens his length and angles this one across the right-hander, Pollard is very watchful as he lets it go by
Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, the bouncer from Khaleel, slanting across the right-hander, Pollard watches it all along and sways away from the line
Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, on a good length and well outside off, left alone
Khaleel Ahmed to Pollard, no run, fuller length delivery and a hint of shape back into the right-hander, played with a straight bat and straight to the fielder at mid-on

Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, out Shai Hope Run Out!! Oh dear! Such a disappointing end to what was turning out to be a nice little start. There was never a run there, not sure who did the calling, but in the end, it's Hope who has to pay the price. Rahul nearly made a mess of a simple throw, thankfully for him and India, Manish was alert and he threw the stumps down. It was a back of a length delivery that was tucked straight to mid-wicket and Hope set-off for a quick single, Hetmyer responded before turning his back on his partner, it was then a one-way race towards the same end by both batsmen, eventually, Hetmyer was the first who plonked his bat inside the crease. KL had all the time in the world to throw it at the striker's end, instead, he lobbed it well over DK's head who slipped as he jumped. Manish was backing up from point, collects the ball, runs at the stumps and breaks it. Shai Hope run out (Rahul/Manish Pandey) 14(10) [4s-3]
U Yadav to Shai Hope, 1 run, back of a length and on Hope's pads, tucked away behind square on the on-side for a single
U Yadav to Hetmyer, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, pushed in front of cover and Hetmyer is off for a quick single

U Yadav to Hetmyer, no run, that was close, fraction fuller and this was a touch wider as well, Hetmyer was looking to repeat his previous shot, got it off the toe-end and the ball lobbed back over Umesh's head, bounced well in front of the man rushing forward from mid-on

U Yadav to Hetmyer, FOUR, that's Hetmyer's reply to the previous ball, length ball outside off, he gets his left leg out out of the way and drives it on the up, over the non-striker's head and races away to the fence

U Yadav to Hetmyer, no run, cut-in-half, lovely ball from Umesh, short of a length and shaping back into the left-hander, Hetmyer's feet went nowhere as he attempted a steer, beaten on the inside edge and wasn't too far away from the off-stump either

U Yadav to Ramdin, out Caught by Karthik!! A nothing shot and Ramdin has walked. A tentative poke to a delivery that shaped away late, drew Ramdin into playing at that - well away from his body, no conviction behind the poke and all he managed to do was to get a healthy edge. DK does the rest and celebrations start in the Indian camp. Ramdin c Karthik b U Yadav 2(5)

Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, FOUR, easy runs for Hope, length ball down the leg-side and all Hope had to do was to get some bat on that. He does so with a wristy flick and the ball flies past the diving keeper
Khaleel Ahmed to Ramdin, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, Ramdin jabs it in front of point and sets off for a quick single
Khaleel Ahmed to Ramdin, no run, on a good length and in that channel outside off, Ramdin was looking to drive on the up, finds the fielder at cover-point
Khaleel Ahmed to Shai Hope, 1 run, tad fuller and shaping back into the right-hander, Hope prods half-forward and pushes it in front of mid-on for a single

Khaleel Ahmed to Ramdin, 1 run, nicely bowled by Khaleel, short of a good length and some spongy bounce on offer, Ramdin was pushing forward and gets a thick edge, past the lone slip and down to third man

Khaleel Ahmed to Ramdin, no run, much better from Khaleel, fraction fuller and a hint of nip back into the right-hander, Ramdin was shuffling across, makes the late change and defends it back at the bowler
Khaleel Ahmed to Ramdin, wide, Khaleel's first ball in T20I cricket is a wide, slid this one down the leg-side as he aimed for swing

U Yadav to Shai Hope, no run, on a good length and a hint of shape back into the right-hander, Hope didn't account for the movement as he swung lustily, was aiming to drive on the up and over cover, gets a big inside edge onto his pads

U Yadav to Shai Hope, FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short from Umesh, Hope spots the length early, hops across and pulls it in front of square on the on-side, through the gap wide of mid-wicket and there's no need to run for those
U Yadav to Shai Hope, no run, fuller length delivery and shaping away from outside off, Hope jams his bat down and squeezes it to the off-side
U Yadav to Shai Hope, no run, on a good length and just outside off, defended with an open face towards backward point

U Yadav to Shai Hope, FOUR, lovely shot, but not a great start to Krunal's T20I career, on a good length and just outside off, Hope leant forward and stroked it wide of cover. Krunal gave chase, slid and then let the ball slip through his hands as he picked it up
U Yadav to Shai Hope, no run, short of a length and just outside off, Hope gets behind the line and pushes it to cover-point
K Paul to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, full outside off, may have stopped on Krunal's drive but he's able to chip it over short cover's head. They come back for the second to seal a 1-0 series lead
K Paul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, full ball on middle and leg, lovely flick shot from Krunal, hurries away past the diving deep midwicket fielder
K Paul to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, short ball around the right shoulder, Krunal helps the pull away wide of Oshane Thomas who puts in a heavy dive. Good commitment shown to cut it off
K Paul to Karthik, 1 run, gets this leg-cutter cutting away outside off, Karthik steers nicely to third man
K Paul to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slingy yorker on off, Krunal rushes his bat down to eke out a thick inside edge past leg stump
K Pierre to Karthik, no run, defended to short cover
K Pierre to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, clipped away through midwicket to bring up the 100. Just 10 away now
K Pierre to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, sliding away from off, that's been dabbed pretty fine from Krunal. Excellent execution of the late dab to send it into the third man boundary
K Pierre to Karthik, 1 run, low full toss drifting in on the pads, flicks it through midwicket
K Pierre to Karthik, no run, punched to short cover

K Pierre to Karthik, no run, Windies have gone for a review, but they don't seem that confident. That's because Karthik has missed this by a couple of inches. Wanted to dab this behind backward point, but it gripped away from him
Fabian Allen to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, he goes reverse! Allen's round the wicket angle was taking it away from him, and Krunal just used that angle to sweep the ball past backward point

Fabian Allen to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, steps out, makes it into a full toss and drills it into the pitch - back over the bowler's head. Very careless misfield from long-on, lucky that Pollard was aware and was backing him up from long-off
Fabian Allen to Karthik, 1 run, works it down to long-on
Fabian Allen to Karthik, 2 runs, sliding in on off, Karthik waits on it before opening the bat face and running it behind point
Fabian Allen to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, sliding across off, pats it through point for his first international runs
Fabian Allen to Karthik, 1 run, sliding in on middle and leg, works it through square leg

K Pierre to Manish Pandey, out Caught&Bowled!! Kicks up on Pandey and startles him. Length ball, he was prodding forward to defend it but the ball vaulted off the pitch and popped up off the splice. An excellent return catch from Pierre too, diving forward to snatch it low with both hands. Windies not out of it just yet. Manish Pandey c and b K Pierre 19(24) [4s-2]
K Pierre to Manish Pandey, no run, length ball on middle, 87kph, Pandey is forward in defence
K Pierre to Karthik, 1 run, quite full outside off, Karthik slaps the drive to sweeper cover
K Pierre to Karthik, no run, pushed to short cover
K Pierre to Manish Pandey, 1 run, flighted up on middle, Pandey pushes it to long-off
K Pierre to Karthik, 1 run, 90kph, sliding in on middle, nudged away through midwicket

Brathwaite to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, Pollard just gets a hand on it this time as he throws himself across the turf. Full ball outside off, nicely driven on the up by Pandey, will get a couple of runs after the half-stop
Brathwaite to Manish Pandey, FOUR, packed enough of a punch from the bottom hand to beat Kieron Pollard. Short of length outside off, Pandey is able to lace it through extra cover
Brathwaite to Manish Pandey, no run, bumper without much menace, Pandey safely bends underneath
Brathwaite to Karthik, 1 run, short of length outside off, Karthik steps across and punches the ball to third man
Brathwaite to Karthik, no run, back of a length on off, blunted to short midwicket
Brathwaite to Karthik, no run, back of a length on middle, pops it to midwicket. Wanted to clip it through the on-side but was early to close the face on it
K Pierre to Manish Pandey, no run, back of a length, darted in on off stump. Pandey stabs it to cover
K Pierre to Manish Pandey, no run, pushed to short cover
K Pierre to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, front leg out of the way, this time he slices it through backward point. Good placement for a couple of runs
K Pierre to Manish Pandey, no run, 91kph, full ball on off, Pandey gets his front leg away from it and pushes to short cover
K Pierre to Karthik, 1 run, short outside off, carves it away to deep point
K Pierre to Manish Pandey, 1 run, drifting in on middle and leg, clipped away through square leg

Pollard to Karthik, FOUR, game-changing over. 12 runs off it. The move to bring in Pollard has backfired for Windies. Short without any purpose, Karthik rocks back and nails the pull in the gap, beating deep mid-wicket

Pollard to Karthik, FOUR, Pollard yells in disgust as soon as delivered it down leg. Help-yourself-with-a-boundary ball, another drifter on leg. This time fine leg was inside the ring and Karthik gets inside the line and sends it to the fine leg fence
Pollard to Karthik, no run, 121kph, cutter outside off. Patted with an open-bat face to point
Pollard to Karthik, no run, where was Pandey heading? Karthik dabbed it in front of cover and shouted "Wait", Pandey was keen for the single and in the end, was sent back wisely
Pollard to Karthik, no run, rolls his fingers across on this full ball outside off, Karthik push-drives it back and Pollard intercepts it in his followthrough
Pollard to Karthik, FOUR, poor, very poor from Pollard. A throwdown delivery down leg, Karthik just needed to employ his bat in order to find the fence. Does so and tickles it very fine
K Pierre to Karthik, 1 run, flighted on middle and leg, Karthik clips it politely through mid-wicket
K Pierre to Karthik, no run, rolling off the wrists from Karthik, it was straightening at 90kph. Turned to the right of the bowler, Pierre moves across and stops
K Pierre to Karthik, no run, quick and accurate at the stumps, Karthik stays in his crease and protects his stumps with a straight bat
K Pierre to Manish Pandey, 1 run, knocked away to long-on
K Pierre to Manish Pandey, no run, skiddier and rushing off the deck, Pandey waited and waited before dead-batting it with soft hands. The ball threatened to roll back, but escaped past the stumps
K Pierre to Karthik, 1 run, flatter and quicker on off, Karthik makes room and slices the punch to sweeper cover

Brathwaite to Karthik, 1 run, yes-no-yes-no, eventually Karthik makes it through with a full-stretch dive. Tapped in front of cover-point, Karthik was ball-watching and hears the call from Manish quite late. Stop-start but no worries in the end as the fielder, who had a shy at the non-striker's end missed his target
Brathwaite to Manish Pandey, 1 run, goes wide of the crease and angles it fuller outside off. Stabbed half-heartedly through cover
Brathwaite to Manish Pandey, no run, Brathwaite throws it wide of off teasing Pandey, who flays and misses
Brathwaite to Manish Pandey, no run, pounds it short, kept curling at Pandey's head, who tried to control the pull with a vertical fore-hand. Fails to connect
Brathwaite to Manish Pandey, no run, cutter, following the batsman who was backing away. Pandey was tucked for space, ends up defending it down the pitch
Brathwaite to Manish Pandey, no run, fullish outside off, Pandey presses forward and extends his defence to mid-off
Thomas to Karthik, no run, patted with a horizontal steer in front of point, wanted a single but Pandey is not interested. End of a fine spell from Thomas

Thomas to Karthik, SIX, moral victory for Thomas. Did everything right, had Karthik in strife but Karthik manages to find a top-edge and gets it away for a maximum. Peppered short, kicking off at the face and Karthik took it on to pull, didn't expect it to rise so much and luckily, gets away
Thomas to Karthik, no run, rearing up from a length, Karthik jumps back and defends it with soft hands, shouts a loud "Wait"
Thomas to Karthik, no run, bluffs Karthik by keeping it short outside off, left alone
Thomas to Karthik, no run, climbing off the pitch, Karthik gets back, was late to pick it but does well to fend it in front of his face down the pitch
Thomas to Manish Pandey, 1 run, rib-tickler at 149.4kph, makes Pandey to yank his bottom-hand off the handle and tickle it to fine leg

Brathwaite to Karthik, no run, beaten, I would say. Although Karthik pulled his bat at the last minute from the line of the delivery. Superb delivery from Brathwaite; on a length and seamed after hitting the deck forcing Karthik to stalk his bat and the ball going past the outside edge
Brathwaite to Karthik, no run, short and rising just outside off, Karthik pokes without any intent and gets a thick inside-edge onto his pad
Brathwaite to Karthik, no run, half-hearted appeal for a caught-behind as Karthik flashed his willow at this away-seamer wide of off. Clearly missed it by a long way

Brathwaite to Rahul, out Caught by Darren Bravo!! Straight to the man at deep square leg. Rahul's awful day continues. Made a few errors in the field and looked out of sorts with the bat too. Brathwaite picks up his second wicket and India in further trouble. This was short and at the stumps, Rahul camped back and muscled it hard in the air, without minding that there is a fielder set for the trap. Straight into the hands of Bravo, who makes no mistake. Rahul is disappointed with himself, slamming his bat into the turf in anger. Indian coach Ravi Shastri looks a bit worried in the dressing room. Rahul c Darren Bravo b Brathwaite 16(22) [4s-2]
Brathwaite to Rahul, no run, 131kph, tighter line from Brathwaite. This was threatening to straighten off the pitch, Rahul takes note and defends it off the outer half into the pitch
Brathwaite to Rahul, no run, shortish and coming in with the angle, Rahul stays on the back foot and blocks it into the pitch
K Paul to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length and no width whatsoever. Rahul knows and drops it with soft hands in front of point
K Paul to Manish Pandey, 1 run, straying on leg, whisked away to fine leg

K Paul to Manish Pandey, FOUR, this should boost Pandey's confidence. Didn't time it off the middle and not entirely in control, but the key was Pandey held his balance till the last instant. It was a full ball and on middle, Pandey lifted it with a straight bat over mid-on. Enough legs on it to reach the fence
K Paul to Manish Pandey, wide, scrambled seam delivery from Paul, gets the line wrong. Slipping it down leg
K Paul to Rahul, 1 run, ushered short, at the body and Rahul gets in a good position to unleash the pull along the ground to deep square leg

K Paul to Manish Pandey, 1 run, edged and flies over gully. Paul finds some juice, extra bounce foxes Pandey as he jumps sticking his bat forward hastily and it takes the outside edge looping away to third man
K Paul to Rahul, 1 run, splice-jarrer outside off, Rahul plonked his bat ungainly and the ball clips the outer half to whistle towards third man
Brathwaite to Manish Pandey, no run, cutting back in and Pandey was caught in the crease unaware of the movement. The ball slams him on the thigh pad and lobs up to point
Brathwaite to Manish Pandey, no run, goodish length outside off, Pandey hops back and softly dabs it to point

Brathwaite to Pant, out Caught by Darren Bravo!! Another one falls. This has been an excellent show from the Windies with the ball and Pant perishes. The skipper strikes in his first over and has his arms aloft in joy. Stunned silence in the crowd and India wobbling a bit, losing their third wicket. It was the slower delivery from Brathwaite, change in pace deceived Pant as he lined up for a wild slog across the line. Lost his shape completely and ended up slicing it in the air off the top-edge, Darren Bravo from cover steps forward and settles under it. Throws the ball up violently and joins the celebrations. Pant c Darren Bravo b Brathwaite 1(4)
Brathwaite to Pant, wide, Brathwaite bangs it short but the line is down leg. Pant went for the pull and missed
Brathwaite to Rahul, leg byes, 1 run, sliding on leg and reared up a bit as Rahul fails to connect with the nudge. Goes off the thigh pad towards square leg
Brathwaite to Rahul, no run, straighter at the stumps, Rahul is behind the line to defend it
Brathwaite to Pant, 1 run, slanted across the left-hander, the angle made Pant play at that and he ends up squirting it away to third man

Thomas to Rahul, FOUR, this is a loosener from Thomas, for a change he bowls it full and ends up serving it on the pads. Rahul makes him pay, glancing it off his pads very fine and it spirits away to the fine leg fence

Thomas to Rahul, byes, FOUR, woah. 148kph, rockets off the surface, perhaps must've hit a crack or something. Rahul tried to help it on its way by getting slightly inside the line but the ball shot off rapidly and so much was the bounce and carry on that, even Ramdin had no chance
Thomas to Rahul, no run, sticks to the similar length, just outside off and Rahul languidly pushes it to cover

Thomas to Rahul, 2 runs, 144kph, Thomas expected another one to take off but Rahul adjusted by getting on top of the bounce and steers it past point. By the time third man runs across to his left and cuts it off, the duo will come back for the second

Thomas to Rahul, no run, look at that bounce and carry. It was clicked at 149kph. Hostile stuff from Thomas. Digs it short and gets some purchase from the deck, kicks off and Rahul does well not to flirt at it
Thomas to Rahul, no run, short of length and just outside off, Rahul rides the bounce by getting tall in his crease and guides it to point
K Paul to Pant, no run, slanted away, goes further away after hitting the deck and Pant makes a late call to let it go by playing inside the line of it
K Paul to Rahul, 1 run, 132kph, Rahul uses the bowler's pace and width in steering that past a diving backward point fielder. Third man mops up
K Paul to Rahul, wide, too short and angling down leg, Rahul was looking to help it away with a hook shot. No contact made and the square leg umpire calls it as a wide
K Paul to Rahul, no run, short of length delivery, Rahul punches it off the back foot, can't finds the gap in the cover region
K Paul to Rahul, no run, defends on the off-side
K Paul to Rahul, FOUR, top shot! Paul shortens his length, no real pace to threaten the batsman. Rahul gets on top of the bounce and slaps it through extra cover. Excellent placement
K Paul to Rahul, no run, tentative batting. Fullish ball swings away a tad, Rahul tries to tap it on the off-side, off the outside half towards backward point
Thomas to Pant, no run, 146kph, short of length ball, Pant hops and blocks. That ends the fiery over from Oshane Thomas

Thomas to Dhawan, out Bowled!! That's a bullet and Dhawan has no clue. 147kph! Both the openers gone. Game on! What a ball that was from Oshane Thomas. Good length ball swung in a tad, Dhawan plays down the wrong line as he has a push at it. A big gap created between pad and bat for the ball to go through. The middle-stump has been uprooted! The Windies players are pumped up. Dhawan b Thomas 3(8)
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, Dhawan hops and drops this short ball into the pitch
Thomas to Dhawan, leg byes, FOUR, errs in line, 148kph, full and on the pads, Dhawan misses the flick and the ball races away to the fine leg fence off his pad
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, 145kph, low full toss, Dhawan half-heartedly has a push-drive at it and ends up inside-edging it towards the on-side
Thomas to Rahul, 1 run, too straight at 144kph, knocked into the mid-wicket region and Rahul wanted the second. Dhawan sends his partner back with a loud call
K Paul to Rahul, 1 run, hint of extra bounce on this shortish ball outside off, Rahul goes hard on the cut and Hetmyer misfields at cover, which allows the batsmen to nab a run
K Paul to Rahul, no run, back of a length delivery at 128kph, back-footed push towards point
K Paul to Dhawan, 1 run, on a good length and Dhawan taps this in front of cover with soft hands for a quick single
K Paul to Dhawan, no run, beaten! Out-seamer in that nagging zone outside off, Dhawan has a poke at it and is lucky not to nick it

K Paul to Dhawan, 2 runs, too straight and Dhawan helps it away wide of short fine leg. Hetmyer sprints across a long way in the deep and makes a sliding stop. Saved two runs for his team there. Top effort
K Paul to Dhawan, no run, short of a good length ball on middle and leg, defended in front of mid-wicket

Thomas to Rohit, out Caught by Ramdin!! A confident appeal for caught-behind and Windies review. Fair delivery. There's a spike on UltraEdge and Rohit has to depart. Good use of the review from Windies. A pacy in-ducker at 146kph, Rohit doesn't account for the inward movement and gets beaten for pace as well. Plays slightly outside the line and gets a faint inside edge. Sharp catch by Ramdin who leaps across to his left to snaffle that with both hands. Windies have the early breakthrough. Rohit c Ramdin b Thomas 6(6) [4s-1]
Thomas to Rohit, wide, too wide outside off and Rohit lets it be
Thomas to Rohit, no run, good comeback. The bowler targets the stumps as he slightly shortened his length. Rohit is late to adjust for the extra bounce as he blocks off the top part of the bat

Thomas to Rohit, FOUR, in the air and over the man at cover-point. Thomas pitches it up and gets it to swing away from the right-hander at 146kph, Rohit saw the width and threw his bat to lace it over a leaping Darren Bravo. Bulleted away
Thomas to Rohit, no run, 145kph, shaping away outside off, Rohit lets it go
Thomas to Rohit, no run, beaten for pace! Short of length delivery at 144kph and Rohit is late to close his bat-face fater his mini-hop. Gets hit on high on the pad
Thomas to Rohit, 2 runs, 144kph, in-angler, Rohit closes his bat-face and gets a leading edge that rolls through extra cover. India and Rohit off the mark with a brace

Pat Cummins to Kohli, SIX, whatta way to end the innings! India reach 190 with that hit. Kohli charges forward to gather momentum, it was full and wide of off, he reaches for it and nails the lofted shot over long-off. It sails into the crowd!
Pat Cummins to Karthik, leg byes, 1 run, good length delivery down the leg-side, Karthik fails to put any bat on the heave. It hits his pads and deflects to the off-side. They scamper for a single
Pat Cummins to Karthik, FOUR, this is a much cheeky shot from Karthik. And a much better one. He waited for the slower one to arrive and just guides it over short third for a boundary
Pat Cummins to Karthik, FOUR, fuller length delivery wide of off, Karthik swings hard, inside half of the bat takes it wide of short fine for a boundary
Pat Cummins to Kohli, 1 run, pulls it to deep mid-wicket

Pat Cummins to Dhoni, out Caught by Finch!! An excellent partnership between two legends of Indian cricket comes to an end. It was a length delivery on the stumps, was surely there to be hit. But Dhoni was touch late to get his bat down and mistimes it. It went up a long way up in the night sky and Finch takes a decent high catch at long-off. Lot of elevation on the shot but not the requisite distance. Dhoni c Finch b Pat Cummins 40(23) [4s-3 6s-3]
Pat Cummins to Dhoni, wide, this one was marginal. But umpire reckons it is outside the tramline.
Pat Cummins to Dhoni, wide, that is well wide of off and Dhoni ignores it

J Richardson to Kohli, FOUR, wow! This is a treat. An absolute treat by two masters of the game. It was in the arc for Kohli, he maintains his balance and creams it down the ground. The straight fielders has no chance as it rockets to the fence

J Richardson to Kohli, 2 runs, that's excellent running from Kohli. He absolutelly charges back for the double. It was a low full-toss wide of off and Kohli steers it wide of third man and some excellent running allowed him to come back
J Richardson to Dhoni, 1 run, slower one on a length, Dhoni waits for it to come and pulls it to long-on
J Richardson to Kohli, 1 run, full-toss just outside off, Kohli drives it down the ground for a single
J Richardson to Kohli, SIX, top shot! It was a length delivery, Kohli keeps his shape and powers it over long-off for another six. The best thing about the shot was that he used the straight bat
J Richardson to Kohli, wide, that's a wide. And Richardson is stunned by that. It was marginally wide of off and that's a fair call by the umpire
J Richardson to Kohli, no run, length delivery wide of off, Kohli swings and misses
D Arcy Short to Dhoni, FOUR, shorter and wide of off, Dhoni cuts and cuts well, gets it over the point fielder for a boundary
D Arcy Short to Dhoni, SIX, it's hugeeeeeeee! This is MS Dhoni at his best. This is the Dhoni of the yesteryears. He gets under this delivery and launches it over deep mid-wicket for a gigantic six
D Arcy Short to Kohli, 1 run, comes down the track and tonks it straight down the ground for a single
D Arcy Short to Dhoni, 1 run, another heave, fails to connect this time, inside half of the bat takes it to backward square leg

D Arcy Short to Dhoni, SIX, spin in the 18th over against MS is never a good option. And that too part time spin. It was tossed up and was in the arc for Dhoni, he unleashes the power hit and deposits it over the fence with utmost ease
D Arcy Short to Kohli, 1 run, goes down on his knees and slog sweeps it to
Zampa to Dhoni, no run, goes on the back foot and cuts finds that point fielder again
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run, nudges it to deep mid-wicket and reaches his fifty. He was finding it tough to time it initially but good players find a way. And he is surely better than just a good one
Zampa to Kohli, no run, cuts, finds point fielder
Zampa to Kohli, no run, brilliant delivery. It was a perfect yorker and Kohli fails to get under it. He was off balance while playing the shot and ends up blocking it back
Zampa to Dhoni, 1 run, stays static and tonks it to the on-side for a single
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run, goes on the back foot and pulls it to deep mid-wicket
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, 1 run, full-toss on the stumps and Kohli knocks it to long-on

Coulter-Nile to Kohli, SIX, hat-trick of sixes for Kohli. He is on fire at the Chinnaswamy. It was a length delivery on the stumps, Kohli advances down the track to gather momentum and tonks it over deep mid-wicket. The timing wasn't ideal this time but it was good enough to send it over the ropes
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, SIX, back to back sixes. Kohli is smoking it now. He backs away on this ball and dispatches it over long-off for another six. He has surely found his timing now

Coulter-Nile to Kohli, SIX, he makes it so ridiculously easy! Whatta shot! Whatta player! Waits for the slower one, keeps his shape and times the lofted shot over deep mid-wicket perfectly for a maximum. 50th six for Kohli in T20I!
Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, 1 run, another slower one, this one length was fuller and it was wide of off, Dhoni wanted to drive it past cover. But inside half of the willow takes it to long-on
Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, 2 runs, waits for the slower one to arrive and half-pulls it wide of fine leg for a couple
J Richardson to Kohli, no run, good length delivery wide of off, Kohli swings but fails to put any bat to it

J Richardson to Kohli, 2 runs, good length delivery wide of off, there was width and Kohli throws his bat at it. It came off the outside half of the bat and it was in the air, It lands short of Zampa at third man but his dive ensures that the ball didn't go any further
J Richardson to Kohli, SIX, shot! He has timed this one for sure and it has gone for a flat six. Backs away, makes room and smokes it to the left of long-off with a straight bat for a maximum
J Richardson to Dhoni, 1 run, punches it to long-off for a single

J Richardson to Dhoni, FOUR, his placement has been extraordinary today. There was no one in the third man area, he waited for the ball to come and cuts it uppishly over the in-field on the off-side for a four
J Richardson to Kohli, 1 run, good length delivery wide of off, Kohli steers it to third man

Pat Cummins to Kohli, 1 run, stands still and wanted to loft it over cover. But timing was horrible again. It is sticking in the wicket a touch and Kohli is really struggling to time it. It ends up at deep cover and Kohli takes a single
Pat Cummins to Dhoni, 1 run, down the leg-side and Dhoni turns it to fine leg

Pat Cummins to Dhoni, FOUR, That's Dhoni power for you. And it has rocketed to the fence. It was a good length delivery on the stumps, Dhoni stays static and powers it. The mid-off fielder was in the circle, it beats him to his right and reaches the fence in a hurry
Pat Cummins to Dhoni, no run, on a good length and around off, Dhoni punches it straight to cover
Pat Cummins to Kohli, 1 run, length delivery on the stumps, Kohli was hurried by the pace a touch and due to that he ends up pulling it to fine leg
Pat Cummins to Kohli, 2 runs, on a length and wide of off, Kohli lofts it inside out over cover. The bat turns in his hands and he fails to time it but manages to place it wide of deep cover fielder

D Arcy Short to Kohli, 1 run, Short would be smiling after this delivery as it was there to be hit. It was short but Kohli fails to connect the pull as well as he would have liked and finds deep mid-wicket
D Arcy Short to Dhoni, 1 run, stays in the crease and punches it to sweeper cover
D Arcy Short to Dhoni, no run, works it straight to mid-wicket
D Arcy Short to Dhoni, SIX, he has connected this one. And when he hits, it generally stays hit. Went down on his knees and clobbers it with the turn over deep mid-wicket for a gigantic six
D Arcy Short to Dhoni, no run, an ugly heave from MS, fails to connect it. It hits his pads. Sliding down!
D Arcy Short to Kohli, 1 run, flatter and it was short, Kohli mistimes the pull wide of long-on. Kohli was looking for a brace but decides against it
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run, fuller and on the stumps, Kohli drives it to sweeper cover and collects a single
Zampa to Kohli, FOUR, there wasn't any width but Kohli manufactures his own width and cuts it past backward point for a boundary
Zampa to Dhoni, 1 run, powers it to long-off for a single
Zampa to Dhoni, no run, drives it straight to cover

Zampa to Dhoni, no run, Dhoni advances and Zampa throws it wide. Good piece of bowling. MS was quick to go back but Handscomb takes off the bails. He is back in the crease in a fashion only MS can do. He stretched to the maximum to reach back. Umpire went upstairs to check and gave the decision in Dhoni's favor
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run, touch short and on the body, Kohli punches it down the ground for a single
D Arcy Short to Dhoni, no run, pushes it to the on-side

D Arcy Short to Pant, out Caught by J Richardson!! Richardson with a stunner! One of the best catches you would ever see. It was a tossed up delivery wide of off, Pant wanted to tonk it over long-on. He mistimes it horribly, bat turns in his hand at the point of contact. Richardson at long-off flies in the air like a superman to his left and takes a truly sensational catch. Pant's tough time in T20I continues. Pant c J Richardson b D Arcy Short 1(6)
D Arcy Short to Pant, no run, sharp away turn on this delivery, Pant fails to combat the turn and it rips past his outside edge
D Arcy Short to Pant, no run, another cut shot and he finds the same fielder again
D Arcy Short to Pant, no run, flatter and wide of off, Pant cuts but finds point
D Arcy Short to Kohli, 1 run, smashes it to long-on for a single
Behrendorff to Kohli, 1 run, tap and run. Singles game is on from Kohli now. Stayed behind the line of the ball and just tapped it out to scamper through for a quick single
Behrendorff to Pant, 1 run, stays behind the line of the ball and tucks it away behind square for a single. Last 17 balls have only accounted for 11 runs. India have dug a hole for themselves here
Behrendorff to Pant, no run, push-drives the ball away to cover
Behrendorff to Kohli, 1 run, stabs the ball down to deep third man for a single

Behrendorff to Dhawan, out Caught by Stoinis!! The third umpire had a good work out and has given it out. Dhawan departs for a 24-ball 14. That is criminal on this track. Heaved the ball away, the bat face twisted and he did not time it. The ball stayed aerial for quite a bit and the man at deep cover came charging in to take it. Then came the replays whether the catch was clean or not and as the soft signal was out, the on-field decision stayed. Dhawan c Stoinis b Behrendorff 14(24) [4s-1]
Behrendorff to Dhawan, no run, looks to slog, not his day and misses

Zampa to Kohli, 2 runs, pulled away again and has Kohli made it? Seems safe! That was a good throw from the deep and hits direct at the batter's end but the dive has saved him. Got on top of the bounce and pulled it down for the fielder at long-on to cut it off, but a fumble and the deep mid fielder zoomed the throw in
Zampa to Dhawan, 1 run, pulled down behind square for a single as that skidded on to the bat after landing
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run, drops the ball short, pulled away down to long-on for a single
Zampa to Kohli, no run, tucks it out to mid-wicket as it was flattish on the pads. Wants a single but was sent back
Zampa to Kohli, no run, combats the turn outside off and pushes it out to cover
Zampa to Dhawan, 1 run, pushes the ball out into the off-side for a single. Was a googly that one

Coulter-Nile to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, looks to heave it away and misses. He is having a terrible time today. Looks rusty. That was a buffet ball on the pads and Dhawan drops the platter by missing the clip. Off the pads and into the on-side for a leg-bye
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, 1 run, slammed on the up, finds deep cover for a single. Again widish line on a length outside off
Coulter-Nile to Dhawan, 1 run, the search for timing continues..shortish delivery and Dhawan is late on the pull. Gets it away off the shoulder of the blade towards deep mid for a single
Coulter-Nile to Dhawan, no run, punched off the back foot, finds mid-off
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, 1 run, chases a wide fullish ball and edges it past the man at slip for a single down to third man

Coulter-Nile to Rahul, out Caught by J Richardson!! 118.9kph delivery and that has been steered to deep third man. Soft dismissal indeed. Tries to be deft, but the lack of pace did him in as the upper cut found the fielder. Misses out on a much deserved fifty. The cutter doing the trick and like the last game, change of pace will be a crucial exponent in this game as well. The fun has ended. Rahul c J Richardson b Coulter-Nile 47(26) [4s-3 6s-4]
Zampa to Rahul, 1 run, stays forward and pushes the ball out to deep cover for a single
Zampa to Rahul, no run, pushed out into the off-side off the front foot
Zampa to Dhawan, 1 run, might have been the googly but has been on-driven to long-on for a single after a dance down the track
Zampa to Rahul, 1 run, bumps the drive back to the bowler and a misfield from him allows the single
Zampa to Rahul, FOUR, and now some deft touch! Quicker delivery down leg and has been tickled away. The full bouquet of shots are on show
Zampa to Dhawan, 1 run, slashes a drive outside off and the man at point gets a hand to it

Pat Cummins to Rahul, no run, and Rahul gets hit in the box now..angling in, Rahul misses the tuck and loses his balance to lay flat on the ground. The physio is out there now attending him. Up now and we will continue

Pat Cummins to Rahul, SIX, Whoa! My fingers will be in overtime mode tonight. That was short, Rahul brings out the pull and clubs it over deep fine leg for a another sixer. Picked the length as if he was a gardener in an orchard and slammed it away

Pat Cummins to Rahul, SIX, Sir VIVesque! That was on the pads and Rahul does a mini helicopter to send it high and handsome over deep mid. That was a sixer the moment it left the bat. Rahul is in the zone now. Grab your crash helmets folks! Good luck..
Pat Cummins to Dhawan, 1 run, slams the pull away, hits it flat and the ball reaches the man at deep square leg in a flash
Pat Cummins to Dhawan, no run, goes across his sticks and looks to play the pick up pull but gloves the ball away to short fine leg. Got cramped thanks to the line just outside off
Pat Cummins to Rahul, 1 run, nimble on his feet, gets back quickly and taps the ball out into the on-side for a single as he managed to climb on to the bounce
J Richardson to Rahul, 1 run, stabs at it and gets it down to third man for a single. Rahul retains strike

J Richardson to Rahul, SIX, mammmmmamiaaaah! That was luscious! Pitched up and Rahul goes through with a punchy drive and that has gone all the way over cover. Saw a similar one in the previous game. He is mitochondria of talent, this lad

J Richardson to Rahul, SIX, banged in short, Rahul looks to hook and gets it more of the top-edge and that has gone over deep fine leg for a sixer! First six of the game. It came quickly on to him and Rahul just went through with it
J Richardson to Dhawan, 1 run, punched on the up, Short at cover dives to his left and stops a certain four! That was timed to perfection but well stopped by the fielder. India off to a sedate start
J Richardson to Rahul, 1 run, gets tucked up, taps it out into the off-side for a single
J Richardson to Rahul, no run, length delivery outside off and has been pushed out into the off-side
Coulter-Nile to Rahul, 1 run, stabs the ball away and gets it down to deep third man for a single
Coulter-Nile to Rahul, no run, looks to punch on the up and inside edges it to mid-on as he played the shot a bit too early
Coulter-Nile to Rahul, FOUR, helped on its way! Shortish down leg and Rahul helped it on its way over short fine for a four
Coulter-Nile to Dhawan, 1 run, tap and run! Inside edged the ball on to the pads and gets a single
Coulter-Nile to Dhawan, wide, moves across his sticks and misses the big heave. It did not miss the leg-stick by much but has been wided
Coulter-Nile to Dhawan, wide, too short, too high and has been wided! That was banged in slow, Dhawan tried to upper cut but in vain

Coulter-Nile to Dhawan, no run, slower delivery down on to the pads and seems that he has coped a blow on the box. Dhawan slipped as well after missing the heave. He is taking deep breathes now. The physio will come out as well. A slight little break in play
Coulter-Nile to Dhawan, no run, looks for a wristy tuck but fails to time it and finds the man at short mid

Behrendorff to Dhawan, 1 run, cramped up but gets it away with a tuck and gets a quick single to ensure 12 come off the over. Good one for India after two quiet ones. That was banged in short, angled in at the hips and Dhawan stayed back to tap it out
Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run, hops up and tucks it away into the on-side for a single
Behrendorff to Dhawan, 1 run, another tango down the track and has been pushed out past point for a single

Behrendorff to Dhawan, FOUR, the open acres of land on the on-side have been traversed by Dhawan. Skips out, Behrendorff shortens the length but Dhawan picks the ball away off the pads and gets it to deep mid for a four on a few bounces. Second four of the over
Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run, poor line on to the hips and tucked behind square for a single
Behrendorff to Rahul, FOUR, enough of sussing out the wicket, gets the room outside off and has been flayed away between point and cover for a four. Put away with disdain as that cut away ferociously
J Richardson to Dhawan, no run, cramps the batter for room and has been stabbed down into the deck. Two excellent overs to start the innings. Pressure on India
J Richardson to Dhawan, no run, chips out of his crease and pushes it away into the covers. The bowler shortened the length
J Richardson to Dhawan, no run, that flew off the bat as he punched it on top of the bounce but hit it straight to the man at point

J Richardson to Rahul, 1 run, on the pads, clipped away to the left of the man at square leg for a single only. Should have been a couple but Short was superb as he got there quickly and then the rocket-like throw to the keeper
J Richardson to Rahul, no run, off the outer half of the blade as he tried to close the face of the bat. That was dug in slightly short and Rahul hopped to tuck it but mistimed it
J Richardson to Rahul, no run, some nip away outside off and has been left alone
Behrendorff to Dhawan, no run, some nip away this time and has been stabbed away to the man at point. Good quiet start for the Aussies
Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run, tucked away off the pads and the man at fine leg cuts it off. They settle for a single. Some movement inwards for Behrendorff
Behrendorff to Rahul, no run, length delivery on the pads, clipped to mid-wicket
Behrendorff to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, angling into the pads, Dhawan misses the clip and the ball ricochets off the pads into the on-side for a single
Behrendorff to Dhawan, no run, gets squared up and has been pushed back to the bowler
