Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run, stabs at the ball and gets off the mark as the man at point dives to his left and stops it

S Kaul to Maxwell, FOUR, slapped wide of mid-off and there's the big roar from the Big Show. What a win for Australia. They win the series 2-0. It was a short ball from Kaul, Maxwell backed away and smashed it for four

S Kaul to Maxwell, SIX, scores level. Such excellent batting, has the audacity to walk down the pitch and take this attempted yorker on the full, just focused on timing than hitting it hard, powered over the long-on fence
S Kaul to Handscomb, 1 run, yorker outside off stump, Handscomb guides it to backward point and Maxwell skates to the other end
S Kaul to Maxwell, 1 run, wide full toss, driven hard to extra-cover, Pant takes the defensive line of getting the body behind the ball
Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run, very sensible from Maxwell, gently drives to the right of long-on, seeing off the best bowler from the opposition
Bumrah to Handscomb, 1 run, another full toss, Handscomb not even trying to hit hard, just takes a single with a drive to long-on, Maxwell to go hard for the final ball
Bumrah to Handscomb, no run, full toss, driven straight and into the sticks at the bowler's end
Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run, such a brilliant yorker, Maxwell had to really jump and take his left leg out of the way to prevent injury, squeezed out to square leg
Bumrah to Handscomb, 1 run, wide yorker, Handscomb guides it to backward point, shy at the bowler's end, direct-hit could have been curtains for Handscomb

Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run, edged into the ground and past the keeper, what a hundred from Maxwell. Such a talented hitter, India tried to tempt with the weakness to the slog against the away-spinning ball, but he countered that tactic well to lead Australia here. Bumrah bowls a yorker, but Maxwell managed to squeeze it out for a run
S Kaul to Maxwell, 1 run, free-hit, so catch at long-off won't count, full toss, hit to Vijay Shankar in the deep

S Kaul to Maxwell, no ball, SIX, oh my word! Full toss at this stage and what's worse, it's been called a no ball above the waist, Maxwell was a long way down the pitch, yet called by the umpire. Easy slog for a man in the 90s over deep mid-wicket
S Kaul to Handscomb, 1 run, softly driven down the ground to long-on, calm head from Handscomb, knows they have almost won the game. Just a case of batting out the remaining 13 balls

S Kaul to Handscomb, 2 runs, nice yorker, but such placement from Handscomb on this guide past backward point that Bumrah had a lot of ground to cover from third man, the bowler actually bowled a good ball, yet he has been taken for two
S Kaul to Maxwell, 1 run, low full toss, Maxwell flicks it to deep mid-wicket

S Kaul to Maxwell, SIX, 118kph slower ball, but this landed right in the slot for Maxwell to muscle it hard over the bowler's head. Kaul couldn't hide the slower ball from the batsman. Lovely hit from Maxi
S Kaul to Maxwell, no run, dot! Maxwell is staring at the deep backward square leg region. Rocked back to pull this really hard, only managed to toe-ended it to the keeper
Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run, slower delivery wide outside off stump, Maxwell reaches out and slices it to deep backward point
Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, valiant dive at square leg but Maxwell has swung so hard at this slower ball that the edge literally flew off the bat and had enough legs to beat the deep mid-wicket fielder
Bumrah to Handscomb, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Handscomb opens the face of the bat and guides it to third man
Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run, yorkerish delivery and has been driven down to long-off for a single. Toe-ended it. 38 off 21
Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, stand and deliver! Just stood motionless and lifted the ball away over cover for a four. This guy is showing all his class tonight
Bumrah to Handscomb, 1 run, chops the ball out to point, Krunal does well to dive to his left and stop it. But fails to abort the throw and concedes an overthrow. 43 remaining
Chahal to Maxwell, no run, looks to chop it out, misses. Chahal finishes with none for 47! A poor day at the office for the leggie, considering this is his adopted home while playing for RCB
Chahal to Handscomb, 1 run, chips down the track and blazes the full toss away to deep cover for a single. 44 needed now
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run, clips the ball away to deep mid for a single

Chahal to Maxwell, SIX, this is some tutorial into shattering the confidence of bowlers. Reverse smacked over deep point for a sixer. That was lured up outside off and Maxwell changed his stance to power it away

Chahal to Maxwell, SIX, bad ball, freebie! Drifts on to the pads, Maxwell kneels down and hammers the sweep over deep backward square for a sixer. India under the pump here. Maxwell taking the game away from India
Chahal to Maxwell, 2 runs, tucks the ball away off the back foot into the on-side and they get an easy couple as there was a misfield by the man at deep mid. 58 needed now
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, slides on, Maxwell looks to pull and under-edges it away to deep fine leg for a single. 60 needed off the last 5 overs
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, SIX, boom! Slapped down the ground and that stays hit! Backed away, created room and hammered it down the ground for a sixer
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, no run, looks to slog reverse sweep and misses. There was an appeal but the impact was outside off
Krunal Pandya to Handscomb, 1 run, goes for the sweep and gets it down to deep backward square leg for a single
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, drops the ball short, pulled down to long-on for a single
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, wide, flatter outside off, left alone and has been wided
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, no run, looks to slog and misses as it was angled in sharply
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run, non-turner at 92.9kph, Maxwell stays leg-side of the ball and punches it wide of extra cover
Chahal to Handscomb, 1 run, fuller and quicker, swept hard all along the carpet to deep backward square leg

Chahal to Handscomb, FOUR, stunning shot! Excellent use of the feet. Handscomb dances down the track and in the process moves leg-side which allows him to free his arms. Post that, he lifts it inside-out over extra cover for a one-bounce four
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run, 84.8kph, punched with the spin through cover-point
Chahal to Handscomb, 1 run, Chahal sees the batter coming down the track and shortens his length, Handscomb wrists it to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Handscomb, no run, Handscomb skips down the track, but isn't to the pitch, finds extra cover with his drive
Krunal Pandya to Handscomb, 1 run, good over, this from Krunal Pandya. Just 5 off it. Another dart with no room on offer, Handscomb bunts it to the right of long-on

Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, back-to-back fifties for Glenn Maxwell! His seventh in T20Is. Gets there in 28 deliveries. Uses the bowler angle to work it through mid-wicket. Can he guide his team to a win?
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, no run, 99.8kph, stump-to-stump line, Maxwell tries to punch, inside-halves it to the bowler
Krunal Pandya to Handscomb, 1 run, flat ball on a good length, punched down to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, leg byes, 1 run, fired on the pads and Maxwell misses the glance. The ball rolls towards backward square leg off the batsman's pad
Krunal Pandya to Handscomb, 1 run, darts a full ball at 98kph and that's been push-driven down to long-off

Shankar to Maxwell, SIX, too predictable! This one was bowled at 90.3kph, Maxwell waits for the length ball on the back foot and deposits it into the deep mid-wicket stands with a mighty pull. 13 off the over!
Shankar to Maxwell, wide, Vijay Shankar errs in line. The leg-break, but sprays it too wide outside off. Maxwell ignores it
Shankar to Handscomb, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off at 130.7kph, chopped to point off the under edge
Shankar to Maxwell, 1 run, low full toss, Maxwell flicks it to backward square leg

Shankar to Maxwell, FOUR, nicely guided away behind the wickets, picked the leggie from the medium pacer, waited for the ball to come and glanced it down to the fine leg boundary, Shankar hides his face
Shankar to Maxwell, no run, short of length delivery wide outside off stump, Maxwell looks to cut, chops it towards backward point

Shankar to D Arcy Short, out Caught by Rahul!! Now this is a definite slice. Oh Vijay Shankar actually bowled a leg break. Short delayed the loft. Wanted to hit down the ground, but ended up slicing it towards cover, Rahula pouches the skier. India have got the set batsman. Many were worried about Vijay Shankar bowling 4 overs today, but he's actually done pretty well. D Arcy Short c Rahul b Shankar 40(28) [4s-6]
Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short, 1 run, pushed away to long-off off the back foot
batsman_bowler: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short

comm: Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, oh leading edge flies over the jumping bowler and rolls to long-off, shortish from Krunal Pandya, Maxwell wanted to knock it to leg, got away with the edge

Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, FOUR, this is a good hit from Maxi. They are trying to force him to fetch from outside off stump looking for a slice to be taken in the deep on the off-side, but Maxwell has been clever enough to not swipe across and play down the ground, hit with a lot of power for a one bounce four
Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short, 1 run, no room whatsoever from Krunal Pandya, Short flicks this flatter delivery to backward square leg
batsman_bowler: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short

comm: Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, shortish and on the leg stump, Maxwell flicks it to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, no run, fired it flat from Krunal Pandya, Maxwell was cramped on the pull, he was also late on the shot, lucky that the ball was slipping down the leg-side
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run, flat and full on the stumps, flicked away to the right of long-on
Chahal to D Arcy Short, 1 run, wrong 'un full outside off, Short mistimes the loft off the toe-end and it drops short of the fielder at long-off
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run, cuts in front of point, easy single
Chahal to Maxwell, SIX, nicely looped up and in the arc for Maxi! He stays leg-side of the delivery and lofts it inside out for a scintillating maximum over extra cover
Chahal to D Arcy Short, 1 run, dropped! Googly outside off, Short sliced the cut off the toe and Pant spilled a straightforward catch diving forward at cover-point. Picked it late perhaps
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run, full on leg stump, Maxwell drives it straight to wide long-on
Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short, FOUR, that's a freebie from Krunal Pandya! Tossed full and in the zone outside off, Short pumps it flat straight back over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four
batsman_bowler: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short

comm: Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, knocked away off the pads wide of square leg to bring up the 50-run stand between the duo
Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short, 1 run, quicker outside off, eased down to long-off
batsman_bowler: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short

comm: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short, FOUR, no spin from Krunal Pandya, just firing it in with the arm. Short knew what was coming, waited deep inside the crease, opened the bat face and nailed it past the diving left hand of backward point
batsman_bowler: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short

comm: Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, another armball and this one keeps slightly low on the stumps, Maxwell adjusts at the last minute and drags the pull off the cue end through mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, no run, fired it in with the arm, Maxwell jumps back and punches to VK at cover
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run, flat and wide outside off, Maxwell goes deep inside the crease and cuts to the left of sweeper cover
Chahal to Maxwell, 2 runs, quicker on the stumps, Maxwell whips it in the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on and comes racing back for the second
Chahal to Maxwell, wide, tries to bowl the wide legbreak and dishes it too far outside off stump. Wided!
Chahal to D Arcy Short, 1 run, a touch quicker on off, worked away into the mid-wicket pocket
Chahal to D Arcy Short, wide, wrong 'un, but he's landed it well outside off and past the tramline
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run, googly on the pads, Maxwell flicks off the inside half to the right of short fine

Chahal to Maxwell, FOUR, Maxwell fancies spinners. Slightly flat outside off and Maxi's powered that through mid-wicket, no timing on that but all power from Maxwell. Dragged it off the bottom half and picked the gap on the leg-side to perfection
Chahal to D Arcy Short, 1 run, quick legbreak on the stumps, Short gets inside the line and tucks it through mid-wicket
Shankar to D Arcy Short, 1 run, tantalizingly slow on leg-stump, whipped away to deep mid-wicket for a single
Shankar to D Arcy Short, FOUR, slower short ball down leg, Short picked the length early and pulled it one-legged into the fine leg fence
Shankar to Maxwell, 1 run, hangs on the back foot and steers this back of a length delivery to the right of backward point
Shankar to Maxwell, no run, 99ks slants in from a fullish length outside off, Maxwell drives and finds cover
Shankar to Maxwell, FOUR, one bounce and over the ropes! 135ks short and wide of off, Maxwell swivels and pulls it backwards of square leg with an air of nonchalance

Shankar to D Arcy Short, 1 run, slower ball dipping on Short's pads and he had to hold his shot for a brief while before whipping it through mid-wicket, Chahal puts in a splendid dive in the deep to keep it down to a single
S Kaul to D Arcy Short, 1 run, 135ks angling in towards off on a fullish length, Short wrists it through mid-wicket for a comfortable single
batsman_bowler: S Kaul to D Arcy Short

comm: S Kaul to D Arcy Short, FOUR, that's a gift from Siddarth Kaul! Full toss wide of Short's off-stump, he stands still and bullies it through covers with a clean bat swing
batsman_bowler: S Kaul to D Arcy Short

comm: S Kaul to Maxwell, 1 run, 136ks angling into the ribcage, Maxwell stays on the back foot and tucks it square on the leg-side
S Kaul to D Arcy Short, 1 run, 133ks short around the hip, Short swivels and pulls straight to deep square
batsman_bowler: S Kaul to D Arcy Short

comm: S Kaul to D Arcy Short, FOUR, driven on the up! Sees the gap on the off-side and hits the drive between mid-off and extra cover to claim his second boundary
batsman_bowler: S Kaul to D Arcy Short

comm: S Kaul to D Arcy Short, no run, full on middle and leg, Short stays leg-side of the delivery and drives it to mid-off
batsman_bowler: S Kaul to D Arcy Short

comm: Bumrah to Maxwell, SIX, can't set a field for shots like those! Maxwell's top-edge and Bumrah's pace - 136ks - doing the trick there. Short and wide, Maxwell had a full-paced swing trying to pull that over the leg-side and it finds the edge before flying straight over the keeper
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, 1 run, 136ks, knocked away to deep square off the pads
Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run, 145ks length outside off, Maxwell punches to the left of mid-off and hustles across for a quick single
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, 1 run, 143ks full outside off, Short pushes the drive in front of mid-off and calls his partner through for a quick single
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, length outside off, punched into the off-side
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, good length nips back into the pads, beats Short on the flick and hits him slightly high on the pads

Shankar to Finch, out Caught by Dhawan!! Shankar gets his reward for bowling some consistent lengths. Scrambles the seam and bowls it slightly wide of off, Finch had his front leg cleared and he wanted to swat this over mid-wicket. Couldn't get any where near the middle and he slices it off the top-edge, only for SD to have a catching practice at cover. They check for a possible front foot no ball, but Shankar's absolutely fine on that count. Finch c Dhawan b Shankar 8(7) [4s-1]
Shankar to Finch, no run, 129ks pounds it on back of a length around middle, Finch pushes it down the pitch

Shankar to Finch, FOUR, 127ks again! Everything right about the delivery except for line and Finch has taken full toll of that. Drifting into the pads and Finch helps it away to the fine leg fence with a glance of his pads
Shankar to D Arcy Short, 1 run, 127ks on a good length around off-stump, Short tucks off the toe-end towards deep square
Shankar to D Arcy Short, no run, 127ks skids on from a good length outside off, Short opens the face and drills it hard, can't beat KL Rahul on the off-side
Shankar to D Arcy Short, no run, hits the deck hard on a good length and cramps Short for room, the premeditated pull could only travel as far as mid-on
S Kaul to Finch, no run, no width on offer, angles it full and straight, Finch respects it with a straight bat
S Kaul to Finch, 2 runs, misfield now! To the left of KL at backward point and Finch once again went hard on the drive

S Kaul to Finch, 2 runs, dishes this wide of off and Finch has smacked the life out of it, so much so that KL Rahul's full stretched leap couldn't cut the pace of it; parries it to the left of cover and concedes two
S Kaul to Finch, no run, a full-throttle swing and a miss outside off stump

S Kaul to Stoinis, out Bowled!! Siddarth Kaul strikes with his second ball and he does the Ashok Dinda-esque jump to celebrate the moment. Did the basics right did the Punjab lad. Bowled it on a good length and got the ball to seam in a fraction to kiss the top of off after beating the vacuous bat swing from Marcus Stoinis. Stoinis b S Kaul 7(11) [4s-1]
S Kaul to Stoinis, no run, good pace first up, keeps it tight around the fifth stump channel, Stoinis punches but can't get it past mid-off
Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run, good length outside off, Stoinis finds the gap wide of cover with a punch and will retain strike

Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, Just Bumrah things! Slower ball bowled full outside off stump, Stoinis had no clue about that, got committed to the drive and ended up dragging it off the toe into the mid-wicket pocket. Absolutely befuddled by the lack of pace
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, 135ks short of length on sixth stump, Stoinis jumps on the back foot and punches crisply to mid-off
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, tries to go too hard this time, skews it off the bottom half into the covers

Bumrah to Stoinis, 2 runs, pure timing from Stoinis! Just presents the full face of the bat against a length delivery and it races off the middle through cover. More of a punch than drive and Stoinis did well to time it off the middle
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, 1 run, back of a length angling away outside off, Short hangs back and steers it past the diving left hand of backward point
Shankar to Stoinis, no run, slightly fuller and wide of off, Stoinis drills it hard, but KL at cover dives to his right and saves a certain boundary
Shankar to Stoinis, no run, good length outside off stump, Stoinis' happy to punch this into the off-side

Shankar to Stoinis, FOUR, when someone's sitting on the back foot, the last delivery you would want to bowling is short and wide. Stoinis didn't find the middle, but he had ample time to clobber that in the gap through mid-wicket, Shankar's pace helped too...
Shankar to Stoinis, no run, good length a shade outside off stump, Stoinis firmly on the back foot, just pushes with soft hands into the off-side
Shankar to D Arcy Short, 1 run, shortens the length and angles it into the left-hander, Short goes on the back foot and gets a soft leading edge onto the off-side. They nab a quick single
Shankar to D Arcy Short, FOUR, straight off the middle and off she goes! A full pitcher outside off and D Arcy Short leans into the drive wide of extra cover. That shot was all about timing...

Chase to Hardik Pandya, SIX, what if MS hasn't landed his helicopter today. His protege - just kidding, mind - Hardik Pandya lands one and gets six. Full around off, Hardik Pandya powers it simultaneously releasing the helicopter. Immense bottom hand mechanics from Hardik Pandya and it lands in front of the sightscreen. India end on a high

Chase to Kohli, out Caught by S Thompson!! Third wicket in four balls. Chase doing all the damage even though Ireland are chasing this game. Kohli is hitting to the longest part of the fence, slugs this full delivery but finds deep mid. Third catch and the easiest of the lot for Thompson. Kohli c S Thompson b Chase 0(2)

Chase to Kohli, no run, no hat-trick. No wide as well. Curious call from the umpire. Short down leg, Kohli missed the pull and it flies over the glove. No touch and Chase gets away with the hat-trick ball

Chase to Rohit, out Bowled!! No 100 for Rohit. No cigar for him tonight. Or today. Chase now on a hat-trick. Rolls the fingers over this one and hits the pitch hard, Rohit aims mid-wicket and swings, but misses and the ball lands on top of the leg stump. Off he goes, head bowed. Still a fantastic innings. Rohit b Chase 97(61) [4s-8 6s-5]

Chase to Dhoni, out Caught by S Thompson!! Gone. Chase gets his second. Thompson at deep mid the catcher. Dhoni came rushing down the track, but could not hit it as well as he would've liked to. Holes out. Good bowling from Chase as he attacked Dhoni with a short of length delivery into the ribs. Dhoni c S Thompson b Chase 11(5) [4s-1 6s-1]

Chase to Rohit, 1 run, Shannon at mid-off, can ge get under that? No he can't. Waited for the hit to come to him, that's why he couldn't catch it. Dropped in front of his hands. Rohit made room and couldn't get under the length ball, thankfully he gets away
Rankin to Dhoni, SIX, sheer power. MS power. Dhoni power. Six. Overpitched and Dhoni smashed the white Kookaburra out of sight, powering it over Rankin and the sightscreen's head. 200 up as well
Rankin to Dhoni, no run, right up there, even MS can't do much. Dug out back to Rankin as the big man fires in the yorker on off
Rankin to Dhoni, wide, pressure. Tells on Rankin, bowls it outside the tramline and called wide
Rankin to Rohit, 1 run, shuffles across outside off and waits for the ball, it is full and he whips it to deep mid. Only a single
Rankin to Dhoni, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Dhoni turns the strike over by tapping it to the backward point region

Rankin to Dhoni, FOUR, superb shot. On a short of length on off, Dhoni swivels and pulls, weight into the shot and bisects fine leg and deep square to perfection. Slightly off-radar and Dhoni gets off the mark with a four first ball
Rankin to Rohit, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Rohit stands and slashes hard, but Ireland have a deep point in place, straight to him
Chase to Rohit, 1 run, again slammed hard into the pitch, on a short of length, Rohit advances and can only find extra-cover

Chase to Raina, out Caught by Kevin O Brien!! Caught at deep square. Short of a length into the ribs of Raina, following him as well, a meek lift up in the air and KoB catches it with ease. Raina c Kevin O Brien b Chase 10(6) [4s-2]
Chase to Raina, wide, slower loopier bouncer, well over the head of Raina and rightly called a wide
Chase to Raina, wide, just wide, went for the wide yorker, missed it by inches
Chase to Rohit, 1 run, slower delivery outside off, Rohit drives to deep cover
Chase to Rohit, SIX, miss the yorker and it is six. Against Rohit in this mood. Dangerous. Length ball on the stumps, bulleted back over the bowler's head and right over the sightscreen as well
Chase to Raina, 1 run, low full-toss on the stumps, Raina finds long-on with a muscled heave
Chase to Raina, wide, angling it across Raina, just wide of the tramline
Chase to Rohit, 1 run, wanted to smash that into the stands here, but can only get an inside edge to fine leg. The length ball on the stumps was there for the taking
S Thompson to Rohit, 1 run, very full on the stumps, drilled to long-on
S Thompson to Rohit, FOUR, finesse. A shimmy forward, gets outside off and sweeps the medium pacer, into the gap and hit with so much pace and power that it leaves deep mid a spectator
S Thompson to Raina, 1 run, length delivery outside off, Raina gets forward to drives to long-off
S Thompson to Raina, no run, missed out on a full-toss. High one outside off, Raina tries to guide it down but fails to make contact
S Thompson to Raina, FOUR, much more convincing shot. 8 off 2. Overpitched outside off, Raina gets forward and muscles the drive, beats KoB running and diving across to cut it off at long-off
S Thompson to Raina, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Raina drives and gets it in the air but into the gap, wide of backward point. Off the mark with four

Kevin O Brien to Dhawan, out Caught by S Thompson!! Can Thompson catch it this time? He does and relief writ large on his face. Lofted to him and looks like it is going to fall short, but keeps his eyes on it and slides to take a good catch at long-on. Does a double fist-pump. Dhawan c S Thompson b Kevin O Brien 74(45) [4s-5 6s-5]
Kevin O Brien to Rohit, 1 run, full on the stumps, drilled to long-on

Kevin O Brien to Rohit, FOUR, what a shot. Rohit is toying with these ridiculous Irish fielders and medium-pacers. Kevin O Brien cleverly bowled it well outside off after seeing Rohit make room outside leg, but Rohit somehow reaches out and slices it over short third's head

Kevin O Brien to Rohit, 2 runs, dropped by Thompson at long-on. Much difficult catch to the one he dropped last over. Ran in to catch the miscued lap-sweep, got there, on the slide, with two hands but it went down
Kevin O Brien to Dhawan, 1 run, yorker length outside off, dug out to backward point
Kevin O Brien to Dhawan, FOUR, low full-toss and pumped over the bowler's head. No chance for the straight fielders, low backlift too, rockets to the fence
Dockrell to Rohit, no run, full outside off, Rohit squeezes it straight to the fielder at backward point, no chance of a quick single
Dockrell to Rohit, SIX, slog-sweep and six. Over mid-wicket. On one knee and a mighty swing of the bat to clear the fielder. Second six of the over
Dockrell to Dhawan, 1 run, low full-toss on the stumps, Dhawan is doing all sorts of things now. Reverse-laps this ball

Dockrell to Rohit, 1 run, dropped by Thompson at long-off. What a miss too. Simple chance and it has been put down. Rohit lofted it off the back foot and didn't have the elevation to clear the fielder. Gets lucky
Dockrell to Dhawan, 1 run, fired in after seeing Dhawan come down, a single to long-on

Dockrell to Dhawan, SIX, six. Down the track and heaved miles over deep mid. The left-armer's angle helping Dhawan, struck that so sweetly, no chance for the fielder in the deep. India getting a move on now

Stirling to Rohit, FOUR, four more. This isn't helping Ireland at all. Backed away and had to reach out to this tossed up delivery outside off, got good enough bat on it, to hit the gap at sweeper cover. Not well-timed but four nonetheless
Stirling to Rohit, FOUR, one hand comes off the bat handle but it is four. Rohit backed away and sliced the full-toss, into the gap at sweeper cover, who ran but it raced away
Stirling to Dhawan, 1 run, fired in full outside off, driven to long-off
Stirling to Rohit, 1 run, slower and Rohit swings too early, off the toe end of the bat, dribbles away to mid-wicket
Stirling to Rohit, no run, Rohit missed out there, full-toss outside off, Rohit drives and finds extra-cover
Stirling to Dhawan, 1 run, low full-toss outside off, Dhawan toe-ends the drive, a single to short third
Kevin O Brien to Dhawan, 1 run, low full-toss outside off, Dhawan reaches out and slaps it to sweeper cover
Kevin O Brien to Dhawan, wide, down leg now, called a wide
Kevin O Brien to Dhawan, no run, Dhawan tries to do something out of the box shuffles across and cleverly Kevin O Brien bowls it outside off, under the whip and a good take by Stuart Poynter
Kevin O Brien to Rohit, 1 run, pitched up outside off, Rohit reaches out and drives square of the wicket

Kevin O Brien to Rohit, SIX, muscled. What power. Stayed back and biffed that length ball way back into the stands at deep mid. If you have to be critical, you can say that the length was a bit on the shorter side
Kevin O Brien to Dhawan, 1 run, slower good length delivery outside off, Dhawan swiped it hard but straight to the fielder at deep mid
Kevin O Brien to Rohit, 1 run, 50 for Rohit too. Just in, plonked his bat in and managed to get in ahead of the direct hit. From extra-cover

Stirling to Dhawan, no run, how is that not a wide? Only if Dhawan got a touch on that and it bounced into the ground before being caught by Poynter. Well outside off, Dhawan tried to reverse-lap that and not sure whether he got bat on that
Stirling to Rohit, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Rohit drives hard but extra-cover dives to his left and keeps it to a single
Stirling to Dhawan, 1 run, fired in full outside off, Dhawan reaches out to drive to long-off
Stirling to Rohit, 1 run, low full-toss outside off, Rohit eases a drive to sweeper cover
Stirling to Dhawan, 1 run, uses his feet and takes it on the full, stroked to long-off

Stirling to Rohit, 1 run, Wilson at cover almost produced a run-out with a good piece of fielding. Dives to his left and creates confusion between the two who are mid-pitch at one stage, but nothing happened as they get to their ends
Dockrell to Rohit, 1 run, Rohit defends with a closed bat face and takes the single to retain strike
Dockrell to Dhawan, 1 run, slower and on off, swiped across the line without much timing to deep square
Dockrell to Dhawan, FOUR, now he finds. Bad ball. Short and down leg, pull/swatted hard and wide of short fine
Dockrell to Dhawan, no run, a loud grunt of frustration as Dhawan reversed his hands but found backward point. Wasn't happy that he didn't hit the gap
Dockrell to Dhawan, no run, sits and gets outside off, paddles it to short fine, no chance of a quick single

Dockrell to Dhawan, SIX, what a way to get to fifty. Down the track and slugged across the line, kept deep mid interested all the way, but it looped over the head of the fielder. Dhawan raises his bat to acknowledge the applause
Rankin to Dhawan, 1 run, went for the yorker, but didn't get it right, full on the stumps, clipped to deep mid
Rankin to Rohit, 1 run, digs it in short, Rohit gets inside the line to pull, straight to the fielder at fine leg
Rankin to Rohit, SIX, magnificent shot. Backed away and even as Rankin followed him, the length was there for Rohit to go all the way. Carved high over long-off, into the crowd
Rankin to Dhawan, 1 run, Simi Singh at backward point, dives to his left and takes all the pace off the cut, a boundary is kept to just a single
Rankin to Rohit, 1 run, short of length and cramping Rohit for room, Rohit dabs to third man
Rankin to Rohit, no run, full on the stumps, Rohit drills it straight to the fielder at mid-off
Dockrell to Dhawan, FOUR, backs away and cuts, cuts hard, has all the legs to beat the diving fielder at sweeper, good effort but too much timing on the ball
Dockrell to Rohit, 1 run, slower on off and middle, worked to deep square
Dockrell to Rohit, no run, well bowled. Slower and dragged it back on seeing Rohit advance, defended back to the bowler
Dockrell to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan rocks back and mistimes the big hack across the line, but gets a single to long-on
Dockrell to Dhawan, no run, too early into the reverse sweep and is hit on the glove, nicely bowled, slower
Dockrell to Rohit, 1 run, tossed up outside off, eased to deep cover
Simi Singh to Dhawan, 2 runs, in the air and falls safely. Tossed up outside off, Dhawan went for a big slog-sweep, top edge went in the air behind the keeper, but not to any hand
Simi Singh to Rohit, 1 run, calmly works a single to turn the strike over
Simi Singh to Rohit, SIX, not long before Rohit imposes himself. Down the track and heaved to the longest part of the fence, at deep mid, the fielder is just a spectator there
Simi Singh to Dhawan, 1 run, quicker this time, Dhawan whips off the back foot to deep mid
Simi Singh to Rohit, 1 run, slower and an offie, Rohit turns it around the corner for a quick single
Simi Singh to Dhawan, 1 run, quick and it skids on from round the wicket, Dhawan though works it off the back foot to leg
Dockrell to Dhawan, 1 run, good bowling. Slows it up, Dhawan though after coming down the track, takes a single to long-on
Dockrell to Rohit, 1 run, another single worked around the corner
Dockrell to Dhawan, 1 run, beaten in the flight after coming down the track, yet he heaves it and it doesn't carry to the man at deep mid
Dockrell to Rohit, 1 run, slower on off and middle, Rohit works it down to long-on
Dockrell to Dhawan, 1 run, quick dart on off and middle, nudged through backward square leg
Dockrell to Rohit, 1 run, tossed up outside off, driven to the fielder at sweeper cover
Chase to Dhawan, SIX, that's comprehensive. Down the track and to the pitch of this good length delivery, smashed straight back over the bowler's head. Went a long way as well

Chase to Dhawan, 2 runs, sliced off a thick outside edge and can Simi Singh get there, running back from backward point, no he can't. Did his best with a dive in front of him, fingertip stuff, eluded him and they take two. A let-off for Dhawan
Chase to Dhawan, no run, pitched up outside off, drilled straight to the fielder at mid-off

Chase to Dhawan, no run, so much action happening. Dhawan was down the track, Chase dug it in short, Dhawan was early into the pull and takes one on the side of the helmet, deflects to short third, throw comes in and hits direct, but Dhawan hasn't gone anywhere
Chase to Dhawan, no run, short of length on off, Dhawan drops it near his feet and looks for a quick single, but the bowler got across in quick time to snuff that thought out
Chase to Rohit, 1 run, full and down on the legs of Rohit who flicks to deep backward square leg
Kevin O Brien to Rohit, 1 run, good length on the middle and leg line, nudged with soft hands through square leg
Kevin O Brien to Rohit, FOUR, beats the diving cover-point. Slightly short outside off, Rohit biffed the cut and got it in the gap. The runs continue to flow
Kevin O Brien to Rohit, no run, short of length outside off, steered straight to the fielder at short third
Kevin O Brien to Dhawan, 1 run, good length on middle, nudged to mid-on
Kevin O Brien to Dhawan, SIX, these medium pacers bowling on a good length is meat and drink for Dhawan. He gets forward and lofts through the line, all the way over long-off
Kevin O Brien to Rohit, 1 run,
Rankin to Rohit, 1 run, that's the line and length, back of a length with bounce outside off, Rohit drops it with soft hands to the right of Stuart Poynter and takes the single on offer

Rankin to Rohit, FOUR, can't err at all. Against these Indian batsmen. Sliding down middle and leg, with short fine inside, asking for trouble, Rohit flicks wide of the fielder and collects another four
Rankin to Rohit, no run, tight delivery delivery on off, Rohit defends with bat and pad together
Rankin to Rohit, no run, that should've been nudged away, angling in on the pads, Rohit falls over and wears it on the pad
Rankin to Rohit, FOUR, now Rohit launches the length delivery outside off over the leaping cover-point fielder, came off the toe end of the bat but had enough to clear the fielder
Rankin to Rohit, no run, back of a length with extra bounce outside off, Rohit steers it straight to the fielder at backward point

S Thompson to Dhawan, FOUR, had he left that, would've been a wide but Dhawan swings this leg-side delivery wide of short fine and it races away for four. Thompson's opening over has opened the floodgates

S Thompson to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan is in form. And Thompson is a medium pacer, right up there in his range, slower delivery outside off, Dhawan heaves high and handsomely over long-on. That gets the crowd going
S Thompson to Rohit, 1 run, good length on off, cramps Rohit for room but he dabs it wide of Stuart Poynter and takes the quick single
S Thompson to Rohit, wide, down leg, that will be a wide
S Thompson to Dhawan, 1 run, short of length on off, Dhawan turns the wrists to work the ball through square leg
S Thompson to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan gets going. Down the track and lofted it cleanly over mid-off, one bounce over the ropes. Good use of the feet and he didn't hold back
S Thompson to Dhawan, no run, nearly a caught and bowled. From round the wicket, took the pace off that one, Dhawan was a tad early into the drive, just short of the bowler
Chase to Rohit, no run, pitched up outside off, a cautious forward push to mid-off
Chase to Rohit, FOUR, another inside edge, but four. Through backward square leg, full and angling in, Rohit flicks and the inside edge races away

Chase to Rohit, no run, wild slog and Rohit gets lucky. Hint of nip back in from a good length, Rohit wanted to mow it over mid-wicket, thick inside edge onto the pads and it dribbled away past the stumps. Lost all his shape there
Chase to Rohit, leg byes, FOUR, wrong line. Four. Down leg, brushes Rohit's pads as he missed the flick. Beats Stuart Poynter who dove to his left, raced away
Chase to Rohit, no run, full outside off, Rohit gets forward to block
Rankin to Dhawan, no run, short of length on off, Dhawan taps with an angled bat to gully. Great opening over from Rankin, just a single
Rankin to Dhawan, no run, good length on off and middle, Dhawan defends forward
Rankin to Dhawan, no run, nice shot for no run, pitched up outside off, Dhawan gets forward to cover-drive, but finds the fielder, either side and it would've been a boundary
Rankin to Rohit, 1 run, Rohit is off the mark, full delivery on the pads, flicked to deep mid
Rankin to Rohit, no run, another tight delivery, attacking the stumps, hitting the bat hard, Rohit defends
Rankin to Rohit, no run, short of length on off, tight delivery and Rohit defends to cover, wants a quick single, but Dhawan isn't interested
Bumrah to Rankin, 1 run, near yorker at the stumps, squeezed back down the ground
Bumrah to Chase, 1 run, length ball speared into the pads, Chase makes room and punches it to cover

Bumrah to Rankin, 1 run, right off the toe-edge, rolls away to third man. The normal pace delivery from Bumrah this time, Rankin was late on getting his bat down after being set up in his methods by the previous two deliveries
Bumrah to Rankin, no run, cramped up again. Slower ball on leg, Rankin misses his flick and it deflects off his pad to the keeper
Bumrah to Rankin, no run, backs away to leg, but Bumrah cramps him up with a short of length delivery. Rankin is forced to defend to cover
Bhuvneshwar to Rankin, 1 run, length ball on middle and off, Rankin dances down and drags it off the inside half through backward square
Bhuvneshwar to Chase, 1 run, back of a length delivery on off, taps it through cover
Bhuvneshwar to Rankin, 1 run, steps out and drives hard to long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Rankin, no run, slower ball on off, Rankin didn't pick it initially but is able to check his shot and defend to cover
Bhuvneshwar to Rankin, no run, short of length delivery, jabbed to cover
Bhuvneshwar to Rankin, no run, back of a length delivery angled across off, Rankin attempts to punch it through cover but is beaten on the edge

Bumrah to Chase, no run, misses leg stump somehow. A very low-percentage swipe from Chase, especially against someone as skiddy as Bumrah. The length ball hurries through him and just bounces over the timber by the looks of it
Bumrah to Chase, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, chopped into the off-side
Bumrah to Chase, no run, yorker at the stumps, squeezed to mid-on
Bumrah to Chase, no run, beaten outside off stump. Chase flashed hard to drive through the covers but didn't stand much of a chance
Bumrah to Dockrell, out Bowled!! Nails the blockhole and smashes off stump. Dockrell was moving all over the place, and is now moving back into the dressing room. Dockrell b Bumrah 9(6) [6s-1]
Hardik Pandya to Dockrell, 1 run, back of a length delivery on off, clips it through midwicket
Hardik Pandya to Rankin, 1 run, clips the slower ball through midwicket
Hardik Pandya to Rankin, no run, dipping full toss, Rankin is taken by surprise. He tries swinging it down the ground but misses
Hardik Pandya to Rankin, no run, short of length delivery outside off, Rankin fails to ramp it away
Hardik Pandya to Dockrell, 1 run, punched down to long-on
Hardik Pandya to Dockrell, no run, skips down the track for an inside-out biff, but gets a thick inside edge to the left of Dhoni

Kuldeep Yadav to Stuart Poynter, out Bowled!! Didn't pick the googly. Kuldeep leaps in delight as the ball crashes into off stump. Poynter was playing for the ball to come into him, only to get squared up in the end. The length was full enough to ensure he didn't have much time of reading it off the pitch. Four for Kuldeep. Stuart Poynter b Kuldeep Yadav 7(9)
Kuldeep Yadav to Stuart Poynter, 2 runs, sweeps it away through mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Dockrell, 1 run, steered through point

Kuldeep Yadav to Dockrell, SIX, he has got right under this delivery, bang! Kuldeep tempts Dockrell with his flight, and Dockrell doesn't hold back. Just plants his foot down and swings it over long-off

Kuldeep Yadav to S Thompson, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Good contact from Thompson, but it goes only as far as long-on. It was a flighted leg-break, and maybe it was a bit too full to get a great deal of elevation. Thompson hits it flat and hard, but a backpedaling Hardik Pandya does really with for an overhead catch. S Thompson c Hardik Pandya b Kuldeep Yadav 12(8) [4s-1]
Hardik Pandya to S Thompson, 1 run, head-high short ball on middle, Thompson swings the pull away to deep midwicket
Hardik Pandya to S Thompson, FOUR, backs away against this short of length delivery and thwacks it through extra cover. Once he made the room, it sat up for him really
Hardik Pandya to Stuart Poynter, 1 run, off-cutter at the stumps, clipped through midwicket
Hardik Pandya to S Thompson, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, chopped through cover-point
Hardik Pandya to Stuart Poynter, 1 run, back of a length delivery on off, dabbed through point
Hardik Pandya to Stuart Poynter, 2 runs, full ball on off, Poynter's bottom hand comes off as he slices it off the outside half over extra cover. Mid-off cuts it off
Kuldeep Yadav to Stuart Poynter, 1 run, knocks it down the ground to long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to S Thompson, 1 run, pushed with the turn through the point region
Kuldeep Yadav to S Thompson, 2 runs, overpitched outside off, drilled through extra cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Stuart Poynter, leg byes, 1 run, goes through with the reverse-sweep way too early, Kuldeep's leg-break hadn't even arrived. It deflects off his arm past leg-slip
Kuldeep Yadav to S Thompson, 1 run, plenty of flight on this leg-break, Thompson bunts it uppishly past a diving Kuldeep
Kuldeep Yadav to S Thompson, 2 runs, bowls the googly way too short, it sits up for Thompson who punches it through extra cover
Chahal to Stuart Poynter, no run, the hat-trick ball is flat-batted into the hands of Pandey at short cover. Crowd catch

Chahal to Wilson, out Stumped!! And another. Ireland falling apart in trying to keep abreast. But what lovely bowling this is from the leg-break bowler. Enticing flight, lures Wilson out of his crease and then gets the ball to dip well in front of him. Wilson isn't anywhere close to the pitch of it in the end, goes through with the slog nevertheless but the ball turns across him for an easy stumping. Wilson st Dhoni b Chahal 5(9)

Chahal to Kevin O Brien, out Caught by Dhawan!! Chahal outsmarts Kevin O Brien. He knows his craft in this format. Tosses the leg-break out wide, Kevin O Brien reaches out to slog and lobs it right off the toe-end. Easy catch for Dhawan running across from long-off. Kevin O Brien c Dhawan b Chahal 10(5) [6s-1]
Chahal to Kevin O Brien, 2 runs, much wider of off this time from Chahal, Kevin O Brien reaches out and slaps it through extra cover. Probably came off the toe-end, the timing wasn't great

Chahal to Kevin O Brien, SIX, tosses the leg-break up around off and invites the wrath of Kevin O Brien. No messing around there. Clears the front leg and smashes it cleanly down the ground for a huge six
Kuldeep Yadav to Kevin O Brien, 1 run, flighted ball on off, pushed down to long-off
batsman_bowler: Kuldeep Yadav to Kevin O Brien

comm: Kuldeep Yadav to Wilson, 1 run, flat on middle and leg, clipped through backward square
Kuldeep Yadav to Kevin O Brien, 1 run, beautifully tossed up, it dips on Kevin O Brien as he tries to loft down the ground and ends up dragging it off the inside half to deep mid-wicket
batsman_bowler: Kuldeep Yadav to Kevin O Brien

comm: Kuldeep Yadav to Shannon, out Lbw!! Fired in from Kuldeep Yadav, beats Shannon for pace and traps him in front. This was a whole lot quicker than what his usual delivery is. Shannon bent down low to try and use the pace for the paddle-sweep, but he failed to make contact. So end of a fine knock from the opener. Shannon lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 60(35) [4s-5 6s-4]
Kuldeep Yadav to Wilson, 1 run, can't find the gap with the reverse-sweep, straight to Chahal at backward point
Kuldeep Yadav to Shannon, 1 run, flighted googly outside off, swept away to deep square leg
Chahal to Wilson, 2 runs, flat outside off, a touch short with this googly. Wilson camps back and cuts it through backward point, easy two
Chahal to Shannon, 1 run, darted in short and wide, Shannon cuts to sweeper cover
Chahal to Wilson, 1 run, flighted leg-break just outside off, chipped over the covers. It lands well short of the sweeper
Chahal to Wilson, no run, initially shaped to play the sweep, but Chahal had tossed this googly up pretty wide of off. So Wilson adjusts and dabs to backward point
Chahal to Shannon, 1 run, dragged down short outside off, slapped to the right of sweeper cover who keeps them to one
Chahal to Shannon, SIX, fires this full on Shannon's pads, and is dismissed. Swiped away over the long-leg fence for six

Kuldeep Yadav to Wilson, no run, tossed up, Wilson gets forward to sweep, effectively yorker length, misses, and it hits the boot. Massive appeal, but not given. Certainly hit in front of off and middle. Mysteriously not given. Hands on heads for the Indians.
Kuldeep Yadav to Wilson, no run, reverse-sweep, spinning down leg, but wide not given, because this one could have been hit by the batsman

Kuldeep Yadav to Simi Singh, out Caught by Kohli! The three-ball trap from Kuldeep. Chinaman, chinaman, wrong'un. Tosses this up tantalisingly and Simi Singh takes the bait. Doesn't read it off the hand, flicks and gets a leading edge that lobs up straight to Kohli at short cover. Simi Singh c Kohli b Kuldeep Yadav 7(10) [4s-1]
Kuldeep Yadav to Simi Singh, no run, coming in again, just short of a half-volley, Simi Singh is struggling with the chinaman, and is struck on the pad trying to flick. Stifled appeal, but

Kuldeep Yadav to Simi Singh, no run, the chinaman's stock ball, on a perfect length on off-stump, Simi Singh comes down the track and realizes immediately that it was a mistake; starts to shift his weight backwards immediately. Manages to gets a thick inside onto his pads and it rolls through to Dhoni who picks up but by this time he is back in the crease. Close call for the batsman.
Chahal to Shannon, 2 runs, half-volley on middle, a late whip away to deep mid-wicket for a brace, and that's a fifty for Shannon
Chahal to Shannon, SIX, again, too full, the leg-break, but in the arc for Shannon. Takes the risk of going against the turn and gets on his knees to slog-sweep that over deep mid-wicket for six
Chahal to Simi Singh, 1 run, yet another loopy leg-break, temptingly tossed up, Simi Singh reaches out and pushes it down to sweeper cover for a single. Caressed
Chahal to Simi Singh, no run, leg-break, loopy outside off, Simi Singh gets across to cut off the turn and sweep, misses
Chahal to Shannon, 1 run, leg-break outside off, tossed up, but too full, Shannon swipes that off the frontfoot to deep mid-wicket for a single

Hardik Pandya to Simi Singh, FOUR, poor end to the over, short and wide, and a well-placed cut away to the deep backward point boundary for another four. Not the best initiation to the UK for Hardik. Cricket-wise...
Hardik Pandya to Simi Singh, no run, short and at the face, well-directed, Simi Singh misses with the hook, and thankfully the ball misses the skull

Hardik Pandya to Shannon, 1 run, banged in hard on a short of length and straightening off the seam, Shannon plays for original line and commits early, gets a streaky leading edge over short third man but short of deep third man for a single. Lucky? I think so
Hardik Pandya to Shannon, FOUR, slightly on a back of a length this one, but on the pads, and an easy tickle to fine leg for four
Hardik Pandya to Simi Singh, 1 run, a tad short, Simi Singh gets into a front-on stance and comes across, dances his way into a whip towards fine leg for a single
Hardik Pandya to Simi Singh, no run, short of length delivery just outside off, tapped to point
Chahal to Shannon, SIX, leg-break too full, Shannon reaches out to slog-sweep and cuts off the angle for turnin the process, slogs it over deep mid-wicket for six
Chahal to Simi Singh, 1 run, tossed up delivery outside off, lots of flight, Simi Singh gets forward and across outside off, and sweeps it hard behind square leg for a single

Chahal to Andy Balbirnie, out Stumped!! Gone. That's Chahal at his best. Slows it up beautifully, even as he might have guessed that Andy Balbirnie was going to charge him, slower and tossed up outside off, beats the batsman's swing to leg. MS has the easiest of jobs to do. Andy Balbirnie st Dhoni b Chahal 11(14) [4s-1]
Chahal to Shannon, 1 run, looked like the slider, from the front of the hand, Shannon sits down to sweep, a thick inside edge to short fine, easy single
Chahal to Andy Balbirnie, 1 run, skids on straight, Andy Balbirnie punches off the back foot to sweeper cover

Bhuvneshwar to Shannon, FOUR, oh, an exemplary over spoiled by a marginally poor half-tracker outside off, Shannon backs away once again and places that square of the wicket and clear of all the fielders for four
Bhuvneshwar to Andy Balbirnie, 1 run, another slower one on a length, deceived, and an attempted carve towards cover goes off the inside edge to short mid-wicket. Miscued. Badly
Bhuvneshwar to Andy Balbirnie, no run, backing away again, Andy Balbirnie follows him with a short one on the gut this time, tries the pull but gets no timing on it
Bhuvneshwar to Shannon, 1 run, length delivery in that nagging hallway of uncertainty outside off, Shannon gets into a pouncing position and cheekily late-cuts that to short third man for a single

Bhuvneshwar to Andy Balbirnie, 1 run, fuller length delivery on middle and leg, following the preempting batsman who was backing away to the on-side, gets a thick inside edge onto pad and away to cover point for a scampered single

Bhuvneshwar to Andy Balbirnie, no run, length ball coming in and skiddy, Shannon tries a cute lap after getting on his knees, but gets hit on the neck-guard! The strap has come off, and surely they'll get it replaced? Yep, they do. All's well.

Hardik Pandya to Shannon, SIX, slower one on middle, Shannon anticipates it as you would if 5 out of 6 are slower, and nonchalantly whips that as it goes soaring over the deep mid-wicket fence for six
Hardik Pandya to Andy Balbirnie, 1 run, short one on the body again, Andy Balbirnie swivels his body to shape up for another pull, gets it away to fine leg for a single
Hardik Pandya to Andy Balbirnie, FOUR, short, this time it was predictable, Andy Balbirnie throws his hands at this cross-batted pull towards the backward square leg fence for four
Hardik Pandya to Shannon, 1 run, another slower length delivery on the stumps, Shannon is early into the whip, gets a thin inside edge onto body and they run a quick single
Hardik Pandya to Shannon, no run, another slower bouncer, this one slanting down leg, but Shannon tries a pull and gets a glove on it. Bounces once through to the keeper
Hardik Pandya to Andy Balbirnie, 1 run, slower short one, but the lack of width has restricted the batsman from freeing his arms. Manages to tap it late into the off-side
Bumrah to Andy Balbirnie, 1 run, fuller length delivery on leg and middle, Andy Balbirnie drags his feet across towards the on-side and punches that to mid-on for a single
Bumrah to Andy Balbirnie, no run, another marginally short one, Andy Balbirnie tries an ill-advised cut, cramped for room, and misses. Dhoni fails to collect cleanly
Bumrah to Andy Balbirnie, no run, shortish, pull attempted, and missed

Bumrah to Shannon, 1 run, he's dropped it! Rohit has dropped it! Length ball again, Shannon slogs over the on-side again, and gets the hand off the bat to slice it in the air. Almost zero distance, but Rohit hasn't quite spotted it well enough on the on-side and can't get under it. Dives forward at the last moment but too late. Where was Dhoni? Oddly enough, the mitt-man hasn't come around. Either way, poor work from the Indian fielders.
Bumrah to Shannon, no run, not much width, on a back of a length outside off, Shannon shifts his weight back and punches it towards cover point

Bumrah to Shannon, FOUR, length ball, perfect Test match length, seaming back in and skidding off the jute threading, Shannon has another wild heave over the on-side, gets a massive 21st century inside edge towards the deep fine leg boundary
Bhuvneshwar to Shannon, 1 run, on off, fuller length, and a cute whip away to short fine leg for a quick single
Bhuvneshwar to Shannon, no run, length delivery just outside off, Shannon trusts the bounce and whips it on the up towards mid-on
Bhuvneshwar to Shannon, no run, short and a tad wide, Shannon misses the cut, and it's through to Dhoni

Bhuvneshwar to Shannon, 2 runs, slower one, knuckle ball, Shannon is deceived by it, as suggested by that bottom hand coming off the attempted golf-swing over the on-side, steepler towards square leg, Chahal comes around, but misjudges it. Can't get under it properly

Bhuvneshwar to Andy Balbirnie, 1 run, no width, pitching on a back of a length and jagging in, cramped, and he gets it off the thighs towards third man for a leg-bye, umpire reckons there was a tickle on the bat

Bumrah to Shannon, FOUR, fuller length again, but before he knew that he backed away into the on-side to loft it towards the cover boundary, ends up getting a thick edge to the third man boundary for four
Bumrah to Shannon, FOUR, short, sitting up just outside off and angling inwards, Shannon stands tall and picks this a tad early, nails the pull to the deep square leg fence for four
Bumrah to Shannon, wide, wide down leg, collected by MSD

Bumrah to Shannon, no run, fuller length delivery on middle, angling in, but Shannon has that back and across trigger, so he is on middle. Huge appeal, but there is an inside edge on that attempted glance
Bumrah to Shannon, no run, length delivery just outside off, tapped to point

Bumrah to Stirling, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! Poor, poor shot selection, this. Short and just marginally wide outside off, Stirling tries another ill-advised pull and loses his shape, gets one hand off the bat, and top-edge it towards mid-off where Kuldeep comes around and takes it safely. Stirling c Kuldeep Yadav b Bumrah 1(3)
Bumrah to Shannon, 1 run, good length delivery outside off, skidding in towards off, Stirling hands back after the forward press and taps it on the head under his eyes towards backward point
Bhuvneshwar to Shannon, leg byes, 1 run, good length once again slanting towards leg and middle, a missed glance and off the pad into the on-side. A stifled appeal, but certainly going down leg

Bhuvneshwar to Shannon, 1 run, in the air! Very full, and again it straightens off the seam this time, Shannon expects true bounce and gets a steepling leading edge that soars towards long-off, but Hardik Pandya drops it running backwards. Looks like it's one short
Bhuvneshwar to Shannon, no run, skiddy from a good length this time, perfectly in line with off-stump, Shannon gets his forward press in and defends hurriedly
Bhuvneshwar to Shannon, no run, into the pads this time, and a polite nudge from the crease into the on-side
Bhuvneshwar to Stirling, 1 run, good length delivery angling in towards middle and leg, Stirling tried to turn it away but it held its line and got a leading edge down to third man for a single

Khaleel Ahmed to Ross Taylor, FOUR, this slower ball was telegraphed early, got to change the grip very late so that the batsman doesn't spot, but this was evident even before Khaleel Ahmed got into his delivery stride. Short ball, Taylor really had to put in all the power and he smashed it brilliantly to beat deep mid-wicket's dive
Khaleel Ahmed to Daryl Mitchell, 1 run, low full toss outside off stump, Mitchell mistimes the loft to long-off
Khaleel Ahmed to Ross Taylor, 1 run, no pace on this slower delivery, Taylor mistimes the pull to deep mid-wicket
Khaleel Ahmed to Ross Taylor, no run, oh he's come out of the crease and missed out on this full toss trying to smash through cover
Khaleel Ahmed to Ross Taylor, no run, outside edge but doesn't carry, slower delivery outside off stump, Taylor wanted to slash that hard and escaped with the edge

Khaleel Ahmed to Ross Taylor, SIX, honestly, how well has Taylor entertained us everytime he swings his bat across the line and connects well! Poor short ball, Taylor powers the pull shot over backward square leg for four
Bhuvneshwar to Daryl Mitchell, no run, the knuckle ball to round off his spell, moved away, beating Mitchell's big swing. So it's 4-0-37-1

Bhuvneshwar to Daryl Mitchell, FOUR, top edge, no fine leg, Krunal runs to his right from deep backward square, Khaleel runs back from short fine, both men on the ground but the ball comfortably evaded them
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, 1 run, overpitched outside off stump, Taylor drives it to extra-cover
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, 2 runs, full delivery outside off stump, Taylor leans forward and drives it to sweeper cover

Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Dhoni!! Bhuvi spots de Grandhomme moving across the stumps and bowled a full ball wide outside off stump, the batsman lost balance trying to reach for the ball and ended up edging it to Dhoni. Excellent hand from CDG. de Grandhomme c Dhoni b Bhuvneshwar 30(16) [4s-3 6s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Daryl Mitchell, 1 run, shortish from Bhuvneshwar, Mitchell pulls it to the right of Hardik at long-on
Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, no run, oh that should have gone to the fine leg boundary, low full toss down the leg-side, the ball brushes the pad and rolls to the keeper
Hardik Pandya to Daryl Mitchell, 1 run, low full toss, driven along the ground to long-off

Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, 3 runs, another mishit, big gap at cow corner, Vijay Shankar runs to his left and dives full length trying to catch the ball with his left hand, but didn't get there. Slower delivery, de Grandhomme mistimes the pull and gets away with it
Hardik Pandya to Daryl Mitchell, 1 run, low full toss, driven back to the bowler, oh Hardik fumbles, ball rolls to mid-off. Hardik not happy with himself
Hardik Pandya to Daryl Mitchell, FOUR, misses the yorker, bowls down the leg-side, flicked to the deep mid-wicket fence

Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, 1 run, in the airrrrrr and it pops out. Tough catch because of the power on it. In fact, Rohit was a little late in moving to his right, could have been pouched. Full and wide outside off stump, de Grandhomme hit the drive really hard on that occasion

Bhuvneshwar to Daryl Mitchell, FOUR, fourth full toss off the over, I am sure Bhuvneshwar will go back to the nets and hit that boot practicing yorkers. This is so unlike him. Mitchell launches it straight and hits it towards the sightscreen
Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, 1 run, low full toss outside off stump, de Grandhomme drives it to long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Daryl Mitchell, 1 run, yorker this time, Mitchell swings it away to deep mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, 1 run, low full toss from Bhuvneshwar, de Grandhomme flicks it to deep mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, a sin to bowl short and wide without third man, de Grandhomme has a lot of width to enjoy and he cuts this hard, beating the leaping fielder at backward point

Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, Bhuvneshwar goes for the yorker but bowls a low full toss, de Grandhomme spotted mid-off inside the ring, so doesn't try to do anything face, just a drive between mid-off and extra-cover
Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, 1 run, quicker and outside off stump, de Grandhomme drills it hard to deep extra-cover
Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, wide, darted outside off stump, left alone, may have been a harsh call for a wide

Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, FOUR, this was expected from the batsman, third man and backward point in, with the bowler bowl way outside off stump, it's obvious that de Grandhomme is going to try and slice it over one of those two men inside the ring and he did exactly that
Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, 2 runs, CDG knows Krunal Pandya is only going to bowl outside off stump, so he slices this loft to get it to deep point, Dhawan fumbles but manages to recover
Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, no run, this is flat and just inside the wide line, de Grandhomme swings and misses
Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, wide, 99kph fired way outside off stump, left alone

Krunal Pandya to de Grandhomme, SIX, "Aage, aage" shouts Dhoni, meaning Krunal Pandya bowled that too full. Landed right in the slot and out came the big slog from CDG, it's lost somewhere in the deep mid-wicket stands. Ball changed
Krunal Pandya to Daryl Mitchell, 1 run, a step forward and across the stumps to flick this flighted delivery through mid-wicket
Khaleel Ahmed to de Grandhomme, no run, slower delivery angled across, de Grandhomme tries to push off the back foot, beaten by the lack of pace and angle
Khaleel Ahmed to Daryl Mitchell, 1 run, worked away to deep mid-wicket

Khaleel Ahmed to Williamson, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! This is top edge, the slower ball bumper and it's only going to Kuldeep at short fine leg. A big roar from Khaleel Ahmed to let out the emotions. Williamson wanted to pull that to the long leg boundary with fine leg inside, lack of pace meant Kane had to generate all the power, in trying to do so, he lost his shape and perished. Williamson c Kuldeep Yadav b Khaleel Ahmed 27(21) [4s-3]

Khaleel Ahmed to Williamson, FOUR, Khaleel has got to sort this field out. If there is no deep cover, you can't bowl full and outside off stump, got to back of a length wide outside off to get third man and deep point in play, it's an easy front foot drive for Williamson past Rohit at extra-cover
Khaleel Ahmed to Williamson, 2 runs, now Williamson pulls to deep mid-wicket, cut off in the deep

Khaleel Ahmed to Williamson, FOUR, this is knowing exactly where the fielders are. Strangely there is no deep cover, he was more at deep point, so as soon as Khaleel Ahmed dropped the ball in the back of a length spot, Williamson rocked back and punched it hard to the left of extra-cover, also beating Vijay Shankar's dive in the deep
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, shortish delivery from Kuldeep Yadav, Williamson pulls it to deep square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to de Grandhomme, 1 run, punched off the back foot to long-off
Kuldeep Yadav to de Grandhomme, 2 runs, that's another edge off Kuldeep, de Grandhomme slogs and gets away with the edge as it clears backward point
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Williamson flicks it to mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! This is a mishit, are they going to catch this, it's Hardik himself and he swallows it. Look at his reaction, catches the ball, screams and almost wants to eat it. He's a livid man making a statement to his team-mates. Flighted delivery from Kuldeep Yadav, Munro went for the slog-sweep, ended up toe-ending it high in the air, long-on runs forward and takes the ball. Clever from Kuldeep Yadav to bowl it wide outside off stump and force him to fetch it to the leg-side. Munro c Hardik Pandya b Kuldeep Yadav 72(40) [4s-5 6s-5]
Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, no run, spinning away way outside off stump, left alone, not called a wide for some reason
Hardik Pandya to Munro, 1 run, low full toss, driven to long-off

Hardik Pandya to Munro, leg byes, FOUR, in the airrrr and the ball just evades the jumping Kuldeep Yadav at short third man. Hardik Pandya facepalms himself with both hands. That's how frustrated he is, should have had Munro early and he's now taken him for a six and two fours already. Pacy short ball, Munro was hurried by the pace, the ball flew off the glove and escaped the man at 45

Hardik Pandya to Munro, SIX, oh look at the height and the distance on this one. Hardik Pandya tried the yorker, lost it by some distance, Munro happily muscles that all the way over the long-on fence, he's making India pay every ball
Hardik Pandya to Munro, FOUR, low full toss, Munro flicks with a strong bottom hand grip, Vijay Shankar runs to his left and gets to the ball but he fumbles, India have been sloppy on the field
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, punched to sweeper cover

Hardik Pandya to Munro, 1 run, There's the top edge. Ohhhh my goodness! Khaleel Ahmed spills a dolly. The dangerman escapes. Such a brilliant slower ball from Hardik Pandya, brilliant because the batsman played early and he also got it to turn considerably, Munro checks the pull shot and top-edges it high, Khaleel only had to move a couple of yards to his right at short fine leg, went reverse cup style and dropped the catch

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, no run, oh lovely bowling! Williamson has had no clue to Kuldeep Yadav's away-going deliveries. This was the slider, Williamson was tentative in his crease in his defence, played inside the line and almost kissed that to Dhoni

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, outside edge, but it rolls wide of the man at slip, no third man, Pant runs from inside the circle, dives but loses the race, Williamson was on the back foot to cut, was troubled by the turn and bounce
Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, 1 run, googly on the off stump, Munro tries to defend, the ball rolls to mid-wicket off the inside edge
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, very full flighted ball, Williamson digs it out square of the wicket on the off-side

Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, 1 run, meanwhile, Kuldeep bowls the classic way of tossing the ball and forcing the batsman to enforce all the pace, Munro had to really reach out to cut this away-spinning ball to deep point
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Williamson drives it to long-on

Krunal Pandya to Munro, FOUR, this is seriously poor bowling, no point darting it in if you are a spinner and this was 104kph, a left-arm spinner typically tries to fire it wide outside off stump when a left-hander is smashing him, Krunal tries to do that and Munro knew what was coming, so opened the bat face slightly to get the placement over cover, expertly done
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, cramped on the back foot punch as Krunal Pandya followed him, Williamson found the man at cover
Krunal Pandya to Munro, 1 run, Munro wanted to slog that really hard, but ended up dragging it through backward square leg
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, fired in at 96kph, Williamson drills it to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Munro, 1 run, full ball outside off stump, Munro drives it to long-off

Krunal Pandya to Munro, SIX, ninth fifty for Munro! Off just 28 deliveries. Gets to the milestone with a powerful strike. It was a flat ball from Krunal and Munro flogged the slog-sweep over deep mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, no run, Williamson is beaten by another wrong 'un. He was on the front foot to push-drive and missed it. Dhoni whips off the bails, but Williamson's back leg was rooted in the crease
Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, 1 run, quicker ball, tucked to mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, SIX, that's been dispatched into the stands. A big strike. When you are struggling to pick the variations, bring out the sweep shot, that's exactly what Munro did here. Got down on a knee, the length was on the fuller side and Munro kaboomed it over deep square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, straighter line, helped on its way to backward square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, no run, googly and that turns a mile outside off. Williamson stays leg-side of the ball and was looking to punch it away, gets beaten by the away-turn
Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, 1 run, cut away to sweeper cover
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, no run, flatter ball, Williamson taps it to backward point and the batsmen decide againt the run
Krunal Pandya to Munro, 1 run, 110kph! On a short of length and just outside off, Munro taps it through the covers for a single
Krunal Pandya to Munro, no run, Krunal Pandya gets away with this wide-ish ball as Munro slapped it straight to extra cover
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, 98kph, short of length on the sticks, punched down to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Munro, 1 run, fired outside off from a short of length and Munro chops it to sweeper cover
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, darts in a length ball and Williamson tucks it to mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, Williamson walks down and dinks it to long-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 2 runs, lap-swept to fine leg

Kuldeep Yadav to Seifert, out Stumped!! Stumping appeal, the third umpire is called. Legal ball. Is Seifert's back leg on the line? Touch and go! Nothing behind the line, reckons the TV umpire and the call has been made. OUT is flashed on the giant screen. Another brilliance from Dhoni! He is so quick. Seifert got beaten on the outside edge by this wrong 'un. He didn't pick it and was looking to push it away. The ball ripped away and Dhoni was at his best. Reaction time: 0.099 seconds! Is that the quickest stumping ever? Seifert st Dhoni b Kuldeep Yadav 43(25) [4s-3 6s-3]

Kuldeep Yadav to Seifert, no run, a big appeal for lbw. Rohit listens to Dhoni and decides not to review. A premeditated reverse sweep and it was too full to be playing it. Replays show that it came off the glove
Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, 1 run, the quicker slider and Munro hurriedly turns it to mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, no run, good start for Kuldeep Yadav. The leg-break pitches around off and spins past the outside edge of Munro who was looking to push it away

Hardik Pandya to Munro, 1 run, shortish ball on the ribs, bowled at a gentle pace. With his back leg off ground, Munro pulls it behind square on the leg-side. Bhuvi runs across to his right and tidies up. The pacer did a good job to keep the batsmen down to a single
Hardik Pandya to Seifert, 1 run, slower ball, full and outside off, Seifert drags it to long-on with a wristy hit
Hardik Pandya to Seifert, no run, 137kph, short of length delivery on off and Seifert pokes it to point

Hardik Pandya to Seifert, SIX, hit through the line. Scrambled seam delivery, full and wide of off. Was the cutter as well from Hardik Pandya. Seifert reached out with a stride forward and lofted it over long-off
Hardik Pandya to Munro, 1 run, 120kph, back of a length delivery on the ribs, Munro tucks it to mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Munro, FOUR, the outfield is lightning quick. An off-paced short of length delivery and Munro stands tall to punch it away. Beats a diving Kuldeep to his right at mid-off
Krunal Pandya to Seifert, 2 runs, 20 off the over! Cut away off the back foot and Pant gets a hand to it diving to his right at backward point

Krunal Pandya to Seifert, SIX, Krunal Pandya is leaking runs here. He was probably aiming for the yorker, missed his mark and got punished. Seifert walked across, bent low and swept this full toss over fine leg
Krunal Pandya to Munro, 1 run, 104kph, short ball outside off, cut to deep point

Krunal Pandya to Munro, FOUR, almost another maximum. Krunal Pandya over-corrects and darts it wide outside off. That allows Munro to free his arms. Bends his back leg does the southpaw and clubs it over extra cover for a one-bounce four
Krunal Pandya to Munro, SIX, massive! Brings up NZ's 50. A flat ball on leg, Munro gets down on a knee and muscles the slog-sweep over deep mid-wicket

Krunal Pandya to Seifert, 1 run, a miscommunication, but Seifert makes his ground. The batter premeditatively came down the track and he had to adjust as the length was on the shorter side. He tickled it to short fine leg and was ball-watching. Munro forced his partner to go for the single
Hardik Pandya to Munro, no run, 138kph, bouncer and Munro is happy to duck under it

Hardik Pandya to Munro, no run, good ball! Pandya slips in the yorker at 137kph and Munro only manages an toe end that goes towards the keeper. Munro was looking to carve it away sans any feet movement
Hardik Pandya to Munro, 2 runs, low full toss, flicked away to deep mid-wicket for a brace

Hardik Pandya to Munro, FOUR, one bounce four! Pandya drops his length short and Munro pulls it over mid-wicket. That's his favourite area. There was protection in the deep, but Munro placed it wide of him. Vijay Shankar ran to his left from deep mid-wicket and stuck his hand out, but in vain. Collides with the ad-hoardings, nothing serious though
Hardik Pandya to Seifert, 1 run, skiddy in-angling short of length delivery and Seifert hurriedly tucks it towards backward square leg after shuffling across

Hardik Pandya to Munro, 1 run, 120kph, good length ball and it might have held onto the pitch a bit. Munro is early into his shot and the ball pops up off the top part of the bat, falls in the vacant mid-wicket region
Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, FOUR, easily done! Back of length delivery on the pads, Seifert helps it on its way with a half-pull. Races away through backward square leg. 16 off the over
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, 1 run, low full toss, wristed towards long-on and Hardik does well to keep the batters down to a single
Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, 1 run, off-pace ball on the pads, Seifert tickles it behind square on the leg-side

Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, SIX, that's a stunning shot! He's swept Khaleel Ahmed for a six. Premeditated, but effective. Walked across towards off, got down on a knee and broomed this full ball into the fine leg fence

Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, FOUR, an excellent effort from Vijay Shankar, but in vain. Ran back from backward point and dived forward with both hands fully stretched, got fingertips to it. In the end, parried it over the ropes. Seifert makes room by moving leg-side and he wanted to elevate this fullish ball over covers. Ended up slicing it over backward point off the outer half

Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, no run, 120kph, cutter from a shortish length and Seifert is early into his stroke - the pull shot. Gets beaten by the lack of pace and the ball rolls towards the off-side off his shoulder
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, 1 run, 141kph, Seifert brings his bat down at an angle and knocks this yorker length ball towards mid-on. Just 3 runs off the over

Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, no run, this is brilliant bowling. Another perfect yorker and Seifert can only dig it out on the off-side. Munro wanted a run, but gets rightly sent back by his batting partner
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, no run, 141kph, in the blockhole and Seifert brings his bat down in time to jam it out towards point
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 1 run, 140kph, Bhuvneshwar goes very full again, jammed past the bowler beating him to his right
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, no run, 140kph, another one in the yorker length, clipped to mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, wide, wayward ball, short and down leg, was the slower bouncer that went wrong. Ignored by Munro
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, no run, 139kph, Bhuvneshwar slips in a yorker right in the blockhole. Munro digs it out
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, 1 run, 135kph, very full ball on the stumps and Munro wrists it to the left of mid-on
Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, 1 run, back of a length delivery at 117kph, tucked to square leg
Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, FOUR, first boundary for Seifert. Change of pace, Seifert picked it, waited for the ball which was on a short of length and slapped it over the cover region
Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, no run, 137kph, pitched up delivery on the stumps, Seifert drills it straight to short cover
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, 1 run, 134kph, full toss outside off and Khaleel Ahmed gets away with it. Munro was looking to drive it through the covers and inside-edges it to mid-on
Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, 1 run, 131kph, length ball on leg and middle, tapped down to mid-on for a quick single
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, 1 run, 136kph, length ball angling in on leg, Seifert bends across and whips it through mid-wicket. 11 runs off the opening over
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, no run, pitched up delivery and Seifert drives it towards mid-on
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 1 run, back of a length delivery and Munro tucks it into the mid-wicket pocket for a single

Bhuvneshwar to Munro, SIX, Munro is underway! Gets off the mark with a maximum. Gives the charge to the bowler by coming down the track and smashes this short of length delivery over long-on. Good swing of the bat and off she goes
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, 1 run, a good stride forward and Seifert offers a straight bat to knock this fullish ball towards mid-off

Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, 2 runs, Bhuvneshwar searches for the swing as he hurls a full ball, no movement in the air and strays on the pads, Seifert works it through mid-wicket and gets off the mark with a brace

Southee to Karthik, SIX, New Zealand win the T20I series 2-1! A slower one on a good length, Karthik waits for it and launches that over the deep extra cover fence for six! A fantastic blow, but a little too late...
Southee to Karthik, wide, wide it is! Short one at the body, Karthik attempts the hook, sails far over the head, and that's called a wide!
Southee to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, full-toss on the stumps, drilled back to the stumps at the non-striker's end, and that's the match and the series unless there are any extras
Southee to Karthik, 1 run, very full delivery just outside off, whip-driven hard to mid-off for a quick single
Southee to Karthik, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, drilled down towards long-on, and he denies the single!
Southee to Karthik, no run, shuffles across, shapes up to lap-sweep, but the tramline moves with him - wide not called!
Southee to Karthik, 2 runs, attempted yorker length delivery, falls just a centimeter short, helicoptered away to long-on with a strong bottom-hand for a couple

Kuggeleijn to Krunal Pandya, SIX, 50-partnership, and this is a stunning hit! Inexperience, wild slogs, so many words against him. Thankfully he doesn't have Twitter out there with him. Picks up with length ball and throws his entire bodyweight behind it to launch it straight down the ground for a colossal six! A pivotal blow from India's perspective...
Kuggeleijn to Krunal Pandya, no run, off-cutter on leg-stump, jags away from the southpaw, Krunal Pandya loses the head again and swings across the line into the on-side, misses!

Kuggeleijn to Karthik, 1 run, half-volley just outside off, Karthik drills it straight down the ground, but a little too straight! Hits the stumps at the other end, and deflects into the off-side for a single

Kuggeleijn to Karthik, SIX, that's a game-changer! Dropped short, Karthik is still as can be, and swivels into the hook with the angle - calmly deposits it over the deep square leg fence for six. Nidahas flashback!
