Kuggeleijn to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, shortish outside off, Krunal Pandya throws the kitchen-sink at the pull, mistimes it away towards cow corner for a single. DK on strike now...
Kuggeleijn to Krunal Pandya, no run, length delivery on leg-stump, Krunal Pandya goes for the swatted pick-up, misses it completely. It was there for the shot, but he just didn't connect
Southee to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, backs away into the on-side, the yorker length delivery follows him, he opens the face and squeezes it out towards point for a sharp single
Southee to Karthik, 1 run, half-volley on the pads, whipped away easily to deep square leg for a single
Southee to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, inch-perfect yorker, finds the blockhole just outside off, Krunal Pandya digs it out off the toe-end towards cover for a sharp single

Southee to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, he's turning the see-saw in India's favour! Full-toss, just about waist-high, Krunal Pandya throws his arms at the width and laces that through to the sweeper cover fence for four

Southee to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, slower one from round the wicket, on a good length with some width, Krunal Pandya clears the front-leg and tries to drag that flog into the on-side, gets a little inside edge past leg-stump to the fine leg boundary for four
Southee to Krunal Pandya, SIX, that's smoked! Not even close to the meat, but a back of a length ball with width invites him to slap it off the bottom half of the blade over deep extra cover for six
Southee to Krunal Pandya, wide, short but too wide of off-stump, crosses the tramline, and that's a wide
Tickner to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, another short slow one outside off, has to manufacture all the pace, tries to delay the pull, but mistimes it towards mid-on
Tickner to Krunal Pandya, no run, short of length delivery in line with off-stump, Krunal Pandya tries to lofts through the line, loses his head, misses it completely
Tickner to Krunal Pandya, wide, shortish one but down leg-side, wide called
Tickner to Karthik, 1 run, short of length delivery with minimal width outside off, punched after rocking onto the backfoot for a single towards sweeper cover
Tickner to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, backing away into the on-side, Tickner follows Krunal Pandya with the short of length delivery, squeezes a cramped cut towards point for a quick single
Tickner to Karthik, leg byes, 1 run, shortish one, Karthik misses the pull, and it thuds off his torso towards square leg for a leg-bye

Tickner to Karthik, SIX, into the stratosphere! The cameras have lost sight of it, despite plethora of pixels packed in there! A half-volley outside off, Karthik gets his weight on the backfoot and lofts it high and mighty into the long-off stands for six!

Daryl Mitchell to Karthik, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the pads, Karthik tries swatting it away behind square leg whilst front-on and gets it off the bat, post-followthrough, towards short third man for a quick single

Daryl Mitchell to Karthik, no run, away-swinger on a good length and jagging away off the pitch, Karthik comes down the track and tries to nudge it towards mid-on, misses it completely - beaten on the outside edge

Daryl Mitchell to Karthik, SIX, short of length and into the body, Karthik was crabwalking across to get behind the line, blinded himself as the ball started to rise but managed to guide the pull high and mighty over the rather short deep backward square leg boundary for six
Daryl Mitchell to Karthik, 2 runs, fuller length delivery outside off, lofted just over mid-off for a couple

Daryl Mitchell to Dhoni, out Caught by Southee! Launched! On a good length on off-stump, clears his front-leg, and lifts it with that bottom-hand of steel, too much elevation, not enough distance, and Southee settles under it at long-on! MS Dhoni departs, and New Zealand believe, that they have the series in the bag. India have Karthik, and perhaps Krunal. They need a one-man show. Dhoni c Southee b Daryl Mitchell 2(4)
Daryl Mitchell to Dhoni, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, whip-driven towards cover - DOT BALL!
Kuggeleijn to Karthik, no run, back of a length close to off, Karthik defends it in front of point

Kuggeleijn to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Williamson!! What happened there? The bat and ball both are flying in different directions. India have lost their way here. 145ks back of a length delivery and Hardik is caught on the shuffle, he tries to pull even though he's cramped up and splices it near extra cover, the bat ends up behind the wicket and Williamson takes the dolly. Hardik Pandya c Williamson b Kuggeleijn 21(11) [4s-1 6s-2]
Kuggeleijn to Dhoni, 1 run, fuller and around off, Dhoni eases it to sweeper cover

Kuggeleijn to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, smartly bowled by Kuggeleijn, saw Hardik shuffle across and kept it close to him, punched down the ground to long-on and there was two as Bracewell had to slide and stop the ball, Dhoni was not interested
Kuggeleijn to Dhoni, 1 run, once again a cut shot finds Santner at sweeper cover, just a single
Kuggeleijn to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, short and outside off, Hardik flays it straight to sweeper cover

Daryl Mitchell to Rohit, out Caught by Seifert!! Huge moment in the game. Mitchell is pumped. He knows the importance of Rohit's wicket. Needless shot from the skipper. The runs were coming from Hardik's end but the adrenaline made him go after this ball. Full and wide outside off, Rohit throws his bat and just about manages to reach albeit an outside edge, simple catch to Seifert behind the stumps. Rohit c Seifert b Daryl Mitchell 38(32) [4s-3]
Daryl Mitchell to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, wide full delivery and Hardik reaches out to squeeze the drive to sweeper cover. It would have been a wide had he let go and he knows as he lets out a grunt

Daryl Mitchell to Hardik Pandya, SIX, super shot! That is a top top shot from Hardik. Slower delivery dips right in front of him, Hardik spotted it early, kept his head down and smashed it straight down the ground, half a dozen. He doesn't bother to even see where the ball is going

Daryl Mitchell to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, this time Mitchell does not get away with a full toss, Hardik moves across his sticks and thumps it with a lot of bottom to cow corner, deep mid-wicket moved to his left and dived, but the ball evaded him
Daryl Mitchell to Rohit, 1 run, another full toss that Mitchell gets away with it, Rohit goes with hard hands and the bat turns on impact, single to deep mid-wicket
Daryl Mitchell to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, low full toss on the pads, Hardik flicks it straight to deep mid-wicket
Tickner to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, good length ball and Hardik pushes it on the rise to mid-off, calls Rohit through for a quick single
Tickner to Hardik Pandya, no run, slower full delivery and Hardik walks into a forward defence
Tickner to Hardik Pandya, no run, on a length outside off, Hardik plays a loose drive away from the body and is beaten

Tickner to Hardik Pandya, SIX, he's announced his arrival in style. Off the mark with a maximum. Short ball and Hardik picked the bones out of that, quickly rocked on the back foot and smoked the pull into the deep mid-wicket stand

Tickner to Pant, out Caught by Williamson!! Maiden T20I wicket for Tickner. It is the pressure that got Pant out. The two quiet overs played on his mind. He gets a full toss outside off, could have had hit it anywhere, but bends his back knee and swipes it towards mid-wicket. Williamson standing on the edge of the 30-yard circle takes a good catch. Pant c Williamson b Tickner 28(12) [4s-1 6s-3]
Tickner to Rohit, 1 run, full delivery outside off, Rohit drills the drive to long-on
Daryl Mitchell to Rohit, 1 run, low full toss and Rohit biffs it along the ground to long-on
Daryl Mitchell to Pant, 1 run, very full and close to yorker length, Pant squeezes it out to long-off
Daryl Mitchell to Rohit, 1 run, no pace on the ball and Rohit goes hard on the drive, squirts an inside edge to the left of short fine

Daryl Mitchell to Pant, 1 run, once more wide outside off and Pant cue-ends the drive to extra cover, just a single and Pant is frustrated. He wanted more on that shot and he could have got it if he had middled it
Daryl Mitchell to Pant, no run, loopy delivery outside off, Pant almost swings off his feet and makes no contact. He had to reach out as Mitchell landed it just inside the tramline
Daryl Mitchell to Rohit, 1 run, starts with a 104ks cutter and Rohit is happy to just drop and run, over to Pant
Tickner to Rohit, 1 run, short and outside off, Rohit cuts it straight to Santner near sweeper cover

Tickner to Rohit, no run, slower short of length delivery and Rohit is through the shot early, wanted to pull but did not spot the change of pace, the ball sneaks underneath the bat and Tickner has wry smile on his face

Tickner to Rohit, 2 runs, fuller and outside off, Rohit flows into the cover drive and does Santner a lot to do near sweeper cover, he moves to his right and slips as well while picking up the ball, easy two
Tickner to Pant, 1 run, no room on offer and Pant tucks it to backward square leg, Bracewell ensures it is only a single

Tickner to Pant, 2 runs, short of length and Pant pulls it off his hips backward of square leg, all along the ground and he races back for the second. Placed it between the two fielders and hurried back
Tickner to Rohit, 1 run, offers space outside off and Rohit cracks the cut straight to the man sweeping on the off-side fence
Ish Sodhi to Pant, SIX, 23 off 6 for Pant! 16 runs off the over as Pant smokes the legbreak over long-on with all his might. India in the hunt as the required run rate is down to 10.5
Ish Sodhi to Rohit, 1 run, treks back and slices the short ball to short third man, does Rohit

Ish Sodhi to Pant, 1 run, drives this one to Williamson at extra cover and calls for a single. Rohit wasn't interested initially but then decides to take the single as the New Zealand skipper misfields and kicks the ball away in frustration
Ish Sodhi to Pant, no run, short in length around middle and leg, Pant sweeps it but straight to the fielder at short fine
Ish Sodhi to Pant, SIX, another brilliant shot! Reads the googly well and dispatches it over long-off for a towering six, does Pant
Ish Sodhi to Pant, wide, pressure to bowl against Pant, darts this one down the leg side
Ish Sodhi to Rohit, 1 run, and... Pant is back on strike as Rohit nudges this one with soft hands into the gap at mid-wicket. Initial call was for two but then Rohit decides to back off
Santner to Pant, SIX, 10 off 2 for Pant! Walks down the wicket and hacks the length delivery into the stands at deep mid-wicket. India need him to fire tonight, can he?
Santner to Pant, FOUR, that's the way! Pant wastes no time and puts the first ball he faces away to the fence. On his knee to sweep that away past the man at short fine leg
Santner to Rohit, 1 run, loop on this full delivery outside off, Rohit square drives it through the gap at cover-point and hands over the strike to Pant

Santner to Shankar, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! India lose their second wicket and it's that man again - Santner. Claims another wicket. Shankar was looking to play the slog sweep but he couldn't get the timing right on this one. Even the power wasn't that great as de Grandhomme at deep mid-wicket completes an easy catch. Shankar c de Grandhomme b Santner 43(28) [4s-5 6s-2]

Santner to Shankar, FOUR, elegance personified! Shankar has moved into the 40s with this lofted drive. All about timing once again, and yes not to forget the placement. Eyes the deep cover fence and puts it away for four runs
Santner to Rohit, 1 run, short in length outside off, punched through the gap at cover by Rohit

Ish Sodhi to Shankar, no run, Shankar is disappointed as he fails to get connection on this one. Was a short and wide ball outside off, the batsman was looking to play a square cut but gets beaten due to the extra carry on that. For a moment it looked as if there was an edge, but nope, there wasn't

Ish Sodhi to Shankar, SIX, two in two! Another tossed up delivery around middle and leg, Shankar is down on his knee once again but this time around it's the deep mid-wicket fence. It's the slogsweep and it's six more
Ish Sodhi to Shankar, SIX, quality shot by Vijay! Down on his knee as he lofts the legbreak over cover-point. Amazing timing
Ish Sodhi to Shankar, no run, legbreak, short and wide outside off, Shankar swings and misses
Ish Sodhi to Rohit, 1 run, drives the legbreak through the gap at covers for a single
Ish Sodhi to Shankar, 1 run, dipping into the batsman this legbreak and Shankar drags it down to long-on

Santner to Shankar, 1 run, another full toss around off, Shankar goes hard at it with lofted drive but once again he doesn't get the timing right, just a single at wide long-off. India need a big over as the required run rate is inching close to 12
Santner to Rohit, 1 run, low full toss outside off and it's been carved away to deep point by Rohit
Santner to Rohit, wide, gives this a bit of flight but keeps it outside off, misses the tramline too
Santner to Rohit, no run, quicker delivery around middle and leg, flatter too and Rohit watchfully blocks
Santner to Shankar, 1 run, advances down the wicket and chips this wide-ish delivery to long-off
Santner to Shankar, no run, touch short around off and Shankar knocks it back to the bowler
Santner to Rohit, 1 run, tossed up delivery outside off, Rohit square drives it and takes a single

Kuggeleijn to Rohit, 1 run, 57/1 in the powerplay! India would have wished for more, but this score ain't bad either. 146ks around off and Rohit chips it towards extra cover to end the over with a single
Kuggeleijn to Rohit, no run, in the channel around off, on a length and it's been punched to the fielder at mid-off

Kuggeleijn to Rohit, 2 runs, that's a good delivery, almost had the batsman in trouble. Rohit got squared up due to the hint of outswing and got a leading edge through the gap at cover-point as he tried to play across the line. Into the gap for a brace and that'll also bring up the 50-run stand between these two
Kuggeleijn to Shankar, 1 run, a low full toss outside off, Shankar gets down on his knee and carves it towards cover. Not timing well, hence he can get only a single, not more
Kuggeleijn to Shankar, FOUR, smacked over mid-off! Width on offer on this short ball and Shankar stands tall to thump it over Williamson at mid-off. On a bounce and into the fence she goes
Kuggeleijn to Shankar, no run, change of pace on that, slower one around leg and Shankar fails to lay bat on his onside flick. Was expecting for a faster one, had to adjust late, which he couldn't

Southee to Rohit, FOUR, another cheeky shot by the Hitman. Waits for the length delivery, opens his bat face late and steers it past the fielder at short third man. Finesse. Who says he's all about power?

Southee to Rohit, FOUR, India are getting these boundaries without much of a risk. Rohit waltzes down the wicket and drives this one on the up, finding the gap at extra cover to perfection, fine timing
Southee to Shankar, 1 run, 136ks, length delivery around off and Shankar heaves it to the fielder at long-on
Southee to Rohit, 1 run, 111ks, short of a length around middle and leg, Rohit picks the length early and picks it towards deep square leg
Southee to Shankar, 1 run, back of a length around middle and leg, Shankar hacks it to wide long-on for nothing more than a single
Southee to Shankar, no run, outswinger in the channel outside off, on a good length and it's been guided to short third man by Shankar. Had he placed it a bit finer, could have been a boundary
Tickner to Shankar, 1 run, ends the over with another back of a length delivery, Shankar bunts it in front of covers and keeps strike with an easy single

Tickner to Shankar, FOUR, how effortless a shot was that! Almost went the distance. Plays the back of a length delivery on the up and chips it over short third man. Just fails to clear the fence by a yard or two
Tickner to Shankar, wide, trying a bit too much is Tickner in his opening over. Bangs this short again but it sails over the batsman's head this time around. Easy call for the umpire
Tickner to Shankar, 2 runs, dipping into the batsman on a fuller length, Shankar clips it into the gap at mid-wicket and comes back for two
Tickner to Shankar, no run, a stare by Tickner as Shankar swings and misses at another delivery. Was in the channel around off, just a hint of outswing that manages to beat the batsman's wild heave

Tickner to Shankar, no run, bangs this one short outside off, seaming away from the batsman at 138kph, Shankar swings and misses. Got beaten due to the extra bounce that the lanky pacer could generate on that short one

Tickner to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length delivery around the thigh, the slower delivery at 122ks and Rohit helps it towards short fine leg with a drag, takes a single but was a touch slow to get to the bowler's end
Kuggeleijn to Shankar, FOUR, bowled at 150ks at the batsman who sends it at 200ks to the fence. On a length around off and Shankar clubs it right over mid-on. Stand and deliver stuff by the one-down

Kuggeleijn to Shankar, no run, angled into the batsman at 148kph, short of a length delivery that's been sliced to short third man by Vijay. Was looking for a single but Rohit sends him back as the ball travelled quickly to the fielder

Kuggeleijn to Shankar, FOUR, Kuggeleijn grunts out loud as he fires this one on the pads at 147ks, Shankar latches on to the opportunity, makes the use of the pace on that and clips it over square leg. The fielder in the deep was nowhere close to cut this down
Kuggeleijn to Rohit, 1 run, goes slow this time around, 119ks, back of a length delivery outside off and Rohit plays it with soft hands gliding it down to third man
Kuggeleijn to Shankar, 1 run, faster than the previous ball, this one came at 146ks and Shankar steered it down to third man
Kuggeleijn to Rohit, 1 run, 144ks for his first ball, not a bad start by Kuggeleijn. Just that he bowls this one on the pads and Rohit clips it away to deep mid-wicket. Easy single
Southee to Rohit, 1 run, on his front foot in order to cream his off-drive to the man in the deep as he retains strike
Southee to Rohit, FOUR, deft touch! Hint of shape on this length delivery outside off, Rohit waits for it to arrive and opens his bat late, like really late and steers it down to third man, neat
Southee to Rohit, no run, swing on that, wide of the crease and spears in a fullish delivery, hint of movement on that in-dipper as the batsman digs it out comfortably
Southee to Shankar, 1 run, 136ks, pitched up around middle and leg, Shankar clips it through mid-wicket and is off the mark
Southee to Shankar, no run, outswinger again, short of a length outside off and Shankar dabs it gently in front of point

Southee to Rohit, 1 run, 131kph, swinging away from the batsman in the channel outside off, Rohit steers it down to third man and gets off the strike. Being watchful here is the opener, having lost his partner early in this chase
Santner to Shankar, no run, darts this one outside off, quicker one and Shankar is tad too late to connect his connect, beaten for pace on that occasion

Santner to Shankar, 5 wides, that's a gift and India wouldn't mind that. Santner bowls a quicker one down the leg side and Shankar fails to get bat on his glance. The keeper fails to grab that too and that'll be five wides for the Men in Blue

Santner to Dhawan, out Caught by Daryl Mitchell!! Santner draws first blood, gets Dhawan! Bowls this one around leg and Dhawan goes for the slog sweep. Doesn't get the timing right and ends up fetching a straight forward catch to Daryl Mitchell at deep square leg. Not the kind of start India were looking for, but they've got a long batting line-up, shouldn't be much of a worry. Dhawan c Daryl Mitchell b Santner 5(4) [4s-1]
Santner to Rohit, 1 run, darts this one around off from round the wicket, Rohit knocks it to wide mid-off and opens his account
Santner to Dhawan, 1 run, drills this one down to long-on and gets Rohit on strike

Santner to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan's off the mark in style and so are India. A short and wide ball outside off, Dhawan reaches for it and slaps it through the gap at covers. First one of the night for the southpaw
Santner to Dhawan, no run, starts off with a full and floated delivery around off, Dhawan drives it back to the bowler
Navdeep Saini to Powell, 2 runs, 120kph, in the blockhole, Powell squeezes it out to long-on and they come back for the second. Fabian Allen makes his ground with a dive

Navdeep Saini to Powell, SIX, another poor ball from Saini. Slower ball straying onto the pads. Powell, after clearing his front leg, waits for the ball and plays the pick-up shot to send it over the fine leg fence
Navdeep Saini to Fabian Allen, 1 run, hit-the-deck-hard short of length ball, Allen stays leg-side of the ball and batters it to deep cover
Navdeep Saini to Powell, 1 run, in the slot at 120kph and Powell misses out with his hoick-across-the-line. Only manages an inside edge onto his pad which takes the ball towards short third man
Navdeep Saini to Powell, SIX, bad ball and gets the treatment it deserves. An in-angling full toss on middle, easy pickings for Powell who smokes it over deep midwicket. Came off the meat of the bat
Navdeep Saini to Powell, no run, slower cutter, Powell swings his bat hard and misses

Bhuvneshwar to Fabian Allen, SIX, flat hit! A knuckle ball from Bhuvneshwar, Allen chips down the track and fetches it from outside off before dispatching it over long-on with a heave. Didn't quite middle, but had enough wings to clear the leaping long-on fielder
Bhuvneshwar to Powell, 1 run, heaved away to the right of long-on

Bhuvneshwar to Powell, 2 runs, tag team work from Krunal and Pandey keeps the batters down to a couple. Powell cleared his front leg and flat-batted this length ball straight down the ground. Krunal moved to his left from long-on and parried it to the fielder running across from long-off
Bhuvneshwar to Powell, no run, full toss wide of off, Powell strokes it straight to extra cover. Three dots in a row
Bhuvneshwar to Powell, no run, another off-pace ball - 114kph. Shorter and wider, Powell is early to pull and under-edges it to the right of the keeper
Bhuvneshwar to Powell, no run, swing and a miss! A slower delivery at 120kph and Powell shaped up to hoick across the line, beaten on the outside edge
Rahul Chahar to Powell, 1 run, on the pads, tickled towards short fine leg for a quick single. The fielder was a bit lethargic in attacking the ball
Rahul Chahar to Fabian Allen, 1 run, quicker and shorter, Allen straight-pulls it to long-on
Rahul Chahar to Fabian Allen, no run, more air on this away-turner, Allen gets forward to drive and is beaten on the outside edge
Rahul Chahar to Fabian Allen, no run, tries to steer this leggie behind square on the off-side, mistimes and is stopped by first slip

Rahul Chahar to Brathwaite, out Caught by Washington Sundar!! Maiden T20I wicket for Rahul Chahar. Wasn't a great ball, but India and Chahar won't mind a bit. A short leg-break which Brathwaite had to fetch from outside off. Brathwaite rocked back to power it over cow corner, but got it off the toe-end of the bat. In the end, the skipper miscued the pull straight down long-on's throat. Brathwaite c Washington Sundar b Rahul Chahar 10(7) [6s-1]

Rahul Chahar to Brathwaite, SIX, Brathwaite welcomes Chahar with a mighty six. The length is on the shorter side, probably was the googly. Brathwaite was quick to jump back and biff it over cow corner
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, 1 run, Brathwaite allows the ball to turn and pats this spinning delivery to the left of cover for a sharp single
Krunal Pandya to Powell, 1 run, full toss outside off at 106kph, Powell reaches for it with a bent back leg and elevates it over extra cover. There's protection in the deep
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, 1 run, 90kph, fuller ball, Brathwaite eases it down to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, no run, hint of away-turn, pushed back to the bowler
Krunal Pandya to Powell, 1 run, fired in on leg, Powell gets down on a knee and sweeps it to deep backward square leg
Krunal Pandya to Brathwaite, 1 run, holds onto the pitch a bit and Brathwaite checks his push off the front foot. The ball is in the air for a while, but well wide of the short cover fielder

Navdeep Saini to Powell, 2 runs, shortish ball outside off, Powell stands back in his crease and dabs it to the right of third man. The throw is wayward and Powell wants the third run, but gets sent back by his batting partner
Navdeep Saini to Brathwaite, 1 run, a low full toss and that's been push-driven down the ground for a single

Navdeep Saini to Pollard, out Bowled!! Saini cleans up the dangerous Pollard with a well disguised slower delivery. It was the off-cutter from Saini and the right-handed batsman didn't pick that. In an attempt to work it through the on-side, he played it way too early and in the process outside the line of the ball too. The ball sneaked through the gap between bat and pad to crash into middle. Saini is delighted - jumps in delight before punching the air. Pollard b Navdeep Saini 58(45) [4s-1 6s-6]
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, no run, slower ball - 116kph. Pollard doesn't spot that and is early into his shot - the swivel-pull shot. Misses and is struck high on the thigh
Navdeep Saini to Powell, 1 run, 140kph, rib-tickler, nudged in front of square leg for an easy single
Navdeep Saini to Powell, FOUR, shortish ball at 139kph, Powell clears his front leg and muscles the pull over midwicket. That was struck hard
Krunal Pandya to Powell, 1 run, 94kph, fullish ball around off, Powell taps it towards cover with soft hands for a quick single
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, Pandya shortens his length and Pollard works it through midwicket
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, SIX, Pollard goes downtown and he collects his sixth six. It lands on the roof! Overpitched by Krunal Pandya and Pollard thumped it well over the sightscreen. Massive
Krunal Pandya to Powell, 1 run, full again around off, Powell gets forward and eases it to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, quick and full, bunted to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, SIX, Pollard reaches his fifty with a six! A full toss from Pandya and Pollard flogged it deep midwicket for a 87-metre six! It was a wristy hit
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, leg byes, 1 run, slower delivery - 124kph, Pollard doesn't pick it and is early to close his bat face. Hits his pad and rolls towards square leg

Navdeep Saini to Pollard, no run, a full toss and Pollard plays all around it, while trying to flick it away. The bowler appeals for lbw, but the umpire is unmoved. Kohli decides to review it. The impact was on the front pad above the knee-roll in front of leg. Missing leg and India lose their only review. The angle was always taking it down the sticks

Navdeep Saini to Powell, 1 run, well-directed bouncer at 133kph, Powell didn't see that coming and is late on his pull shot. Gets a top-edge that balloons up in the air and falls in the vacant backward square leg region
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, 1 run, Saini shortens his length, Pollard swivel-pulls it in front of square on the on-side
Navdeep Saini to Powell, 1 run, 135kph, back of a length delivery that opens up Powell a bit. The right-hander adjusts and runs it down to third man

Navdeep Saini to Pooran, out Caught by Pant!! Edged and gone! An away-angler at 138kph from a good length, Pooran plays away from his body for an attempted steer down to third man. Only manages an outside edge and Pant takes a good catch with both hands moving to his left. The partnership has been broken. Pooran c Pant b Navdeep Saini 17(23) [4s-1 6s-1]
Krunal Pandya to Pooran, 1 run, low full toss fired around off, Pooran whips it to long-on and takes a single to end the over
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, tossed up delivery by Krunal Pandya, Pollard push-drives it to long-on with gentle hands
Krunal Pandya to Pooran, 1 run, low full toss on the pads, Pooran clips it through square leg for a single
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, knocks the flatter delivery to long-on for a single
Krunal Pandya to Pooran, 1 run, moves across the stumps and bludgeons this one to long-on, wasn't middled to perfection, hence only a single
Krunal Pandya to Pooran, wide, 91kph, fired outside off, misses the tramline and Pooran can't reach for it
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, works this one to long-on for a single, does Pollard
Washington Sundar to Pooran, no run, darted on leg, was on a short length, Pooran looks to hammer it with a pull, but the ball comes off the inside edge and hits his pads
Washington Sundar to Pollard, 1 run, clips this one to backward square leg for one run
Washington Sundar to Pollard, no run, flatter around middle and leg, Pollard treks back and nudges it to mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Pollard, FOUR, Pollard making sure to get at least one boundary in an over. Goes down on his knee and slogsweeps this one to deep mid-wicket for four runs
Washington Sundar to Pollard, wide, quicker delivery down the leg side, Pollard can't connect his sweep, beaten
Washington Sundar to Pooran, 1 run, tossed up delivery around off, Pooran goes for the reverse sweep, but he can't beat the man at point
Washington Sundar to Pollard, 1 run, knocks the short ball to long-on and takes a comfortable single

Krunal Pandya to Pooran, SIX, partnership between these two has crossed the 50-run mark. A tossed up delivery to end the over by Krunal Pandya and Pooran smokes it over wide long-off for half-a-dozen. Plenty of sixes in the last few overs, was Pollard earlier and Pooran has joined the party too
Krunal Pandya to Pooran, no run, yorker outside off, Pooran squeezes it towards mid-off
Krunal Pandya to Pooran, no run, tossed up delivery outside off, full length delivery at 92kph and it's been left alone
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, 1 run, 87kph, fired outside off and it's been driven to sweeper cover by Pollard, Pandya is keeping it quick, not tossing it up against the right-hander
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, no run, full toss outside off and Pollard hammers it to the same fielder again, should have put that away
Krunal Pandya to Pollard, no run, quicker one outside off, Pollard drives it powerfully to Rahul at covers
Washington Sundar to Pollard, 1 run, this one kept very low around middle and leg, Pollard bunts it down to long-on and retains strike, once again..
Washington Sundar to Pollard, no run, tries to flick this one into the leg side but the off-break kisses the inside edge, thuds into the pads and lobs towards the on-side
Washington Sundar to Pooran, 1 run, loopy delivery by Washington Sundar around off, Pooran square-drives it through point and gets back Pollard on strike
Washington Sundar to Pollard, 1 run, darted on the batsman's pads, Pollard works it through mid-wicket for a single
Washington Sundar to Pollard, wide, quicker off-break that spins down the leg side, Pollard couldn't connect his glance once again. Kohli isn't happy with the umpire's call
Washington Sundar to Pollard, 2 runs, whips the overpitched delivery to deep mid-wicket for a brace

Washington Sundar to Pollard, SIX, spinners taken to the cleaners by Pollard! An off-break by Sundar, very full in length and Pollard tonks it over wide long-on for six more. He's dealing in sixes, not fours
Rahul Chahar to Pollard, 1 run, drills the last ball of the over to long-on and retains strike with a single

Rahul Chahar to Pollard, SIX, Chahar under pressure on debut. Tosses it up again, it's on a full length and Pollard lifts it over long-off with a powerful bottom hand, the fielder stationed in the deep was interested for a moment, but he could only watch it sail over him
Rahul Chahar to Pollard, no run, quicker one around the off-stump line, this one kept a touch low and it's been carved to point
Rahul Chahar to Pollard, no run, sharp leg-break and Pollard blocks it
Rahul Chahar to Pollard, no run, back in his crease to flat-bat the short ball to deep mid-on

Rahul Chahar to Pollard, SIX, Pollard might have faced him in the nets during IPL and he's decided to take him on. A leg-break by Chahar, Pollard stays put and lofts it over long-on with nonchalance. So much power in those wrists
Washington Sundar to Pooran, no run, floated around off, Pooran punches it towards extra-cover
Washington Sundar to Pooran, no run, loopy delivery outside off, Pooran drives it to cover
Washington Sundar to Pooran, no run, quicker off-break by Washington Sundar, Pooran goes deep in his crease and guides it back to the spinner
Washington Sundar to Pollard, 1 run, rocks back and knocks the shortish delivery to long-on
Washington Sundar to Pollard, wide, fires this one down the leg side, Pollard can't connect his sweep, had he done that, might well had been a four
Washington Sundar to Pollard, no run, flighted off-break by Sundar, Pollard keeps his eyes on the ball and eases it back to the bowler
Washington Sundar to Pooran, 1 run, slices this one through point and takes a single, Pollard's back on strike
Rahul Chahar to Pollard, no run, darted on middle and leg, Pollard comes on his front foot and blocks it with a huge stride
Rahul Chahar to Pooran, 1 run, slightly short outside off, Pooran treks back and chops it to sweeper cover, just one run
Rahul Chahar to Pooran, no run, slider outside off, skids along the deck and Pooran gets beaten on his on-side heave
Rahul Chahar to Pooran, leg byes, 2 runs, flatter on leg, Pooran's glance doesn't connect and it brushes his pads on its way to fine leg

Rahul Chahar to Pooran, FOUR, edged away to the fence! Pooran plays the leg-break with soft hands and it comes off the outside edge and races past the fielder at slip, was the Indian skipper stationed there and he didn't even think of giving it a chase
Rahul Chahar to Pollard, 1 run, slightly short ball around off, Pollard flat-bats it down to long-on and takes a single

Chahar to Pooran, no run, tempts the batsman with a length delivery outside off, this one keeps straight and Pooran leaves it, just like Pollard did earlier in the over. (3-1-4-3) - Chahar's figures so far..
Chahar to Pollard, 1 run, length delivery in the channel outside off, swinging away from the batsman and Pollard heaves it to deep mid-wicket, lost his cool somewhat as he played that rash shot
Chahar to Pollard, no run, third successive leave of the over, curving away from the batsman outside off, it's a length delivery and Pollard shoulders arms like he has so far
Chahar to Pollard, no run, back of a length outside off, shaping away from the batsman, Pollard shoulders arms once again
Chahar to Pollard, no run, teasing delivery in the channel outside off, hint of outswing and Pollard decides to lift his bat, doesn't flirt with this one
Chahar to Pollard, no run, pitched on a length around middle and leg, Pollard brings his bat down in time and clips it to mid-wicket
Navdeep Saini to Pooran, no run, 139kph, back of a length outside off and it's been steered to point by Pooran, good stop by the fielder inside the ring
Navdeep Saini to Pooran, no run, this one kept a touch low around off, skids along the deck and Pooran dabs it towards point
Navdeep Saini to Pooran, no run, 140 clicks, goes full in the channel outside off, Pooran comes on his front foot and push-drives it to covers
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, 1 run, short of a length around off, Pollard works it through mid-wicket for a single

Navdeep Saini to Pollard, SIX, shot! Stands tall and pumps the length delivery over the long-off fence, does Pollard. "Welcome into the attack Mr. Saini," says Polly. West Indies need a few more of these
Navdeep Saini to Pollard, no run, pitched up by Navdeep Saini and it's been driven to mid-on
Chahar to Pooran, no run, pitched up by Chahar, full length delivery and the batsman leaves it alone. Double wicket maiden for the senior Chahar

Chahar to Hetmyer, out Lbw!! Another one bites the dust, Chahar is on fire! An inswinging delivery by Chahar and Hetmyer gets beaten on his flick. Sharp movement off the deck too, nothing could the batsman so about it. Struck around middle and leg, and it might have probably clipped the leg stump. West Indies have no review left either, hence they can't even go upstairs. Has been the case for them this entire series. Pollard needs to rebuild for them again, can he? Hetmyer lbw b Chahar 1(3)
Chahar to Pollard, leg byes, 1 run, length ball around middle and leg, Pollard tries the flick, and it comes off the pads and rolls towards fine leg
Chahar to Pollard, no run, swinging away from the batsman outside off, very full length ball, almost a yorker and Pollard gets beaten again
Chahar to Pollard, no run, comes down the wicket in order to negate the movement but Chahar goes full, Pollard yorks himself and squeezes it into the off side

Chahar to Lewis, out Lbw!! Lewis has been adjudged lbw, and he's decided to challenge the decision. The only thing that can save the batsman is an inside edge, else this is plumb. Hitting the middle stump, in my opinion. Yup, it's hitting the middle stump and there's nothing on UltraEdge. Both West Indian openers are back to the pavilion and it's Deepak Chahar who's doing the damage. This length delivery pitched around off and came into the batsman, Lewis gets beaten due to the lack of pace and is pinned right in front of middle. Three reds and he'll have to walk off. Lovely bowling! Lewis lbw b Chahar 10(11) [4s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, 1 run, another slower ball - 120kph, a shuffling Lewis turns it towards square leg
Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, 1 run, back of a length delivery, tucked through backward square leg
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, 3 runs, 117kph, length ball on the pads, tucked through midwicket for a triple. Good running

Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, FOUR, first boundary of the innings. Another off-pace ball at 124kph, wasn't that short but the line was straighter. Lewis shuffles and swivels across to pull it square of the man at short fine leg
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, no run, slower delivery at 116kph, Lewis moves across and punches it into the off-side, can't find the gap
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, no run, 131kph, fullish ball around off, Lewis drives it to point off the outer half of the bat
Chahar to Hetmyer, no run, fuller than a good length ball, swings in too and Hetmyer knocks it to mid-on

Chahar to Narine, out Caught by Navdeep Saini!! Chahar gets the early breakthrough! Chahar shortens his length and Narine stands tall to thrash it wide of mid-on. There's no timing on it as it comes off the lower part of the bat. Saini takes a sharp low catch at mid-on, moving to his right and bending forward. Narine c Navdeep Saini b Chahar 2(6)
Chahar to Narine, no run, inswinger, Narine doesn't account for it on his attempted flick, gets hit on the pad. Was swinging down leg, hence no appeal for lbw
Chahar to Narine, no run, very full ball outside off, Narine wants to drill through the covers with cemented feet movement. Beaten on the outside edge
Chahar to Narine, 2 runs, hurled full, slightly overpitched with width on offer. Narine reaches out and wafts his bat at it. Goes over cover for a couple
Chahar to Lewis, 1 run, with a slip in place, Chahar starts with a back of a length delivery, Lewis moves back and across to pat it towards point

Bhuvneshwar to Narine, no run, beaten again! Short of a good length ball nipping away from the left-hander around the fifth stump channel, Narine sticks his bat out and the ball whizzes past the outside nick. Tidy start from Bhuvneshwar
Bhuvneshwar to Narine, no run, opens up Narine with this out-seamer, Narine looks to work it across the line and gets beaten on the outside edge
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, 1 run, after two ducks, Lewis opens his account. He knocks this length ball in front of mid-on for a quick single. Washington was a bit slow to get to the ball
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, no run, Bhuvneshwar goes fuller, leaves the left-hander and Lewis has a tentative poke at it. Beats the outside edge goes to the keeper on the bounce
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, no run, shapes away a bit does this good length ball, Lewis hangs back and taps it to off
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, no run, Bhuvneshwar starts with a fullish ball slanted across the left-hander, Lewis covers his sticks and shoulders arms

Brathwaite to Pant, SIX, Pant wraps it up in a glamorous way for India as they complete a clean-sweep. Brathwaite dishes out a freebie on middle, Pant keeps a solid base and lifts it with a straight bat over the bowler, launching it over the ropes
Cottrell to Manish Pandey, no run, wide yorker just outside off, Pandey is beaten for pace and fails to squeeze it
Cottrell to Manish Pandey, no run, cramps Pandey with a leg-stump short ball. He swiveled back to pull and ends up dragging it awkwardly besides the pitch
Cottrell to Pant, 1 run, fuller length and outside off, Pant reaches out and drives it - yanking his bottom hand off the handle - to long-off
Cottrell to Manish Pandey, 1 run, backs away to leg and wrists it to long-on
Cottrell to Manish Pandey, no run, 140kph, full and pacy zeroing at the stumps. Pandey with a closed bat-face block
Cottrell to Pant, 1 run, tailing on the pads, glanced away through square leg
Thomas to Pant, 1 run, Thomas shoots a yorker, Pant digs it out to mid-on and keeps the strike

Thomas to Pant, SIX, Pant is upping his game. This shot is a throwback to the IPL 2019 where he played a similar one against Bumrah. Sits deep in his crease, takes on this low full toss and flicks it incredibly for a maximum behind square on the leg-side
Thomas to Manish Pandey, 1 run, wafts it full just outside off, Pandey squeezes the drive to mid-off and sets off for a single

Thomas to Kohli, out Caught by Lewis!! No celebration whatsoever from the West Indies unit which says a lot. Nonetheless, Kohli's brilliant innings comes to an end. Went wide and bowled it very full, Kohli looked to slice it behind point but couldn't find the placement and picks out Lewis, who flies across to his left and completes the catch. Kohli c Lewis b Thomas 59(45) [4s-6]
Thomas to Kohli, FOUR, swatted over mid-wicket. Banged in short, Kohli waits deep and cashes in expertly
Thomas to Kohli, no run, jerking in, almost a yorker and Kohli jams it off the inside half onto his toes which then dribbles back to tease the stumps and remains stationary..

Cottrell to Pant, FOUR, there's the nonchalance. There's the half-century and gets a congratulatory message from his skipper. Fuller and down leg, Pant with all flair picks it up stylishly to send it behind square and 100-run partnership also comes up between the duo
Cottrell to Pant, no run, nippy short delivery, Pant is early into the shot and mistimes it to mid-wicket
Cottrell to Kohli, 1 run, this slower ball doesn't quite arrive as Kohli would've liked. Sits on one knee and drags it along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Cottrell to Pant, 1 run, another top-class delivery, gunning at the toes. Pant takes his leg out of the way and whips it to deep square leg
Cottrell to Pant, 2 runs, 133kph, firing at the stumps. Clipped to mid-wicket, runs briskly and collects the brace
Cottrell to Kohli, 1 run, short ball towards the armpit, Kohli swivel-pulls it to fine leg
Narine to Pant, FOUR, Pant tries innovation for the first time today and it has paid off. Preempts a reverse, sits low and brooms it in the pocket between short third man and backward point
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, quicker on middle, knocked down to long-on
Narine to Kohli, no run, slower and just outside off, Kohli orchestrates room for himself and punches it to extra cover
Narine to Pant, 1 run, flatter outside off, caressed to sweeper cover
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, tucked away behind square on the leg-side

Narine to Kohli, FOUR, wow! Execeptional batting from Kohli and that's his fifty. 21st half-century for the Indian captain. Picked this flighted delivery and hacked it through square leg. Acres of gap and despite a desperate chase from the fielder, the ball wins the race

K Paul to Pant, SIX, 110kph, slower ball in the swinging arc for Pant and he takes the ball journey over extra cover. My word! He's crunched it with some force and it's gone all the over. These are not small boundaries mind you. Such a flat-hit
K Paul to Kohli, 1 run, Paul pulls his length and wafts it short outside off, flayed square past point
K Paul to Kohli, FOUR, whipped wide of long-on and Kohli splits the gap. Fuller and just outside off, Kohli stayed deep in his crease and executed that shot
K Paul to Pant, 1 run, goes round the wicket and angles it on off, muscled it to long-on
K Paul to Kohli, 1 run, fullish just outside off, Kohli gambols out and slams it to long-off
K Paul to Pant, 1 run, shaved away to deep mid-wicket

Brathwaite to Kohli, FOUR, this is a tremendous shot from Kohli. This is the shot he was trying a couple of balls ago. Gets into a good position, flails his hands and spanks it magnificently over extra cover. One bounce before hitting the ad cushions. It was referred to the third umpire, who confirmed it after watching the replays
Brathwaite to Kohli, 2 runs, skews up in the air and it lands in front of Pollard at long-on. Gives everything, loses his balance thereby miscuing it. Another day it would've carried to the fielder
Brathwaite to Kohli, no run, slips in another off-paced delivery, Kohli charges out and flashes his bat, makes no contact
Brathwaite to Pant, 1 run, on the pads, flicked along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Brathwaite to Kohli, 1 run, converts this into a low full toss and uses the pace to steer it to point
Brathwaite to Kohli, 2 runs, leg-cutter just outside off, Kohli runs down the pitch and opens his bat face to smear it over point
K Paul to Pant, no run, very full just outside off, Pant drills it with a lot of muscular power back to the bowler. Paul offers his boot to stop it and that should've hurt
K Paul to Pant, SIX, this had to come, the run-rate is climbing and Pant goes big. Gets the space to free his arms and clobbers it over long-off
K Paul to Kohli, 1 run, swung across the line towards deep mid-wicket
K Paul to Pant, 1 run, pounds it short, rushing Pant, who mistimes the pull to long-on
K Paul to Pant, no run, bang! Wide yorker from Paul. Pant is late to jam his bat under it
K Paul to Kohli, 1 run, there's the patented Kohli whip, little uppish and dies in front of Cotrell at deep square leg, who takes it on the bounce and gives a wild stare..
Narine to Pant, no run, flighted fuller outside off, Pant with a half-hearted push to extra cover
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, leading edge balloons up to fall in no-man's land behind the bowler. Kohli chips out and closes the bat face early without noticing this tossie stoping on the pitch
Narine to Pant, 1 run, bit slower through the air, punched away to sweeper cover
Narine to Pant, no run, this one skids on and beats Pant on his attempted cut
Narine to Pant, 2 runs, spinning away outside off, Pant hammers the drive through extra cover. Hetmyer from sweeper cover runs across the circumference and keeps the ball in play
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, flatter outside off, Kohli pivots back and thrashes it to long-on
Brathwaite to Kohli, 1 run, Brathwaite continues with his cutters and this one tailed in a touch, Kohli gets fooled as he goes for the drive and inside-edges it to square leg
Brathwaite to Pant, 1 run, slower short ball aimed at the torso, Pant dances around and controls the pull to fine leg
Brathwaite to Kohli, 1 run, uses his wrists and places it to mid-wicket
Brathwaite to Kohli, FOUR, stand and dismiss stuff. Slightly fuller outside off, Kohli takes a step forward and creates room, nailing it in the gap at extra cover
Brathwaite to Pant, 1 run, shorter outside off, fierce bottom-handed slap to sweeper cover
Brathwaite to Kohli, 1 run, worked off the pads to mid-wicket
Narine to Pant, no run, slower on off-stump, blocked back to the bowler
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, quicker and drifting in, Kohli chops it wide of cover for a quick single
Narine to Kohli, no run, clears his front leg and hammers the pull straight towards mid-wicket
Narine to Kohli, 2 runs, looks to go over cover but on seeing the pace (quick) he decides to hurry back and open the bat face to stab it fine of short third man
Narine to Pant, 1 run, gets across and dinks the offbreak in front of cover for a quick single
Narine to Pant, no run, pitches on middle and spins a long way outside off to beat the poking blade of Pant on the back foot
Fabian Allen to Kohli, no run, flat outside off once again, Kohli cuts and its been stopped by a diving effort from cover to his right
Fabian Allen to Pant, 1 run, ambles down the pitch and nudges the flatter delivery through mid-wicket
Fabian Allen to Kohli, 1 run, hangs back and pulls the quicker delivery wide of long-on
Fabian Allen to Pant, 1 run, too short on leg-stump, pulled away hurriedly to the right of fine leg
Fabian Allen to Kohli, 1 run, opens the bat face and uses Fabian Allen's pace to knock a quick single on the off-side
Fabian Allen to Kohli, no run, comes down the track, knows he cannot reach the pitch of the delivery and smartly fiddles it into the off-side
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, fired in and keeps low around off, Kohli clears his front leg and hammers it along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Narine to Pant, 1 run, touch short on middle, Pant swivels and drags the pull to deep square

Narine to Pant, FOUR, cannot err twice in a row against a hard-hitting batsman like Pant. Waits deep inside the crease, and cuts the flatter delivery at the last possible instant to beat the sliding fielder at backward point
Narine to Pant, 2 runs, plenty of width for Pant to express himself and he throws his bat on the cut to deep backward point
Narine to Pant, no run, slower and wider of off, knocked back to the bowler with soft hands
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, ambles across and flicks the full delivery off his pads through square leg
Fabian Allen to Kohli, 1 run, opens the bat face and pushes the drive wide of cover does Kohli, retains the strike with that single

Fabian Allen to Kohli, FOUR, class! Knows Fabian Allen ain't getting any turn and so what does Kohli do? Stays deep inside the crease, picks the line wide of off and cuts the ball late in the gap behind backward point
Fabian Allen to Pant, 1 run, slower on leg-stump, Pant knocks it round the corner for an easy single
Fabian Allen to Kohli, 1 run, tossed full outside off, Kohli slices the drive wide of cover
Fabian Allen to Kohli, 2 runs, loopy on middle and leg, Kohli whips it through mid-wicket pocket and he's placed it in the gap yet again
Fabian Allen to Kohli, 2 runs, floated up wide of off, Kohli drives square on the off-side and completes the two with great ease
Thomas to Pant, no run, good length on off, played back to the bowler
Thomas to Pant, no run, full outside off, straight-batted push back to the bowler
Thomas to Pant, FOUR, sees the width, throws his willow and slices it over backward point
Thomas to Pant, no run, angled-batted dab to backward point
Thomas to Pant, 2 runs, punched off the back foot past cover, Hetmyer gets a hand and slows it down
Thomas to Kohli, 1 run, pitched up outside off, creamed to sweeper cover
Fabian Allen to Pant, no run, gets across and bunts the slider to mid-wicket
Fabian Allen to Pant, no run, quicker outside off, Pant cuts and finds backward point

Fabian Allen to Rahul, out Caught by Pooran!! Tries to go for the big one down the ground and reveals his cards way too early in the process. Fabian Allen sees all of that and denies any flight on the delivery; fires it quick and wide of Rahul's reach outside off and Pooran completes the formalities behind the stumps. In fact the replays suggest that Rahul got a thick inside edge as he tried to heave it straight down the ground. Rahul c Pooran b Fabian Allen 20(18) [4s-2 6s-1]
Fabian Allen to Rahul, no run, quicker delivery on off, driven straight to cover
Fabian Allen to Rahul, 2 runs, makes room and goes for the inside out drive over cover, the ball's flat and wide and therefore, Rahul manages a toe-end into the extra cover pocket
Fabian Allen to Kohli, 1 run, dishes out a full toss outside off, Kohli goes hard on the drive and gets it past the diving fielder at cover
Thomas to Rahul, no run, slower fuller ball outside off, Rahul opens the face and sends the dribbling towards cover
Thomas to Rahul, no run, full at straight at the stumps, Rahul shuffles and pings the drive to mid-on
Thomas to Rahul, no run, attempts to ramp this short ball over the keeper, but the extra bounce seems to be his undoing

Thomas to Rahul, FOUR, thick edge and it evades the fielder, jusssst! Rahul looks to go leg-side and had to restrain his momentum in the end, such's the width that his leading edge flies all the way down to third man escaping past the diving left hand of Cottrell who came rushing across for the catch
Thomas to Rahul, wide, short and too far outside off, Rahul throws the kitchen sink but no dice
Thomas to Kohli, 1 run, short and offers ample width for Kohli to crunch a square drive wide of sweeper cover
Thomas to Kohli, no run, back of a length around off-stump, Kohli hops in his crease and drops the ball dead into the off-side
Cottrell to Rahul, 2 runs, plenty of width outside off, Rahul drags the pull off the toe-end and it flies past the leaping fielder at mid-wicket
Cottrell to Rahul, FOUR, gets a hit-me down leg and Rahul gives it full treatment. Swivels to get inside the line and bam it goes racing into the fine leg fence...
Cottrell to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length on middle and leg, tucked off the pads square on the leg-side and the Indian skipper is off the mark
Cottrell to Kohli, no run, short of length outside off, Kohli dabs with soft hands into the off-side
Cottrell to Rahul, 1 run, on a length and angling away outside off, Rahul opens the bat face and steers it fine of third man
Cottrell to Rahul, no run, full on off, driven to mid-off

Thomas to Dhawan, out Caught by Cottrell!! Dhawan's poor run of form continues. Yet again looks for the pull and he's dragged it off the splice straight into the pocket of short fine. Cottrell grabs the dolly sans any fuss. Clever bowling from Thomas to persist with the same length. Dhawan c Cottrell b Thomas 3(5)
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, keeps it short around off, Dhawan tries to pull and instead splices it into leg-side
Thomas to Dhawan, 2 runs, pitches it up on off and middle, Dhawan slams it straight and the bowler deflects it (off his palm) wide of mid-on in his followthrough. Easy two for SD
Thomas to Dhawan, no run, throws his bat at fullish delivery outside off and the ekes a thick inside edge that flies to the right of the keeper
Thomas to Rahul, 1 run, gets across, gently taps the ball into the leg-side and rushes across to nab a quick single
Thomas to Dhawan, 1 run, short of length well outside off, Dhawan stabs it in the gap between cover and point and calls his partner through for a quick single
Cottrell to Rahul, no run, back of a length on middle and leg, tucked straight to short mid-wicket
Cottrell to Rahul, no run, full on off, driven firmly to mid-off

Cottrell to Rahul, no run, mild appeal for leg before but that's swinging down leg, Rahul tries to flick a full delivery and is beaton the inside edge. Doing too much perhaps? Windies don't consider a review...
Cottrell to Rahul, SIX, shuffles down the pitch and thrashes the ball in swagger as he launches Cottrell for a clean maximum over long-off. India off the mark
Cottrell to Rahul, no run, back of a length on middle and leg, tucked into the leg-side
Cottrell to Rahul, no run, pins the yorker right in the blockhole and Rahul can only jam it back to the bowler

Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, leg byes, 1 run, back of a length angled in and Dhoni is through his swing a tad early, misses it completely and the ball strikes him on the thigh pad before rolling behind point
Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, wide, sprays it down leg and Dhoni can't meet with the attempted pull shot, wide called

Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, no run, there was two and Dhoni has misjudged it. He expected Zampa to catch that. Hurried by the short of length delivery and the pull is top-edged towards fine leg, Zampa can't get there as it bounces in front of him and he runs past it. The duo don't run
Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, no run, runs down the wicket to put NCN off but he doesn't, short of length delivery and the ball flies past the swinging blade. That is three dots and a six in the over
Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, no run, sharp back of a length delivery and Dhoni crunches it straight back to NCN

Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, SIX, Vizag erupts. They needed this. India needed this. Full and outside off, Dhoni stays leg-side of the ball and goes inside out, frees his arms and muscles the loft over deep extra cover
Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, no run, full and slanting in, Dhoni hoicks and drags it off the inner half to deep mid-wicket
Pat Cummins to Chahal, no run, this was his chance to throw his bat, but Chahal is not built to clear the ropes. He tries his best to heave the length deliveries and mistimes it horribly to long-on
Pat Cummins to Dhoni, 1 run, short of length around off, Dhoni eases it off the back foot wide of cover
Pat Cummins to Dhoni, no run, fuller and around off, Dhoni mistimes the big mow and the ball rolls down to long-on, denies the single

Pat Cummins to Dhoni, no run, this should have been connected better. Length delivery right in the slot and Dhoni was in position to tower it over cow corner, but gets it off the toe-end and finds deep mid-wicket

Pat Cummins to Dhoni, 2 runs, India still searching for a boundary. Bit of width outside off and Dhoni flays it behind point, Richardson had some ground to cover from third man and he keeps it to a brace
Pat Cummins to Dhoni, no run, fraction short and Dhoni biffs with a cleared front leg straight to long-on, no single taken
J Richardson to Chahal, no run, he is happy blocking 'em. Back of a length angled in, Chahal drops it softly into the leg-side
J Richardson to Chahal, no run, short of length and Chahal is right behind the line to defend it back
J Richardson to Dhoni, 1 run, back of a length on middle, Dhoni knocks it in front of long-on, leaves Chahal with two balls

J Richardson to Dhoni, 5 wides, that will help India's cause. Wayward stuff from Richardson. Sprays it way down the leg-side and gives Dhoni nor Handscomb a chance to get anything on it. Races away to the fence and hands India some bonus runs

J Richardson to Dhoni, no run, three dots in a row.. Sharp short of length delivery and Dhoni is rushed on the pull shot, he still goes through and splices it towards mid-wicket, just lands in front of NCN
J Richardson to Dhoni, no run, shortens the length and Dhoni clears his front leg to have a crack, mistimes the pull to mid-wicket
J Richardson to Dhoni, no run, on a length outside off, Dhoni pushes it to mid-off and decides against the quick single

Pat Cummins to Chahal, no run, gets a loud cheer from the crowd for keeping this delivery out. Even Chahal is batting a couple of spots higher than his usual number. Full delivery on off-stump, he blocks it solildy to cover

Pat Cummins to U Yadav, out Lbw!! This was a matter of time. Umesh batting at 8 was never a good choice. He kept shuffling across the stumps and Cummins had noted that, keeps one straight and beats him for pace, struck right in front of the stumps. That is as plumb as you can get. India in trouble of being bowled out. U Yadav lbw b Pat Cummins 2(4)

Pat Cummins to Dhoni, 1 run, even bad deliveries are finding the fielders. Short and outside off, Dhoni slashes the cut uppishly but picks out third man on the bounce, just a single. Needed to place it better
Pat Cummins to U Yadav, 1 run, opened up by this length delivery and Umesh does well to play it with soft hands, the outside edge rolls down to third man
Pat Cummins to Dhoni, 1 run, offers space outside off and Dhoni crunches it straight to sweeper cover
Pat Cummins to U Yadav, 1 run, fuller and outside off, Umesh eases it to mid-off and sets off, brings Dhoni back on strike
Pat Cummins to U Yadav, wide, shuffles across and gets inside the line of this slanter, goes past leg-stump and Cummins is not happy with the wide call
J Richardson to Dhoni, no run, on a length and close to off, Dhoni pushes it to cover and that is another quiet over
J Richardson to U Yadav, leg byes, 1 run, stifled appeal for LBW. Umesh walks across and misses the flick, the ball deflects off the thigh pad
J Richardson to Dhoni, 1 run, dug in short and Dhoni mistimes the pull to deep backward square leg, just a single
J Richardson to Dhoni, no run, back of a length on off, Dhoni knocks it back down the wicket
J Richardson to Dhoni, no run, tucks the batsman for space, Dhoni taps it straight to mid-wicket
J Richardson to Dhoni, 2 runs, straying on the pads and Dhoni clips it backward of square leg, fine leg fumbles and the second is stolen quite comfortably

Coulter-Nile to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Maxwell!! Reckless! That is what you can call this shot. There was no need to play this shot, especially with half the side back in the pavilion. Short of length and NCN generates the extra bit of climb, Krunal wanted to pull but is beaten for pace and bounce, the top-edge skies up near cover-point and Maxi calls for the catch. Krunal Pandya c Maxwell b Coulter-Nile 1(6)

Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, 1 run, bit of hesitation but no harm done. Dhoni drops it into the off-side and starts off, then stops but upon seeing Krunal run through, he races to the other end. The fielder fails to collect the ball
Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, 2 runs, full and drifting on the pads, Dhoni flicks it past mid-wicket and it is an easy brace as Cummins cleans up from long-on
Coulter-Nile to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, angled in at the stumps, Krunal shuffles and whips it to long leg. He was a goner had he missed that
Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, 1 run, short of length around off, Dhoni punches it square of the wicket on the off-side

Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, no run, for the second time Dhoni has missed out on a cut shot by playing outside the line. It is touch short and outside off, Dhoni wafts and is beaten on the inside edge. Barely carries to Handscomb
Zampa to Krunal Pandya, no run, wrong 'un turning away and Krunal cuts it with the turn to backward point, Cummins ensures the single is not taken
Zampa to Krunal Pandya, no run, quicker and attacking the stumps, Krunal turns it towards mid-wicket
Zampa to Krunal Pandya, no run, tries a cheeky reverse sweep as the line was outside off, fails to make contact
Zampa to Krunal Pandya, no run, googly first up to the southpaw, Krunal prods forward and defends to cover
Zampa to Dhoni, 1 run, leaves the crease and almost yorks himself, dug out in front of square on the leg-side
Zampa to Dhoni, no run, flatter delivery and Dhoni knocks it to the right of Zampa, who restricts the single

Coulter-Nile to Karthik, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Pin drop silence at Vizag. Second wicket for NCN and India are really in trouble. A nothing shot from DK. He walks down the wicket and the length decks in slightly, looks to drive and leaves a gap for the ball to sneak through. The middle-stump is flattened. So both Pant and Karthik fail to deliver today. Karthik b Coulter-Nile 1(3)
Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, 1 run, short of length outside off, Dhoni punches it square on the off-side, sweeper tidies up
Coulter-Nile to Karthik, 1 run, shortens the length and is around the hips, tucked wide of mid-wicket
Coulter-Nile to Karthik, no run, fuller than a good length and Karthik offers a straight bat as he knocks it back

Coulter-Nile to Rahul, out Caught by Finch!! Fifty and out! Rahul shakes his head as he walks back. A shot that has brought him plenty of runs in this innings brings about his downfall as well. He makes room to elevate the length delivery over mid-off, but gets it right off the toe-end and it balloons towards Finch who is standing right on the edge of the 30-yard circle. India losing their way a bit. Rahul c Finch b Coulter-Nile 50(36) [4s-6 6s-1]
Coulter-Nile to Dhoni, 1 run, runs down the wicket and steers the short of length delivery to third man
D Arcy Short to Dhoni, 1 run, drops it short outside off, Dhoni chops the cut wide (left) of cover

D Arcy Short to Dhoni, 2 runs, another tight second. Dhoni works it towards deep mid-wicket and called for two, Rahul had to put the skates and dive at the bowler's end to make his crease, he survives as the throw was off target

D Arcy Short to Rahul, 1 run, fifty for Rahul. That is the way you announce your arrival back to the team. He raises the bat and is congratulated by the former skipper. Rahul waits in the crease to this googly and nurdles it into the vast vacant spaces on the leg-side
D Arcy Short to Rahul, no run, googly and Rahul plays against the spin, closes the bat face and the leading edge rolls back to Short, who deflects it onto the stumps but Dhoni had made it back in
D Arcy Short to Dhoni, 1 run, wrong 'un and Dhoni gently nudges it square on the leg-side, for a single
D Arcy Short to Rahul, 1 run, dipping low full toss and Rahul clips it to deep mid-wicket
Pat Cummins to Rahul, 1 run, short and does not bounce as much as Rahul expected, he adjusts and pulls it to fine leg
Pat Cummins to Dhoni, 1 run, back of a length around off, Dhoni eases it wide of cover to rotate strike

Pat Cummins to Dhoni, 2 runs, too full and outside off, Dhoni drives off the cue-end behind point and charges back for a second. He was in trouble had Handscomb collected the ball and whipped the bails off
Pat Cummins to Dhoni, no run, fuller and around off, Dhoni goes for the drive on the rise and is beaten. This time on the outside edge, he is finding Cummins's pace too hot to handle
Pat Cummins to Dhoni, no run, fraction short and outside off, Dhoni throws his bat but it is outside the line, he was beaten on the inside edge. Too quick and not short enough to play that shot
Pat Cummins to Rahul, 1 run, angled in from a length, Rahul clips it in front of square on the leg-side

D Arcy Short to Pant, out Pant Run Out!! Sheer brilliance of Behrendorff fetches Australia this wicket. Pant's terrible run in T20I continues. He comes down the track and wanted to cut it past cover where the lanky fast bowler dives dramatically, stops it from going further and hurls the throw to Handscomb quickly. Pant was a pretty long way down and there was no way he could have made it back. Handscomb takes off the bails without much fuss and Pant was way short. Pant run out (Behrendorff/Handscomb) 3(5)
D Arcy Short to Rahul, 1 run, flighted one on the stumps and Rahul eases it with the turn to long-on for a single
D Arcy Short to Pant, 1 run, stays in the crease and mistimes the punch wide of cover for a single
D Arcy Short to Pant, no run, this one keeps a touch low and it went under the bat of Pant who was attempting a punch wide of cover
D Arcy Short to Rahul, 1 run, flatter one on the stumps and Rahul pulls it to deep mid-wicket
D Arcy Short to Pant, 1 run, pulls it to deep square leg for a single
Zampa to Rahul, SIX, wow! If Virat can't hit out of the park, Rahul will! It was a googly, Rahul picks it up off the hand, comes down the track and larrups it over long-on for a maximum
Zampa to Pant, 1 run, smashes it straight down the ground for a single

Zampa to Kohli, out Caught by Coulter-Nile!! One of those rare days when Kohli fails to convert his start. Beautiful delivery from Zampa, he tosses this one and gets some assistance off the deck. Kohli dances down the track but fails to reach close to the ball. He still goes through with the shot but fails to time it as well as he would have liked. It was hit hard though and Coulter-Nile takes a really good catch at long-on. Kohli c Coulter-Nile b Zampa 24(17) [4s-3]
Zampa to Rahul, 1 run, Rahul advances, Zampa saw that and delivers it short, he mistimes the punch straight down the ground
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run, it was on the stumps and Kohli uses bottom hand to drive it straight down the ground
Zampa to Kohli, 2 runs, drives it with the turn, cover fielder fails to collect it cleanly and that will allow Kohli to take a brace
Pat Cummins to Rahul, 2 runs, mistimes the flick but gets it wide of deep mid-wicket and they will take a brace. 50-run partnership comes up
Pat Cummins to Rahul, no run, length delivery, Rahul backs away and wanted to punch it over cover. He was beaten by the sheer pace on this delivery and ends up making no contact
Pat Cummins to Kohli, 1 run, it isn't the best deck to bat on. This was one was on a short of length and Kohli mistimes the pull, he wanted to hit it squarer but ends up slapping it to long-on
Pat Cummins to Rahul, 1 run, now that pick-up shot of his. It was around off and Rahul uses bottom hand to flick it uppishly, finds deep square leg
Pat Cummins to Kohli, 1 run, this one bounces a touch extra than Kohli would have anticipated. But Virat controls it well and runs it down to third man
Pat Cummins to Rahul, 1 run, on a length and on the stumps, Rahul gets outside the line of the ball and clips it to deep mid-wicket
Zampa to Rahul, 1 run, goes back and steers it wide of point to retain strike
Zampa to Rahul, wide, this one was marginal. It was wide of off but I guess just inside the tramline but umpire calls it wide
Zampa to Rahul, wide, down the leg-side, wide called
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run, goes on the back foot and works it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Zampa to Rahul, 1 run, quicker one on the stumps, Rahul goes on the back foot, he was hurried by the ball a touch and ends up mistiming the pull shot to the leg-side for a single

Zampa to Rahul, FOUR, gee! That has been clobbered. Absolutely clobbered. He uses his feet to reach close and then creams it straight down the ground. The straight fielders had no chance as it rockets to the fence
Zampa to Rahul, no run, good idea, he wanted to reverse sweep with the turn, connects well but finds short third
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run, goes back and knocks it down to long-on for a single

Coulter-Nile to Rahul, FOUR, four to end the powerplay. It was a length delivery on the stumps, Rahul backs away, manufactures room and lofts it over point for a boundary. He opened the bat face intentionally to get the placement right
Coulter-Nile to Rahul, no run, on a length and targeting the stumps, Rahul uses soft hands to defend it to cover
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, 1 run, this one was attacking the stumps, Kohli creates his own width and guides it to third man
Coulter-Nile to Rahul, 1 run, touch short and on the stumps, Rahul keeps the pull down to deep square leg
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, 1 run, shortens the length around off-stump, Kohli steers it to third man
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, FOUR, wow! He has a bottom-hand of steel! It was a length delivery on the stumps, Kohli keeps his shape and hammers it over deep mid-wicket for a boundary
Behrendorff to Kohli, 1 run, opens the face of the bat to third man

Behrendorff to Kohli, FOUR, crashed! It was fraction short in length angling away from the right-hander, Kohli goes full-throttle on the slash and flays it over backward point, no half measures from the India skipper
Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run, this one was on the stumps, Rahul creates room and eases it wide of backward point for a single
Behrendorff to Kohli, 1 run, guides it to third man for a single
Behrendorff to Kohli, FOUR, stand and deliver stuff from Kohli! He didn't move an inch just keeps his shape and smashes it straight down the ground. It rockets to the fence
Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run, on a good length and wide of off, Rahul runs it down to third man
J Richardson to Rahul, 1 run, much fuller this time, Rahul comes on the front foot and drives, ends up hitting wide of mid-off and he will take a single

J Richardson to Rahul, FOUR, this is the Rahul we know. He identifies the slower one off the hand, delays his bat swing and powers it over cover for a four. It came right off the sweet spot of the blade
J Richardson to Kohli, 1 run, just runs it down to third man

J Richardson to Kohli, no run, it is stopping a bit. Kohli came down the ground to gather some momentum, he wanted to punch it through cover but mistimes it horribly and ends up hitting it to the leg-side
J Richardson to Rahul, 1 run, drives it wide of mid-on and collects a quick single

J Richardson to Rahul, FOUR, the bottom hand came off the bat but still he manages to clear the in-field by some distance. It was a length delivery on the stumps, Rahul intially wanted to whip it over deep mid-wicket but it comes off the outside half of the bat and reaches deep cover fence
Behrendorff to Kohli, no run, on a fuller length and on the stumps, Kohli charges down, and drives it back to the bowler
Behrendorff to Rahul, 1 run, sees the width and runs it down to third man for a single
Behrendorff to Rahul, no run, on a length and curving into Rahul, he gets behind the delivery and defends it to the off-side, wanted a single but Kohli was not in a mood

Behrendorff to Rohit, out Caught by Zampa!! Behrendorff roars and India have lost their vice-captain. It was a length delivery on the stumps, Rohit went for a cheeky paddle over short fine. It comes off the bottom half of the bat and he fails to clear Zampa at short fine. He goes back and takes a fine catch. Rohit will be disappointed with his effort. Enter: Virat Kohli. Rohit c Zampa b Behrendorff 5(8)
Behrendorff to Rohit, no run, on a good length and a hint of inward deviation, Rohit manages to defend awkwardly

Behrendorff to Rohit, 2 runs, on a fuller length and on the stumps, Rohit goes through with the shot and lofts it over mid-on. The timing was not as good as he would have liked and it won't reach the fence. Rohit will settle for a brace

J Richardson to Rahul, FOUR, poor stuff from Richardson. Errs in line again and dishes out a hit-me delivery on the pads. Rahul says thank you so much and whips it wide of short fine leg for his second boundary
J Richardson to Rohit, 1 run, again, Richardson provides width and Rohit eases it to third man
J Richardson to Rohit, no run, on a length and around off, Rohit stands tall and punches it handsomely, finds cover
J Richardson to Rahul, 1 run, he looks more relaxed after that boundary. It was outside off and Rahul steers it to third man to rotate strike

J Richardson to Rahul, FOUR, he is off the mark with a boundary. This will ease the nerves. It was a length delivery on the stumps, Rahul stands tall and flicks it wide of short fine. The outfield is lightning quick and it runs away in a canter for a boundary
J Richardson to Rohit, 1 run, on a length and wide of off, Rohit guides it to third man
Behrendorff to Rahul, no run, brilliant delivery! In that corridor of uncertainty and some away movement, Rahul fails to combat the movement and it defeats his outside edge

Behrendorff to Rahul, no run, he is seriously out of touch. This one moves away slightly and beats the outside edge of Rahul who was looking to run it down to third man. Not a great deal of movement but just enough to beat the outside edge of Rahul
Behrendorff to Rahul, no run, again, fuller and a hint of away deviation, Rahul was squared up by it a touch. He manages to get his bat down just in time and outside half of the bat takes it to cover

Behrendorff to Rahul, no run, very full and targeting the leg-stump, he could have easily flicked it for a four through square leg. But instead, he decided to use a straight bat and block it to the leg-side
Behrendorff to Rohit, 1 run, Rohit walks into the shot, the line was outside off and he opens the face of the bat to guide it to third man. He is off the mark and India are off the mark too!
Behrendorff to Rohit, no run, on a fuller length and a bit of inward movement, Rohit takes a semi-stride forwad and defends it to the off-side

U Yadav to Pat Cummins, 2 runs, wow! Aussies have won this. They have stolen a win in the last over after almost losing it in the last five. Umesh Yadav and his death bowling went for a toss. Managed to squeeze it past the bowler and scampered back for a brace. The throw from long-on did not have accuracy and the Aussie camp are chuffed to bits
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, FOUR, the tail doing it for the Aussies. India did not have one. Low full toss, Pat Cummins backed away and biffed it past cover for a four. 2 needed now. Final ball coming up

U Yadav to J Richardson, 1 run, low full toss, almost a yorker, has been drilled down to long-on. Only a single. Umesh is being bull headed now and rightly so. Yorkers are the best option. 6 off 2 now
U Yadav to J Richardson, 2 runs, and that second will hurt. Dug the yorker out past the bowler and scampered through. The throw at the batter's end went in vain
U Yadav to J Richardson, FOUR, moves across his sticks and blasts it past deep mid for a four! That was a dagger in the heart of the Indian fans as they are silenced. 9 needed off 4 now
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, 1 run, drags the length ball away to long-on for a single. Was again cramping the batter for room. 13 off 5 needed now

Bumrah to Coulter-Nile, out Bowled!! Oh Bumrah! You are a poet in the death overs. An inswinging yorker squeezes under the bat and messes the woodwork. India get another wicket. Brilliant from the death over specialist. How good is this man? You can't quantify it. 142.7kph delivery and Coulter-Nile had no chance. He trudges back slowly. The Vizag crowd have their decibel levels up as well. 14 needed off the final over now. Coulter-Nile b Bumrah 4(8)

Bumrah to Handscomb, out Caught by Dhoni!! India needed a cool head under the catch and they had the coolest one possible. Short ball, top-edge and Dhoni runs a few yards to his left to take it. India are trying to snatch an unlikely win from the jaws of defeat here. Credit to the bowler who cramped the batsman for room with his line and length. 50th T20I wicket for Bumrah. Handscomb c Dhoni b Bumrah 13(15)
Bumrah to Coulter-Nile, 1 run, drags the shortish ball down to long-on for a single. Was that hard length again. 14 off 8 now
Bumrah to Coulter-Nile, no run, the hard length! The Aussie bowlers did well and Bumrah is doing an encore. Length delivery, slightly short of it may be and Coulter-Nile missed the dragged pull
Bumrah to Handscomb, 1 run, skips out, tucks the ball away to deep square leg for a single. 15 off 10 balls!
Bumrah to Handscomb, no run, slips in a short ball, the ball refuses to bounce and it goes on a few dribbles to the keeper
Markande to Handscomb, 1 run, danced out! Did not read the length on it and dragged it down to long-on for a single. 16 needed!
Markande to Coulter-Nile, 1 run, backs away, reads the googly and slaps it past the bowler for a single to long-off
Markande to Coulter-Nile, no run, and another dot ball. Flatter, just outside off and slapped back to the bowler, who fumbled a bit
Markande to Coulter-Nile, no run, slaps the flatter ball to find cover
Markande to Handscomb, 1 run, and that was dangerous! Went very back to dab the googly away towards short third for a single

Markande to Handscomb, 2 runs, and a couple! That was heading to the boundary but Rahul put in the slide and saved two for his side. Too floaty and was driven past cover for a brace. The third umpire had a few looks at it before signalling it as a double. In fact, they are still looking at it. Looks fine as he released the ball before one of his foot touched the boundary cushion. Two it is
Krunal Pandya to Handscomb, 1 run, in the air and safe! An uppish push and just away from the man at cover for a single
