Krunal Pandya to Coulter-Nile, 1 run, should have been stopped as he dived to his left and got there but the ball bumped past him for a single
Krunal Pandya to Handscomb, 1 run, easily milked off the back foot to long-on for a single
Krunal Pandya to Coulter-Nile, 1 run, punched uppishly past the bowler for a single down to long-off

Krunal Pandya to Turner, out Bowled!! The fat lady for a moment had started her preparations but she has been asked to hold on. The game is alive and kicking now. Flatter, quicker ball and Turner misses the paddle to be clean bowled. The crowd erupts. They sense something special. Half-the-side is back in the hut. Turner b Krunal Pandya 0(5)
Krunal Pandya to Handscomb, 1 run, Dhoni says "yours" but Krunal is unable to stop the punch past the bowler
U Yadav to Turner, no run, charges out, looks to heave it and manages to get hit high on the thigh pad. Dot balls!. 26 more needed!
U Yadav to Turner, no run, short ball, cut away to the man at point
U Yadav to Turner, no run, another searing in low full toss and has been on-driven to mid-on
U Yadav to Turner, no run, full and slanting in, Turner looks to drive but gets a thick inside edge to mid-wicket

U Yadav to Handscomb, out D Arcy Short Run Out!! 1 run completed. Bonus wicket for India. The game is still on a ventilator, ain't dead yet. That was clipped away towards fine leg after a hop across the sticks. And if the shot was not iffy, the running was shody. Both the batters wanted a mid-pitch handshake it seems and all that Dhoni did was collect the throw from the deep and disturb the sticks at the batter's end. Dhoni did not know about the whereabouts of either batter and just as a matter of caution threw the ball to the bowler, who also took a bail off. But no double play is allowed, of course. D Arcy Short run out (Krunal Pandya/Dhoni) 37(37) [4s-5]
U Yadav to D Arcy Short, 1 run, length delivery, comforts himself with a single down to deep cover by playing it off the back foot
batsman_bowler: U Yadav to D Arcy Short

comm: U Yadav to D Arcy Short, wide, his poor day with the ball continues! Spills it down leg and and has been wided
batsman_bowler: U Yadav to D Arcy Short

comm: Markande to Handscomb, 2 runs, and the googly again! Almost bamboozled the batter on his way to his first wicket. Handscomb did not pick it, left a gap between bat and pad but the ball trimmed the inner edge and went past the keeper and sticks for a brace
Markande to D Arcy Short, 1 run, drilled down the ground! The bowler makes a half-stop and
Markande to D Arcy Short, no run, knocks it away to find short mid
Markande to D Arcy Short, FOUR, quicker one, punched off the back foot and it speeds past the man at cover for a four. Takes all the pressure off
Markande to D Arcy Short, no run, flatter, quicker, was a googly and D Arcy Short trying to cut it, misses. Did not pick the googly
Markande to Handscomb, 1 run, lot of air, oodles of it and has been driven down the ground to long-off for a single
Chahal to Handscomb, 1 run, punched off the back foot into the deep cover region
Chahal to Handscomb, no run, clips the ball away off the pads to find mid-wicket
Chahal to Handscomb, no run, goes back and pushes it away into the covers

Chahal to Maxwell, out Caught by Rahul!! And the curtains have been drawn on the Big Show tonight. Fuller, tossed up leggie, Maxwell looks to drill it and slices it big. There was elevation, lot of it but not a lot of distance. The man at long-off back-pedalled and took it easily at long-off. The crowd find their voices after being on mute for long but is it too late for the Indians? Maxwell c Rahul b Chahal 56(43) [4s-6 6s-2]
Chahal to Maxwell, 2 runs, and again..poor from the leggie and has been paddled away again. Krunal at deep fine leg does well to dive and stop it
Chahal to Maxwell, FOUR, paddles the ball fine and that has run away. Chahal is gutted and so is his skipper as that was a bad ball

U Yadav to Maxwell, 1 run, fuller ball, helicoptered down to long-on. A little one it might have been but it brings about fifty for the Big Show! On a wicket where people have longed to time it, Maxwell has batted mellifluously
U Yadav to Maxwell, no run, bangs the ball short, Maxwell looks to pull and misses
U Yadav to D Arcy Short, 1 run, short ball sits up, D Arcy Short pulls the ball down carefully towards fine leg for a single. Australia doing it in singles and are happy to do so
batsman_bowler: U Yadav to D Arcy Short

comm: U Yadav to Maxwell, 1 run, slams a fuller ball down to long-on
U Yadav to Maxwell, wide, terrible mistake from Yadav and thankfully it was well down leg for it to be a wide only. The attempted slower delivery was too much down leg

U Yadav to Maxwell, no run, the cameras did a 360 degree search trying to locate the whereabouts of the ball which after connecting the inside edge got jammed into the pads of the batter. Was a short ball and Maxwell was late on it
U Yadav to D Arcy Short, 1 run, slightly late on to a fullish ball and sliced past point for a single down to third man
batsman_bowler: U Yadav to D Arcy Short

comm: Chahal to Maxwell, no run, looks to rip the skin off the ball and manages to inner edge it on to the wicket
Chahal to D Arcy Short, 1 run, treks back, reads the trajectory from the wicket and tucks it away to deep mid for a single
Chahal to D Arcy Short, no run, tossed up delivery and was a googly as well. D Arcy Short picks it late and pushes it to cover
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run, flighted on the pads, clipped to deep mid for a single
Chahal to D Arcy Short, 1 run, off the inner edge on the attempted tuck to get a single down to short fine leg
Chahal to D Arcy Short, FOUR, flatter googly and has been blazed through the point region for a four. The dive from the man at deep cover was not good enough
Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short, 1 run, flatter ball, tucked down to long-on for a single
batsman_bowler: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short

comm: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short, no run, tucked off the pads, finds mid-wicket
batsman_bowler: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short

comm: Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, just a meek punch past cover and a single is taken as it beat the dive from the man at cover
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, no run, in-darter, flat-batted to cover
Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short, 1 run, turning in, tucked off the pads into the on-side for a single
batsman_bowler: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short

comm: Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, knocks it off the pads into the on-side for a single
Markande to Maxwell, 1 run, full and outside off, driven hard to sweeper cover
Markande to D Arcy Short, 1 run, chops and gets an under-edge that rolls to short third man off the keeper's pad
Markande to Maxwell, 1 run, quicker delivery on the stumps, Maxwell punches it to long-off
Markande to Maxwell, SIX, smashed away! Tossed up delivery, slightly too full and outside off. Maxwell bends forward and bludgeons it over long-on. A mighty hit
Markande to D Arcy Short, 1 run, googly, turned to square leg
Markande to Maxwell, 1 run, goes for the big slog sweep, doesn't middle and Rohit charges in from deep mid-wicket. The vice-captain put in the dive, but the ball fell just short of him
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, on the pads, flicked away to deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, no run, punched hard, but straight to extra cover
Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short, 1 run, pitched outside leg and keeps a touch low, Short gets an inside edge onto his pad whcih rolls towards short third man. 50-run stand
batsman_bowler: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short

comm: Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, Chahal scores a direct hit at the bowler's end. Is Maxwell out? Krunal Pandya isn't very confident. He's made his ground. It was a quick ball on the stumps and Maxwell chopped to the right of Chahal at point. Chahal was quick to get to the ball, but Maxwell was quicker
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, no run, bit of flight on this occasion - 83.2kph, Maxwell delays his stroke, played back to the bowler
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 2 runs, fires a length ball on the stumps at 95kph, jabbed to the left of deep mid-wicket

Markande to D Arcy Short, FOUR, too slow - 74.5kph and plenty of width outside off. Short takes full toll of it. Waits for the ball on the back foot and scythes it powerfully through the cover region. Bulleted away to the fence
Markande to Maxwell, 1 run, cut to sweeper cover
Markande to Maxwell, no run, wider outside off at 73.1kph, Maxwell waited for the ball and slapped it straight to Kohli at extra cover. Maxwell has a wry smile on his face
Markande to Maxwell, no run, slower through the air - 81.1kph, Maxwell punches it to extra cover
Markande to D Arcy Short, 1 run, leg-break from a length, Short punches it past the diving Markande. A single to long-on
Markande to Maxwell, 1 run, starts with a wide-ish leg-break outside off, Maxwell thrashes it to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, decent over from Pandya - just 3 off it. Bunts this length ball towards long-on and keeps the strike with a single
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, no run, quicker ball on off at 96.7kph, Maxwell knocks it to the right of Short, Pandya is quick to go to his right and mop that up
Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short, 1 run, 93.2kph, Short stands tall in the crease to punch it to long-on
batsman_bowler: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short

comm: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short, no run, 93.7kph, fired on off from round the wicket, pushed back to the bowler
batsman_bowler: Krunal Pandya to D Arcy Short

comm: Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, 1 run, flat ball at 94.1kph that keeps low, Maxwell drags the pull to mid-wicket, came off the inner half
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, no run, 89.2kph, stump-to-stump line ball from round the wicket, Maxwell defends towards extra cover
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run, 92.4kph, darted full on middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on
Chahal to D Arcy Short, 1 run, fullish ball, Short with a big back-lift drives it all along the carpet to long-on
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run, 87.1kph, flat ball on leg, knocked to the right of mid-on
Chahal to Maxwell, no run, quicker and flatter on off, Maxwell goes back and cuts to cover-point
Chahal to Maxwell, FOUR, four more! More timing on this occasion. Once again, the length is slightly on the shorter side, Maxwell whips this leg-break over mid-wicket off the back foot. Top shot
Chahal to Maxwell, SIX, Chahal drops one short and Maxwell has deposited that into the stands. Maxwell rocks back and pummels the pull over deep mid-wicket
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, 141.6kph, back of a length delivery, Short is content in defending it to cover from the crease

Bumrah to D Arcy Short, FOUR, in the air, but also in the gap. 116.2kph, fuller ball outside off and Short drives it uppishly through the cover region. Once it found the gap, there was none to stop that
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, 138.4kph, shortish ball, Short gets on top of the bounce and defends on the off-side

Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, in the air, and it falls short of Umesh at mid-on. Another slower delivery, Short is early into the flick and the ball popped up, only to drop in front of the diving fielder
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, slower ball - 109.1kph, Short picks it late and guides it to backward point
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, 2 runs, 139.7kph, back of a length delivery, tucked through mid-wicket for a couple

U Yadav to Maxwell, FOUR, third boundary in this over! Maxwell is toying with Umesh. The Vidarbha pacer bowls length, Maxwell backs away to free his arms and lifts it over mid-off. No need to run for those
U Yadav to Maxwell, FOUR, this is good batting from Maxwell. The length was wrong from Umesh. Maxwell moved across and used his wrists to flick this length ball fine of the man at short fine leg
U Yadav to Maxwell, no run, 138.1kph, back of a length delivery, Maxwell shuffles across and blocks it into the leg-side
U Yadav to Maxwell, FOUR, 137.1kph, shortish ball, Maxwell moves leg-side, clears his front leg and carves it over wide mid-off. Easily done!

U Yadav to D Arcy Short, 1 run, punches this short of length delivery off the lower half and sets off for a risky single. Pant collects the ball after running in from mid-off, but fails to hit the target. A direct hit there, and Short would have been a goner!
batsman_bowler: U Yadav to D Arcy Short

comm: U Yadav to D Arcy Short, no run, 140.2kph, short ball, Short is late on the pull, the ball hits his arm and falls in front of the sticks
batsman_bowler: U Yadav to D Arcy Short

comm: Bumrah to Maxwell, FOUR, a glorious shot to get off the mark. A short of length delivery at 132kph, Maxwell rides the bounce and punches it through the big gap between cover and mid-off. The latter gave a chase, but could only escort the ball to the fence
Bumrah to Maxwell, no run, 141kph, Maxwell watchfully keeps out this length ball on the off-side
Bumrah to Maxwell, no run, 143kph, short of length delivery that straightens off the deck, Maxwell looks to punch, gets beaten
Bumrah to Maxwell, no run, length ball keeps a shade low, Maxwell hurriedly blocks
Bumrah to Maxwell, no run, full and swinging in, Maxwell goes for the booming drive, beaten on the inside edge

Bumrah to Finch, out Lbw!! Superb start for India. The in-coming delivery which troubled Finch in the previous series, does him in again. No Bhuvui, but Bumrah is more-than-well-equipped to trap him. A pacy in-angler, that seams in further, Finch is half-forward to tuck it. The ball keeps a touch low and beats his inside edge before rapping him on the front leg. That looked out to the naked eye. A golden duck for the skipper, who reviewed but in vain. HawkEye showed it to be clipping leg. Finch lbw b Bumrah 0(1)

Chahal to D Arcy Short, out Stoinis Run Out!! A misjudgement! Stoinis is sent back by Short. The TV umpire is called and Stoinis is a goner. India have the early breakthrough. Just what the doctor ordered. It was a flat ball on the pads and Short nudged it backward of square on the leg-side. While the striker was ball-watching, Stoinis was halfway down the ground. Stoinis saw his partner and turned back to try and make his ground, but was late. Umesh at backward square leg was quick to collect it and fired an accurate throw at the bowler's end. Chahal does the remaining. Stoinis run out (U Yadav/Chahal) 1(5)
Chahal to Stoinis, 1 run, slower ball at 83.4kph, Stoinis allows the ball to do its bit and knocks it to the right of mid-on
Chahal to Stoinis, no run, four dots in a row! 92.7kph, flat and on leg, Stoinis backs away and goes hard on the drive. Miscued and mid-on makes a diving stop to his left
Chahal to Stoinis, no run, quicker ball at 90.7kph, turns away and beats Stoinis's shot. The batsman moved leg-side in a hope to crash it over the off-side
Chahal to Stoinis, no run, 87.2kph, leg-break from a length, Stoinis punches it to mid-on
Chahal to Stoinis, no run, flat and full on middle, pushed back to the bowler
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, 144kph, good length delivery marginally outside off, poked to backward point

Bumrah to D Arcy Short, FOUR, 145kph, straighter line and Short gets off the mark with a boundary. Short of a good length ball on leg, Short hops and closes his bat-face to glance it through square leg. Didn't over-hit and relied on timing, the ball raced away to the fence
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, 143.7kph, on a length and Short watchfully taps it to mid-on
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, 140.5kph, on a good length, Short is happy to block it down the pitch, mid-off mops up
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, 145.6kph, fuller on this occasion, on the pads and Short misses the flick. Pitched outside leg and hence no major appeal for lbw
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, 142.1kph, back of a length delivery on the sticks, Short hops and bunts it into the leg-side

Khaleel Ahmed to Santner, FOUR, good finish for NZ! Full toss and Santner picks his spot, heaves it away square through the leg-side. Dhawan in the deep at mid-wicket slipped while getting across although I doubt if he could have got to it
Khaleel Ahmed to Kuggeleijn, 1 run, slower bouncer this time and Kuggeleijn climbs onto the pull but hits it straight to deep mid-wicket

Khaleel Ahmed to Kuggeleijn, FOUR, slower ball again and this time, Kuggeleijn was ready. Sat back and got the shortish length that he wanted. There was a long-off fielder but this was smashed wide of him, leaving him with no chance

Khaleel Ahmed to Santner, 1 run, Ahmed is mixing his pace well and this is a good start to the final over. The hard length at usual speed, 138kph, hurries Santner on the flat-batted stroke, down to long-off
Khaleel Ahmed to Kuggeleijn, 1 run, slower ball and Kuggeleijn couldn't connect the slog well enough. Gets it off the inside half to deep backward square leg
Khaleel Ahmed to Santner, 1 run, full toss and Santner misses out, mistimes the slog sweep to deep mid-wicket. Thought about the second but Kuggeleijn declines it eventually

Bhuvneshwar to Kuggeleijn, SIX, that's gone all the way! Kuggeleijn is known for his powerhitting cameos back in the NZ domestic circuit and like in the SL T20I earlier this year, he is showing it again. Bhuvneshwar misses the wide yorker by an inch and it's deposited over sweeper cover for a flat maximum. Lovely pick up and bat swing from Kuggeleijn
Bhuvneshwar to Kuggeleijn, wide, another premeditated shuffle across the stumps by Kuggeleijn and Bhuvneshwar wanted to hit the stumps, ends up feeding it well down the leg-side

Bhuvneshwar to Kuggeleijn, FOUR, creative batting! Shuffled across and almost reached the tramline while playing this wide yorker. Opens the bat face late to beat the diving short third man fielder. Highest T20I score at this ground now!
Bhuvneshwar to Kuggeleijn, no run, short of a length wider outside off, Kuggeleijn moved across for the cut but can't connect. Good call from the umpire to not wide it

Bhuvneshwar to Kuggeleijn, FOUR, streaky runs but they all count and NZ won't mind especiallt at this stage. Short of a length and Kuggeleijn wanted to force it square on the off-side. Got a thick edge that beat Dhoni to the third man fence
Bhuvneshwar to Santner, 1 run, slower ball and Santner dabs this towards point for a single

Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, out Caught by Khaleel Ahmed!! Another skier and Khaleel settles under it. Nearly popped out of his hand but he tells his mates that he was in control. Can afford to say that once you have pouched it. Coming to the dismissal, this was a definite plan to Taylor, to feed him well outside off so that he can't access the leg-side with ease. Was a slower leg cutter on a good length well outside off, Taylor tried to slog by fetching the line but only managed a top edge that flew high towards the short fine leg region. Ross Taylor c Khaleel Ahmed b Bhuvneshwar 23(14) [6s-2]
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, wide, tries to outsmart Taylor who was shuffling well across the stumps. Speared well wide outside off, beyond the tramline
Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, 1 run, back of a length outside off, cut away to deep point for a single

Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, out Caught by (sub)Siraj!! Incredible catch from Siraj! Was a big skier from de Grandhomme and he was agonizingly close to the ropes when he dived across for the catch but did well to complete it without any real fuss. Was a slow full toss and de Grandhomme swung at it, skewing it straight up in the air towards the square leg fence. Fine catch by the sub. de Grandhomme c (sub)Siraj b Hardik Pandya 3(4)
Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, 1 run, very full and attacking the stumps, dug out towards deep square leg where there is a slight fumble

Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, 2 runs, DK puts down a sitter! Strange night for him, put down two dollies and pouched a blinder. This was a full toss and Taylor miscued the slog straight to deep mid-wicket. In and out. A brace to the total
Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, no run, wide yorker outside off, good ball and Taylor jams it out. Good comeback by Hardik

Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, SIX, slogged away! In the slot and Taylor just clears his front leg to dump this over deep mid-wicket. Placed the hit well too as this didn't have a great deal of height on it, a flat six

Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, 1 run, might have been a wide if Taylor left this alone. He was going for the premeditated paddle but Bhuvneshwar smartly speared it further outside off. In the end, an ungainly sweep towards mid-wicket and they get a single

Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, 1 run, good wide yorker, de Grandhomme is sitting deep and jams it out to extra cover as they steal a run. Direct hit at the bowler's end might have got him in trouble maybe
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, 1 run, short of a good length outside off, flat-batted down towards long-on

Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, SIX, blazing shot from Taylor! Very full and outside off, width on offer and Taylor chose to go over point. Quick hands and raw power as he managed to get the leverage to send this soaring over sweeper cover. Wow!

Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, 2 runs, skewed it in the air but falls safe! Dhawan from mid-wicket trekked backwards, as did DK from long-on but neither were going to reach it anyway. Taylor had to fetch this from well outside off and got a top edge on the slog. Gets a brace
Bhuvneshwar to Ross Taylor, no run, good call from the umpire. Taylor was shuffling across the stumps and Bhuvneshwar kept it very full near the tramline. Rosco can't put bat on ball
Chahal to Ross Taylor, 1 run, good change up from Chahal, fires this on a length and it skidded through a touch low as Taylor went for the pull. Mistimes it to deep square leg
Chahal to de Grandhomme, 1 run, quicker and cramps de Grandhomme on the slog, dragged to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Ross Taylor, 1 run, slowish leg break and Taylor tries to play it with soft hands. Off the splice and rolls towards cover
Chahal to de Grandhomme, 1 run, bowls the googly from the wide of the crease, tempted de Grandhomme into the slog and he drags it off the inner half down to long-on
Chahal to Ross Taylor, 1 run, floated up very full outside off, driven down the ground to long-off

Chahal to Williamson, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Successive wickets for India! This is a big one as the well-set Williamson departs. Was a skiddy half-tracker and I suppose he didn't go that hard on the pull stroke. Wanted to time it rather than really clobber it and the placement wasn't right either. Hardik at deep mid-wicket takes the catch with ease. This double strike could dent NZ's final assault although they do have some depth in hitting still to come. Williamson c Hardik Pandya b Chahal 34(22) [6s-3]

Hardik Pandya to Daryl Mitchell, out Caught by Karthik!! Stunning effort from DK! This is a fielder's wicket really. Was in the slow and Mitchell went for the loft down the ground. Probably middle it as well as he would have liked and was travelling towards DK who took the catch initially but had tremendous presence of mind to lob it back just before stepping past the ropes. Came back in and dived forward to complete the formalities. Brilliant stuff. He had put down a skier earlier and has redeemed himself with a screamer. They check for the front foot no ball but Hardik is fine on that count too. Daryl Mitchell c Karthik b Hardik Pandya 8(6) [4s-1]
Hardik Pandya to Daryl Mitchell, wide, tries the leg stump yorker perhaps but spills it down leg via a full toss. Tough take from MSD who has an angry look on his face

Hardik Pandya to Daryl Mitchell, 2 runs, good running and they steal a two. Quite full and Mitchell drilled this towards long-off. KW wanted the second and the throw was at his end with him never in danger really
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, quite full this time, squeezed out to mid-off and they scamper through for the run

Hardik Pandya to Williamson, SIX, this is an even better stroke! Williamson has switched the aggressive button. Short from Hardik again, not learning and goes the distance. Clobbered off the back foot in front of square through the leg-side this time. Made a crunchy sound off the blade
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, SIX, cracking stroke! Short ball and he swivels to nail the pull to perfection. There was a man at deep backward square leg but this went finer and way into the crowd
Hardik Pandya to Daryl Mitchell, 1 run, wide half volley, Mitchell shuffles across once again and drives this to sweeper cover. Might have been another wide if he left this alone

Hardik Pandya to Daryl Mitchell, wide, good deception from Hardik but the line is a bit wrong, well wide outside off and Mitchell can't put bat on ball. Harsh call I feel as he had shuffled across early

Chahal to Williamson, 2 runs, terrific work by Krunal! This was travelling and he got across to his left from deep square leg to palm it back into play while Hardik completed the tag team effort. Was a half tracker that Williamson pulled away with good power. Fine fielding denied him a boundary

Chahal to Williamson, 2 runs, this time they get a brace. Williamson works it off the back foot towards the wide long-on region. Call was for two from the start and they got it with ease. Shankar had a bit too much ground to cover
Chahal to Daryl Mitchell, 1 run, fuller and outside off, Mitchell shuffles a bit and works this through square leg. They ran the first run hard but the deep fielder charged in to prevent the second
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, slider on middle and off, cramped Williamson who opened the bat face to glide this in front of short third man. Quick single
Chahal to Williamson, no run, slower this time, a bit of width and Williamson cuts but can't beat point
Chahal to Williamson, 2 runs, good running and they get a brace. Drifting in on middle and leg, Williamson works this wide of long-on and they race back for the second

Khaleel Ahmed to Daryl Mitchell, FOUR, straight over the bowler's head! Mitchell is off and running. Overpitched from Ahmed and it's launched straight by the debutant. Clean hit and to the safest spot of the ground
Khaleel Ahmed to Daryl Mitchell, no run, dug in short and Mitchell rides the bounce with a push down the track

Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, out Bowled!! Khaleel Ahmed strikes a big blow! He's excited and so are his mates. They know the value of this wicket. Seifert was done in for pace here I reckon, was very full around off at 139kph, he just cleared his front leg to go for a swipe but couldn't connect. Was sitting deep in the crease and that hit his back leg in front of middle and off before crashing into the stumps. Sensational innings from Seifert comes to an end. He's certainly made a massive statement to the selectors with this knock. Seifert b Khaleel Ahmed 84(43) [4s-7 6s-6]
Khaleel Ahmed to Williamson, 1 run, another slower ball, this deceived Williamson who was on the charge. Off the toe-end towards the mid-on region

Khaleel Ahmed to Williamson, SIX, poor length and it's dispatched! Khaleel's rough night continues. Tried a slower ball again but too short and Williamson just fetched it with a mighty pull over deep mid-wicket. Clean strike

Khaleel Ahmed to Williamson, no run, slower ball and Williamson can't beat extra cover with the back foot punch. Dot to start the over which will please Khaleel Ahmed but he has a tough job ahead stil

Chahal to Seifert, SIX, Seifert is putting on a show tonight! The runs just keep coming and they're coming in big hits too. Slightly flighted by Chahal but couldn't deceive Seifert who rammed the slog sweep over deep square leg. Needless to say, it has gone deep into the crowd

Chahal to Seifert, FOUR, how hard has he hit this! Slower and wider outside off, he just stands tall and bashes this past extra cover. That went like a bullet train, leaving sweeper cover with no chance
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, fractionally short and Williamson rocks back to pull this to the right of deep mid-wicket who is quick to attack the ball. Prevents the second run
Chahal to Seifert, 1 run, slightly shorter and skids through, mistimes the pull down to long-on
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, flatter and fuller, whipped away down to long-on to give the strike back to Seifert
Chahal to Williamson, no run, tossed up around off, defended well off the front foot

Krunal Pandya to Seifert, 2 runs, dropped by DK! This was in the air for an eternity and seemed like he looked nervy while trying to settle under it. Never appeared confident and eventually, puts it down. Could be costly for India with the way Seifert is batting. He wanted to slog sweep this but the length wasn't quite there and he skewed it miles up in the air towards long-on. Not an easy catch under lights but need to take these in international cricket
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, flighted up this time, middle and off line, worked away to deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Seifert, 1 run, fired in, on a length outside off, cut away to sweeper cover
Krunal Pandya to Seifert, SIX, and another! Wowza! Fuller one, around off and Seifert makes room to loft this inside out. For a moment long-off was interested but it cleared him

Krunal Pandya to Seifert, SIX, what a hit! Seifert is such an inventive hitter and this is proof of it. Came down the track and although the length was shortened, swatted it flat-batted over deep square leg. Well into the crowd
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, flatter and straighter lines, Williamson makes room and cuts it to deep point

Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, the googly that stays low on middle and off, Williamson is cramped and chops it off the inside edge towards short fine leg for a quick single - a direct-hit, an appeal, but he's comfortably in.
Chahal to Seifert, 1 run, tossed up much fuller outside off, Seifert comes down the track, cuts off the spin-angle, and whips it away against the turn to mid-wicket for a single
Chahal to Seifert, 2 runs, angling flat towards the middle and leg-stumps, Seifert gets across and laps it uppishly towards fine leg for a couple
Chahal to Seifert, FOUR, dropped short and flat, Seifert premeditates the reverse-stance, reverse-pulls it without changing his grip between backward point and gully for four
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, dropped short once again, too short, Williamson loses his shape trying to impart too much power into the pull, gets it away towards cow corner for a single
Chahal to Williamson, no run, dropped short just outside off, Williamson tries to get across and lap, adjusts after spotting the line and dabs it into the off-side
Krunal Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, skiddy length delivery on off-stump, pushed off a low stance to cover point for a quick single

Krunal Pandya to Williamson, no run, straightens from a length, Williamson is fooled and chips it back towards the non-striker, Krunal attempts the caught&bowled, but the batsman is in the way. Krunal Pandya is livid, and appeals, presumably for obstructing the field, but the batsman has all the right to stand his ground
Krunal Pandya to Seifert, 1 run, slow through the air, angling into the middle and leg-stump, swept away fine to short fine leg for a quick single
Krunal Pandya to Seifert, no run, angled in, arm-ball, squeezed out into the off-side

Krunal Pandya to Munro, out Caught by Shankar! Massive wicket for India! One against the run of play, and they've managed to buy Munro's wicket! Krunal has courageously tossed this up outside off, Munro gets low and tries to club that over long-on for six, gets the timing slightly wrong, and that's right down the throat of Vijay Shankar at the long-on fence who makes no mistake. An imperious looking Munro departs. Munro c Shankar b Krunal Pandya 34(20) [4s-2 6s-2]

Krunal Pandya to Seifert, 1 run, fired into the pads, nudged off the frontfoot towards mid-wicket for a quick single and Seifert brings up his maiden T20I fifty. Raises his bat to acknowledge the applause. Fantastic innings by the young wicketkeeper
Hardik Pandya to Munro, no run, shortish one at the midriff, Munro misjudges the slow bounce, tries the calypso-pull, chops it off the under-edge into his body and into the off-side
Hardik Pandya to Seifert, 1 run, over-pitches just outside off-stump, drills it with a strong bottom-handed whip towards strai0ghtish long-on for a single
Hardik Pandya to Seifert, no run, shortish and slow, no width on offer, Seifert backs away and slaps it hard towards point off the backfoot
Hardik Pandya to Seifert, SIX, back of a length and angled into the pads, Seifert gets low and behind the line and lap it with another expertly executed pick-up shot over backward square leg for six
Hardik Pandya to Seifert, FOUR, shortish and no width, Seifert has a short-armed attempt at the cut, gets a thick top-edge wide of Dhoni towards the third man fence for four
Hardik Pandya to Seifert, no run, angling in on a length and seaming away from the channel, Seifert gets the front-leg out of the way and attempts to smoke it over long-on, misses

Krunal Pandya to Seifert, leg byes, 1 run, flat one fired in on leg-stump, Seifert steps across and tries to lap it over fine leg, misses it, and it strikes his pad - massive appeal, but possibly going down leg-side, and they've managed to steal a leg-bye as the ball trickles into the on-side
Krunal Pandya to Munro, 1 run, another one that's dropped short, but that's flatter, no width, Munro punches it to sweeper cover for a single
Krunal Pandya to Seifert, 1 run, dropped short, carved away square of the wicket for a single

Krunal Pandya to Seifert, FOUR, tossed up down leg-side after he shapes up for the switch-hit, loses his shape but executes it to perfection - slaps it over the in-field to the deep backward point fence for four
Krunal Pandya to Seifert, no run, perfect length and skidding in towards off, Seifert is cramped on the cut, chops it off the under-edge towards the off-side
Krunal Pandya to Munro, 1 run, dropped short and wide outside off, Munro crouches low and slaps it away to sweeper cover for a single
Hardik Pandya to Munro, 1 run, low full-toss on off-stump, Munro tries a bottom-hand drive through extra cover, miscues it, gets a thick inside edge towards mid-on for a sharp single
Hardik Pandya to Seifert, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the stumps, almost yorker length, Seifert stays in the crease and whips it wristily away towards long-on for a single
Hardik Pandya to Seifert, FOUR, attempted slower ball outside off, far too short, too much time for the batsman as he puts his entire bodyweight into that slap through sweeper cover for four
Hardik Pandya to Seifert, no run, backs away into the on-side, Pandya follows him, the off-cutter, pushed off the backfoot into the off-side
Hardik Pandya to Seifert, FOUR, shortish and angling in, Seifert plays the short-arm, low-leverage pick-up pull over the leaping man (Khaleel) at backward square leg for a one-bounce four
Hardik Pandya to Munro, 1 run, short of length delivery on the hips, and that's a pick-up pull towards backward square leg for a single
Hardik Pandya to Munro, wide, short, very short, appallingly short, Munro mocks a duck under it, and is upright again, only for the ball the sail over him. Wide called.
Krunal Pandya to Munro, 1 run, dropped short on the middle-stump, tucked away off the backfoot towards cow corner for a quick single
Krunal Pandya to Seifert, 1 run, skids through on middle, Seifert tries opening the face, chops it off the inside edge towards backward square leg for a single
Krunal Pandya to Seifert, SIX, fired down leg, Seifert steps across and plays the pickup over fine leg for a massive six. Jawdropper of a shot!
Krunal Pandya to Seifert, no run, a slider of an arm-ball, Seifert gets back and tries to carve it away, gets a thick edge towards short third man, but I think Dhoni has dropped it - tough chance
Krunal Pandya to Seifert, 2 runs, length delivery on the pads, Seifert gets across and laps it away towards backward square leg for a couple
Krunal Pandya to Seifert, no run, skiddy and shortish outside off, chopped off the backfoot towards point

Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, 1 run, another slower short ball angling outside off, Seifert mistimes an ugly swipe of a pull towards backward square leg for another single. Decent comeback by the youngster - 16 off the over, after conceding 12 off the first 2 balls.

Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, 2 runs, fuller length delivery angling across, the off-cutter again, effectively the converse for the right-hander, he tries to whip it away but it grips, gets a leading edge over the in-field towards sweeper cover for a couple
Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, no run, back of a length delivery across the right-hander

Khaleel Ahmed to Seifert, no run, back of a length delivery across the right-hander, Seifert has no trigger and stays side-on, tries to drive off the backfoot, on the up through cover, misses - beaten comprehensively on the outside edge
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, 1 run, great comeback by Khaleel! Bowls the yorker length delivery on the stumps, and that's squeezed off the toe-end towards mid-on for a scampered single
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, SIX, short and wide, Munro's eye light up and flashes that flat over deep point for a second consecutive six! That is an astonishing hit!
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, SIX, length delivery just outside off, the off-cutter, Munro spotted that, stepped across, and smoked that over deep mid-wicket for six
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, no run, a bit of width on offer, just wide of off-stump, Seifert hops and slaps it towards cover point - can't quite split the in-field
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, FOUR, pitches on a good length on off-stump, no lateral movement, Seifert drives confidently through the line. In the air, but flat, and straight down the ground for four
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, no run, short of length delivery without much width, Seifert stays on the backfoot and steers it towards point with an open-face
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, SIX, the knuckle-ball, doesn't lose any pace due to backspin, on a short of length outside off, Seifert picks it up clubs that with a horizontal bat over long-on for six

Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 3 runs, back of a length delivery on the stumps, Munro charges down and gives himself room, top-edges a cross-batted loft towards long-on for three, as Rohit Sharma chases it down to cut it off

Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 2 runs, on the hip after pitching outside the leg-stump, perfect line for the signature Munro pick-up - tries to execute, but it trickles off some part of his bat towards fine leg for a couple
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, 1 run, short of length delivery with minimal width outside off, Munro waits patiently for it to arrive, opens the face, and runs it down towards square third man for a single

Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, no run, the off-cutter on a back of a length, Munro walks across and forward towards the off-side and attempts the pick-up shot over the on-side, and that cuts rigth through him and goes to Dhoni on the bounce
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, no run, back of a length and wide outside off, Munro's eyes light up as he throws his hands at the cut, but it's stayed too low, and he misses

Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, FOUR, half-volley just outside off, right in the slot, Munro walks down the wicket and clubs this in the air, straight down the ground, for a one-bounce four. A much better shot, this

Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, FOUR, short of length delivery once again, Munro walks down the wicket towards the line and cross-bats it over mid-off, towards the long-off fence for four as a chasing Rohit fails to pull it in. Not the best timing on that.
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, no run, back of a length and wide outside off, Munro slaps it off a low crouch towards the man at cover - stopped inside the circle

Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 1 run, slower one, perhaps the knuckle ball pitching on a good length and in line with the middle and leg stumps, Munro delays his polite nudge towards midwicket for another scampered single
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, 1 run, another one on a short of length just outside off, Seifert gets on the backfoot and drags it with a tuck into the on-side for a sharp single
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 1 run, shortish one at the ribcage, Munro just about manages to squeeze it out from the fulcrum off the backfoot hop in front of square leg for a single

Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, 1 run, a hint on away-swing, pitches on a back of a length, skids through, Seifert gets forward and checks a drive that nearly splits mid-off and short cover, but the man at mid-off moves swiftly to cut it off and keeps it to a single
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, no run, angling in from a short of length, Seifert is right back on the backfoot once again to punch it firmly towards cover
Bhuvneshwar to Seifert, no run, back of a length delivery in the channel outside off, Seifert gets on his toes, on the tall stance, and punches it towards wide mid-off

Daryl Mitchell to Chahal, out Bowled!! The typical tail-ending medicine - full, straight, bang on middle. Chahal makes some room, staying beside the line, wafts, misses and the lights light up behind to signal India's worst T20I defeat in terms of the number of runs. It's been that kind of a day, clinically consistently good/bad depending on which side you're seeing it from. Chahal b Daryl Mitchell 1(3)
Daryl Mitchell to Khaleel Ahmed, 1 run, full on middle. A lame toe-end down to long-on. Umm, it was also meant to be a free-hit
Daryl Mitchell to Chahal, no ball, 1 run, high full toss, outside off though as Chahal stabs through sweeper

Southee to Dhoni, out Caught by Ferguson!! The bouncer it is to end yet another batsman's vigil - bumped in quick, angling in well. Dhoni in fact seemed ready for it, pulled quite off the middle too, but picks out deep square leg. Dhoni c Ferguson b Southee 39(31) [4s-5 6s-1]
Southee to Dhoni, no run, foxes him with the off-cutter. Well-disguised, outside off and Dhoni is a week early in whatever he's trying
Southee to Dhoni, FOUR, [u bang in the slot. And MS with a very measured backlift and a smaller followthrough hammers it over Southee, straight down
Southee to Dhoni, no run, unwinds for a big hoick across the line. Misses, but luckily ends up inside-edging it onto his pad
Southee to Dhoni, no run, shorter, climbing over the shoulder, which Dhoni pulls just over short fine leg. Once again, I miscue, I bat
Southee to Dhoni, no run, short. Mistimed pull down to long-on and Dhoni's started his bit of taking all the blame upon himself -- by keeping the strike to himself

Ferguson to Chahal, no run, well, it's been just too good for most top-orders, and poor Chahal is a certified number eleven masquerading as a number ten here. Just flirts at a fiery line just outside off, missing big time

Ferguson to Bhuvneshwar, out Caught by Seifert!! Now some one-handed elegance as well to rub in India's face. Full, wide outside off, making Bhuvi stretch, which he can do only to find an outside nick for the keeper to dive low, right-handed. Bhuvneshwar c Seifert b Ferguson 1(3)
Ferguson to Dhoni, 1 run, 144kph, a bent-knee slog across the line, deep mid-wicket
Ferguson to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, to cover, 143kph, hard good length on the stumps. Blocked in front of cover, and Dhoni calls him across for a quickie
Ferguson to Bhuvneshwar, no run, opens up a straight bat face, running it away defensively to short third man
Ferguson to Dhoni, 1 run, length, just outside off, sliced through the covers

Southee to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Seifert!! Well this was always coming. Pandya couldn't handle the pace, and the bowlers also seem to have found a chink in his play against the short ones. So Southee obliges with a quick skiddy bumper, hurrying up, tying Pandya for room - who then ends up compulsively looking to pull it from it in front of his face. Gloves. Helmet. Balloon. Diving keeper. Krunal Pandya c Seifert b Southee 20(18) [4s-1 6s-1]
Southee to Dhoni, 1 run, full, tailing in on middle. Wristed away through mid-wicket
Southee to Dhoni, FOUR, wow, quite cool. Dhoni jumps, uses Southee's pace in the short-wide sitter to very politely cut it away over point
Southee to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, steps away, opening up the sweeper region with a full-faced punch
Southee to Dhoni, 1 run, 110kph, short, tummy-lined. Pulled away round the corner

Southee to Dhoni, FOUR, a running down pull, Ferguson at the deep square leg fence overruns the ball, but then Santner's covering him, even if he's only a foot behind, anticipating the fumble and diving. But in the process his non-ball palm has touched the ropes

Ferguson to Krunal Pandya, no run, 151kph. Well, well. Ferguson's variations in pace only keep adding a few yards to it - this one just as full, slightly outside off to beat Pandya's across-the-line hoick for pace
Ferguson to Krunal Pandya, no run, 149kph. Full, quick, too much so for Pandya's shuffling heave to connect -- takes the outside of his pad through to the keeper
Ferguson to Krunal Pandya, no run, 143kph in the bumper. Skiddy, quick, sharply over Pandya's looking-elsewhere-pull
Ferguson to Dhoni, 1 run, hacked away, swinging across the line, skewing it away off the inside half through square leg

Ferguson to Dhoni, FOUR, 143kph, absolutely flat footed. And a very, very streaky boundary .. so Dhoni freezes in his crease without a clue about the ball angling back in, but then somehow, you know miraculously sticks his bat out, gets an inside edge, just past his leg-stump
Ferguson to Dhoni, no run, 143kph, back of a length in-nip on the tummy. Dhoni can barely middle his defence down the pitch

Ish Sodhi to Krunal Pandya, SIX, one, two, three steps down, Sodhi responds with a half-tracker. But Pandya adjusts well, pulling uppishly, and these boundaries are good ebough even for top-edged miscues
Ish Sodhi to Dhoni, 1 run, carved away with the spin, sweeper
Ish Sodhi to Dhoni, wide, another square-turner. In fact this one's well inside the tramline, but then a leaving Dhoni gives the impression that it's spun past, fooling the umpire well
Ish Sodhi to Dhoni, wide, big leg-break, turning way outside off as Dhoni walks towards it in his leave
Ish Sodhi to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, long hop googly, cut away hard, covers

Ish Sodhi to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, leg-lined. Pandya walks inside it, sweeps without a lot of control, but then it bounces just in front of short fine leg, and then spins away too to past his best efforts
Ish Sodhi to Dhoni, 1 run, back deep inside, swivelling to heave it away through square leg
Ish Sodhi to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, an advancing drill down the ground, where Sodhi's stuck out palm takes some momentum off it, and then the umpire saves the ricochet as well
Santner to Dhoni, SIX, dances, and finally connects something the way he'd planned to. Gets one in the slot for a change and then hoicks it big, bottom-handed, over long-on
Santner to Dhoni, no run, perfectly yorked. Dhoni jumps down, right where the ball pitches, and just about jams it out eventually
Santner to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, drifting in as a low full toss on the feet. Squeezed away in front of square
Santner to Dhoni, 1 run, another step down, only for a calm, meek poke through the covers
Santner to Dhoni, no run, the arm ball -- Dhoni tries stepping out, realizes he's got no room at all -- so settles to push it to point
Santner to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, fired in on the pads. Pandya's down to slog, skewing off the inside half through square leg
Ish Sodhi to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, arches backwards, sticking out a dab to short third
Ish Sodhi to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, another big googly outside off. Pandya does another one of his waiting slaps, backward of point now, as sweeper runs across, dives and saves a couple
Ish Sodhi to Krunal Pandya, no run, loopier wrong 'un. Sliced away, after waiting for it on the back foot, and still ends up finding point
Ish Sodhi to Dhoni, 1 run, a tad short. Dhoni stabs typically, point
Ish Sodhi to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, the front-of-the-hand variation, Pandya shuffles, for a short arm swivelling jab through square leg
Ish Sodhi to Krunal Pandya, no run, wide googly. Outside outside off already, and then bouncing as well over Pandya's attempted slap
Santner to Dhoni, no run, air, drifting in on middle. Dhoni waits, presses forward and pushes it down to long-on

Santner to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, real smart bowling this - wide, full, always going away, which Pandya for some reason wants to swipe through the on-side. Has to settle for an inside edge past his stumps
Santner to Krunal Pandya, no run, tighter, flatter on off. Pandya shuffles, cramps out the room, and jabs awkwardly
Santner to Dhoni, 1 run, moves away, freeing up his hands in a slap through sweeper
Santner to Dhoni, FOUR, steps down, closes out the line and smokes a severly bottom-handed loft down the ground. Some respect in an otherwise lost cause
Santner to Dhoni, no run, rocks behind in the crease, forcing it to a diving extra cover

Ish Sodhi to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Daryl Mitchell!! The equation makes him swing, his reputation makes him swing. And Pandya obliges. He steps out, reaches out to a wide-liner and carves it away to a running back deep extra cover. Hardik Pandya c Daryl Mitchell b Ish Sodhi 4(4) [4s-1]
Ish Sodhi to Hardik Pandya, no run, googly, spinning under Pandya's ungainly swipe across the line
Ish Sodhi to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, tosses it up bravely, and Pandya's taking it on. Oh he HAS to take everything on. Does it with an airy punch, way over the covers
Ish Sodhi to Hardik Pandya, wide, way outside off. Pandya shapes up, realizes how wide it is, and keaves
Ish Sodhi to Hardik Pandya, no run, pushed away with the spin, to cover

Ish Sodhi to Karthik, out Caught by Southee!! Sodhi you mindreader. He's tossed it up wide outside off, Karthik's taken it on with a massive slog sweep. But then it's too full, too wide and gets grapped flat uppishly off the inside half, where Southee, at cow corner nearly lost the ball against the backdrop, but then recovers quickly to dive low to his right. Karthik c Southee b Ish Sodhi 5(6)
Ish Sodhi to Karthik, no run, big reverse sweep. But then Sodhi's got this to turn just as big, way outside off for Karthik to miss big
Daryl Mitchell to Karthik, 1 run, low full-toss on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on for a single
Daryl Mitchell to Karthik, 2 runs, fuller length delivery at the stumps, driven back at the non-striker's end, hits the stumps and deflects away wide of mid-wicket for a couple of runs
Daryl Mitchell to Dhoni, 1 run, full and at the stumps, Dhoni was setting himself up for the helicopter shot, off the inner half and wide of mid-wicket for a single
Daryl Mitchell to Karthik, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, Karthik went hard on the drive, off the inner half towards long-on for a single
Daryl Mitchell to Dhoni, 1 run, the slower ball from Mitchell, bowled at 108 kmph, Dhoni was looking to tuck and missed, clipped off the pads and wide of square leg for a single
Daryl Mitchell to Karthik, 1 run, on a length and at the stumps, nudged wide of mid-wicket for a single
Santner to Dhoni, no run, Santner drops one short and well outside off, Dhoni makes room and cuts it to the right of point - the fielder tumbles and makes a good stop
Santner to Dhoni, no run, tossed up well outside off, Dhoni leans forward and pushes it to the off-side

Santner to Shankar, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! India are falling apart now, nicely tossed up on off and hint of drift away from the right-hander, Shankar was looking to smash it back over the bowler's head, doesn't cover for the drift and slices it high and towards long-off. CDG under the ball and he never drops it. An useful hand from Shankar - but with the rate always going up, he was bound to mishit one. Shankar c de Grandhomme b Santner 27(18) [4s-2 6s-2]
Santner to Dhoni, 1 run, tossed up on Dhoni's pads, he comes down the track and works it wide of mid-wicket for a single

Santner to Pant, out Bowled!! This was always coming - Pant never looked at ease, very full and at the stumps, almost a yorker length delivery. Pant was prodding forward on the drive, ended up yorking himself and the middle-stump is rattled. Excellent variations from Santner and that earned him this wicket. Pant b Santner 4(10)
Santner to Pant, no run, Pant isn't getting it right here, short and drifting across the left-hander, he went for another ambitious reverse sweep and missed
Daryl Mitchell to Pant, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off, whipped in front of mid-wicket for a single

Daryl Mitchell to Pant, no run, change of pace from Mitchell, slower delivery outside off, rolled his fingers across the seam - Pant was looking to hammer it towards the off-side, beaten for lack of pace and the ball bounces twice on its way to the keeper

Daryl Mitchell to Shankar, 1 run, Shankar horribly miscues one, luckily for him, the ball dropped well in front of long-on, no timing at all on that shot and luckily for him - the ball dropped well in front of the fielder
Daryl Mitchell to Pant, 1 run, short of a good length and well outside off, drive wide of extra-cover for a single

Daryl Mitchell to Pant, no run, Pant brings out the reverse sweep, on a good length and shaping across the left-hander, Pant got down on his stance, reverses and looks to help it past the keeper - is beaten for sheer pace
Daryl Mitchell to Pant, no run, fuller length delivery and well wide of off, Pant went hard on the drive and missed
Santner to Pant, 1 run, pushed through flatter and quicker of off, Pant cuts it straight to short third man, a single as Shankar scampers across
Santner to Shankar, 1 run, slower and just outside off, no pace to work with as Shankar drags the lofted on-drive, bounced well in front of long-on for a single
Santner to Shankar, no run, slower and well outside off, pushed off the back-foot towards cover

Santner to Shankar, no run, appeal for stumping. The third umpire will have a look, it's a fair delivery, has Shankar dragged his foot back in time, he has and it's NOT OUT. Nicely bowled, slower and spinning away from outside off, Shankar was dragged out on the sweep, did well to come back in time
Santner to Shankar, SIX, massive, tossed up at the stumps, Shankar bends down low, gets underneath the delivery and swipes it high and over mid-wicket - went a long way into the stands
Santner to Shankar, no run, tossed up well outside off, Shankar makes room and drives it to the left of cover who makes a tumbling stop
Ferguson to Shankar, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, bowled at 150 kmph, pushed to the right of extra-cover for a single
Ferguson to Pant, 1 run, full and on Pant's pads, clipped in front of square on the on-side for a single
Ferguson to Pant, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Pant leans forward and pushes it to the off-side

Ferguson to Dhawan, out Bowled!! That's some yorker and Ferguson enjoyed it - not so, Dhawan, as he walks back to the pavilion. A searing pacy delivery at 151 kmph, full and honing onto Dhawan's pads, beaten for sheer pace was the left-hander, the ball clipped the front-pad and then rattled into the middle-stump. Unplayable stuff from the quickie, he's chuffed to bits and India have lost both openers. Dhawan b Ferguson 29(18) [4s-2 6s-3]

Ferguson to Dhawan, FOUR, nicely played, full and wide of off, Dhawan reaches out, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and scoops it over backward point, rolls away to the ropes for another boundary
Ferguson to Shankar, 1 run, on a good length and angling into the right-hander, Shankar doesn't get hold of the drive, in front of mid-on and he scampers across for a quick single
Kuggeleijn to Shankar, 1 run, short of a length and angling down leg, Shankar was looking to flap it round the corner - off the glove and rolled wide of the keeper for a single, 18 from the over
Kuggeleijn to Shankar, SIX, cracking shot, length delivery outside off, Shankar leans forward and lifts it high and over mid-off, sails over the ropes for a maximum

Kuggeleijn to Shankar, FOUR, much better from Shankar, short of a length and at the stumps, he picked the length early and found the gap wide of long-on with the half-arm pull, couple of bounces and over the ropes
Kuggeleijn to Shankar, 2 runs, short and well outside off, Shankar didn't get hold of the pull as he dragged the shot - has enough to clear the fielder running back from mid-on

Kuggeleijn to Shankar, FOUR, beautifully played, length ball outside off, Shankar leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and lifts it over mid-off, held his pose as the ball bounced once and crossed the ropes
Kuggeleijn to Dhawan, 1 run, on a good length and angling into Dhawan's pads - from round the wicket, flicked down to long leg for a single

Ferguson to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, fuller length delivery on Dhawan's pads, he was way too early on the flick, off the pad and they scamper across for a leg-bye - as the ball rolls towards cover-point
Ferguson to Dhawan, no run, Ferguson shortens his length and angles this one across the left-hander, has Dhawan feeling for the ball and beats his outside edge
Ferguson to Dhawan, SIX, lovely, length ball at the stumps, Dhawan prods across and swings it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum

Ferguson to Shankar, leg byes, 1 run, loud shout for LBW, but think the ball was sliding down leg, struck Shankar low on the back-pad - right in front of leg-stump, the full ball and the right-hander was caught in an absolute tangle
Ferguson to Shankar, no run, short of a length and angling back into the right-hander, Shankar opens himself and clips it straight to the fielder at mid-wicket
Ferguson to Dhawan, 1 run, yorker length delivery on Dhawan's pads, nudged behind square on the on-side for a single
Southee to Shankar, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, Shankar leans forward and finds mid-off with the drive
Southee to Shankar, no run, short of a length and shaping away late, Shankar is opened up by the late shape - off the outer half towards backward point
Southee to Dhawan, 1 run, almost another, but the ball bounced just in front of Munro at long leg - short and at the stumps, Dhawan swivelled across on the pull and didn't bother keeping it down
Southee to Dhawan, no run, on a good length and on Dhawan's pads, nudged towards the on-side

Southee to Rohit, out Caught by Ferguson!! This was coming, the pressure was egtting to the Indians - Southee gave nothing away and he has a wicket against his name now. Banged in short and at the stumps, Rohit swivelled across on the pull, didn't get hold of the shot - high off the bat and the ball lobbed over square leg. Ferguson ran in from the deep, kept his eyes on the ball and completed a fine running catch - sliding forward. Rohit c Ferguson b Southee 1(5)
Southee to Rohit, no run, short of a good length and at the stumps, Rohit prods half-forward and defends it back at the bowler

Kuggeleijn to Dhawan, no run, change of pace from Kuggeleijn, slower ball on Dhawan's pads, he was looking to help it towards fine leg and missed, off the pads and rolled back to the bowler, 16 off the over

Kuggeleijn to Dhawan, FOUR, more runs for Dhawan, he's off and running after a scratchy start, back of a length and on his hips, he swivels across and helps it on its way, over the man at short fine, one bounce and over the ropes
Kuggeleijn to Dhawan, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Dhawan, on a good length and on Dhawan's pads, flicked away backward of square and on the on-side, sails over the ropes for a maximum

Kuggeleijn to Dhawan, SIX, just over deep square leg, heart in the mouth moment for Dhawan, length ball on the pads and he flicked it high and over square leg. Ferguson was the man in the deep - he perhaps timed his leap wrong, burst over his outstretched hands and landed over the ropes
Kuggeleijn to Rohit, leg byes, 1 run, short of a length and angling down the leg-side, Rohit was looking to paddle it around the corner, off his thigh-pad and rolled backward of square on the on-side
Kuggeleijn to Rohit, no run, Kuggeleijn finds some shape as well, full and shaping away from outside off, Rohit's eyes lit up as he saw the length, went for the drive and is beaten by the swing

Southee to Dhawan, no run, Seifert looks very interested, but neither does his capatin nor the umpire, but this is a fine start from Southee, full and shaping back into the left-hander, no room for Dhawan to free his arms, he swung hard and missed
Southee to Dhawan, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, Dhawan leans forward and finds mid-off with the drive

Southee to Dhawan, no run, this is a good start from Southee, keeps it full and gets it to swinb back into the left-hander, Dhawan was coming down the track and squeezes an inside edge past the leg-stump
Southee to Dhawan, no run, full and swinging back into the left-hander, Dhawan slightly fell across on the flick, off the inside edge and onto the pads
Southee to Dhawan, no run, on a good length and well outside off, eased in front of square on the on-side, can't get it past cover
Southee to Rohit, 1 run, short of a length and on Rohit's pads, tucked past square leg for a single

SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, 1 run, another single to finish the innings. Bangladesh finish with 139. Short delivery aimed right at the batsman, Taskin splices the pull towards mid-wicket and has to be content with a single

SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, wide, slower delivery slips out and sprays it outside off, Karthik had to move quickly to his left to glove that. It would have cost Thakur more had Karthik not moved across
SN Thakur to Mustafizur, 1 run, advances and takes it on the full, cue-ends the drive to sweeper cover
SN Thakur to Mustafizur, no run, bouncer just too good for Mustafizur, he stays leg-side and even steps out, but the ball sails over the attempted pull shot. Another dot from Thakur
SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, 1 run, cross-seam delivery and Taskin drags the heave off the inner half to deep mid-wicket

SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, out Rubel Run Out!! 1 run completed. Taskin wanted to keep strike and Rubel had to sacrifice. Thakur follows a backing away Taskin and pings the yorker, squeezed out to long-on and Rubel was pushed for the second by his partner. Raina got to the ball and sent a flat throw to Thakur, who fumbled but the ball deflected right onto the stumps. Rubel run out (Raina/SN Thakur) 0(1)
SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, no run, round the wicket and starts with a heavy ball - short of length around off, Taskin is beaten for pace. The ball had already past him when he attempted the pull shot

Unadkat to Rubel, no run, big swing and a miss from Rubel. He went deep in the crease to the back of a length delivery and missed it altogether. Unadkat finishes with three albeit being expensive, 4-0-38-3

Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, out Caught by Karthik!! Rahman took his chance, but with so much technology, he was not getting away with it. Very full and outside off, almost close to the yorker length, Rahman hits his bat onto the ground while trying to squeeze it out, the ball takes the outside edge and Karthik does the rest. Rahman was hoping it would be a bump ball, which was not the case. Sabbir Rahman c Karthik b Unadkat 30(26) [4s-3 6s-1]
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, wide, this is a fair call. The wide yorker goes too far outside off
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, wide, that's a harsh call. The off-cutter decked off the surface, beating Rahman's pull shot. It was well inside the tramline and still been called
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, no run, much better. The wide yorker outside off, Rahman can't dig it out

Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, SIX, Unadkat is predictable with his length and pace, the off-cutter on back of a length, Rahman goes deep in the crease and waits for the delivery, then nails the pull over deep square leg. Just manages to clear the rope

Unadkat to Taskin Ahmed, leg byes, 1 run, back of a length and Taskin fails to meet with the flick, the ball drops on the surface after hitting the thigh pad and Rahman calls for a quick run, Unadkat has a shy at the bowler's end and misses
Unadkat to Taskin Ahmed, FOUR, starts the over well. Unadkat pitches it right in the arc, Taskin clears his front leg and heaves it to wide long-on, not off the meat but it was in the gap
SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, 1 run, another delivery dug into the surface, Taskin jumps across and helps it along the way to fine leg. Just the two off the over and more importantly Taskin keeps strike
SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, no run, slants the short of length delivery in, Taskin hops and tucks to mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, finally makes connection. The normal speed short of length delivery, Rahman is rushed on the pull and mistimes it through mid-wicket, settles with a single
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run, another play and miss. The knuckle ball on a shortish length, Rahman walks down and swings blindly across the line, nowhere close to the ball
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run, off-pace delivery and Rahman is early into the steer to third man, no contact once again
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run, back of a length around off, Rahman swings and misses. He went too hard and lost his shape
Unadkat to Taskin Ahmed, no run, pounded short and hits the bat hard, defended with an angled bat to backward point
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, short and around the hips, tucked square on the leg-side, for a single

Unadkat to Mehidy Hasan, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Another one gone. Bangladesh need to play around Rahman. Hasan backs away and is followed by a back of a length delivery, not too much room to free his arms and hence the mistime on the heave, right off the splice and Pandey runs across from long-on to complete the formalities. Mehidy Hasan c Manish Pandey b Unadkat 3(4)
Unadkat to Mehidy Hasan, wide, bouncer is too high and is rightly called a wide. Hasan had no chance of connecting with that
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, back of a length on off, Rahman drops it near backward point and sets off
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, much needed boundary for Bangladesh. Short and outside off, Rahman had the space to free his arms, he uncorks his wrists to cut it fiercely past point. Raced away!
Unadkat to Mehidy Hasan, 1 run, angled outside off and Hasan uses that to his advantage to run a single to third man
Chahal to Mehidy Hasan, 1 run, slower and the shortish length allowed Hasan to work it to mid-wicket, Chahal mops up and he too finishes a tidy spell. Figures of 4-0-19-1
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, dragged back length and Rahman pulls it to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Mehidy Hasan, 1 run, shuffles across, got down on his knee and scooped it over Karthik, right over him
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, excellent work from Chahal. The googly is tucked to mid-wicket, no one there and Chahal ran quickly, covered good ground and released the ball. Kept it to a single
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, no run, nice loopy delivery, Rahman plunges forward and defends

Chahal to Liton Das, out Caught by Raina!! Das is waiting. The umpire checks for a no-ball. Fine. Back he goes. Shimmies down and gives himself some room which made him reach out for the flighted delivery, mistimes it towards long-off. It came right off the toe-end. Raina stations himself underneath and reverse cups it. Das was set and had to bat through. Liton Das c Raina b Chahal 34(30) [4s-3]

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, seven runs off the final delivery. Ruins the figures of Shankar somewhat. Low full toss outside off, Rahman bent his back knee and scooped it over short fine. The pace on the delivery did the rest

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, no ball, he's struggling to complete his over. Two wides followed by an overstep. Speared in full and Rahman squeezes it out to extra cover, Das is sent back on the single
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, wide, loopy full delivery outside off, Rahman drives and misses. The umpire takes his own time to signal a wide, right call but took too much time
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, wide, bumper down leg and Rahman lets it pass, wide called. Will it make Shankar pay?

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 2 runs, dropped! But it was the toughest of the lot. The cross-seamer outside off, Rahman reaches out and skies it towards mid-wicket, Shankar runs all the way from his followthrough and gets both hands, but the momentum makes the ball pop out. He might have also overran a bit. Full marks for effort though
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, the heavy ball from Shankar once more, pounded hard and close to off, Rahman is through the pull shot and the ball sails over the top-edge
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, 1 run, low full toss and Das laps it towards long leg, this time Sundar cleaning up

Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, no run, premeditation from Das, walked across to play the scoop, but a clever Shankar pulled the length back, flies over the flashing blade of Das. Right on top of leg-stump

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, short of length around off, Rahman helps it down to deep backward square with a pull. Chahal does well to keep it to a single, attacked the ball and released it quickly
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, flatter and outside off, dabbed to short third man. Sundar is done for the evening, another economical outing for him, 4-0-23-0
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, 1 run, fired full and on the pads, nurdled round the corner
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, wide, pushed it too far outside off, Das can't reach for the cut, wide given
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, 2 runs, steps out and chips it inside out to sweeper cover, wide of Dhawan and the two was on
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, quicker and at the stumps, Rahman reverse sweeps square and near sweeper
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, 1 run, low full toss and Das under edges the reverse sweep towards backward point. He would have been better of playing a conventional sweep to the bad delivery

Washington Sundar to Liton Das, FOUR, once more the batsman manages to split two fielders. Das dances down the wicket and lofts it with the turn over mid-wicket, Unadkat from long-on put in the dive but the ball still rolled over

SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, the extra ball ruins the over for Thakur. Pitched up around off, Rahman almost checks his drive and chips it uppishly, but luckily for him it was right between cover and mid-off
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, wide, effort delivery from Thakur, the grunt was also heard, bouncer just outside off, Rahman lets it sail over him. The square leg umpire does not like the height on that
SN Thakur to Liton Das, 1 run, rolled his fingers across the ball and Das nudged it through unmanned mid-wicket. He wanted the second but Dhawan ensures that the duo stay put
SN Thakur to Liton Das, no run, yorker outside off, Das can't squeeze it out, right underneath his bat
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, fuller delivery to which Rahman hangs back, the block rolls away past mid-wicket and to long-on
SN Thakur to Liton Das, 1 run, once more dug in and Das swivel pulls it to deep backward square, on the bounce to Dhawan
SN Thakur to Liton Das, 2 runs, banged in and cramped Das for room, he backed away and spliced the pull straight over Thakur, Pant from long-on runs across and tidies up, two added
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, fired into the blockhole and Rahman jams it to back to Sundar
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, 1 run, tossed up and Das fetches the sweep from outside off, mistimed through mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, no run, flatter and around off, Das punches it meekly to cover
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, wide, might have slipped out of his hand, full toss down leg and Das lets it pass
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, shortens the length and Rahman tucks it square on the leg-side

Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, now tries a fancy reverse sweep, but Sundar had slowed it up - the ball arrived after the shot was played. Strikes Rahman on the thigh pad and drops near his feet
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, beaten. Sundar back and he beats the bat. The straight roller outside off, Rahman plays for the turn with a big lunge forward and is beaten

Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, no run, almost had another. Das shuffles across to play the lap, the length does not aid him and he misses it by a long way. Shankar had dragged the length back smartly. Another eventful over from him

Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Tame, tame dismissal. Shankar making up for those two drop catches in his first over, has two wickets in his kitty now. Nothing but a harmless back of a length outside off, Mahmudullah can't resist going after, punches it uppishly to sweeper cover. The intent was to take it over the point fielder, but he got it squarer than he would have liked. Mahmudullah c SN Thakur b Vijay Shankar 1(8)
Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, no run, back of a length just outside off, Mahmudullah stays back and knocks it to the right of Shankar
Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, no run, sharp bouncer that is also well-directed, right at the batsman, Mahmudullah watches it all along and sways away from the line of the delivery
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, 1 run, fullish and outside off, Das once more looks to target the cow corner fence and drags it off the cue-end to long-on, just a single as Pant tidies up
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, wide, sees the batsman walk across his stumps and spears a low full toss down leg, wide called. The free-hit stays..
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, no ball, oversteps and fires it full outside off, jammed out towards cover. Shankar has been teasing the line for a while now and has finally been penalized
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, no run, on a length and outside off, Das tries an ugly hack to the leg-side and misses
Chahal to Mahmudullah, no run, darted outside off, Mahmudullah dabs it in front of point
Chahal to Liton Das, 1 run, tossed up delivery outside off, Das fetches it from way outside off and sweeps it over mid-wicket. A single taken
Chahal to Mahmudullah, 1 run, slow and low on the pads, Mahmudullah flicks that away to deep mid-wicket for a single
Chahal to Mahmudullah, no run, flighted delivery around off, Mahmudullah pushes it in front of cover-point
Chahal to Mahmudullah, no run, quicker delivery on middle and leg, Mahmudullah goes for a wild heave and ends up getting an inside edge on his pad. Could have easily chopped that on
Chahal to Liton Das, 1 run, tossed up delivery on middle and leg, Das tucks that away to deep mid-wicket and takes a single
Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, no run, short of a length around off, Mahmudullah looks to punch that and gets an under edge

Vijay Shankar to Rahim, out Caught by Karthik!! The keeper knew it was out and he asked for the review straightaway. He's bang on with his call. Length delivery outside off, Rahim comes down the track, throws his bat at and gets a feather to it. Though the onfield decision was not out, India called for the review and got it right. UltraEdge confirms the same and Rahim has to make the long walk back to the pavilion. Rahim c Karthik b Vijay Shankar 18(14) [4s-2 6s-1]

Vijay Shankar to Rahim, SIX, pulled away! Short delivery again with not much pace in it. Rahim has plenty of time to pick the length and pummel it over mid-wicket. Hits the scoreboard on the full and the umpire raises his arms
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, 1 run, on a length and outside off, Liton steers it down to third man with an open face of his bat
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, no run, banged short around middle and leg, Das is way down the track as he attempts a pull and misses

Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, FOUR, short and punished. Short delivery well outside off, Das reaches out for it and slaps it through the gap at covers. No real pace in that delivery by Vijay Shankar and gets the treatment it deserved
Chahal to Liton Das, 1 run, shortish on middle and leg, worked to backward square leg for a single

Chahal to Rahim, leg byes, 1 run, quicker one on the pads, Rahim gets struck on the pads as he fails to connect his flick. As the ball rolls to the left side of the pitch, Rahim calls for a run. Karthik sprints to collect the ball and goes for a direct hit at the striker's end, can't hit though. That was close. Might have been a run out
Chahal to Liton Das, 1 run, loopy delivery around off, Das puts on his dancing shoes and drives it uppishly through the gap at cover
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, dipping into the batsman and a bit fullish in length. Rahim moves away and angles that in front of gully. Clever bowling by the leggie on that occasion
Chahal to Rahim, no run, comes down the wicket and pushes the tossed up delivery back to the bowler
Chahal to Rahim, no run, loopy delivery on middle and leg, Rahim tries to flick that, ends up getting a leading edge. Almost chips it back to the bowler
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, no run, back of a length around off, Liton Das knocks that back to the bowler

Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, 2 runs, that's the second dropped catch of the over. Butter fingers? Short of a length around middle, Das pulls this one towards fine leg where Sundar comes running in, gets his hands to it and spills it out. Raina earlier and Sundar now! India are struggling in the field today. Quite unlike them
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, back of a length around off, Rahim has whipped that to mid-wicket for a single

Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, 1 run, how can you drop that, says the commentator on air. And when a fielder like Suresh Raina does that, can't get any worse. Short of a length delivery around off, Das goes for a pull and mistimes it towards mid-off where Raina puts down a sitter.
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, 2 runs, good length delivery that sticks in the surface. Das tries to work that away to the on-side, ends up getting a leading edge over mid-wicket
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, on a length around off, Rahim pokes his bat at it and gets an inside edge. Just past the stump and to the left side of the keeper
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, aimed on middle and leg, Rahim nudges it in front of mid-wicket and takes a single to retain strike

Chahal to Rahim, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries. Flighted delivery on leg, Rahim goes down on his knee, gets in position early and sweeps that away through mid-wicket. That was hit with a lot of authority by the veteran
Chahal to Rahim, FOUR, that's t20 cricket. Changes grips and reverse sweeps the flighted delivery nonchalantly over point to get off the mark in style
Chahal to Rahim, no run, another floater delivery on off, Rahim looks to attack the delivery with a heave, doesn't middle it though
Chahal to Rahim, no run, full and straight on middle and leg, Rahim is on his front foot as he blocks it off his front foot
Chahal to Rahim, no run, flighted delivery coming into the batsman after pitching outside leg, Rahim defends it off his back foot

SN Thakur to Tamim, out Caught by Unadkat!! Thakur gets his man. Couldn't get the lbw in his favour but does him with a short delivery. Bangs it short on middle and Tamim is in no position as he attempts the pull shot. The top edge flies to short fine leg where Unadkat makes no mistake and takes a reverse cup. Thakur was probably destined to get the opener's wicket. Tamim c Unadkat b SN Thakur 15(16) [4s-2]

SN Thakur to Tamim, FOUR, not timed but enough on it to race away. Short of a length around off, Tamim walks down the wicket and flat bats it. Doesn't middle that but gets it over the fielder at mid-off and finds the boundary
