SN Thakur to Tamim, FOUR, insult to injury. Full in length outside off, Tamim charges down the wicket and slams it through the gap at covers. Good looking shot by the southpaw.

SN Thakur to Tamim, no run, decision overturned! That was a really good DRS by Tamim Iqbal. Tamim tried to flick that away before he got rapped on the pads. As it was pitching outside leg, the onfield decision has to be reversed. Good call by the batsman there

SN Thakur to Tamim, no run, full and wide outside off, Tamim dances down the track and tries to reach for it, can't connect his shot though. Saw the batsman walk down the track and fired it outside off. Clever
SN Thakur to Tamim, no run, back of a length outside off, Tamim cuts it hard but can't find the gap. Straight to the man at point

Washington Sundar to Liton Das, FOUR, nicely done. Grounds his knee and sweeps the flighted delivery over square leg. On a bounce and into the fence. Good thinking by the batsman there, he knew there was no fielder in the deep and he picked the right shot and the right spot
Washington Sundar to Tamim, 1 run, flatter on middle and leg, worked away to deep mid-wicket by Tamim for a single

Washington Sundar to Tamim, no run, in the air... but safe. That's been dropped, in fact. Tossed up delivery on off, Tamim dances down the wicket and drives it uppishly to cover. Rohit puts in a dive forward, gets his hands to it but spills it out. Was difficult, but should have been taken
Washington Sundar to Tamim, no run, shortish delivery at 83 kph outside off, Tamim reaches for it and punches it to Chahal at cover-point
Washington Sundar to Tamim, no run, fired on the pads, Tamim goes deep in his crease and tickles it to square leg. That was bowled really quick
Washington Sundar to Tamim, no run, floated around off, Tamim pushes it back to the bowler off his front foot

Unadkat to Tamim, 1 run, grunts out loudly after bowling that full length delivery. On middle and leg, Tamim nudges it in front of deep square leg and takes a single. Wanted the second too, but Das sends him back. Quite an eventful over, that
Unadkat to Liton Das, 1 run, shortish delivery shaping into the batsman, Das tucks it off his hips in order to get off the mark

Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, out Caught by Chahal!! Unadkat draws first blood. Should have got his wicket in the first over itself, gets it a over later nevertheless. Pitches it up on middle and leg, Sarkar flicks it again but this time straight to the fielder at short fine leg. Chahal is the man who takes a sharp low catch and ends Sarkar's stay at the crease. Had struck a six earlier in the over, should have been more patient. Soumya Sarkar c Chahal b Unadkat 14(12) [4s-1 6s-1]
Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, wide, short and wide, in fact way outside off. Easy call for the umpire and Unadkat isn't pleased with himself
Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, 2 runs, good length delivery on off, Sarkar shimmies down the wicket and chips it over mid-off. Doesn't get the proper timing, could have cleared the fence or else

Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, SIX, nonchalant hit. Full length delivery on middle and leg, Sarkar picks up the length early and with utter ease flicks it over the square leg fence. Half a dozen in his account and Unadkat has been put under pressure
Unadkat to Tamim, 1 run, shortish delivery aimed at the hips, Tamim is on his toe as he flicks it over square leg. On a bounce to the fielder in the deep

Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, another delivery fired into the batsman. On middle and leg, Sarkar flicks that away to short square leg. Lucky there. Might have easily gone through his defence, if he was a tad late in getting his bat down
Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, short and quick outside off, cuts it hard but finds the fielder at point
Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, floated on off, Sarkar drives it back to the bowler off his front foot
Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, sharp turn on that. Pitches outside off and spins away sharply to beat Sarkar's tentative push
Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, fired in outside off, Sarkar brings his bat down and chops it to backward point
Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR, smashed away! Short and wide outside off, Soumya Sarkar reaches for it and slaps it through the covers. First boundary of the innings and the match...

Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, three fielders converging on that and it falls in no man's land. Nobody called there, should have been taken. Lack of communication, the culprit there. On a length around off, Sarkar heaved it and got a top edge towards third man where there were three fielders (third man, backward point and cover-point) and no body went for it
Unadkat to Tamim, 3 runs, strays in line again. Length delivery on the pads, Tamim flicks it through square leg and takes three as the ball crawls away to the deep
Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, good length delivery around the off-stump channel, Sarkar angles it past backward point and gets to the other end. A fumble from Pandey allowed that single
Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, no run, that's a jaffa. In that corridor of uncertainty around the off stump channel. Sarkar tries to fend, gets beaten due to the undeviated delivery
Unadkat to Tamim, 1 run, first runs on the board. On a length and bowled on the pads, Tamim gets off the mark with an easy flick to fine leg
Unadkat to Tamim, no run, starts off with a shortish delivery outside off, Tamim lifts his bat and let's it through to the keeper

Rubel to Manish Pandey, 1 run, diving half-stop at point by Mehidy but that won't matter much. Manish Pandey has thrown his hands at the width and gotten his side over the line. India win by 6 wickets
Rubel to Manish Pandey, no run, doesn't get the timing right. Throws his hands and miscues the drive to cover
Rubel to Karthik, 1 run, stays in the crease and slices this ball towards extra cover. Softs the impacts, and hence could buy some time for the single
Rubel to Manish Pandey, 1 run, cramped for room, Manish Pandey punches this back of a length delivery straight down the ground. 2 needed

Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower delivery ticked straight to square leg. And they've charged across for the run. And the throw at the bowler's end wasn't going to scare Manish Pandey one bit. 3 runs needed
Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, FOUR, there's width again and there's Manish Pandey at it again. Gets on his toes, reaches out and cuts it uppishly through cover-point
Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, no run, back-footed to run this round the corner. Finds the fielder though. Mustafizur tries to cramp Manish Pandey for room this time
Mustafizur to Karthik, 1 run, scythes at the width and thrashes it behind the point fielder. 8 needed

Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, 1 run, stays put and uses his hands to guide the ball behind backward point. He's using the width that Mustafizur's over the wicket angle to the right-hander comes readymade with. 9 needed
Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, FOUR, 119ks cutter going across Manish Pandey who deftly guides it late through third man. Dive in the deep but that's for nothing. 10 needed
Taskin Ahmed to Manish Pandey, 1 run, manoeuvres this from the crease. Just opens the face of the bat to guide this back of a length delivery past point. Just the 14 needed
Taskin Ahmed to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, uppishly punched over cover. Gets lucky with a little bit of height else.. Early into the shot

Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, out Caught by Liton Das!! Miscues it to deep mid-wicket. Taskin Ahmed was bowling from round the wicket, Dhawan tries to lay into that with his leg-side loft but gets it a bit straighter than intended. End of another of Dhawan's specials. He's nearly gotten India there.Dhawan c Liton Das b Taskin Ahmed 55(43) [4s-5 6s-2]
Taskin Ahmed to Manish Pandey, 1 run, gets tall with the length and swivel-pulls this short ball one-legged, pirouetting on his left toe
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, 1 run, pushes it on the up to mid-off. Quick single in the face of that wide throw
Taskin Ahmed to Manish Pandey, 1 run, back of a length outside off, shunted to third man
Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, no run, played back to a full ball and squirts it out somehow. Bails out, though. Mushfiq ran back and stylishly deflected the ball onto the stumps
Nazmul Islam to Manish Pandey, 1 run, now a full toss that's punches to long-on
Nazmul Islam to Manish Pandey, FOUR, possibly the worst follow-up delivery you can bowl. Beat him with turn last ball and now drops one short. Pulled off the back foot
Nazmul Islam to Manish Pandey, no run, a bit of turn. Manish Pandey's wanting to run a single to third man and nearly edges it to the keeper
Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, 1 run, fired flat on middle and leg, stabbed to long-on
Nazmul Islam to Manish Pandey, 1 run, outside off, Manish Pandey pushes a single to long-off
Rubel to Manish Pandey, 1 run, cramped by this back of a length delivery that kicks up extra, but Manish Pandey's nicely ridden it wide of cover. 27 needed off 30
Rubel to Dhawan, 1 run, slower length ball on the pads, Dhawan waits and swats it round the corner
Rubel to Dhawan, no run, back of a length 137ks delivery angled across, Dhawan can't get it past the off-side infield
Rubel to Manish Pandey, 1 run, stabbed to cover for a single
Rubel to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, gets off the mark with a jabby ramp over the slipper. Rahman runs across and cuts it off from deep backward point. Looked like a boundary until then

Rubel to Raina, out Caught by Mehidy Hasan!! Once they find you out, they find you out. Short ball gets Raina again. Was caught in an awkward position, trying to play a short ball with a crouch instead of off back foot. Ends up chipping it tamely to the fielder at square leg. Raina c Mehidy Hasan b Rubel 28(27) [4s-1 6s-1]
Nazmul Islam to Raina, 1 run, this time only as far as mid-on. Use of the feet again. 32 needed
Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, 1 run, comes down the track and stabs it to long-on
Nazmul Islam to Raina, 1 run, pinches a single through covers

Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, byes, 1 run, this skidded on straight after pitching. Dhawan was long way down the track, doesn't get bat to ball, and yeah that's a missed stumping. Keeper makes a meal of it. Didn't read it either. None of them

Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, FOUR, consecutive fifties for Dhawan. Gets there off an absolute filth. Nazmul Islam sees him making room, fired it down leg. Way down leg. And Dhawan just helped it through fine leg
Nazmul Islam to Raina, 1 run, fired on the bast of leg-stump from over the wicket, squirted out to deep square leg.
Mahmudullah to Dhawan, no run, comes down the track and finds extra cover with his soft-handed punch. He's gotten singles off these tonight -- plenty of them -- but not this time. 41 needed
Mahmudullah to Raina, 1 run, turns it to backward square leg
Mahmudullah to Dhawan, 1 run, got too close to the pitch of the ball there. Used his feet and then had to chip it out towards long-off
Mahmudullah to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan shows how to deal with lengths like these. Rocks back and mauls the drag-down over deep mid-wicket
Mahmudullah to Raina, 1 run, quicker on the stumps, worked to long-on
Mahmudullah to Raina, 2 runs, dropped short and all Raina does is pick it up over square leg. Could have taken more off that
Mustafizur to Raina, 1 run, good dive at backward point and Raina's open-batted glide, and that after making room, fetches just the single. India need 52 runs in 48 balls
Mustafizur to Raina, no run, short 133ks ball booming over his right shoulder, Raina just evades it. The last thing he wants to give away his wicket to
Mustafizur to Dhawan, 1 run, gives this pull shot a real go. Had his weight in front, so the hands had to generate all the power
Mustafizur to Raina, 1 run, swivelled round the corner there

Mustafizur to Dhawan, 1 run, he's jumped out of the crease to the wrong length. Shorter than he thought, just manages to chip it over Tamim running back from extra cover say. And the batsmen settle for a single, after nearly colliding into each other. Raina wasn't keen on the second
Mustafizur to Raina, 1 run, cleanly makes room, exposing the stumps entirely, and picks Mustafizur with an open-bat punch through covers

Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, no run, Bangladesh review: Dhawan charges down and nearly yorks himself, and Rahim looked convinced behind the stumps. Seems to be no bat on first replay. Clearly missing the inside edge. Ball tracking is in, and it's umpire's call on impact and wickets. Just tickling the leg-stump, so the onfield decision stays. And so does Bangladesh's review
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, no run, front leg out on the push but can't beat mid-off
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, no run, not the first time we've seen Dhawan miss that. The sweep, early into the shot and was hit on the forearm there
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, 1 run, makes room and has to open-battedly squeeze out a quicker delivery aimed for the stumps
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, slider, Raina prods out a forward defence
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, gets a big stride out and sweeps it round the corner

Soumya Sarkar to Raina, FOUR, that is Raina at his very best. Looks so composed when he plays that chipped loft over extra cover. Stays stable at the crease and opens up the off-side with exquisite timing

Soumya Sarkar to Raina, no run, looks to be cheeky, stands way outside leg and was made to reach out for a full and wide delivery, makes contact off the toe-end and trips over after losing balance. Looked comical realtime
Soumya Sarkar to Dhawan, 1 run, veering in full at the stumps, Dhawan creams the flick through mid-wicket
Soumya Sarkar to Raina, 1 run, charges out of his crease and chips the cut behind point
Soumya Sarkar to Raina, wide, digs it short and gets too much height on that, called wide
Soumya Sarkar to Dhawan, 1 run, advances and adjusts smartly to splice the punch wide of mid-off
Soumya Sarkar to Dhawan, no run, 115ks, Dhawan had to generate pace on that, punch-drives as hard as he can, but can't get it past cover
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, stays legside, opens the bat face and taps the ball to cover
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, firmly punches to short cover and speeds off for a quick single
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, 1 run, nicely flicked away behind square

Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, another 94ks slider, Dhawan fails to lay bat on the defensive push and is hit pretty high on the pad. Appeal for leg before, but the angle might have taken it down leg. They don't conisder a review either
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, 1 run, tucked away through square leg, Mehidy Hasan is just firing it in
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, shuffles down the pitch and works this quicker delivery through mid-wicket
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, 1 run, fuller and wider, Dhawan inside edges his drive onto the pad and gathers a single as the ball escapes into the off-side
Taskin Ahmed to Raina, 1 run, digs it into the pitch, Raina hops and drops the ball into the vacant spaces at mid-wicket, easy single
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, 1 run, touch short, Dhawan's quick to rock back and pull to deep square
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, no run, better. Keeps it full on off-stump, Dhawan drives, but can't pierce the gap on the off-side
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, FOUR, another swivel and this one's shovelled to the deep backward square fence. Taskin needs to reconsider his lengths, can't keep bowling short to such a quality batsman

Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, SIX, when you bowl a short ball to Dhawan around leg stump, you better head back to your bowling crease, because there is only one way the ball's gonna go. Into the stands. 12 rows back. SD swivels and parcels it into the vacant stands over fine leg
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, looped up around off, pushed back to the bowler
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, presses forward and drives a slider to the left of short extra cover, a diving stop from the fielder there
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, shortens his length and pushes it aroud middle, Dhawan clips to deep square
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, 1 run, eases a single down to long-off
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, SIX, Raina's go-to stroke against the spinners, the slogsweep. Goes down on one knee, picks the flight and lauches Mehidy Hasan over cow corner. Clean as a whistle
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, quicker delivery, fires it in on the stumps, Raina tucks himself into a block
Rubel to Dhawan, no run, is happy to sit back and bunt this length ball into the off-side

Rubel to Raina, 1 run, dropped. Mehidy, the fielder. He was standing at leg gully position, had very less reaction time, straight in and straight out. All that after Raina flicked one off his pads, another day and it would have gone straight into the hands of the fielder
Rubel to Dhawan, 1 run, lovely late cut now, saunters across for a single to square third man
Rubel to Dhawan, FOUR, short around off-stump, Dhawan had enough time to pick his spot, swivels and lays into the pull through mid-wicket

Rubel to Raina, 1 run, a direct hit at the bowler's end would have been curtains for Raina. He taps the ball in front of cover and calls for a quick single, had to put in a desperate headfirst dive and thankfully for him the throw misses the target

Rubel to Pant, out Bowled!! Ah, this is getting contagious. Another chop on, Rishabh Pant the latest entrant. Must say, this was a poor shot selection from the Delhi lad, gets width alright but he is so reluctant to move his feet, just throws the kitchen sink in hope and drags it back onto his timbers. Pant b Rubel 7(8) [4s-1]
Mehidy Hasan to Pant, 1 run, dabs the ball to cover and nabs another quick single
Mehidy Hasan to Pant, no run, jumps down the pitch and quickly realizes he ain't gonna get to the pitch of the ball, nicely pads it away with an extended lunge forward
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, slider, looks to tuck Dhawan for room, he nudges it into the leg-side and takes off
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, FOUR, risky, but effective. Reaches out for the flighted delivery outside off and controls the sweep behind square, no-one in the deep
Mehidy Hasan to Pant, 1 run, smart batting this from the youngster. Pushes the ball in front of cover and sneaks a quick single
Mehidy Hasan to Pant, no run, floats it up around off-stump, Pant prods forward and defends solidly
Mustafizur to Pant, 1 run, full and homing in towards middle and leg, Pant goes whack on the flick, drags it off the inside half to deep square
Mustafizur to Pant, FOUR, yorker? No problem says Rishabh Pant who unveils those mighty bottom hand power to whiplash it over mid-wicket. Gee, he hit that really hard
Mustafizur to Pant, no run, here is a chance for the outrageously talented Rishabh Pant. Gets a short ball first up and he mistimes the pull to short fine leg

Mustafizur to Rohit, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Another failure for Rohit Sharma. No room on offer on this cross seam delivery, Rohit decides to sit back and guide it down to third man with an open bat face, the ball darted back in a touch to catch the inside edge and shatter the stumps. He looked good in his brief stay and I'm sure he would be gutted having failed to convert this into a big one. Rohit b Mustafizur 17(13) [4s-3]
Mustafizur to Rohit, no run, full outside off, driven gorgeously, but straight it goes to the man at cover
Mustafizur to Dhawan, 1 run, gentle length delivery sprayed on the pads, Dhawan helps it through square leg for a single
Rubel to Dhawan, 1 run, full and zooms in towards the pads, Dhawan drills it straight and a half-stop from Rubel enables the single
Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, turns his bat face early on the flick and sends a leading edge behind point
Rubel to Rohit, wide, looks to slash a wide delivery, too far outside off stump, wided

Rubel to Rohit, no run, that's a corker, bowled at 140ks. Lands on back of a length and takes off.. Rohit searches for the ball with an air of uncertainty, nowhere near; the ball seamed away with a lot of oomph and the extra bounce made Rohit look like a school boy. Well past the edge
Rubel to Dhawan, 1 run, shapes it back into Dhawan, he gets a big inside edge onto pad that rolls into the square leg area
Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, wide of off-stump, Rohit steers a single down to third man
Rubel to Rohit, FOUR, edged and four! Straightens off the seam around off-stump, catches a thick outside edge as Rohit looks to push off the back foot and off she goes....very fine of third man
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, no run, 137ks, pitches outside leg and leaps sharply into Dhawan who fails to lay bat on the tuck, hit on the thigh pad and drops dead near his feet
Taskin Ahmed to Rohit, 1 run, angled in on middle, worked away into the leg-side for a single

Taskin Ahmed to Rohit, FOUR, not too much width but Rohit has such good hand-eye co-ordination. Lazy elegance. Times the pants of this length ball as he crashes it square on the off-side, no-one moved
Taskin Ahmed to Rohit, no run, bowls it full and straight, Rohit's drive finds mid-on
Taskin Ahmed to Rohit, FOUR, nonchalant! Picks up the length early and nails the pull over mid-wicket. Fast hands, excellent timing and placement

Taskin Ahmed to Rohit, no run, and there comes the typical Rohit Sharma tentative push. Hangs his bat outside off sans any feet and gets beaten on the outside edge. Lovely away movement on offer there for Taskin
Mustafizur to Dhawan, no run, 134ks short ball, climbs up over Dhawan's head as he watches it sail over to the keeper
Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, slower ball on the stumps, Rohit waits on the back foot and tucks it round the corner
Mustafizur to Dhawan, 1 run, fizzes off the pitch and rushes onto Dhawan, he deflects it off the inside half into the leg-side
Mustafizur to Dhawan, 2 runs, picks it up off his pads and chips the flick over mid-wicket, got a faint leading edge on that but he had placed it in the gap
Mustafizur to Dhawan, FOUR, width and bam! Dhawan sits back and flays that behind point. Can't bowl there to Dhawan, he is so dismissive
Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, bowls it on back of a length and slants it wide of off-stump, Rohit opens the bat face and guides a single down to third man

Rabada to Navdeep Saini, byes, 1 run, back of a length angled into the right hander, Saini backs away and is beaten by the clear pace of Rabada. Chahar races across to the other end and survives as de Kock fails to hit the target. India finish with 134

Rabada to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Miller!! Geez! That was struck off the middle but straight to the fielder. Pandya gets underneath the length delivery and powers it flat to long-on, Miller reverse cups the catch but the force was such that he tumbled backwards. Pandya watches the catch and walks off with a smile on his face. Hardik Pandya c Miller b Rabada 14(18) [4s-1]

Rabada to Washington Sundar, wide, out Washington Sundar Run Out!! Sundar sacrifies himself for the greater good. Rabada sprays the bouncer down leg, there is not contact made by the batsman and Pandya is almost next to Sundar by the time de Kock gloved it, there was no other option then to listen to the senior partner, Sundar goes for it and is caught well short by a direct hit by Rabada. Washington Sundar run out (de Kock/Rabada) 4(1) [4s-1]

Rabada to Washington Sundar, FOUR, cheeky! The confidence these young guys carry these days. Ufff! Short of length delivery around off, Sundar arches back and ramps it over de Kock. He did it so nonchalantly
Rabada to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, full, fast and on off-stump, Pandya shuffles across and whips it to deep mid-wicket
Rabada to Hardik Pandya, no run, even Rabada has resorted to slower balls now, Pandya swings across the line and is deceived for pace

Rabada to Jadeja, out Caught&Bowled!! It's up, still up.. still.. still.. and there Rabada takes it. Jadeja cleared his front leg to muscle it to cow corner but sent it into orbit, Rabada moves across to his left and waits for an eternity for the ball to arrive and then takes it calmly. He then holds the teapot pose for his skipper who might have doubted his catching skills. Jadeja c and b Rabada 19(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, ends the over with a much needed boundary. Sees Pandya shuffled across and sprays the slower delivery way outside off, Pandya reaches out and hammers it with all his power to wide long-off. That is the first one he has middled in this innings
Phehlukwayo to Jadeja, 1 run, slow dipping full delivery, Jadeja whips it to deep mid-wicket
Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, once again no pace offered and Pandya goes full-monty but only mistimes it to long-on

Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, no run, that is the second time Phehlukwayo has fooled Pandya with a leg-cutter. Lands it perfectly in the slot and gets it to deviate off the surface, Pandya goes hard and almost is swinging off the feet, but no connection made

Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, in the air and lands safely. Slower short of length delivery, Pandya shuffles across and cramps himself, slices the flat-batted hit over extra cover and the ball drops wide of the running sweeper. It is good enough to come back for the second
Phehlukwayo to Jadeja, 1 run, charges down and is met by a slower delivery, chops it to cover and crosses over for a quick single
Rabada to Jadeja, 1 run, short and rising up, Jadeja hops up and drops it into the leg-side, retains strike
Rabada to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, triggers back and across again, cramped by the back of a length delivery and he can only tuck it through mid-wicket

Rabada to Hardik Pandya, no run, bouncer outside off, Pandya with his back and across movement gets into a bit of an awkward position, from there to connect with the pull/hook is almost impossible, beaten comfortably on the top-edge. Umpire Menon signals one for the over
Rabada to Jadeja, 1 run, back of a length close to off, Jadeja drops it into the off-side and rotates strike

Rabada to Jadeja, SIX, shot! That wakes the crowd up at Chinnaswamy as well. Jadeja backs away a bit and gives himself the space to free his arms, the back of a length delivery is right in the slot and he smashes it straight back over Rabada
Rabada to Jadeja, no run, back of a length on off, Jadeja stays leg-side and steers it to backward point
B Hendricks to Jadeja, 1 run, short of length around chest height, Jadeja swivels and pulls it to long leg. Hendricks has finished bowling a fine spell, he ends with impressive figures of 4-0-14-2
B Hendricks to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, back of a length at Pandya's body and he can only knock it to long-on
B Hendricks to Hardik Pandya, no run, spears the yorker outside off, Pandya moves across and cannot squeeze it out

B Hendricks to Jadeja, 1 run, shortens the length as Jadeja gives the charge, jams the heave off the inside edge onto the pad and the ball rolls in front of point, Pandya calls him through for a quick single
B Hendricks to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, short of length outside off, Pandya slaps it to sweeper cover
B Hendricks to Jadeja, 1 run, back of a length around off, Jadeja drops it in front of cover and sets off, Miller swoops down and fires at the striker's end but Pandya had made it in

Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, no run, oh! Pandya and Phehlukwayo have a laugh. The latter completely deceived Pandya with a leg-cutter. It was in the slot and Pandya thought he could smash it out of the ground, went full swing with his bat but the away deviation beat him comfortably
Phehlukwayo to Hardik Pandya, no run, fuller than a good length and Pandya drives it back to Phehlukwayo who parries it to mid-off
Phehlukwayo to Jadeja, 1 run, on a length outside off, Jadeja steers it to third man and once again Pandya shouts a loud "no" for the second

Phehlukwayo to Jadeja, no run, hesitation between running between the wickets and you expect that with this pair. Jadeja knocked it towards cover and starting racing to the other end, Pandya stayed put and sent back his partner. Jadeja turned back and made it in. It was a 50-50 call for a single but when in doubt it is better to abort
Phehlukwayo to Jadeja, no run, good length ball on off, Jadeja defends it back down the wicket

Phehlukwayo to Jadeja, FOUR, edged and four. India will take them any which way now. Full delivery angled in from round the wicket, Jadeja looks to drive through the line and the outside edge runs away fine to third man
B Hendricks to Jadeja, 1 run, short of length and Jadeja hops across to ride the bounce, tucks it backward of square leg

B Hendricks to Jadeja, no run, beauty! He is getting the ball to nibble around even in the 15th over. Back of a length and moves away, Jadeja goes feeling for the ball and is beaten on the outside edge
B Hendricks to Jadeja, no run, oh! Almost very similar to the one that got Krunal out. Back of a length in the channel around off, Jadeja has a flirt before bringing his bat inside the line

B Hendricks to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by de Kock!! Umpire Nandan took his time but raised his finger at last. There was a clear edge and the South Africans were up immediately. Krunal knew and he doesn't even bother to discuss about the review with his brother. Short of length delivery that straightens a touch, Krunal is opened up and feathers an outside edge through to de Kock. Krunal Pandya c de Kock b B Hendricks 4(7)
B Hendricks to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, short of length outside off, Pandya shuffles across and slaps it to sweeper cover
B Hendricks to Hardik Pandya, no run, back of a length angled across the right hander, Hardik stands tall and looks to drive on the rise but is beaten by the angle and the extra bit of bounce

Shamsi to Krunal Pandya, no run, drifting down leg and Krunal tries to work it into the leg-side, but the ball turns to catch the leading edge and roll to backward point. Shamsi finishes with 4-0-23-1
Shamsi to Krunal Pandya, no run, quicker and skidding on, Krunal goes for the cut upon seeing the length but is beaten on the outside edge
Shamsi to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, on the pads and Hardik clips it away to backward square leg
Shamsi to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Pandya drives it to cover and the fielder parries it to long-off
Shamsi to Krunal Pandya, no run, flighted on off-stump, Pandya pushes it inside out to cover
Shamsi to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, wrong 'un that Krunal reads off the surface, steers it to backward point where Fortuin dives over the ball and allows it to escape, easy two
Fortuin to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, flatter delivery around leg-stump, nudged away in front of square on the leg-side

Fortuin to Shreyas Iyer, wide, out Stumped!! Second wicket in the over and India are in trouble here. Once again clever bowling from Fortuin. He sensed the charge and darted it down leg, Iyer has no second line of defence and it is an easy stumping for de Kock. India have lost their last 4 wickets for 29 runs and that long batting line-up will certainly be needed today. Shreyas Iyer st de Kock b Fortuin 5(8)
Fortuin to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, first ball and Hardik does not need a sighter, whips it with all his power to long-on

Fortuin to Pant, out Caught by Phehlukwayo!! This time it doesn't come off. But smart bowling by Fortuin. He was operating from round the wicket and ensured it was not anywhere close to the stumps. Fired it outside off, Pant still decides to go after it with a loft over long-off, but since he had to reach for it all he could manage was a slice down Phehlukwayo's throat. South Africa keep chipping away at the wickets. Pant c Phehlukwayo b Fortuin 19(20) [4s-1 6s-1]
Fortuin to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, wanted to hack it into the leg-side but the slider skids on and cramps him, mistimes it to long-on
Fortuin to Pant, 1 run, walks down and nudges it with soft hands to the unmanned mid-wicket region, wants a second but Iyer rightly sends him back
Fortuin to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, quicker and outside off, Iyer shimmies down and drills it straight to long-off

Pretorius to Pant, SIX, pressure-releaser from Pant. India needed that and this pair needed it even more badly. The scoring had stalled in the last couple of overs and Pant decides to improvise, he crouches low almost on his knee and scoops the slower delivery over fine leg. He managed to get enough wood on that for it to clear the rope
Pretorius to Pant, no run, another finger-roller and Pant cannot generate enough power on the punch to beat Fortuin at backward point
Pretorius to Pant, no run, slower delivery and Pant dabs it behind square on the off-side, wants a single but Iyer says no this time
Pretorius to Pant, no run, fuller and just outside off, Pant drives it straight to mid-off
Pretorius to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, back of a length around off, Iyer looks to drive on the rise but slices it away to sweeper cover

Pretorius to Pant, 1 run, starts with a slower delivery and Pant pats it into the off-side before taking off for a tight run. Iyer responds and would have made it in even if Fortuin's under-arm throw had hit the stumps

Phehlukwayo to Shreyas Iyer, no run, oh! That was close to the stumps. Banged in halfway down and Iyer goes for a forehand pull, has to take it from above his head and almost toe-ends it back onto his stumps
Phehlukwayo to Shreyas Iyer, no run, good length ball around off, Iyer bunts it straight to backward point
Phehlukwayo to Pant, 1 run, angled across the left hander and Pant slices the cut towards third man
Phehlukwayo to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, back of a length around off, Iyer plays the dab right under his eyes to third man
Phehlukwayo to Pant, 1 run, short again and Pant does not look comfortable, he mistimes the pull and sends it backward of square

Phehlukwayo to Pant, no run, did it carry? Nope. Just landed in front of de Kock. Short and around the ribs, Pant swivels to pull but does not have the space to free his hands, the ball takes a big deflection off the glove and drops in front of a diving de Kock
Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, flighted up at the stumps, almost dips in the blockhole. Iyer jams it out

Shamsi to Pant, 1 run, flat and short delivery that's well wide outside off, Pant weirdly reaches out and paddles it behind square rather than going for the obvious cut shot that was screaming to be slapped
Shamsi to Pant, no run, pushed to cover
Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, floated up on off, Iyer pushes to long-off
Shamsi to Pant, 1 run, stoops across on the back knee and somehow paddle-scoops this behind square

Shamsi to Pant, no run, back of a length delivery outside off, was pushed through flat by Shamsi who still gets enough purchase out of the track. Pant initially chases and then withdraws his bat belatedly
Rabada to Pant, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, steered wide of backward point
Rabada to Pant, FOUR, that's a gimme from Rabada, easing down some pressure by offering a full toss on the pads. Pant drop-kicks it into the deep midwicket boundary
Rabada to Pant, no run, full on middle, pushed back towards mid-on

Rabada to Kohli, out Caught by Phehlukwayo!! Walking a tightrope at the midwicket boundary, Phehlukwayo has done a great job to silence this crowd. Whipped up in the air quite wristily by Kohli, looking to get on with it after a sluggish start to his innings. It hangs in the air for quite a bit. Phehlekwayo has no room with the boundary just behind him as he runs across. But he keeps his calm, takes the catch after stretching to his left and then rebalances on the run. India in a bit of a spot here. Kohli c Phehlukwayo b Rabada 9(15)
Rabada to Pant, 1 run, good length delivery that kicks up a touch and hits Pant high on the bat in defence
Rabada to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length around middle, tucked through to deep square leg
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, flighted leg-break on off and middle, whipped with the turn through midwicket
Shamsi to Pant, 1 run, floated up on middle and off, Pant nudges it through square leg
Shamsi to Pant, no run, tentative shimmy from Pant before steering this googly to point
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, clipped away through square leg

Shamsi to Dhawan, out Caught by Bavuma!! Shamsi has his revenge and going by his celebrations, it tastes sweet. Elaborate celebrations actually, removing his boot and pretending to make a phone call with it. Did Dhawan in the flight, which he held back a touch. Dhawan, even after using his feet, wasn't able to get to it. Still went ahead for a lofted shot and sliced it up off the outside half. It's a really good catch from Bavuma too, pedalling back from extra cover. They're always more difficult than they seem. Dhawan c Bavuma b Shamsi 36(25) [4s-4 6s-2]
Shamsi to Kohli, 1 run, right to the pitch of it as he purrs down the track, belts it to long-off. Almost got too close for his own good
Fortuin to Kohli, 1 run, eased down to long-on
Fortuin to Dhawan, 1 run, down the pitch, but unable to carry through with his aggressive intent with Fortuin pulling his length back. Just taps this down to long-off
Fortuin to Dhawan, no run, flatter delivery sliding across off, steered to point

Fortuin to Dhawan, FOUR, swept away over short fine. He's quickly down on the back knee, having gauged Fortuin's plan and anticipating him to bowl a straight line. That bit of premeditation sets up an easy put-away

Fortuin to Kohli, 1 run, hammered back at Fortuin who fails to hold onto the chance! Barely a chance though. Kohli raced down the pitch and hit this with so much power. It smashes Fortuin's right thumb before he can get his hands in the right place
Fortuin to Dhawan, 1 run, back of a length on leg stump, the idea being to give no room. Dhawan tucks it down to long-on
Shamsi to Kohli, no run, flighted up on off stump, driven back to Shamsi
Shamsi to Kohli, no run, overpitched around off, Kohli drills it to mid-off

Shamsi to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, drifting in on leg, straightens a touch and hits Dhawan on the pad after a missed sweep. Don't think it straightened enough, not that it dissuades Shamsi from clearing his throat
Shamsi to Dhawan, no run, pulls the length back and pushes it through much flatter, Dhawan dabs to short third man

Shamsi to Dhawan, SIX, and more pressure on Shamsi as Dhawan makes it back to back sixes. Dances down to the leg-break and lofts it through the line. If it's timed well enough, it's going to clear these boundaries
Shamsi to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan doesn't bother having a look, goes after Shamsi straightaway. Full enough for him to do so. Stretches out for it and tonks it over long-on
B Hendricks to Dhawan, 1 run, short ball angled in, Dhawan pulls it to deep square leg
B Hendricks to Dhawan, no run, short of length delivery outside off, not enough room for Dhawan to infuse much power on the cut. Finds cover-point
B Hendricks to Kohli, 1 run, short of length around the chest, pulls it out to the deep
B Hendricks to Dhawan, 1 run, full on off, punched to the left of mid-off
B Hendricks to Dhawan, no run, short of length delivery just outside off, Dhawan looks to run it down to third man but this fizzes past his outside edge
B Hendricks to Dhawan, no run, short of length delivery outside off, Dhawan - having advanced down - finds himself in a tough position to make anything of it. He tries, he fails. Cut and a miss

B Hendricks to Dhawan, 3 wides, super, super wide outside off. They're not letting de Kock breathe easy. But even he can't do much with this, with the ball evading the cut strip and running away to third man. Rabada does well to cut it off

Phehlukwayo to Kohli, no run, back of a length delivery across off, with Phehlukwayo sticking round the wicket even for Kohli. He wanted to work it into the on-side but ended up bunting it down the pitch
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, 1 run, punched to the right of mid-off
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, FOUR, a lot more fortune about this boundary. Charges down to a short of length delivery, slashes hard and it runs away off the edge past de Kock

Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, FOUR, that's an improvised back foot punch straight back down. Shows how easy paced this pitch is. Dhawan initally walked over into the off-side, possibly looking to manufacture a pull or his pick-up shot. But with Phehlukwayo chasing him and going even wider, he's able to adjust so serenly
Phehlukwayo to Kohli, 1 run, that's unusual for Kohli, having an angry swish at this length ball outside off. Flies off the outside edge and bounces well in front of third man
Phehlukwayo to Dhawan, 1 run, short ball from round the wicket to start with, Dhawan pulls to deep midwicket
B Hendricks to Kohli, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, stabbed in front of first slip
B Hendricks to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, back of a length, skids through onto Dhawan's back thigh after cramping him up
B Hendricks to Kohli, 1 run, works it off the pads through the on-side to get off the mark
B Hendricks to Kohli, no run, full ball around off, driven to mid-off

B Hendricks to Rohit, out Caught by R Hendricks!! Momentary silence from the crowd, but it's not taken long to turn into anticipation for the arrival of Kohli. Anyway, South Africa have broken through early here. Hendricks strikes with his second ball of the series, planting a bit of uncertainty in Rohit's mind. He accounted for a bit of inswing, but this went on with the angle to take the edge through to first slip. Rohit c R Hendricks b B Hendricks 9(8) [4s-2]
B Hendricks to Rohit, no run, full ball slanted away outside off, left alone
Rabada to Rohit, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off, Rohit throws his hands and carves it down to third man
Rabada to Rohit, no run, short of length delivery outside off, beats Rohit for extra bounce as he slashes at it
Rabada to Rohit, FOUR, now along the ground, but still four. Been a very erratic start from Rabada. Doles out a gentle half-volley outside off which Rohit merely caresses through extra cover
Rabada to Rohit, FOUR, pitched up outside off, Rohit simply leans across, reaches out with his hands and slices it over backward point. Flies off his bat, quite indicative of excellent timing
Rabada to Dhawan, 1 run, whipped off the pads down to fine leg
Rabada to Dhawan, no run, full ball swinging back in on leg, smashes into Dhawan's pad as he's late on the flick
Rabada to Dhawan, wide, third in a row. Rabada falls away down the leg-side again. Bizarre.
Rabada to Dhawan, 5 wides, down leg again, and much more wild from Rabada. De Kock scampers across and dives full stretch but it tips his fingers and runs away
Rabada to Dhawan, wide, wayward start from Rabada, hurling this well down leg
Fortuin to Rohit, no run, plays this slider nice and late in defence

Fortuin to Rohit, no run, huge shout for leg-before, still going, still going .. and still. But the umpire is unmoved. Fortuin was more interested than de Kock apparently. They've decided against the review. Sliding in sharply with the arm, cramps Rohit and sneaks through onto his back pad. Height maybe? Ball-tracking shows it's clipping the outside of leg stump
Fortuin to Dhawan, 1 run, fuller now, sliding through across off, Dhawan drives crisply to the right of mid-off who makes a diving stop
Fortuin to Dhawan, no run, misses out on the sweep as this length ball zips through onto his pad. Had pitched comfortably outside leg from that angle
Fortuin to Dhawan, no run, flat delivery that skids through from round the wicket, Dhawan punches it down the pitch
Fortuin to Dhawan, FOUR, oh boy, he's dropped the first ball down leg with the length pretty short. Dhawan pulls it away past short fine leg. Too easy

Krunal Pandya to Bavuma, SIX, up and all the way, that's the game. Series drawn 1-1. This is a thrashing from South Africa. Short delivery, Bavuma rocks back and pulls over mid-wicket, short boundaries here, and they travel too
Krunal Pandya to Bavuma, no run, flicked towards square leg, Jadeja fires a throw to make sure Bavuma can't think about stealing a run
Krunal Pandya to Bavuma, 2 runs, he's been paddling all game, uses the pace on the ball and sends it to fine leg
Krunal Pandya to Bavuma, no run, flatter delivery on the off stump, Bavuma defends
Krunal Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, shortish and just outside off stump, de Kock pulls to long-on
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, flatter delivery just outside off stump, de Kock turns it to square leg and keeps strike
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, shortish and on the stumps, Bavuma gets down on one knee and paddles to fine leg
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, on the leg stump, de Kock flicks it to backward square leg
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, flatter delivery outside off stump, Bavuma cuts to sweeper cover
Jadeja to Bavuma, no run, look at that ball land, grip, turn and bounce. Bavuma couldn't offer a shot because that spun a long way outside off stump
Jadeja to Bavuma, no run, reverse sweep rolls to backward point
Krunal Pandya to Bavuma, 1 run, flatter and just outside off stump, Bavuma pushes it to point
Krunal Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, pull away towards mid-wicket, to raise the fifty partnership
Krunal Pandya to de Kock, SIX, easy, so easy! Flighted delivery spinning back, landed right in the slot, de Kock gets down on one knee and slog-sweeps all the way over deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Bavuma, 1 run, fullish delivery on the off stump, Bavuma flicks through mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, cuts it away square of the wicket on the off-side

Krunal Pandya to de Kock, FOUR, optimistic shout for a catch from Pant, de Kock connected this cover-drive decently well to clear the fielder's leap at cover. Enough width from Krunal Pandya to go for the shot
Jadeja to Bavuma, no run, the reverse sweep attempted as Jadeja bowls slower through the air, missed
Jadeja to Bavuma, no run, beaten, no feet from Bavuma, so this one turns and beats Bavuma's attempted defence from the crease
Jadeja to Bavuma, no run, oh the ball stopped on the batsman, Bavuma uppishly pushes this to the man at cover, bounced just in front of him
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, catch is the cry as QdK slogs and hits it on the bounce to deep backward square leg
Jadeja to Bavuma, 1 run, the conventional sweep shot, Bavuma hits it to the right of deep square leg
Jadeja to Bavuma, 2 runs, paddle-sweep very fine, big open space at fine leg, returns for the second run
Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, 1 run, slower delivery on the off stump, Bavuma flicks it to square leg
Hardik Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, pull shot, but cut off at deep square leg
Hardik Pandya to de Kock, no run, Hardik Pandya comes round the wicket and bowls a slower length ball, de Kock hits it decently, but finds the man at cover
Hardik Pandya to de Kock, FOUR, slower ball but this had a bit of room, so de Kock frees his arms and nicely lofts over extra-cover. He wants to finish this off early

Hardik Pandya to de Kock, SIX, the back foot pull shot from QdK with a clean connection is one of the sights to watch in modern day cricket. Short of a length delivery on the leg stump, de Kock powers it hard and handsomely over square leg
Hardik Pandya to de Kock, wide, short slower delivery high and wide, umpire Nitin Menon stretches his arms
Hardik Pandya to de Kock, no run, tapped towards point
Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, no run, short of length and straightaway gets respect from the batsman, defended to backward point

Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, FOUR, low full toss, poor line, Bavuma flicks and gets it in the gap at mid-wicket. This is a good test for Navdeep Saini, plays for RCB here, but at the moment isn't understanding that pace off the ball is the way to go on this particular pitch. Rohit goes, "use your head," kind of gesture to his bowler
Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, FOUR, back of a length is the zone for a bowler on this pitch. Full ball at pace is freebie for a batsman, Bavuma happily lofts over extra-cover for four
Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, 2 runs, nice-looking flick shot through backward square leg, cut off in the deep

Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, no run, there's the edge, doesn't carry but Ro makes a lovely diving save to his right. Bavuma tried to defend this length delivery, Bavuma was foxed by the late seam movement away
Navdeep Saini to Bavuma, no run, solid-looking straight drive, but Navdeep Saini bends and stops the ball in his followthrough
Hardik Pandya to de Kock, no run, short delivery, de Kock pulls and misses

Hardik Pandya to de Kock, FOUR, clever batting from the captain. Knows Pandya is bowling off-cutter, so targets the vacant deep extra-cover region, safe shot and he had the timing to clear the infield. Fifty comes up as well

Hardik Pandya to de Kock, wide, "Ohhh, s**t" is the expression from de Kock on seeing this slower ball really grip and turn like an off-spinner, he pulled out of the off-side slash, definitely was deceived but the line was way outside off stump
Hardik Pandya to de Kock, no run, played to the off-side this time

Hardik Pandya to de Kock, FOUR, a big grunt from Hardik Pandya, he knows he shouldn't have bowled a short ball down leg, de Kock has a good measure of the way the pitch is behaving, so waits and pulls off the back foot behind square on the on-side
Hardik Pandya to Bavuma, 1 run, outside edge, but no one at slip, so easy run to third man, Chahar almost fumbles near the rope. Bavuma wanted to drive, got away with it

Hardik Pandya to R Hendricks, out Caught by Kohli!! Stunning piece of fielding from Kohli. He took one last match, now he's run forward, dived full length and taken it inches from the ground. Hardik Pandya does what a pacer should do on a sluggish pitch, bang it in and take pace off. Never easy for the batsman to judge the exact pace at which it comes. Mid-on was inside the ring, so Hendricks backed himself to clear the infield but horribly mistimed the pull. Credit to Kohli for keeping the field up in that region. Finally India have a breakthrough. R Hendricks c Kohli b Hardik Pandya 28(26) [4s-4]
Krunal Pandya to R Hendricks, 1 run, smart from Hendricks! Waits for the slider to arrive, taps it on its head and posts it into the vacant space at square leg
Krunal Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, gets low and sweeps the full delivery to the left of deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to R Hendricks, 1 run, flat and fast on off, tucked round the corner on the leg-side
Krunal Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, full and wide of off, de Kock goes for the loft and skews it off the cue end to the left of long-off
Krunal Pandya to R Hendricks, 1 run, full on middle and leg, eased down to long-on
Krunal Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, quicker and sliding in, de Kock chips the pull off the splice and it drops well short of the incoming fielder at long-on
Washington Sundar to de Kock, 1 run, fired in on the pads at 88ks, de Kock manages to nudge it round the corner for an easy single
Washington Sundar to R Hendricks, 1 run, slower and spinning in from outside off, Hendricks uses the crease to tuck it in the gap through square leg
Washington Sundar to R Hendricks, no run, fired flat and fast outside off, Hendricks looks to cut and gets beaten on the outside edge. So close
Washington Sundar to de Kock, 1 run, full on the pads, flicked away through square leg
Washington Sundar to de Kock, SIX, easy peasy for Quinny! Makes room early, converts the slider into a back of a length delivery and hammers the pull way over the wide long-on fence
Washington Sundar to R Hendricks, 1 run, offbreak sliding in on off-stump, Hendricks waits on the back foot and punches into the off-side
Krunal Pandya to de Kock, 2 runs, crouches, waits for the full delivery to dip and then uses his fast hands to reverse sweep it int the gap behind point
Krunal Pandya to de Kock, wide, pitches around leg-stump and spins in to beat de Kock leg-side on the flick. Wided
Krunal Pandya to R Hendricks, 1 run, fuller and straighter on the stumps, Hendricks forces the drive to the right of the diving bowler, easy single
Krunal Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, slower and hint of indrift on leg-stump, de Kock makes room and pushes it with an open bat face wide of cover
Krunal Pandya to R Hendricks, 1 run, flat and wide, punched away down to deep cover

Krunal Pandya to R Hendricks, FOUR, flat outside off, Hendricks hangs back and punches it to the right of sweeper cover, Shreyas Iyer - the fielder in the deep - doesn't really get the control on the slide as his foot makes contact whilst trying to pull the ball back into play. Or has he just saved it? The telly umpire is inspecting various angles and he feels its a boundary
Krunal Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, full on middle and leg, swept away to deep mid-wicket and that's the 50-run stand for the opening duo
Washington Sundar to de Kock, 1 run, sliding in quick outside off, de Kock jumps on the back foot and cuts wide of point

Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run, de Kock misses the sweep and is that out? India don't have any reviews left. Drifts in and straightens a tad after pitching to smash de Kock on the front pad, the Protea skipper was early into his sweep shot and perhaps didn't expect the ball to straighten as much. Replays in: Three reds on that de Kock's appeal. Ouch!
Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run, slider on off-stump, de Kock backs away and punches into the off-side
Washington Sundar to R Hendricks, 1 run, fuller outside off, Hendricks gets down on one knee and sweeps along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to R Hendricks, FOUR, too short and Hendricks likes the pace on it. Just swivels and posts it in the gap between deep mid-wicket and deep square leg, a crunching pull shot!
Washington Sundar to R Hendricks, no run, flatter and wider of off, Hendricks looks to cut and gets beaten on the outside edge
Chahar to R Hendricks, 1 run, skiddy short of length delivery on the stumps, pulled away to deep mid-wicket
Chahar to de Kock, 1 run, short of a good length outside off, de Kock stays deep and forces the punch-drive through covers
Chahar to de Kock, no run, slower short ball outside off, de Kock looks to ramp it square and splices it towards backward point

Chahar to R Hendricks, leg byes, 1 run, the knuckle ball bowled full and into the pads, it pitches around leg stump and beats Hendricks on the inside edge as he tries to flick. The bowler got excited and so did the keeper, those two played a key part in sending this upstairs and Kohli clearly wasn't pleased after the final verdict. Poor review from India...
Chahar to R Hendricks, wide, slower ball full and slipping down leg, past Hendricks' flick

Chahar to R Hendricks, FOUR, India are just feeding freebies, via the fast bowlers refusing to compromise on their pace. This delivery sits up nicely from back of a length and Hendricks wastes no time in clobbering that through mid-wicket. Easy!
Chahar to de Kock, 1 run, 136ks plenty of width outside off, cut away crisply square on the off-side

Navdeep Saini to de Kock, 1 run, is that a catch, well almost? Fullish and angling away outside off, de Kock unleashes the fierce drive and nearly chipped it to the right of diving cover fielder, just short of him
Navdeep Saini to R Hendricks, 1 run, fullish and just outside off at 144ks, Hendricks uses the pace and guide it wide of slip
Navdeep Saini to de Kock, 1 run, skiddy short of length delivery on middle and leg, pulled away to the right of deep mid-wicket. Krunal Pandya does the mop up job

Navdeep Saini to de Kock, SIX, and again! Navdeep Saini is not learning. Its a track where you bank on slower balls but the Delhi lad is doing the exact opposite: Offers a lot of pace on this length delivery and gets deposited in the blink of an eye over deep square, crunching pull shot from the South African skipper
Navdeep Saini to de Kock, no run, makes room and gets a thick inside edge on the steer to the right of the keeper, good reflexes from Pant with a diving effort to his right

Navdeep Saini to de Kock, SIX, Quinton de Kock is one the sweetest hitters of a cricket ball and this is why a lot of pundits rate him highly. Length ball on the pads and a lot of batsmen would have dealt that in a muscular manner, but de Kock doesn't, rather his class doesn't allow him to. Just stands firm and flicks it nonchalantly into the stands over deep square

Chahar to R Hendricks, FOUR, ah! The reward for being patient. This should make Reeza Hendricks feel better; he waits for the bad ball and pounces on it. A real gimme outside off - short and wide - and it's been dealt with a flashing blade through covers
Chahar to de Kock, 1 run, opens the bat face and punches the length delivery wide of cover

Chahar to de Kock, no run, a yelp of 'ooh' from de Kock as he's cut into half by this bewdy of an inswinger from Deepak Chahar. Swerving in from back of a length and it darts in viciously to beat de Kock neck and crop on the inside edge, too good
Chahar to de Kock, no run, makes room and looks to stab this through covers, no pace on the delivery means de Kock under-edges it to cover and has to hurry back to avoid a run-out at his end
Chahar to de Kock, no run, pitched up and moving away at 127ks, de Kock goes for the full-blooded drive but can't hit the gap on the off-side
Chahar to R Hendricks, 1 run, 137ks back of a length delivery outside off, Hendricks stands tall and punches it wide of the man at cover
Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run, quicker and sliding in, de Kock looks to whip and gets a thick inside edge onto pad
Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run, tossed wide of off-stump, dabbed away to backward point

Washington Sundar to de Kock, FOUR, de Kock doesn't need any second invitation when you bowl it that full. Just uses his fast hands to spank the drive in the gap through extra cover. Jadeja tries his best in the deep but he comes second and he seems to have hurt his finger there? Clearly looks in some sort of discomfort

Washington Sundar to R Hendricks, leg byes, 1 run, huge shout for lbw but that's missing leg. The skiddy offbreak from Washington Sundar and Hendricks played down the wrong line, clonks his front pad and deflects into the off-side. Krunal tries to effect a direct hit and there's a bad bounce which could have resulted in four overthrows. Not to be. Excellent back up from the fielder at mid-on
Washington Sundar to R Hendricks, no run, peach of a yorker from Washington Sundar. 96.5ks and dips right in the blockhole as Hendricks squeezes it into the pitch
Washington Sundar to de Kock, 1 run, smart play from de Kock. Sees the quicker delivery dip outside off and executes the late cut to perfection behind point
Chahar to R Hendricks, no run, slightly fuller with a hint of extra pace outside off, Hendricks checks his drive into the covers. Superb start for Deepak Chahar, almost had a wicket. Almost
Chahar to R Hendricks, no run, better from Hendricks! Walks across, covers for the swing and bunts this good length delivery into the off-side

Chahar to R Hendricks, no run, squares him up completely this time. Hendricks shuffles a tad, expects the ball to move in but it doesn't, cunningly whizzes past the outside edge as Hendricks gets beaten for the second successive time

Chahar to R Hendricks, no run, Chahar goes up in appeal, but no-one joins him. Fair call from umpire Nandan. No edge. Hendricks looks to poke at a beauty of an outswinger and gets beaten by a hair's breadth margin on the outside edge
Chahar to de Kock, 1 run, width on offer this time around and de Kock's uses all of it to steer a single square of third man

Chahar to de Kock, no run, Kohli smashes the stumps direct, but that after collecting the ball on the bounce. de Kock's safe as a house there. Made it in time. He wanted to steer this outswinger square on the off-side and gets a soft edge to the left of Kohli at first slip, sees the India skipper aiming for a run-out and rushes back in time

Washington Sundar to de Kock, 1 run, Rohit Sharma with a diving effort at cover. He flung himself to his right and prevented a certain boundary there. de Kock got the length he wanted - full - and no guesses as to which shot he intend to play - the drive. Timed it well, but Rohit's brilliance ensures its just a single
Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run, flatter and aiming for off-stump, de Kock gives himself a bit of room and checks his drive to mid-on
Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run, fullish and angled into the pads, de Kock's happy to negate it into the leg-side
Washington Sundar to de Kock, no run, shortens his length and keeps it just outside off, de Kock stays back and taps into the off-side

Washington Sundar to de Kock, FOUR, just the timing on this shot! Sweet as... Nicely looped up outside off and de Kock just leant into the drive while slotting it in the gap through extra cover, the timing takes care of the rest
Washington Sundar to R Hendricks, 1 run, flighted on off and spinning in, Hendricks uses the crease to camp back and tucks a single on the leg-side. South Afica off the mark...
Cottrell to Pant, 2 runs, India finish with 170/7 in 20 overs. Pant goes down on his knee again and whips the length ball to deep square leg, takes two runs and finishes with 33* off 22 balls
Cottrell to Chahar, 1 run, down on his knee goes Chahar and slogs the length ball to deep mid-wicket

Cottrell to Washington Sundar, out Caught&Bowled!! Here comes the salute, a match without this celebration by Cottrell has to be incomplete. Back of a length delivery by the bowler and Washington Sundar mistimes his slap right back to the bowler. Easy caught and bowled dismissal and India are not able to finish things off as they would have liked to. Washington Sundar c and b Cottrell 0(1)
Cottrell to Pant, 1 run, flat-bats the shortish delivery to long-on as he takes the bottom hand off, just one. Was the slower one again, only 112kph
Cottrell to Pant, 2 runs, 100 kph, slower length delivery by Cottrell, Pant drags his pull to deep mid-wicket, takes two runs
Cottrell to Pant, no run, in the channel outside off, full one and the batsman loses his bat as he swings hard. The bat slipped out of his hands and flew towards the leg umpire

Kesrick Williams to Jadeja, out Bowled!! You miss, I hit! Williams ends his spell with a wicket. It's a slower one that does the trick for him. Goes full with hardly any pace behind the ball, and the batsman gets deceived due to the lack of pace. Jadeje swings across the line, gets beaten and loses his off-stump in the process. Jadeja b Kesrick Williams 9(11)
Kesrick Williams to Jadeja, no run, on a length around off, Jadeja mistimes his punch, guides it back to the bowler
Kesrick Williams to Jadeja, 2 runs, full toss by Kesrick Williams, Jadeja flicks it off a leading edge towards deep backward square leg and takes two more

Kesrick Williams to Jadeja, 2 runs, good shot by Jadeja, but an equally good stop by Walsh at deep mid-wicket. Was a short ball and was pulled powerfully by the batsman, but the fielder's sliding stop near the fence keeps them down to two

Kesrick Williams to Pant, 1 run, back of a length ball around off, Pant whips it into the gap at mid-wicket, wasn't in control of the shot, and the connection wasn't that great, hence was just a single
Kesrick Williams to Pant, wide, another slower one attempted, another wide down the leg side

Kesrick Williams to Jadeja, leg byes, 1 run, shortish delivery by Kesrick Williams, this one arrives a touch late than the batsman anticipated, Jadeja was down the track to play, he swivels, but can't connect, it comes off his ribs and drops into the off side
Kesrick Williams to Jadeja, wide, goes for the slower one, ends up spraying it down the leg side
Cottrell to Pant, no run, fine reflex stop by Cottrell, this was driven firmly back at him and he does well to grab it in his followthrough, that too with his weak hand, the right one
Cottrell to Jadeja, 1 run, slices the short of a length delivery towards backward point for one
Cottrell to Pant, leg byes, 1 run, slower short ball by Cottrell, Pant is a touch too early in his swing and ends up getting hit on the body, takes a leg bye as the ball rolls into the off side
Cottrell to Jadeja, 1 run, slides this one on the pads and Jadeja works it through square leg for a gentle single
Cottrell to Jadeja, no run, on a length around off, this one skids along the deck, Jadeja hacks across the line and gets an inside edge towards short fine leg
Cottrell to Jadeja, wide, walks down the wicket to play this one, but Cottrell bangs it short down the leg side, Jadeja sways away

Cottrell to Jadeja, 2 runs, brilliant running between the wickets by the two left-handers. Jadeja nudges the shortish delivery with soft hands towards mid-wicket, and by the time the bowler gets there and gets rid of the ball, the batsmen are back for two

Hayden Walsh to Pant, FOUR, just like the last over, Pant gets a boundary off the last ball, even in this one. He holds the key for India, and with his eyes in, would be interesting to see how he ends this innings. A tossed up delivery outside off, enough width on offer and the left hander smashes it through covers, again piercing the two men in the deep
Hayden Walsh to Jadeja, 1 run, this one had a bit of extra carry on it, was around the off stump line and Jadeja got a leading edge towards point as he tried to knock it into the off side
Hayden Walsh to Jadeja, no run, fires this one at 95.8kph, Jadeja nudges it towards the left of the spinner, Walsh is quick to move across and stop it
Hayden Walsh to Pant, 1 run, legbreak around middle and leg, Pant works it through square leg

Hayden Walsh to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Brandon King!! Hayden Walsh gets another wicket, Iyer walks back. Gives this one some good flight outside off and Iyer has a wild swing at it. Was the legbreak that spun away sharply and caught the leading edge before it popped towards King at backward point. Looks in agony as he walks back to the pavilion. Shreyas Iyer c Brandon King b Hayden Walsh 10(11) [4s-1]
Hayden Walsh to Shreyas Iyer, no run, floated outside off, Shreyas Iyer leaves it alone

Holder to Pant, FOUR, boundary to end the over. Holder ends his spell having conceded 40-plus runs. Bowls this one on the batsman's pads and Pant flicks it through square leg, bisecting two fielders in the deep, one was haring across from fine leg, the other one from deep mid-wicket. Placement.

Holder to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Iyer wanted two, but Pant has sent him back. Perhaps, the right call by Rishabh. The batsman had nudged the length ball into the gap at mid-wicket, but the fielder in the deep was quick to sprint in and get rid of the ball, keeping the batsmen down to just one

Holder to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that shot will give him some confidence. A full ball by Holder, Shreyas Iyer gets under the length and plays an uppish cover-drive, eluding the man inside the circle and finding the fence with nonchalance
Holder to Pant, 1 run, good length delivery in the channel outside off, on a shortish side, Pant slaps it powerfully through covers but can't get it past the man in the deep

Holder to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, well bowled by Holder. Shreyas Iyer had shuffled back and across in the crease, but Jason does well to follow up the batsman, he fires in a yorker around leg, and the batsman can do nothing much about it, he squeezes it through mid-wicket with a flick, takes one in the end
Holder to Pant, 1 run, fullish delivery by Holder, in the channel outside off, and it's been driven by Pant through covers

Hayden Walsh to Pant, 1 run, yorker by Hayden Walsh to end the over, this one dips into the batsman around middle and leg, Pant squeezes it towards mid-wicket with a flick and retains strike with a single
Hayden Walsh to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, shortish in length, and outside off again, Shreyas Iyer rocks back and punches it into the gap at covers
Hayden Walsh to Pant, 1 run, knocks the tossed up delivery down to long-on
Hayden Walsh to Pant, no run, drags the shortish delivery towards short fine leg off an inside edge, does Pant
Hayden Walsh to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, another short ball by Hayden Walsh, provides the width as well, Shreyas Iyer is quick to trek back and slice it through the gap at point
Hayden Walsh to Shreyas Iyer, no run, short and quick outside off, the legbreak skids along the deck, Shreyas Iyer gets beaten on his cut shot
Kesrick Williams to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, short of a length outside off, Shreyas Iyer slices it to short third man
Kesrick Williams to Shreyas Iyer, no run, in the channel outside off, it's a touch slower, hence Shreyas Iyer fails to get his timing right on the cover drive
Kesrick Williams to Pant, 1 run, flat bats the shortish delivery to long-on for one

Kesrick Williams to Pant, FOUR, and Pant makes the most out of the free hit. Goes down on his knee and helps the low full toss down to the fine leg fence, cheekily done, and well executed by the left hander

Kesrick Williams to Shreyas Iyer, no ball, 1 run, Kesrick Williams oversteps and pitches this one up, Iyer eases it into the leg side and walks across to the other end, he's off the mark with a single. Free hit coming up!

Kesrick Williams to Kohli, out Caught by Simmons!! Williams has got the big fish - it's Virat Kohli. And nope, he's not following it up with his notebook celebration, instead, he's asking his team mates to be quiet, puts his finger on his lips. Was down the wicket to play this one, was Virat Kohli, but the bowler keeps it short and slow outside off, Kohli tries to fend it away, ends up getting it of the leading edge towards short third man. An easy catch for Simmons and that shall be end of the Indian skipper. "Not everyday can be your day," he'd said earlier in the day. He was right! Kohli c Simmons b Kesrick Williams 19(17) [4s-2]
Kesrick Williams to Pant, 1 run, fullish length by Kesrick Williams, around the middle and leg stump line, Pant flicks it into the pocket at mid-wicket
Hayden Walsh to Kohli, no run, full-toss outside off, Kohli slaps the drive straight to extra-cover, went too hard on the shot and didn't get the timing right
Hayden Walsh to Kohli, 2 runs, dropped short and at the stumps, Kohli is quick to rock back and pulls it wide of long-on for a couple

Hayden Walsh to Kohli, FOUR, a cross-batted swipe and Kohli finds the gap wide of long-off, tossed up well outside off, Kohli reaches out, gets underneath the ball and swipes it wide of Holder at long-on
Hayden Walsh to Kohli, no run, flatter and quicker of off, Kohli backs away and finds the fielder at backward point
Hayden Walsh to Kohli, no run, beauty, a sharp leg-break from Walsh, pitched on off, drew Kohli forward and then spun past Kohli's outside edge
Hayden Walsh to Pant, 1 run, very full and sliding down leg, Pant went right across the stumps, got to the ball on the full and swept it behind square on the on-side for a single
Holder to Kohli, FOUR, edged and four, on a good length and at the stumps, Kohli made room after backing away and then flashed hard, gets a thick edge that races past the keeper and into the ropes
Holder to Kohli, 2 runs, full-toss on the pads, whipped behind square on the on-side for a couple of runs
Holder to Pant, 1 run, fuller length delivery and well wide of off, driven square on the off-side for a single
Holder to Kohli, 1 run, Holder shortens his length and angles one back into the right-hander, Kohli makes room and punches it square past cover for a single
Holder to Kohli, no run, fraction fuller and just outside off, Kohli was looking to work it to the on-side, went with a closed face and rolled towards mid-off, he wanted a single but ius sent back
Holder to Kohli, no run, Holder shortens the length and follows Kohli as he backed away, mistimed cut towards backward point

Hayden Walsh to Pant, SIX, lovely, the back of the hand wrong 'un, but Pant is spotting them well, good stride forward, gets close to the ball and then inside out with the lofted drive, clears the ropes at deep extra-cover and he's off and running with a maximum
Hayden Walsh to Pant, no run, the wrong 'un once again, Pant picked it from the hand and pushed it to the off-side

Hayden Walsh to Kohli, 1 run, has Kohli run himself OUT? He looks confident and replays show he's well in - NOT OUT is the call. This was tossed up on Kohli's pads, he nudged it to the on-side and called his partner through, Pooran was quick on the ball and throws down the stumps at the bowler's end, but Kohli was well in

Hayden Walsh to Shivam Dube, out Caught by Hetmyer!! This was coming, Dube was looking to play shot-a-ball and finally holes out to extra cover, another wrong 'un and once again he didn't read it, went for an ambitious loft - the ball turned away and he ended up losing his balance on the shot, skewed it high and towards Hetmyer. He didn't lose it under the lights, watches it all along and completes a reverse-cupped catch. Shivam Dube c Hetmyer b Hayden Walsh 54(30) [4s-3 6s-4]
Hayden Walsh to Shivam Dube, no run, another wrong 'un and Dube didn't read this one either, rocked back on the pull and is beaten on the inside edge

Hayden Walsh to Shivam Dube, FOUR, oh dear! Pollard has lost sight of the ball and ended up conceding a boundary - what would have been a first-ball wicket has ended up as four runs for Walsh - dropped short - the wrong 'un, Dube didn't read it as he went for the pull, flat and down long-off's throat, Pollard ran in and then turned his back at it at the last moment

Kesrick Williams to Shivam Dube, 1 run, maiden T20I half-century for Dube - gets a standing ovation from the dressing room, Kohli is pleased with what he's seen as well, back of a length and on the hips, tucked behind square on the on-side for a single
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length and well wide of off, Kohli rides the bounce and dabs it to short third man for a single
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, no run, short of a good length and well wide of off, Kohli reaches out and mistimes the cut to cover
Kesrick Williams to Shivam Dube, 1 run, full-toss on Dube's pads, whipped behind square on the on-side for a single

Kesrick Williams to Kohli, no ball, 1 run, good thinking from Williams, saw Kohli running down the track and shortened his length, Kohli adjusts and pulls it past mid-wicket for a single. The third umpire has spotted the overstepping and it's called as a no-ball
Kesrick Williams to Kohli, 2 runs, nicely played, on a good length and just outside off, Kohli leans across and drops it in front of mid-wicket - played with soft hands and runs back for the second
Kesrick Williams to Shivam Dube, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the stumps, Dube drags the heave past square leg for a single
Kesrick Williams to Shivam Dube, wide, Williams pre-empts Dube backing away and looks to fire one on the pads, ends up sliding down leg and concedes a wide

Pollard to Shivam Dube, 1 run, this is good batting from Dube, drops a good length delivery in front of extra-cover and scurries across for a quick single - 26 runs from the over and the Pollard experiment isn't looking too flashy now

Pollard to Shivam Dube, SIX, cracking shot, he's making a mockery of Pollard now - wide full-toss outside off, Dube reaches out and slaps it over extra-cover, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum

Pollard to Shivam Dube, SIX, smashed, Pollard and his slower ones are going the distance now, length delivery at the stumps, Dube leans across and swings it high and over backward square leg - the biggest of his three sixes so far
Pollard to Shivam Dube, wide, another slower ball from Pollard, full and well outside off, called as a wide and Pollard isn't pleased, but it did look like a fair call from the umpire
Pollard to Shivam Dube, wide, Pollard fires this slower one way outside off, called as a wide
Pollard to Shivam Dube, SIX, lovely, he's getting a feel of this wicket now, banged in short and well outside off, Dube swivels across and clubs it high and over deep square leg for a maximum
Pollard to Shivam Dube, 2 runs, full and at the stumps, Dube gets his right leg out of the way and drives it wide of mid-wicket, Kohli calls him back for the second run and he does so with ease
Pollard to Shivam Dube, wide, the slower ball from Pollard, but he slipped this one well wide of off, called by the umpire

Pollard to Shivam Dube, 2 runs, Pollard shortens his length outside off, Dube clears his left leg and hacks it back past the non-striker - the fielder at long-off is square and Dube comes back for the second run
Holder to Shivam Dube, 1 run, short of a length and on the hips, tucked in front of square on the on-side for a single
Holder to Kohli, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Kohli brings his wrists into play and works it to long-on for a single

Holder to Rohit, out Bowled!! Rohit never looked at ease on this slow wicket, tries to manufacture something, trying to be cute and he can keep walking back to the pavilion. He shuffled right across the stumps, Holder kept his cool and kept it full and at the stumps, once Rohit missed his paddle, it was always curtains. The ball hit the top of off and the zing bails light up. Rohit b Holder 15(18) [4s-2]
Holder to Shivam Dube, 1 run, on a good length and angling into the left-hander, Dube plays with soft hands and works it wide of mid-wicket

Holder to Shivam Dube, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Dube, full and sliding onto the pads, Dube backs away and clubs it wide of mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes - bisected the two fielders in the deep to a nicety

Holder to Shivam Dube, SIX, clubbed, he finally connects one, did Dube - back of a length and at the stumps, Dube swivels across and pulls it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum, should give him some confidence
Pollard to Shivam Dube, 1 run, that's very ugly from Dube, he almost fell off his feet while trying to smash this slower ball, went off the toe-end and rolled towards backward point
Pollard to Shivam Dube, no run, another slower ball from Pollard, he's read this pitch well, Dube had to reach out on the drive and slaps it straight to the fielder at cover
Pollard to Shivam Dube, no run, change of pace from Pollard, slower ball angling across the left-hander, Dube has another wild swing and misses it by a mile
Pollard to Shivam Dube, no run, banged in short and angling across the left-hander, Dube swings across the line and misses
Pollard to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length and well wide of off, Rohit rolls his wrists and pulls it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Pollard to Shivam Dube, 1 run, on a good length and on Dube's pads, tucked behind square on the on-side for a single

Kesrick Williams to Rohit, 2 runs, lucky runs for Rohit, came down the track, didn't get anywhere close to the ball, but still went through with the lofted on-drive - off the inner half of the bat and looped wide of mid-wicket - dropped right in between two fielders

Kesrick Williams to Rohit, no run, a swing and a miss from Rohit, on a good length and angling into the right-hander, Rohit was looking to send it out of the mid-wicket fence with a wild hoick, beaten completely
Kesrick Williams to Shivam Dube, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the pads, Dube flicks it uppishly and over square leg, one bounce and to the fielder at deep square leg

Kesrick Williams to Rohit, 1 run, that was close, short of a good length and angling back into the right-hander, Rohit was cramped for room on the cut, manages to dab it wide of the keeper for a single
Kesrick Williams to Rohit, no run, short and wide of off, Rohit gets on top of the bounce and finds backward point with the cut
Kesrick Williams to Shivam Dube, 1 run, short of a length and on Dube's pads, flicked behind square on the on-side for a single
