Holder to Rohit, FOUR, nicely played, banged in short and it kept rising on the right-hander, Rohit didn't get completely on top of the bounce as he hooked, but he managed to clear short fine, one bounce and over the ropes
Holder to Rohit, no run, on a good length and around the off-stump line, nudged to the on-side off the back-foot
Holder to Shivam Dube, 1 run, short and at the stumps, Dube clears his left leg and heaves it without any timing, just a single to deep square leg
Holder to Shivam Dube, FOUR, ugly hoick and four, back of a length and angling across the left-hander, Dube made room and went for the pull, gets a fat top-edge that sails over the lone slip fielder
Holder to Shivam Dube, no run, banged in short and at the stumps, Dube is cramped up for room on the pull, is through with the shot early and the ball lobs to the off-side off his body
Holder to Shivam Dube, no run, short of a length and well wide of off, Dube went chasing after that and missed
K Pierre to Rohit, no run, pushed through on off, Rohit leans across and defends it to the off-side
K Pierre to Shivam Dube, 1 run, Pierre keeps it full and at the stumps, eased down towards long-on for a single
K Pierre to Shivam Dube, no run, slower and well outside off, defended back at the bowler

K Pierre to Shivam Dube, 2 runs, tossed up well wide of off, Dube pushed it in front of mid-off and called his partner across for a quick single - the fielder was quick on the ball and has a shy at the bowler's end, it's a poor throw though and he concedes an extra run
K Pierre to Rohit, 1 run, tossed up on off, Rohit drops it behind square on the off-side for a single

K Pierre to Rahul, out Caught by Hetmyer!! Pierre strikes early for the visitors - Rahul was looking to be aggressive and has holed out to deep backward square leg - was making room for the slog sweep and Pierre spotted it - slowed down the pace and followed the batsman, Rahul wasn't in a great position on the shot, the ball caught the top-edge and swivelled high and behind square, Hetmyer, the man under it and he doesn't drop it. Rahul c Hetmyer b K Pierre 11(11) [4s-1]

Cottrell to Rahul, 1 run, change of pace from Cottrell, slipped in the slower ball outside off, Rahul spotted it early, played with an open face and placed it to the right of backward point for a single
Cottrell to Rahul, no run, nicely bowled by Cottrell, followed Rahul who was backing away with a very full delivery - Rahul was looking to jam it to the off-side and missed
Cottrell to Rahul, 2 runs, back of a length and on Rahul's pads, tucked behind square on the on-side for a couple of runs - he's looking good once again, Rahul

Cottrell to Rohit, leg byes, 1 run, much better from Cottrell, full and swinging back into the right-hander, Rohit was looking to flick and missed, off the pad and rolled to the off-side for a leg-bye
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, Rohit cops a blow on the box, short and at the stumps, Rohit was early into the pull, might have grazed the bottom-edge and struck Rohit high on the pad
Cottrell to Rahul, 1 run, on a good length and slanting onto Rahul's pads, he closed the bat-face and clipped it past square leg for a single
K Pierre to Rahul, 1 run, Pierre drifts one on Rahul's pads, worked in front of mid-wicket for a single
K Pierre to Rahul, no run, Pierre shortens his length as Rahul came down the track, punched back at the bowler
K Pierre to Rahul, no run, tossed up on off, Rahul gets half-forward and pushes it to the off-side
K Pierre to Rahul, FOUR, cracking shot, the slider from Pierre, but he dropped it way too short, Rahul makes room and cuts it square past cover-point for a boundary
K Pierre to Rohit, 1 run, flighted outside off, punched down towards long-off for a single
K Pierre to Rahul, 1 run, tossed up on off, Rahul leans forward and pushes it to long-off for a single
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, Cottrell shortens his length and angles one onto Rohit's pads, nudged to the on-side
Cottrell to Rohit, wide, Cottrell hasn't got his radar right, short of a length and sliding down leg, called as a wide
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, much better from Cottrell, on a good length and shaping back into the right-hander, nudged towards mid-wicket
Cottrell to Rohit, FOUR, this is a poor start from Cottrell, he's getting swing, but he's drifting it down leg, Rohit gets inside the line and flicks it fine, no chance for the fielder at long leg
Cottrell to Rohit, no run, on a good length and shaping back into the right-hander, Rohit was looking to turn it to the on-side and is struck high on the pad
Cottrell to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length and well wide of off, Rahul dabs it down towards third man for a single
Cottrell to Rahul, 5 wides, wrong line from Cottrell, swing on offer, but he slid it way down the leg-side. KL lets it go and Pooran can't reach out with the dive, five bonus runs for India

Cottrell to Rohit, 1 run, signs of this being a slow track already, short and angling across the left-hander, Rohit swivels across, delays his pull and places it behind square on the on-side for a single
Chahar to Pooran, FOUR, that'll do it. Slower short ball that sits up for Pooran who pulls it to the midwicket boundary. West Indies are level and we're going to Mumbai for the decider
Chahar to Simmons, 1 run, squeezes the yorker to short third man
Chahar to Simmons, no run, into the blockhole outside off, jammed out

Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, SIX, picked up emphatically into the crowd. A glimpse of why Pooran gets people excited. Stunning shot executed with such ease. Back of a length on leg, not short enough for the pull but try explaining that to Pooran who's whipped it so gloriously over long leg
Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, 1 run, yorker length around leg stump, flicked through to deep backward square
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, 1 run, eases this down to long-off
Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, 1 run, short of length at the body, pulled to long leg
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, 1 run, back of a length delivery on leg, slower one, gently nudged wide of midwicket by Pooran
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, FOUR, blistering drive through extra cover. They're doing it so easily. Full ball outside off, Pooran cracks it to the boundary off the front foot
Chahar to Simmons, SIX, belts it over long-off. Brings the run-rate under six. Full outside off from Chahar, Simmons shuffles and nails. That bottom hand proving destructive again
Chahar to Simmons, wide, has the length right on this wide yorker, but he's gone too far wide. And even though Simmons had walked across, there was no getting away for Chahar
Chahar to Pooran, 1 run, clipped off the hip behind square
Chahar to Simmons, 1 run, full toss outside off, Simmons walks across and flays it to deep point
Chahar to Pooran, 1 run, slower short ball outside off, Pooran drags the pull to deep midwicket

Chahar to Pooran, 2 runs, sliced up in the air, Iyer charges across from long-on but fails to even get a hand on it. Probably misjudged it initially. Kohli not amused. There's a run-out check sent upstairs but Pooran had grounded his bat in time at the striker's end
Chahar to Pooran, no run, length ball just outside off, defended to cover
Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, FOUR, charges down and deals Bhuvneshwar with a hammer blow through extra cover. Terrific end to a terrific over for the West Indies. Hardly a peep to be heard
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, 1 run, length ball across off, pushed down to long-off
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, 2 runs, more smart batting from Pooran who nudges this softly through midwicket and scampers for two
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, FOUR, length ball angled away outside off, Pooran shows great awareness of the field and simply drives through extra cover. This is super batting
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, no run, defended into the off-side ring
Bhuvneshwar to Pooran, FOUR, how good is the timing on that from Pooran! An absolute skimmer of a pull shot that screams past Jadeja's screaming dive at deep midwicket

Chahal to Simmons, SIX, steps across over to the off-side anticipating Chahal's signature wide leg-break. Once in position, having got the ball in his arc, Simmons unleashes. Massive strike over wide long-on. 14 off the over to swing the balance firmly towards West Indies
Chahal to Pooran, 1 run, short again, but not as much as the previous one. Pooran cuts wide of point
Chahal to Pooran, SIX, jumps all over this short ball. The line, which is significantly outside off, isn't a hindrance either for Pooran who smokes the pull over wide long-on
Chahal to Pooran, no run, slid away outside off, Pooran lets it go
Chahal to Simmons, 1 run, short ball turning away from off, Simmons cuts through to sweeper cover
Chahal to Simmons, no run, flighted leg-break around off and middle, defended into the off-side
Jadeja to Pooran, no run, looks for a flamboyant drive through the covers but is beaten on the edge
Jadeja to Simmons, 1 run, nudged round the corner

Jadeja to Hetmyer, out Caught by Kohli!! Hetmyer goes again, but finds a sensational Kohli in the way. Gosh, what a catch! He ran across to his right from long-on, stretched every sinew in getting both hands to it which allowed him to take the catch, but it also meant it threw him off balance. So he went tumbling down unable to have any control of his sideward momentum, but somehow manages to keep himself from touching the boundary ropes. Hetmyer had drilled this full ball really hard. Has every reason to wonder what the hell happened that he's having to walk back rather than getting six. Hetmyer c Kohli b Jadeja 23(14) [6s-3]
Jadeja to Hetmyer, SIX, this time through the off-side. Reaches out to a wide one and smokes it over extra cover. Flat and hard, hammers the boundary cushions on the full
Jadeja to Hetmyer, SIX, smashes it over cow corner. Jadeja clearly spooked by Hetmyer here, drags it short and makes it worse. Bludgeoning pull from Hetmyer
Jadeja to Simmons, 1 run, pushed through flat on middle, straightens a touch, Simmons nudges it through square leg
Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, 2 runs, another yorker, this one's squeezed through midwicket by Hetmyer. Back for two
Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, no run, right in the blockhole from Dube, Hetmyer jams it to cover
Shivam Dube to Simmons, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, slower one, Simmons delays his cut to place it in the gap but is denied by Chahal's diving effort at backward point
Shivam Dube to Simmons, no run, short of length delivery outside off, chopped off a thick under-edge back down to Dube
Shivam Dube to Simmons, FOUR, short and wide from Dube, and at his pace that's just asking for trouble. Simmons slaps it through backward point
Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, 1 run, back of a length delivery across off, squirted off a thick leading edge that flies through point
Jadeja to Hetmyer, 1 run, slightly short outside off, pulled down to long-on
Jadeja to Hetmyer, no run, dabbed to short third man
Jadeja to Hetmyer, no run, wanted to force this off the back foot through cover, only to get a thick outside edge to short third man

Jadeja to Hetmyer, SIX, may not have got it right off the middle, but got enough on this slog-sweep to clear midwicket. Definitely fancies this match-up against Jadeja, doesn't even take a ball to size him up
Jadeja to Simmons, 1 run, flat at the stumps, Simmons clips it through square leg
Jadeja to Simmons, no run, defended back to Jadeja

Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, no run, right in the blockhole from Dube, almost did Hetmyer for the upgrade in pace from the previous slower one. Hetmyer just got his bat down in time to squeeze it off the toe-edge which bumped it over the stumps through to the keeper
Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, no run, cuts his fingers across this delivery, Hetmyer gets an inside edge onto pad
Shivam Dube to Simmons, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off, Simmons cuts to deep point

Shivam Dube to Simmons, FOUR, Simmons capitalizes on the free-hit, drills it wide of long-on. Dube didn't do much wrong with this delivery actually. It was bowled right up, hardly giving Simmons any space to get under the ball. But Simmons stays back in the crease and powers it with the bottom hand
Shivam Dube to Hetmyer, no ball, 1 run, back of a length delivery across off, punched through to sweeper cover. Front foot no-ball detected by the third umpire
Shivam Dube to Simmons, 1 run, clipped off the hips to long leg
Shivam Dube to Simmons, 2 runs, back of a length on middle, Simmons shuffles across and works it to the left of Bhuvneshwar at short fine. Bhuvi's dive is a clumsy one, gives away an extra run
Washington Sundar to Hetmyer, no run, Hetmyer starts off with a front foot block, which will also be bring an end to Sundar's spell

Washington Sundar to Lewis, out Stumped!! Sundar should be proud of this dismissal. This is just delightful. Had got Lewis rooted to the crease with the previous delivery which was flat. This one though is lobbed up judiciously at 76kph, and Lewis just can't resist putting his dancing shoes on. But the dip and turn trips him. It spins past his wild swing, giving Pant an easy stumping. Lewis st Pant b Washington Sundar 40(35) [4s-3 6s-3]
Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, comes in with the arm from round the wicket, cramps Lewis and strikes him on the pad. Was going down leg
Washington Sundar to Simmons, 1 run, darted in full and fast at the stumps, 102kph, Simmons drives off the back foot to long-on
Washington Sundar to Simmons, no run, Sundar drags the length back and extracts sharp turn, enough to beat Simmons's slog-sweep on the inside edge
Washington Sundar to Lewis, 1 run, pushes it through the covers
Chahal to Simmons, no run, expected a wide but the umpire deemed that he'd walked too far across off to be granted an extra
Chahal to Simmons, no run, cuts it to backward point

Chahal to Simmons, SIX, now this is a terrific shot from Simmons. That wristwork, uff! The sheer power generated with the wrists to take it over deep midwicket. Brilliant timing too as he whipped this leg-break

Chahal to Simmons, FOUR, bit of a shocker from Jadeja at backward point. Last person on the field you'd expect this misfield from. It's gone right through him. Simmons's cut may have had some spin on it but you'd expect Jadeja to deal with it
Chahal to Simmons, no run, leaves this alone for the keeper. Probably thought it was too wide but it wasn't. Not at all

Chahal to Simmons, 2 runs, 87.4kph, full leg-break outside off that's sliced away off the outside half through backward point. Simmons had stepped away for the inside-out smash but couldn't execute it to perfection because of the turn
Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, skidding through from back of a length, Lewis looks to work it through the on-side but gets it off a thick inside edge onto pad
Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, flat length ball at the stumps, turned to midwicket by Lewis

Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, Kohli enquiring with Sundar about an LBW appeal. He's taken the review with one second left. Don't think it's a wise decision. Appeared to have hit him outside off. Ball-tracking confirms that. A short ball that stayed quite low and sneaked well under Lewis's pull. But it struck him outside off and was turning further away
Washington Sundar to Simmons, 1 run, clipped off the back foot to deep midwicket
Washington Sundar to Simmons, SIX, now Simmons into the act. And this is big. Full ball outside off, Simmons plants his foot forward and absolutely nails this into the sightscreen
Washington Sundar to Lewis, 1 run, spooned up off a thick top-edge but it lands short of short fine leg. Attempted a cheeky paddle-pull there and almost paid for it
Chahal to Lewis, 1 run, 89.6kph, short legbreak outside off, Lewis knocks it comfortably into the pocket at covers, ends the over with one
Chahal to Lewis, no run, slider outside off, quicker in pace, Lewis has a poke and gets beaten
Chahal to Lewis, no run, shortish delivery outside off, Lewis punches it to the man at cover-point

Chahal to Lewis, SIX, he scored 40 in the previous match, and he's just a hit away from moving into the 40s tonight. A tossed up delivery by Chahal on the batsman's pads, Lewis goes down on his knee and sweeps it over deep square leg, getting six runs
Chahal to Simmons, 1 run, played with soft hands by Simmons, worked into the gap at mid-wicket with a closed bat face
Chahal to Lewis, 1 run, shortish delivery outside off, Lewis punches it off his back foot through covers
Chahal to Lewis, wide, googly by Chahal, fires this one outside off, misses the tramline
Washington Sundar to Lewis, 1 run, tossed up delivery around off, Lewis drives it along the ground to long-off
Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, shimmies down the wicket and chips the tossed up delivery to covers
Washington Sundar to Lewis, wide, fires this one down the leg side, Lewis can't connect his paddle sweep

Washington Sundar to Lewis, SIX, two mistimed hits, and both have sailed over the fence. Lewis walks down the wicket and smokes the flighted delivery over wide long-off. Sundar's figures taking a beating, he conceded only one in his previous over
Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, short in length outside off, slapped into the covers

Washington Sundar to Lewis, SIX, that's gone the distance. A tossed up delivery by Washington Sundar, Lewis goes down on his knee and although he doesn't connect the slogsweep to perfection, it sails over the deep square leg fence
Washington Sundar to Simmons, 1 run, down the wicket to slog the tossed up delivery to deep mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, 1 run, short of a length delivery outside off, Simmons opens his bat face, glides this one to backward point and retains strike
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, 1 run, punches the length delivery towards cover for a single

Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, no run, another dropped catch, Pant is the culprit this time around. Lewis tries to cut the knuckle delivery and gets a regulation outside edge towards the keeper. Pant dives to his left, gets his gloves to it as well, but the ball doesn't stick in. So both batsmen have been dropped in this over, Bhuvneshwar could have got two wickets in the over. He has none! The skipper isn't pleased with that effort too
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, no run, back of a length delivery around off, Lewis swings across the line and gets an inside edge on to his pads

Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, 1 run, he bowled a brilliant over moments back, and has dropped a sitter now. Oh, Washington Sundar! How costly is this going to prove? It's Simmons, and he can hurt you. Was the knuckle ball by Bhuvneshwar, and the batsman mistimed it awfully, swung hard and the ball went miles up in the air towards mid-off. Sundar had all the time in the world, but he fails in his quest to take the reverse cup
Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, no run, back of a length around middle and leg, this one was a quick one, Simmons swings across the line and gets beaten, struck on the pads

Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, awesome over by Washington Sundar, concedes only 1 run. That too in the powerplay. Gives this one a bit of toss outside off, and Lewis finds the man at point as he plays a square-drive. Indian bowlers keeping a lid on the scoring, building the pressure. Not an easy wicket to bat on, told ya!
Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, loopy delivery around off, driven straigh to the man at cover-point
Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, drives this one towards cover-point, wanted a single, but was denied it
Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, floated outside off, Lewis knocks it into the off side, again not quite of the middle

Washington Sundar to Lewis, no run, appeal for an lbw by Pant and the man at slip, but the bowler isn't convinced. Was the off break by Sundar around middle and leg, Lewis tried to work it through the leg side, ended up getting a leading edge into the off side, the bowler was right
Washington Sundar to Simmons, 1 run, tossed up delivery around middle and leg, nudged into the leg side by Simmons

Chahar to Lewis, 2 runs, that was in the air for a while, but it falls in no man's land. Short of a length delivery by Chahar, Lewis slaps it over the bowler's head with a flat-bat, but it drops between deep mid-off and deep mid-on. Chahal flicks it back to his partner, and although it's a relay throw, the batsmen take two
Chahar to Lewis, wide, Chahar is shocked as the umpire calls this wide. Was well inside the tramline, but it was well above the batsman's head - the slower bouncer
Chahar to Simmons, 1 run, drags the shortish delivery towards square leg as he fails to connect his pull
Chahar to Lewis, 1 run, slower one by Chahar, around the middle stump line, Lewis works it through square leg for one
Chahar to Lewis, no run, back of a length outside off, punched into the off side by Lewis

Chahar to Lewis, FOUR, make that two in two. Short of a length delivery outside off, sets up nicely for the batsman. Lewis transfers his weight on to the back foot and times his punch through point, four more

Chahar to Lewis, FOUR, finally a good connection. Back of a length delivery by Chahar, keeps a tad low, Lewis is quick to pounce on it as he treks back and pulls it over mid-wicket, four from the moment it left his bat

Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, no run, even better over by Bhuvneshwar, compared to the opening over by Chahar, in terms of the economy rate. Sticks to the off stump line, delivering a length ball, Simmons is watchful as he knocks it back to the bowler

Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, 1 run, back of a length delivery around middle and leg, skidding along the deck and keeps a touch low, was a slower one, hence the batsman couldn't time his pull, taking a single at deep square leg
Bhuvneshwar to Lewis, no run, a length delivery by Bhuvneshwar, this one sticks into the surface and the batsman plays a checked drive towards cover

Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, 1 run, sharp inswinger by Bhuvneshwar, this one comes into the batsman after hitting a length, Simmons brings his bat down in time and plays it off an inside edge towards mid-wicket

Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, 2 runs, a lot of power behind the shot, but it'll be nothing more than two. A short ball by Bhuvneshwar and the batsman pulls it over mid-on without much timing behind it, Chahal was quick to sprint back, put in a slide and flick it back in
Bhuvneshwar to Simmons, no run, back of a length delivery by Bhuvneshwar, on a shorter length, Simmons knocks it back to the bowler

Chahar to Lewis, FOUR, a fine over by Chahar comes to an end. Drops this one short around off and the ball is an outswinger, Lewis tries to work it into the leg side taking his eyes off the ball, but it takes the outside edge and flies over the fielder at slip. Only 5 runs though
Chahar to Lewis, no run, 136.2kph, fullish delivery by Chahar and he keeps this one wide, just inside the tramline though, Lewis left it alone expecting a wide, but it wasn't one
Chahar to Lewis, no run, 132.1kph, on a length outside off, Lewis opens his bat face and slices this to point
Chahar to Simmons, 1 run, first run for the Windies. Simmons waits back in the crease, treks back and nudges the shortish delivery in front of mid-on, he's off the mark with a quick single
Chahar to Simmons, no run, 132.4kph, another outswinger by Chahar, this one's on a shorter length, Simmons comes down the wicket and gets beaten due to the away movement
Chahar to Simmons, no run, signs off aggression show by Simmons, walks down the wicket on the first ball and drives the fullish outswinger towards mid-off
